Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: kate w
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the French Quarter for three nights during our honeymoon. The resort was excellent for easy access to food and all the parks, which are all just a quick bus ride away. There is also the fun option of taking a riverboat to several places, like Downtown Disney. The room itself is what you would expect from other moderate Disney Resort. It is clean, but the beds are a bit uncomfortable, the comforters and sheets are rough, the shower/toilet room is very tiny, and the provided toiletries only include a shampoo/conditioner and bar soap. The resort does provide free WiFi that is very easy to access, which is an added plus. Each day, house keeping leaves a fun little towel decoration somewhere in the room. When we requested a check out that was 30 minutes later (normal check out is 11am), they would not accommodate our request. Using the Disney Magical Express was excellent, and the resort took care of all of our check-in needs for our airport departure to include checking our bags from the hotel and printing out our boarding passes. All of the hotel staff was very nice; however, there was always a very long wait for the concierge services, no matter what time we stopped by. We would definitely recommend staying at the French Quarter if you'd like an affordable Disney Resort with easy access to the parks and aren't concerned with a fancy resort room.

Reviews.Title: “dirty washcloth and hair in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at Disney with a wet dirty washcloth and pub-hairs on bathroom. Even the Mickey towel design on our bed was sloppy. When I mentioned it to our maid she just looked at me. I went to talk to front desk, but it was too busy to stand a wait and lose time that could be spent in park. I wrote a letter to Disney, so stay tune… Food in the restaurant was avg.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Emily G
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Port Orleans, French Quarter for our honeymoon last October. My husband is an avid Disney goer, and has been since he was a child (he's been there no less than 25 times). He did hours of research before deciding on this resort. One of the reasons is that it was freshly renovated the summer before our vacation. You could definitely tell things there were new. He said by talking to the lady on the phone, they were really trying to make the trip special for us. They definitely delivered. We loved this place. He reserved on the phone and we got a quiet room on the water, on the end of the building. We even had two windows! It was a little trek from the front, but not bad at all. We got our king bed, and they put a signed "congratulations!" picture signed by Mickey and Minnie. We had towel art every day by our housekeepers and the room was clean upon arrival, and clean every single day we were there. We even had to ask housekeeping to come back one morning because we weren't ready yet (to be fair, it was noon). Check in was a breeze, we got there about 5pm, and received buttons that we were just married and our cards. We did not have one single problem with those cards the whole time we were there. It was awesome just scanning them to get into the park or to pay for our meals. The gave us a free dining plan when we reserved and explained the plan well upon check in. One of the very best things about the French Quarter is that it is not overly big compared to the other resorts. It feels more intimate, and it makes things like the food court and the "streets" in general less busy. The pool was beautiful. We didn't use it, as we're not pool people, but it looked very well maintained and the kids there were having a blast. We used the buses the entire time we were there. We didn't drive anywhere the entire 2 weeks .... the wait was not long at all (when it was raining it felt long, but it was really only about 15 minutes...) and it was a breeze getting to and from all the parks, and park hopping in between. We didn't even drive to Universal Studios. The concierge set up a bus for us (for a fee) so we didn't have to navigate there either. The staff was friendly, the food court was great (especially when coming in late from the parks to grab a quick bite before heading to your room) and the Port Orleans Riverside was only a short (romantic!) walk from the French Quarter. We ate at the sit down restaurant there twice because we liked it so much the first day. We also loved how you could take a boat to Downtown Disney. Our room was right next to the river, so it took us about 3 minutes to get the to dock. A really nice boat ride later, you're Downtown. The bed was comfy, though, after 12 hours of a theme park, any bed is awesome. We stayed for two weeks there and never had any sort of problem. The only "bad" things (not even really bad) were we had a very excited little boy staying in the room next to us and his parents would let him run up and down the hallways in the morning. But, it was about 8:00, it was almost time to get up anyway. And, because we were on the water, you could hear the boats honking as they passed at night. This was only until 11pm or midnight though, and by the time we were 2 days in, I didn't even notice it anymore. We were so pleased with our stay here, and we had an absolutely magical honeymoon. I would stay here again in an instant, but will most likely be trying the other resorts, as I've married into a Disney family. I would highly recommend this resort to a vacationing couple, or like anywhere in Disney, a family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon & we were amazed at the friendly service that we got from the moment we stepped off the bus to when we left. The food court has amazing foods, the rooms are always clean, the pool rocks, & this resort is only a boat ride away from Downtown Disney. Thank you for making our stay fun.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Small-Scale Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: bowlerboy77
Reviews.Content: Compared to most Disney resorts, this is a relatively low-key, small-scale place to stay. I found the grounds very quiet and peaceful. The one noise problem are the air-pressure forced toilets which will wake you up in the early morning hours when your neighbors start getting ready for the day. The grounds are very pretty and well kept. Many gardens and courtyards. The rooms were nicely decorated and maintained, but the bathrooms are a bit small. I'm not a big guy and I had to step out of the way of the door in order to close it. Remember to close your drapes or use the privacy curtain in the vanity area, as you have other guests walking right by the windows of your room. I found the transportation very good. Only once did I wait more than 15 minutes for a bus to/from a theme park. Most times it was under 10 minutes and many times under 5 minutes. Commuting times were good. In the morning we had our own dedicated bus service, but in the afternoons/evenings it was shared with the Riverside section of the resort. Staff was very friendly and helpful, but didn't have that "spark" associated with many Disney cast members. Food court was fine. Had some different selections - jambalya, po' boys, pot roast - not usually found in other Disney food courts. There is no table service restaurant, but who really dines at their resort? If you want, the Riverside portion has a table service restaurant, Boatwrights, but be warned... it's Southern cooking and I found it a little heavy. I was a little disappointed they don't have what is referred to as a "quiet pool" - a place for adults to relax without the noise of kids. You are welcome to use the quiet pools at the Riverside branch of the resort. Overall, I enjoyed this resort and would stay there again (after investing in a sound machine to try to muffle the sound of those roaring toilets.)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: susanwhittaker
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a nicer place to stay :) This was our second trip to Disney but our first stay at a Disney Hotel and we were not disappointed. The hotel and its surroundings were lovely and visiting at Easter I was expecting crowds of people, and whilst it was busy, there was never a feeling of overcrowding or masses of people. Everything was well maintained and the staff were always very helpful and welcoming, a special mention has to go to 'Rich', such a happy chap that brightens your day. The disney transportation from the FQ is very good, we never waited too long for the bus to any of the parks we visited and they were extremely helpful with my dad who has a disability and had to use a mobility scooter. The bus drivers treated my dad with the upmost respect something you don't always see and most guests were very patient whilst the drivers helped him on the buses and then allowed us as a family to board on first. I would like to take this opportunity and thank those guests for their understanding. The food court is typically fast food style choice, which is expected but served us well when we did choose to eat there. One tip would be to purchase the plastic drinks cup, its approx. $15 and you can top up on cold or hot drinks throughout your stay at the hotel and its well worth the money. The pool & pool area is very clean and was always kept spotless. Towels are plentiful and you don't need to take your own. The rooms have hairdryers and irons, so again you don't need to take your own. There are a huge amount of positives about the FQ and staying in a Disney Hotel but there is room for improvement albeit small ones....wardrobes in the double rooms would help as the rail space is very limited when there is a family of you. Also, the cleanliness of the room was a bit hit and miss which surprised me because the main hotel was always kept very clean. Also, the boat to DTD was a bit of a nightmare. It collects people from Riverside first and only leaves a certain amount of places for those staying at FQ which meant we waited approx 50 mins for the experience and then the trip was in the dark! None of these would put me off going back, I would just take less clothes for space and take the bus and not the boat for DTD. Everything is made easy for you when you stay at a Disney Hotel, you can charge purchases to your room card, so you don't have to carry money around. You can organise purchases to be delivered to your room so you don't have to carry stuff around. It's little simple things that make life easier. We paid for the Fantasmic Dinner Package, which was well worth the money. The food was lovely and we were able to walk straight in to sit down for the show as the package offers reserved seating. No standing in the queue for ages. Also paid for evening dinner in Cinderella's Castle. After reading mixed reviews on this, I was wondering if we had wasted our money but we didn't. It was a lovely memorable experience and worth it. The children got the opportunity of meeting the princesses on a one-to-one basis in lovely surroundings. It was very special and one we will always remember. I would recommend this experience and the food was nice, a change from fast food! We went shopping at the largest of the Outlet Stores (near Sea World) and picked up some bargains. The Hotel organised a taxi for us and gave us an idea on cost for journeys outside of Disney (for those who are not intending to drive) so we were able to venture out to Universal and Sea World. Its all made very easy for you and everyone is helpful when you do need advice. We travelled with Virgin on our frist trip to Orlando and then First Choice Holidays for this most recent holiday. Out of the two, I would choose Virgin. The weather was gorgeous, a few cloudy days which you are pleased about when walking around the parks and it was raining/thundering on our last two days but the majority of time it was hot sunshine and definitely short and t-shirts. I didn't want to come back, I wanted to stay in the magical bubble and live in the dream. Its such an amazing place and it takes you away from everyday life and transports you into a happy, magical, special place. I LOVE DISNEY and....we'll be back :) x

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: disneymomalways
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a carribbean cruise and it was BEAUTIFUL. It was also very peaceful. The rooms were clean and my family loved the beds. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great service...beds need updating though”
Reviews.Author: ohhector
Reviews.Content: Part of the price of staying at a Disney Resort is the experience...not only being able to participate in the Extra Magic Hours, but also having your hotel be a theme park of sorts as well. The two Port Orleans resorts are absolutely beautiful. The theming is fantastic, both inside the rooms and out. Service was great. Positive things: 1) Walking around these resorts is great. Nice little workout from one part of the 2 hotels to the other. 2) Riverboat transportation to the Downtown Disney area was nice. 3) The pool area was very nicely themed, and allowed for it to be very full but not feel crowded. Hot tub was not really enclosed, but in a nice secluded area 4) TWO sinks in the pre bathroom area, as well as a curtain you can pull to separate the pre bathroom area from the room. I did have a few gripes though, that prevented me from scoring this 5 stars: 1) Full beds instead of queen beds. "Doubles" might be standard in other parts of the country, but almost every hotel in the area has 2 Queen beds when there are two beds in a room, even the cheaper $30 hotels. 2) My bed was super noisy and not comfortable. The other bed in the room was better, but at the point point they should be nicer and newer. The value resorts have nicer beds than this. Granted, this might have been a room that hasn't been upgrade yet, since I know they did a lot of that recently. 3) Fridge has no temperature control, and did not get very cold even after they replaced it once.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation! Perfect resort!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: Wow...just wow! We stayed 7 nights here and LOVED it! Peaceful and gorgeous! Not crowded at all! Buses came frequently. Clean rooms. Much better than the value resorts! Free wi-fi, fridge and coffee pot were extra bonuses! Great staff. Great Pool. I could go on and on about how much we loved it here! Definitely will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: gtown15
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans French Quarter was a great resort. I attended the resort March 25-31 with my wife, two kids, my parents, my sister and nephew. It was an awesome time .... thanks Mom and Dad!!!!! The French quarter was a fabulous resort. The room itself was kind of small for 4 people but the decor and furniture was great. We did not spend much time in the room, but the time we did spend was awesome. The resort is very well groomed and kept very clean. The pool was enjoyed by my daughter and everyone looked like they were having fun on the slide. There were movie nights outside, a playground and horse and buggy carriage ($) if you liked. The food was good, very good portions. The free cup we recived for unlimited drinks was awesome. Best rice krispy mickey heads (with and without chocolate) were awesome. Pulled pork sandwich was awesome as well. Boatwright's resaturant at the Riverside potion or Port Orleans was an awesome meal as well. Beautiful walking paths around the resort. There was also the boat that picked up people along the river to take them to either the Riverside or downtown disney was a very picturesque and relaxing ride. I really have no complaints about the resort and Disney in general. I was a little skeptical of going again, it was about 25 years since I had last went to Disney, but my experience was great and just told my wife the other day that I feel like I have some unfinished business at Disney and would not mind going back again in a year or two!!! 85-90 degrees everyday with all sun, it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, cant wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: sara s
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second amazing trip to Disneyworld and stayed at PO-FQ. This is a fantastic resort that is almost perfect. As soon as we arrived we felt totally relaxed, even after a nine and a half hour flight!! The staff are lovely, and can't do enough to help you, we even had a message on our room phone welcoming us!! During the second week of our stay our 5 year old son lost his autograph book that he'd worked hard on filling up and was devasteted. I told the concierge when we got back from the partk in the hope that it had been found, however it had't. The next day when we got back to our room, there was a replacement autograph book, full of character signatures, our son was thrilled, thinking that it was his book and still does not know to this day that this is a replacement!! They had even put his name in the front of it. The rooms are spotless, and kept that way throughout by Mousekeeping, who often leave the children little suprises!! Beds are amazing, we looked at purchasing one when we arrived home, perfect after a long day in the parks. One minor negative could be that there should be DVD players in the room, for those nights you arrive back a little early and would like to relax? Maybe you could hire DVD's to watch during your stay? As there were not any we took advantage of the open air cinema on two occasions, this was a lovely way to wind down at night, the kids loved making their own popcorn in the food hall. Food in the food hall was excellent, everything is cooked fresh and in front of you and there is lots to choose from, we often ate at the Riverside food hall for a change of scenery, and enjoyed the walk along the river to get there. Transportation to the parks was good, and again the drivers were very friendly. When coming home you can catch the French Quarter or Riverside coach if you are prepared for a short 10 minute walk along the river to your room and the boat to Downtown Disney was a lovely change at night. If you are looking for a lovely, quiet, immaculatly presented base to stay during your disneyworld holiday then PO-FQ is deffinately the resort to stay in. We stayed at Riverside last year and found this resort a lot busier, with more people using the trasportation system, therefore there were waits sometimes for coaches. The rooms are also spread out quite a lot and involve a lot of walking to and from reception and the food hall. this is a beautiful resort and we will deffinately be back in the future, we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else on Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kjb1976
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times and love, love, love it! Love the fact that you can still have the Disney Magic, but feel like you are in a little hide-away with the lush greenery and grounds. We've always had clean rooms that have been quiet in all three different buildings and floors. We love the choice of food at the food court...it has always fit needs/likes of DH, DD, and myself. Never had an issue with the bus service, love the boat transportation to Downtown Disney, and like the short walk to Riverside as an option for food/pool. Our DD loves the pool and we always spend several afternoons/evenings poolside. The front desk has always been very accommodating and helpful. One year our flight got in early and our room wasn't ready. Upon hearing we had an 8 month old, the cast member switched our room to a first-floor room close to the food court/busses to help us out. We were also able to get ground floor rooms near the bus pick up/drop off when my mom came with us and had knee issues. I've stayed at 5 other Disney resorts from value to deluxe and French Quarter will always bee my fav!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: egp0428
Reviews.Content: We just returned from PO-FQ and it was so awesome. We stayed in BLDG 2 garden view room. It was across the "street" from the check-in/arcade/gift shop/cafeteria on one side and the pool on the other. The rooms were clean and quiet. Our mousekeeping person left surprises each day ( arranging stuffed animals, making towel animals, hanging up clothing) and the kids LOVED the pool. The cafeteria met our needs and was accessible until midnight. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Christmas stay at POFQ”
Reviews.Author: kelhoney
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several of the Disney resorts (including Riverside, All Star Music, and Caribbean Beach) and this is definitely our favorite when it comes to value and moderates. Unlike PORiverside, FQ is quaint and everything is a very short walk away. We were in building 6 and the pool, food court, and store were only about a 1-2 minute walk. We could also cut through the gardens and be at the bus stop in just as little time. Another nice feature is the river taxi that's available to transport guests to downtown Disney. You get a great view of some of the other resorts and a break from the buses. Speaking of buses, we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. Since POFQ is picked up first, often the bus would fill up and we didn't even have to stop at POR. When we did stop at Riverside, it only took around 10 minutes. Also, POFQ is dropped off first, so we never had to go though all the stops at POR. We chose a standard view room, but we had a nice view of some gardens and a fountain. The rooms are nothing special, but they are clean and convenient, which is what you are paying for. Our family always likes that the tub/toilet and sinks are seperate. In addition, the curtain that seperates sleeping quarters is nice early in the morning. When we asked for extra towels, we were accomodated. We were also accomodated when we asked for connecting staterooms, but we did book several months in advance. Almost everyone we encountered on the property was fantastic. We only had a problem with one night shift desk clerk who refused to remove a tip from our room charge. We had paid the tip in cash, but she said without a receipt she would not remove the charge. Even though we were a party of 8 or more, technically tips are still optional, even though they are added to the bill automatically. Even if she did not trust that we paid the tip in cash, which we did, she still should have removed the charge. Overall, POFQ was great. We plan to go back. If your family is like ours, you are in the room very little and when you are, you are sleeping. I say, splurge and go for deluxe dining like we did and go moderate on the room. I'm not a fan of the value resorts and though I love the deluxe resorts, they are not much better when it comes to the room. We found it better to spend the extra money so we could dine in the castle and see dinner shows. It just depends on your preference. Also, for us, we like the PO resorts because they are the closest moderates to Magic Kingdom, the park we spend most of our time in. If you are looking for a moderate resort, definitely try French Quarter. Riverside's new royal guest rooms are tempting, but I'm not sure that they outweigh the convenience and quaintness of POFQ.

Reviews.Title: “Insist on a room far away from construction!”
Reviews.Author: gem21
Reviews.Content: We stayed just two nights at French Quarter to make a one-day park-hopping excursion easier; that way we could get an early start and stay till closing without having to drive anywhere. The hotel, in my opinion like all Disney resorts, is overpriced for what you get. You pay a premium for being on property, and I understand the concept. For $180 a night, we had a room with two queen beds that had okay mattresses, average linens, and horrible, puny little pillows (and no extras offered in the closet area like many other hotels have) -- the bed quality is what I'd expect at a Hampton Inn (actually, Hampton Inn offers much nicer pillows, but I digress). On par for its price, French Quarter offers a nice vanity area with two sinks separate from the toilet and shower. The shower is a basic motel shower/tub combo with fabric curtain, but ours was clean and had spotless grout. Another "premium" item is the mini-fridge. A sub-par offering is the lack of TV stations; while roadside motels boast "HBO" on their signs, Disney properties offer only Disney channels and the basic networks. I know, I know, you don't come to Disney to watch TV, but for $180 a night, it would be nice to watch cable TV before falling asleep. The food court is horrible but on par with all the other "quick service" Disney dining "experiences." Coffee is Nescafe, and only non-dairy creamer is offered. The food is a cut above what I imagine prison food to be -- everything fried, institutional food service fare. Fortunately we were there only a short time; I can't imagine spending a week and subsisting on that bad food. As I mentioned before, we stayed on Disney property in order to wake up early and hit the parks. At 11:30 pm the night before our big park outing day, we were awoken to the sound of a loud engine that caused our room to vibrate. At first I thought it was some sort of emergency maintenance vehicle, but it went on. My husband dressed and went outside our room, only to see that a construction worker was operating some sort of concrete cutter on a section of the main lobby building that was right next to our room (Building 3). I called the front desk to inquire about the noise, and the polite woman told me that "they only do the construction at night." Thinking I was perhaps just groggy from being awaken, I asked her what exactly she meant. Her reply was, "So you can hear it?" Again, she was polite, and she put me on hold to speak to her supervisor. She returned to the line and said she couldn't locate the supervisor but would get back to me ASAP. Did I mention we were planning on getting up early the next day to hit the parks on the one and only day we were visiting Disney? About 10 minutes later, I got a call back from the supervisor. The noise had ceased at that point. The supervisor apologized and told me they told the construction workers to stop. We managed to fall back asleep, and the noise indeed ceased for the night. But the question begs, who in the world thought it would be a good idea to put people in rooms near a noisy construction area with loud noise going on IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT? At checkout I mentioned the incident to the "cast member" at the front desk. She wanted to know if the situation had been dealt with; I assured her it had ceased, but I wanted to know why it happened in the first place. She was courteous and apologized and said the front desk doesn't always realize when guests can hear construction noise in their rooms. I told her I wouldn't be back and couldn't recommend the property -- I was nice about it, but I still could not fathom why this would have happened at all and how a family resort would think it was OK to run equipment at OSHA-breaking decibel levels in the middle of the night. Upon hearing this, she summoned her manager, who credited me 50% off one night's fare. That seemed fair. Given how the hotel handled the situation, I can't say I won't recommend this hotel. My review stands -- don't expect luxury or even above-average amenities, and don't expect healthy food ... and certainly don't expect a decent cup of coffee, because you won't get one! ;-) I will recommend this: Upon check-in, ask where and when construction will be taking place during your stay. Insist on a room that is far away from construction. You deserve a night's sleep that is uninterrupted by construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mkdoan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. Staff was friendly, room is clean. Our room was very close to food court and pool. Nice atmosphere at night at the pool. The kids wanted to swim all night. Food court was ok but served the same food the whole week we were there. Needs variety there. Nice walk along the river to Riverside. Overall, very enjoyable stay. My kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MRayGRay
Reviews.Content: The resort was spread out well with all rooms close to the parking and the main dining/registration hall. The grounds are very well kept and the staff was very friendly. We will defintly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: caretakerthms
Reviews.Content: what a brilliant hotel! i can not fault one single thing about this hotel. beds were very comfortable and clean. staff very friendly and helpful. some real characters in the restaurant like ethel who treats you like royalty. i really enjoyed the boat to and from downtown disney and all other transport links were great. i was genuinely very upset to leave and although i cant afford to stay in 2012 i will be visiting the site to remind me what a brilliant time i had.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: djbarnes
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from 5 nts at the Port Orleans French Quarter (April 15-20, 2012). We had a great time and would definitely return. The resort is extremely relaxing with a quiet riverfront location. The pool area was great (kids enjoyed it) and the cafeteria-style restaurant (Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory) was actually very enjoyable. The grounds are very nice and you are a boat ride away from Downtown Disney or a short walk from Port Orleans Riverside where you can use the pools also (or rent a surry). The staff were all extremely friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future. I only have positive things to say about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: paul_s1962
Reviews.Content: Just back from great 7 day break with family and 2 extras. We had 4 in each room. 2 rooms, great value if booked to full Room capacity. This resort is pretty central with short ( 10 min) transfers to all Disney parks and complimentary buses were extremely frequent and at least every 20 mins. Boat trip takes you to Downtown Disney. Fridge in each room. Dining to midnight with good selection of decent food. Bar entertainment every night was a plus. Booked my hotel, passes and quick service meal plan directly with Disney UK and this was best value as (much better than paying in dollars via Disney.com) with 7 day quick dining plan we had breakfast cereal with milk (2 snacks), lunch and dinner (each was main course, dessert and drink) which was daily allowance which could be carried over (or used by any family member) if not used any day. Got there on low cost air travel to Orlando booked separately. Taxi for all 8 of us from Sanford costs $200 return booked at kiosk on arrival there (free from Orlando Int airport using Disney express coach service if staying in Disney hotel). Taxi to Universal resort (Harry Potter etc) costs $35 each way for 8 and tickets for there booked in advance via Universal site direct from UK and tickets printed out at home (about £55 each adult). All in all best value Disney holiday and also was the 4th time we have been there over the years. Before taking a package check out flights and holiday as two separate bookings. You could save several hundreds of pounds each for the same holiday - a holiday rep is definitely not required when you stay in Disney Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: verypikytraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quater(POFQ) for 7 nights over Easter and it was a awesome stay! We arrived late at night and the person who was checking us in was "earning his mouse ears" so it did take longer then normal to check in but he was very friendly and apologetic about it. We were given room 3203,in building 3 on the second floor and it was in the perfect location, a quick 1 minute walt to the food court and to the pool! Our room was very clean and nicely decorated, and our mouse keeper was very friendly. The service was awesome at the hotel, when ever we would call the front desk they would anser "Good evening this is Mary speaking how may we assist (our last name) tonight. All the people in the food court were very friendly and the bellman was very funny and energetic. The transportation system was ok. We had to wait 45 minutes one day to go to Epcot and 1 hour to go to MGM studios but other than that we had to wait about 30 minutes for a bus at the most. In the morning they would go straight to the park , but other times you would have to go to riverside and stop at all the depots there (there were about 5 stops). The boat to Downtown Disney was awesome and we only had to wait 5 minutes for it to come. The pool was very nice they had a little water slide and during the day they had entertainment for all the kids, the hottub was very nice and clean also. The property itself was spotless and it felt like you were in the French Quater in New Orleans.The attention to detail throughout the property was amazing. Out of all the moderate properties this is out favorite one. We have come to Disney 8 times in a 15 year period and stayed at all the moderate properties, this was our 3 time at this one! We can not wait for our next trip to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, perfect for little ones”
Reviews.Author: JPHughes
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Disney World, this time with a grandchild. A friend suggested staying at Port Orleans and we were not disappointed. The staff was excellent, everything was is close walking distance, and with a 5 year old and 2 grandparents, that was important. The staff, bus service to the theme parks and airport were always on time and very comfortable. The pool was fun and the staff was excellent. One of the many lifeguards grabbed 2 boys sent down the slide by 2 mothers into water that was over their heads, Problem - both moms were on top, so boys went under - lifeguard got both of them and actually smiled at the moms when she had a talk with them. Anyway this place is clean and we will stay there again with our next grandchild when he is 5.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite so far”
Reviews.Author: Gayle512
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love going to Disney World even as seniors ages 82 & 65. We have stayed outside the park twice but found staying in the park has so many advantages that we love such as checking our luggage at our home airport and not seeing it again until it magically appears in our room, Magic Express from the airport, transportation to the parks and the magical atmosphere everywhere. We have tried several of the Value Resorts as well as the Moderate Resorts and found that the French Quarter is our favorite so far. It is smaller so there is not so much walking to do before getting to the dining room or the bus stop and the riverboat to Downtown Disney was an unexpected surprise. We thought having to ride a bus to our room at the Caribbean Beach Resort after checkin was a real inconvenience and one of the reasons we really liked the French Quarter. I use a mobility scooter so the extra on and off yet another bus at that resort was a pain after getting to the airport, flying and taking the bus to the resort for checkin. Neither of us was ready for that extra bus ride to our room. Our room at the French Quarter was neat and clean. Loved the double sink for dressing in the morning. The dining room was smaller so easier to navigate. The surroundings were beautifully landscaped and maintained - - and it was quiet! We were in building 4 so just a quick trip to the main building and dock area. The bus spot was shaded and we never had to wait for a bus overly long. It seemed the cast member at the stop called in extra buses when needed. This was especially appreciated since the older buses can only take 2 wheelchairs or scooters at a time. The only down side was the invasion of some type of milipede on the last night we stayed. Dreadful things that we were afraid of stepping on in the night. We were on the first floor so will request an upper floor next time with hopes that they could not reach us there. We are sure they would have been taken care of as soon as reported but we were focused on packing for our trip home the next morning. Having just returned from our great trip to Disney, we are already planning our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property! Great with kids!”
Reviews.Author: EMEDCt
Reviews.Content: We were at the French Quarter as part of a large group of young dancers staying with their families, staying for 5 days. We were there with our young daughter and my in-laws and their 6 year old son. A great property, beautiful and fun pool, the kids loved the slide, very safe with a lifeguard just for that slide. Good foodcourt with great selections, rooms are spotless. Staff is friendly and very accomodating. Romantic setting by the river, smores making every night over an open fire and movies on the lawn under the stars! Absolutely would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and it was just as great”
Reviews.Author: doey1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2011 and decided to stay here again....it was just as awesome! The rooms are great, lots of room and great planning for a family with lots of shelf and the curtain for the sink area so kids and parents can change with some privacy. The thing I love about this resort is the size. It is big enough without being overwhelming. Not a huge long walk to the food court for drinks or to catch the bus. The pool was great, lotsw of life guards and every afternoon they were doing Disney themed trivia for the kids. The food court offers traditional breakfast with New Orleans themed food for lunch and dinner. Muffaletta, gumbo, beingets but also burgers, pizza, fried chicken and a great salad stattion where they custom make each salad with whatever you want in it. The staff was very helpful and friendly. This is our favorite place to stay at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: onebigfellah
Reviews.Content: We reserved a double queen room so that we could have the extra space. The room was very nicely decorated and extremely clean. The bathroom sinks were in the room, but there was a dividing curtain that could be drawn to reduce the light flooding the rest of the room or just to add a bit of privacy. The toilette and shower where in a separate smaller room that had a door on it. Everything was spotless. The television worked great. The internet connection was very shotty though, it was very hit or miss as to whether or not you would get on...and if you did get on...it was a gamble if you could even surf the web. I didn't end up using my laptop for either night we were here, it wasn't worth the aggravation. The bed was very comfortable. The pillows were the small ones again, but we had enough between the two beds to make resting your head comfortable. The AC worked superbly and was very quiet with no odor. The pool area was very clean and had a really neat slide that I just didn't get time to take advantage of...perhaps next time... :o) This was a great alternative to the Port Orleans: Riverside hotel, we would have rather stayed there but it was booked full. This sister hotel delivered in almost every way though!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pnk65
Reviews.Content: We love Florida and don't need much excuse to visit WDW and over the years have stayed at a range of their hotels. French Quarter certainly didn't disappoint. The resort is tiny in comparison to its sister Riverside, but with one possible exception, is all the better for it. Our room slept 4 comfortably and all the staff were typically Disneyesque in terms of their friendliness and willingness to help. Our room overlooked the green where the night film was played, which was slightly inconvenient given that we have young children, but this was a minor issue. One area for improvement could be the Food Court, which in truth is typically Disney - its time they realised that vegetarians exist!! Riverside Food Court has more to offer and is only a 10 minute stroll. Downtown Disney is close to hand but you need to be organised and reserve a table. An on site restaurant would make this place perfect, particularly if I were going as a couple - its less of an issue if you have kids. Even without a restaurant/better dining facilities, FQ looks very good value against its more expensive rivals.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tpayne20
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the French Quarter hotel the week of March 18-23. We have not been to Disney in many years and we did not know what to expect, except for the reviews we have read. It was an awesome choice for us (3 adults and a 4 yr old). We had enough room with this average size hotel room (compared to many other hotels like Hampton Inn or Hilton Garden) and we were even able to put a twin size air mattress on the floor each night for our daughter. We stayed in building 6 during a peak spring break week. Here are my positive accepts: Small and easy to get around Very quiet, if there is an issue they take care of it quickly We stayed in building 6, 1st floor facing the green lawn with the movies- great location-about 2 mins To filll up drinks Staff was allows helpful, giving out beads, coins, coloring pics etc.. Buses were usually there within 10mins and 9 out 10 we had seats Pool was clean, towels available, bar was convenient, our daughter loved the slide- not heated but fine Food court was adequate but nothing fancy Boat ride to downtown disney was an nice extra Here are the drawbacks Some buses you had to share with Riverside were overly full, especially going to Epcot during mid-day, you had to go to everyone of there bus stops The housekeeping was disappointing by never doing any mouse keeping, except when we specifically asked for it from the check in staff, they were great with photos and such Pool stay did not seem to acknowledge you if you joined in the middle of there activties, which were geared to older children Had a problem with refrigerator never getting cold, they swapped it but the next did not work, finally we figured out the outlet did not work????

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ogorman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 5 which was a little far from the pool and reception area, but we usually walked along the water. The boat ride to Down Town and to the Riverside was always nice at the end of the day. The pool was nice for the kids as well as my husband and I. The Grab and Go food court was ok. The room was clean and had plenty of room for the 4 of us including the Pack n Play. Bus service to all of the parks was convenient and we never really waited that long. The walk along the river at night from the Riverside after dinner was relaxing and helped the kids quiet down. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay on Disney property. We have stayed at the value resorts and the deluxe resorts before this, and the French Quarter was by far our favorite. Having two sinks in the bathroom was very convenient and the room was very spacious. Also, the resort is so small that it was always very quiet and we never had long waits for the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: jamesm0m
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to count the number of times we've stayed here and loved. Perfect location, lovely grounds, "Disney clean," nice staff, and from here you can take a boat to Downtown Disney! Can't wait to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully”
Reviews.Author: iamjoan
Reviews.Content: Been staying here on my vacations for the last five years. We are seniors and just love it everything is close by not a lot of walking to get to restaurant or to the boat for a relaxing ride to downtown Disney. Rooms are always clean. Staff is very nice .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lindie_h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights at the end of our Orlando holiday. We really enjoyed the resort. We were in Building 6 on the ground floor which was handy for access to Sassagoula's food court, and only a short walk to the pool, bus depot and boat jetty for transport to Downtown Disney. We have previously stayed at Riverside, which I loved, but I do think the French Quarter has several advantages, being smaller meant it was much quieter; and with only one bus stop, transfers between parks and hotel are quite speedy. Its size meant it was easy to find your way around. The pool area was nice with plenty of seating - some shaded for those like me who don't like to sit out in the sun. I like the quiet pool over at Riverside and thought FQ pool would be too noisy, but that was not the case. There were plenty of places to sit away from the activities going on for children. The food court was disappointing. We did eat breakfast there a couple of times and also tried lunch. Breakfast was very hectic and sometimes difficult to find a table - but for the price I thought was reasonable value. We didn't visit the theme parks this trip, instead we spent some time exploring the resort hotels. We had breakfast a couple of mornings at Kona Cafe at The Polynesian - very yummy. Easy to hop on the bus to the Magic Kingdom and then either monorail or boat over to the Poly. We had evening meals at Narcoossee's, Grand Floridian Cafe, Kona Cafe and Wolfgang Puck Cafe. We managed to see the Electical Water Parade which sailed past whilst we were eating at Narcoossees. All in all a great end to our Florida holiday. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying here..”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 years ago and loved it. We stayed again when we went last September. My Dad and Stepmom went along and we got adjoining rooms. The walls are so solid, you can't hear anything from the other room. The food is good, but can get so crowded you can't find a table. Smart people (not me) send someone for breakfast and take it back to the room. I didn't figure that one out until it was too late. Good idea. We did the horse drawn carriage ride both stays and it's beautful riding through there. The paths are nice for joggers/walkers to get some exercise, but the parks are enough walking for me. They always had fun stuff going on at the pool like dancing and games. The best part of the resort is the single bus stop. While this one stop looks crowded (Grandpa kept complaining about it), you will usually ALL get on so relax becuase there is not another stop and you will get there more quickly! We will stay here again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: Rootbulls
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a Disney resort, French Quarter is an ok choice. Maid service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. The rooms themselves were pretty average, and I didn't sleep well. With outdoor entrances, there was quite a bit of noise when people walked by. The pool area was pretty nice, but the water was freezing. I'm not sure if it was heated. The food is served in a food court, and I found the prices to be very fair considering we were at a disney resort. Food was pretty good, but there were more choices when we walked along the riverfront to the Riverside resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: feliciah7
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans-French Quarter was wonderfully appointed and made me think I was in New Orleans. They even have jazz musicians performing some nights and delicious beignets to put you in the N.O. mood. I purposely chose this side over the Riverside section because it was smaller; therefore, no need to pay the extra fee for a preferred room. Every section was pretty close to all the amenities. In addition, there is a short line for check in/out and only 1 bus stop for theme parks (The Riverside has 4 stops). The only cons are that there is no restaurant and the food court was very small. There was a smaller selection of entrees and snacks than I've seen at other resorts, so for one meal, we walked over to the restaurant at the Riverside. Although the French Quarter side does not have all the amenities as the Riverside, the best part is that you are within a short walking distance to the Riverside section so you can enjoy all the restaurants and amenities there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Diney's Port Orlean's French Quarter Resort on Saturday 3/31/2012. We spent 8 nights there. Myself, wife and two kids (ages 5 and 7) enjoyed our stay. The room was very neat and modern. The bathroom was spotless, particularly the tub and toilet. The room was made up every day and fresh soap and shampoo was left on the tub. The room size was adequate for a family of four with two smaller kids that shared a queen sized bed. The beds were comfortable. The room had a refrigerator, coffee pot an iron and a nice flat screen tv. The thermosat was easy to work and the room heated and cooled nicely. The ceiling fan was also a nice feature. The resort is smaller than some of the other ones we had looked at prior to our trip. The main advantage was using the Disney bus to travel to all of the parks throughout DisneyWorld. The bus stopped at the French Quarter resort first when returning from the parks, which is very nice with two worn out kids. There was never more than a 10-15 minute wait for the bus either at the resort or returning from the parks. We found that the pool area was nice as well as the jacuzzi spa. Our room was inbuilding number 5 which was a 3-5 minute walk to the bus stop. There was also a movie played everynight outdoors in the garden area at 8:00 p.m. The corwds were also small there as well. The cast was friendly and helpful and I would recommend this resort to anyone travelling and wanting to stay at the park. The most difficult time we had transportation wise was accessing the Downtown Disney area via the boat that you can catch on resort property behind the pool. Overall a great stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: StaceletIL
Reviews.Content: I am a complete Disney fanatic. I have lost track of my number of visits in my lifetime & go at least once a year as an adult. I have stayed at every value & moderate property as well as a few of the deluxe resorts. This said, French Quarter may be my new favorite. Keep in mind, Disney moderates are not 4-5 star accommodations. I read some reviews and the complaints seem to me that the people were expecting luxe 5-star city accommodations. This is Disney where it is location, location, location (even though the price you pay may get you luxury somewhere else). The French Quarter has that AND all the necessary accommodations for a comfortable stay. The newly renovated rooms are wonderful. They were clean and very functional -- loved the extra counter space and underneath "storage" by the sinks that wasn't there before. We were put in a river view corner king room in building 5 and it was surprisingly quiet considering it was busy "spring break" time & I think the resort was at or near capacity. We never heard noise from other rooms other than the toilets (which are quite loud). The resort is definitely much smaller than the other moderates & it never felt over crowded. It really was the best of both worlds though because if you ever felt you needed that large resort feel you could walk on over to Riverside. Our room was only half a mile from the main building at Riverside -- a very easy, scenic walk. The grounds at French Quarter are lovely. I am a runner & many of the other value & moderate resorts leave you running circles in deserted parking lots and along access roads. Port Orleans has a beautiful 2-ish mile path along the river & around both resorts if you enjoy walking or running. If you are debating between the moderates vs. deluxe, the only major differences I found were no table service restaurant (we had a rental car so no big deal) and no gym facility. My last trip was to Saratoga Springs and for twice the price it did NOT have twice the amenities. I would choose French Quarter again! If I had one minor complaint it would be that the food court was lacking. There seemed to be much better selection over at Riverside. But overall, the French Quarter was fabulous! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: h2nho
Reviews.Content: On our second visit to Disney, we decided to stay in the French Quarter Resort. When we get in, we immediately realized the theming. I've never been to New Orleans before, but I thought that, from what I've seen, Disney pulled it off. It felt like you were in a party atmosphere everywhere you went. Sometimes, this made me feel tried and antsy. I wanted to relax. As far as the location goes, when you pick a Moderate resort, you usually get moderate times to get to the parks. It's great service though! The rooms were nice, although they were a little boring. I would have liked to see a touch of Disney in our room, just to make it extra special. The best thing for our family overall was the Disney wakeup call. Our child loved hearing their favorite Disney character tell them good morning just before we went to the parks. Overall,a I think that French Quarter is a nice hotel, but not the best in Disney World. I'd have to say that Coronado Springs was a much better choice for me nd my family.

Reviews.Title: “clean enough for my 4 month old :)”
Reviews.Author: Kelley P
Reviews.Content: after reading horrible reviews and wonderful reviews for ALL of the Disney hotels, I was very worried. And even more worried since I was bringing my 4 month old along with us for vacation. I can deal with rude people, but I can't fix dirt, filth, and bugs in a room.....My main concern was how clean everything would be. This hotel was very clean. Nothing bad in the towels, carpet, bed, and the air conditioning worked. it was very quiet, and we really don't have any complaints. Took the boat over to Riverside, and we decided that next time if we stay in a moderate hotel, we will do riverside over french quarter. Riverside is a bit bigger, better gift shop, and better food court. Overall, it was a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: CindiTyreeBrooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent six wonderful days at the French Quarter. Our room was great and the food at the resort restaurant was great too. It was our first time using the dining plan and it is somewhat confusing at first but the staff is more than helpful explaining it as you go. All of the staff was very helpful and always happy. If I had to talk about one thing that concerned me; it would be the distance of the bus stops to catch the park buses. I am handicapped and use a scooter when i get to the parks but next time I will get the scooter rented to use at the resort as well. It will be less wear and tear on this tired body. I would recommend French Quarter to anyone. The theme is wonderful and the music that plays is so relaxing. I wish I was still there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent resort”
Reviews.Author: Joanne73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter in December 2011 for 8 night - myself, husband and 2 children. While we were happy with the hotel, I wasn't really that impressed. The main reason for staying there was because it was one of the smaller Disney hotels which was one of the things we were looking for. We stayed in building 5 and the walk was not bad at all. When we arrived at the airport, we took the bus (Magical Express) to the hotel. It was the first time I've used Magical Express and what a great thing to offer! Loved it!! Our room had 2 queen beds and a decent size bathroom - the sinks were outside of the bathroom which is nice so that you can get ready if someone is in the shower. The beds were terrible. After the first night, all I kept wondering was how I was going to get by another 7 nights on these beds. Someone mentioned asking the front desk and they actually brought up a mattress pad and it was SO much better...so definitely ask for one if you see the beds are not that comfortable. The pool area was really nice and the toddler pool was great too. It was never too crowded either and we were there when the hotel was full to capacity. There is also a little playground near the pool area and our daughters really enjoyed it. The hotel area was nice and clean and well kept. All of the staff that we dealt with were really friendly and always looking to help. For the most part, we didn't eat at our hotel - they don't have a restaurant, just a small food court type of dining. The food was not bad though - my favorite was the quesadilla. They We had the dining plan while we were in Disney, which is great. We used a grocery delivery service and had groceries delivered to the hotel so that they would be there the day we arrived. (We have twin daughters that were 2 and needed milk, diapers, etc - stuff we didn't want to pack from home) so we had the grocery service delivery to the hotel and it was great. The hotel has a place where they store items in the refrigerator, if needed so everything was kept cool. We also purchased snacks and fruit so that we could bring out own with us instead of needing to purchase them. When we checked in to the hotel, they delivered our luggage and groceries within 30 minutes, it was great! The bus service was pretty good. Only once or twice did we have to wait longer than 15 minutes, or wait for another bus since it was full - but being that it was a busy season and the hotel was booked, that was to be expected. Overall, we had a nice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms, Disney quality”
Reviews.Author: wjtlet
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans - French Quarter is the smaller of two Port Orleans resorts (the other is Riverside). We had a great time for the eight days we were there with two children aged 6 and 4. The buses ran promptly - never more than 20 minute wait - to all four parks. The restaurant is food court style with a good selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner - very good food, and reasonably priced. The pool features a small waterslide that keeps 7 and unders very happy - and daily activities for kids run by Disney event staff. We loved the movie on the lawn between buildings 5-6 every night - families are given towels to watch a movie sitting outside on the lawn each night - all the regular Disney titles of course. The riverboat is great too - providing regular access to Downtown Disney if you are sick of buses. Overall, we will return to the Port Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jstickler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at French Quarter for 10 days in March, choosing the resort for its smaller size and great location. The staff are so incredibly friendly and will help sort out anything you may need. We spent a day at Universal Studios and the concierge happily booked a shuttle for us ($18 per person return) and helped us with bus transport to a local mall too. We stayed in building 4, next to the main building, food court and the pool, and our room was spotless and in a fantastic location. I would definitely reccommend asking for this building. We were both using the Disney Quick Service dining plan and ate breakfast in the food court each day and a few lunches and dinners. The menu isn't hugely varied but there's something for everyone. Breakfast is typically waffles, omelettes or a cooked breakfast as well as a selection of fruit and a bakery counter. Lunch and dinner consists of salads, hot rolls, burgers, chicken and ribs as well as a pizza counter. The refillable mugs are a brilliant extra and we were constantly using them throughout our stay. The transport system is another brilliant feature. Free boat shuttles operate to Downtown Disney as well as buses from outside reception that go to all the theme parks, water parks and downtown Disney. Overall a brilliant hotel, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke618
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and 4 yr old daughter. From start to finish we had a wonderful vacation. Faxed a request for building 4 prior to our arrival-they honored. (closest to transportation) Our room was ready well before 3pm and our luggage was there waiting as promised. I would highly recommend POFQ for those with smaller children. After a long day at the parks, it is just a short walk to your room. Plenty of options at the food court-even for picky eaters. You must try the freshly made beignets. Our daughter really enjoyed the pool and the lifeguards are always on high alert. A reservation is required for the nightly carriage ride. Be sure to get up early and take advantage of the extra magic hours. Bus stops begin to crowd after 8am daily. Only negative is the downtown disney bus that stops at every Riverside depot (four of them) and Typhoon lagoon. Allow 40 minutes each way. For a change of scenery, take the boat to downtown, nice and relaxing. MAGICAL EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful POFQ! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: WDWfan7647jet
Reviews.Content: I'm a single mom and I stayed @ POFQ during Spring Break, Mar 18-23,with my son and nephew, ages 11 & 13. The property was beautiful and the landscaping well maintained. The pool was great, the kids loved it. The room was clean and comfortable. Nice to have a coffee maker and small refrigerator in the room. Laundry facility was convenient. About $1.00 to purchase a single load box of laundry detergent or dryer sheets, $2.00 per 30 min cycle. There's a change machine in the laundry room if you need change. In my experience, I found all cast members...front desk, gift shop, food court, bell service, mouse keeping to be polite and helpful. By Wed of our stay the hotel was 80% full, but it never felt overcrowded. The only busy time was the breakfast rush in the morning, but we were still able to find seating. Food court staff was helpful explaining to me how my meal plan worked, as it was my first time using a meal plan. I recommend the quick service dining, it was plenty of food. Boat taxi to Downtown Disney was nice and relaxing. If you are in a hurry to make dinner reservations, you might want to take the bus, we're weren't. The boys had fun in the arcade and I enjoyed the evening entertainment. The buses ran frequently to the parks and we never waited more than 10-15 mins.(usually less) We only had to stand a few times. Sometimes the buses make stops at Riverside, but this didn't happen during any of our rides. Overall, I was very happy with our stay at POFQ and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel without "Disney Size"”
Reviews.Author: bschiefe
Reviews.Content: Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter (POFQ) provides a wonderful Disney resort experience without hoards of people. A moderate resort, POFQ has everything you need and a fun theme. We stayed in a king size room- which I think is a little bigger than the double rooms and we had plenty of space. All of the POFQ ROOMS were recently renovated so they don't feel old/dingy. The bathroom area is really spacious. The double vanities and closet area are partitioned from your room with a curtain and the shower/toilet are in a separate room. Our room was cleaned everyday and little towel animals were left behind- very cute! We stayed in Building 1 which is the "farthest" building from the center lobby/pool/food court. It took us 5 minutes to walk to there. We had a beautiful courtyard view from our room and our resort was so peaceful and quiet (even during spring break dates). The jazz lounge and bar were great and there was a jazz muscian who played til midnight Thurs-Sun. Prices at both the food court and bar were very reasonable. The buses ran frequently and the boat to Downtown Disney was a big plus. Overall, we were not disappointed and were extremely happy with our stay at the POFQ! I definitely recommend it to families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: renauerc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3/7/12-3/12/12 visit and we were so impressed with the POFQ. I've never stayed at a moderate resort - usually stay at the Value level - but this was so worth the couple hundred bucks extra. We had 3 adults and 1 child (3years old). We had a car so I can't comment on the Magic Express or park buses. But overall we loved this hotel. Maybe not the best choice for those looking to be totally immersed in all things Disney - but a nice little retreat after being at the parks all day. Room: 2 queen beds, large bathroom. I didn't find the beds to be uncomfortable but my husband said his back hurt by the last night. The housekeeping left cute towel animals each day, arranged my daughters toys on teh ledge and in her pack n play - which totally made her day. Room was clean, decor was nice. Really appreciated the 2 queen beds - one of the main reasons we chose this hotel in teh first place. We had frieds staying at AKL and I think our room was actually bigger and nicer than theirs (alhtough I'll admit the pool at AKL won by a longshot). We also really likd the big bathroom and the privacy curtain - especially since my husband and I were staying with my mom. Pool: Good size, welll kept. We mainly stayed at the toddler pool - which my daughter loved. No problems getting a table, towels, etc. She also really liked the little playground right next to the pool. Every day they had a couple staff members organizing games and things for the kids - trying to get people to participate. Hotel: We were in building 7 - which was maybe a 3 minute walk from the lobby and pool area. The grounds are beautiful - we walked along the river and watched the boats. The landscaping and little fountains around the grounds were beautiful. Everything seemed clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly whenever I called or asked for something. We espeically liked the size of the grounds - everything was close together. We took a drive through the Riverside area and was amazed at how big it was - totally different atmosphere that the FQ. Food: We ate several meals in the food court and was pleasantly surprised. This was the area I had the lowest expectations for but we actually thought the food was pretty good. It was busy during breakfast rush but at dinner time it was pretty calm. They had a little TV showing cartoons and a coloring area for kids. I had quesadillas - which were great - and my husband had chicken and ribs whcih he alos really liked. The breakfast food was good too - waffles, etc. Serving sizes were huge - espeically on hte dining plan where you got desert and a side with every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, ignorant staff”
Reviews.Author: DKirsty
Reviews.Content: First, French Quarter really is one of the most beautiful of the Disney resorts. Small in comparision to most of its neighbours and right on the river, its quaint and charming. None of the rooms are far from the bus stop, and the riverboat down to Down Town Disney is lovely, the sound of the boats going by soothing. Really, its a lovely spot to enjoy a little R&R between trips to the parks. I stayed in a riverview room in building 2, and I would heartily recommend going the riverview route. Waking up and looking out straight onto the river is just lovely, we took our coffee out onto the walkway both mornings to enjoy the peace and quiet and the restful morning river. The rooms themselves are great, good proportions, comfy beds and very nicely themed. Unlike a few reviewers, I had no issues with the pillows - I found them to be comfortable and aided in my 2 very good nights sleep. The pool is also fantastic. not too big, but not so small that I felt crowded, or as 2 adults enjoying the pool we didn't feel that we were encroaching on the kiddy pool. The lifeguards were attentive and alert. What I did have an issue with regarding this resort, and is the reason I will be thinking long and hard before I return, was the service given by the staff. Check in was long, rude and unhelpful. We later found out that we had not been checked into the magical express for our return journey, the staff were again rude and unhelpful, just giving me a number to call to rearrange. Of course, that still did not work and we had to spend half an hour with guest services the next morning to get it fixed, missing rope drop at my favourite park and a bad taste in my mouth on my last day at Disney. Bell services however were consistently great - beyond helpful and just lovely. Rude and unhelpful is not something I have come to expect, so this stay with Disney was tinged with disappointment. I loved the surroundings however, so if I stay there again I will know to expect very little in the way of good service and remember to double check any information that I am offered by the staff well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Quarter!!”
Reviews.Author: sne1516
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and now will never stay anywhere except the French Quarter. The grounds were smaller so it was easier to get to the main office, food, bus service, and your room. The room was exceptionally clean and very comfortable. The pool is large and the hot tub is away from the pool so adults can have quiet time! Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul Stay - Friendly Employees”
Reviews.Author: Justin H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Disney resorts and, without fail, I've had great experiences. Port Orleans - French Quarter provided much of the same, but with an environment that stood out amongst all of the other resorts I've vacationed at. The grounds are kept up perfectly, with everything being absolutely beautiful. The nightly campfire/marshmallow roasting and movies in the park were PERFECT for the kids. The hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable. The beds were great, with the only major complaint being the pillow that I found to be uncomfortable. Though, I'd imagine that'd be a personal preference. All experiences with the staff were very pleasant, especially with their front-desk and their airline check-in staff. The buses were as good as any of the other parks . . . Being that it was the busy season, we expected some delays. The food court was very nice and appeared to be very clean. The food was surprisingly good for having been "Disney Food." Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend Port Orleans-French Quarter. Also, the other family we traveled with stayed at Port Orleans-Riverside. The walk between the two hotels is not only fairly short, but BEAUTIFUL. I loved walking between the two. Between the two hotels, however, I'd probably pick the French Quarter only due to size. Riverside was beautiful, but was for more crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and bus service”
Reviews.Author: Gamblers50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January 2012. Disappointed with the Restaurant at this property. We enjoy a sit down breakfast, lunch and dinner. You will have to go elsewhere if you want this. They only have the self serve fast food entrees. I was surprised that the Pizza booth only offered two kinds of Pizza, ham and pineapple or pepperoni! The place was always busy so the food couldn't have been that bad. The room was nice. Very similar to the rooms at the Caribbean Beach Resort. We have also stayed there too (2009) and I did prefer their Self Serve restaurants and it's sit down restaurant. If I were to choose, I would suggest the Caribbean Beach Resort, Aruba. Why, because it has the better fast food booths and the sit down restaurant was very good! The Pools in both resorts are nice and both are close to Downtown Disney but the French Quarter also has the ferry which takes 15 minutes. Hope this helps some people out. I also suggest you go for the dining plan. We have had the regular one once when we stayed at the Animal Kingdom and the Deluxe for both the Caribbean Beach and French Quarter. We prefer the Deluxe. You can eat at all the really good places with this plan! This year they included all the restaurants in all of Disney World! You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Marilia v
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans - French Quarter overall is a very nice resort. This resort, unlike other moderate resorts is spaced close together so you are never far from any other building, including the main building where the restaurant is located. The bus stop is also very close by and the pool is centrally located. The food at Sassagoula is so-so with the beignets being the star attraction. My biggest problem with Sassagoula is that there isn't as much seating availability as in other food courts, but you are able to grab a table outside since the patio is under a lot of shade trees. This means that you also get to experience the view from the river. For food, you're better off hiking to Riverside, which has a lot more options or making reservations at another resort/park restaurant. The rooms at PO-FQ are surprisingly quiet. My husband and I paid for a waterview room which ended up overlooking the pool and even with a lot of people in the pool area, the room was quiet. The only big drawback: the elevators are a mission to find so you end up lugging your stuff up and down the stairs. As for the remainder of the resort, the main building was under construction while we visited, making it a bit inconvenient, but the few extra steps won't kill you. The resort has lots of little paths between the buildings that are ideal for an evening stroll and the river path has a very calming effect. The boat to downtown disney is also a great option, but beware: a stiff breeze will shut them down. While the pool could use a makeover and the food court can stand an expansion, the ability to use all of the amenities (including the pools and AMAZING restaurants) at PO-FQ's sister resort (Port Orleans - Riverside) make up for it. There are a lot of activities that can be enjoyed at both resorts, such as bike riding, carriage rides, fishing, movies, boat rentals, etc. This also means, however, that disney busses stop at both resorts during a trip, making it hard to get a seat or get off quickly. The busses will however be designated to a single resort during peak hours/times.

Reviews.Title: “Free Boat ride 4 staying guests, horse carriage and much more”
Reviews.Author: flipflopsbeach
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the French Quarter, our kids loved the FREE boat ride around Port Orleans which also takes you to down town Disney and drops you off beside the rain forrerst cafe. It hosts Boatwrights dining hall which has pork chops, steaks and even milk shakes. They also have the best chicken nuggets for children. Our pool was large and we had a great size tot pool. Our hotel was next to the gift shop/ front desk too. We also had a bus that took us to all the parks as well. Sometimes we would just hope on the boat for fun and ride back and forth. The hotel really looks like an original New Orleans hotel. Not as flashy and bright as other hotels in disney. This one is laid back and stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Average room and average resort”
Reviews.Author: cent1nu11
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is a nice theme. We were quite close to the main location. The room was clean but cramped (slightly better than an upgraded motel). (My wife liked the room and location). The lone restaurant was the Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory Food Court was fine for lunch and a snack, but that was it. I did like the pool decor although we didn't spend time there. One thing I like is that we could take a river cruise to some of the Disneyworld park and it was a great alternative to the bus. Despite all this, I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pool - shade and movies just steps from the bus stop!”
Reviews.Author: LianaBeth
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort!! We stayed in a corner King room in building #4 and were literally just steps from the bus stop, the food court, pool and the lovely green space where they showed movies under the stars each night. You would think it would have been loud this close to the action - but it was actually very quiet. The room was larger than I expected, exceptionally clean, and although the bed was just comforable (not like sleeping on a cloud like you sometimes find in deluxe hotels) after walking the parks and swimming in the great dragon pool all day - we hardly cared. The bar was great, the property for evening strolls was beautiful too - my ONLY real "meh" of this review is the food court - if good dining is your thing (as it is ours) then plan to always eat elsewhere - there are so many amazing restaurants at Disney - don't waste your appetite on a food court. Plan to sometimes make extra stops at the time-share properties along your way to the parks during peak times, and you will love this place too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: tellemarie
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is perfectly themed. I loved taking a long walk at night along the river bank in the evening. It was a very peaceful resort, so it was ideal for a solo traveler or would also be quite romantic for a couple. The room was very beautiful and detailed, there was a piece of art that was actually an invitation to a ball from the late 19th century. The lobby itself and food court were very nice! There was work being done on a portion of the lobby but what was still open was very grand, I loved the glass ceilings and the murals done behind the check-in counters were also very beautiful. Wifi was stop and go even though I was right next to the lobby, but it was free and for as much as I used it it was fine. I had a king room and I found the bed to be a bit hard, but if you like that then wonderful. We were a bit far out from MK, but we were very close to EPCOT and Downtown Disney. The bathroom was very large, the slate on the flooring was very nice, it wasn't ever too cold in the morning. The cubby holes next to the shower were very convenient! Overall I'm obviously very happy with the resort. I never encountered an unfriendly cast member and the theming of the resort is beautiful. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: michelewave04
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best resorts in Disney World! We have stayed at The Contemporary, The. Polynesian, The Grand Floridian and all of the other Moderate Resorts. Of the Moderate Resorts, this is the winner. The atmosphere, convenience of a smaller resort especially added to a pleasant stay. The pool complex was fabulous! The 'cast' was great. The food court was good. We will probably choose to stay here again next year! That is highly unusual, but everyone loved it (11 and 13 year old), son and daughter in law, as well as us (actively mature people)!

Reviews.Title: “Great first few days but wouldn't stay on this particular property again”
Reviews.Author: Talula777
Reviews.Content: Family and I were booked to stay at the French Quarter for 7 nights but spent the last 2 nights of our trip at the Riverside resort/Acadian house (which was great!
