Very clean, no complaints at all) The reason why we switched over was because on our fifth day, we came back to our room from the parks and discovered an outbreak of unknown bugs/ants in our room. We had never seen these types of ants before- it was absolutely disgusting. They were right by the door/window/surrounding floor area. Within minutes, there were more and more. We stayed in building 2, on the first floor. I called the main front desk right away and told them about the issue and they said they would contact pest control and we'd get a call back from someone asap. However, we didn't receive a call and had to keep calling the front desk. During this waiting period, we packed up our belongings because we surely were not going to spend the rest of our trip in a bug infested room. About 40 minutes later, a bellman arrived and took our luggage and told us that we'd be speaking to the manager who would switch us over to a nice room at the Riverside resort. The bellman informed us that the bugs looked like 'argentine ants'. The bellman and manager 'Boris' were kind and tried to cheer us up. We were given new room keys, everything was sorted out pretty quickly. We were then driven to the Riverside resort and shown where everything was/buses, the restaurant, etc.  Prior to this stay, we have only stayed at a deluxe resort but I had read so many great reviews about this resort so I thought what the heck- let's give it a try. The grounds are cute, the sassagoula river boat system to downtown Disney was great, building 2 where we stayed was near the buses and the pool but this ants situation really threw off my mood that night! After seeing how nice and clean our new room at the Acadian house was, we instantly cheered up and tried to forget about the whole ordeal. This was the only negative situation about our entire Disney trip- the French quarter is a quaint and charming resort, I wouldn't recommend staying on the first ground levels though.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Awful, Slow, etc.”
Reviews.Author: charles w
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a Disney Trip. It was March 4th - March 12th. It was my first moderate disney stay after reading all great reviews on Port Orleans French Quarters. I dont know if it was because I usually stay in a Deluxe, The Wilderness Lodge but the trip was horrible. The Room and the grounds are great. Pool is Great. The resort had even less people than I thought they would. Really easy to get around and get food. The bad was magical express came 7 hours after my flight and my kids bed time things were in there. We had to wait for the luggage. They appoligized and said this never happens. OK. THe buses to every park was horrendous. I have taken buses hundreds of times. These were the slowest I had ever taken. Im talking an hour and a half from downtown disney back to French Quarters. Thats after we waited a half an hour in the rain for the bus. Everyone was pissed. I waited over an hour at French Quarters to go to Magic Kingdom. I complaned 3 times and got a free taxi ride there. I waited for the taxi and the bus STILL DIDN'T COME. There were about 10 other times waiting for the bus. I'm tired from this and going to sleep now. I guess people are used to slow transportation but that never happens at Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Shari B
Reviews.Content: Look no further! I spent such a long time trying to decide where to stay on Disney. I finally decided on French Quarter because of all the great reviews that I read. We stayed for 7 nights the first week of March and fell in love with the resort. The kids loved the pool area and the poolside games everyday. I was so impressed by how thorough the lifeguards were. The foodcourt was awesome, the rooms were clean and quiet (we were in Bldg. 5), the grounds were beautiful...what more can I say. The singer in the Scat Cat Lounge was so entertaining. The bus service was great-never really had to wait long. The boatride to downtown Disney was relaxing and the walk along thr riverside to Riverside was so peaceful. This resort is so cozy. I found some of the other resorts to be too big and lots of walking to get to everything. French Quarter also has a nice gift shop and arcade. We will definitely stay at this resort if we ever return to Disney. Loved everything about it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “difficult check in”
Reviews.Author: Chi
Reviews.Content: Our check in was less than competent and pleasant, a very bad start to a much needed get away. A manager was called to handle a very simple-straightforward process. Room was clean and we appreciated the updated features. One bed was great and the other not. And we heard every time our neighbors visited their bathroom! Construction was going on in the lobby but the pool and other features of the resort were available. We were in building #4 which was close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice For On Disney Property Benefits”
Reviews.Author: widening8horizons
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter for the first time and I was extremely happy with the experience. Staying at the WDW resorts can be more costly than staying in Orlando, but the benefits were absolutely worth it: frequent resort buses straight to and from the parks, great hotel service, extra magic hours, and more. The Port Orleans was fantastic because my group was able to enjoy the amenities of both the French Quarter and the Riverside for dining and swimming. Rooms were clean and well maintained. The Louisiana themed dining options were fun and delicious, although a little tiring after a while. Overall a really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at French Quarter!!”
Reviews.Author: disfanatic702
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 night stay at French Quarter. This is a wonderful resort. The relatively small size and newly refurbished rooms were wonderful. The transportation to and from the parks and downtown Disney was better than some deluxe resorts I have stayed at. If you want a good value for your money, you could not ask for anything better than the French Quarter!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: MelMel87
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends in December 2011...right near christmas time so it very busy at the theme parks. The French quarter was beautiful, great set up with a spa, dining room, laundry and communal areas. The free boat ride to get 'downtown' was a highlight. Definitely a magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort because of the "moderate" price tag and the fact that all rooms have at least queen size beds like the deluxe resorts. We're a family of 3 and had a room on the main floor in bldg. #1. Although it's one of the furthest rooms from the pool and dining area, it was a short peaceful walk along the river to get to the pool and lobby. We drove to Florida and found this resorts location to be very convenient for driving to the parks. Upon arriving we found our room to have no soaps or shampoos. A call to housekeeping and that was remedied within an hour along with a bonus of receiving the resort hand lotion which I don't think is an amenity usually provided to the moderate resorts. We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge last year and loved it so I was a little skeptical that we would enjoy our stay as much this year. The beds, vanity area and space in the room was more than adequate and comfortable for our stay. The only downside to this resort is that there isn't a table service restaurant. The pool slide was fine for our 5 year old but the water was a little chillier than the waterpark we visited. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this resort if comfortable and quiet sleeping rooms is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better values in this area .”
Reviews.Author: Tildor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Expensive Rooms are small , it's like a motel With a tag price of 4 star hotel . To get to breakfast you have to drive . Nothing special .

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the Price”
Reviews.Author: momof6_1dog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at various resorts at Disney World, and as were all of the hotels, the Port Orleans is very nicely maintained. Where we chose to stay depends on our budget and needs at the time. On this trip we had 8 people, so we chose adjoining rooms. The Port Orleans offered queen beds in the rooms and is smaller than many Disney resorts. We were in building 2 which was close to the food court, bus station and parking lot. The room size is pretty standard. The drawbacks for some people may be the resort is more like a motel than a high rise hotel, although no problem of kids screaming in the halls, nd some of the parks are not that close. Besides the buses, the only transportation option is a boat to downtown Disney which did not run most of our stay because of winds. The pool area is very nice. It is mentioned as less kid friendly than Riverside, but we did not find that to be an issue. Overall, great pick for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for disney”
Reviews.Author: vacmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in building 6 and were given a corner room with a river view as an upgrade. Great location, 5 min from pool and a 10 min stroll to the pool at riverside. Taking the boat to disney village at night was so easy. Having a bus to get around the park was great. We just parked the car and forgot about it. The food court was ok. Glad we did not have to eat there a lot. We were only there 2 nights and our room did not get picked up. When we got back from our day at epcot the bed had not been made up. That was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: Miriam021
Reviews.Content: I recently took my 15 y.o. niece and 10 y.o. nephew for a 9-days vacation at WDW, and after careful consideration, chose to stay at POFQ. What a great choice! The hotel is the right size and with all the amenities we needed. Our room was in building 3, close to the main building and bus stop, but since the resort is fairly small, I don't think there are bad buildings. Housekeeping was OK, but I can't say the kids left everything in their place, so it may have been some of a challenge to clean the room around their stuff! We got a couple of towel animals, the kids loved them! My nephew loved the pool, and we all enjoyed some time there, even though the water wasn't as warm as we expected. I put a load of clothes to wash at the laundry room while I had a little swim with the kids, no problem at all. The food court was never too crowded (we were there for Presidents' Day and were worried about the crowds), the transportation to the parks was awesome (only once in 9 days we had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus to Magic Kingdom).We loved the boat trip to Downtown Disney, although in the evenings, it may be quite of a wait. Wi-Fi worked perfectly fine both in the rooms and in the reception area, and it's free! We got to see the Mardi Gras Parade at the hotel, it was really cute! All in all, I don’t think I’ll stay anywhere else the next time I go to WDW (hopefully soon!) Extra comment: We got a promotion with the Disney Dining Plan for free, and it was amazing! Both the quality and quantity of food were excellent, but it requires a lot of planning to get the right reservations. If you’re willing to work a bit in advance, the Dining Plan is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Disney's French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a four night stay at the POFQ and had a wonderful stay! We had a riverview king room in building 6 and we were very pleased with the accommodations (especially the cute towel animals every night). It was nice that we didn't have to walk too far to the bus stop or food court, but some days we chose to walk over to the Riverside pool, gift shop and food court because they had a larger variety of food it seemed. The bus service is so convenient, definitely better than renting a car! I feel the resort is really centrally located among the parks and Downtown Disney. They let us check out late too because we had a later flight...and you can even check into your flight and check your luggage for the flight right in the lobby, it was really convenient! You drop it in the lobby and don't see it again until you are at your home airport. For the little amount of time you spend at the hotel because of everything else to see in Disney…this is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Darren P
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at All Star Sports, I was looking for something less crowded and with better transportation to the parks. POFQ was the perfect choice. The resort is fairly small and everything is relatively close to the main area with the food court and bus stops. The resort also has a boat to Downtown Disney. The bus sometimes goes to the PO Riverside resort but always goes to POFQ first. I never had a problem getting to and from the parks unlike the previous year at AStSports. The food court is smallish but big enough and has a decent food selection. The entire resort is themed like Mardi Gras in New Orleans. Arrive at the right time and you can get beads when you come in and at night you can listen to some great jazz. You also get to share any of the amenities at the PO Riverside resort which is a 10 minute walk or short boat ride away. My room had a view of a garden and a parking lot (3rd floor) as it was a standard room. This didn't bother me at all as the whole place is quite pretty, and I spent my time at the parks. The room had a fridge at no additional charge but wired ethernet was $9.95 a day. I think there is now free WiFi but check on that before you go. The room amenities were good and a cut above the value resorts. As a solo traveller I had lots of room. The mousekeepers (Disney for housekeepers) gave me wonderful towel art every day. (I did tip them everyday so that probably helped, but I appreciated their care). All of the POFQ rooms were refurbished and given queen size bed before my arrival in August, 2011. Overall I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stay at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFairyNYC14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort during the Disney Princess Half Marathon Weekend and it provided a very pleasant stay. We were in building 4 which was very convenient as it was closest to the dining area and to the bus stop. Buses to the parks was pretty regular and we never waited too long, except on one occasion. Since it was a host hotel for the race weekend they also provided very convenient shuttle transportation to the race expo at Wide World of Sports and also to the race start. The rooms were a good size and very clean. The bathroom had two sinks which was helpful since there were 3 of us staying in the room. The only thing that was odd was that the pillow cases seemed too small for all the pillows, so they seemed firmer than they were. Overall, great hotel to consider for a stay at Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort and location”
Reviews.Author: Tracey K
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights here - on previous visits to Orlando/Disney we had hired a large townhouse and so this was the first time we stayed at a Disney resort. We wouldn't go back to a townhouse after this experience. Why? Well firstly location - we were between 5 and 15 minutes drive (or bus journey) from all of the Disney parks and the transport service was excellent. We did hire a car but didn't use it that much as the buses were so regular and convenient. The resort itself was very pretty, it had a very friendly and laid back feel to it - it had all of the facilities you could need - and everything a very short walk away. We were in building 4 - we were on the corner on first floor level and you literally could walk of of the room, down the stairs and you were at the food court or swimming pool. The food court is excellent (for quick service type food). Our favourites were the Mickey waffles with lots of syrup, the Oreo ice cream and the take out pizza. The regular boat service to Downtown Disney is lovely, and we also hired the small watercraft for the kids - which they loved. Highly recommended especially if you are lucky enough to get the free quick service disney dining plan with it, although we would upgrade to the full dining plan if we stayed here again (which is very likely).

Reviews.Title: “Feb Vacation with the grandkids”
Reviews.Author: tukki
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Disney's French Quarter resort at Port Orleans with my 3 grandsons ages 16,14 and 10. This was my 2nd visit at FQ but first with the kids and my 10th Disney trip in 10 years. I would strongly recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Disney with "older" kids. They had the time of their lives! Not only is the resort Disney level clean and safe, the food courts are so kid friendly, I had a hard time convincing them to eat anywhere else. The sister resort Riverside is an easy walk through beautiful grounds and offers more pools and dining options. The convenience of having both bus transport and water taxi to downtown was also great with the kids. Although it was school vacation week and the resort was " full" it never felt crowded. There were always seats at the pool and there was never a long wait at the food court. We also took advantage of the meal plan, another thing I would recommend, it is really a great deal and the kids don't have to find you to get $ anytime they want a drink or a snack. We shared a rm with 2 queen beds and it was not spacious, but comfortable. It also had a fridge. I liked the feature of being able to draw the curtain at the sink area so you could get out of the shower and have a private dressing area. The layout of the resort is great too, not too big, easy walk to the lobby, buses, pool, food. It was also very safe, when myself and the 10yo were tuckered out the older boys enjoyed the pool until midnight. When I checked on them I found the area well lit and watched closely by security...ahhh felt very comfortable letting the teens have this "freedom". All in all it was a perfect vacation ( and probably my last chance to get the teens to WANT to go away with Nana.) No matter where I go, I always compare everything to Disney, Disney does it right! And love love the Magical express, not having to worry about luggage especially traveling with kids is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Disney Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LisaSecula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans - French Quarter over Christmas 2011 through New Years 2012. A wonderful time to visit Disney. We book adjoining rooms - a king bed in one, two doubles in the adjoining room. It was really nice for our 2 kids to each have their own bed. Very clean, comfortable, spacious accommodations! The food court was decent - had lunch there a couple of times. The bus transportation to and from the parks/resort was great. I was worried about the holidays being a very busy time, but Disney was prepared. We never had to wait long at all, and most of the time our bus went right to the park. A very good trip - I would recommend the resort and we'll definitely return to French Quarter with our kids the next time we want a hassle-free vacation to Disney! Our travel agent, Linda Hower at Dream Makers vacation was an excellent resource.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Moderate Resort at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: pak4489
Reviews.Content: Went on a family vacation to Disney just before Christmas 2011 and stayed 6 nights at Port Orleans French Quarter.Although our first time here we have stayed in pretty much every moderate priced resort at Disney sometime in the past. Hands down this has become our new favorite! Our kids are now adults and this resort was perfect for us- clean, plenty of room, close to all of the parks. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus and all but the last day we were there had no problems getting on the first bus that came (warning - if you go at Christmas time be sure and leave by the 22 or the crowds may be overwhelming). We loved the decor, pool and the service at the French Quarter. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: 301Canadians
Reviews.Content: We were at Disney World for 10 days in February 2012. We spent four nights at Port Orleans Riverside and five nights at Port Orleans French Quarter. Both resorts were wonderful! We had asked to be in either building six or seven @ French Quarter, to have a garden view and to be on the top floor, and were given a room covering all three requests. Koodos to Disney for putting queen sized beds in!! From check-in to check-out, every staff member who we had contact with was wonderful--knowledgable, friendly, helpful. We took the boat down to Downtown Disney twice--so enjoyable. Even if you aren't into shopping, just take the boat down and come back on it--so relaxing! The food at the Food Court was excellent. The French Quarter side of Port Orleans is much smaller than the Riverside side, but even so, we didn't feel confined. It was about a two minute walk from our room in building six to the main building. I did laundry one afternoon and the laundry facility is very adequate. I don't think it has been upgraded since the resort opened, but the washer and dryer did the job--and the washers and dryers are very plentiful. I wandered the grounds while my laundry was going. This was our nineth trip to Disney World--we have stayed in most of the value resorts and a number of the moderate and the French Quarter was excellent. Our stay there couldn't have been better and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jannica
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at a Disney resort and I was not disapointed. There are plenty of things to do at the resort itself, without ever going to a theme park. We did not stay there to visit any of the parks. Instead we took the boat to Downtown Disney, saw a movie, walked and saw the sights. Then we took a bus to Contemporary to check it out. From there we ventured on the Monorail to Grand Floridian for lunch. Not once did we have to use our rental car! We spent our second day at the pool at French Quarter. They had games poolside, trivia, a Mardi Gras party, and even a movie under the stars. The food at the food court was pretty good, I can't say enough about the beigents! They also had transportation from the resort back to the airport, which was free! The concierge can print your boarding passes, and help with any dining needs which was nice. On the day I checked in the computers were down, but the staff at French Quarter didn't let that affect their smiles. Parking was free at the resort, and if you're looking for a room with a view I would book the river view rooms, it's very pretty. The beds were very comfy, flat screen tvs, and a fridge in the room. I hope to come back on a Disney vacation with the kids and husband!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place!”
Reviews.Author: Coldguinness4me
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms with queen size beds, beautiful grounds and a nice compact but spacious resort with great attention to details. Our family loved this resort, both kids ages 7 and 10 had a great time at the pool. The food court is excellent, I loved the shrimp po boy! 3 days before our visit, I faxed in a simple 4 or 5 line request directly to the hotel with a few room and building locations requests, they honored both! We were placed in building 4 on a top floor. Building 4 is a great choice, right next to the food court, bus stop and pool.

Reviews.Title: “The lesser of the Port Orleans Resorts”
Reviews.Author: stones2125
Reviews.Content: The rooms, while very nice, were not as well themed for kids. The pool was ok. The food at the dining location was very Cajun heavy and not remarkable at all. Given the choice of Riverside or French Quarter, I would do Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: michelleSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two kids. We were in building 1, which is the furthest from the bus stop, but still not that far. It took us maybe 3 minutes to walk there and to the main buidling where the restaurant is. The rooms were designed nicley with plenty of room and storage. The one downside was the boat to DTD. The boats will not pick up passengers going to DTD until they have already picked up at RIverside, which means that many times the boats are full or can only hold a few passengers so there is a long wait. The buses to the parks were great.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: HuggingFitMum
Reviews.Content: There are two Port Orleans resort inside Disney World, the French quarter is smaller and has cozier feel than the Port Orleans Riverside. The rooms are spacious, although the bathroom is pretty small. And I'm already Asian. The buses going to the various theme parks can be a bit slow especially in the evenings. But this hotel is just a 10 minute bus ride to Magic Kingdom. If you stay here, try to get rooms in building 4,5 and 6. This hotel also have a 24 hour coin laundry facility, right beside the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back & lovely, our favourite Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: Rune R
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times in the past 2 years with my 19 y/o daughter and have thoroughly enjoyed ourselves each time. The French Quarter is the smallest of Disney's resort hotels and feels very laid back and relaxed when compared to say the Contemporary, Caribbean Beach or All-Star Movies but it doesn't lack for quality, the grounds are always immaculate and there is a lot of space for kids to let off steam as well as a good sized pool with slide and a small hot tub. Jazz music plays in the background but is never so loud as to be a nuisance and really adds to the Mardi Gras atmosphere that's carried over into the reception and food court. Dining options are typical Disney offerings but with a few New Orleans twists such as muffaletta, po'boys & beignets and quality is okay but it can get a little repetitive if you're only using the food court here, we tend to eat in the parks or at Downtown Disney when we stay in order to to change it up a bit, or if you have a car it's not far to the various family restaurants down the 192. There's a laundromat on site if you need to do any washing, as well as the usual video arcade and gift shop. The shop stocks a small range of toiletries / medicines but its not extensive so stock up beforehand if you don't want to go off site for stuff. Rooms aren't what you'd call large but since we only sleep there it's not a problem and there's plenty of room for two although 4 adults might be pushing it. Beds are always comfy with plenty of pillows (I wish Disney would do away with the blankets though thats just a personal pref) and the AC is easy to adjust. You also get a table, chairs, mini fridge and coffee maker plus the usual Disney toiletries and lots of good quality towels. Internet is available but at almost ten dollars for a day you end up feeling a bit resentful when you only need 30 minutes to check a few emails (so if you have an email equipped cellphone, take it!) Vanity area was spotlessly clean with 2 good-sized sinks, bathroom also clean although a little stained around the corners in places. No complaints though. Transport to all the Disney parks is via bus, there's only one bus stop here but we've never had a problem with not getting on buses and they also start running early enough in the morning for you to be able to get to the park or surrounding hotels for the various character breakfasts. Occasionally the buses go or return to the parks via Port Orleans Riverside resort which is much larger but don't panic if this is the case, they will take you home in the end! One of things we really enjoy about FQ is getting the riverboat from here to Downtown Disney, it's a relaxing 15-20 minute trip and a lovely way to start or round off the day. Coming back along the river at twilight is very atmospheric, especially when you encounter the horse drawn carriages clopping around the lanes. If you fancy a change of eats, you can walk over to the Riverside section and visit the food court there and this is also where you pick up the horse drawn carriages. Staff are always cheerful and polite here and we've never had any problems with poor service, even at those hectic whole coach party checking in times. Cleaning staff / room service are always polite and just as they do in other Disney hotels, will arrange your stuffed toys, towels etc into amusing poses or patterns - something we always looked forward to seeing when we got back at night. It's always Mardi Gras here so if you have kids (or indeed if you're just a kid at heart) don't forget to collect all those strings of beads that turn up around the resort, we found them not only in the gift shop but also in the food court, concierge desk, check in desk and even in the taxi office. At certain times they also have activities for children out on the 'green' by the pool including discos, treasure hunts, various competitions and Disney movies screened outdoors. This is our favourite Disney resort, it never feels crowded even at busy times like Easter and Halloween and we always feel welcome here. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelDad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay at the French Quarter. I was with my wife and children 7 and 4. I don't know really what it was but Disney has definately lost a step. I have stayed on and off property many times and I have always preferred on property because of the Disney feel and treatment. The French Quarter was a little run down. The room was ok and the pool area was aged. The center of the resort is under renovation so that didn't help things. The food court area at times was a mess with garbage cans overflowing and tables not cleaned. I have never seen this at a Disney resort before. I am by far not a complainer. We still had a great trip but it was a little lacking this time. On our last day we went to Riverside and spent the day there. The pool and slide were nicer and the water was much warmer. I would not stay at French Quarter again. Unfortunately our camera and video camera were lost/stolen while we were at Riverside so I don't think we would stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, not so happy to see you”
Reviews.Author: dearmisterbones
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one weekend in February to attend the Princess Half Marathon. The room was spotless, not even a hint of any kind of odor. It was quiet, the grounds were immaculate, and there was a pleasant walkway that connected to the Riverside part of the property. For a place that has so many rooms, it didn't seem very busy though they booked due to them being a Princess Half Marathon host hotel. Transportation was frequent, and easy to the parks and to the half marathon events. The boat ride to Downtown Disney, though loud, was a fun way to travel other than a bus. Housekeeping was prompt and very willing to accommodate my simple requests. The food court was small but had enough variety for a short say. My only complaint was that the staff were not very friendly. No smiles from anyone (except the housekeeper), or expressions of appreciation for being a guest there. Checking in took a very long time and the staff did not seem pleased to welcome guests. At checkout I was not acknowledged or asked about how my stay there was. I would stay again because it was a pretty and quiet property, and since I'm not chatty I didn't mind the unfriendly staff but I think others may be put off by that.

Reviews.Title: “The best moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjam15
Reviews.Content: The renovated rooms are great! They are doing working on the lobby area now and it is still wonderful. I think you just can't go wrong at this hotel for the price and location! So convenient to Downtown Disney. The buses are always available. never waited longer than 15 minutes! We love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lily_em82
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to DisneyWorld and it was for our honeymoon. This resort was suggested as it is the smallest one and would be quieter for us. The room was beautiful. We had a corner room on the top floor so we never heard another person our whole week. Fridge was handy for drinks so we didnt have to always go back to the food court. Nice table and chairs and window bench so you arent always hanging out in bed when in the room. I loved that in the evenings there was a different Disney movie shown out in the court yard and there was staff there handing out large towels to sit on the grass. We even saw a bunny one night. Dining options are limited as the resort is small but it was great for breakfast and most of our meals we were away for anyways. We had our towel Mickey when we arrived and the next day there were two swans inside the Mickey. One day we returned from the parks and found a picture of Mickey and Minnie that said congrats in a folder for us to add a picture of ourselves and display together. My husband got sick and the staff were great at helping him get to a clinic and have medication delivered; the clinic had someone come pick him up and bring him back. A couple days later we had to go to the Emergency room and the conseirge gave us a voucher to cover the cab there and back. There was some work being done but it didnt take away from our wonderful experience. We were heading off to the Bahamas for a week afterwards so it was also nice that they have a laundry area easily accessible. Our experience with the bus was great. Each time we were picked up we went straight to the park with no more stops to pick people up. After a show at the polynesian we had to take a bus to downtown disney then from there back to our resort; the bus driver asked where we were going and ended up taking us directly to our resort. As some mentioned, we also saw the large groups of cheerleaders but usually got to the food court before the busy time so this wasnt a problem. I would reccommend this resort and we would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay on property and were able to stay at the French Quarter. The room was so comfy and large, the bathroom was just the right size and I love having the sinks outside the bath and toilet area. The shuttles are right there to pick you up, the boat easily to get to go to Downtown Disney. The staff were are so friendly and warm. Always a smile on everyone's face. The pool was fantastic, what a nice bar too. The grounds were so clean and well kept. The front desk staff were very good and professional. The food court was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fr Qtr-NOT 4 fams w/Tw&Teens!!! also rm, food,tix tips....from DisneyVet”
Reviews.Author: AFBrat1117
Reviews.Content: Have been to Disney 20+ times; used to live in FL so have been going since the 80's.First off, let me say that I was v. excited to stay at French Qtr; we actually are French and a jazz playing family so the theme and design was perfect. I do not mean to bash the resort but there is a SERIOUS LIMITATION for families w/tweens/teens (more below) or anyone who is expecting to use a pool/hottub (see below). The room itself was lovely and had a brilliant design, def an upgrade from All Star where we stayed last, more space, two Q beds (v. doubles @ AS), flat screen tv, fridge, and a curtained off dressing & bath area that was ingenious (allowing people to dress in privacy, great for families) The curtained off area had a lovely tile floor (main room was plush carpet); double sink was also in this area w/a hairdryer, ironing bd & iron & small in wall safe (only big enough for wallets etc.). The toilet/shower also had its own door behind the curtain. So the dressing and bathroom areas had complete privacy, great for families! Kudos to the design team for this layout! The buildings, grounds, & room design itself were brilliant, altho be warned there are 7 buildings so it can be a wallk from the main bldg to your building, they are kind of spread out over about a mile I think, but on the up side only three floor high and completely charming. Tres New Orleans style and grounds design, walking paths, fountains etc. But we were traveling w/a teen son and I just want to warn others: the pool was a KIDDIE POOL. It was absolutely useless to us. It looks lovely on screen but it about 3-4 feet deep and completely toddler oriented. That would be ideal if you are traveling w/young children, don't get me wrong; if that's you, then do not hesitate to book this resort. But if you are traveling with teens or tweens, or a couple looking forward to a spa pool, pardon my french, teens or adults would not be caught dead in this so called swimming pool! It is really a toddler play pool. Perfect for that, but not for adults wishing to swim or unwind or anyone with kids older than 7 I would say. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT! We are from the north so swimming was one of our main reasons for booking this vaca, obviously we don't get to swim up here in the Notheast in the winter so we arrived w/swimsuits in tow looking forward to getting a dip and R&Ring by the pool (from our previous experience at the All Star Movies when our son was younger, we assumed all pools would be large and inviting like their many pools.) The literature you receive upon check in or advice from the front desk about this situation was, "Well you can use the pools at Riverside "next door"- let's be clear: Riverside/"next door" is a MILE WALK! Who wants to walk a mile to go swimming or come back sopping wet over a mile? Even if you took the bus over there, who would want to ride a bus in their swimsuit or back sopping wet on the bus? Even so, Port Orleans Riverside "pools" are characterized as "swimming holes" spread all over their property so not exactly like we'd be walking over to the disney beach club beach...so NOT WORTH IT! TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY w/TWEENS/TEENS or couples looking fro a romantic spa/pool! if anyone plans on swimming. Otherwise, the layout was fine, the grounds were lovely, the food court had a decent amt of themed food, beignets highly recc; ribs/dirty rice/chicken, along w/ typical pizza/mac n cheese/chicken fingers for finicky kids plus sweets/bakery. All good/fine but not great and of course, expensive. Burger was typical frozen amusement type park food. My son said his ribs & dirty rice were good. we paid $30 dinner for three no desserts. Our meal at Liberty Tree Tavern (Magic Kingdom) on the other hand was AMAZING, best kept dining secret. Def try to go there for luch, get res. if u can. My husband's bacon burger was out of this world, I get the Patriot's (Turkey dinner) always good, pot roast good. Traditional colonial amercian fare but high quality. We always reserve here and never disappointed. HINT: book for LUNCH as dinner menu is prix fixe turkey dinner only and costs more. Lunch menu is the one w/widest offerings. And amazing desserts! Martha's Choc Cake w/coffee frosting and Some kind of Apple Dessert w/caramel and cranberries served warm, OMG! Best dessert I have ever eaten! Overall, Resort is Lovely; main check in bldg has check in, food court, fountains, live music some nights, sep bar, gift shop w/post office & groceries (milk/cereal etc so handy to keep in room for bfast to save $). (You can also find a WalMart close by etc to purchase lunchmeats breads etc to pack lunches etc so save more.) POOL A PROBLEM for tweens/teens/couples; but if you are here w/toddlers or under 7 crowd ok. Be prepared to walk, can be a distance from main building where the bus stop is. Bus service was excellent tho. We ended up leaving 2 days early due to lack of pool. We had planned time at the parks, did those then had figured we'd R&R by the pool then found out there was none appropriate for our family. Total waste for our/teen family. Should've stayed at AS Music or a some other hotel w better pool access. Not worth the upgrade for us. AS Music similar theme but better pool facilities for teens/tweens. Food not much better/diff. Rooms a little smaller in AS, no sep dressing area and dbl beds vs Q. See my ROOM TIPS to choose a bldg that is appropriate for you. They also have a luggage hold area in the main bldg which I think is for is you arrive early you can stow your luggage till check in time and conversely you can stow on check out day to pick up later. ALSO, do NOT get PARK HOPPER TIX: we spent over 1.5-2 hrs "hopping" between parks (this is Disney's official disclaimer time as well); the transporatation system is a joke/way overcrowded. You take a monorail to get to the main monorail hub (where you can also choose the riverboat,supposedly faster to MK) to get between parkss. At each stop, there is a 45-hour queue so you end up waiting for the first trans, then getting in line again for the next trans, then finally getting to your destination/other park like TWO HOURS later!!! miserable waits out in the hot sun as well . We've been to Disney 20 or more times; just get the single day park passes and focus on/stay in one park for the day so as not to waste hrs trsansferring btwn parks, there are enough lines in each park you will have to wait in/waste time anyway thruout the day just as normal part of DW (try to take advantage of fastpass at least, at opening, run to the most popular ride first in the park and get a fast pass at the kiosk u need your admission cards to get them and ride them right away) if u wait, you'll end up w 8 pm ride times) and ride them first, you can bang around the park for shopping & less serious rides later. Take advantage of Magic Hours if u can, espec the morning ones to get there early and get to those pop rides; divide and conquer, get in those pop ride lines fast (Soarin & test track at Epcot; Space Mtn, Buzz, etc at MK) then have one party/parent take your tickets to the fast pass kiosk while ur waiting in line & print u fast passes for later. generally, you get a one to two hour ride again altho if u arrive at the rides late, it can be up to 8 at night. We also visited Universal/HP this trip so check my other review for that.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty carpets and poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: PBSalem
Reviews.Content: I love Disney and I want to love this hotel. I loved the theme, the layout and size of this hotel but the room was just not clean. We got dressed for dinner Andy daughter was wearing a white cotton sweater she was playing on the floor and when she got up her sleeves were filthy. The carpets need to be replaced. It was obvious the room was never vacumned during our stay and the faucet handles were dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Already recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Redheadsx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PO-French Quarter Dec 14-21, 2011 and had an excellent trip. We flew down and utilized the free bus transportation from the airport and was slightly concerned about our luggage arriving in our rooms but some of it was there before we finished check-in. Check-in was a breeze (though there were only 2 people working and the visitors before us seemed to have a lot of questions so that took a little extra time). There were 11 people in our party so we reserved 3 standard rooms but we were upgraded to "riverview" rooms which was very nice. We were on the 3rd floor of bldg 6 and 2 of the rooms were directly across from each other and the 3rd was just a few doors down. We had 2 children in our party ages 3 and 8 they loved the nightly marshmallow roast and the nightly Disney movie shown on the lawn. The pools were great and fairly warm for December. The food court was nice and the food was great, especially the deserts baked fresh in the bakery. The size was great and the resort was so quiet. When you got off the bus people would head in different directions and then seem to disappear and you almost felt like you had the hotel to yourself. The only time our bus went through Riverside was one afternoon when we headed to miniature golf at Blizzard Beach and there were a few people headed to Animal Kingdom but I think the only reason they went through Riverside was because the bus was so empty. One other time we went to one stop but when the bus was full with people standing we headed off to the park. They have transportation people at each hotel and parks that can re-direct buses as needed. We have alreay recommended this hotel to friends planning a trip. I have stayed in Disney hotels twice and one time off property. Once at Carribean Beach Resort and the other at All-Star Movie Resort and both were OK but we will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magical”
Reviews.Author: Milliecat72
Reviews.Content: Its taken me a while to write this review. Myself and my husband went to Port Orleans FQ on 10 December 2011 for 1 week. Whilst it was some time ago, my memory of the hotel shall remain with me for my life. We were in Block 3 in a standard room. Check in was seamless and very 'Disney' but in a good way! Our room from the moment we entered became the most comfortable 'at home' experience myself and my husband have ever felt (and we have been to quite a few hotel) not only was the room spotless, it was cosy, well presented and very comfortable. MouseKeeping were brilliant and our room was cleaned to perfection every day. I cannot comment on the swimming pool (bit too chilly even for an English woman!) but the grounds were amazing, the attention to detail (which I appreciate is Disney) was wonderful from the 'old world' street lamps to the cobbled streets. We went whilst all the Christmas Decorations were up, how utterly magical. We found ourselves wandering around in awe at the sheer colour spectrum they used and what a great effect it was. The Disney Shop at the hotel had a great selection of goods including Star Wars Vinylmation which I never thought two 39 year olds could get excited about...But we did! We didn't eat at the hotel, but the bar, whilst quite small was enjoyable and very friendly. The reason it is nearly the end of February and I have only just written the review, is because we are booking to go back to Port Orleans FQ in September this year. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. You will have a truly wonderful stay here. 3% fullUsing 280 MB of your 7683 MB ©2012 Google - Terms & Privacy Last account activity: 12 minutes agoDetailsLet people know what you're up to, or share links to photos, videos, and web pages.

Reviews.Title: “It Is A Moderate Hotel Without A Doubt!”
Reviews.Author: GVTrai58
Reviews.Content: My little family of four loves DisneyWorld. We have stayed at Wilderness, Contemporary, Animal Kingdom, Boardwalk, Riverside, and now the French Quarter. Let me say the difference between the "Deluxe" and "Moderate" resorts is HUGE. We loved the Deluxe Hotels and enjoyed spending time at the resort whether it was swimming, exploring, or just relaxing. The Deluxe Hotels are part of the experience. Now, as my kids have gotten a little older, we go to the parks in the morning and have been coming back late...so, I haven't felt like spending the money on the good hotels. And the French Quarter is a decent place to sleep after a long day at the park. The doors open to the outside like a hotel off the interstate. Our room was clean and decorated well. The rooms are fairly small. The beds are OK but, certainly not great. The TV selection stinks. Disney has about 50 channels and 20 or more are Disney Infomercial type channels. So, when you get back to the room and put the kids to sleep and you want to watch a little TV, the choices (channels) STINK! Now, the grounds are beautiful. The pool is nice although we didn't take the time to swim in it. So, to sum it up. The French Quarter is a decent hotel on Disney's property. If you are going to go to the parks in the morning and not come back until fairly late the French Quarter is an average place to sleep at. It is not going to wow you, but will give you the benefits of staying on Disney property like Disney Transportation and the Disney Dining Plan. I recommend this hotel rather than staying off the property and having drive your own car to the park or take a non-Disney bus which drops you off far away from the main gates.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite So Far”
Reviews.Author: amandasprice
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went on a mother/daughter Disney vacation and I let her pick out the hotel. We stayed Oct. 29 - Nov 4, 2011. This was my 4th Disney resort to stay at and it quickly became my favorite so far. The rooms had recently been renovated and just a standard room was close to the transportation. LOVED IT and I plan to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Times have changed at Disney resorts”
Reviews.Author: ppraisegod
Reviews.Content: We recently spent Presidents Day weekend at this hotel. The Disney resorts however have really gone down in quality. We have been staying at Disney hotels for long weekends for over 15 years . Gone are the nice soaps ,shower caps , sewing kits, shoeshine kits, lotion and other nice extras. The beds only had 2 small pillows and one decoration pillow. The safe had no key so the first day we had no safe until they took a part out and made a new key for it. Our recent stay at this hotel we were given one very small conditioner/shampoo combo and 2 small soaps. The large wooden furniture is gone. The amenities are the same as you would receive in a motel 6...... We were in room 5135. This is the first floor.This room is next to the grass area. DO NOT stay in this room if you plan on sleeping much. At 1 AM we were awaken by very loud guests laughing and playing on the grass. The staff does nothing to quiet guests down. Finally a man opened his door and yelled at the loud people who played for another 20 minutes before finally being quiet. On Saturday nights they have a very loud movie on the greens. The hotel is big enough that you need not ever be near these rooms so ask. The pool looks nice but when we finally had a free minute we were told it was closed and we could walk to the hotel next store if we wanted to swim. Only a 10 minute walk they kept saying.... This trip we did not try the buses since we know how slow they are . We were told by another guest that it took them from 9AM-10:20 to arrive at magic kingdom on the bus!!!! Disney has combined many resorts on the same bus route. In the past all resorts had their own bus. The reason to stay in a Disney hotel would be: You need the transportation and have lots of time to waste. You want to do the magic hours in the park. If you don't get up early or stay out at parks into the night there are much better and less expensive resorts all around property. I never thought I would advice this. We have always advised people to stay on property . This resort is considered a moderate resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the French Quarter resort with my husband, toddler and mother (in adjoining rooms) for 3 nights while visiting Walt Disney World. We booked the rooms with a AAA discount, and I found the rate to be a great value. The rooms aren't fancy, but they have been recently updated and are certainly adequate. The resort is small - great for a family with young children. The on-site food court does not have much variety, but it is kid friendly and easy. The line moves pretty quickly, even at peak hours. We were there in early February and never had a long wait for a bus to the parks, though they do fill up just prior to park opening times, and you may have to wait for a second (or third) bus to come along. The boat service to Downtown Disney was fabulous. When we return to Disney, we would certainly consider staying here again .

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not up to Disney Standards”
Reviews.Author: Shawn_McKnight
Reviews.Content: Coronado was full for our annual trip so we tried Port Orleans French Quarter this time. We picked French Quarter as it has good reviews and the same number of buses as riverside but less people guaranteeing less crowded transport. The rooms were good and clean, and in fact the rooms are identical to Coronado except the bathroom separator was a curtain instead of solid wood doors. Free wi-fi works well and the service was reasonable - an AC problem was fixed right away, but it overall it wasn't up to previous trips. Our only request, a ground floor, was ignored, we wound up on the top floor. They forgot my wife's birthday on check-in and Fulton's Crab House forgot it as well along with the cake I ordered. (Note most of the Downtown Disney Restaurants are now on the dining plan but are still working out the kinks). We ordered a river view room and got a bit of a surprise. The "river" is a 200ft wide blackish green body of water for the water taxis - not really much of a view. Water taxi's ply it every 20 minutes in each direction, every 10 after 4pm till 11pm. That's an average of a boat every 5 minutes past your door and each boat repeatedly honks an air horn pulling in and out of the dock, so picture a sports fan in a lawn chair with an aerosol can air horn honking and yelling at your room every 5 minutes. Imagine the tone of your wife turning to you 15 minutes after check-in and saying "REALLY?" upon hearing the 3rd horn go off. If you get the pool as your view, you should know they set up a DJ booth and speaker system for loud music and kids games at 2 and 3pm so if you afternoon nap your kids this could be an issue. For the $25 a day extra the water view room costs you could get a park hopper or water park/golf add-on for the family instead and not miss a thing. We skipped the Magic Express again (see my Coronado review) and went for the $100 limo including a grocery trip. Tried Payless Transportation this time instead of Tiffany and won't make that mistake ever again. Tiffany picks you up in a town car when you book a town car. Payless - also booked as a town car service - picked us up in a Ford Expedition and returned for us (late) in a dented green panel van we were embarrassed to climb into. So overall, in point form: - Rooms are good and clean and free wi-fi works good. - Don't get water or river view - Service is okay but remind them repeatedly of special occasions - Watch your dining plan credits after using downtown Disney restaurants - House of Blues charged us once at dinner and once again the next morning (between meals so it was hard to detect) and the only way we avoided a truly embarrassing conversation at a character breakfast was by watching the bottom of the receipts, noticing multiple credits disappeared and getting the mistake fixed at the front desk. The people at the restaurants cannot help you. - Hollywood and Vine is the best character breakfast by far and we've done them all. - The Toy Story Mania ride is awesome and always full and the fast pass closes (full) before noon on any day. Book an 8am Hollywood & Vine character breakfast to get into the park an hour early. Send the family to the restaurant and walk immediately to the fast pass machine (back of park) to get fast passes which even by then will be after 9am, then go have breakfast. When you get out of breakfast go ride - and notice that the fast pass times are now near 5pm. - Try not to book meals at other resorts (ie.Boma, Jiko, Narcoosees etc) unless you don't mind the full hour transit time because you have to go to a park then get the resort specific bus back to where your meal is. We found buses took a little longer from this resort since it was off the highway system by a road or two. Note MK water ferries don't operate in the morning in time to get early breakfasts. - Some parks (Hollywood for one) offer transport to other parks directly so they can be used as transport hubs. - Want friends in the area to join you in the pool? Have them park free at DD and take the free boat to the French Quarter that lets off 200 ft from the pool next to the Dragon Slide. - For photos and recreation schedules etc, see www.portorleans.org

Reviews.Title: “Magic is gone from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noble_Scribe
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that most of our poor impression of this hotel was probably owed more to the guests than the staff. Still, so that people will understand clearly what they’re in store for, I will endeavor to write candidly of the experience. We stayed here in mid-February, what had been described as the “last week of the off season.” But if this was the off season, I’d hate to see the busy times. It was a family trip, with our 3-year-old daughter, my wife, and my wife’s parents. Check-in was smooth. The front-desk staff weren’t terribly welcoming, rehashing the same spiel about meal plans, check-out options, what the room key/park ticket did, etc. like they’d done it a thousand times that day. We arrived on the heels of a Disney Express bus bringing a load of people from the airport, so the lobby was crowded and we had to wait behind the bus people. That was the story of the trip, come to think of it – fighting through semi-organized crowds. After fighting through the bus people to check in, we found that our connecting rooms were not that at all. They offered to let us stay a night, pack up our stuff again, become nomads from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., and then relocate to another pair of rooms elsewhere in the resort to have connecting rooms. We decided instead that we’d deal with the separate rooms, which were at least adjacent, and would just shuttle our 3-year-old back and forth between our room and her grandparents’ as she wanted to visit. Then, we discovered that the buses from the hotel to the parks were incredibly crowded with the most obnoxious class of people. Regardless of how long you’d been at the bus stop, the crowds were eager to push their way past you to board the buses and secure themselves a seat. The buses also pull through a series of about four stops at the adjacent resort – Port Orleans Riverside – which creates a special impediment if trying to make time to keep a dinner reservation at one of the parks. One particular group with which we had the most negative impression was a large group of teenage cheerleaders who were staying at the hotel for some type of competition. They all sought breakfast at the same time at the Sassagoula Boatworks and Food Factory at the hotel, which made it impossible for any other guests to dine there before hitting the parks. These girls broke in line, stepped in front of you, spent time socializing in front of soda fountains and bathrooms, bumped into you and your tray of food without apology or regard and generally created a terrible start to the day. While their behavior could not be regulated by the hotel, one wonders why Disney, with its immense resorts, would book a party so large at one of its smallest hotels. The dining facility was simply not able to accommodate so large a crowd and its family guests. More planning or organization on Port Orleans French Quarter’s part, such as having these crowds dine earlier or later than the breakfast rush for other guests, would have been a vast improvement. (Although, honestly, the food wasn’t that great anyway. Which made having to fight for it all the more of an insult.) Though the hotel offers ferries to Port Orleans Riverside and Downtown Disney, these turned out to be a bit of a joke. We promised our 3-year-old a boat ride and had intended to visit the toy store at Downtown Disney, and since the ferries departed from our hotel, it seemed sensible to take one as a convenience and an experience. Of course, we never expected to lose 45 minutes of our vacation to standing on a dock (couldn’t provide benches for people, Port Orleans? Really?) waiting for the ferry to arrive. Once it did arrive, it loaded so many people on it that some, including yours truly, had no seat. Unlike the buses, you’re not permitted to stand for ferry trips, so I had to ask people to please put their children in their laps and move over so that I wouldn’t have to get off the boat and wait another half hour for another ride. THE GOOD The best thing we can say about the resort: the room was immaculate, the “mousekeeping” staff was first-rate and polite and the rooms were comfortable and reasonably well-appointed. The furniture was nice and was not worn, and the carpet was clean and lush, and the bathrooms were very clean and stain-free. THE BAD It goes without saying that Disney is going to have crowds, but the crowds at this place were exceptional in their rudeness, which Port Orleans French Quarter did not try at all to mitigate. The staff wasn’t rude, but wasn’t as exceedingly welcoming as one has come to expect from a Disney resort. The long and short of it, the magic just ain’t here at this Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the Disney moderate hotels”
Reviews.Author: sclarkey
Reviews.Content: Great location - beautiful grounds I think it is nicer than Riverside. Fabulous boat service to DTD dont forget to eat at Earl of Sandwich which is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Disney Hotel Resort”
Reviews.Author: pawisngtren
Reviews.Content: Find another Disney Hotel Resort. Our experience staying in this hotel did not meet our expectations. For example they close the swimming pool at 5 pm, disappointing the children. Broadband is not free and food is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moomduck1
Reviews.Content: The theming is beautiful. Rooms were clean. Pool was nice. Hot tub was jammed with small children so we skipped it. Large selection of food at food court. Wonderful singer/musician when we were there in the evenings near the bar. It's not a deluxe hotel but for what you pay, its really very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MiaCat1523
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, food fine, mousekeeping good, rooms lovely but - at the end of the day - we were in DISNEYLAND!!!!! First timer (obviously?) and WHO CARES if the bathrooms are very slightly small? We had a totally amazing tme. There are so many places to eat around the parks that we rarely ate at the hotel except for breakfast (the kids went for waffles or pancakes every time but there were also yogurt and fruit, cereal and more traditional "cooked" breakfasts) somethng for everyone really so lack of menu choices not really an option although i appreciate that salads or chips must get boring for veggies. I absolutely loved it, building 4 right near the bus stops and restaurant, never had a problem with delivery noises or anything else, would thoroughly reccommend it to anyone. Fantastic pool and hot tub, great shop, laundry facilities......unless you're very fussy you will love it. Wish I could go back right now!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM and FRIENDLY FOLKS”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: This is where we stayed for our wedding trip. Everyone was super friendly and excited to be working. Our 1st room had a great view and was peaceful and quiet. But a giant mother spider had hundreds of babies living there as well. (Not Disney's fault).They happily moved our room, to a different side of the hotel where they show a movie on the lawn at 9:00 every night. Well, it goes on to 10:30 or 11 pm and is very loud. So, before unpacking, I said, with a young child this wasn't a good fit. They found us a quiet room in the back of the resort. Wonderful location. Friendly staff. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the moderate category”
Reviews.Author: Michaels017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during our Disney vacation and loved it! The room didn't have a ton of extra space but we had 4 people in ours pretty comfortably. I liked that there was a curtain you could pull to block off the sink and bathroom area, in case anyone was in there while other people were trying to sleep. The resort is smaller, which we liked a lot. Ours was one of the farthest buildings from the lobby but it was only a 3-5 minute walk to get to the front where the Disney buses pick you up. You can also take a free water taxi to Downtown Disney, which was great. They have a cafeteria style restaurant that's a little over priced but we only went there for breakfast, and the beignets were delicious! I loved the gift shop at the hotel... we went there almost every night when we got back and I bought most of my souvenirs right there. The New Orleans style of the hotel was really cute and everything seemed really well kept, and our room was also nicely cleaned each day. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A neat little property”
Reviews.Author: champferg
Reviews.Content: I was here on business, and have stayed at Disney properties before as overflow for a larger Orlando expo. Port Orleans - French Quarter has standard rooms, very clean, and excellent maid service. There are quite a few dining options in a "food court" type situation, and a bar there as well. There was also a nice pool bar, near an awesome - complete with sea serpents and slides - the kids would love. Nice cobblestones and wrought iron, and a good feel about this place. I also should note that buses will carry you to Downtown Disney and the parks, and there's a boat to Downtown Disney. While I was there they also seemed to be having outdoor movies like "Bambi" each night. This was a business trip, but I'd certainly go back as part of a moderately priced vacation with my kids. Great staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SueTN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the French Quarter from Jan. 1st until January 9, 2011 and enjoyed the location. The rooms were spacious and quiet even though we were directly across from the pool. The travel to and from the Disney Parks was painless with buses running continuosly throughout the day. We also had access to Downtown Disney via the water which was a nice excursion. The Christmas deocrations when we first arrived were beautiful. On our last day they were almost all taken down and the place did a little of its sparkle-but then again I love the christmas season.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Charm of this Resort!”
Reviews.Author: sleepingbeauty_10
Reviews.Content: Love this resort! I think it is the best vaule of all of the moderate Disney Hotels. You can really feel like you are visiting New Orleans. They really do a great job of replicating the cobblestone roads, and every night you can hear the clip clack of the horses and their carraiges. I also loved the way they designed the building with all of the iron scrolls. There is only one bus stop, so you don't have to worry about a bus coming to you full. The benoits in the food court are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: TBearden
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter segment of the Port Orleans resort is nice enough, but don't expect the real French Quarter. Yes, there is a little wrought iron and some Mardi Gras-style giant faces in the food court, but would you ever find a food court in the real French Quarter? That said, I concur with most of the other positive reviews of this resort: large room, tiny toilet-shower cubicle, very loud plumbing, good beds, good sound isolation from the outdoor movie, etc. I would add one fairly small negative--the room lighting was quite obnoxious. It came from too-powerful CFCs in all the fixtures, and lit up the place like an airport men's room. If you turn all the lights on, it's downright blinding. I guess Disney got a bulk discount or something, but since CFCs can't be dimmed, less powerful bulbs would be a major improvement--and save electricity, too. On the positive side, the checkin process and the concierge service were simply outstanding. There was one glitch in the bus service when we had to wait 40 minutes for a ride to the Magic Kingdom; otherwise no problems with the internal transportation. The shuttle boat to Downtown Disney was a great value. Take advantage of it to find better restaurants than the PO food court.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Disney Gem!”
Reviews.Author: carrubba
Reviews.Content: Stayed February 3-11, 2012 as a family of four with 2 teenagers. This is a compact resort, as far as Walt Disney World goes. Since there are only 7 or 8 buildings it is not a far walk from any room to all services. I had a room in building 5 which appears to be recently redone. Two queen beds, a flat panel tv, double sink with privacy curtain, tub with shower, mini fridge, coffee maker, iron and hair dryer. Check in was smooth and mousekeeping was wonderful. The grounds are nicely landscaped with a mardi gras theme. The pool has a slide and separate hot tub. Never waited very long for buses, and a boat to Downtown disney was very convenient. The only downside to this resort is that the food court was somewhat limited in choices, but being Disney with so many other places to eat, we tended to eat somewhere else anyway. I had placed a food order with a grocery delivery service and bell services had it ready and brought it to the room. They had the cold items safely stored so I didn't have to be there when they arrived. The had a blow-up movie screen and showed nightly movies on the lawn for the kids at night. There were three floors in each building with elevators. Having stayed at a few of the allstars, Carribean Beach, and Riverside, this is my favorite Walt Disney World Resort so far.

Reviews.Title: “shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: darren f
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very good for transport to the theme parks and it was also very clean. the bar was a little bit over priced but so was the whole of disney at 5.5-6$ for 160z pint!! the rooms were ideal if you only stayed for a few days to a week but as we stayed for 2 weeks the rooms were not big enough. we did not have enough space to store clothing and not having a balcony made it difficult to dry any swim wear. the pool was well presented and had more life guards than swimmers some days so it helped to relax when the children were out of sight. the staff in all areas were great and showed a interest in the children which is what the trip was all about. the massive downside to the whole stay was the food choices,after 2 weeks it was boring and more than repetative.same breakfast choices every morning,same sandwhiches or pizza every lunch and the same pot roast or pizza every evening and if you didnt get enough of the pot roast on a evening it was shredded and used to make sandwhiches the following day for lunch. add to the fact my wife is a vegi and i challenge anyone not to be sick of pizza and chips for 2 weeks solid,that said when we raised the issue that a distinct lack of protien options for vegi's we were offered turkey!! maybe they grow thier turkeys different in the u.s it is a carb junkie's dream but not very good for anyone with a desire for choice and specific requirments.

Reviews.Title: “Well Priced Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mlsmith142
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the sparkle of the Grand Floridian this place is not for you. The hotel is very charming and comfortable and provides everything a family will need for a great Disney stay. We just returned from 8 nights at this property and everyong had a great time. If you can, stay in building 4 or 7. These are the closest to the bus stop and made it easier to get back in forth from the busses to our room. We were at the mark from open to close so the short walk was nice. Building 7 also puts you closer to the Riverside property and I highly recomend a walk over to this location as well. My kids loved the pool and the hot tub was a nice end to almost every day. The staff here is extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are fine. The bathroom area is a bit small but I found that to be the case when we stayed at the Wilderness Lodge last year as well. Rooms are clean. Only negative is I notices some of the sheets have "stains". Know this is hard to avoid with the volume but some were very noticeable. Bus stops were great and frequent. This location has no stops to the parks and the busses are great. Granted, we were at Disney during a slow time but we never had an issue with the bus system. All in all, a great value considering we were only at the hotel to sleep and get ready for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Disney Moderate Hotel - Though Downside of Lots of Stops on Bus to Riverside”
Reviews.Author: Second_City_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and wanted a hotel that was closer to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. This location fit the bill - especially since I had previously stayed at the Carribean Resort and wanted to try something new. I picked French Qtr over Riverside based on other TA reviews. Riverside is right next door and even larger in size (similar to Carribean Beach which is huge). My stay was pleasant and everything you'd expect from a Disney moderate resort. The main downside for me (and probably the reason I'd stay elsewhere in the future) is that the bus made stops at all Riverside locations. I had deliberately not stayed there b/c it was so large. Worse yet, the French Qtr was the last stop returning from Downtown Disney, and the the first stop the next morning to Hollywood Studios (so you then hit all the stops on the way out). This results in lots of extra bus time. Only the bus back from Magic Kingdom was direct to French Qtr.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Week”
Reviews.Author: DonnLlouM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Disney World the week of 01/23/2012 to celebrate our 21st wedding anniversary. It was the first time that we had stayed at French Quarter, and I HIGHLY recommend it. The smaller size of the resort (read "less walking") was perfect after long days at the parks. The ability to travel by boat to Riverside (with a sit-down restaurant) and Downtown Disney, or by bus to other Disney properties truly added to the enjoyment of a week of Disney immersion. All cast members were friendly and knowledgeable. The food court was wonderful for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks (try the fresh, cooked-to-order beignets!). The entertainment in the lounge was fantastic and we truly enjoyed an evening spent there. The property is decorated to resemble old New Orleans. Nothing gaudy, just fun. The room (first floor) was quiet (we didn't even hear the nightly movie shown just outside our front door). The decor was quite nice. The only concern I had was that the bed was very soft and I awoke each morning to a backache. We would highly recommend French Quarter for couples traveling alone or families, as there were LOTS of family activities available daily. The pool and hot tub looked very inviting although, unfortunately, we had forgotten our swimming suits. Highly recommend French Quarter...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Short Get Away”
Reviews.Author: EKSWV
Reviews.Content: We just did a four day getaway at the French Quarter. The accommodations are very nice for a moderate resort. The layout of the facilities are wonderful. The buildings are close together, however with each of the little streets you do not feel crowded. It is nice to be able to relax around the fountains or along the river. There was quite a bit of grounds maintenance taking place while we were there, which probably comes with the time of year. It was noticable, but not a problem. Very easy boat ride to Downtown Disney. A nice place to stay, even if you are not going to the Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans made our holiday perfect!”
Reviews.Author: minniemouse16
Reviews.Content: Just got back to Scotland from a fortnight in Port Orleans French Quarter. After reading the reviews on here we had high expectations, and they were surpassed. The Hotel was stunning, rooms were immaculate but most of all the staff were amazing! Arnel the greeter at the front door was the friendliest most helpful man ever, he constantly has a smile and gave my 3 year old Daughter mardi gras necklaces and coins every time he seen us. The Disney dining plan is fantastic, far too much food for the 3 of us well worth the money. Food choice in Riverside however is better. Watching movies under the stars is a perfect was to end a busy day........will defo be back here as soon as we can. Thank you everyone who made our dreams come true.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: Rob L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. had a garden view room. Away from the water which may be good because the boats that come by at night blow the horns non stop. They allowed late check out at 1pm instead of 11am. Any later, they said would charge a fee. It was a pleasant stay, but I would like to try a different resort if I went back. Pros - close to downtown Disney. There's a boat that comes every 10 minutes from 4pm to 1130pm and every 20 minutes from 10am to 4pm. - smaller resort that doesn't take 15 minutes to walk anywhere. - clean - friendly staff, great service - rooms were a decent size Cons - only place for food is a single food court with mediocre food and not a whole lot of selection - decor is pretty plain and boring - the plumbing in the building is incredibly loud. Almost each time someone above us (and not necessarily directly above) flushed the toilet, it woke up my 1.5 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Moderate Resort!”
Reviews.Author: MadScrapperMom
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter is definitely our new favorite moderate Disney Resort. We like the smaller size of this moderate resorts and the grounds are gorgeous, even in January. Our room was immaculate upon arrival and housekeeping always did an excellent job during our 6 night stay. We also enjoy the boat to Downtown Disney and the food court had a good selection. We found the food quality to be above average when compared to other Disney counter service restaurants. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: kasiny126
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week with my girlfriend, two teenagers and my parents, everyone loved this hotel. the cafe food was good enough and the staff was super friendly. the nightly performer was great, my daughter loved the pool, we were in building 7 and still was just a quick walk to everything. I would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kitty959
Reviews.Content: 4 of us spent a little over a week at The French Quarter from January 20th to29th. Absolutely fell in love with this place and can't wait to go again! The staff went even beyond Disneys usual excellent requirements. The accommodations were beautiful, clean and very well maintained. Love the little nuances like evening movies in the garden, parades, handing out beads and coins, pool games, boat ride to Downtown Disney, camp fire with marshmallows (supply your own grahams and chocolate and make a smore) to making my daughters birthday a little extra special. The dining area was very nice, had a lot of food options as well as going over to Riverside for any thing you can't find at French Quarter. Its a smaller resort too so everything we needed was close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Second time stay - still brill”
Reviews.Author: DISNEYFANLincoln
Reviews.Content: Just got back from second trip to French Quarter, stayed 12 nights end of January 2012, still as good as I remembered it.
