Bus service was great - no long waits, transportation time to parks was quick, no overcrowding, only shared bus with Riverside on the return journey from the parks, not to the parks in the morning. Buses were only overcrowded once on return from Magic Kingdom Wishes fireworks at park closing so that's only to be expected. Bus drivers were great and friendly. Boat to downtown disney as relaxing as I remembered it although a little busier as one boat is now shared between two hotels. Since last visit an added value - Movies on the green at 7 pm every night. This is a chance to watch a different disney movie each night sitting outside on the lawn, towels are provided to sit on, a great way to relax after a busy park day with a tired 6 year old. The rooms have been renovated and now have two queen beds (King sized in the UK) Decor was clean and nice with two hidden Mickeys. I like this resort because it is one of the smaller Disney resorts, it doesn't really matter which block you get allocated because none of them are a huge distance from the facilities, you don't have to pay for a preferred room. Food court is great - try the fried chicken and corn bread - my favourite. Only negatives are they no longer provide Kids life jackets for free at the pool but you can rent them and they were doing renovations to the lobby when we stayed but they've got to do it sometime to keep the hotel looking so nice. The gardens of this resort are special, the planting is lovely you can just sit on a bench and relax, the gardens even smell good. The walk to the sister hotel Riverside is a maximum of 10 minutes a way, a gentle stroll down the river if you want to try bigger facilities. The pool at French Quarter was excellent, many life guards constantly patrolling which makes you feel safe. Also note that there's free Wifi access in rooms - this does not seem to be widely advertised. I've stayed at other Disney hotels, this is still my favourite, I highly recommend this hotel, its so great on Disney value, I can't work out why people pay more to stay at the deluxe hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with great food”
Reviews.Author: MarySooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort just after Thanksgiving. We had a newly refurbished room with a gorgeous view of the river. We were close to where our car was parked but it was a jaunt to the food court, laundry, reception desk, and boat landing. We loved the resort and the food was phenomenal. Even though most of the resorts have basically the same breakfast menus, they aren't all equal in quality. We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in August 2010 and were disappointed with the food. We'll definitely stay at Port Orleans French Quarter again. The moderate resort room was more spacious than the deluxe resort. Next time we'll get a standard room closer to the food court. The street and garden views are just as nice as the river view. Also, the resort was very quiet. It will be nice when Disney starts putting wireless hotspots at all of their resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: J E
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the hotel for 12 days during the Christmas holidays. We had a great time! The hotel atmosphere was nothing like the mass chaos at the Value resorts. It was small enough to have a very quaint feel. The rooms were great and the service was outstanding. Even with the huge crowds, the food court was easily accessible. We didn't have to wait long for the buses to arrive and the return trip was just as easy. We also received the dining plan with our reservation. That was fantastic. We didn't have to worry about spending too much on food and snacks. Our kids were able to get whatever snacks they wanted and we got to go to most of the character meals for FREE!!! What could be better than that! Being from Hawaii and because we stay for a long period of time, we are always nervous about making the right hotel decision (comfort wise and financially). We were very happy with our decision! Staying here instead of the Value resorts was well worth the extra money. If we didn't have to spend 15 hours on a plane and mortgage our house :) to afford the plane fare, we'd be back really soon. Have to be satisfied We also wanted to give the Concierge ladies a big kudo for being extra nice and helpful. Well done ladies!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family Christmas Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply Awesome! With the updated renovations and the closeness to the parks, we had a great Family Vacation... The little animals which were left in the rooms each day were extra special and the hotel was clean and neat! We had an extended family with us and the trip was one of the best we have had! Even the little glitches were taken care of right away. The staff were pleasant and thoughtful ! The only regret was that we did not stay at the hotel long enough to enjoy all of their amenities! Next time it will be for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Karey H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from Jan 21st to Jan 28th. We loved it. The room was very clean and had lots of space for luggage, clothes etc. Not too far from all the amenities. Everyone was very helpful. We loved the boat ride to Downtown Disney. The pool and the games the kids played were great. Plus the buses were never too crowded. Can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nbgrif4060
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. It was very clean and the amenities were right on target for what we payed for. The staff went above and beyond in helping us get from the airport to the hotel and then from the hotel to the parks everyday. We used the disney transportation system and never waited more than 10 min for a bus. There is no need to rent a car when staying in a Disney resort. There were many activities at the resort to do during the day if you got tired of being at the parks. Pool/hot tub area was great after a long day of walking. Resort was much smaller than other disney resorts so it was much easier to get around in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Another PERFECT stay at a Disney World Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morrisonfamily67
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Disney World for the third year in a row and decided to try out a different hotel (We have previously stayed at Pop Century). We chose the Port Orleans French Quarter because of it's size and greenspace. I find that after walking the parks all day, I don't want to walk 1/2 mile to my room upon arrival back at the hotel. Well, it was another WONDERFUL stay. The hotel is everything we had hoped it would be and more. Even though there were a few facelifts happening during our stay, the property is just beautiful, very calm and quiet. The ferry that will take you to the Riverside side of the hotel or to Downtown Disney is a great convenience, although I DO recommend doing the walk to Riverside at least once along the waterway. The ferry's comes often and it gives a new perspective when you arrive at Downtown Disney by water. The food court is great, the food is very nice and the only disappointing thing that I experienced was finding out that they have changed their policy on redeeming leftover quick service meals for snacks. We had a bunch left and they would NOT let us take a muffin in place of a Quick Service. This didn't make sense since you could take the muffins as part of the Quick Service meal...The pool is lots of fun for the kids with the slides and games that take place in the afternoon around the hotel. We travelled to the Riverside pool as our pool was having maintenance performed one day, and we actually preferred the Riverside Pool, definately worth the trip over there. The staff at the hotel lobby are just great and all of the servers are very helpful as well. The rooms are a bit larger than the average hotel rooms, the beds are very comfortable and we were very comfortable. They have just installed WIFI access so it is free, no longer do you have to pay $10 per day for their usual service. BONUS - I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay :(”
Reviews.Author: Leasy J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our one year anniversary in October. While making the reservation months in advance, I requested a king bed. When we arrived, they only had a room with two double beds available! Super uncomfortable and small. Our room was clean, but we were woken up at 8 every morning by maids screaming to each other outside our door. This happened five out of eight mornings. We complained four times, but nothing was done until the final complaint when I threatened to contact a corporate number.. and even after the horrible wake up calls, the hotel only offered us 1/2 of ONE night's stay in return. Not impressed. The staff was incompetent and lazy. The food court was dirty and unfriendly. Definitely not a hotel Disney should be proud of. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice mid-priced resort”
Reviews.Author: Avelave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012. We requested a room with a king which we got but we also got a room with a view of the "river," which was on the back side of the resort and in our case furtherest from the pool and noise. This meant a further walk to the pool, restaurant and bus stop but we like to walk. The room was clean. It had a 2 sink vanity. A curtain can be drawn to divide the vanity space from the bed area. We liked this because it kept the room open but could be closed to keep light down for anyone still in bed. The shower/tub and toliet were separated with a door. There is no closet. Instead there is a rod along one side of the vanity area. Again not having a walled area with a door created more space to move around in. I thought the room was very spacious, but 2 queens would make it less so. We never waited more than 5 mintues for a bus. We went to Epcot and Animal Kingdom. We also took the Magic Kingdom bus from the airport. We found all the transportation very convenient. I doubt that January is a peak time for Disney so take that into account in considering this review. There is no monrail service at the Port Orleans resorts. One of our bus trips did take us through the Riverside resort and it seems to be much larger than the French Quarter so a lot more walking could be involved there? There is only one restaurant, Sassgoula, at the French Quarter. It had a good cafeteria style breakfast. We didn't eat there otherwise. You can take the bus to the other resorts or Kingdom's or take the boat to Downtown Disney for meals as well. We ate at several restaurants in Epcot and had lunch at one in Animal Kingdom. We also ate at a restaurant at Downtown Disney. They were all good to very good. We opted not to buy a Dining Plan. now that we know how much our meals at Disney cost, we know that the Dining Plan would have actually cost us money. I would look at this carefully before buying a plan. The meals in the Plan in general cover only an Entree, a dessert, and a nonalcohol drink. We like dessert but often prefer to split one or prefer to have an appetizer but you can't substitute. Sometimes we split a lunch etc. There are several different plans so you really have to study this and decide based on your eating preferences and whether you have children etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for my family”
Reviews.Author: libratravel
Reviews.Content: I visited for 4 days with my five year old daughter. She loved this hotel- the pool is,by far, her best memory of the trip! While at the parks each morning, she begged and pleaded to go swimming at the hotel. We loved the boat shuttles to downtown Disney. The park bus shuttles ran frequently and we never had a long wait. I really do think this hotel met our needs extremely well- we even took advantage of the nightly campfire at 5:30, as well as pool games, playground. There is an exquisite running trail along the river- take advantage of a gorgeous run/walk along the river!!!! I am so happy with our choice. Meals are cafeteria style but to be honest, we never ate on the property. Had a few groceries and had a meal plan to eat at all the other choices !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay During the 2012 Disney Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: FireDiver443
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as my family participated in various parts of the Disney Marathon Weekend festivities. My wife and I found our stay at Port Orleans Riverside quite enjoyable. The room was a super launch point for everything we did; clean, spacious.... I was able to spread out all my marathon stuff without inconveniencing my wife. Very close to the bus stop for Disney transportation. Loved the pool & hot tub area. The food court had a great selection although was lacking in the pre-packaged salad dressings; all you had to do was go to the salad station, though, and they hooked you up. The folks in the food court really bent over backwards to support the odd schedule race weekend participants were following to make sure we were all set for our races as we had to be in the corrals well before the food court opened for the day. We also really enjoyed the ease of boat travel to Downtown Disney, also a fun spot. If you get the chance, T-Rex is a must see. When we booked this trip, the "Disney Magic" I was hoping for pretty much focused on crossing the finish line of my first marathon. Somehow, and probably a testament to Disney, we wound up having a magical weekend as well as a great marathon. You might here people come in on going to Disney for marathon weekend. Even if you aren't a runner, I think you'd find this a great weekend to be at Disney

Reviews.Title: “Not often I say this, but we'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl444
Reviews.Content: My family of 10 (in 4 rooms) stayed here for a week and I have next to no complaints. The rooms were spacious and ultra-clean; the playground and pool were great for our 5-and-under crowd (there were 3 of them); the staff was very helpful and pleasant; the food court offered a decent variety; and the smaller size of the hotel made walking to the Disney buses a huge plus. Only negatives I could point out were the loudness of the rolling housekeeping carts, and the bathrooms: the toilets flushed so loudly that we could hear them in rooms above/next to us; the light in the bath/toilet area wasn't that bright; and the water stream from the shower head wasn't that forceful. Overall, it was a great stay and I'd recommend staying there - I'd go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: cathy191
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went down to celebrate my 40th birthday. we chose the FQ this time as we stayed at the riverside last year which we thoroughly enjoyed but want to try something different. i highly recommend this resort. the service was excellent all the way around. sue who checked us in was more than helpful and we were in and on our way to our room within 5min. we had no wait at all. connie was our mousekeeper all week and she was great. the resort is very clean. due to being a smaller resort, the pool was busy as it was the only one but that was okay and we had unusually warm weather while we were there. we never used the food court. we are not big breakfast eaters and ate our other meals in the park. we never had to wait long for a bus or boat and were close to everything. we had dinner at the grand floridian one night and it took us 35min from downtown disney to get there. beautiful place but too far from everything as opposed to FQ, our longest bus ride was 15min and that was due to traffic. they have a small park not far from the pool between buildings 5 & 6 and they show movies there every night. we didn't catch the entertainment in the lounge but did see the one at riverside which was awesome. lots of fun. there is certainly no shortage of things to do if you are not in the park. all i all, we loved it and would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased”
Reviews.Author: #1bamafan
Reviews.Content: I am a long time DisneyWorld visitor with more than 35 on-property resort stays but this was my first stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. I was extremely pleased with the size of the resort as well as the rooms. We traveled as a group of 5 adults, 1 child, and 1 infant and stayed in connecting rooms which worked out perfectly for us. The room was exceptionally clean and appeared to have been recently refurbished. The water taxi transportation to the downtown Disney area was an extra added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan W
Reviews.Content: Had a fab time at this resort. It is smaller than the rest which I think is a bonus as it isn't too far to walk to reception or the eating area. Great pool and very clean with lots of lifeguards if you have young children. The food court is a bit repetitive but if you are in the parks there is lots of choice throughout the day. I stayed in block 2 which was really convenient so if you get the chance request it!. There is a great boat service to downtown disney and riverside every 10 minutes until 11.30pm so no problem in getting around. Disney buses are every 20 minutes as well and as they are first pick up/drop off nice and convenient. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “quality disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: joisey-joe
Reviews.Content: we had 3 rooms for a week long family disney trip - pros: smaller resort, so easier to get around, we had 3 little ones so we didn't need all the bells & whistles ... bus transport was fine .... rooms were roomy enough w/ 2 queens .... you have to know these rooms get beat up on a regular basis just from the sheer number of people staying there, so starting to show wear already after a recent upgrade, but again was clean which is most important .... what you'd expect from disney cons: poor lighting in bathroom area, poor tv channel selection - no little kids cartoons on weekend mornings all in all a great stay and no real problems

Reviews.Title: “GOING BACK FOR A THIRD TIME”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: We love this place, its clean,the rooms are comfortable and have every thing you need, although being english we drink tea so we bring a travel kettle with.The staff are so friendly and bend over backwards to help you,we dont get this quality of service in the UK.Its a smaller resort so everything is close by.We have stayed by the water and also by the pool, both equally as good. The only down side is my partner found the food on offer in the food court a bit samey, i however did not. the pool bar was fab as was the Scats bar. The transport is excellent especialy the boat ride to Downtown Disney its so relaxing. Although there is a game room and a good pool i would say this resort is more suited to adults and older children.It has a well stocked general store that sells most things you could need.During our second stay i needed medical attenetion, nothing serious, the staff put me intouch with a local chemist/pharmacist who delivered medical supplies to the lobby/reception within an hour.We have booked to go back november 2012.So excited already. If you choose to stay here i am sure you will have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Magical Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: americaninparis08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter resort the week before Christmas and had a wonderful stay. Our room was in Building 5, on the third floor, and we had a beautiful view of both the river and the pool. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The recently renovated rooms are very nice, and you can't beat the intimate size (for an on-site Disney property). We were just a short walk from everything, the food court, the buses, the boats. And the beignets are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple”
Reviews.Author: Sigep565
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 19-25 of this year, and our stay was great. We had a king bedroom room which was close to the pools, lobby, and boat dock. The bus area what not that far of a walk either. I have previously stayed at the Pop Century, and this resort was an excellent upgrade. The only downside for us was having to occasionally share buses with the Port Orleans Riverside which is a HUGE resort with a HUGE guest count to match. Other than that, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Family With Children”
Reviews.Author: DovHatayar
Reviews.Content: If you plan to visit with your children Disney World in Orlando - this is one of the hotels you should consider. The Resort complex offers variety of hotels to choose from, all operated by Disney World. The Disney's Port Orleans Resort represents a great value for a middle of the line budget. Not cheap, but not too expensive. I would put it in the First Class category. The rooms have typically two double beds, very spacious and have all the basic amenities your family will need. The hotel's restaurant court is designed to fit the budget and taste of the adults and with special menus for the children. You are in the heart of Disney World entertainment complex with easy shuttle access to all the Disney "Lands"

Reviews.Title: “fine for family of that spends all waking hours in parks”
Reviews.Author: chefmsm
Reviews.Content: Only moderate property that allows 5 people in a room. We spend every waking hour in parks, so prefer not to spend a fortune on a resort we are not utilizing. This is our second time at this resort. Rooms adequate in size, concierge helpful, front desk is ok. Food court good enough with good selection. Bus waiting areas easy walk-definitely would stay on property vs off property hotel. Can't beat Disney customer service. There was a told of 18 of us. Our rooms all in a row. Was a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, just a little far....”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Grlz
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice. The gift shop was great, the restaurant was good, and the rooms were very nice & clean. The pool was nice for our 8 & 6 year olds. The only problem we had (and January is the off season) was that we had to wait for buses a lot. It wasn't so bad at the resort, but we waited for quite awhile at the parks. Definitely worth the money, but next time I would probably go with the Swan, Dolphin or Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ozetravellers
Reviews.Content: We had a quick 2 night stay here after being on the Disney Cruise for 5 nights. We had previously stayed at Carribean Beach resort which is another 'moderate value' Disney property. I chose French Quarter because it was small (so less walking to bus stop) and also had access to the boat to Downtown Disney. Unfortunately, we ended up not having time to catch the boat, or do much around the resort but I noticed the restaurant menu looked nice and the pool area looked great. It was also winter so swimming was not on the agenda anyway. The rooms are similar to Carribean Beach Resort - adequate and clean but nothing spectacular. I was disappointed with the dirty iron which ruined my clothes though, and I left a note for the housekeeper but she ignored it and left the iron as is! The room was just next to the pool which would have been great if it was warm, but far from the carpark which was a nuisance. Overall, good for a moderate value hotel...you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but the buses aren't great”
Reviews.Author: jiwdurando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2012, with my family. We had a corner room facing the pool. We were also very close to the boat dock. Our room had 2 queen beds, table and chairs, 2 dressers, tv, coffee maker and hair dryer. The room looked a little dated, but it was clean. Small bathroom, but most Disney hotels have small bathrooms so thats no surprise. Beds were comfortable. All in all the room was good. The pool is large and has a dragon water slide which my daughter loved. The water was cold, I thought the pool was suppose to be heated. If it was it was barely heated. The hotel was quiet and we all slept very well. The cafeteria area was always well maintained. My only complaint was the buses. It took forever to get a bus to certain places. I think we waited over 30minutes one time.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for Disney stays”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan41169
Reviews.Content: My husband insists that we stay at Deluxe properties because he feels that they have faster access to the parks, but on our most recent visit we spent two nights here before moving into the Contemporary and we were all impressed. The rooms are smaller than a deluxe property but the renovations at Port Orleans means the rooms were lovely, and we found the bathroom to be a good size and easy for our family of four to share during the morning rush. Our boys (ages 6 and 10) just loved the pool, and the little hot-tub tucked around behind the poolside bar. They declared this pool to be their favorite one of all the resorts (so much for spending more money on the Deluxe resorts!!). We were also pleased with the food court - the gumbo is a super deal, a meal in a bowl for under $3.00. The buses were fast and efficient and we loved catching the boat to Downtown Disney. One minor source of frustration were the key cards which did not work three times in a row, but that may have been a computer glitch. It meant a lot of walking. This property is small and easy to navigate compared to the Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: craquell
Reviews.Content: We visit Disney once or twice a year with our two children (ages 2 and 5) and we normally stay at the Polynesian or Wilderness Lodge. WIth that said, my expectations are HIGH for Disney property. This visit was a business trip with my spouse's work and we were originally put in the All Star venue (horrid). Due to a chemical spray in our all star room and over booking, we were moved to Port Orleans French Quarter. When we arrived, we were given our room key and taken to building 1. The lobby is well appointed and clean. my children loved the greeter who was dressed in a New Orleans outfit with lots of beads to hand out to new arrivals. There is a nice gift shop, a bar and a food court. The walk to our room was short and lovely. I really liked the cobblestone streets and lanterns that lined the walkway. The property is well appointed with lots of beautiful shrubs, trees and flowers. We stayed in room 1146 and the room was beautiflul. Two queen beds, large dresser with flat screen tv. Refrigerator and we received a microwave, per request. Two seperate sinks with a large storage shelf underneath. There is a great curtain divider between the sink area and the bedroom area (which is great for kids that go to bed early). The room looked recently remodeled. The food court was nice. The large pizza was very good and economical. We ate here one night and walked over to riverside one night. The kids enjoyed the pool. Loved that the moderate resort also provides poolside activities for kids. Hot tub was nice. Playground was new, clean and wonderful. Nightly movie under the stars, marshamallow campfire each night at 5:30, boat rentals, bike rentals, great bus service to to parks, boat shuttle to downtown disney and my favorite, horse drawn carriage rides. I must say, that after spending LOTS of money for rooms at the Polynesian and Wilderness lodge, I would not hesitate for a second to save some $$ and stay at this lovely resort. I love the convenience of the Magic Kingdom hotels and was nervous about not staying on the monorail line, but the bus service from this resort was very fast!! Lastly, I believe you get what you pay for and I think that Port Orleans, French Quarter actually gives you MORE than you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: KngJ
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit at Port Orleans, French Quarter! It was our first trip in 20 years and we were not disappointed. The rooms were very clean which is the most important thing to me! We enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast and late night snacks. No issues with bus service to the parks, always timely. From check-in to check-out it was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Wonderful, & Fun.. : )”
Reviews.Author: Jenny4752
Reviews.Content: Upon our check in, at Port Orleans French Quarter, we knew we were in for a great stay! We arrived around 12 noon and found our room was ready! What a surprise that was! We received our Keys to the World.......... and found our room in building #4 delightful! The daily Mickey & Minnie towels left on our beds were so much appreciated. We soon discovered what an awesome resort this was! Very close to all the Disney Magic...... : ) Never had to wait long for Disney transportation, & a lovely boat ride to Downtown Disney. When leaving every morning to go to the parks....... what fun to receive Mardi Gras beads... : ) We loved the sweet gentleman who gave out the beads.... such a nice added feature to this resort........ : ) We loved the New Orleans flair to this resort! : ) Cobblestone streets and lush gardens, and carriage rides(priced extra), what, authentic atmosphere to this wonderful resort! Later in the evening we so enJOYed, Elliott, at The Scat Cat Lounge. What an entertainer! : ) He sang, danced, played an aray of instruments, and interacted with all of his audience! What a nice family atmosphere! His sing-a-longs were so much fun. : ) In closing, the Queen beds were awsome, all the staff at The French Quarter were, friendly, helpful, and wonderful. What a fun-filled Disney trip this was!! Thanks again to all the employees at The French Quarter for a perfect Disney Vacation!! The Logan's : ) : ) : )

Reviews.Title: “An OK place”
Reviews.Author: kkak1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Port Orleans French Quarter over the holidays (First week of Jan.) The hotel is average (moderate). The rooms have been updated, but are a little on the small side for a family. It's a great place to stay after spending the day at the park, but a little on the quiet side if you plan to spend a day at the hotel. The kids loved the pool and our daughter couldn't get enough of the water slide. The beds were comfortable, but the rooms tend to be a little noisy. You can hear the other guests flushing the toliet, showering, talking,etc. The boat to downtown disney is located right at the resort and it's a nice, relaxing ride(arrives every 20 mins.) If you are looking for a moderate place to stay at disney this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite resort at WDW”
Reviews.Author: diswish
Reviews.Content: My mom and I visit WDW every January (1/7-1/16 this year) and always stay at FQ. We love it because of its small size, friendly staff, and clean rooms. Transportation has been reliable, and the food court is excellent for breakfast. It's great to come back year after year and recognize some of the cast members. It's also reasonably priced (okay, for WDW anyway).

Reviews.Title: “A Very Magical Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter as part of a Grand Gathering December 3-13. We had three rooms and asked to be put in a quiet location. We were assigned to Building 1 on the top floor. To of our rooms were adjoining and the other room was right around the corner. We had rented a car so we found the location to be perfect. It was just a quick walk out to the car, but because the resort is so small it was also a short, but beautiful walk to the pool and main building as well. If you are using the buses exclusively you may want a closer building, but we didn't mind the walk to the bus stop either. We found the bus service to be very convenient and we always used the bus when traveling to the Magic Kingdom. The rooms are lovely and fairly spacious. We were traveling with four children (two of whom slept in my parent's room) but we kept all the clothes in our room and found that we had plenty of storage space. The fridge in the room is convenient if you want to stock it with milk and yogurt for quick and easy breakfasts. We thought the beds were quite comfortable, just a tad on the noisy side. We also had a knocking noise in the bathroom, but we couldn't hear it if we kept the bathroom door closed. The noise from the toilet flusing is quite loud as well. Still, we were pleased with the rooms overall and thought that they were clean and well maintained. The food court is adequate, but we didn't eat anything that really stood out. It's a quick and easy option if you're exhausted from being in the parks. I wished that we'd walked down to Riverside to try their food court for some variety. We loved the pool area. My boys are 8, 6, 3, and 1 and they all enjoyed the pool area. The slide is perfect for younger children since there is not an enclosed area. There's plenty of room for splashing and playing and also a lovely children's wading pool as well. We never had the chance to try out the hot tub, but it looked large. The boat to Downtown Disney is convenient and so relaxing. It's a nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of the parks. They run every 20 minutes during the day and then come every 10 minutes starting in the evening. We usually only go to Downtown Disney once during a trip, but this trip we went three times because the boat made it so convenient. Magical Express stops at Saratoga Springs and Old Key West before hitting the French Quarter. My husband and dad rented vehicles and made it to the resort before us, but just by about 10 minutes. At Christmas there are four beautiful Christmas trees in the courtyard off the lobby that are all aglow in the evening making it seem very welcoming. There was a short line for airline check-in on our departure day, but it does move slowly so go down to the lobby in plenty of time to get through the process. The French Quarter is a lovely resort and well suited for couples and families. The landscaping is beautiful and the resort is very quiet. We stayed at Pop the previous two years and thought that it was well worth the money to upgrade to the French Quarter. It's a more relaxed and has a much more secluded feel. We've also stayed at the Polynesian, but thought that the French Quarter was just as nice. If you're hesitating just give it a try! I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: mama101
Reviews.Content: Our 7 days 6 nights stayed at POFQ was pleasant. Our river view room in the building 6 was pretty well accomodated. It was not too far from the main lobby. Room was a bit small, but clean and new. The staffs were nice especially with our kid who collected mardi gras beads and coins. Don't forget to take a boat to Downtown Disney. You will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “"Fabulous Family Holiday"”
Reviews.Author: smilersu
Reviews.Content: We went as a family of 4 (2 young children 5 and 7) from 18 Oct to 1 Nov 2011, having read the reviews on trip advisor we decided to go for the moderate hotel and we are so glad we did, what a lovely place to stay, you are in the middle of all the parks with easy access via the buses and the boats and to down town Disney. The hotel is set around Jazz and Blues, it is huge and I believe we stayed at the better one suited for a family who likes to swim as the pool is lovely. We had to bribe the kids to get out. They have marshmellow evenings, cinema nights on the green where you grab a towel to sit on (it was quite chilly when we arrived which was a surprise to us, to take a warm light coat or thermal cardi (especially for kids) we hadn't taken anything and had to buy. Though it did warm up a few days later it was still cool on the evenings. The food is self service and the same, it is much like a canteen, my husband hated the plastic plates and cutlery, though you can see it cuts outs washing up, the waste is terrible. We had missed the dinning plans so had to pay, it is on a par with English dining it was cheaper to buy the plastic refillable cups though as you could fill them with hot or cold drinks through the day (only at the hotel), they do leak so dont rely on them for not leaking all over your things. The room was great we were in 6032 and i had a vision that it would be very cramped with the bathroom and toilet area on show. it was huge with 2 king size beds, a TV, room for 4 cases (take hangers never enough), room service was every day and they were lovely. The whole staff there were very pleasant and helpful, infact every where! If you are like we were and totally new to Florida we hadn't a clue and were guided by a couple of friends who had been. We hired a car as we had booked to go to Sea Life (worth a trip if got time) and Kennedy Space Center (which was also good if got time) I have to say fitting these in were a rush and we didn't really need them, the parks are vast for firt time visits. If you are on a schedule and can get around quickly (I have walking difficulties), like to get up very early to catch the shows and early hours (which are open at different times for different parks) you would probably fit extra in. We enjoyed what we did at our pace even fitting 3 Days out of 14 around the pool. It is not a relaxing, by the pool holiday, but it is fun and exhilarating and not just for children.We had a Fabulous Time at the parks. In hindsight we didn't need the 2 extra trips or the car so could have saved the money, we would probably go again in a couple of years time as they are developing again and just do the parks. It is worth having the dining plan if you can get it, and I think you can book direct with the hotel if not offered via the travel agent to pay before you go though a couple of weeks before. SOME NOTES: Themed Restuarants are great, however book in advance to get what you want, we couldn't get in to the castle as we didnt know there was a 3-6 month waiting list, we did get to meet Cinderella, Prince Charming, the ugly sisters and mother dear at the Floridian (wow what a place, not for children too pristine hehe) our resort got us in there and we had to pay, it is on a rotary basis so get you meal whilst waiting for them to come round. Our kids were awe struck as it was a total surprise. 2) Do the Pirate Day at Disney World, it is expensive to have every thing though you can take your own costums, they do your face and take you through a special place, great fun the kids loved it and it took a good hour and half. 3) No food into the parks, they check bags and are rigorous. 4) Take water capes as the flume is well worth going on, so much fun. 5) You dont have to tip the camera people. 6) Read the plans to know what time the star people are about my daughter lover peter pan and he was there. Go the French Quarter, Go to Disney Land, Go and have a ball......

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite. A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: darcysmile
Reviews.Content: Alright, I'm a Disney geek and I've bounced around trying out several different resorts on WDW properties in the "Value" and "Moderate" categories. This one, though? Hands down the winner. If you're looking to balance the best of everything, I think you'll like French Quarter, too. Here's why it's the best ... * Size ... it's HALF the size of the Riverside resort, so no matter where your room is, it won't be a long walk. * Layout ... it's laid out in little perpendicular "streets", which makes it really easy to get around and find everything. * Rooms ... they JUST renovated every room in the resort. They all have brand new QUEEN sized beds, and the new decor is really lovely, classy (I didn't care for the previous decor - it was kind of "loud"). * Pool ... this one has a proper waterslide, and awesome themeing throughout the pool area. If you're traveling with kids who plan to swim, be sure to compare the pools. * Value ... although this is in the "moderate" resort category, and value resorts will run a little less, there are some drawbacks to the value resorts. They're located out by the main highway, they're HUGE (so walking from your room to transportation can take a while) and typically the transportation seems to be a little further away, more crowded and run less often. At least, that's what I experienced. THIS "moderate" resort is a step up, but not a hugely expensive one. Worth the slight increase, in my opinion. * Quiet, and NOT a destination ... by this I mean, if you stay at one of the "Deluxe" resorts - such as the Polynesian or the Grand Floridian, etc - you're at a destination that guests of other resorts will be traveling to for dinners, shows, etc. It can make those resorts feel pretty crowded and busy. The nice thing about French Quarter is that it is not a destination for anyone other than the actual hotel guests. There's a dining hall on property, and a steakhouse in P.O. Riverside (you can walk to it), but there's no restaurant on the actual FQ property. This means the only people at FQ are FQ guests. After a busy day in the parks, I like to come "home" to a resort that's relaxed. It was nice and quiet ... At least, it was quiet when we were there, and I was told they were nearly full, so that's a good sign. They had jazz Christmas music playing at all times, but the level was just perfect. Just loud enough to be heard, and not so loud that it was disruptive or annoying. You'd see people around, but it never felt "busy". * Proximity ... We like Epcot the best, and this resort is in the Epcot area. However, it's also just down the river from Downtown Disney, and has its own dock to a boat ride you can take there and back. Kind of a nice bonus. Speaking of which - ask for a room by the river. It's SO nice and peaceful out there in the morning. * The Doorman ... I have to give credit to the doorman who dressed up in fabulous purples and greens with feathered plumes and passed out beads and coins throughout the day. It was one of those little touches that made a big difference. He was a favorite part of the trip for my daughter, and she looked forward to seeing him every day. All in all, a great trip and our search for the best Disney resort (for us) is over. We'll be staying at French Quarter again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: mckinfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in January. I picked this Disney resort as it is the smallest of the moderates and everything there is easily accessible. We were in building 7 which is one of the buildings that is farthest away from the food court and pool, but it was still very manageable. We arrived at 2:00 p.m. and our room was ready. It was recently refurbished and the room was very nice with comfortable beds. I particularly liked the curtain that you can draw across the double sink area as I'm an early riser but my son liked to sleep in a bit. Everything was very clean and mousekeeping did an excellent job. (The only complaints I can think of are that there were no teabags provided with the coffee in the room, and there was no lotion provided with the toiletry amenities.) We only had breakfast in the food court and it was good (the beignets especially!). Had nice enough weather to utilize the pool and there were games for the kids. We had a great time in Disney and staying at the French Quarter contributed to it a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: sarahc20165
Reviews.Content: This was my first time actually staying at a Disney property while going to the parks and it was somewhat mediocre. I think the perks that come with staying there; such as transportation to and from the airport and between the parks and downtown Disney are really great but the property itself.. the rooms, amenities, etc. are really not all that great for the money. I don't think I would stay on the grounds again. It seems it would be easier to just stay at a nicer hotel and rent a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull and cosy hotel, great transportation!”
Reviews.Author: domimickey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from the 9th untill the 16th of january, we had a blast and it really did feel like home, the grounds are beautiful and the fact that the resort is not as wide spread as some of the other Disney resorts is a big plus, the bus service was great, most of the times we had direct service to and from the parks without any stops at other hotels. The room was beautiful and upon arrival we got upgraded to a river view room, in building 6, wich gave us a nice spot to relax outside and ust in front of our room there was a nightly little bonfire with castmemebers standing by to hand everyone some complimentary marshmallows!! The foodcourt is good, not great, but really sufficient in handling a nice breakfast or lunch. And a special thanks to Arneil, who is the greeter in this resort and has roots in the Netherlands. He still speaks Dutch and it was a lot of fun talking to him. It felt like having a personal friend who's always there to welcome you and ask how your day was. Thanks Arneil!! Hope to see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Base for marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: GEMWpg
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here over the marathon weekend 01/04/12 - 01/09/12. I have previously stayed at the three ranges of Disney hotels and have stayed at this resort previously as well (prior to the recent refurb). We didn't take advantage of many of the amenities at the hotel but will comment on the services we did use. Check in: smooth and quick House keeping - good - we had a few days where we needed to rest in the afternoon so kept the "do not disturb" sign on and one of the days received extra towels and shampoo, etc via a bag on the door Grounds - beautiful and clean - we enjoyed walking around the resort and along the path to Riverside Boat to Downtown - smooth regular service - very convenient Busses - never had to wait long for a bus but every bus except for Magic Kingdom was shared with Riverside which added 4 stops either leaving the hotel or when coming back to the hotel. This was fine for us but added time and might be a hassle for folks with younger kids and strollers. Cafeteria - good food with good proportions - there seemed to be a good variety at each meal but if you have any picky eaters you might run out of options after a few days. Magical Express - a bit of a wait at the airport before leaving but solid service and return trip to airport was quick even though there were stops at a few additional hotels. Timing of the return trip was good - we were at the airline check in at a good time before there were huge line ups. Room - queen size beds are a plus, not a huge amount of extra room in the room itself but was adequate, tv was flat panel with various input ports on the stand for hooking up dvd players, laptops, etc to the tv, double sinks outside the actual toilet/shower area are convenient, there is definitely noise from the toilet and you can hear other toilets from nearby rooms. I would definitely stay here again although the additional bus stops at Riverside will give me pause if I am travelling with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Disney hotel!”
Reviews.Author: disneyworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney many times. I have stayed both on property and off and this by far has been my favorite place to stay. We arrived very early and quickly got a room. The front desk agent that checked us in wasn't the friendliest and seemed to be going thru the motions , she wasn't interested in conversation. Our room was in a great location close to the pool, bus stop, boat dock, and food court. If you stay here request building 2. The resort itself is small and easy to navigate. The pool area is awesome with a great slide that my children loved. My son became ill with a ear infection during our visit and the front desk was very helpful and contacted a local walk in clinic that provides transportation. We met a wonderful front desk manager Damien who was very helpful and thoughtful. He was knowledgeable and answered many of my questions. He was very kind and gave my son a stuffed animal that my son is still carrying around today, when he heard he was sick. He provided the exceptional service that Disney is known for and should be recognized for that. We cannot wait to plan our next Disney vacation and this will be where we stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love Disney, Love Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SophiesMom55
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the French Quarter at Port Orleans while in Orlando. It is a lovely place. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is helpful and considerate. It is so much fun to ride the boat to Downtown Disney. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ghosthuntgirl
Reviews.Content: As many times as we've viited Disney we've always stayed at the value resorts. This was our first time at a moderate resort and I have to say I was very well pleased. We were told this was the smallest of the Disney resorts and it was very nice. We were very lucky that we had a room right next to the cafiteria, and close to the bus stop. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. We had a prblem with our key cards one day and they had it straightened out without any problems or delays. I would highly reccomend this resort to anyone and I would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate Resort in WDW”
Reviews.Author: Musthavedisney
Reviews.Content: my husband and I are Disney nuts.. we go annually and enjoy trying new resorts. POFQ is the only one we have returned to (consider we have yet to stay in a Deluxe resort as of yet). It's location is perfect.. not too far from the major theme parks (save AK) and is very close Downtown Disney which is just a short relaxing boat ride away. One of the major pulls to this resort is it's size.. it truly is quaint and small so no matter where you're room is you aren't more than a 5 minute walk away from anything. Another plus is that given its such a small resort there is only a single bus depot. That's a major draw if you've ever stayed at one of the larger moderate resorts w/ mulitple bus stops or worse.. had to take a place in the cattle line at the value level. The pool is fun themed, if you prefer to just bathe in the sun you can do that while taking in the serenity of the Sassagoula river. Ok, so the food court is amazing.. but it isn't terrible either. If you book thru Disney (we always do) then you can opt to purchase a dining plan and then, eat someplace else. Personally the food court wasn't much of a bother since we rarely ate there.. but it seemed to please the young palets. All in all, the is the BEST resort (of the moderates) on Disney's property. One downside(hardly worth mentioning): remember I said there was only 1 bus depot? Well that's certainly a plus when you're ready to head off into the parks, but sometimes the bus is shared with the other side of the resrot (Riverside) and that can add a few minutes delay in arrival or.. when leaving the parks.. a long line if there's isn't a line specified for FQ.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient , but don't plan on sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Orange B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter for the Disney Marathon. The proximity to Epcot and the Marathon starting line was great. The hotel also has a water taxi service that takes you into Downtown Disney, which was also nice. The pool and hot tub were very nice for a "moderate" hotel. The rooms, however, left plenty to be desired. The bed was horrible. I felt every single spring in it. I have stayed in hostels that had better mattresses. Also, the plumbing system is not very well insulated because we heard toilets flushing and their contents rushing past us through the wall all night. Literally every 20-30 minutes we heard waste rushing down the pipes in the room. The food court was not particularly good. It is definitely worth the water taxi ride into downtown Disney to eat. If you need a convenient, moderately priced hotel that is on-site, and you aren't concerned with comfort, this hotel is perfect. However, if you want a good nights sleep, it would probably be better to pay extra for one of the nicer Disney hotels or get a very nice hotel off-site for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Disney”
Reviews.Author: outlanderinflorida
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at this hotel with extended family. The rooms are well designed - small, but not cramped. The layout of this resort is very good - not too much walking to get anywhere and the grounds are centered around squares that are very reminiscent of New Orleans. We especially enjoyed being able to take the boat to Downtown Disney - a nice break from bus transportation. Some of our party used Disney's Magical Express airport service which was incredibly easy and efficient. The food court is just ok, but there are refrigerators in the rooms allowing for breakfast/snacking and Disney has plenty of good restaurants to choose from so you don't need to rely on the food court. I have stayed at several Disney hotels and this is my favorite so far. The pool is superb and there are lots of poolside activities for the kids and a nice bar for the adults, The only less than great experience was at the lounge in the lobby. The drinks are expensive, the wine we paid $9 per glass had obviously been open for too long and the entertainment made it difficult to chat with each other.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean and an Easy Boat Ride to Downtown Disney!”
Reviews.Author: pinepg
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Port Orleans - French Quarter, and we were not disappointed. The check-in was handled smoothly, we were given (without even asking) an upgrade into a river-view room in Building 1, and thoroughly enjoyed our six-day stay. The room was spotless, and had obviously been updated. The cleaning staff were very efficient and pleasant. As a matter of fact, all of the staff at Disney World are pleasant--that is part of why we enjoy going there. French Quarter is a quieter, more romantic Disney resort in its architecture, and layout. Also, if you like to walk, you will enjoy walking along the paved walkway from French Quarter to Riverside, its sister resort in Port Orleans. The walkway borders the river and provides one of the most scenic walking areas (in our opinion) in the Park. For those who like to go to Downtown Disney, it is an easy, relaxing, and enjoyable boat ride to Downtown Disney. Boats run all day and well into the evening. The cafeteria restaurant is fine for quick meals or snacks. One tip: explore the other resorts, such as Old Key West, Polynesian, Animal Kingdom Lodge. It is easy to ride the free Disney transportation to these other Disney resorts, eat in their restaurants, and admire their grounds. Then you can return to your reasonably priced, quiet accommodations at French Quarter for the night. One caveat: if your room faces the river, you will occasionally hear the boat horns--the boat captains are required to blow the horn when approaching and leaving the dock. This might be a disadvantage for those staying in Buildings 1 or 2, since they are closer to the dock. We did not mind it, but others might.

Reviews.Title: “omg! will be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: kimi7997
Reviews.Content: very nice! from check in to check out. this is the second time staying here. the last time i was 12. the rooms were recently re-done. everything was nice. great attention to detail. check in staff was super duper. loved the guy @ the front doors giving out gold coins! room was clean, only found one hair after moving the tissue box. no mold or mildew anywhere. great clean carpet also. was notified we did not need to checkout as we will have express checkout. they even let us park our car and use bus system the day we checked out also. wish it was warmer to take advantage of the awesome pool. ferry boat to downtown disney was fast and awesome. bus service was excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “The best moderate resort in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: hjruiz
Reviews.Content: Wow! I've stayed in five different Disney resort and this one has been one of the best. Small in size so it's very quiet. Stayed from Jan 3 - 9, during Marathon Weekend. It was the perfect resort for those participating in the running events. The main building is near every room building. The food court is big enough for the size of the resort. The food quality and variety is pretty good. Breakfast was the same you find in any other Disney resort. For lunch and dinner they have creole food besides the traditional pizza, burger and nuggets. The rooms where recently renovated and now the beds are queen size instead of full and are spacious. Because of the cold weather, didn't try the pools. The transportation was very good. Buses where frequent and went directly to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “sooo relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Costamogen
Reviews.Content: just lovely and quiet. no hassle, no drunks, loads of beds, loads of fun. easy access to all the disney parks. been 3 times in 4 years. food court is a bit rubbish, but it should not spoil anyone's holiday. the river boats are fab for an evening at downtown disney. the reception staff are great. and everywhere is so clean.unless an english person was at there just before i was (im english) loved every second

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TXMom22
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney and I had no idea what to expect. I was so happy with this resort. Honestly, the outside just looks like a regular motel (even an older one) with the doors on the outside, but the rooms are great. They are a little small but we only used them for sleep so they were perfect for the four of us. The beds were extremely comfortable and everything was nice and clean. The bathroom area had a curtain that you could close so my kids could get just a little more sleep while I was getting ready in the morning. (Beware, though... the swinging curtain pull hit me in the head more than once during our stay!) The best part of this resort, for me at least, was the peace and quiet. Our room was on the third floor and faced a parking area but there were trees so we couldn't see the cars. There was absolutely no noise at night and it was wonderful. Oh, and I loved the lobby and dining area as well. The food was wonderful. If we ever get to go back to Disney (I hope!) I won't think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: ontariocanadavacay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon. It was amazing! We stayed in the Port Orleans resort and got the meal plan, plus a 7 day Hopper pass to the parks. The meal plan is absolutely worth it, however, I would even say that it was too much food! The American serving sizes are huge, so if you have kids, I would suggest sharing meal plans. The food was excellent, both at the resort and at the parks. The service was excellent. My husband broke his glasses and the attendant at reception sent a glasses kit to our room! Everyone was always in a pleasant mood and always knowledgable. All in all, a fantastic vacation and honeymoon. We had a blast being big kids in Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort on Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: sandybcal
Reviews.Content: Having visited Disney six times in the last decade, I consider myself somewhat of an expert. Making the decision to say at Port Orleans was based on price, comfort, a friend's recommendation and location. First, I would like to say that the grounds of the Port Orleans Resort is impeccable, bringing to mind Southern charm. Upon reaching our hotel room I was dismayed at the small size of the room. As a family of four we had a double room which was tiny. It really didn't seem up to par with the whole Disney image. Port Orleans is described as a mid-price hotel and is priced accordingly. Frankly, I thought the price was too high for such a teeny room. By the end of the week we were sick of being in each other's way since the room had no space for anything other than sleeping. On the positive side we greatly enjoyed the pool area - it was fun, whimsical and entertaining for the children. The slides in the pool are awesome! With regards to food on the property, I found it reasonably priced and accessible. It is well worth the price of buying the all purpose cup which allows you to have drinks for your entire stay. Meal plans are also available, but we did not choose this option since we wanted to sample restaurants in the Orlando area. The best part of staying at Port Orleans was the proximity to Disney, the buses that took us quickly and frequently to Disney locations and the perks we received for extra park hours due to us staying on Disney property. Overall, I wasn't thrilled with our room (way too small) but I felt that it was overall a decent stay. I probably would not want to return to this hotel since I prefer a larger living area/bedroom for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A fun affordable Disney property”
Reviews.Author: capecodmom77
Reviews.Content: We visited the French Quarter for a family vacation the week before Christmas. The resort lobby was decorated for Christmas and was very festive. We did online check in and were given our room keys fairly quickly. Magic Express ride went well and was convenient, but it did make several stops. Delivery of our luggage from the airport was a great perk! We were in building 2, which is near the pool. The pool was awesome! It had a waterslide that came out of a dragon/serpent's head. Our kids loved it! I could see older kids maybe feeling that they had outgrown it, but I even went down the slide and it was fun. The room was small but very nice. It was refurbished with new queen beds. For the small size, it was well thought out: hooks for coats on the wall, shelves under the double sinks for storing clothes/shoes, a marble shelf above the sinks to keep the clutter off the counter. There was also a curtain to divide the bedroom from the vanity area. The actual tub/shower area is really small. There is a table and chairs and small refrigerator for breakfast in the room. There is a water shuttle from the back of the hotel that takes you to Downtown Disney, which was great. I did not like that there were no balconies off the room other than going outside. The food court was convenient and had a lot of choices. The decor of the hotel was "New Orleans". So the food court was a bit overdone, with enormous paper mâché clown heads hanging over your table. But it was fast, always had seats, and got the job done. We weren't sure about using buses to get to the parks but it worked well. We didn't have to wait long for a bus, and generally had a seat except for one evening returning from the Magic Kingdom. The resort has a small gift shop and small lounge area. The luggage return to the airport was easy and was handled right outside the lobby. All in all, it was a nice place to land at the end of the day and was much more economical than the deluxe hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property! Easy Commute to/from Parks!”
Reviews.Author: Aaron R
Reviews.Content: Just as you would expect from a hotel on Disney property, the customer service was fantastic. The rooms were clean and easy to get to. As a "moderate hotel" there is nothing more I could ask for. I will, without a doubt, go back to this hotel. It is very easy to get to and from the Disney parks and we never waited too long for the commuter bus.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney World resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveY73
Reviews.Content: I'm no stranger to Walt Disney World (25th time this December) and have stayed in many of the on-site properties (French Quarter, Riverside, Caribbean Beach, All Star Music, All Star Movies and the formerly-known as Grosvenor Resort). Out of them all, this one is the best bang for the buck, isn't overly Disney-fied, and is the most centrally located. It's French Quarter charm and small alleys make it just expansive enough to not feel like you're on top of one another but everything is well within a short 5 minute walk. Most of the rooms have been updated to have an even more distinguished look and feel, flat screen TVs with working remotes, small refrigerators in the rooms are now standard equipment, and the heat/air conditioning is now a quiet under window unit with a wall-mounted thermostat as opposed to the old and loud multi-function units that never maintained a steady temperature. Disney buses are frequent and rarely standing room only. The Sassagoula River snakes through the property providing a soundtrack at night while walking along the footpath and also sports a ferry to take you either to Riverside or Downtown Disney. If you have a car, they have ample parking and you're situated in a spot that is easily accessible to Disney Studios, Disney's Boardwalk, EPCOT, Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom. But even perfection has its flaws: When it first opened it had a wonderful restaurant called Bonfamille's, but that was removed in favor of a counter service offering. The only sit-down restaurant now is at French Quarter's sister resort, Riverside, which only serves dinner. Water pressure in the rooms is practically non-existent and the showerheads usually spray water in every direction other than towards you. If you're in one of the interior buildings along the Sassagoula River, be prepared for a walk to get to/from the parking lot and bus stop. There is only one bus stop for French Quarter, right outside of the main building, whereas other similarly laid out hotels have multiple bus stops. No business center for guests to utilize a computer and a printer or at the very least, an internet-ready kiosk with built-in printer so guests can do online check-ins for their flights. The airline check-in desk in Disney hotels is operated by Orlando Airport staff just to take care of checked luggage. This service does not allow you to check-in and get boarding passes for your flight. Few benches adorn the footpath along the Sassagoula River to allow guests to sit and just enjoy the scenery. The general store, though well-stocked, is small in comparison to other resorts. Why they never moved it to the old Bonfamille's area and expanded it is beyond me. The current location would be better served as a larger gift shop that also housed the gaudy Disney Vacation Club desk which resides adjacent to the registration counter. Smoking areas are located close to regularly traveled walkways and egresses. The one directly outside of Sassagoula Floatworks should be removed completely as it is no more than 12 feet from the outside tables. They no longer offer half and half in the beverage area. Your only option is tiny Coffeemate creamers. This is the only resort that stopped offering half and half and the reason for it? "We tried it, but it wasn't working out" is what I was told by a cast member. Yeah, it didn't make sense to us either. Coffee in most hotels is mass produced Nescafe...it's not even their "Mickey's Coffee" that's sold in their gift shops. There are only 2 coffeeshops that brew fresh coffee in Disney hotels. One is found at Kona Cafe in the Polynesian...but get there early because they close at 11am and it changes into a sushi bar! The other is located in the Contemporary Resort's lobby and is open until, I think, 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “First Family Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: yogagirl08
Reviews.Content: I thought the Port Orleans French Quarter was a great hotel. It was beautiful and the room was just the right size for our family of 3. We got an upgrade to face the river in the back which was really nice and we didn't have a far walk to get to the pool or to eat. It was clean and just what I expected. The only complaint I would have would be the check in. It took awhile to to get us checked in and it seems they only had one person on staff to do this. We were also told the wrong room number since the key card they gave us did not work for the room number they told us but our correct room was just one door over. Overall I had a great stay would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Disney World in April 2011 with our son and daughter and their 4 children. We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter and had three nice rooms in a row on the first floor. This was very convenient for our group of 10 to coordinate activities and ease of access with strollers etc. Disney's transportation was excellent as always and we had options of using the bus or the water shuttle to get to the attractions. Food was okay. We did not use the meal plan and ate in the parks for a lot of meals. The kids loved the pool area and there is a nice sitting area for the adults which has a bar located next to it. For us the hotel was convenient, clean, comfortable and affordable. Great for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would go back to this resort.”
Reviews.Author: Nettyduck16
Reviews.Content: We first came to Disneyland in 2004 but this time we had a 5 year old daughter and my parents so it took us a while to choose which resort would suit us all but then we where recommended this resort by friends and we where not disappointed. This is the smallest disney resort which is nice and is in walking distance to visit Riverside Resort which both has access to a water taxi (Boat) which will take you from each resort to Downtown Disney and back which is a nice change to the bus. When we booked we asked for rooms next to each other which wasn't a problem are rooms where nice and had everything you needed for the time you spend in them these had not long been renovated either, clean towels where supplied daily also free towels where available for the pool and hot tub (by the pool). There is also a toilet and shower facilities by the pool for you to use at any time but is great to use to freshen up for your return journey back home as you need to be out of your room for 11am. We where on DDP (Disney Dining Plan) which i would highly recommend as it was real value for money and it took away the stress as we made all are resevations for food 180 days prior to are stay so we where able to try all the places which we wanted. So didn't eat much in the food court other than breakfast a few morning but the Riverside Resort seemed to have more choose and they also have a restaurant. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic all the way!!”
Reviews.Author: CampbellScot
Reviews.Content: This is one of the BEST resorts on property! I would rather stay here than at the Grand Floridian! This resort is small and quiet and beautifully themed. No matter what building you are in, you are close to everything. The sidewalks and street lamps are so charming. The rooms are clean, the staff is top notch and the bus service stops at FQ first both pick up and drop off, which means you aren't always worried about getting a seat! My family especially loves the boat to Downtown Disney. We really do love the French Quarter! The food court has those heavenly beignets!! Even after we bought DVC we still stay at French Quarter when we arrive a day early or stay a day later. It's our favorite resort on the property and we would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a lovely, romantic, charming stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: eclair09
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Short bus ride to all parks with almost all direct. Felt safe letting kids go to food hall etc by themselves. Pool was great and supervised until 8 at night, even in Winter. Gardens and layout provided plenty of space for kids to get rid of excess energy. Staff very helpful - especially when my 8 year old was sick. Made Disney experience magical for whole family. (Travelling party consisted of myself, my 67 year old mother, 16 and 8 year old sons)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of tranquil and fun.”
Reviews.Author: GFam2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights just before Christmas and we had a great time. We have a 2 and 4 year old so we wanted a place the kids would like but would also feel tranquil at the same time. POFQ had the perfect ambiance. It was quiet, yet it was fun- music and good vibes around the pool, our building was soooo quiet, which was great. The kids loved getting beads and the coins from the lovely gentleman at the front door to make wishes in the fountain. The bus service was great. We rarely shared a bus with Riverside and when we did we were the first ones on and first ones off. My only complaint would be the food. Even my 4 year old wouldn't eat their hot breakfast and he loves basically any type of breakfast food. There is much room for improvement in that area. We had a lot of oatmeal, cereal and fruit for breakfast, which is fine, but can get old. Overall, if we stayed on Disney property again, this would be my first pick for what it offered. I couldn't justify going Deluxe unless we got a huge discount.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans= Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early November. For us, the location can't be beat as it is a quick ride to the parks, especially Magic Kingdom, Epcot and the Downtown Disney area, which are our favorite places to visit. In classic Disney fashion, they do a great job giving you the feel of being in New Orleans, from the architecture and Magnolia trees, to the Mardi Gras themed greeters, who hand out beads to guests. The resort also offers a complimentary and relaxing boat ride down the "river" to the Downtown area (and the Riverside Resort). We normally stay in the Value Resorts - so we appreciated the extras offered in this Moderate Resort, which definitely put it in a cut above such as the indoor and poolside bars, a restaurant (in the Riverside section), a fun pool slide (that looks like a sea-serpent!), and special features such as live jazz music in the bar, the riverboat transportation and a lovely horse and carriage ride through the hotel grounds (which I highly recommend!). Two other big pros to staying in a Moderate Resort (at least this one), is less crowding at the bus and transportation sights than you get with the Value Resorts (we almost always got a seat), and the special deal sometimes offered where you get a FREE meal plan when you stay at a Moderate (which we took advantage of and highly recommend!!). True to all the Disney Resorts we've stayed in, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff were always friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - no so great food court”
Reviews.Author: Tigger_ttfn
Reviews.Content: I love this resort for the New Orleans Flavor that it has. It's quiet and clean. I love the streets that look like old time with the horse posts and the gas lamps, the horse-drawn carriage trotting along. In December, they had a huge movie screen set up in the park area and showed Disney Movies every night at 7pm. The food court is extremely small with limited offerings compare to the other resorts we have stayed at (Caribbean Beach, Polynesian, Pop Century).

Reviews.Title: “Magical 35th Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: louieloves
Reviews.Content: Magical 35th Anniversary! We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from 12/7 through 12/13 to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. This was our third stay at Port Orleans, our second at French Quarter. When we arrived in Orlando, everything seemed to move quickly and smoothly. We found the Disney Magical Express and did not wait too long before we drove to our resort. We had checked in from home, so all we had to do was pick up our registration package (and our Happy Anniversary buttons). The room was ready (it was only 11:00 a.m.!), so we dropped off our carry-on bags and headed for Hollywood Studios and our lunch reservation at Mama Melrose’s. We had preferred seating for Fantasmic! but didn’t really need it because the parks were not crowded. Our room was 5233, which was a great location - not far from the bus stop and the food court and the hot tub. The room is small, but we didn’t spend much time there. It looked like it had been renovated recently. The grounds around the resort were beautiful and immaculate. This was a great time of year to go - decent weather and not very crowded. One day at the Magic Kingdom, we walked onto every attraction - no lines at all. We only used Fast Pass one time, and that was for Buzz Lightyear’s Space Ranger Spin at Hollywood Studios. Every employee on every bus and at every attraction and restaurant was extremely polite. Disney employees are always the epitome of great customer service. If there was anything negative, it would be that there are too many people on cell phones all the time and also texting (not watching where they are going) and people wearing entirely too much perfume. Not a reflection on WDW at all, just society in general. We had a fantastic vacation and would not hesitate to go back. LouieLovesMexico

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RESORT! VERY HAPPY WITH OUR STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof3kidzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter Resort from December 17 through December 22. We are a family of 5; Dad, Mom, two adult children & one 13 year old. We requested adjoining rooms and our request was honored. We checked in around 11:00 a.m. and much to our surprise our rooms were ready. We were lucky to be assigned in building 3 without paying the upgrade. This building is soooo close to the food court, bus stop, etc. We stayed at the Disney's All Star Music 2 years ago; Disney's Port Orleans Riverside last year. By far this resort exceeded our expectations. The other two resorts were nice; of course, Riverside nicer than All Star (mainly because of the room size) but French Quarter is such a small resort that after a long day at the parks there is not a long walk back to your room. Even the farthest building is not a long walk. Riverside is just such a huge resort; it's beautiful but for us, we prefer a much smaller one. One thing I'm very picky about is how clean the rooms are. These were just renovated and I'm not even sure if our room had been used. There was some dust on the shelf in the dressing area but other than that, everything was extremely clean. Mousekeeping always gave clean towels everyday, made the beds, etc. We only had towel animals one day which was a little disappointing but they are very busy. We were on the second floor and the only sound we heard were the toilets flushing once in a great while from other rooms. We never heard talking, walking, etc. The beds were extremely comfortable and were queen size. Very nice upgrade from the full size we've had in the past. The food in the food court was great; but we aren't picky eaters. The dining plan is an absolute must. Honestly, the quick service for both meals is plenty of food. It just depends on what you prefer. We had one table service per day and honestly, we never had a bad meal. If you have reservations, you just need to make sure you allow plenty of time to get to your destination. It took us a little over an hour to get to Chef Mickey's from our hotel using the bus system. The bus system - the only complaint I ever have and it's a minor one. Sometimes they came quickly sometimes they didn't. Sometimes we picked up Riverside at all 4 of their bus stops and sometimes we didn't. It was hard to figure out how much time to allow to get to our reservations sometimes.
