On the upside, we were always first on and first off. So, we always had a seat. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and we will be staying here when we go back. Everyone we encountered was very nice. My daughter actually left her wallet on a bus back from Downtown Disney and the driver actually found it; nothing had been touched in it. Where else would that happen. We ate at the food court once for breakfast - it was great. We ate their for our lunch on our way out - it was great, too. I absolutely recommend the Backlot quick service restaurant at Hollywood Studios if you get the chance. It's always fantastic. We also ate at the 1900 Park Fair for breakfast; never disappoints. The Crystal Palace was okay - not fantastic. Coral Reef was very good at Epcot. Chef Mickey's was awesome. And, as always, Le Chef De France at Epcot was outstanding. We've eaten there for lunch and dinner and both were awesome. BEST PLACE EVER TO STAY!! :--)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our party of 3 rooms”
Reviews.Author: leojtracnik
Reviews.Content: The propertyis easy to get around. It is also very quiet. The rooms felt a little cramped for our two adults and two children. The good news is that the point of Disney World is to ot be in your rooms. The food court on property was satisfactory for a quick breakfast with a variety of choices, but the quality was mediocre and the services waned after breakfast. We checked in after midnight and it definitely was not the typical disney welcome. There was no bag service and they were cleaning the floors I could barely here the guy at registration. There was also no place to eat when we checked in after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Disney for adults”
Reviews.Author: Jan1598
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort just after the recent refurbishment. We were not disappointed. The rooms have been completely overhauled- were extremely clean and new. Queen beds were comfortable, pillows were fluffy. Bathroom was very very clean and the double sinks were nice (these two 20 something sisters didnt have to share!!) Lots of room on the counter for toiletries. This resort is very close to the parks. Used Disney buses exclusively. The bus trips were very short, which was nice. The bus stop could use some improvement- its a free-for-all in the mornings with 50+ people and no line up. Kind of a mess. Never shared the bus with the neighboring Port Orleans Riverside during our trip. Very convenient. Food court was a bit disappointing. This trip following a family trip to Disney staying at an All-Star resort. The French Quarter food court is small with not as many options as the bigger court at the AllStar. Was a bit disappointed here, so we did not use this food court much. Pool was beautiful, pool bar was great and very close by. Bartender did a great job making good drink for the price (ie- not watered down or weak). Impressed by all cast members, all were attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon to Remember”
Reviews.Author: meiya_999
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent many months researching possible locations for our honeymoon as well as possible hotels. We finally decided to go to Disney World and opted for Port Orleans French Quarters for a 12 night stay - We were not disapointed!! The lovely river that wrapped part of the resort grounds set a peacful atmosphere, as did the multitude of trees and the rabbit that would come to the park area almost every night. Our room was clean and had a nice "mickey" on the bed made out of towels when we got to our room. We had a king sized bed with a view of the river...and we have no regrets!! The gorgeous view allowed us to relax after long days at the parks. The double sinks were nice, and we liked that the bathroom/shower area was separate than the sink area, and we also liked that there was a curtain that separated the sinks from the bedroom. We liked that this resort was smaller, making it easy to get around and it did not leave you with a 15 minute walk to your room when you got back from the parks - it was great! The restaurant and pool were very child oriented, but when in Disney, it is expected. We had a ton of fun in the pool (not too crowded compared to other resorts) and as for the restaurant, if we weren't in the mood, we simply picked up our food and brought it to our room where we could enjoy the absolutely delicious food while enjoying our wonderful view. The decor is great and makes you want to stroll around the grounds and appreciate life. The bus system was hit or miss, but for the most part, we found that we didn't have to wait much more than 20 minutes on average, which compared to the other resorts on the Disney grounds, was great. Our resort's buses weren't as crowded as the ones for the other resorts, which was also an added bonus to having chosen a smaller resort. One of the best things was that we could also take a boat to Downtown Disney instead of taking a bus, which was romantic, fun and different. The wait for a boat was not as long as the wait for the bus, but the transit time was a bit longer, but well worth it. Finally, there are 7 buildings on the resort that contain the guest rooms (we were in building 5, on the far side of the pool). You can choose your view as well as your location (far away for isolation and privacy or near the lobby/restaurant/gift shop/pool). You can also enjoy the nice trails and you can also enjoy the neighboring resort, Port Orleans Riverside. Port Orleans French Quarters delivers on it's promises - If you choose this resort, you will not be disapointed! It is clean, well maintained (they have just finished remodeling the resort) and is a great mixture of fun and romance. Have an amazing trip!! We sure did! =)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay at Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: trunkbaygirl
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from Walt Disney World and decided to stay at a moderate resort this time around. Port Orleans French Quarter was a dream come true. The room had two queen sized beds, was clean as a whistle and very conveniently located next to the bus stop. We never waited longer than 15 minutes for a bus to any of the parks. The resort was decorated in wonderful Christmas decor and the pool with it's serpent water slide was fantastic. We never ate in the food court because we had plans to eat in the parks but the food looked great and I did manage an order of their beignets which tasted like a bite of heaven. All in all a great experience with wonderful cast members. Would stay there again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Bolderkalamazoo
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney several times and normally stay at the deluxe hotels. This was the first time at a moderate hotel. Overall the hotel is in a nice spot very close to Epcot which we tend to do most of our dinners at. The hotel was clean and building 3 was in a good location. However, the service is not up to Disney standards. I will give a few examples. When returning to my room one day, the cleaning lady was not done with my room and told me I could not go in. I would have expected her to phrase it a little different but since she could not speak English I assume that is why she was so abrupt. Another example which is what made me write a review was when we stored our bags and my daughters’ balloons. They told me that they store balloons all the time so it would be no problem however when we returned to get the bags and balloons I noticed one of the outer balloons of the Disney ear style balloons was popped. The bellmen did not say anything and when I asked what happened he told me it must be losing air – he never apologized. My 3 year old daughter began to cry when she saw the balloon so I did not have time to deal with him. Once I was able to calm my daughter down I entered the hotel to let the concierge know so that they could update the manager so no other child would be disappointed on their last day at Disney. The concierge did not seem to care about this and I am sure they did not update the manager. I was not requesting anything special but a sincere apology which was never given by any of the Disney staff. I hope the hotel manage reads this and makes sure that his staff takes care of all items especially the items that are for the children so that they are never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Downright Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: G8Rgirl91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter this past weekend. The GOOD: The re-creation of the French Quarter look is great. It's like being in the heart of New Orleans without the drunkeness or the dirty streets. The staff were friendly and helpful as well. The BAD: We checked in to the hotel in the morning to pick up our Keys to the World then headed to the Magic Kingdom. We were told at check-in that we would get a text or call when our room was ready including the room number so we wouldn't have to go back to the desk when we returned from the park. Finally we decided that even though we hadn't been notified our room must surely be ready. When we got back to the hotel we had to wait in line at the check-in desk to find out our room number since they had never called or texted us with the information. Inconvenient but not unbearable. The UGLY: Hollywood Studios was the park with extended hours that night which was the whole reason we chose that night to go to Disney. (The Osbourne Family light show was INCREDIBLE!!!) You'd think that since so many people would be heading to Hollywood Studios there would have been plenty of buses going to that park from the hotel. We got to the bus stop and waited. And waited and waited and waited. After 45 minutes a bus finally came but was full and could only fit 2 people even though there were more than a bus load of people waiting. The bus pulled up behind a Magic Kingdom bus that was letting a traveler in a wheelchar off so 2 people from the back of the line got on instead of the people at the front who had been waiting the longest. By this point a riot was about to break out because there were a number of people who wanted to get to Hollywood Studios in time for a show that they were now in danger of missing. After we were there an hour (some people had been there even longer) people who had been waiting a long time started calling the hotel to complain. Finally an hour and 15 minutes after we got to the bus stop, a bus to Hollywood Studios showed up. Unfortunately by the time we got to the park and got oriented most of the food places were closing so we wasted a lot of the time we had left in the park trying to find a place to eat dinner. The whole reason we stayed at a Disney hotel was to get the Fast Passes and the transportation. We missed rides we wanted to go on because they ran out of Fast Passes (Big Thunder Mountain Railroad at the Magic Kingdom was the biggest disappointment in that regard) and we didn't get to do everything we wanted at Hollywood Studios because of the transportation. Now I realize the holidays are incredibly busy at Disney but you'd think they'd be prepared for the onslaught and at least have enough transportation. Not sure it's worth the extra money to stay at a Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,rude,awefull”
Reviews.Author: Don D
Reviews.Content: The food area was dirty,front desk at check in took 25 min. and without knowlege. The day bartender at the pool was rude and made a terrible drink.I brought 7 adults and my 3 grandkids and would NEVER go back. AVOID at all cost!!!!!!!!! And the beds were terrible.....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ToddMcfly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter in Nov 2009 and we liked the place so we chose to stay there again, Dec 2011. This time the rooms had been renovated and were really nice. Before the rooms were good but were getting older. The resort is small so you don't have to walk far to get to other places on the resort. One bus depot is nice. Other resorts are so big you have several bus depots and you spend a lot of time riding in the bus around the resort stopping at the different depots.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place to stay, but lost some of its luster.”
Reviews.Author: ptb4life
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter Hotel. This review might be fairly similar to the review posted in May of 2009. Basic Overview: Port Orleans French Quarter is designed to look like New Orleans....having never been there, I don't know how well they succeeded. It is a nice and unique looking hotel though. All rooms are accessed from outside, which I always thought was the difference between a hotel and motel....oh well. For the most part, the grounds were very nice and well kept. They were doing a bit of construction on the walkways outside of our room though. And they started around 8am, so that was a bit annoying. Everything was very clean. There is a walking path that leads to the Riverside hotel. The Room: We had a king size bed. The mattress was a little hard and creeky, but I've had worse. The pillows however were (still) the worst I've ever had in a hotel/motel....they were hard as rocks and extremely high. I learned my lesson from our first stay and brought my own pillow from home. The shower was pretty standard, with a slightly above average sized tub. The powder room is separated via a curtain and had 2 separate sinks and mirrors which was nice. The room had enough drawer space, medium sized flat screen TV, and a mini fridge. One odd issue with the rooms in this hotel is the toilet. They flush with the power of a jet engine. That was fine, until it was time for sleep and you realized that you can hear a loud WHOOOOSH every time the room next door would flush. If you're lucky, your neighbors won't be peeing and flushing all night....this was only a nuisance the first night this time. Front Desk: Nice as could be and very helpful with anything we needed. We had groceries delivered via Garden Grocer (good money saver in Disney) to the hotel prior to arriving and they held them for us. If you plan on renting a car though, just go to the supermarket on your own. They helped with any reservations we needed and made checking out and baggage for the flight pain free. Pool: The pool at the Port Orleans French Quarter is geared more towards children then it is adults. The slide is too slow for an adult to have a good time (Grand Floridian has a great one though). We went in December, while it reached 80 during the day, it was too chilly at night for swimming. There is also a separate hot tub/jacuzzi area. You are allowed to use Port Orleans Riverside's pools though, and they were much nicer for adults (and warmer for some reason). Food: Just a basic food court here. Pizza, hot dogs, chicken nuggets, hamburgers, sandwiches, etc. Nothing fancy, but it was good enough for a quick snack or meal. It might be my imagination, but the food was better this time. We also got breakfast this time and while the bacon was undercooked, the Mickey Waffles were excellent. Transportation: You can take the boat to Downtown Disney (only do this if you feel like taking your time) or you can use their shuttle bus service. Depending on where you are going, the trip can be a pain, or nice and quick. Magic Kingdom is about a 10-15 minute ride depending on whether you have to make the stops at Riverside too (although, you might be waiting at the bus terminal for up to 20 minutes for any bus). Epcot and MGM are also fairly quick rides at 10-15 minutes. Animal Kingdom is a little longer (and it also stops at Blizzard Beach) at maybe 15-20 minutes. We didn't take the bus to Downtown this time. Last time I raved about the shorter bus lines for Port Orleans. This time it seemed to be the opposite. Going to a park was always nice and quick, but getting home was a different story. Sometimes the lines were so long, you had to wait for a second bus...and even then you'd most likely be standing instead of having a seat. If we ever go back, I think we'll rent a car the entire time, it makes getting around soooo much quicker (especially when you're late for a dining reservation). The 3 days we had a car was great! Speaking of which, the drive times to Busch Gardens was about an hour and change, and Universal was about 30 minutes. Overall, it's a nice place to stay in Disney. Quick transportation to all the them parks (though not so quick to get back) and a moderate price each night. The pillows and the loud toilet flushing are the only big negatives.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean, moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: yoshi808
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days w/ my girlfriend in 2nd week of December. When we arrived, a shuttle met us & drove us to Port Orleans (shuttle took awhile to depart & made stops at other Disney properties; we spent maybe an hour on the shuttle). When we arrived, check in went smoothly. The property was nice & clean & has a large pool with slides, hot tub area, & campfire area. It is pretty, sitting on a little river that has water shuttle service to Port Orleans Riverside & Disney Downtown. Room itself was a little small but very clean. Shuttles run to all Disney areas but can take awhile. Hotel desk is very helpful & friendly. Food is mixed & can get very expensive. Main strength of this hotel is its convenient location, cleanliness, great service & free shuttle. Drawbacks are mainly cost of food, & room slightly overpriced. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ycp1996
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old daughter, 4 year old son, and myself stayed here in late September 2011 for our disney family vacation. We stayed there for six nights. We had a great time! Great hotel with good service. My son got an ear infection as soon as we arrived and the conceierage staff was great helping us goto a medical clinic and pharmacy. The buffet restaurant was ok and the park transportaion was efiicient and timely. We were very close to the bus stop and it was easy to get to with our young children. The pool and playground was very good. The disney magical express airport transfer is amazing! Would absolutely recomend this moderate level hotel for familes or anyone interested in a step up from the value resorts. This is a nice small resort and easily navigated!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Blueboy02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of October/early November 2011. Good location, lovely staff, very clean (rooms cleaned every day), nice pool for kids (our's are 8&6). We had the disney dining plan and you can use the snacks to have cereal for breakfas to save your main meals and also keep the food intake down (which isn't easy in Florida!). If you can, get block 1 or 2 as closer to reception/restaurant, handy shop on site with usual disney gifts and some groceries (bread etc). I think for the price it is hard to fault this hotel and compared to the all star sports we have previously stayed at this felt a cut above. Overall would recommend this hotel and the Disney dining plan will save you a fortune in food so if you can include it, then do so!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Disney resort experience!”
Reviews.Author: naturalogg
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the "Calypso Cay Suites" elsewhere in Orlando on a free vacation deal. Within 5 minutes of stepping inside one of their rooms, we knew we had to call Disney. We were right. Port Orleans had a lovely garden view room available, and we snagged it. There's a reason why Disney is so good at what they do. The decor in the rooms is delightful, and all of the antique-looking wood furniture (and even covering on the air conditioning unit) give the room a very New Orleans feel. The property is beautifully landscaped and arranged, and the resort overall has everything that a 20-something couple traveling alone together would need to maximize their Disney experience. Best of all, the hotel comes with a free water taxi to Downtown Disney - which we didn't even know before we booked. It only runs until 11pm, but that's still a fabulous plus, in addition to already being pretty centrally located relative to all of the parks. We'll definitely be back - thank you for saving our Orlando vacation once again, Disney!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, fresh and quick”
Reviews.Author: Jimwill77
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this was my first visit to the French Quarter, I have stayed at other moderate Disney resorts as well as delux resorts. There are many things that stand out about this resort, small size makes it quick and easy to get to the pool, market, main lobby or grab a bite to eat... No more than a 2 to 3 minute walk to get to anything that you need. Food options on site were pretty good, nothing fantastic but still ok for cafeteria type food. decent burgers, pizza breakfast items... nothing to write home about though. The bus stop was good not great, it was fantastic to be the first group on the bus as you leave for the parks, and first stop on the way back... In fact about 95% of the time French Quarter buses dont stop at Riverside while heading out to the parks... The only headache would be the buses staying on schedule while heading to the parks.. quite often 2 or 3 of the same buses would line up and would wait for people while folks waiting for magic kindom or epcot would wait 20-30 minutes... this only happened a few times so nothing too major. The room we stayed in was in building 5- room 5318... third floor (less noise) with a water view... There were 4 four of us in the room... and it felt very tight while we were in there... but as always, Disney rooms are not made for people to lay around in all day. Rooms are perfect size for 1 king size bed for a couples vacation. The decor was basic not over the top... The beds were not all that comfortable... rather stiff to me... and pack you pillows from home as there really wasnt much to them. Others have commented about room noise, I did not find this to be a problem at all... Occasionally you could hear a faint sound of a toilet flushing, but not enough to complain about. If you decide to stay here, you really wont be disappointed, nice boat ride to DownTown disney, 10-15 minutes, best moderate resort I have stayed at in Disney... It never felt crowded, very small resort and short walks which are great after a long day at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct 30-Nov 5 2011. We had a great time. Rooms were great! Restaurant great! Staff excellent! My daughter-in-law last World Pass, Transportation found it. In the meantime, staff issued another card for her at our resort. We really enjoyed our stay. Would definitely stay there again. Kids loved the pool and we loved the hot tub. Our rooms were very quiet, and quite well-maintained during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be more pleased”
Reviews.Author: 215Stacy_S
Reviews.Content: This was our first real trip to Disney and boy were we impressed. We took the Disney bus from the airport to our hotel and then headed straight to the park. When we got back our bags were waiting for us. The property is very charming. The room was not extravagant but it was clean and quite. There is a huge dragon slide in the pool area. In a rush to check out (trying to catch an earlier flight to beat an ice storm back home) my husband left his GPS and a set of keys. After a quick phone call the next day, housekeeping had found the items and overnighted them back to us. We could not have been more pleased with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: jendujka
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter for 7 nights earlier this month. I was incredibly impressed with both the quality of accommodations and staff courtesy at this resort. Since this is a moderate resort for Disney, I expected the accommodations to mirror that of a nice Hampton Inn (which I also highly recommend), and this is what we received. The beds were very comfortable, extra pillows were available in the room, and there was a mini fridge in the room. The housekeeping did a fantastic job on a daily basis. I say this because we were traveling with our two young children, and there was no shortage of mess from small food items such as goldfish crackers or powdered sugar from the fabulous beignet that was available for purchase in the food court. The room was obviously vacuumed daily. The property includes complementary shuttle service to the Disney parks, and it is also on the boat route to the Port Orleans - Riverside and Downtown Disney. The pool area is very nice, and they offer complementary life vests for kids to use during your stay. They also show a Disney movie outside each evening. We also took advantage of the complementary Magical Express transportation and luggage service to and from the airport. I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderfully easy Disney makes the whole traveling experience, and there is no doubt in my mind that we will return as soon as possible. I was surprised to have our boarding passes for our return flight printed and hanging on our door the morning of our departure as well as instructions on where to drop off our checked baggage at the resort so that we wouldn't have to worry about bringing it to the airport with us. This was our first trip to Disney, and we never expected to be this impressed with the entire experience. Originally, we intended to plan our next family vacation someone else in the next few years, but my husband and I agree that Disney will be the destination of choice. We fully intend to return to the Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: deinarson
Reviews.Content: Having just been on the Disney Dream cruise for 4 nights I was hoping that my stay at Disney World wouldn't suffer too much by comparision. The Port Orleans French quarter was a very nice resort with a great pool area for the kids. It is along the river so you can take boat rides to Downtown Disney insted of the bus if you wish. It was nice and quiet compared to the Value resorts. Everything Disney does is top notch, they think of everything. The theme parks were great! But if you haven't done the cruise, there's nothing like it!

Reviews.Title: “The best Moderate Resort at Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: Lisalyn58
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best mod at Walt Disney World. It has it's own bus service which makes it even better! The resort itself is beautiful as are the grounds and rooms. My room was just gorgeous and my bed so comfortable - I loved it! Rooms are equipped with spacious bath areas, coffee makers and fridges which are great for all those leftover dinners or snacks! I spent 6 nights here in bldg. 2 (which I certainly will request next time I go also!) Only had a 5 minute walk to the Main Lobby area, restaurants, gift shops etc and buses...5 out of 5 stars in my book!

Reviews.Title: “A convenient, good value hotel @ Disney World”
Reviews.Author: tank1050
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 6 day stay the Fench Quarter Hotel. Though it is rather sprawling, it is smaller than a lot of the other hotels and is a good value, especially withthe dining plan. The buses are a convenient way to get around. Rooms are nice size and well appointed with a small fridge and nice flat screen TV. Beds were a bit soft. Staff is friendly and helpful. I am going back in a few months and will be staying here again. One small glitch - the on site airline desk misdirected my bag mainly because the was a big crowd checking out that day. Make sure they label it in front of you before you move away.

Reviews.Title: “nicely updated”
Reviews.Author: miller01Buffalo
Reviews.Content: just stayed here for 5 days and the hotel has been nicely updated. rooms were clean. short walk to the food court, bus transportation and pool. only downside is bathroom is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right size!”
Reviews.Author: HartleyIA
Reviews.Content: We have at one point or another stayed at each of the Disney hotels. The Port Orleans FRENCH QUARTER is one of our favorites and is the smallest of the moderate priced Disney hotels. Therefore it feels less crowded and more relaxing than any of the others. This also makes it easy and quick to get to buses. This stop on the bus route is the first to get on and the first to get off on its way to the parks. So you can usally get a seat even during busy periods. The bus then runs through the larger riverside area of the resort and fills to the standing room only. There is a fun party feel to the resort with the New Orleans theme. The kids love the pool area with is sea-serpent waterslide. There are also hot tubs very nice when the weather is cool. The food court offers a nice variety and wonderful made to order beignets. A nice bonus is the boats that take you directly to Downtown Disney for a meal or shopping. Each resort offers a different experience. If you are looking to get away from the crowds for some peace and quiet the FRENCH QUARTER of Port Orleans is a good place to retreat to. Do not get it confused with the Port Orleans Riverside which is larger, busy and last to get on the bus!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Will Be Our Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daniblossom
Reviews.Content: French Quarter is a great place to stay. Stayed there over the Veteran's Day holiday with family. As always, Disney obliged to our special room request near transportation, ground floor. This hotel was recently remodeled and all the rooms are freshly painted and feature new furnishings. The room we stayed in was spotless! It was immaculately clean. If someone had told me that nobody had ever stayed in there before us, I would have believed it! Honestly, I've never seen such a clean hotel room. Outstanding. The rest of the campus was clean as well save the rubbish left behind by piggy people who can't be bothered to dump their empty soda cups in a waste basket less than a foot away from their tables but hey, they're on vacation right? Probably upset no Disney employee popped out of the bushes to throw it out for them when they drank that last drop! The food selection was the only downside. It was pretty grote. The soup was salty and breakfast was extremely greasy. Not a lot of vegetarian options either. I know, I know. Us vegetarians should just stay home and eat grass and let the meat eaters live in peace. But hey I'm sure your cholesterol would appreciate one or two less mickey mouse shaped hamburgers while on vacation. Just a suggestion Mickey. I know you have that space-aged green house over in Epcot and all. Just sayin'. The cast members were all very nice, courteous and helpful. None of those vacant stares some people get when you ask them a question. "Oh no a customer! Quick! Act like I'm mentally incapable of grasping the point of their inquiry!" At FQ you can hop on a little ferry boat and it takes you to Downtown Disney, a giant gift shop with restaurants. I enjoyed taking the ferry. You better get ready to wait at least 30-45 minutes to get on one though because the queue is long. No, I'm not British, I just enjoy saying queue. It is much funner than saying line. Also, the fairy boat makes a loud , piercing honking sound so get ready for that! Bus transportation is super convenient, especially to Magic Kingdom because as you know, the Kingdom is on an Island or something and you traditionally have to schlep over from the parking lot on a ferry or the monorail (more hideously long queues that make you want to stab yourself and others). So with a bus, TA-DA! They magically dump you off right at the front gates of the Magic Kingdom. Totally worth the $bazillion a night to stay at a Disney property because I hate to stand in a queue. It's bad enough you have to do that all day to get on rides, right? Why stand in a queue to get to the park? There are kids screaming about how they want to see Mickey Mouse, dad's drinking out of tiny liquor bottles, pining for a weekend golfing with their co-workers in accounting, mom's crying silently into their handbags. Yep. Not a pretty picture. You'll probably experience that on the bus too but you'll be sitting down and moving so you'll be less aggravated. Paying for a "river view" room is a waste of money. Don't get had! This is a tiny resort and a great deal of the rooms are away from the Sassagoula (or whatever the river is called...) so I don't even know where exactly the river view rooms are. But at any rate, what, are you staying in your room all day, glued to the chair, watching the ferry boats roar by with their loud honking? Is that what you went to Disney for? Save the money for one of the 25,000 gift shops at each of the parks. You can get a replica of the monorail and make little plastic disney characters stand in queues at home or you can buy a Mulan shaped candy bar. Yeah! Save that cash! There's a gift shop that takes up half the theme park at Magic Kingdom. You don't need a river view room or to save money for medical emergencies. Just slap a Jafar band-aid on that cracked skull. $14.99 for 7. FQ boats a pretty landscape, an arcade, a pool with some serpentine creature jutting out of it. It's a great little place to stay. And if you get bored of your hotel like the entitled, fickle Americans that we all are, you can always wander over to Riverside next door to see if the grass is greener. We didn't wander over there ourselves. If you stay at FQ, you're first to get dropped back home after a long day at the theme parks getting sunburned , screamed at by ungrateful children, taken for every red nickel you have and then told that Magic Kingdom is a DRY PARK. FQ offers great value and cleanliness. Unlike some of the other expansive properties, you don't have to leave a trail of breadcrumbs to help you find your car when you leave. Not like Coronado for instance. Sheesh. Somewhere on the trek between the parking lot and their room, some family ended up like the Donner party. You can also get one of those $14 souvenir cups you can refill your soda endlessly with during your stay at the resort. I think the cups are uh, the same for all the resorts and uh, I'm pretty sure that uh, maybe, they uh, don't change them. Ahem.

Reviews.Title: “Not a honeymoon suite”
Reviews.Author: Krigsby09
Reviews.Content: My Father In Law booked this hotel for us for my honeymoon. When we got there, there were teenagers in the halls (around 10pm) being loud and yelling down to other rooms. Of course, our room was right next to them. We could hear them all night and the next morning. Running up and down the outside walkway from room to room. I have no idea when they actually slept. Luckily, the next night they were gone. It was nice, but not very fancy, as I would have expected from a Disney hotel... We didnt really get a chance to explore much more of it, as we were only there for 2 days. It was ok though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Softbal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thanksgiving week and we had so much fun!! The pool was a little chilly but that didn't bother the kids.... It is close to downtown Disney so you can ride the boat to downtown Disney. Overall wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: raeann74
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at POFQ, before moving to a partner hotel of Universal Studios. We wanted to stay on property for many reasons, including the extra magic hours, transportation options, etc. Perhaps our expectations of Disney were too high, but we were overall disappointed with our accommodations. Although our room was clean, beds were sufficient, etc. as others have reported, there is really no ambiance to speak of. Everything feels like a 1/2 finished movie set. The pool was crowded and was not designed for a swim so much as for playing in the water. Because the hotel is newly renovated we also expected amenities that just did not exist. For example, the "safe" in the room was not even large enough for my travel jewelry case, much less even one of the laptops that my husband and I are required to bring with us by our employers. The laptops had to be brought back and forth to the lobby where a cast member assisted us to lock them up. This meant waiting in line each time to be assisted by people who, much of the time, did not know the process for us signing them out. I remember staying at Disney when every cast member went out of his/her way to make guests feel at home and well taken care of, when they at least presented as if they knew everything OR at least would find out and help. We did try to eat at the food court one night, but the food available wasn't very good quality so we opted out. It was sad that we had such better experiences on our trip at the two less expensive, non-Disney properties on our trip. I'm not sure that we will stay on property again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Fun Resort”
Reviews.Author: dallas14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ the end of October to November for two weeks with my son and family, having previously stayed at All Stars Sports and Pop Century they are both nice, French Quarter is less Disney themed and more adult for older people. We had requested on booking contecting rooms which we had. I emailed before going (as per advised on POFQ unofficial guide) to request being near all amentities as my husband as walking difficulies whether they had it or not I don't know, but we couldn't have been better placed, we were in building 2, on ground floor with small garden area outside just across a small street was the pool, childrens play area, beyond that the hot tub, bar, laundry, just a little further was food court, shop and arcade for children, just at the end of our block was the dock for the boat to Downton Disney or up to Riverside. Our room was lovely and we had a huge bathroom as the vanity unit with the two hand basin were in there, we also had a wardrobe not hanging rail, my son next door had small bathroom with the hand basins outside with curtain but that suited them being four. The food court is quite small and busy as commented on in previous reveiws, but we always managed to get table, we also ate at Riverside which is a lot bigger with a different menu which gives more variety using both resorts. The boat to Downtown Disney is a nice and we also caught it up to Riverside for dinner as well, I can't comment on Riverside sit down restaurant as we didn't use it, but had lovely turkey dinners in the self service twice. I can't comment on bus transport as we only used it once to come back from Downtown but seems very good. There were activities for children by the pool in the day and movies some nights on the lawn and a pit for roasting marshmallows by building 5, although we didn't use them being busy in the parks. We choose POFQ being a moderate resort for the quick service dinning plan which we were very pleased with makes a big saving especailly with children although you do get a bit fed up on times with quick service Disney meals we then ate out at our favourite places. The snacks are also very good and good value, all in all worth the extra to have quick service dining plan. The only complaint myself and hubby have and we heard some Americans saying it as well the pool was cold, and some days colder than others depending on weather of course, but it didn't seem to be heated at all, as one American told us not what is says in brochure, it didn't deter our children at all they loved the pool and the hot tub, the hot tub was very nice after day in park and if you had taken a dip in the cold pool. This is a lovely resort and I would highly recommend it all the grounds were well taken care of as well, only thing being with the all the trees and bushes by our room and being near the river we had quite a lot of mosquito bites and I had left my plugin for room at home, apparently Florida had, had a lot of rain and they were out in force according to news. Riverside looks really nice as well but a lot bigger, for myself I think POFQ is easier to get around, and you can always go to Riverside for food or pools by boat, walking or driving. POFQ is a lovely themed resort, fantastic place would go again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Anongirl
Reviews.Content: On arrival, our room as dirty. The floors/chairs had not been vaccumed and dirt stuck to my feet after removing my shoes. The bathroom area was tiny and poorly lit, though clean. The room itself was small and could barely fit the two queen beds. The beds were very hard, and my spouse had a difficult time getting to sleep on them. The courtyard areas were well-maintained and kid-friendly and the staff were especially courteous. The hotel offers complimentary busrides to the major Disney attractions, so we were able to save on parking expenses. The parking lot was located far from our room, so we had to carry our luggage across the resort during check-in and check-out. Overall, I expected better quality for the price. I will consider staying at a different Disney resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: amcc1983
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the POFQ. It was very clean, employees were very nice. Rooms were clean, beds comfy, pillows kind of hard, asked housekeeping for different ones, no problems. Bus service was normal Disney bus service, lots of people use this, so expect full buses, sometimes no seats, but that is just how it is, but a great service. Pool was huge and awesome, my son loved the waterslide. My son(4 years old at the time) took part in the Pirate Adventure. It left from the PORS. We walked over to the Riverside and he got an eyepatch,bandana,name tag,life vest,sword and a bottle of water. It is a 2 hour excursion(no parents allowed)the children go on a "Pirate Ship"(Pontoon Boat) and go to different stops looking for Pirate Treasure, then it wraps up in the Hotel's Lobby, were they get thier treasures! He loved it, the Cast Members were great and made me feel totally comfortable leaving my son with them. He loved it and talked about it for a long time afterwards, we would highly recommend this. We also rented a pontoon boat from over at the riverside, good price and lots of fun for our little ones. Water taxi to Downtown Disney was great and relaxing,again kids loved it. Live jazz/blues music outside of the food court at night, really helped set the New Orleans vibe. Great Hotel, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter.....Nice”
Reviews.Author: rhodeislandbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Port Orleans French Quarter last week of October 2010. Check in was a breeze. We arrived early so our room was not ready, we dropped our coats and carry on at the desk and went off to the Magic Kingdom. with in an hour I recvd a text message saying our room was ready. We ignored it and went on with our day. When we returned to our room, our luggage was there thanks to Disneys Magical Express. The room was very clean, Not overly Disney, Just what I expected from the pictures here on Trip Advisor. Not 5 star but perfect for our needs. Safe very, very small, could not fit Laptop. Overall I was happy with our decison to stay here. If I traveled back I think id try a different property just because i would like to stay somewhere different. Bus service was great, never waited more than 15 minutes. I would recommend. Have a great trip. Cast Members at the hotel are the best.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, awesome, BEST Disney Hotel Going! A++++”
Reviews.Author: msspungen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Nov 17-21 2011, and it was flawless from top to bottom. This was our third stay at this hotel, and the new renovations were very noticeable (comfy beds, new clean rugs in rooms, new bead spreads, flat screen tvs, and fresh bright paint on hotel exterior). We stayed in building 6, and had a free upgrade to a river view. SO PRETTY. The room was clean, comfy, roomy, and perfect. The hotel staff was friendly at all times. The property is lush with gardens (think garden district New Orleans) and statues/fountains, and the whole thing is just amazing to walk through and enjoy. The hotel is QUIET which is a plus, and despite hearing people occasionally flush toilets (toilets are loud when flushed), we never heard a PEEP from any other guests as the walls are thick. Also, hotel is small, which means EVERYTHING IS A SHORT WALK. The bus stop is not far from ANY room, and this is great. The bus system was wonderful and we never had a long wait. Also, there is a free boat to Downtown Disney, and the river is gorgeous to view and enjoy. We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning and even though some folks are griping on here, we LOVED IT! We had Mickey waffles each day with fruit (so yummy), and they had coffee, juice, soda, energy drinks, french toast, cereal, omlettes, eggs, etc. You could get whatever you wanted and the quality of the food was AMAZING. YUM! We liked the bengiets too, which are special french donuts. So good!!!! (Okay ,the prices are Disney level, but other than that, no complaints!) I will NEVER stay anywhere else when at WDW. The magic express bus was great, the hotel was fabulous, and the bus service to the parks was amazing. We like how relaxed and small this hotel is as most WDW hotels are MONSTEROUS. This is not at all, which makes everything easy to do, and wait times are minimal! They also have a small store on site, and we traded pins with the staff. So cool. They also give mardi gras beads out when you arrive, and they have free movies at night for families to enjoy outdoors. We did not use the pool but it was clean looking and really amazingly shaped (kids will love it!) Two thumbs up. Stay here once and you will be hooked forever!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Customer Service as Expected from Disney”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Walt Disney World (WDW) POFQ recently, expecting the typical Disney "moderate" resort, and we were surprised by our experience. While expecting nothing but excellence from Disney's castmembers, the CMs at POFQ exceeded their counterparts at other WDW resorts. We are Disney Vacation Club members, yet these CMs went far-and-beyond those working at Animal Kingdom Villas, Old Key West, Saratoga Springs, or Beach Club Villas. Our room was ready upon check-in, so our WDW experience began without any delay. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. We typically find recently that housekeeping misses those little things which differentiate themselves from the "usual", like dust on the furniture. However, POFQ housekeeping exceeded our expectations. The only odd thing we found about our room was that the previous occupants (from Canada) had left their passports behind... in the mini-refrigerator's freezer compartment, of all places. One call to the Front Desk had that "issue" immediately addressed. POFQ is a little oddly-located, yet it is in the middle of Walt Disney World, making it convenient to the theme parks. Typhoon Lagoon is close to this resort, as well as Downtown Disney/West End. Epcot is the closest theme park, with the Magic Kingdom a short drive away. While the drive is a little further to the Disney Hollywood Studios and the Animal Kingdom, the travel time isn't really so bad. Disney transportation is available to all resort guests, we find it more convenient to have a car. The price for theme park parking is waived for resort guests, providing a daily savings of $14 (2011 pricing). If we find ourselves wishing to stay at a Disney "moderate" resort, POFQ will be our pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: LafayetteGAmartin
Reviews.Content: Our first stay onsite at Disney was at Riverside and we loved it. The next trip we decided to try French Quarter and although it took us a day or two before we stopped comparing it to Riverside, we LOVED.it! The small size of the resort was wonderful. We were so close to everything; the pool, food court, bus stop, boat launch. We never had any bus trouble and we love the boats to Downtown Disney and Riverside; it is the best perk at the resort. The theming at this resort is amazing, it looked just like the New Orleans from the movie "The Princess and the Frog"!! We were very pleased with the food at the food court and loved the guy who played the blues in the bar. We were sitting in the lobby with our girls while they colored for a few minutes and got to listen to some really good blues music. The staff at POFQ was very friendly and were constantly giving us beads and stickers. One very nice lady even had princess cards laid out for our girls when we returned from the parks one day. That trip was in May of 2010 and we were fortunate to go back to Disney in December that same year. We stayed at Pop Century and it was very nice and very well-themed. We tried to like it....we really did! But we decided that if at all possible that it was worth the extra money to stay at French Quarter. We are definitely spoiled! We stay in a constant state of "planning" for our next Disney trip and where we want to stay is a no-brainer!!! POFQ...here we come!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: imanageourbudget
Reviews.Content: Just got back 11/18 from 6 nights at POFQ. We have always stayed at Riverside in the past but due to POFQ being recently rennovated we opted for it. Loved the fact it is a small resort and we weren't far from the bus stop. Rooms were clean and staff friendly and helpful. For us there were 2 downsides. One the food court was small, crowded and the food wasn't very good. Two after staying a Riverside we did not find French Quarter to have much ambience. But the upside was it was a short walk to Riverside. We ate at the food court there. Food selection was wonderful, food was better and the walk over was beautiful and all the ambience you need so I would suggest POFQ (rennovated rooms) and walking over to Riverside for good food and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Port Orleans Resort - August 2011”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, food ok, dining plan a bit restricting (why can't you refill drinks in the Disney parcs), service very good and attentive, got stung when we used the room phone to call home - $20 for a 1 minute call! (but was able to negotiate a settlement with reception), pool good, room maintained to high standard. Entertainment excellent - Elliot Dyson's music show top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marvick5520
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at Port Orleans Resort-French Quarter. This was my first time at this Disney Resort and it is worth to pay extra staying at the moderate rate Disney resort than the All -Star ones. We decided to stay at Disney resort mainly it provided transportation to all Disney parks and Disney downtown. For Port Orleans, it can be via ferry to downtown Disney. Also, early admission into the park on selected days. Check in was quick and I used the on line check option, so the entire package is ready for me at the time of the check. Staff is always pleasant. Our room is on the second floor in building 6 facing the river. A bit of an issue is lack of sign indicating where the elevator is located unless you want to carry your luggage up the stairs. The room is well decorated, spacious, comfortable and the best thing is the mini fridge that we can keep our drinks cool. We never ate on site but looks like a good selection of staple like pizza etc offered at a fair price. Grounds are very well kept and beautiful to see. We enjoyed our walk along the river to see the Riverside resort. Very quiet overall and house service is on time. Like the towel decorations. The pool is great for kids and young at hearts and the resort has coin laundry also

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: FionaWarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter in October 2011. Have previously stayed at Pop Century but as just us two we thought we would give a Moderate Resort a try there was the added bonus of the free quick service dining plan. We booked Port Orleans as it appeared to have a more adult theme and not too Disney....silly you may think - why stay at Disney if you didn't want too much Disney?? Well i'll tell you why.... The resort was spotless not just clean, the staff were working around the clock sweeping, washing and just generally everywhere within the resort was SO clean The staff especially Mousekeeping were fantastic The grounds and setting/theme of the resort was beautiful...so relaxing Lovely pool Not too big - we stayed in building 7 the furthest away from the lobby but was not too far Excellent transportation system buses and the lovely boat to Downtown Disney Food at the Sassagoula Food Factory was very good, a little limited with choices but had fast food and healthy options and what can you say in our case it was FREE!! The quick service dining plan was AMAZING this saved us a fortune! The best tip I read before I went was if you have this plan then pay for breakfast and use your 2 meals for lunch and dinner. This is true as breakfast for two cost us $17 and the lunch or dinner would have cost $40 each time (for two). The snacks were great too, however do research this as Disney will advertise a piece of fruit as an example snack but you can have many other options especially ice creams and cakes/pastries from the bakery. Unless you get the refillable mug with your dining plan then buy one - it's such good value and these can be used for soft drinks and hot drinks unlimited within your resort. You do get a drink with each meal on the dining plan so we got bottles of water instead of a fountain soft drink as we could use the water to take to the parks! We like our food and the portions are so filling. The rooms were refurbished and very clean with a TV, Fridge, Double basin's and two beds! Air conditioning great and comfy beds - no complaints whatsoever. We used the Magical Express to and from Orlando International which was faultless! They had pool activities for the kids and also movies under the stars which was such a lovely idea! While we were there (10 nights) it rained for 48hrs solid but nobody cared, everyone was wearing their Disney poncho's and getting on with it The resort had plenty of children and Disney Magic however was not over the top and although the resort was well occupied it never felt overcrowded and was very quiet! Overall very enjoyable/relaxing experience! Would completely recommend to anyone & everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoy this resort”
Reviews.Author: scrapbookgirls
Reviews.Content: This is probably the 4th time I've stayed at this resort and I plan on going back in a couple of years. We arrived early and we had to wait until the 3 o'clock check in because they were at 100% capacity but we went to eat and started shopping in the gift store. Our rooms were clean and comfortable, the property is very nice. We enjoyed both the hot tub and the pool. We shopped in the store several times and did pin trading with the people who worked in the store. All of them were very pleasant. We like that you really don't have to walk far to get where you want to go on this property. Also, the buses ran very well on this trip. We almost never had a wait. Great service. The only complaint I can think of is that the food wasn't that great in the quick service restaurant at French Quarters and a couple of times they made my order of food wrong. Everything else was a positive experience and we will go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Connie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend/birthday trip. It was just the two of us (adults). The rooms are great. The location is great. Our room was always clean. We did the online checkin and arrived at 11 am and found our room ready, the whole process was easy. As we arrived on the magical express, we were greeted outside of resort by a staff member who was ready with beads and birthday pins for our birthdays. The dining area is great especially the breakfast. our room was easy to get to. We never waited that long for a bus. I had stayed here with my children 11 years ago and found that it did not dissappoint again! I would recommend this place and we are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but disappointing for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly1017
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for the Epcot Food & Wine Festival. We live in the area, but far enough away to make staying in a hotel a reasonable idea. We got a Florida Resident discount and paid $140 total for the night, which is ridiculously cheap by Disney standards, so I knew going in this wasn't going to be deluxe accommodations. That being said, with it's exterior corridors, it reminded us of a Disney-fied Holiday Inn. The decor was New Orleans inspired of course, but to me it was a little worn out. They use old-school bedspreads, the kind I automatically remove upon getting in the room, for all the reasons you can imagine. The bed was hard as a rock. We both woke up with backaches. The bathroom was pretty nice, obviously recently renovated. Two sinks, which is great for us. The shower needed a little help, as I had to wait a good five minutes for hot water, and the shower head was finicky. Being that it has exterior corridors, we heard noise throughout the whole night and morning. On the positive side, there is Disney service still behind the scenes. We were greeted professionally & warmly at all times. Everyone we ran into was very accommodating, and they provided us with the late check out we requested. All in all, it was not a horrid experience, but just average and served our purpose for one night. I just cannot fathom paying the normal standard rate of around $200/night here. Save your money and splurge on the deluxe resorts if you insist on staying on Disney property. Otherwise take your $200 and spend it on neighboring properties where you can get a lot more luxury for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityCampbells
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Port Orleans French Quarter a couple of hours ago, and we couldn't wait to review it for others who may be considering a stay there. We go to Orlando a lot (you could even say a rediculous amount, as this was our third trip this year) simply because we love Disney. Over the years, we've stayed a number of places, from Disney's budget resorts, to the Ritz-Carlton, to Marriott timeshare villas, and we've loved them all, but this resort was something special. First, it is a sensory delight. Narrow French Quarter "streets" lead you through beautiful gardens of rose bushes and magnolia trees and past peaceful fountains and sitting areas as horse-drawn carriages clip-clop by. And did I mention the river? The resort sits on a river and you can catch a boat to Downtown Disney. We did, and we loved it! The room was very nice and we were fortunate to have a room with a river view. Not a big room, but a very smart use of space. A curtain divides the bath and vanity area from the rest of the room for a private dressing area, and the dresser/TV stand contains a mini fridge that we found very helpful for keeping our snacks and drinks chilled. The housekeeper kept the room beautiful, and she surprised us everyday with a new towel animal! The food court was hectic and noisy, as food courts are, but the staff were helpful and friendly. A couple of pieces of advice-- I suspect that we got a top floor river view room (quiet!) because I booked over the phone and had a great conversation with the booking agent about our family size, and what we were interested in, etc. In the past, I've done everything online and therefore, I didn't have that advocate saying, "I think you want to stay in the newly renovated building," or, "I can get you a better view for $60 more..." From now on, I'll always book by phone. Another tip, get a dining plan. We've been making this trip at least once a year for 10 years, and this was the first time we purchased a dining plan. I'm a little embarrassed to admit what a slow learner I am, but I've finally learned that the dining plan is a good thing! It makes your trip completely worry-free. The bottom line--You will not be disappointed by this resort!

Reviews.Title: “This Disney property was perfect”
Reviews.Author: SavannahT1
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too big or too small. Very easy to get to the main building and transportation. Very clean rooms! Will definately return to this one!

Reviews.Title: “A magical stay”
Reviews.Author: kiltouangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at French Quarter for 4 days and it was great after a hot day in the park to know that we didn't have to do any cleaning. There were always fresh linen and the Mickey heads made of towels were just so cute. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough No-Frills Property”
Reviews.Author: bdscates
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this property. It is a moderately priced resort, which houses one cafeteria-style restaurant. My room was comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful and pleasant. There was one small bar connected to the cafeteria and one at the pool. My travel agent did not advise me that the property was undergoing renovations; it did not negatively effect me however, if I had known this I would most likely stayed elsewhere. The clientele is mostly families and seniors, not many in between. One drawback is the location, which is approximately 20 to 30 minutes away from the attractions. One must take a shuttle to get a table-service meal. The shuttles do not run consistently so if you have a dinner reservation at Epcot, plan to leave 2 hours OR MORE before your reservation. The next time I visit Walt Disney World I will stay at the Swan, Dolphin or Yacht Club, although the price for these establishments FAR exceeds the price of the Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Planning for daughters wedding - 2012”
Reviews.Author: phil_darlow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with our daughter and future husband to Orlando to plan their wedding in Sept 2012. We have stayed at Disneys Port Orleans previously in 2009. The holtel and staff are as would expect with a Disney property and again they did'nt disapoint. Room, hotel and surrounding area were always clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter is quiet, clean and updated!”
Reviews.Author: reed13ja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter in a King Bed room Oct 30 - Nov 5, 2011. Grounds and Facilities: The resort was recently updated, and there is still some exterior work (painting mostly) going in some buildings, but it appeared the nearby rooms were left empty. The landscaping was absolutely lush and very well kept, and the river was beautiful. We used online check-in and it was a total breeze. Absolutely no wait to get our keys. The one dining facility is a quick self-service cafeteria style place. We ate a few breakfasts here, and the food was nothing to write home about. Typical mass quantity taste and a high price. Room: The room was spotlessly clean and fresh. We received a river view, which was great. The room was spacious and the bathroom had a separate dressing area that was helpful in the mornings. The flat screen TV was large, but the cable TV selection is absolutely terrible. You can only watch local channels, ABC, ESPN and Disney. Bus service tip: We drove, so we had our own car. We decided to try the Disney bus system one day, and I cannot recommend that if you have your own car. The bus for PO French Quarter also makes four stops at the Riverside location, so it takes a lot of extra time and can get crowded. When driving yourself, it typically takes at least ten minutes to make it to the main parking gate of any of the major theme parks. Epcot is the closest to the French Quarter. Overall: We visited several other Disney resorts for meals and entertainment, and French Quarter is by far the quietest and most relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “2011 Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Gazoo68
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd Family vacation on the Disney properties. French Qtr was small and perfect. It was clean, We stayed right off the open grass area where they had MOVIE night. The rooms were clean. Service was quick. The Bus stop area was ez to get too. Even with the buses going to the other Port Orleans area, the rides were always quick and we never missed a beat. Food Court was decent. No sit down resturants, but it served its purpose and the kids ate fine. Pool was nice size and the layout was cool. Would definately stay again. Not an issue at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great trip, an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennAly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans, French Quarter for a week at the end of October. We had a great time; however there were definitely some issues with the hotel. My goal is to give an honest review, both positive and negative. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel, the first was about seven years ago – we really liked the hotel at that time and we looked forward to returning. Check in was fast and efficient, we had our room assigned and had keys to it around 11:30 a.m., well before the actual check in time. The person at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. She told us where our room was at and we were disappointed that we were assigned a room on the first floor when we had requested a room on the 3rd floor. They acknowledged the request and changed our rooms without a problem; the person even mentioned that she didn’t understand why we were assigned a 1st floor room when we had requested a higher floor. None the less we were happy to be checked in and head out to the parks. We had an issue with getting our luggage from Magical Express – due to the room not being the one originally assigned. It took one call and our luggage was in the room by the time we returned for the night. A couple of days into our stay and the toilet in our room stopped flushing. We called for maintenance and were told that someone would be there shortly. We waited for an hour, and no one showed up (we did specifically note the times of the calls) two more times and finally we got someone after waiting for two hours. I was very frustrated with waiting around, I realize that people have access to your room whenever they want, but I did not have access to a shower or toilet so that made getting ready to go out kind of impossible. I called and asked to speak to a manager, they seem to have someone on duty, however they had to radio her and have her call me back. She called just as maintenance arrived, and offered me some fast passes to whatever park I wanted for my troubles. I was annoyed, but accepted this. She indicated that she would call me back with a case number so I could pick them up at guest services at whatever park we wanted. Before she called back the maintenance person indicated they might have to replace the toilet – when the manager called back I told her about this and she offered me a room change or access to another room so we could use the shower in that room. About that time the maintenance person indicated that they found a toothbrush in the toilet and that the toilet was now flushing. He indicated that we should call housekeeping so they could come clean up the mess he made. I declined the other room because I was under the impression that the issue was resolved. The wait started all over again with housekeeping, they told us someone would be up there right away and nearly an hour went by and we had to call back again they said it would be at least another 15 minutes. At this point I was furious because I still couldn’t use the bathroom, so I went up to the front desk in hopes of talking to this manager and letting her know that there are some serious issues with resolving this problem. She was not at the desk, but I spoke to the front desk manager and he was very friendly and apologetic. The whole point of a hotel room is the bathroom and the bed – it’s a big deal that the bathroom was unusable and that no one seemed to think it was a priority. I asked that the front desk manager please communicate my dissatisfaction with things and he assured me he would. I assume that the bathroom was cleaned up while we were out for the evening. The very next day we were out of the room early and gone until 6:30 p.m. We returned and the room and was upset to see that the room had not been cleaned at all. I called housekeeping and got the front desk and told them the room wasn’t cleaned. They immediately asked if I left my privacy sign up, which I did not. She apologized and transferred me to housekeeping; the person who answered in housekeeping was not at all friendly and did not apologize. They said they would send someone to clean and asked that they wait an hour so we could get ready to go out to dinner. I called the manager I spoke with the day before and she was apologetic and admitted that they screwed up badly between my issues the day before and the room not being cleaned today. She refunded my nightly rate for that night and asked if we wanted turn down service when they came to clean up – I accepted and appreciated her admitting the problem and doing something to make up for my lost time. We did get a phone call from a housekeeping manager apologizing for the issues and she also stopped by later in the week to make sure everything was going well and our room was cleaned up to our standards. I appreciated someone making that effort. I’d like to mention that either of these two issues on their own would be irritating, but it was the combination of problems on two consecutive days that made me so mad. I felt like my time was not being respected and that they didn’t view these problems as issues. I fully understand that a room can sometimes be missed while cleaning, and under normal circumstances I wouldn’t have expected anything in return – but again it was that coupled with my totally wasted evening the night before. After these two nights we had no other issues. I found bus service to be very good at this hotel (better than Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge); we didn’t wait more than 10 minutes for a bus going to a park from the hotel and not more than 20 from a park to the hotel. It was inconvenient that we had to stop at the four stops at Riverside some times, but that didn’t happen all the time. Boat service to and from downtown Disney was very relaxing and a nice change from the crowded buses. We ate in the food court for breakfast a couple of mornings and for a snack one evening – the employees were all nice and one particular cashier seemed very sincerely interested in learning about where everyone was from and if they were having a great time. The grounds at this hotel really are beautiful and impeccably clean. While we do not have children the activities that they have for them really seemed nice, I thought the movies in the court yard would be a great way for kids to settle down in the evening. We stopped at the front desk a couple of times to check our room charges and those employees were always friendly and helpful. The rooms do look a lot nicer since the renovations; however they are still a very basic hotel. The bathroom is unbelievably tiny; it’s nice that the sinks and mirrors are separate from the shower area and there is more space to get ready there – however the bathroom is among the smallest I have ever seen at a hotel. The beds are all queen sized now, but they are still using the head/footboards from the full sized beds so it looks a bit odd. I found the beds to be EXTREMELY uncomfortable and I woke up with a back ache the last four nights. I’m not sure that I’d stay here again, I think that Disney hotels are overpriced for what you get – but I realize that you are paying for all of the extras associated with a Disney hotel. I’m not sure I would stay at a Disney hotel again unless I was getting free dining or a substantial room discount.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service and grounds”
Reviews.Author: HMByrd
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of my husband, his parents, my 3 yr old son and me. We all really enjoyed this resort. We all enjoyed every meal we ordered, we received connecting rooms as requested, and every staff member we encountered was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite WDW resort!”
Reviews.Author: jennz_id
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at POFQ. We have stayed at AS-Movies, AS-Music, Pop Century, and PO-Riverside. I decided to try FQ as the reviews were great and the whole hotel has been refurbished. The rooms now have queen beds which is a big plus as I have a couple of kids who are bed hogs and have trouble sharing a full bed. This was a godsend, and justified the price upgrade from a value to a moderate resort. There is a small coffee pot and a refrigerator in the room, and the decor is tasteful and nice. I brought in some of those maxwell house filter packs, and they make the perfect pot of coffee in the coffee maker. As anyone who has stayed at WDW knows, good coffee is hard to come by there. The food courts all offer nescafe, and the packs they give you in room to use in the coffee pots are lackluster. If you are addicted to your morning joe like I am, I highly recommend bringing in those filter packs, they're wonderful. You can grab creamer and sugar from the food court. The pool is awesome - a big dragon slide, and playful alligator statues surround the area. The boat service to downtown Disney and PO-Riverside was a nice option as well. What I really, really liked about this resort is the layout. The buildings are fairly close together and compared to other WDW resorts, there is not a crazy amount of walking involved to get to the main building and transportation. As both of my children have gross motor issues and my Dad has nerve damage in his right leg, this was an important feature for us. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Angel77021
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a 6 night vacation at POFQ, and it was amazing! If you are going to Disney, you HAVE TO stay at a Disney resort! From the dinning plan, to the extra magic hours, to the transportation,to being in the middle of the magic, it is totally 100% worth it! This being my 5th Disney resort, it just keeps getting better and better! The grounds were absolutely beautiful! We seen a bunch of lizards, squirrels, and bunnies every day..even some deer! I must have took 100 pictures just of the resort itself! Our room was on the 3rd story of building 5 which was perfect! Our room looked over a courtyard that played "movies underneath the stars" every night. To the right of our room we could see the river which is absolutely amazing! If you are staying here DEF take the boat ride to Downtown Disney, it's so peaceful! To the left of our room we could overlook the pool, which is really nicely themed! The food at the resort was great (loved the mickey waffles in the morning), and the cast members were super super friendly! There is also a short ten minute walk along the river to Port Orleans Riverside, which was also really nice just A LOT bigger then French Quarter. They had a horse and carriage ride that went from both resorts, which was really nice! I would stay here again and again, you can't go wrong with Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Stay”
Reviews.Author: elisbanders
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 recently stayed at this hotel. It was my son's first trip to Disney and we were celebrating his birthday. It was our first time staying at a Disney property so I wasn't sure what to expect. I was very pleased with everything and had no issues while there. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable, which was great. The first night we requested some additional towels and a blanket and they were promptly delivered. The room was a good size, very clean and comfortable. The property has been recently renovated and everything looks great. My son played at both the pool and playground, which were great. We ate 2 meals at the on-site restaurant and has no issues. I felt the food was on par with Disney and the selections similar with other restaurants. We had no issues with the busses and never waited more than about 15 minutes. Overall, we had a great stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ZR900MAN
Reviews.Content: Was totally amazed at the high level of cleanliness of the room and grounds. There was a huge abundance of clean towels delivered to our room (we keep the privacy tab on) and also at the poolside and hot tub at all times. The grounds were always void of garbage and the walkways were incredibly clean (pressure washing). The onsite cafe wasn't very good (ice cream didn't taste very good and service--especially at late night was awful). We found that walking next door to the sister hotel, Riverside, we found better food. The grounds were a relaxing vacation in themselves, having the ability to take long walks on the paths between the French Qrtr and Riverside. We also enjoyed the free boat transportation massively. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations, fabulous”
Reviews.Author: KRTT
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 10 night night stay at fq & want 2 go back! We were in building 4 right nxt to restaurant, shop, concierge, bar,buses etc. Our room was great not huge but as we were only in it 2 sleep it was fine. Staff were always friendly & helpful from check in 2 food court, we were new to the dining plan but it was great & saved us a fortune & the food still good, we had meals & snacks left over even after getting sweets to take home! The buses were good & didn't pick up at riverside so always easy. Boat to downtown also easy & a nice ride. The whole holiday was made easy by staying here using the transportation & dining plan. Taxis also good as they are waiting in car park. Can't understand anyone who moans about fq as we are fussy but can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations for an overnight during the Half Marathon!”
Reviews.Author: FLBulldogger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans Oct 1, 2011 and was impressed with the property and accommodations. Beds were nice and room very clean. The grounds were immaculate and provided a nice walk around before the Half Marathon. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough”
Reviews.Author: kimylou32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and a really good base to then explore the disney parks. the pool is very good and kids seem to love it. The rooms are very clean, we had a mickey towel the first day and despite daily tipping, nothing else. Not sure if the daily tipping is expected or not but thought better to than not. The refillable mugs are great value and you can have tea, coffee or soft drinks. A Must. The riverside complex is about a 5 - 10 (max) walk along the river and we never ate there altough now wish we had. The dining at the french quarter is the same day in day out and no real low fat options. Apple sauce for a side of macaroni cheese seems a little strange but different countries, dfferent accompanyments with meals. Twice we ordered the large pizza and that uses two dining plan meals so good to know. A hotel that does what it says on the tin!!! Staff very friendly and happy to help.
