Rooms very clean and fridge an added bonus in the room. Take hangers as not much hanging space really but not enough hangers for a family of 3. No real place to store suitcases etc as cannot place under the bed. Beds very comfortable if not a tad firm but a pleasant nights sleep. Buses to disney reliable and frequent. The boat back from downtown disney can be affected by large queues later in the eveing but the bus is very near the dock so always an alternative. Towels by the pool available so no real need to pack your own. Hairdryer in room is adequate also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyHeart
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney many times and usually rent a car and stay off property. This year there were 5 of us including my 3 year old grandson so I wanted to simplify it and use the Disney Magical Express and Disney Transportation. This worked out very well for us and gave us more freedom in general. I choose Port Orleans, because the resort has recently been refurbished and now has 2 queen sized beds in a standard room. This is a well themed, smaller resort that makes it easy to get around and the overall atmosphere of this resort is charming and relaxed with enough little touches to please people of all ages. It was particulary nice in the evening with terrific jazz music at Scat Cats off the main lobby. It drew a crowd including families and older people who just wanted to relax and wind down. I just can't say enough about the atmosphere and precious moments like seeing a dad and his daughter dancing in the lobby... truly magical. The location and ease of gettting around was A+. The DisneyTransportation was very good and there was never much of a wait to go to the parks. The buses were not overly crowded other than park closing time which is understandable, but they come more often at that time and you could wait for the next one. One of the best features of this resort is that you can also take the Sassagoula River boat to Downtown Disney or Port Orleans Riverside. We took the riverboat to Riverside once for lunch at the foodcourt and once for dinner at Boatwright's Cafe. They were two of the best meals we had at Disney. It is not always easy to find nice fresh food when you're on Disney property so this was a real treat. The food court has a salad bar where you can create your own salad and it was fresh, delicious, and huge. Boatwright's Cafe was really good too.......... and ohhhhh the roast beef! French Quarter also has a food court, but doesn't have a sit down restaurant like Riverside. The boat ride to Riverside is worth the adventure and the resort is worth seeing. They had live music at Riverside as well in the lounge area next to the restaurant and everyone was having the best time. The music was great and there were many families with their children on stage having a sing along. I noticed on the boat ride back after dark that there was a large screen movie being shown on the other side of the river. Now this would be enough to please many, but there's more...... they also have horse drawn carriage rides! We saw this a couple of times, but we were unable to get a reservation. The carriage ride goes from Riverside over to French Quarter and back again. We happened to be going into dinner when it crossed in front of us and the sound of the horses hoofs added to the already wonderful atmosphere. There is also a walking path along the river between the resorts and I could see people out for a stroll, sitting and taking it all in or out for a romantic walk. We even saw a marshmellow roast at our resort and the captain got us to say "We Want Marshmellows" at the count of 3. Very cute........ they were all waving and holding up there sticks showing off their delicious treats. All and all this is a wonderful resort and you can enjoy it and it's sister property for the price of one... they are both very different and worth the experience. I wouldn't have to be going to the parks to enjoy myself. In fact I'm very anxious to go back with the intention of enjoying all the resorts have to offer just to relax and go to Downtown Disney. It's nice there in the evening and you can take the boat over, have a little "Happy Hour" and see La Nouba and not have to worry about driving... just relax. The Earl Of Sandwich is also at Downtown Disney and worth honorable mention. Never let the lines scare you no matter how long they are as they really have their act together. It's a great place for lunch or a light supper with delicious sandwiches, salads, fresh fruit and other desserts. There you have it and now my fond memories just make me want to go back. It's nice to try different resorts, but I haven't had enough of this one yet and need to go back to fully discover and enjoy all the wonderful touches this special resort has to offer... including it's sister resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PSUNittanyLion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon after getting married in Disney. I must admit I was a little skeptical about staying here considering I have never stayed on property at Disney. But my wife def made a great call. I loved out stay there. The rooms wasn't what I was expecting but it was still really nice. Lots of space and very clean!!! Its in the moderate level so don't expect Grand Floridian Decor and ammenities. The food decent and the best part I think was we enjoyed they guy who played music at night by the bar. We really enjoyed ourself. I will def be staying here if I ever get a chance to again!!! The shuttle service wa excellent too. Huge pool and really nike landscaping. We didn;t have to park far from our room either. Overall a really nice place to stay when your at Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Holiday”
Reviews.Author: sunshine10139
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter the last 2 weeks of September 2011. The room was spacious and clean and very close to the pool, we did have a problem with our air conditioning but it did get sorted eventually, we did have to ask a couple of times!! The Food court had alot of choice, although could be very busy at peak times. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family and couples. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Jell4
Reviews.Content: The PO:FQ is located a fair distance from all four parks. Access if fast to any park using the free buses provided by the WDW Resort. Bus service could certainly be improved, however, as you'll often see five buses going to one park, and wait twenty minutes for the bus you are waiting for. There is an onsite store selling bread, milk and snacks at a reasonable price. You can also purchase yogurt, beverages from the eating area. This allows you to make very good lunches and save a lot of money on your mid-day meals when on a budget. Most of the hotel, and the entire riverview (not to be confused with riverside) area has been refurbished. Call ahead to ask for which rooms are refurbished. There is a large pool ideal for children. When we went, south american summer camps invaded the area, and we never tried the pool. Getting a riverview room allows you to enjoy the view, but most importantly to avoid all the noise coming from the pool area. Anyone looking for a mid-day nap can forget about it if they are facing the pool area. The rooms are standard, small rooms with two double-beds and a tiny bathroom. You may use the refrigerator to store the snacks and lunch material purchased at the store. No wi-fi. No easy computer access.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: douceophelie
Reviews.Content: We went there for our honeymoon. The room was very pretty (recently refurbished and you could tell...), very clean and quiet. The riverview was romantic and the building very quiet. The resort itself is beautiful and fun... The staff was nice. We only ate breakfast at Sassagoula, it was O.K. ... We're going to try a deluxe resort for our next trip but if we had to come back to a moderate or suggest a moderate to a friend, we would definitely suggest Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Taylor M
Reviews.Content: For being considered a "Moderate" Resort, it's very nice! I've stayed there several times, they have a decent sized pool, and nice landscaping. The rooms were very clean, of course. And they had nice places to eat. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating, is because I found the rooms to be rather small. Although they are nicely decorated, they're not very large. But all in all, I would consider it to be a good deal, and I would indeed recommend it to fellow Disney goers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: gerrtaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days and it was excellent. Rooms were clean, large pool and they have activities going on during the day. They show movies on a common area, of course disney movies. Disney transportation was excellent, bus stops right in front of resort. Checking out was easy, checked our luggage and got boarding passes at the resort, so no waiting to check in at airport. This was the easiest time I have ever had on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great theming, location and value.”
Reviews.Author: helloson
Reviews.Content: We have only previously stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in a Savannah view room, so I was a little apprehensive about staying in a moderate resort. I am however, pleased to say that this is a brilliant hotel. We stayed in builiding 3 which was only a 2 minute from reception, the pool, the shop and the quick service restaurant. The other good thing about this hotel is the ability to park your car opposite your building. This means that nothing is more than a short walk away. TIP: when you first check-in, leave your cases in the car as you will be told to park your car next to your building. This will save you making two trips with your luggage. This hotel is only a pleasant 5 minute walk down the river away from the Port Orleans Riverside resort and the additional amenities it has to offer (different food choices at the quick service restaurant, horse and carriage rides, bike and boat hire). We were on the Disney Quick Service Dining plan and were able to exchange meal credits for any three snack items at French Quarter. This was useful to us as we used more snacks (drinks, ice cream, beignets etc.) than actual meals. Our room was spotless and we were very pleased with the Mousekeeping. We had a few towel animals and our housekeeper left us a birthday card signed by Mickey and Minnie for my son's birthday. All of the staff was very helpful and pleasant and there were lots of acitivites for the children; marshmallow roasting around the fire, games around the pool, an outdoor cinema each evening etc. My only criticism would be the number of motorised buggies the staff used to drive around in. They had loud petrol engines and we saw them everywhere we went. This was quite irritating at 7:00am or while trying to enjoy an evening stroll along the river. This is not something I remember seeing at Animal Kingdom Lodge. On balance though, I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and due to the central location of both the rooms and the hotel itself to the parks and downtown Disney, I think I would go as far as saying that I actually prefer this hotel over Animal Kingdom Lodge. The theming obviously isn't in the same league, but this really is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this resort”
Reviews.Author: LoveJBM
Reviews.Content: First I should state that I have not drank the Disney Kool-aid. I beleive that Disney, in general, is vastly over-priced for the quality, and that is across the board. Negatives about the resort: the room decor was too over-the-top for me with dark wood furniture, gold colored walls, and purple and gold bedspreads. I know that the theme is Mardi Gras, but a more relaxing decor would have been appreciated after the constant over-stimulation of the DIsney Parks. The bathroom was very small. Every night we ran out of hot water for the shower. There were very few hangers -definitely bring some of your own if you want to hang more than a few items. Really, very limited drawer space, too. A small, gaudy room for the price that you pay. The decor looks better in my photos than it did to my live eye. Positives: The beds were reasonably comfortable. Not the best that I've slept on, but no one awoke with a backache. The kids loved the swimming pool and the costumed greeters who stood by the lobby door each day, wishing them a magical day and handing out trinkets. The resort grounds, unlike the room, had a calming effect with its wide, cobblestone walkways, a small river meandering through, and the clop-clop-clop of horses hooves as a horse drawn carriage circled the property. The hot tub was actually hot. The cleaning woman/man always arranged the children's stuffed animals into a cute display, which the thrilled the children. In the moderate price range, I'm not sure that you can do better than this resort at Disney. I would, however, try to get a recently updated room. I am under the impression that they are somewhat more tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: gottaGetawayMaryland
Reviews.Content: Once of Disney's moderate resorts, and on e of thier smallest resorts. Not too far to walk to your room. Beautiful landscapes. Cool looking pool and water slide. Great New Orleans theme. Excellent food at the food court! All staff very nice and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfey.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Remodeled Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cas250
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans - French Quarter rooms have been renovated since my last visit. The new decor is lovely with purple and yellow base colors. I like staying here because the property is small. I found the rooms to be relatively quiet; the window air-conditioning unit helped to drown out sound. The bed was very comfortable. I also like the amenities offered: alarm clock, small refrigerator in the room, privacy curtain between the room and the bathroom area, small safe in the wall with detachable key, quality TV, laundry facilities (washer and dryer both take 30 minutes and cost $2 each, detergent costs $1), clothesline in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Small size makes for a GREAT resort!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh R
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to take my son to California this year, but instead invited my parents with us for a trip to WDW. I was originally going to book All Star Sports, but my parents are both big people in their 50's, and a lot of walking is not up their alley. They came with us, but mostly just enjoyed the resort, downtown Disney, and dining. The room was on the small size considering the price, but this is Disney! Also, our room only had 2 double beds, however while we were there they were in the middle of refurbishing the resort, and I understand they were installing two queen size beds in each room. We loved the fact that we could take a boat to Downtown Disney or Port Orleans Riverside. Also, we could use the pool at Riverside, which we did one day.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaK1039
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a stay at French Quarter. We've stayed at a Disney value resort once and we've stayed at 3 other moderate resorts. Last Dec we stayed at Yacht Club. For the two of us, this resort was "just right". Some of the other moderate resorts are just too spread out and the multiple bus stop thing gets old. Our king room was very clean and the package we got through AAA with WDW made are stay so enjoyable and carefree. The staff was efficient. The only things we did not like were the pillows and the mattress. For our taste, the pillows were too firm and the mattress too soft, but that's just our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter-best resort for a young couple who likes a mix of fun and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Letsdoyourhair
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Disney to surprise my boyfriend for his birthday-mid 20s age-was not looking for the cheesy Disney themed resort, but was pleased when we arrived and how quaint, clean, and "magical" it is. We stayed at building 6 which is right across from the large pool, walking from the food court(which offers great meals that are not overpriced and yummy!) and right on the river for us to head over to Downtown! The rooms are very clean, comfortable beds and nice tv. Staff is great, always cleaning, painting and willing to do anything they can to assist. Walking around at night and seeing the cobblestone streets fill with horse carriages and beautiful lights-all very romantic and beautiful. Transportation is on point-you dont worry about a thing very easy to get around. Would for sure stay again and can't wait to head back. Disney does it right! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about”
Reviews.Author: PutMeThere
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 5 day stay here & have nothing bad to say at all about the French Quarter. Everything from start to finish was fantastic & had no problems at all. Our 5 & 7 yr olds LOVED the pool with the slide & the activities that the pool attendant had. Am thinking kids any older may find the slide to be too conservative. But good luck getting any kid at or younger to get off. Service for everything had no flaws & always with a smile. The French Quarter is much quieter than Riverside & smaller. The bus stop was very convenient for buildings 4 & 5 & never overly crowded. Buses seemed to stop frequently. Probably every 20 to 30 minutes for any one destination. The rooms are spacious, clean, updated, & quiet for the most part. Only complaint for the whole trip was the frequent sound of other rooms toilets being flushed but never heard any other sounds from the other rooms. Only had one meal at the counter service. A dinner which was very good. Much better than the typical Disney counter service. Walked down (10 minutes) to Riverside to have a dining dinner at their restaurant & it was outstanding. French Quarter has convenient water taxi transportation to Riverside & Downtown & worked nicely. Although one gentlemen I sat with said he waited 45 minutes for it to arrive at the resort. Sign says everything 20 minutes it should be there. Not sure what happened for him. If another reviewer has nothing good to say about the French Quarter, I believe they're somebody that can never be pleased cause this location was perfect for our family & will always make it our home away from home. Enjoy! You can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkvintagerose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort between 25th September and 4th October 2011, this was the second time on Port Orleans property although last time we stayed at Riverside back in 2009. I prefered this hotel as it was alot smaller and everything was within walking distance and after a busy day at the park it was nice to come back to somewhere quiet. We stayed in building 4 which was right next to the food court - perfect distance and i would recommened requesting this building. The food court is nice, breakfast offered many choices including the Mickey waffle and really yummy chocolate chip pancakes!! the beignets were AMAZING ( bascially like a fried doughnut) wish i had tried them earlier in my holiday. The gift shop is good for snacks and bits and pieces but i would just nip to downtown disney for gifts. Didnt use the pool but looked lovely and never over crowded. Had no problems with buses, epcot was probably the longest wait on the way back and not many of the buses went to riverside first. I would recommended going to other resort hotels for lunch or dinner too as you can use the dining plan there! We went to Camp Fort Wilderness and did the smores and met chip and dale, well worth a visit!! (8 dollars for marshmallows, graham crackers and 2 chocolate bar) rooms were also very clean and maid left us couple of towel animals. Cant wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic family hotel”
Reviews.Author: planetScotland
Reviews.Content: just back from a 2week stay at port orleans french quarter with my partner and a 4&3yr old. this is the first time we have done a disney only holiday and we got the free dining package so it made good sense. the room was better than i expected for a moderate hotel.good beds.large toilet area with a great shower and full size bath.everything was very clean and new looking.housekeeping wasn't the best but no big deal. the size of the hotel is great if you have small kids as very compact so not far from room to bus stop/pool or the cafe area as there is enough walking for them in the parks. we only used the quick serve restaurant for breakfast so cant comment on the food but all the staff were so friendly and helpful explaining how the disney plan worked. my kids loved the man who stood out at the front door giving out coins and necklaces he was very friendly as was all the staff we met in the resort. the pool area was good always plenty going on for kids,mine loved the slide.you can also borrow the life jackets for the length of your stay if you don't have your own(saves room in suitcase) we never had any problem with buses ,always came within 20min at the most.The boats going to downtown are great nice relaxing 20min journey down river. we had an amazing holiday and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic first stay on a Disney property”
Reviews.Author: JDBGreenwood_IN
Reviews.Content: Delighted with our stay at Disney's Port Orleans FrenchQuarter. Staff was friendly and helpful and all was clean and well maintained. Transportation everywhere was fantastic... Boat to Downtown Disney, buses to and from theme parks and airport were very convenient. Poolside activities were fun and well staffed. I imagine the time of year and week (Mid-Oct, Mon-Fri) didn't hurt any but I, my daughter and 5 year old granddaughter enjoyed every minute. Nice restaurant w/ good food choices. Easy walk to Port Orleans Riverside with more leisure activities. We had signed up for (KidCamp-type) Pirate Adventure Thurs AM, but it was cancelled due to lack of participation. Would have appreciated other organized child activities on down days to give us adults time out. We were situated in a room overlooking the river which was quiet, clean and comfortable with every amenity we needed. Minor setbacks included room lighting with two blaring lights over each bed and another ceiling light, any one which by itself illuminated the room to the max. Smaller, directional lights for reading late while the rest of the family sleeps would have been good-- take a small reading light and/or night light if you fit this scenario. Also, TV wasn't the greatest with fitful remote and volumn seeming to blare w/ Disney channels and needing a boost w/ regular TV, and a challenge to use (like the lights) late or early while some of us slept. Also, good toilets w/ good flush, but we could hear toilets flush in rooms adjacent all night/morning. How to stifle the noise of a flushing toilet? No other noise issues. All in all, I loved this hotel and would probably stay here again if/when we return to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, all round great hotel”
Reviews.Author: elleHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 10 nights from the 3rd October. Our 5th visit to Orlando but 1st time in a Disney hotel. As said before, it's all been refurbished to a high standard and the grounds are beautiful and so well kept. The room was cleaned every day and towels replaced plus new soaps and shampoo/ conditioner left each day of our stay. These were Mickey themed and we took them home for the kids, all 10 sets! We were left both hard and soft pillows so as we could choose. The room had a coffee maker which could also heat water if you wanted tea. You can collect tea bags from the dining room and they leave you plenty of coffee each day. There is a fridge in the room and a washing line over the bath to hang your wet swim wear etc. Air con is also a heater which you can set to be as hot or cold as you like. We had 2 large double beds and a separate bathroom and vanity area. The up dated photos were exactly what we got. We tipped the maid 4 dollars a day and she seemed really pleased and she made us a few towel art designs on our bed. Our room was on the 3rd floor in building 2, facing the gardens with a fountain. It was so quiet and convenient for the pool, shop, reception, dining area, laundry, bus stop and boat launch to Riverside and Downtown Disney. We had no car as we were just doing the Disney parks this time. The buses were usually every 20 mins and sometimes you had to stand. The boats were a lovely way to travel if going to Downtown Disney, such a pretty trip and a nice alternative from always being on a bus. The river really sets this resort apart from some of the others. We visited many of the other Disney hotels and thought the grounds, boat rides, serpent themed pool, friendliness of staff and newly decorated hotel, meant the French Quarter came out on top for us. Because of it's reasonably small size, everything is close enough to get to quickly but including Riverside, the resort is spacious and gives you another feel if you take a nice walk over there along the river...the best of both worlds. We had the free quick service dining plan which worked out great for us. We didn't want to make reservations for dining 6 months before we went on the restaurant dining so we were happy to eat when and where we liked. Be sure to look on the many websites which tell you the best places to use your credits and learn about the snacks you can choose. You can choose the most expensive meals and desserts from anywhere and snack credits can be used on almost any item under 4 dollars, so we used them for breakfasts. There are places which serve salads, pasta, and mashed potato and veg meals if you don't want to live on burger and chips all the time. I spent an hour or so before going to check out all the tips on using the quick service plan to our best advantage and wrote a few things down...it paid off. Our only small complaint was that the breakfast room could get very full at peak times and it was hard to find a table. Sometimes, when you did eventually get one, it would not be cleaned. The staff all worked hard but could not always keep up. One or two of them liked to talk to everyone rather than wipe the tables but that meant that they made you feel very welcome. A refillable resort mug was given to us on our dining plan to use whilst at the hotel and you could fill it as many times as you liked with hot and cold soft drinks. If you are not on the dining plan, you get disposable cups left in your room which you can use to help yourself to the same drinks in the dining room. No one seems to mind this as it's the only way to get a drink unless you buy the bottled ones. They even supply you with the cup tops by the drinks machines. Try the hot chocolate, it's so creamy! If staying in Disney parks, you don't need a car. We had the magical express to and from the airport which was great. There were plenty of Taxis in the car park always but our rep told us they were expensive. The pool was open until 12.00am and in the day time there were 3 lifeguards in attendance. There were always plenty of sun beds and a bar. Laundry room was next to the pool area and a wash cost 2 dollars, so did a tumble dry. At certain times there was entertainment for the kids at the pool and marshmallow and film evenings by building 5. Always playing was the music from the Orleans area. I'm going on a bit now, so will end here. I will answer anyone's questions if I can, if you need further help with anything. Just to say, I would love to go there again and thought that with the free meals, it made a very good value trip.

Reviews.Title: “October Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alana F
Reviews.Content: We just completed our 3 night stay here & loved it. The hotel is clean & the staff is very informational & friendly. The rooms were large enough for our family of 4 & were clean & well maintained. I like that there are different transportation options to Downtown Disney as well. The only downsides was: There is only 1 bus stop on the entire hotel grounds, which is at the front of the hotel. We’ve previously stayed @ Port Orleans Riverside & they have 4 stops. Also, we stayed in a “Riverview” room. This had a beautiful view of the river, BUT it also meant that every time a boat passed by, you could hear the boat engine & the boat horn!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to book our next trip!”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 daughters ages 10 and 12 stayed at French Quarter from September 17 to the 23rd. We absolutely loved this hotel! The pool was great, even my husband and I enjoyed the sea serpent slide. There was a DJ with games and prizes each day, which was great for kids of all ages. The staff was friendly and helpful, our girls loved the little bear made from towels our housekeeper left one day. Oh, and the buses were pretty painless, I too was worried by some of the reviews, but we always had pretty quick travel to and from parks. We hope to book a trip for my husband's big 50 in a little over 2 years and will definitely be booking the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great escape!”
Reviews.Author: lppenny23
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Disney resort and I loved it! Great room, beautiful grounds and we loved the riverboat to downtown Disney! Everyone there was so nice... And the bartender wanted to see our pictures from splash mountain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: indyoes
Reviews.Content: This Disney resort hotel was nicer than my expectations. It's not the cheapest but not the most expensive. We had never been to Disney before. This resort is clean, comfortable and has everything you need. Great pool. The kids and the adults in our group were all happy. There is one dining option on this property, so you'll need to travel to other Disney spots if you want finer dining. One bonus about this hotel is that you can get to a lot of other Disney locations by taking the pontoon boat instead of the bus -- an extra treat for the kids and the adults. Although we had a slight hiccup with the reservation process, they made it right. And, the housekeeping staff really outdid themselves with the stuffed animal arrangements, etc. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a life time! First stay at Disney.”
Reviews.Author: SarahDHallam
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at POFQ from the 25th of August - 8th of September. When we arrived we were taken aback at how beautiful and quaint the resort was! Our Room was in building one which is a two miniute from reception but so close to the boat dock, that takes you to downtown Disney. We much prefered to take the boat. I was so pleased to see that we had been given a corner room! I would recomend that anyone planning to stay here to request one, it made the room bright and spacious with a table and chairs in the corner. You could tell it had been referbished recently. The two beds were huge and one of the comfyiest beds i have ever slept on. The bathroom and sink area was very good, with a his and hers sink there was no crowding and the shower was just what you needed at a very long day. Mousekeeping was brilliant and cleaned our room very well, she even made a towl animal with mardi gra beads when she saw all my birthday cards. We recommend tipping at least a $1 per person when you get your room cleaned or have fresh towels. A few times it wasn't necessary for our room to be cleaned or have fresh towels so we did choose to put the do not disturb sign in the key slot. The buses are brilliant, they do the job that there to do. A couple of times we were waiting a good while. Coming back from Hollywood Studios late one night we waited about 30 minutes which is long enough especially when humid. We witnessed twice that night people in electric chairs going straight to the front of the que and as there party can get on with them, the people waiting at the front were getting very angry, especially when 9 people got on with their family member. It seemed no buses were coming and children were falling asleep on there parents. Leaving that little bit earlier would shorten the wait and avoid the long ques. After a long day just hope that the bus stops at FQ first because it takes another 10 miniutes to go around the four stops at Riverside which can be very tedious. On our trip we had the quick service dining plan, which was great value for money you could go the parks and not spend any money on drinks and food and with the prices they charge you save an absolute fortune. It took a little getting used to the point system but you pick it up. However the food offered at some of the parks and at POFQ was extremely limiting, this would seem to contradict some of the reveiwes on here, but i only eat fish and the amount of meat on the menu there in my opinion is ridiculous. Even my other half who could eat meat all day was fed up by a couple of days in. At POFQ for breakfast i lived on a bagel and a milkshake. They offered the french toast, (with icing sugar - weird) bacon and/or sausages scrambled eggs with cheese etc. At some of the parks we walked around for ages looking for something that i could eat, for example at Hollywood Studios the only thing was a vegatable sanwhich that wasn't very appetising at all i ended up chucking it away. There was a lovely looking sandwhich and cake shop near Mickeys hat that didnt even have a vegetarian option! All meat. Some days i just ate salad bowls, a few times the lack of food made me so close to tears! When i found a Subway i was so excited to have fresh salad rather than something out a bag. The Parks are amazing great for all ages. The rides and characters are the best and live up to Disneys name. A few tips we have would be for anyone who is from the UK is to plan your first few days very well, and use the jet lag to your advantage we did our early access to Harry Potter (Virgin deal) on our second day becuase you have to be up very early. NB. Harry Potter at Universal is amazing. Choose the frozen butterbeer. Being up early is great for this however depending on how bad you suffer from jet lag, like me you wont be able to make it to any fireworks or late extra magic hours the first couple of nights. Overall Port Orleans Fench Quater was really good, and well worth the value for a moderate resort, givng you something different from the hustle and bustle of the parks, whilst keeping the disney magic. I would definately recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stop at a disney hotel. Best holiday of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Amy H
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Property is not spread out like alot of the others, so you don't have to walk far to buses or food. Rooms recently re-done and have been upgraded to queen size beds. Boat available to take you to Downtown Disney if you want a relaxing ride. Friendly staff. Kids loved the pool. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay At Disney”
Reviews.Author: HSH041
Reviews.Content: This is approximately the 4th time we've stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter. We've stayed in all level of Disney hotels (deluxe to value) and this is one of our favorites. The hotel is clean and nicely appointed. Parking is easy and free (which you don't find much in Orlando anymore). Food court has wonderful Orleans style options. Pool is huge and has a great dragon slide. A small play area has been redone and offers the little ones something else to do. The walkways are set up like the streets of New Orleans and you don't have to worry about traffic. Port Orleans offers boat rides to Downtown Disney and the ride is very enjoyable. We can't wait to o back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical vacation”
Reviews.Author: DonkArizona
Reviews.Content: Disney World resort choice for our family. Check in was very fast and received the room we requested. The Meals were quick service but that saved time and no reservations needed. Has a nice game room for the kids and a very nice gift shop. Pool was not crowded but the hot tub was fairly full of people soaking there feet after a long day at the parks. Did laundry that is next to the pool so that was convenient to swim while the clothes were getting washed. Very friendly staff and service. We stayed here instead of Riverside since this was recently renovated. Rooms were not large but roomy enough for our family of 4. Rooms have a nice size refrigerator, iron and board, separate vanity area with double sinks, which worked out great with plenty of mirror space. We had a corner room and it was very quiet. Bus service to the parks worked out very well since this resort gets picked up before Riverside and had plenty of room to sit down. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from beginning to end !”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 20th August to 3rd September 2011.This was our 3rd stay at the French Quarter.We have visited a few hotels but this one is by far the best.It was quiet and qaint.The hotel grounds are lovely and everywhere is so clean and picturesque. We were in building 7 but even this was only a couple of minutes walk to the food court.The transport to the parks is amazing.Don't go anywhere else !

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, quiet hotel, would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: lauren s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I was a bit worried about the buses after reading some bad reviews but we didn’t have to wait long at the resort. The longest wait was coming home from Epcot late one night. But we could have caught the Riverside bus and decided to wait it out instead. The rooms were very clean. Mousekeeping even made us a cute little bee towel animal. The food in the food court is a bit gross – mainly because the main options are meatball subs, pizza, hamburgers and fries or with pasta salad on the side. I felt a bit sick after the four days we stayed! The Mickey Waffles were pretty cute. The boat to Downtown Disney was nice. It really sets this hotel apart. The pool area was very busy despite it being after 10! This was a bit weird. But the spa was closed so that might have been why! We went for a swim while waiting for our laundry it's a good plan as they are right next to each other! The only downside was the air con – it was either freezing or off and then too hot! But that could just be personal preference! We did ask for a cab to be arranged for an early morning trip to the airport (our flight was at 7 so too early to catch the magic express!). The front desk just said to ask in the morning. This was a bit odd. We had a cab pretty quickly the next morning but it meant we had to be ready 15 minutes early just to allow for waiting time. Other than that the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, comfortable rooms, great pool area, good size!”
Reviews.Author: zanlk001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon Sept 16-19th 2011. The resort was a good size (not too big) the staff were extremely attentive, helpful & super friendly. Our room was well-appointed, clean & tidy and a good size. We ordered room service one night that was well-priced & arrived fast & was hot! It was great to catch a ferry to the downtown disney area & the ferry-driver was lovely. The pool area was great (designed for families) & we spent a few nights in their hot tub. Its nice & quite after busy days at the parks. Concierge staff were always fast & careful when they helped us with our suitcases. The only disappointing part of it is the lack of healthier food options & variety in their food court. We had a caricature portrait doe of us by one of the artist in the foyer which we loved and was a great experience. I'd recommend this resort to both couples & families. We'll probably stay here next time we come back to Disneyworld. Laura & Grant, Adelaide, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Already looking to return to his hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinda-Mark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Wine and Dine 1/2 Marathon based on the prior reviews and we received a hotel that exceeded our expectations for the value. Our room was in building 1 and was lovely. Doors shut quitely and the only noisy area is the pool which was not that bad at all. The pool was never crowded. Everyone was helpful and pleasant. Magic Shuttle worked flawlessly both directions. Room was clean and I love how they have the bathroom set up with lots of counterspace while keeping the sink area clean (sounds odd, I know, but came in very handy). Our maid service was great, but our friends had a slightly less friendly maid then we did. My one and only complaint for this hotel is the size of the restaurant - they need a larger seating area for breakfast. We had such a lovely experience I'm almost hesitant to try another Disney resort!

Reviews.Title: “The new rooms & staff are better than the Grand Floridan! This hotel is a must stay if your going to Walt Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The new beds were great. Its a short bus ride to all the parks. The boat ride to downtown Disney is so nice. Make sure you go over to Riverside to see Bob Jackson he's very funny. Love the food court. It was so nice to come back to such a peace full place after a full day at the parks. I was sad to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Moderate”
Reviews.Author: joobilance
Reviews.Content: My family of five (two adults and three children) love this moderate resort. It is a bit spread out, but the grounds are so pretty and lush, it's hard to mind the walk anywhere. Parking is great, also. We have never had an issue finding a spot close to our building since it's never been overcrowded on our visits (and there have been many as Florida residents). Rooms have recently been renovated so that all include two queens instead of two doubles. Also, even though the rooms aren't really intended for parties larger than 4 (unless the 5th party is a baby in a crib), my three kids (8, 6, and 3) have been able to fit comfortably in one bed. As part of the renovations, the bathrooms have been updated so that bath/toilet/sinks are in one room with a door (pre-reno, the sinks were separated from the sleeping area by a curtain with the toilet/tub in a separate room w/door). Not sure I care for that since, with 5 people, I liked having access to the sinks at all times. There is a playground for small children, but it was closed our last visit. The pool is great - kids love the dragon slide (and there is a smaller pool for toddlers). So much nicer than the pool at Port Orleans Riverside! And the dragon slide actually "breaks" up the large pool up so there are several areas that seem more secluded and private. The food court is nice - great muffaletta - but try to get there for breakfast before 9, or you might have an issue getting a table - especially if you are bigger than a party of 4. Also, be sure to get the refillable mug if you love fountain drinks. They are a bit pricey, but if you're staying more than a couple of days, it's worth it since food and drinks are expensive (like all wdw resorts). I also have to mention the boat that runs to and from Downtown Disney. What a treat! So relaxing and it alleviates the stress of competing for parking. Runs late, too (I believe until 11 pm). Be forewarned, though, it's a relaxing (read: slow) ride and may not be the best choice if you are with young, tired, fussy children that you want to get back to the hotel quickly. Unfortunately, we have outgrown this resort because the kids require much more space, but for parties of 2 or three (or larger, with connecting rooms) it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bonny L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 21 to the 28th and loved every minute of it. Everyone here was very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping was excellent and our granddaughter loved the towel animal which were left for us each day. The resort was nice and quiet which we really enjoyed after a busy day at the parks. The pool was fantastic and very kid friendly. The grounds are well keeped and beautiful. We would definately recommend this resort to everyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: SGH2011
Reviews.Content: Although the exterior of the hotel is very nice and well maintained, our room was not. The moment we walked inside, the room smelled like an old cigarette tray. It was obvious some air freshner was used to get rid of the smell but it did not help at all. The drain in the bathtub was also clogged so we showered in water up to our ankles. Overall, we would have preferred to stay somewhere else on the Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: ippyi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay. Miss the bed so much! Also the great, clean room and lovely staff. Thank you to Disney they are still the best for sevice and magic. Still need to improve the food but thats nothing new. For lunch try the Ritze golfclub open 11 to 4pm you can not beat the service and food (best burger in town) The new Hilton and bonnet creek for breakfast (pancakes) are lovely and the Peabody for takeaway sandwich , coffee and cake. For that special evening meal of steak go to the Capital Grill.(love the service and food)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracy S
Reviews.Content: We have been here 2 other times in the past 10 years and stayed at the value resorts both those times. This was a great resort to choose as an upgrade. The resort itself is not large so the waits for the buses and the amount of people in the buses was much more pleasant than those at the value resorts. It is a much closer ride to the parks also. The rooms are larger than those of the value resorts and the grounds are beautiful. I know most people think they will not be in the room that much so it does not matter. I am here to say just the improvement in the wait lines/time for the buses and the amount of people put on the buses does make a difference. I really liked the fact that although we were in one of the buildings furthest away, the walk is pleasant and short. We have a 5 year old and this helped greatly. Next trip we plan to stay at this resort again. I will say since it is a smaller resort the food selection was more limited, but we could have gone over to the adjacent "Riverside" resort and ate, but we never had the energy after park hopping all day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for longer stays with kids IMO”
Reviews.Author: loveshak22
Reviews.Content: It was a tough call for me on whether to rate this property average or very good. There were a lot of great things about the hotel. 1. It is a pretty hotel and very clean. 2. The hotel is efficient (asked for things like a rollaway and extra towels and shampoo and it was there immediately). 3. The food court has a decent amount of choices and the pricing isn't horrible, given that it's Disney. 4. There seemed to be a lot of neat resort activities. We were only there 3 days and they were long days so we didn't participate in the activities but I saw them doing a movie on the lawn where people had blankets and towels and they were showing the movie The Incredibles. Also, one day it rained and I noticed in the food court there were staff playing with kids and they had a box of games labeled "Rainy Day." 5. The rooms were nice and pretty big. We had 2 queens plus there was a rollaway and my dad's electric scooter. So it was tight with all of that in there but not really bad. I was happy with the size. There was also a complimentary fridge and the rollaway was free. What I didn't love about the hotel were more personal preferences, not anything about the hotel itself so that's why I ended up going with the "very good." The hotel was pretty spread out so it required a lot of walking. I was with a disabled parent though so it probably affected me more so than it would others. We forgot to tell the AAA lady to book a handicapped room or one that was closer to the buses/food and when we got there they didn't have any handicapped rooms or any rooms closer to the front so we ended up in building 6. I think buildings 5 and 4 are closer to the buses/food depending on the side of the building you are on. Also, it was still pretty hot in Florida when we were there so I prefer a hotel where everything is inside one central building. At POFQ the rooms open directly to the outside. So in the rain or heat it can be a pain walking to where you want to go. One thing that was annoying is that you could hear the toilet flushing from the room above you. Thankfully it didn't happen often but you'd be trying to sleep at 11:30 and hear a loud "kkkuuuushhhh" of the toilet above you. Once I fell asleep it wasn't loud enough to wake me up but it was a little annoying trying to go to sleep. I wouldn't say it was bad enough to keep me from staying here if I wanted to. Overall, if you are going to Disney with a family and for a longer trip I think this would be a great choice given all the activities and the moderate price. However, if I were a couple going for 3-4 days I'd probably pay the extra and stay at a deluxe resort. My husband and I went and stayed at Wilderness Lodge and I believe it's the cheapest of the deluxe options so I'd price compare the two and if it wasn't much more I'd get a deluxe. We didn't spend anytime in the pool but I heard it's supposed to be cool.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Moderate Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KVic
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research (mostly by reviews on Trip Advisor) on which resort to stay at on the Disney property and the Port Orleans French Quarter came out on top by far. All reviews were so great, I was 100% confident in my final decision to book at this location. After 11 days at this resort, I can honestly say it didn’t disappoint. Recently renovated rooms which all include a mini fridge, flat screen and two new queen beds made this a very comfortable stay. The property itself is a wonderful and relaxing respite after a long day of park hopping – you can take an evening walk along the Sasagoula Riverfront, or enjoy a stroll through the beautifully landscaped pedestrian streets that join each of the seven buildings. The Sasagoula Floatworks Factory has decent enough meals and selection for a quick service location with Beignets made fresh to order all day. We rented a car and didn’t have to rely on the bus transportation, however we did hear from others that it was a frequent and reliable way to get to each of the theme parks. I can’t say enough wonderful things about the Port Orleans French Quarter. If you have the means to stay at a moderate resort and are looking for a relatively low-key resort on Disney Property that isn’t dripping with the Disney theme, characters and music like the value resorts, then I recommend the Port Orleans French Quarter as your #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “a fine time”
Reviews.Author: fooofighter
Reviews.Content: We spent a Friday and Saturday night here in early September and it was not crowded at all especially by Disney standards. The place is absolutely immaculate and kind of peacful. The pool is plenty big and you can expect it to look just like the photos on there website. Room was clean and comfortable in every way. There were 4 of us me being the only male.So the curtain that seperated the vanity area by the bathroom came in handy. The little water taxi boat that takes you to Downtown Disney is a pleasent trip which takes around 15 minutes give or take and the bus that picks you up and takes you to any of the parks was well air conditioned,clean and extremely convenient. Plus you won't have to pay the $14 for parking if you drive to the parks. The food court type restaurant had the basic menu found at all the disney resorts with a few cajun dishes thrown in and was decent. We did not have the opportunity to eat at any of the other restaurants that were there so I can't comment on them. I would definately stay here again and highly recommend it with or without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday, well worth going”
Reviews.Author: KellyLuke
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend visited POFQ in aug 11. It was an amazing holiday and well worth the trip. POFQ was a really nice resort to stay at, it was very peaceful and many beautiful sights to see. The pros for staying at this resort is it is not too disney (especially after a day at the parks) and not many kids about, it has easy access to downtown disney with either a short boat ride away or you can take the bus. The bus service around the disney parks was helpful and we never had to wait longer than 10mins at a time. The room that we stayed in were very clean and just what we were expecting, we were not let down on this. There are a few cons to the resort, the food in the food court is very repetitive, however you can take a short walk to Riverside and they have a lot more choice. Only other problem is if you are going to non-disney parks you have to make your own way there, you can get a taxi or a shuttle but you will need to ask you holiday rep for details as the concierge at the hotel weren't very helpful on this. Other than that it was a amazing holiday, we would definetly go bk again but in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Full hotel, yet a quiet & peaceful stay!”
Reviews.Author: PaineSense77
Reviews.Content: My wife & I visited POR-FQ in November 2010 during the middle of renovations to outlying buildings. If we hadn't seen the renovations w/our own eyes, we would've never known they were taking place! This is easily the most peaceful moderate resort @ WDW! At the time of our stay, the basic meal plan was included in several packages offered by Disney, so the resort was full (We do the wine & dine plan. Well worth the $ if you love wine). However, the resort is laid out so well, noise wasn't just minimal, it was non-existent. We arrived via the Disney Magical Express, a lifesaver on stress & a money saver on a rental or towncar! Hotel staff was extremely friendly, helpful, & always willing to go the extra mile for a friendly guest! Disney has also expanded their snacks to include a breakfast order of 3 beignets, a must-have @ POR's food court! Buses arrived in a timely & efficient manner, never keeping guests waiting longer than 10 minutes for a destination. The water taxi was a 15 minute leisurely, relaxing ride to Downtown Disney & passes the newly-renovated Treehouse Villas! At night, the grounds were lit w/period gas lamps that gave the grounds sufficient yet romantic mood lighting & just a simple stroll around the resort was a magical experience! The poolside bar was well-stocked w/several beers & concoctions native to the New Orleans region, as well as numerous domestic & foreign choices & a full bar. We failed to visit the indoor bar, we didn't vacation in Florida to sit inside! Our trip lasted 6 days, & we could've stayed a week longer. This resort will give you a well_deserved rest, but keeps you only a short ride away from all the action you can handle! I hope all find this review somewhat useful, & I wish all many happy & safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer030
Reviews.Content: After many years of staying at Disney Value resorts it has been a nice change to try out the moderate resorts. While I've enjoyed the other moderates the French Quarter was the last for me to check out and I absolutely adored it. This will be my new Disney "home!" The grounds and theming was so quaint and relaxed that I could easily spend a day or two at the hotel and skip the parks. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is relaxing and like an attraction in itself. Nothing in the resort is more than a five minute walk from the bus stop, food court or pool. And the walk to the Riverside is a very nice 10-15 minute stroll along the river. The food court seemed small at first glance, but we never had trouble getting a seat or had to wait long for food. I admit I did like the menu at the Riverside slightly better, but I had a great Shrimp Po' Boy and Muffalata at the French Quarter. Loved my stay here so much....can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet resort”
Reviews.Author: farcus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ for one week beginning Sept. 23. This was our fourth stay on Disney property. The grounds are maintained well and had a friendly staff. The pool was always crowded every single afternoon. We spent a lot of time under the covered umbrellas at Mardi Grogs in the afternoons. The dining area at the hotel was ok but didn't have much of a selection. The newly updated rooms were nice but you could hear people flushing toilets, showering, etc in the adjoining rooms. The size of the resort is nice because its so small. Bus service was pretty good. The only time that it gets bothersome is when they go and pickup at Riverside which has four different bus stops. I am so glad we didnt book Riverside!! If we stay at a moderate again, we would definitely go to French Quarter. We have stayed at the Poly and the Wilderness in the past. It's hard to beat the deluxe hotels but if money is an issue then you can't go wrong with FQ.

Reviews.Title: “great base, great price”
Reviews.Author: tillypoppy
Reviews.Content: overdue review, sorry. Stayed here sept/oct 10 and hotel is worth staying at again. The location was great. Easy to get to every disney attraction- and the fact the parking was free(due to stayin in a disney hotel saved loads) Our room was on a corner on the first floor, which was not the best location as it felt like you could never have the window open, due to people walkin past. But the room itself had no faults, 2 large beds, clean, good air con, good tv and a fridge. what more is needed? We never ate at the hotel as the buffet seemed very school like and the food didnt seem great, but that was to look at. It may of tasted lovely. Didnt use the swimming pool but did go to the riverside and hire a boat for the afternoon, this was a great laugh and as I remember not such a bad price. Hotel was a great based and had everything we needed- would go again tomorrow. I have already recommended to family, Who have now been and also enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Resort accomodation - Great for families, couples may find it awkward”
Reviews.Author: Judge404
Reviews.Content: This is text book resort accommodation. Loads of rooms scattered over a large plot with buffet style canteen restaurant that serves reasonably priced food that does the job. There is a constant flow of entertainment on the go for kids and families ranging from pool games to movies on common grass patches at night. Avoid rooms that face the pool or an entertainment area! Service is very responsive, but lacks the personal touch - to be expected. Access to Disney World is direct from bus stops at the resort, and there are plenty of cabs on site. Good value for those simply wanting to crash while exploring the parks on the trot, or for families with kids. Couples who want to relax at a hotel should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A solid Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: hierbamty
Reviews.Content: French Quarter, with its recently updated rooms, was a pleasant stay while visiting WDW. We opted for a king room and were placed in building 6. As this is a relatively small resort, this is within minutes to the front desk, gift shop, quick service food area. If one is using a car to navigate, you will find also parking easily accessible. As our room was on the 3rd floor facing the river, a tranquil atmosphere pervaded throughout our stay. The only limiting factor is that there is no table service available but as we take our 'sit down' meals in the parks, this was a minor issue and we knew this prior to our vacation. The one biggest plus was the overall courtesy and friendliness of every cast member encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great, moderately priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans from 9/10/11 - 9/20/11. We were in building 2. Our room was nice, not over-the-top, but really nice. We loved the pool area and the atmosphere in "The Quarter". They have nighly marshmallow roasts and outdoor movies in the courtyard. They have boat access to Downtown Disney, which was really nice. The restaurant was good food, it wasn't table service, but we didn't need or care about that. We could get in, get fed and get out and the food was good. We loved that we could use the ameneties as their sister resort, The Riverside, which is a nice stroll down the river. They have a bigger restaurant and store and their pool is a nice switch from the pool at the French Quarter, although we loved that pool too. We also really loved the bus service. Our resort was always the first bus stop so we got dropped off before anyone staying at the Riverside location - this makes a big difference when you've been at the park all day and just really need to get to a shower and a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Peaceful Moderate Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: uvahoo02
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at POFQ September 10 through 17. We were in building 4, room 4112. We used Disney's Magical Express to get from the airport to the resort. We love DME and had a great experience yet again. Prior to arriving, we completed online check in. When we got to POFQ, there was a line of maybe 4 people ahead of us (from our DME bus). We waited maybe 5 minutes before getting our packet and heading to our room. We checked in around 1030am and our room was ready for us. The resort is small, very clean, and very New Orleans. It didn't have a huge "Disney" feel to us. Last year we were WOW'ed by Animal Kingdom Lodge, but POFQ didn't really wow us. With that said, there was nothing wrong with this resort... it just wasn't overly Disney or as amazingly themed as AKL. The walkways around the resort are small versions of streets with street names, light posts, and sidewalks. It is very cute. There are courtyards between the buildings, one of which they show movies in the evening on a huge blow up screen. There are several fountains through out the resort, making it very peaceful. The pool was great. There is a nice water slide and lots of kids activities through out the afternoon. We never had any trouble finding chairs and there were always plenty of towels available. Our room was on a corner, close to the stairs and elevator. There was a crack around the door that allowed love bugs to enter our room- every time we walked in, we had to grab some tissues to get all of the bugs. The beds were comfortable but our pillows were really flat (I am sure they would have brought us more if we had asked, but we didn't). The room was very convenient to get to the bus in the morning, and the restaurant/lobby. The pool was not a far walk as the resort is pretty compact. We did not have any issues with noise (although, the toilets flushing are rather loud so we did hear them every once in a while- not a big deal though). There are double sinks with a nice shelf above the sink area for storage. The curtain separating the bathroom area from the bedroom was a nice touch for changing and getting ready. The bath tub also had a shelf for storage which was great for all of our toiletries. Water pressure was decent and we never had issues with water temperature. The safe is small, but great for travel documents, wallets, money, Kindle, etc. We left mousekeeping tips in little envelopes every day, but we did not receive any towel art after the day of our arrival (Mickey on the bed). There is a fridge in the room, great for water or snacks as needed. Bus service was great. We never waited more than 10 minutes at the resort. One morning a bus came full from POR guests but there was a second MK bus right behind it that was empty. One evening when we returned to Epcot from the resort, the bus stopped at all four POR stops after picking us up. Other than that one time, we did not share buses with POR at all. The counter/quick service restaurant had lots of options and HUGE portion sizes available. We enjoyed the freshly made beignets a couple times (Yum!) and refilled our water bottles multiple times a day. We ate lunch/dinner our last day and used up some extra snack credits on the rice crispy treats to bring home. The ice cream portions for a snack credit are huge. It was never overly crowded when we were there. One afternoon I used the laundry facilities- $2 for each wash and $2 for each dry. There are amble machines to use as well as detergent to buy if needed. The wash and dry take 30 minutes each. We took the boat to Downtown Disney one evening. It was nice to have another option other than buses. It took about 15 mins each way and the wait was only a few minutes. I wish we had more time to take the boat to DTD more than once. Overall, we had a really nice stay at POFQ. For a moderate resort, it was a great choice for us. If we had not stayed at AKL last year, we probably would have loved it even more. POFQ is a relatively quiet, small, peaceful resort that is a nice break from the busy parks. For small children, I think I would rather stay at POP (or the new Art of Animation) to get the Disney characters and theme more abundantly. We felt like AKL was more "home" to us and never got that feel about POFQ unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “First visit and very happy”
Reviews.Author: Noel E
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Disney World. Travelling from Australia my wife, daughter and myself chose the Port Orleans French Qtr because it was close to Downtown and because it was a moderate resort. We were roomed in block 2 facing the pool. Awesome room because we were so close to the pool, the boat, the bus stop and the restaurant. The room was a good size and always cleaned immaculately. The safe was ridiculously small. It stored our passports and not much else. The resort was amazingly quiet also. We were debating whether to stay at Riverside because it offers the bike hire, fishing etc but we would do a park all day and if home early enough would catch a boat to downtown. Very rarely did we get home before 9:30pm. Time enough for a swim, a spa and a not much else. We would recommend the resort to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ally83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second half of our Orlando holiday (we stayed in the holiday inn express for the first half. See seperate review) Arriving we were transported to another world! The reception area is fantastic and the staff are so helpful. We were in block 2 our room looked over a small building by the pool, not that we spent anytime at all looking out of the window! The building was great as it was right next to the pool, foodcourt and boat to downtown, although still very quiet. We had the quick service dining plan included in our room rate. It was an amazing amount of food! We read reviews saying don't waste it on breakfast but honestly we ate breakfast at the hotel and lunch at a park and were full for the rest of the day. We had 16 snack credits to spend at the end of the stay which we sepnt at goofys. The only tiny downside was the gap under the door to outside meant you could hear children running up and down the balcony but this was normally first thing in the morning when you are either up early for the parks, or so tired you would sleep through. The toilets are quite loud but obvioulsy the people in the rooms around you don't spend the whole day flushing the loo. The rooms are so nice you hardly notice anyway. There was quite a lot of food to choose from and way more than any Biritsh person would be used to. You get a free cup with the plan where you can get any drink at the hotel except English tea (you can take get hot water) and milk. You can use a snack credit for milk or buy it in the shop. There is quite a lot of healthy food included in the dining plan, like salad with shrimp or chicken. We always felt like we were treated like royality staying at the port orleans. Nothing was too much trouble and we never waited more than 5/10 mins for the bus. The worst que was after hollywood studios closed and this was about 20 minutes. The best bit of the hotel was the boat to downtown we loved it and never took the bus. We were so relaxed and loved every single minute. I swore we wouldn't go back until we had kids but I can't say i'm not tempted to go again before.

Reviews.Title: “Lush surroundings great resort”
Reviews.Author: klick4nick
Reviews.Content: The are a number of Disney Resorts, however this was our second visit. The rooms in French Quarter have been subject to a refurb and were first rate. New showers, tiling and sanitary ware, plus large flat screen HD TV all adds up to make your stay comfortable. We went slightly later this year, 26.08. to 09.09 so the theme parks were a little quieter, however you are in to the 'Hurricane Season' so to say there was the odd shower is a bit of an understatement. However once the rain passed, the sun broke through and you were in the late 80 to early 90's degrees. There was a lot more on for kids this time, and a film show every evening in the main square area, including some Disney classics. The staff as always were superb, I had a little difficulty with the rental car (Alamo). Where their customer care was lacking considerably, resort staff more than compensated for this. One staff member even leant me their personal mobile phone to make a lengthy call to the recovery service. This was our 4th visit, the previous 3 we rented from Dollar and suffice to say that is the one and only time Alamo gets my $$$'s. This is in NO WAY a reflection on WDW and Port Orleans F/Quarter. We would highly recommend this resort in the blink of an eye. The boat trips to Down Town Disney are a particular favourite, and the Disney buses a little more frequent and less full at French Quarter (there are 4 stops at Riverside and it is a bigger resort). Can't wait to cross the pond again, and POFQ will be in the running for a 3rd visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Anne3411
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful quick visit -- from Magic Express to the friendliness of Port Orleans French Quarter. The renovated rooms are very nice with comfortable beds and a nice size room. Restaurant packed at breakfast and very difficult to find seats, but not too bad the rest of the day. Food was good. We were in building 1 and it wasn't much of a walk anywhere in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family lodging on Disney”
Reviews.Author: cynmorgan
Reviews.Content: The location on the water is great and it was fun taking the water taxi to and from Downtown Disney. Going to the parks was easy via the Disney bus system -- much better than parking in the lot. The hotel is designed well and very pretty. Our kids (17 and 13) had a great time at the pool & spa. The selection of food (fast & not inexpensive) was not the greatest but the bar was great. The four of us were comfortable in our room because of the extras -- shower & WC separate from the double sinks with a curtain that created a private dressing area. Of course, the staff was friendly and the common areas were beautiful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carlita08
Reviews.Content: Great place. Everything clean and great staff. Amparo took care of our room and let us a Mickey & Minnie made in towel. Recommend this hotel 100% most of all for families. Even though I travel only with my husband still was a quiet place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AFwife87
Reviews.Content: Have visited Disney a dozen times and this was our first stay at Port Orleans. Room was clean. Housekeeping was hit or miss. They always made beds, but that's really all we could count on. Several times we had to call for hand towels or wash cloths that were not left. Here's a huge tip...the internet connection by the table that is supposed to the desk/computer station/dinner table was disconnected when the hotel was renovated. After wasting an hour on the phone with tech support, we finally got a person who said "pull the end table away from the wall...there should be a connection there..."sure enough, the working internet connection is behind the bedside table between the two beds. Speaking of the renovation, all the rooms in French Quarter have been renovated and have queen beds instead of double...very nice! Food court was ok...lots of quick, mostly fried foods. My daughter loved the cheese Danish. Pool bar was hit or miss if it was open or not. Transportation to the other parks was by bus (very slow) or water taxi (even slower) so we were driving to the parks by day 4...saved loads of time. We got a great deal on this hotel, so for what we paid, we got a good deal. I would stay here again if I found a really screaming deal, but it would have to be a really really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place at Disney”
Reviews.Author: TiPi35
Reviews.Content: Simple but really well located. Arriving at 7am in the morning, the front desk had a room available. This was really nice. The room is simple but OK for Disney at Disneyworld. Breakfast can be taken in a food court very good. Open late for a late drink. This is also a bar for cocktail (Cocktail are not really good honestly, Take a beer). Only Drawback : Disney Bus. This is so long, this is such a mess from the morning until night. We were so tired about the waiting time that we finally took our car.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaj43
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay, Although it is a Disney hotel, it's not in your face so you get a good "Disney rest bite" after long days in the park! Beautiful surroundings, highly recommend the boat trip to Downtown Disney, Thanks to Norma who cleaned our room everyday to a high standard also she left a little animal made out of towels most days for our 7 year old daughter. very clean, very friendly, very accessible to all the parks, well done Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Really Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Stormy53
Reviews.Content: My son and his family, including my two granddaughters ages 6 and 17 months, stayed at this hotel for 6 nights - July 21st to July 27th. It was spotless and the staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The pool, open 24 hours with its wonderful dragon slide (only open 'til 11 PM), was a huge plus. We used it almost every night no matter how late we got in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!! Would recommend to everyone as a great place to stay for your Disney Adventure.”
Reviews.Author: OZ_Family_Abroad
Reviews.Content: It was quite daunting when you look at ALL the accommodation options that are on offer at Disney World to pick where to stay, but I must say this place was Fantastic in every way you could think of. From the moment we checked in, the staff where so friendly and helpful and our room was nice and close to the restaurant which was very handy as we had two small children with us it was not too far to walk down to breakfast each morning and then to the free shuttle bus to travel to the individual parks. We had a lovely room up on the 2nd floor with a beautiful view out through the abundant trees that line the property. The room was a good size with 2 queens size beds and bathroom with Bath/shower and toilet and a separate change room area that could be closed off with a curtain. We would come back to our cleaned room each day to find the towels creatively folded into different animals or Mickey shapes, which the children thought was fantastic. The resort itself has a nice feel walking around it with lots of gardens and trees and a really good sized swimming pool which was open until midnight, which did come in handy after coming back to the hotel after a long hot day out at Disney to be able to go for a swim at 11pm before bed ... The resort also was located on the riverbank which had free shuttle boats that took you to the downtown Disney area too, which was a great trip to take in itself especially at night !! There was also a children's playground (which looked like it was getting an upgrade as we were leaving) and huge coin operated laundry room too, which was also very handy when travelling with children and open 24 hours with your room key. There was also a horse drawn carriage that we saw on our first night roaming the cobble stoned streets around the resort, but were back too late every other night to actually go for a ride ourselves. When we booked this trip we also took up the Quick Service Meal Plan Option of "2 x Quick Service Meals (which included drinks) and 2 x Snacks" per person per day. This was the best thing we had done as it meant that each day when we left the resort all we needed to take was our room key card, which was our Disney Parks ticket and our meal plan vouchers all rolled into one. This was so much easier than carrying cash around and when we bought anything from the parks or downtown disney then we just had it sent back to our hotel to save us from carrying it around with us all day and night. Also when buying food/drinks/snacks etc for a family much better not to need any cash, just show them your card and the items would come off your total meals allocation. I think this is an excellent idea from Disney and really just makes your trip that much easier and hassle free, as was the "Photo Pass" which is a registered card which you show to the disney photographers every time you get your photo taken by any one of them at any one of the parks and ALL the photos are available in one place to order online prints or downloads or make books or other products you are able to get made up after your trip and sent to you. The restaurant was casual quick service style but was varied and also was open until midnight. Also it had a drink station for self serve soft drinks, tea and coffee etc. This is a great hotel with great service and will really make a stress free Disney holiday complete. Travelling with small children (5yrs and 3 yrs) this was a perfect hotel to ensure we had a perfect stress free 8 day trip to Disney World. I can't recommend this place enough !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of Our WDW Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KendallsMom
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 (me, hubby, 3 daughters aged 22m, 4 and 7). Just returned from a 6 night stay Sept 7-13. Every cast member was so nice and polite (like all of Disney) and were willing to help w/ anything you needed. Resort was not crowded at all first couple of days, but got pretty busy around the 11th and 12th. Resort - We loved this resort! Thanks goodness for this place or our vacation would have been a total wash! It was 'smaller' than other Disney resorts, but not small compared to other places we have stayed. We stayed in buidling 7 which is considered 'North Quarter' and is closest to Port Orleans Riverside. Rooms - They felt a little small, but were the size of a basic hotel room. We got a corner room which was great because we had 2 windows which made the room seem bigger, and we had a view of the river, although we only booked a standard. The little bathroom/vanity area was nice as well. Lots of storage for our stuff.
