We never found the pack'n'play bed for the little one, but since the beds are Queen size we had plenty of room for all 3 girls in one bed. We only used Mousekeeping a few times, but they were great when we did. Food - We ate at the Quick Service dining room mostly for breakfast and a few times for lunch. Food is ok, not bad, not good. It does get a little old after a while. We were on the dining plan, but if you are not, you can look to spend about $10 per person per meal and about $3 per drink or dessert. Pool - My kids LOVED the pool and pool slide. They also loved the pool activities they put on daily. My 4 year old actually won 2 games! :) She was excited to get to pick a prize from the treasure chest. The pool changes depths throughout so I would suggest a life vest for any kids that are not great swimmers. You can get them free of charge to keep for your entire stay from Jackson store. It was great my 4 year old that is not a swimmer could go down the slide and follow her older sister around the pool the without problems! Pirate Cruise - My older 2 girls did a Pirate Bayou Adverture cruise and had a lot of fun. It is a 2 hour boat ride (leaves from PO Riverside next door) that takes the kids on a treasure hunt. It is about $35 a kid, they get little a snack, trinkets and toys (pirate related of course) along the way! Buses - Bus transportation is very easy to understand and clearly posted. Buses came often, we never waited longer than 15 min for one. Once on them is another story and probably could be another review. Some are fast and crowded trips, some are long and not so crowded, some have lots of stops along the way and some head straight to the destination. Folding and unfolding a loaded stroller is a pain after the 4th or 5th time! Boats - There is a dock at POFQ that goes to POR and to DTD. You could easily walk to POR from POFQ, but is fun to ride the boat as well! The trip to DTD would have to be by bus or by boat, and since there is so much bus riding already to the parks, boat was much more fun! We never waited more than 10 min for a boat to pick us up! I also liked that you didn't have to fold up your stroller on the boat! POR - Although this review is about POFQ, we visited POR a few times so felt like I should mention it in my review as well. My kids loved the POR pool and slide. They thought it was even better than the POFQ pool and slide. Also, the Quick Service dining room had so much more to pick from than the POFQ QS dining room. I would suggest going over there for if you don't mind the walk (about 10 min at most). We also ate at Boatwrights one night, I didn't care for the food much and the service was the slowest of any place we ate on our entire vacation, but of course the staff was very nice! The POR also had a lot more stuff to do it seemed, marina activiities, horse carriage rides, etc. It's very pretty to pull into the marina at night on the boat. Would I stay here again? If it was relocated to a beach somewhere...ABSOLUTELY! :)

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Port Orlean's”
Reviews.Author: mickeygoofyfan
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The staff was wonderful, very attentive and interactive. We arrived early and were allowed to check in early. Luggage service was helpful. They took care of everything for us. They even set up our return flight and printed our boarding passes to make life simpler.. The rooms were nice too. Our's was a little small but our things fit fine. The beds were comfy. Matresses firm and soft and big fluffy pillows. The swimming pool was perfect for families. Not too deep but large enough to have plenty of room to move around. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for your Disney visit regardless of a bigger budget!”
Reviews.Author: RangerDanger78
Reviews.Content: We have been to WDW over 15 times through the years and stayed at a wide variety of Disney properties and we feel that this one wins the prize even if you have more money to spend on a luxury resort. Though we love all the Deluxe resorts, particularly Animal Kingdom Lodge, I have to say that "Lobby's are free"...go and enjoy! But, staying in a room there can mean a very long walk down corridors when you just wanted to get coffee! No, for shear all-points perfection it's French Quarter for us. Here's why: -Size of Resort: I believe this has to be the smallest Disney resort and therefore no matter where your room is located you will not have a long walk to the food court or to transportation! Although, because we faced a parking lot one time, we do pay for a water view. -Size of Room: Moderate in price, but spacious room size due to the fact that it was built a while ago. -Location in "the World": Can get to any of the parks rather quickly and boating to Downtown Disney is our check-in day activity (must eat at Earl of Sandwich, Ice Cream at Ghiridelli's). We also hit DD after check-out leaving our car at French Quarter...one last peaceful boat ride to say good-bye! Not Crowded: Unlike it's sister resort, "Riverside", the food court will not be noisy and crowded. Also, and this is BIG...you get picked up first at the Bus Depot before heading to Riverside (sometimes you have your own bus and skip Riverside all together). This means you have a seat! Also, coming back from the parks, French Quarter gets dropped off first. Atmosphere: Though you can easily stroll or boat to Riverside's amenities, the French Quarter pool and all facilities, including the food court are great. Yet, because it's not massive, there remains a quiet neighborhood atmosphere with a great jazz pianist in the lobby many nights. So, regardless of our budget, we choose to stay at French Quarter hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: MicknAnnDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at a few wdw resorts including animal kingdom lodge,all have been great but the location of French quarter is perfect. It is also a very compact resort offering everything you would need for a great stay.very friendly and amenable staff throughout the resort,as is normal for Disney.would be happy to use this resort again and would recommend to anyone.if you can get the Disney dining plan again this is first class and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - a best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2011 for a mother/daughter trip. When we arrived we were upgraded to a River View and were thrilled to find out the renovations that were just completed included two queen beds (used to be double/double)! The room was very clean and our location was great. There was no noise heard from our neighbors The one "negative" was that in a moderate resort they give you bar soap and not the shower gel. The grounds are well maintained and the pool is great for kids of all ages. My 11 year old wore out the slide which is themed after a dragon. The food court was OUTSTANDING. We LOVED the salads where you chose what you wanted on it. Everything we had was extremely fresh and delicious. Of course you cannot stay at the French Quarter and NOT have beingets. You definitely want to have them when they're hot and fresh. There is only one bus stop at the French Quarter - which is a unique feature of this resort comparing it to the other moderates which have multiple stops. We will definitely be back to the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “WDW - Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: vacawithfamily
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the French Quarter several times. Family enjoys the relative compactness of this resort compared to other WDW hotel complexes. Recently all the rooms have been updated to have queen beds instead of the previous double beds. All rooms have mini-fridges, hair dryers, double sinks, and a wall safe. Buses to the WDW parks all run from one central location and sometimes are shared with Port Orleans Riverside. In my experience the buses always pick-up and drop off at French Quarter first when shared. Nice quiet resort with lovely grounds.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy53449
Reviews.Content: My husband & I go on a Disney World vacation every year. You can't beat Port Orleans for the price. The food court is great! We eat breakfast and our late night snack at the food court. We had the freshly made to order Beigaets daily. The rooms are not far from the bus stations to take you to all the parks (you know how tierd you are at the end of day). We never waited longer than 10 minutes for a bus. It was our third time at this resort and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “It was not what I expected from Disney”
Reviews.Author: janefox2
Reviews.Content: We spent 6-nights at the Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter and it was really just mediocre. We requested adjoining rooms because grandma joined us on this trip. We were told because of this request we were limited to a certain number of rooms. The rooms we got were in the last building and they were average. Unfortunately they gave us rooms right outside of construction that was being done on the facade of the building. So when we arrived back at our rooms in the afternoons wiped out from the excursion of the day we got to listen to saws and hammering right outside our door for the next hour or so. They did compensate us by taking $80 of our total bill, but they should not have put anyone those rooms in the first place. A few other irritations - 1. the internet is not wireless, is very slow and is expensive 2. Unless we tipped the maid daily, we did not get great room cleaning services 3. The hotel staff were hit or miss. Some had very over-the-top Disney attitudes and some were clearly not interested in being there. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful resort but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: katelyn321
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in row that we stayed at this resort. It is small, convenient and beautiful. The front desk staff was nice enough during check in but when my mother became ill and we needed to stay an extra few days it was a nightmare. They made us check out, check back in 4 hours later and switch rooms. Fortunately, after an hour of begging, they finally agreed to move us from one room to the next simultaneously. The newly remodeled rooms are great. The queen size beds were SO comfortable!! We left housekeeping a tip each day and they did "okay" service. There was one day when we came back to our room at 4:20 and it still was not serviced. This was a little upsettign just because we were going to rest for a couple hours before heading out for the evening so then we neede to decide if we wanted our room cleaned or to rest. You should not have to make such decisions so late in the day :-) On our last day there, we went to the food court for breakfast. I went back to the room to gather the last of our things and our room key did not work (they had already deactivated it even though we hadn't checked out yet). It was 8:15 am and I used the house phone to call the front desk. They said they would send someone. Almost TWO hours and FIVE phone calls later two front desk employees (women) finally showed up to let us in. This took a about 10 seconds! I was FURIOUS that it took so long to get help when I explained on my very first phone call that I was in a huge hurry to get on the road to start our trip home. I seen the two female CM as they were making thier way to our room. They were walking very slow and talking like they had no place to be. They were each carrying bags where they had purchased something from the gift shop. To make it worse, they took the long way around to get to our room so they could use the elevator instead of climbing up the ONE flight of stairs to get to our room. The lack of urgency and "not caring" cost me two hours of my morning. This was absolutely unneccessary.

Reviews.Title: “Oo-la-la! Dreams really do come true in New Orleans, THANKS evening star!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastBrookses
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the pleasure of staying in building 7 of the French Quarter during our last trip to the happiest place on earth. As usual, Disney's magical express made the trip from MCO to our hotel relaxing and stress free. Once at the door of the resort we were welcomed by the doormen and directed to the concierge desk. As we used Disney's online check-in option we bypassed the lines and were handed our folder with all of our details in it including our room location. While we had initially requested building 4, we were given a room in building 7. At first we were disappointed that we were not able to be in the room requested, however we soon found out that building 7 was a blessing in disguise! With our room located where it was we were able to walk out our door and were steps from the bus stops. This meant that if the weather was less than agreeable we never had far to go. Every time we came back to the hotel the room was clean, the towels fresh, and the place looked great. While the room was a distance from the pool it acutally gave us a chance to dry off on the walk back after a good swim at the end of the day. The pool was huge with lots of seating areas around it and plenty of spaces to swim in. The pool was never crowded and the water slide (while small for an average slide) was just the right size and length for kids and adults alike. We are always looking forward to our next disney vacation and now will be looking forward to it even more knowing that when we go we will be staying once again at the French Quarter resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela Y
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to WDW, and this hotel was beautiful!!! I loved the quaintness of this resort. Everything was close, the pool was fantastic, the food was great, and our room was beautiful and very clean!!! The staff were very helpful, and courteous!! I loved it!!! If you get a chance to take such a great trip, this hotel is wonderful!!! The ferry to Downtown Disney and Epcot was also a special treat!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port orleans was ok”
Reviews.Author: wallyPhila.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with the french quarter, but i also wasn't displeased. it was in my opinion just ok, kinda bland. Our room was far from the food court, and pool, you may want to request a closer room. We were so bussy at the parks each day that we didnt even use the swimming pool. Food was what you'd expect at a disney resort. expensive but not ridiculous. you can save alot of money here by bringing food and drink. My wife had recomendations to purchase the plastic drink cups which you can than fill up for free at all disney resorts. They probably saved us some cash, but they leak, and are a hassel to carry arround all day. There is alot of traffic on the walk ways within the resort from golf cart driving employees. in my opinion they would benefit from "car pooling", or simply walking. I do recommend a walk to the neighboring port orleans to see a performance by the infamous Yeehaww bob. Fun for the familly. Rooms at the french quarter are fairly small, bathrooms are very small. there is a small mini fridge, but it's VERY small. television has only a couple stations (EsPN) and disney channel seems to be the main one. All things considered the place is ok, but there's alot of other places I'd like to stay before going back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Resort”
Reviews.Author: SeaSure
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our latest trip to Disney World. Each year we try to visit a different Disney Resort to make the trip unique from the years prior. Port Orleans consists of two sides; French Quarter which has a New Orleans Mardi Gras Theme and the Riverside, which has a southern mansion, Tom Sawyer feel to it. I've stayed at both. The French Quarter is about 1/3 the size of Riverside and makes everything rarely quick to get to....pool, dining, arcade, gift shop, nightly movies and bonfires. The rooms are newly renovated with very comfortable queen sized beds and nice linens. The norm for Disney is full size, so this is a nice perk. There is also flat screen tv, table & chairs, mini frig, coffee maker, iron/ironing board and hairdryer. You can stroll to Riverside in less than 5 minutes on a well lit path along the Sassagoula River. There is also a running path about 1 mile round trip. Boating service is available to Downtown Disney and a couple of the bordering resorts...relaxing, scenic and a nice alternative to taking the bus. Our 10 year old daughter enjoyed the sea monster slide at the pool and the daily pool side activites. (her Dad and I liked the pool side bar!) She also looked forward to seeing the doormen, Arneil and Santos for coins to toss in the lobby's fountain. My tip...don't waste your money purchasing the refillable souvenier cups for $14.95 each. The cleaning staff leaves plenty of Disney styrofoam cups in the room and there are lids to fit them at the beverage refill center. I really liked the smaller size of this resort and hope this review helps when you plan your next magical trip to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite Disney resorts!”
Reviews.Author: izsmom02
Reviews.Content: This stay was our second and it was as wonderful as the first. We think they have the best resort counter service at Disney - restaurant quality, and the beignets are the best we've ever had. Our son loves the pool. It's so relaxing to swim looking up at the open sky and the nearby lake, with boats passing by. I love even just walking around this resort - beautiful landscaping, fountains and music. We will definitely be back and would recommend this resort to everyone. Who doesn't love to relax in a beautiful place?!

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we chose Port Orleans, French Quarter; we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Raquel
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Aug 30-Sep 6, 2011. DH, DW, DD23, DS08. My 3rd time to WDW but first staying at a Disney Hotel. Chose French Quarter because of the reviews and was not disappointed. Warm welcoming atmosphere and all staff were friendly and accommodating. Pool area was great - they had games there for kids during the day - but we were at the parks so didn't take advantage of the great pool and slide. The quick service restaurant (cafeteria style) had a good variety with a Louisiana flair. We had the Disney Dining Plan (standard), which I strongly recommend. Food prices are not cheap anywhere at WDW, and the Dining Plan saves you about 40% and encourages you to eat well, because its already paid for and you have a sit-down (or buffet) meal every day. Note: Make your reservations well in advance for the popular restaurants. We waited until the weekend before the trip and ended up planning the days around the reservations times that were still available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - disney style!”
Reviews.Author: jes1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter over Thanksgiving. Check in was timely and we were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded (we didn't even have to ask) to a newly remodeled room in Building #7. We were the first family to stay in this room since the remodel. Biggest plus? the 2 queen size beds as opposed to the double beds found in most hotel rooms. As a family of 4, this was the best! Biggest downfall? after walking ALL day in Disney's amazing parks, walking to building #7 seemed like forever away. I believe all of the rooms have now been refurbished, so pick a building closer to the buses, cafe and especially if you purchase the drink mugs - nothing is worse than walking all that way for a drink that is gone before you even get back to your room. The pool and hot tub were nice - not spectacular - but nice. Besides, it's Disney and we spend most of our time at the parks. We can swim at home! We had fabulous service from the front desk and concierge - we had luggage that arrived from the airlines - completely destroyed - unusable for our trip home. Disney replaced our luggage, gave us fast passes because we had to take the time to solve this issue. One downfall - the 'check out' was an issue for us. We were told to be at the check out at a certain time, we arrived, the line was long, the staff was (new, I think) being trained and we ended up missing out bus to the airport. On Thanksgiving weekend, our concern was the security line being too long & us missing our flight. Again, the concierge to the rescue ... a cab was provided & paid for by Disney. Security was long but we made our flight. All in all, a great trip, thanks for another great Disney stay!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Disney in 28 years and pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Mert1108
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Disney resort. I was very happy as the room was clean and came equipped with a refrigerator and a coffeemaker. The best part of the dining hall was the breakfast offerings. I wasn't impressed with the supper selections. I had taken the walk up to Riverside and was glad we hadn't stayed there as the place looked humongous compared to French Quarter. It was also centrally located to the parks, Downtown Disney, and the waterparks. The Concierge service was very good as I had to ask directions to get to a couple of restaurants elsewhere on the property and they were able to add the Waterparks and more to our tickets. All in all, we were very happy with our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: katmomnewyork
Reviews.Content: the decor makes you feel that you are in new orleans during mardi gras....the room was spacious and clean...all amenities were very conveinient

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very nice, great pool and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Makemineadouble
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to WDW. I loved this hotel. Makes me want to see the real French Quarter in N.O. We had a room on the first level which was very convent to ge to the pool, restaurant and bus/boats. The room was adequate for two adults and two kids. I did the online check in and requested a first leve room near transportation and they gave me that when I checked in. The bathroom was huge. We loved going to the parks in the mornings, coming back after lunch for a swim and nap then going back around 6:00 when the heat wasn't so bad. We had a thunder storm one night and it was hot and lightening and rain. Heaven. Next time we go to WDW I will like to stay at another Disney property just to see what others are like but we loved this hotel. Staff was great and the restaurant was good and very reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: icm99
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, lovely clean rooms with excellent facilities and reasonably sized. The kids LOVED the pool, the mardi gras beads and the pool games. We loved the air con, the bus services to all the parks and the boat trips up the river. The staff were without exception, friendly and helpful. The only small grumble was the food. We had Disney Quick Service Meal Plans which for 2 weeks was hard going!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and going back”
Reviews.Author: Desiree c
Reviews.Content: Went with my mom and dad and loved it luv the atmosphere.Loved the pool and the slide. The service was awesome the staff was so friendly.The food was okay not much of a choice but still yummy.And the boat to Downtown Disney is quick,fun and dandy.Loved it and will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you want to stay on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: RJM1468
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and nice, seem to be recently re-done. Everyone was very nice and helpful around the hotel, and the N.O. theme was fun. Our kids loved the pool, wish we would have reserved more days just to play in it (and the pool bar was a nice touch for Dad). The best part if being on Disney property, i.e. free parking at all the Disney parks and locations, plus free transportation around the whole park. Boat ride to Downtown Disney was a real hit with the kids - not just a way to get from point A to point B. Food court is not bad - nothing special, but OK for a quick meal. Restaurant at Riverside was very good, just a little expensive (but hey, this is Disney, right). A real nice touch in the rooms was having the shower and toilet in one room with a door, and having the sink area separate, but also separated by a dark curtain from the bedroom. Allowed us to get ready for the next day after our kids went to bed in the main room. We reserved three rooms for our family trip and they got is all in a row, 2 with a door between them. We had a great time for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Another super week at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy121
Reviews.Content: Just finished a week-long stay at the French Quarter. Everything was wonderful. Had adjoining rooms with my inlaws and check in was easy and carefree. Good food options, great pool area, and nice atmosphere without the crowd of a value resort. Disney needs to offer WI-fi with their rooms. Enough money gets spent on property that it seems rather greedy to charge for internet use per d aywhen every other hotel or motel in the world offers it as an amenity for guests. Overall a wonderful resort that is perfect for the family.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite resort on Disney property so far!”
Reviews.Author: DianeFrederick_MD
Reviews.Content: I've tried all of the moderate resorts and a couple of the deluxes at Walt Disney World, and Port Orleans French Quarter is the winner so far (yes, even over the deluxes!). The room was your basic moderate room, and was comfortable. We stayed in building 5 and loved the proximity to the restaurant, pool, and boat launch, however the small size of this resort means there are no rooms very far away from things. I do hate having to walk miles around a resort after walking miles in the parks all day! The grounds and theming are lovely. We ate at the food court several times and the food was good. The boat transport to Downtown Disney was very convenient. Staff was so nice and accommodating. I guess the only drawback here was the lack of a sit-down restaurant, and the pool. It is a very cool looking pool, with a sea serpent slide, but geared towards younger kids. My 13 and 14 year olds found it a little young, but the pre-teen set will love it. We didn't use the park bus service, so can't rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DTG2010
Reviews.Content: We were quite surprised when we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 a.m. and our room was ready for us! My one problem with this checkin process it that I was told when I made the reservation that I couldn't request a fold-out bed until I checked in because it was first come/first serve. When we checked in, we were told that they don't allow fold out beds anymore because the hotel had recently been renovated. This just made our room a little crowded, but we managed. The rooms have recently been renovated and were lovely. We enjoyed walking the hotel grounds. Our room was conveniently located near the food court. At first I was concerned about this because I thought it would be noisy, but it wasn't at all. However, I would be concerned about staying near the pool. During the afternoons the music was extremely loud and might make it difficult for anyone returning to their room to put down the kids for a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic”
Reviews.Author: disneycaravanfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at this Disney property. It is very quiet and a much more realxed feel compared to our stays at other Disney properties. The restaurant food is nothing to get excited about, but with all the other dining options available at Disney this is not a big detractor for us. We will probably be back to this hotel on our future visits. After staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (Deluxe), Port Orleans French Quarter (Moderate), and Pop Century (Value), we fell that this is by far the best value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Yogaseeker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly remodeled, clean, and well maintained. The room was a good size, facing the nearby river. My request for a quiet, out of the way, room location was accommodated. It was actually peaceful which was a nice surprise since I was expecting to hear lots of families all around. The hotel is not too large, only three floors high, and separated into 7 buildings. I stayed in Building 7 which is the farthest you can get from the main lobby and pool areas (about 250-300 yards). The dining room is buffet style so there's no need to wait, tip, spend a long time getting a meal. The food was very good and reasonably priced. Transportation to the parks went smoothly and was fairly rapid in most cases.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort on Premises”
Reviews.Author: Jeva89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug 1-6 2011 . The rooms now have queen beds which made it even more special. When my husband and I and my 2x sons came back from the park the rooms were always clean and the AC was on for us as we return. The entertainment at the pools and the the arcade were my sons favorite part about the resort. My husband loved the fact that resort was not over crowded and it was nice and quiet at night. Can't wait to come back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean and Peaceful Environment”
Reviews.Author: R_S_T_Sivakumaran
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of a Disney Hotel. We have no complaint to make about our stay. Room was spacious (for 2+2) and clean. The surrounding areas were peaceful. The staff were courteous and very helpful. Breakfasts were not included as in many American Hotels. Since food were cheap outside it didn't bother us. For the visitors to the Disney Parks there are some benefits thrown in too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ricecakes87
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 2215 with my 2 grown daughters. Right by the pool, down 1 flight of steps to the boat dock. Boats run to Downtown Disney every 10 minutes or so, much nicer than the buses. Easy walk along the river to Riverside. It has several pools and eating places that French Quarter guests can use. Beignets are a fun snack served here just like the Princess and the Frog. Elevator was slow but steps were easy & quick.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED!!!”
Reviews.Author: joannelin137
Reviews.Content: This was our first to Disney World and it was AMAZING!!! Had no idea what hotel to choose - we were tossing up between 3 moderate resorts, French Quarter, Riverside and Caribbean Beach. In the end we made our decision based on size and location. The service was impeccable - the cast member that checked us in was just as excited as we were. Pointed out highlights, her personal favourites etc it was great! We had a bit of a fail with the Magic Your Way welcome pack, but they couldn't do enough to find a solution. The room was as you'd expect - tidy, spacious, not overly themed but really nice. It wasn't 5-star flashy but that's not what we were after. The beds were sooo amazingly comfortable! Housekeeping services were reliable - left us little animals made out of towels each day. POFQ is the smallest of the Disney hotels, located next to Riverside but it has it's dedicated bus services (some do loop to pick up/drop off at Riverside). They had their own stops at each park, and always had fewer people than Riverside, which has 4 different 'wings' each with its own stop. Our building was close to the bus stops and close to the food hall (but without the river view) - French Quarter doesn't have a table service restaurant, but to be honest, we did not miss it since we did most of our eating the parks! The ferry boat to Downtown was so handy and fun! The rest of the Disney transportation was reliable and relatively quick - never waited more than 15-20 minutes for transport anywhere, and it didn't seem to take more than 20ish minutes to get to any park. LOVE this hotel! If we visit again, will always choose French Quarter!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Renee123-13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 12-14. The staff was very friendly and helpful!! After we checked in,we went to our room.The room had not been cleaned yet,so we called the front desk.They told us to come back to the check-in.Oncer there,they moved us to a different room and apologized for any trouble.The room was clean and very nice! The breakfast was good,a little expensive,for what you end up getting,but what isn't expensive at Disney :-) Overall,it was a good experience.My daughter LOVED the pool.we will be back,to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites at Disneyworld!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle O
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVE French Quarter. We originally stayed here back in 2008 because our rooms were not what we had requested at Port Orleans Riverside. What a pleasant, fortunate mistake for our family! Riverside has become our favorite Disney "Moderate" Resort. The rooms now have two queens - a much needed improvement! The location is fantastic, the prices are perfect for our large family get-togethers (we often stay for 7-10 days and it's much more affordable than the next Disney "deluxe" tier). And of course, the kids all absolutely LOVE the pool area (one of the BEST in all of the World's resorts!) We all love the New Orleans theming, although I agree with most that the giant masks in the food court are rather scary. The alligators throughout the resort are so fun and our little ones love to see them on our way in and out of our rooms. French Quarter has a quaint, quiet, peaceful feel (compared to the hussle and bussle of Riverside). Although the food court is smaller than Riverside's - all you have to do is take the boat or walk for dinner there instead. We LOVE French Quarter and will continue to stay there each visit to the World! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Irish1964
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at WDW Port Orleans French Quarter August 4th to August 11th. We had a room in Bldg 4 on the third floor. The resort had just been refurbished this past spring and included upgraded beds from full to queen size. The rooms were clean and decorated nicely. The resort was great as well. From pool games for the kids to a movie on the courtyard. Other activities ( for an additional cost) included bike rentals & boat rentals. We did not use either as we preferred the pool for down time. The resort had a Bayou Pirate Adventure for kids age 5 to 12 for $36.00. Our 6 1/2 yr. old did it and had fun. It was 2 hrs. and gave us time to do some laundry and relax by the pool. The resort staff was very accommodating and gave first class service. My only complaint would be the food, we didn't feel there was enough of a selection and also did not have low fat options.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Disney Hotel going again in 2 weeks.”
Reviews.Author: Julie D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year, building 1, river view. It was brilliant, very tidy and clean, not too big and noisy just perfect for a family getaway. The lady who cleaned our room left towel animals every day and even used some of my sons toys to make little scenes. Very easy for buses and the boat to Downtown is excellent. We are going back to wdw this year and decided to stay here again, we did visit other hotels during our stay but found them just a bit big, especially for bus stops and food halls. We are from N. Ireland so not used to the sheer size of Disney, bigger than Belfast lol. If you have any doubts you needn't worry, we cant wait to see it renovated, and look forward to our holiday in a few weeks. lady who cleaned our room left towel animals every day and even used some of my sons toys to make little scenes, so hopefully we get her again.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter a Disney Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Massachusetts_Dad
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Disney’s POFQ. Overall this was a great place to stay. The rooms had recently been redone and the place was clean, staff were terrific and we couldn’t have been happier with our stay. The rooms were nice and well appointed. Fridge in room, Ice cold air, and strong water pressure. Ceiling fan in the room moved air and was also welcome. The pool area was clean and lots of fun. We also spent time at the pool at Riverside. The difference especially during hot summer days is that there is much more shade with trees at Riverside. The pool at POFQ remained very warm on the hottest of days and wasn’t as refreshing as Riverside. We also liked the boat shuttle to Downtown Disney and to Riverside. It added to the trip. Only a few negatives: Smoking is allowed in designated areas. One of these areas is on the corner near the food court door entrance. Each morning we walked through a cloud of smoke before breakfast. Yuck. I think Disney should move that spot away from the main food building. We also visited Riverside to use their pool, and for two meals there. Understandably as Riverside is larger, the food court had many more options on the menu. Overall the fare offered was tasty, but we would have liked some more healthy options, such as lowfat milk for coffee, lowfat yogurt, and more salad, fresh veggie selections. We found that the size of this resort was just right for us, not too big, with plenty to do. The kids pool party and activities were great, as were the ones at Riverside. We were sorry to have to leave and would certainly stay on property and at POFQ again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right size”
Reviews.Author: illinoistravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 1st week in Aug. Our party had 4 adults and 4 kids ages 7-11yrs. The rooms were decent for Disney. They were clean and were usually stocked w/ shampoo and coffee complimentary. Our maid was a little lazy though but as long as she emptied the garbage and gave us clean towels it was fine. The resort is smaller in size compared to the Riverside side. It reminded us of a quaint bayou hotel. Decorations were in the mardi gras theme not in Disney print. If you are looking for characters this is not the place. The food court (no restaurant) has good food. Not just burgers but chicken and ribs. The kids didnt have a problem finding something to eat. They have an option to purchase a reusable cup for unlimited refills during your stay which alot of people were doing. There is a boat that takes you to Riverside portion of grounds and also to Downtown Disney. Never a long wait or crowded. The buses were close but only one pick up and drop off point. But at the end of the night we were happy not to have to stop at multiple stops to get off. The grounds are not spread out very far so walking is minimal. Check in/out was easy. The kids loved the pool. It was open 24 hours. There was a slide but it was only opened when there were lifeguards on duty and we usually were at the park when that was. Would come back because we enjoyed the whole package.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: lilfoot2
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort! The newly redecorated rooms are comfortable with plenty of storage space. I love the queen beds and the privacy curtain separating the bathroom/sink area from the bedroom area. The pool is huge with an awesome slide. Hot tub area is private. The resort is small, no building is far from a parking lot, the bus station, food court, gift shop or pool area. And it's beautiful with the gardens and river, even in winter. Loved that you can take the boat to Downtown Disney! We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It And Will Be Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: Lapser
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter is very quaint for a disney resort, but you still had the disney experience but toned down a bit. Upsides- The Wonderful pool with the dragon tongue waterslide was a huge hit with the kids! They Also had mardi gras crocodile statues playing insturments everywhere which added a fun atmosphere. The rooms provided what we needed, a clean,updated enviroment with a orleans flair! The Lobby was great! As soon as you walked in they gave you mardi gras necklaces and coins to throw in the fountian.The Parks were all in a ten minute bus ride away maximum. Downsides- No Character breakfasts, which is a large part of disney meals,Only one eating area but this wasnt much of a problem because theres so many other restaraunts in disney.It Took a while to check in which can be irritating when you are tired and jetlag.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel65432123
Reviews.Content: On my most recent seven night visit to Walt Disney World I stayed three nights at Pop Century and four nights and Port Orleans: French Quarter for four nights. I was not impressed with French Quarter. It was not have any “Disney feel” yet it was not elegant like the deluxe hotels. Also, the food court was not that good. It was small, did not have much of a selection, and the cast members were not super friendly like they should be. Also, I was not impressed with the arcade or the pool. One nice thing is that the property was small and not a long walk from the far end of the property (building 1 where I stayed) and the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Pleasantly surprised! Great stay and great Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: Mec0415
Reviews.Content: We have been testing our way through the Disney hotels and love to stay on property for the convenience of the Disney Transportation and just plain fun of being close to all the action. A Disney cast member recommended the Port Orleans Resort- New Orleans for our weekend trip and it was fantastic. Super clean rooms, great decor and smaller resort made for a wonderful trip. Everything was nearby and transportation was great. The Pool was fun and close to all of the rooms- same with the main quick service restaurant. We had a great time listening to nightly music in the bar- the band was incredible and the whole resort had an intimate atmosphere. Would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eblis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter for our honeymoon in January 2011. What a great place for a honeymoon! The entire property is very small by Disney standards and that helps give the feeling of a quiet little hotel in the country. The grounds have plenty of tree-lined paths and walkways to stroll in the evenings. There is also a nice path along the river behind the hotel. Be sure to watch for river otters in the water and on the island across from the boat dock. The hotel offers a launch from the dock to Downtown Disney at 20-30 minute intervals. In the evenings, we found that a nice boat ride to Downtown Disney for dinner or drinks was a great way to relax before bed. The only food available at the hotel is the food court which isn't bad, but it isn't really ideal for a quiet meal at any time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Deserved”
Reviews.Author: Dinodan
Reviews.Content: My family had an excellent stay. Great customer service and the food was great. I would like to recognize Kim for helping our physically challenged son carry his dinner and provide the utensils for him. She did not have to do this for him, yet went out of her way to make him feel "normal." Thank you Kimberly and Port Orleans for an awesome vacation!

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, it's Disney!”
Reviews.Author: tansandy
Reviews.Content: We took our grandson for his first trip to Disney. I don't know who had more fun, him or us. Stayed at Port Orleans- French Quarter for 1 week. There is nothing that I would change about our room. The maid had towel art for our grandson everyday. Room was what you would come to expect from Disney, fantastic. If you do go, be sure to take advantage of the Disney Express from the airport. Didn't worry about our luggage from the time I checked it in at our airport, until it "magically" appeared in our room shortly after check in. The last time we stayed in a Disney hotel with our sons was 20 years ago. Then everything about the hotels were great. This time the same thing, Hotel was laid back, and we had a great river view from our room. Pool was great for our "afternoon break periods". Catching the boat at the hotel to go to Downtown Disney was very easy. All the people at the hotel were absolutely friendly and treated us like family. So what else can I say, it's Disney!!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Stay Onsite...Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Tay91
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 28th June - 12th July with my boyfriend and travelled from Manchester with Virgin. The hotel was amazing especially as everything within the hotel is so close due to the size of the resort. We had a courtyard view on the second floor and it was so peaceful. The rooms are a good size with 2 queen sized beds that are so comfy...slept very well. They also have a large flat screen TV with a good choice of channels.The rooms have also been recently refurbished so are clean and a good standard. The food court has a good selection of counter service style food, but we only ate here a few times due to the water taxi that could be caught to downtown disney where there is a great choice of places to eat. The water taxi departs every 20mins between 10am - 4pm then every 10 mins until around 11ish. A very relaxing ride that runs in good weather, (If it rains the water level in the river gets too high and the boats cannot get under the bridges safely) if not there is a bus that runs every half an hour or so. The buses to the parks come very frequently and in the morning there is usually a cast member around to help if you have any questions. So if you want to stay onsite in a nice hotel with a great pool I would highly recommend this hotel. We will return on our next trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Had some Problems, but Overall It was a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: writergirl28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter over July 30-Aug 1, 2011. We had some issues such as our fridge didn't work, our tub wouldn't drain, and our toilet had an issue. While these things were very annoying, the staff took care of everything right away. We discovered the fridge problem around midnight and someone brought us a new fridge within 15 minutes. The staff responded very quickly to the tub and toilet problems as well. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay there because the food in their cafeteria style restaurant was great and the pool was warm and very clean. They offer live entertainment on certain nights and their frozen drinks were great! The rooms were also very clean and our maid left us animals made out of towels, which was cool. The buses to the parks ran every 20 minutes (sometimes faster than that) and the Magical Express to the airport was great! We were able to check our luggage in right from the hotel and everything arrived smoothly. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: glk725
Reviews.Content: Staying at the PO couldn't have been any easier. Our room was lovely and extremely clean...and quiet. After a long day of going to parks, Downtown Disney, etc, it was nice to return to some peace and quiet. The absolute best part of the resort is the water taxi that takes you to Downtown Disney! This was awesome. Instead of waiting for a bus, you simply wait for 5-10 minutes and take the next boat ride to DD. It was a refreshing change from the hustle and bustle of the buses. As for the hotel itself, anything we asked for, was taken care of within the hour. We needed extra hangers, they were at our door in 10 minutes. Our room was excellent and the housekeeping was great. The grounds were so awesome, really nice and quiet. The only thing that was a little difficult was manuevering our way around for the first few days. We got a little lost trying to find our building, but with a little practice, we were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, not too crowded. very nice rooms. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: rah1075
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Port Orleans-FQ. Rooms were very nice. I liked the curtain divided the bathroom area. I stayed in the Wilderness Lodge about 15 years ago and LOVED it because of the ambiance and the restaurant in the building. Couldn't afford it so we went for the moderate resort and really liked this place. We had a crazy amount of rain so walking to the restaurant was sometimes a pain. The pool was really nice and my son loved the slide. If I had to do it again I would have asked to be in a room close to the cafe and the bus stop. Because we were walking there a lot. Food was good. We liked our refillable mugs. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Grounds, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaGuest
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the French Quarter. You have your own bus to and from attractions (no other hotel stops!) and you can also take the boat to Downtown Disney. Rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet. The pool are was nice and if you want to walk down to the Riverside pool, it's just a short walk on the jogging path.

Reviews.Title: “we found it very practical”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaToni
Reviews.Content: Being located on disney grounds made it easy to access disney parks without the hassel of parking, buses where clean, air conditioned and easily accessed. The buses took max. 30min. to parks. The hotel is family friendly and clean. The staff and evening entertainer was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mommy_needs_RandR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at French Quarter in late May/early June with our extended family (grandparents, cousins, etc.) Our travel agent recommended this hotel because it's more intimate in size (not as sprawling as other moderate Disney properties). We were very, very happy with our stay here. Our travel agent had recommended Bldg. 4, which is right by the food court , closest to the bus stop, and not far from the pool. We really enjoyed the convenience of the location. My husband bought one of the refillable cups and it was convenient to run into the food court to fill it up on the way to the pool or at night after the parks. The beignets for breakfast were yummy! We took the boat over to Riverside, and really enjoyed the peaceful boat ride. The pool water slide at Riverside was longer and IMO more fun than the serpent slide at French Quarter, but of course the kids all loved the Serpent Slide too. At FQ, we had a tough time finding an empty lounge chair over Memorial Day weekend- the pool was very busy. The atmosphere at FQ is a welcome change from the hustle and bustle of the parks. The tree-lined pathways felt very peaceful. I haven't stayed in any other Disney properties, but I don't think I need to since I know I want to return to French Quarter again next time!

Reviews.Title: “It's much nicer the Disney value resorts!”
Reviews.Author: Pretty29
Reviews.Content: My family and I stood at this hotel for a week and were very impressed with the rooms and area in general. The rooms are bigger then the disney value resorts and just slightly more. The hotel was close to all the parks and there is a water taxi that will take you to downtown disney (for free). It's a nice boat ride! Restaurant was never crowded. My kids loved the pool. It's big and there is a slide in it. My husband and I loved the jucuzzi. We're definitely coming back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney choice”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort, quiet getaway from the theme parks, nice grounds, great boat ride to downtown disney. Resort was a little dated but was being refurbed while we were there, nice choice for people wanting to get away from the noise and bustle of disney parks. Transportation is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, Like New, Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: 4everadisneylover
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated resort was the perfect size for a family with 3 small kids. The rooms were beautifully done and very clean. The beds were queens size, a nice change from doubles. It was also quite in the room, we never heard our neighbors. I was only in The Sassagoula food court once, but seems like it had plenty of room. We did go to the pool, which the kids couldn't get enough of. The serpent slide was small and calm enough to keep the little ones entertained. Unfortunately, the playground was under construction. There was only one bus stop, which was great because most of the time we went directly to our destination without having to make many stops in between. (Riverside is like that. We went through there once and it definitely took double the time.) The buses ran efficiently and weren't crowded. We never waited more than 15 minutes, which i believe is the appropriate amount of time Disney estimates. The staff were nice and very helpful. We had an issue with the mini fridge, and within 5 minutes, a staff member came to the room to check it out. I don't know how long it took to replace it, but by the time we got back to our room 4 hours later, the fridge was going and quite cold already. We had a great experience and would, without a doubt, stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, love boats to downtown disney”
Reviews.Author: sVT_traveler
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter: excellent stay. We stayed at the French Quarter from Jan. 24-29th of this year with our two-year old daughter. It was our first time staying at a moderate resort, we had always stayed at All Star/Pop Century or nearby non-WDW related hotels before and we have to say we were amazed at the difference it makes to stay at a moderate! The service was excellent and our rooms (we had a newly refurbished one) were beautiful. Extremely clean grounds and it captures the romance of New Orleans. We loved the fact that you could take a boat as transport to Downtown Disney which was so much more convenient and quick than the bus. When we did have to use buses (like for the Magic Kingdom), we never had to wait too long which was a huge plus with a toddler. The food was not anything to write home about but I think it is like that in the cafeteria setting of all the resorts. We loved the Scat Cats loung bar and the fact they had nice live music from Wed-Sat in the evening there. The pool and hot tub facilities were clean and convenient. French Quarter is a much quieter setting than Riverside but a short walk (or boat ride) to the area for walking and enjoying too. One small warning to those who stay there is that there is some construction going on but they really try to be courteous about the times that they are doing it. We were close to the contruction and it never once disturbed us or became too noisy in our room. They were testing the fire alarms 2 days of our stay from 11-2 but they gave us advanced warning the evening before via phone and we were out of our rooms while that was happening. They really try to not make it too bothersome but it is something you should know before you go there. Overall highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great trip”
Reviews.Author: lezlieb
Reviews.Content: We love the fact that this hotel has a boat to Downtown Disney. The room is small and a bit rundown and they need to renovate. The pool area is good (has a slide and water features that my daughter loved). The food court is very small and has a limited selection (compared to other resort food courts). The bus station is great. We hardly ever waited for a bus for longer than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Families with small kids - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: trippinmaman
Reviews.Content: It will not be kiddie chaos or baby madness, I promise! It will be good food (amazing beinets and jambalaya), serene pools (waterslides, baby pool et al) and proximity to everything! The access to Boatwrights and Ferry to downtown disney is a big plus as well. I would stay here again over any other mid range resort. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: klounsbe
Reviews.Content: We loved our 8 night stay at French Quarter. We were in building 2 with a river view and still very close to the pool. The room was very comfortable and clean and we never heard any noises to disturb our sleep. Our two boys, ages 9 and 10 enjoyed the pool, but we also appreciated the option to take a short walk along the river and enjoy Riversides pool as well. The riverboat to Downtown Disney was right at our door step and we never had to wait more than 10 min for a very relaxing boat ride. We had rented a car and never found the need to use it as busses to the parks ran very regulary and we never waited more than a few minutes to board. Maid service was very good and staff was always friendly. We bought the refillable mugs and found the food court to have several delicious selections. The pot roast, ribs and mashed potatoes were all very tasty. The friendly gentlemen at the door that greeted us each day and gave our kids a coin was a welcome sight. We had stayed at Pop Century in the past as just a place to sleep when we weren't at the parks. We will always stay at French Quarters going forward as it was less crowded, better pool with slide, better menu and all and all a resort that we looked forward to relaxing at rather than heading to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Going on 11”
Reviews.Author: NancyCook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the French Quarter 10 times! October 2011 will be our 11th. We have stayed at or toured most of the other Disney resorts but like the French Quarter the best. It is so great that there is boat service to Downtown Disney - what a wonderful perk! We use it all the time. The resort is clean and quiet and the staff is outstanding. We see the same staff members year after year and some of them even remember us! It doesn't get better than the French Quarter!!

Reviews.Title: “We love the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JulieCanton
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Disney for seven years 3 of these trips were spent at the French Quarter. This is where my kids request to stay. We have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean. The grounds are clean and well kept. The staff is always polite. The food hall is clean and that is no easy task when you see how many people are there at meal times. If you are trying to decide between this one and Riverside keep in mind the bus for these hotels picks up and drops off first at the French Quarter. You'll have a better chance of getting a seat. In the evening when you are tired you will be getting off first. Riverside has three stops. The French Quarter isn't as spread out as Riverside so the bus stop and food court are an easier walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “not a thing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: lenbo1
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip tp Disney, the port orleans was a great place to stay. Clean rooms, well kept grounds, excellent staff and ok food. The rooms had great showers with adjustable haeds and great water pressure, walls are nice and thick could not hear next rooms. staff was very frendly and helpful. Ate two breakfeast so so. If we go back to Disney would stay their in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: pinkmingos
Reviews.Content: First of all, we found nothing really wrong with the French Quarter, we just weren't overly impressed. The grounds are nice, but not nearly as well maintained as other Disney resorts. The room was adequate and clean enough to the eye, however the carpet was stained in many places. The room was also very dark and just a bit dingy, even though it was recently renovated. We stayed in a 1st floor room. The doors open up directly to the outside (more like a motel), and I did not like the fact that light came in from the outside. To me, that means that there is space where all sorts of things can crawl right in. Also, we found that the woman who helped us book reservations at the concierge was a bit rude- which is VERY un-Disney. We were trying to book a reservation for a restaurant (basically any) for that evening. I know you are supposed to make advanced reservations, but we find that limiting. She acted like we had made the most crazy request and said it would be a "long shot." I know they aren't supossed to give recommendations, but she really took that to a different level by not suggesting anything! When we found a place that had an open spot (it only took 2 tries, so not really a "long shot" by any means...), I asked if she knew if it would be a problem to split a meal (we hate getting two large meals that we can't eat and then just throwing it away, so we usually split and get dessert). Instead of just saying "yes" or "I'm sure that would be okay," she said, "What you do is your own business." Seriously? Walking away my husband said it was almost like she was discouraging us from eating anywhere in Disney. It just took away from the "magic" we had on the rest of the trip. Overall, this stay was just okay. We have stayed in much nicer places for the same or better price. If we return, we would probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “certainly will be back”
Reviews.Author: teedee14
Reviews.Content: We loved it from the minute we checked in. We had checked in online so we just walked up to the desk, showed ID and got our room key within seconds we were in our room and five minutes later our luggage showed up and we were in the pool. Everywhere was spotless, cast members very polite and friendly. The food court was a bit of a let down as the food was overpriced and in our opinion not good quality, although the cast members were again excellent. You can get a better quality meal at Downtown Disney (just a short boat ride away) for less. We spent $40 for two chicken sandwiches and a portion of chicken fingers, again not good quality. We brought cereal for breakfast and bought milk in Jackson Square resort store, saved a lot of money as we had breakfast the first day and threw it away and it cost $30 for two adults and one six yr old. The pool is open very late, well after midnight it is clean and well attended. Warm towels are abundant poolside. For the smokers, there are many smoking areas well away from everyone else. Back to the food court - the refillable mugs are good value for the coffee and perhaps the blue power drink, but the other drinks had a funny taste, maybe it was the lines, but given the attention to detail of the rest of the resort I doubt it. Overall, a very quiet and clean resort, outstanding cast members who work very hard, but have a plan B for the food, take the boat to Downtown, less expensive and excellent food. Rooms - spacious and spotless. More than enough towels, soap etc.. coffee maker, fridge, iron & board, hairdryer, safe. Beds very comfortable and adjustable temperature control. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: Diana129
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of tines since it's usually the cheapest of the moderate resorts it really relaxing and has this wonderful pine smell which we loved all over the property the only down side is like most of these resorts there alot of walking from the lobbay to your room and even the bus suttles to the park but you find that in just a about all of the disneys moderate resorts

Reviews.Title: “very nice middle of the range resort”
Reviews.Author: floridafun49
Reviews.Content: we are a family of 4 this is the second time we have stayed at port orleans (first time riverside alligator bayou) french quarter is more central, quieter,nicer pool,closer for the boat to downtown disney overall a nicer place to be than riverside,also getting the dining plan was well worth the money the food in boatwrights was very nice and more than any of us could manage, we left after 2 weeks with loads of food still on our plans unused!! getting the table service plan means we ate lunch or dinner at planet hollywood most nights and their food was delish.

Reviews.Title: “Magical getaway!”
Reviews.Author: mcool
Reviews.Content: We Spent 8 Days there in June. We had an incredible time. The rooms are very recently refurbished. Queen size Beds. New TV's, redone bathroom area. Felt like we were royalty. Beautiful views of the river. You can take boats to Riverside or Downtown Disney. Rooms always cleaned and the pool with the slide was a blast. This is a smaller resort than most. But it mean that you were close to everything. Only 2 things i would recommend for improvement. Is have the food court with a little bit larger menu. 2nd is the pillows in the rooms were terrible. Other than that still highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Nettiezs
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time staying at Port Orleans French Quarter. It is such a lovely place. The rooms are immaculate and spacious. The beds were so comfortable. It was renovated since our last stay and I wondered if it may have been changed too much but all the ambience was there and just perfect in every way. It was hard to leave after our five night stay and we wil hopefully return soon. Just to add to the charm and atmosphere at Disney: I had purchased a pin during my afternoon at Epcot and pinned it to my hip pack. When I returned to the hotel I discovered it had fallen off. I was disappointed and went to the gift shop to repurchase. While searching for my wallet I found the receipt to the pin. When I told them that I had just lost it at the park, they replaced it for me without my asking. That's classy! I love Disney!

Reviews.Title: “fun time, lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: raisinette
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the French Quarter side of Port Orleans resort. The first thing that came to my attention was the fact that this resort has been open for 20 years and it still is in amazing condition! The theming of the resort is wonderful and the decor is wonderful. The food court even has beignets! We had a basic room-but boy was it pristine! there was not a thing out of place, dirty or moldy! The washrooms were spacious and clean. the beds were comfortable. The landscaping was perfect. The only issue we had was the pool was closed temporarily for a "maintenance" issue. So, we just took the scenic path to the Riverside section and took a dip in the pool there. The resort also has a ferry boat taking you to Downtown Disney's Marketplace. We had dinner reservations at Wolfgang Pucks, so it was a bit of a trek. Just make sure to plan accordingly if you have reservations:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kristi5
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to disney included our three children and my parents. Upon being transferred to the hotel from the airport (via disney's magical express), we were greeted by an employee who walked up to my son and I as we were sitting on a bench in front of main entrance to hotel awaiting my folks to exit the bus. After greeting us, he asked us where we were from and when I told him, he immediately recognized our family names (he asked if we were the_____ and _____ families). He then escorted us to check in...... top notch service! Our rooms (adjoining) were on level one in building two... poolside. My parents had a corner room. Both rooms were perfect.... new interiors and beautifully decorated. There is a lovely curtain that can be pulled out to allow privacy in the sink and bathroom area from the rest of the room.. this came in handy. We were right next to the dock for the river taxi to downtown disney as well. Close to food court.... and obviously the pool. Perfect location! The pool is wonderful... I thought from the pictures, that there were two water slides... but there is actually only one. The other is a bridge that you can walk over the water on. The food court is satisfying and nice. Usual fair... sandwiches, chicken, pizza... great breakfast as well. I recommend that you buy the refillable cup available for purchase in the food court... a money saving tip. I washed the same and frequently refilled, even putting my a.m. coffee in the same. My only complaint was that the bus service to the parks was hit or miss. Some days we would show up and only wait for a minute. Other times we would wait for 30 plus minutes. There were times when we had to stand on the bus due to the crowds as well. But the boat ride down the river to downtown disney is beautiful and makes up for the bus! I couldn't believe how many bus stops are located around Port Orleans Riverside (4 or more?)... when the French Quarter is quaint enough to only need one. I highly recommend this resort. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! After we left the resort, we transferred directly to the Disney Cruise ship (Dream). Impeccable service in transfer from the resort. The cruise is another review.... BUT.... WOW... what an amazing ship. GO on the disney cruise if at all possible.... well worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: OhioMeisje
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World on many occasions but have never stayed in a Disney property and I have to say, they did not disappoint. The biggest thing we had going for us was that we visited during an off-peak time. The hotel was well appointed, the staff was courteous and helpful and the room was pretty and comfortable. We took the boat to Downtown Disney and our purchases there were delivered to the hotel two days later without any hassle. The food was good and there was a lot to choose from, not the standard hamburgers and hot dogs. We were on the meal plan which we can’t say enough good things about. Disney made everything easy. Our trip into Epcot was made even better by the extra magic hours. We got to see everything we wanted. The Magic Kingdom was as wonderful as ever. We wish we could have had a few more hours in that park. It closed way too early while we were there. The transportation on the bus was great but again, it was an off-peak season so we had no trouble. I can see having major transportation headaches during peak season. My only regret is that we didn’t spend enough time there. Most of our time was spent in the parks when there was so much to do at the hotel and the neighboring Port Orleans Riverside. I would definitely love to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jdepaillat
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that it didn't seem as crowded as other Disney resorts and the views were lovely from our room! Plus, the best restaurants were within walking distance at the Port Orleans - Riverside Resort! The room was very nice. The only downside was the cheap toilet paper they provided.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE”
Reviews.Author: chlobert
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans French Quarter is FABULOUS!!! we arrived around 11:00 am and our room was all ready:) The new rooms are beautiful, I felt like I was at a deluxe resort. The food court is great, I only wish it was open later. Buses are very efficient and come all the time. The pool is beautiful and the grounds are very well kept. Housekeeping is very helpful especially if you need something at night. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: daddyschamp
Reviews.Content: Just a quick last minute trip to WDD resort and again we stayed at our favorite resort. Although we like the PO Riverside better, this one is aright behind. Kids love the pool and waterside, and I love the boat ride to Downtown Disney. No need to fight traffic and look for a parking spot. The room looked great after the recently completed upgrade, and the beds were very comfortable. Much needed after a day of walking. Living only an hour way, I am sure we will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “It was a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: ashleyb423
Reviews.Content: When we 1st got here it was wonderful. We loved our room very much. A little confusing finding it. But we managed. The signs to guide you to your room, elevators and ice machine was a little off but nothing to bad.... The beds are really uncomfortable. You should deferentially bring your own pillows. They have small hard or way to soft pillows. We did not know that you could leave your luggage down in the storage room and call for them to bring it up until the day off we were leaving. Their food court is basically the same thing as the theme parks. Not much of a variety. The pizza was decent, not what we were expecting though. Their was a lady who worked at the resort and we asked her where were the buses for downtown Disney. and she replied in a attitude way " you could take the bus but the boat is a lot funnier" so we said okay where is the boat then and she pointed out the door. We couldn't check into our flight until the day off we were leaving because they close so early. They said my card was denied when their was money on it. We went to pull money out to pay for the baggage and they wouldn't take cash.I never thought someone would reject cash before. Buses be prepaid to make stops. We were n the french side and it said to Epcot. So we got on and expected to go to Epcot. We made stops to the river side along the way and missed our firework show because of it. Some will say heading to your resort name and they will take you to blizzard beach, typhoon lagoon and then your resort. Our cleaning lady cracked a glass in our room, and also cracked open a shampoo and conditioner and just left it in the cracked glass in our room. we were very upset about this because we didnt want to get charged. and why wouldn't she just take it out when she did it. We also kept the windows closed and when we got back she had opened them and didn't close them. we like our privacy we dont like people peeping in. The ac was not the best we had it all the way down and we still ended up sleeping with the fan on. The tv hardly worked. We had it on the news, radio Disney and that was all the channels that worked. we changed our hotel at the last minute and they never changed the name for it. So we never got our magical express form saying what time to be back for the bus. We waited at the hotel for 3 hours. until we finally realized we had to ask someone whats going on. and then they told us we had to do such and such to get this form. and the form said hope you enjoyed your stay at the Caribbean beach. i thought we were at port Orleans lol :-). But the rooms look lovely, the resort over all beautiful just some problems. they need to out. but we don't think we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and well themed resort”
Reviews.Author: NickB90
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel in October 2010 and have had an amazing time. The hotel is lovely theme and it's very spacious. The room was spacious and well themed. The only disappointment was the small and smelly bathroom. The restaurant is very good, both for breakfast or dinner. Went several times to take my breakfast to one of the lovely gardens, instead of sitting in a restaurant. What else do you want? Having a nice breakfast under the Florida sun? Shuttles to the parks were every 20 minutes. Just the way back from Downtown Disney was terrible as we had to pass by the four bus stops of the riverside. Busses can be too cold. Would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: Alinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid June in block 7, which may have been a few min walk to the restaurant and buses, but was in a quieter section. The hotel staff were very friendly, even when we arrive from the airport to the hotel at 23.30 - there was a friendly smile and loads of help. We had an amazing nights sleep in our king bed and loved the disney shape the towels were laid in. Our room was always clean and spotless when we arrived back each day. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful - we had a friend joining us a few days into our stay and spoke to the hotel - we were able to move her to an adjoining room, get balloons, cupcakes and candles to celebrate her belated birthday. The restuarant was colourful and had quite a variety of snacks, breakfast, lunch and dinner options. The pool area was lovely with bright characters and huge amount of room for all age children and adults. Our check in and check out was easy and the staff made this hotel even better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Belinda037
Reviews.Content: The Disney Port Orlean's Resort - French Quarter is New Orleans only Disney-fied. The room was very pleasant with bright colours, comfortable beds, very clean with a coffee maker, mini fridge and extra pillows and blanets. We had requested a king bed but were provided with two beds instead. It actually worked out better because after a full busy day in the parks, it is much easier to fall asleep alone. Our room faced the Saratoga river which was a bit loud because of the ferry's that run until midnight. We had brought earplugs and were happy that we had. Dispite the noise, the view was incredible and were happy to have it. Although there is no fitness facility at this hotel, there is a running path that runs between the French Quarter and the Riverside resorts. So if you need a chance to work out, the running path was great. This resort is in a great place as it is very central. All the bus rides to the parks are less than 20 minutes in length and the buses start running before the parks open so you can be first in line to get in. The pool with the King Neptune slide was a welcome reprive from an active day in the parks and the hot weather. Had a great time howeveer the next time we go, we will try to stay at another hotel only because there is so much to see and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and resort :) Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: KimF2708
Reviews.Content: Visited October 2009 and Stayed for 2 Weeks. During our 2nd visit to Orlando we choose to stay at a Disney Resort (stayed in villa on 1st visit) and it was absolutely fantastic. As a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teenagers) we had a room with 2 double beds, the room was a decent size with a separate area with 2 sinks/mirrors and then a small bathroom with the toilet and bath/shower. Perfect for what we needed it for…Sleeping. There was Internet service available at a cost ($10 for 24 hours I think). There’s plenty of drawer space for clothes, TV, fridge, coffee maker and safe. Our room was close to the boat service and car park, about 2-5 minutes walk to pool, reception, shop, restaurants. We only used one of the restaurants and that was in the morning for breakfast you can also take it away to eat on the go or in room. The pancakes and sausages were delicious. Housekeeping was fantastic came to our room every day with fresh towels, coffee making things and all the essentials. Linen was changed every couple of days. And all staff members were very friendly and helpful. We were seen straight away on arrival at reception and were given our room keys/keys to world which you add a card to it and you can just use your key to the world in all Disney areas for food/shopping. Also we found the system that you can purchase anything in the Disney parks and then collect it from the gift shop at the hotel later that day or next morning fantastic. It meant we didn’t have to carry stuff around all day in the parks. There’s free shuttle/boat service, which goes to any Disney Park and Downtown Disney. Stops at certain times at night though. Gives older children there own freedom.
