Magic hours was another amazing perk of staying in a Disney Park and was such a god send as its not as busy at night, gives you chance to go on any rides that are to busy through the day or if you missed a show. We only used the pool once, which was ok, decent enough size for a dip especially on the hot days, was also hard to find seats and bit crazy with kids but not a big problem. There’s a big secure car park to leave your hired/own car with security at entrance checking you stay at the hotel. The hotel grounds are nicely kept and decorated and is very quiet and lovely to return to after a busy day at the parks. We loved our stay at Port Orleans French Quarters and have booked to stay again in 2012. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Gracianod
Reviews.Content: I decided last minute (week before) that we stay at Disney World. I am so glad I made the choice, our experience couldn't have been better. Upon arrival our room was ready and I was surprised to see it was very clean. Housekeeping was there every day and even when I placed the privacy sign on the door they left me a bag full of clean towels, tissue, etc.... The beds are sooooooo comfortable, once I arrived I purchased the same ones for my house. I had a surprise arranged for my daughter and it came right after arriving. I also received a small bday cake made from towels for my birthday. We were on the dining plan and I would only recommend it if you don't have picky eaters. The dining plan gave us the opportunity to do many character meals, which was great with a 4 yr old. Honestly, I don't have anything to complain about I had a wonderful experience. We stayed there June 25-July 1st. We are already planning trip #2!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Stella31072008
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, fab rooms, fab service, cant wait to go back in november

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Disney Resort we LOVED it!!!”
Reviews.Author: starrmoon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful!! We were there for 8 nights. The beds were the best part of the room. We are still joking about how we miss those comfy beds!!! The room separator was very convenient. The bathrooms were clean. The grounds were beautiful. We are definitely staying there again in 2014. We highly recommend this resort. The food in the dining area was good. Our only regret we didn't get the dining plan. Downtown Disney boat ride was a unique experience. We can't wait to come back!!! The staff was VERY friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mimiof2grrls
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at PORFQ from May 5-9. I had been here previously and wanted to share with her what a great resort this was. It is small and compact but did not feel crowded at all! Our room was on the third floor in building 7. The room was recently refurbished and seemed very fresh and new. Very quiet and easy walking distance to bus stop and an easy walk next door to POR.. Bus's were always quick and we loved the boat to DTD! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: Gluten_Free_chic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 4 nights allowing us 3 full days at Disneyworld. I chose this resort because it was not too expensive and didn't have many bad reviews. To be honest I can't understand why it would have gotten any bad reviews at all.We had a 1 bedroom unit with a bathroom, a bed, TV and a small fridge. What more could you want? There was Internet but you had to pay for it which was disappointing given how much we were paying for a very average hotel room. Our room was quiet and comfortable. The resort had 2 bus stops and a food hall. The food was very average with the same food as everywhere else in Disneyworld, a bit of variety wouldn't have gone astray!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Spotless! Great ambience!”
Reviews.Author: Brygida_2008
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all entirely renovated to 2 queen sized beds from the prior 2 double beds. What a difference! All new furniture, new bedding, new shower, etc. This is one of those "you walk in and its perfect!" hotels. Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “simple and quiet”
Reviews.Author: pvides
Reviews.Content: with a hectic Disney schedule, this hotel was nice and quiet... great pool, kids loved it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quiet Disney Hotel - Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: KAJOJA
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the area in 10+ years and I couldn't have been happier with the resort we picked. The rooms were beautiful and quiet. They are newly renovated and a good size for a small family with a mini fridge so it's perfect if travelling with a little one. We also loved the food court (yummy) which came in very handy after a long day in the parks. The buses to the parks for the most part were good but we ran into an issue after the Fantasmic show at Hollywood Studios and ended up waiting almost 1 hour for a bus with a 2 year old it was a little unacceptable but I don't think it's typical. Some buses will go Express to the parks while others stopped off at the other Port Orleans hotel which was enormous - with 4 different bus stops. The great thng about FQ was your first to get picked up and first to drop off so your chances of getting a seat are good (which is nice with little ones.) The boat to Down Town Disney was an added plus and a nice escape from the parks. Laundry room was clean and had lots of nice washers and dryers so no waiting. The pool looked great but we didn't make it between the parks and baby naps. Overall we loved coming home to the quietness of this hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Any Disney trip will include a stay at Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: triptik8
Reviews.Content: We loved Port Orleans French Quarter with its Mardi Gras flavor. The location was great! The resort is intimate with everything close: the bus stop, the beautiful pool, the dining room and the boat that transports to Downtown Disney. It's a very user friendly resort with a peaceful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 6 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: j_g1517
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I visited walt Disney world earlier this June. We're glad we chose to stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. Upon arrival (from Disney's Magical Express), we were greeted by friendly cast members at the front desk. We had requested for one of their newly renovated rooms in a quiet building. Our room in building 1 was great - it was new, clean and quiet. It was a really short walk to the reception area, the food court, the bus stops ( which brings you to all parks) and the river taxi dock ( which takes you to downtown Disney). I must mention that our luggage did not arrive at the Orlando airport the same time as us. We made a report and headed straight to Port Orleans on the Magical Experss. During check-in, I told the front desk staff what had happened and they were all out to help! They provided us with toothbrush, toothpaste, mouthwash at once. They also checked if we had enough clothes and that all our basic needs were met. A very convenient and affordable Disney property with staff who will go an extra mile to ensure that you are taken care of. We had a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MegKel
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th time taking our daughters to Disney. Previous trips included stays at the Grand Floridian, Swan, Beach Club and the Yacht Club (my personal favorite, and the place we had stayed the most). With a daughter heading off to college in the Fall, we needed to cut back a bit on the cost of the trip. Having stayed at the above Deluxe Resorts I was afraid I was going to be disappointed with a moderate. Although the pool area and location can not be compared to the Yacht Club, there was no disappointment in this trip at all. The refurbished rooms were pleasant, and the size was adequate for our family of four for the amount of time actually spent in the room. We didn't spend much time at the pool, but it was okay, again, the pool at the Yacht Club is exceptional, and it would not be fair to compare the two, however, it was clean and the slide cute for younger children. Of the 8 days 7 nights we spent there, I had only one complaint about the bus service, and it was not on the way going to the park, but coming back from Hollywood Studios on a rainy night. The grounds are well kept and very peaceful, especially when you consider their are so many families around. Food Court was fine, for the one time we ate lunch there. All in all, this is a gem. We also used the magical express again, and are grateful for this service. Thanks to Disney for more magical memories to add to all of the others ....

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Resort at WDW - now with new theme rooms and upgrades!”
Reviews.Author: cnm6528
Reviews.Content: We thought we were planning a trip for 2 somewhere tropical but after finding Southwest Airlines was offering fares at $79 each way from St. Louis to Orlando & Disney’s Free Dining, a surprise, spontaneous trip to Disney was the new itinerary. My husband had challenged me saying he could accomplish this for our family of 4 for less than what an all-inclusive would cost for the 2 of us. Oh lord! He was actually going pull it off! We knew staying at a Deluxe Resort wouldn’t be possible for this challenge’s parameters so we began researching moderate resorts. My daughter & I had planned a bayou birthday bash for her 4th birthday to be “hosted” by Tiana (the story was that Princess Tiana was inviting all of her princess friends to New Orleans to celebrate my daughter’s day this way we could include all of our fave princesses). PS- my daughter switched her birthday party theme 2 weeks before the day to an Ariel Under the Sea theme! Anyhow, we had had New Orleans on our minds from the music to the beignets to the “pardi gras” vibe. It made our resort decision narrow down much quicker for sure. We loved the look of Port Orleans French Quarter Resort in pictures & we especially loved the pool. Room renovations for POFQ occured in 2011 & sometime in 2012 "Royal Guest Rooms" will be offered with a new theme. There is even talk Tiana might walk around at some point, an idea we thought would be great when we were there!http://www.land.allears.net/blogs/allearsteam/2011/05/newrenovated_rooms_at_port_orl.html Our kids’ were 2.5 & newly 4 at the time of our trip. The September before when we traveled to WDW with extended family, we were spoiled by having the monorail at Grand Floridian so we could easily get on and off without breaking both strollers down (see my previous review). We were most worried about traveling to the parks. We were scared the busses would make us wait or be extremely crowded or difficult to navigate with two such small children & all of the gear we are required to take for them. But we thought it would be easier to attempt this with just the 4 of us & not the 8 that we would normally be traveling with. This trip we arrived to the resort by 1:00pm via Magical Express from MCO, we decided to dump our bags & head straight to the Magic Kingdom for lunch. We had checked-in on-line so our packet and keys were ready for us & we were actually able to go to our room even though we were early. The cast member told us that because we had two small children we were on the 1st floor. I was extremely grateful as there are no elevators & we had strollers in tow as well. The music was festive & the atmosphere was very reminiscent of the French Quarter; that is if the French Quarter were sanitized Disney style! Our room was a pleasant surprise. We had braced ourselves to be completely disappointed if we compared our accommodations to those we had the previous year at GF but Port Orleans French Quarter held its own. There were two double beds, décor was Southern style, a fridge, a tv, an area that could be curtained off with sinks, an open closet, safe, iron, ironing board & then the bathtub & toilet were enclosed next to it. We had a window & a table & were quite comfortable. If you have 5 guests you will need to stay at Riverside because FQ doesn't have a fold-out couch or bed to accomodate this. There is also a bench which we found handy for our suitcases & to slip our shoes underneath. We bring nightlights with us but we could leave a light on behind the curtain if we had to (little people that are newly potty trained can be scared at night). On our previous trip I had mailed food & baby supplies to us but we were able to carry things like snacks, juices & cereals with us on this trip and it came in handy as we stuck with the free Basic Dining & didn’t upgrade. We had no problems getting our ADRs even though we were less than 30 days out when we booked them (we were only not able to get into Chef Mickey’s out of all of our choices). Plus we no longer had a need for any diapers! Yeah!!! I had been very thorough in what to pack on the trip, to the parks, etc. as the trip back to the resort would not just be a quick monorail ride if something were forgotten. We waited less than 15 minutes for busses on average (the max wait time we ever had at Port Orleans New Orleans was 25 minutes & we only ever made one pick up at Riverside). We were quite relieved that the transportation wasn't drastically worse going from Deluxe to Moderate. There isn't a sit down restaurant on the premises so if you'd like to dine at the resort you will have to take the scenic walk on the Sassagoula River Path over to Riverside for Boatwright's. We found the food at Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory to be as good as Gasparilla Food & Games at Grand Floridian if not a touch better. However the Mardi Gras sized float heads hanging from the ceiling are a tiny disconcerting! Beignets are offered at Sassagoulas! A must-try. One evening we grabbed a hot pizza for the room at Pizza Express. The game room was more than adequate if not a bit expensive as they all tend to be. We had a tragic stroller accident but we were able to replace it at Jackson Square the store on site. We could've waited until we got to the park as they are available there as well but we chose to have it with us. You can buy souvenirs, postcards, stamps, snacks, film, etc at Jackson Square. There are lots of activities on the grounds you can take advantage of including bike rentals, the marina, surrey bikes, cane pole fishing, horse drawn carriage rides, etc. You can also take a quick boatride to Downtown Disney from FQ. Also check out Scat Cat's to enjoy a drink & live music off the lobby next to Sassagoula's. I mentioned Doubloon Lagoon the awesome pool at FQ with the Mardi Gras Dragon slide featuring King Triton & the alligator fountains. There's also a jacuzzi near the pool that stays open until 2:00am. The differences I noticed from Deluxe Resort to Moderate were all those you are likely aware of when booking. The toiletries are a bit different, at the time the decor a bit dated, the sheets & comforter slightly less comfortable, not as many dining choices, etc. The size of the room in the moderate was smaller, there wasn't a couch etc. But there is pizza delivery at the moderate resorts which deluxe resorts don't have. Also moderate resorts have a bigger & nicer laundry facility which I always try to take advantage of while on vacation. FQ's is near the pool so I was able to visit with my family while I did laundry to have clean clothes to take home. At GF my mom stayed behind one morning and finished it up for us & there were only 2 machines in the builiding (but they were in our guest building so not far to carry). I look forward to our trip this year to the Polynesian & checking out some of the Christmas decorations! Of course I will give you a review when I get back. Until then, if you have any questions about this review or resort - just ask! (or check out http://www.portorleans.org/) When you go to Port Orleans French Quarter, say hi to Arnie & make sure to get your coins for the fountain! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Handyyou
Reviews.Content: The Management was excellant. Had a health scare and they were great in their response time in getting the ambulance , making sure my wife got vouchers to take her back and forth to the hospital. They asked about my care each day and showed concern when I returned from the hospital. I would like to thank everyone for all they did. It truly means alot!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: QCTraveler
Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment. Thread-bare towels, no grip bars in bathrooms, no restaurant with table service, no free newspaper, $10 per night extra charge for internet access, not even a folding luggage rack in the room (except by request). All this for only $200 a night! Give me a break. I've stayed in much better places for 1/2 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best disney trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: Luck295
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at French quarter and it was fantastic! We arrived via magical express around 10 am and because I had checked-in online we only waited about 2 mins before we were handed a folder with all the info and our keys to the world. And our room was ready! We had a room in building 4 which is right next to the food court and lobby and only a 3 minute walk to the pool. The food in the food was your standard quick service food, but it was made fresh when you ordered it. The bus system was great. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus and only stopped at Riverside once. When check out time came it could not have been any easier, our boarding passes and check out info was left on the door. So we didn't have to go done and check out we just dropped our luggage off and didn't have to worry about again until we got off the plane. All in all the stay was incredible and I would never stay anywhere else again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cas250
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The room was large and comfortable. The transportation options to the parks was easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL AND SERVICE, FOOD WAS GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jgalea71
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 boys to Disneyworld for the first time in May and we stayed 1 week at this resort. The amenities were great. Food in the food court and Boatwrights was wonderful, service was great, staff always ready to help. Great music at night, maid service was great. Rooms at the French quarter were recently renovated and great size. Ferry service was wonderful and right behind our room. Kids loved the pool and the arcade. No complaints. We received a free dining plan for the 4 of us when we booked this resort and ate about $1200 worth of food for the week for FREE. We had a choice of over 90 restaurants but book them early!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, food not so much”
Reviews.Author: MickeysAttic
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been totally redecorated, unfortunately you can't get many choices if you want just plain food. Husband is a meat & potatoes kind of guy...not to be found here in their food court. Went next door to RIverside and ate every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was clean, quiet, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: LBitt
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Fourth stay, and this time, rooms have been refurbished. Everything was very clean and comfortable. Rooms were quiet. No signs of bugs. We like the food court, fun slide for the kids in the pool, hot tub, arcade, and playground. Transportation was easy and convenient, and parking for our car was free, well lit, and close to the main entrance. For the price, I feel this hotel is the best deal at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kelltnas
Reviews.Content: I am a little late in writing this review but wanted to submit because of all the choices in the Walt Disney World Resorts. My family took our first Disney trip in Sept 2010 and were very happy we chose the French Quarter. I was overwhelmed with the choices when planning our first trip and did a lot of research on my own. The main reason I chose the French Quarter was the size of the resort. Of all the moderate choices I believe it is the smallest. I am not a "big resort" kind of traveler and preferred the charm and quaint feeling of the French Quarter. Although there are many buildings on the property it never seemed crowded. As we strolled the brick streets, enjoyed the pool, visited the restaurant and lobby if felt a world away from the hustle and bustle of the parks. We also enjoyed being able to take the boat between the property and downtown area. As we traveled around on the Disney transportation system I was surprised how many stops some of the other resorts had and the size of them compared to the French Quarter. The room itself was clean and adequate (there are 3 in my family), typical hotel size and could have used some updates but we didn't go to Disney to spend a lot of time in the room anyway. I understand they are planning some room updates soon. The rooms could be improved but the grounds of the property were beautiful, charming and clean. I also felt secure while walking around which was one concern I had. We had a very nice 1st trip and if we return would definitely stay at the French Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love POFQ”
Reviews.Author: 3GirlsandaBoy
Reviews.Content: I love POFQ for so many reasons. The small size of the resort is wonderful, and means that the longest walk from any room to the bus stop, concierge, or pool is never more than a few minutes. The newly refurbished rooms are gorgeous. Bedding is soft and comfortable, although I didn't love the pillows (that could just be personal preference though). The rooms are comfortable and clean, with plenty of space. I was in a standard room, overlooking a parking lot. The noise the first night was pretty bad. I believe this was only because of the room renovations that were still being done. However, on our second night, as I was tucking my son into bed, we heard popping noises outside. I looked out the window to find that we had a perfect view of the fireworks! What a wonderful surprise! Suddenly, that parking lot view wasn't so bad!! The pool at POFQ is great. The slide is a lot of fun for kids, and was never crowded at all. The boat over to Downtown Disney is a relaxing 20 minute ride. The food court is good, (and serves delicious beignets!) but can get VERY crowded in the morning. The only problem we had during our 9 day stay was that our refrigerator stopped working. I had a lot of food in there, and didn't realize that the fridge had stopped working until it was too late (my food had spoiled). I would've thought they would have reimbursed me for at least some of the food, but when I went to the concierge desk, they were actually quite rude. The staff and customer service were not what I have come to expect from Disney. I do think this was an isolated incident, and although it was disappointing, it didn't change my love for this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: abs628
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at all of the moderate level resorts in Disney and this hotel provides all the amenities that one would expect from this level resort in Disney World. The rooms are clean and the property is well-kept. Getting breakfast in the morning at the cafeteria-style restaurant is easy and all items are available a la carte so you can get anything from a full breakfast to just eggs and toast. In addition, an added perk of this hotel is that you can take a boat from the hotel to Downtown Disney. If you are looking to stay at a hotel within this price range at Disney, I would strongly recommend this particular resort.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Moderate Totally Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: tellana1
Reviews.Content: We've taken a vacation every year for the past seven years and have always stayed at the Value resorts, primarily because we don't spend much time in our hotel room! With the free dining plan promotion, however, upgrading to a moderate level resort also included a dining plan upgrade from all counter service meals to 1 counter service/ 1 table service meal, so we went ahead and took the plunge and won't go back! We loved Port Orleans. All the rooms have been recently renovated to include 2 queen sized beds (doubles are standard at Disney Value and Moderate resorts, except for Coronado Springs. Port Orleans Riverside is in the process of renovating their rooms as well so some of them are queens while some are doubles). For those people used to staying off property, you have to understand that you can probably get nicer rooms for the same price with competitive off property deals, BUT it is hard to beat Disney transport, extra magic hours, and in our case free dining! We felt, however, that these rooms were fine for our needs. For those people in our position--debating whether or not to upgrade from the value resorts, here are the primary differences: queen beds! fridge in room. double sinks. nicer furnishings/carpets/linens/etc. bathrooms pretty much the same. coffee pot with real coffee in the rooms. pool has water slide/fountains. quieter. Port Orleans French Quarter in particular had several additional perks. First, like Riverside, it has access to Downtown Disney via boat, which we loved. I enjoyed how small it felt and because of the small size we never had any problems getting seats on buses and boats. The trade off is that it has less amenities (carriage rides, boat rental, etc.) than Riverside BUT you can take the boat or walk to Riverside to use these if you want. It also had a smaller dining area with less offerings than Riverside--that was the only downside I could see between the two. Otherwise, the pool was about the same size--with a third as many people--and the boats and buses came as often--with as third as many people (and, in the case of the buses, a third as many stops). Soo.... Pros: on property with usual perks, queen beds and fridge, very quiet, pretty, on the river/boat access, bus transportation was great, clean, friendly, fun pool, compact Cons: not as many amenities as Riverside, fewer dining hall offerings If you are thinking about a Disney Moderate Resort, this was a good choice. I haven't visited Caribbean Beach or Coronado, but between Riverside and French Quarter I would personally pick the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: PAMOMJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans a few years ago and when returning this past November with my parents, 7 year old daughter, brother and sister in law and their 4 year old we decided to go back to Port Orleans because of how pleased we were prior. It was great to go back with the kids. Port Orleans is just great. The staff had so much fun with the kids. They catered to them every morning. They had so much fun at the pool that we had trouble getting them out just to go back to the parks. Also, the food at the food courts is outstanding. We plan to go back in a few years and would love to try somewhere different but from what I understand from other friends that have gone and stayed at other resorts, Port Orleans seems to be hands down the best of the moderate resorts. Our rooms were always clean, staff was very accomodating, the music and atmosphere is great. The kids enjoyed taking the water taxi to downtown as well. I would highly recommend it. I don't think that Disney does anything bad but this is a guaranteed great place.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: Hauntcub
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night, long weekend stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. Though by no means our first Disney trip, it was the first time we stayed on property. Going through Magical Express worked pretty flawlessly. We arrived at the hotel around noonish, but the room wasn't quite ready. Since only a small percentage of the rooms have king beds, which we requested, we knew we might have to wait. I also requested a refurbished room, but I think most of them are at this point. They texted us about an hour and a half later giving us the room number. The room was attractively decorated and nice. No noise issues whatsoever. Convenience-wise, it was the perfect location- we were at a corner across from the hot tub and right across the "street" from the food court , gift shop, and front desk. Food on property was typical food court fare, but the quality was good as well as the taste. It was wonderfully convenient to be able to take the river taxi between the two Riverside resorts and Downtown Disney. We also ate dinner at the full service restaurant at Riverside. Service and the food were both fantastic. Concierge desk was friendly and helpful with tickets, as was the airline check in upon departure. Overall, I would recommend this resort. We would probably stay at Riverside next time, simply because there are more pool choices as well as boat rentals. The only thing that prevents me from giving it five stars is that obviously, being Disney, you're paying for Disney convenience and theming. We've rented a full house for cheaper than the moderates. That being said, we would do it again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, free transportation a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ryeholts
Reviews.Content: Years ago we stayed at a Value Resort, and decided our next trip we would spend the extra money for more comfort in a Moderate Resort. We have been very happy at the Caribbean Beach Resort, but decided to try the POFQ since it had bus and boat service. Although the hotel itself was fine, the transportation was lacking! We waited at the bus lines for 20-35 minutes regularly, watching several buses for the Pop Century, All Star, Contemporary, and more go by...often empty or close to it. We even had an incident leaving Animal Kindom where one person in a wheelchair was brought aboard a bus with 18-20 family members, not just 1 companion, before everyone else was let on board. The worse thing about that was they had just arrived and everyone else had been waiting!! Then the manager on duty had her name badge covered by her hair then she turned her back to the people in line and would not talk to anyone. Very NOT Disney behavior! It got to where we took our car to the parks - once you are checked into a resort, you park for free at the parks, too!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: tc3399
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I debated forever on whether to stay at a Disney property or not. Cost was what was keeping me from it, but this hotel had rates that were affordable enough that we decided to stay here. The hotel is very good, the rooms are probably comparable to a Holiday Inn/Marriott level, if you're looking for something significantly better you can find those resorts at Disney, but you'll pay a lot more. The pool is large enough for kids, I would say that kids age 12+ will probably be bored with it, but it is an ideal pool for younger kinds. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise- they have several different stations with a variety of food available. We ate there several mornings and evenings and had different food each day, all of which was good. We stayed in building 4, which was nice and close to the pool, restaurant, and bus stop. To be honest, I will probably look at some other more expensive options for our next Disney trip, but if they are too expensive, we will be glad to stay at the French Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovinmama
Reviews.Content: Our stay was May 30- June 3. From the moment we arrived everything was perfect. The new rooms are spacious and clean. The grounds are so beautiful and quiet. This is the smallest of the moderates at Disney and you truly felt as though you had the place to yourself. My 3 boys loved the pool. The new Queen size beds are so comfortable. Everything is close and we only had to wait 15 minutes for a bus once all other times were 5-10 minutes max.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Disney's Port Orleans Resort FQ!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahandandrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here for 7 days and we adore this hotel so much - we have already booked our next stay here next year! The location is fantastic for Disney as you are staying on property. Disney transport runs to all the parks every 10 minutes and is fantastic. We chose to use it instead of our car on many occasions as it's so easy to use. There is also a river boat direct from the resort to Downtown Disney which we used almost every night. A point also worth remembering is that anything bought througout Disney can be delivered to your room by the next afternoon to save you carrying all your purchases around! The hotel grounds where beautiful, very clean and tidy with manicured lawns, fountains, flower beds, places to sit and admire the view, river running all along the resort wich you can walk along. The pool was lovely with a waterslide for children, a pool bar and lots of sunbeds. The hotel lobby was spacious with very helpful staff. There is a Disney general store on site selling all manner of Disney goods as well as essentials like shampoo, painkillers etc. The staff were super friendly and we loved being told to have a magical day whenever we visited it(only at Disney)! The dining hall could get crowed but had a good selection of counter service meals to choose from at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Food was served all day until 11.30pm. The laundry services were also great and reasonable priced. Our room was in building 3 and very close to the pool/foodhall/lobby, so we were lucky. Some buildings were quite far from all the facilities. The room itelf was spacious and very clean. Lovely flat screen TV with cable channels including Disney. Mini fridge, safe and hairdryer all worked perfectly. The shower and toilet were very clean and worked perfectly. We had to wash basins which was excellent and a large well lit mirror each. The carpet was clean and looked quite new. Our bed was comfortable with clean sheets and the aircon was easy to use. Parking at the hotel was free but internet access wasn't. Can't wait for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Savannah1975
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Disney before but I love this Hotel. We sayed 4 nights and will only stay at the French Quarter. This resort is small but it is nice that you are able to walk to the bus station and food court in a couple of minutes. The rooms now have Queen Size beds and they were very clean. Every one they was great a the staff was helpful and always greated us with a smile. The food court is a little small but the bagetts are wonderful. At night it is very quiet, I had no clue that their was some one sstaying next door. The pool is large and the kids loved the water slide. The bus came every 15-20 minutes and we only stopped at the Port orleans river side one. If you are looking for one of the best Disney resorts you must choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom1004
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this resort. This was our second visit to Disney and our first time to stay at this resort. We had stayed at the Coronado Springs Resort on our first trip. Unlike the French Quarter, the Coronado was very BIG. So,we fell in love with the fact that the French Quarter was so small and easily accessible. We are also from south Louisiana and it felt like home away from home. They did a great job on depicting the streets of New Orleans.We plan to stay here again in the furture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNutUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for 10 nights this was the first time we had stayed on Disney property previously we had rented a villa and when we arrived we were really pleased with our choice. The themeing was really well done there was very quiet background music outside the main building which was a nice touch. We had trouble when we checked in as our park tickets had been issued wrond with Disney through our tour operator but after explaining to the concierge she rang our tour operator for us to confirm our correct tickets and then issued us with the correct ones. Our room was very clean and we had a king room which was a good size although I think if we had travelled with children having two double beds in a room that size would probably be a little tight. A good tip we picked up before we left was to leave a small tip for mousekeeping (housekeeping) each day rather than a larger one at the end of the day. They were very good and respectful if you put your privacy tag in the door. Our room location was fabulous we stayed in building 5 which was very close to the pool and the main building which we thought may be noisey but actually you can' hear an awful lot once you are inside the room. We also stayed in room 5101 which was the best location as it was on the ground floor and I believe the closest possible to the main building. It was also a corner room which are very popular as they have two windows and more natural light. My sister was staying in the Caribbean beach resort whith a friend at the same time as us and we visted each others resort. After seeing our resort and our room they both moved resort over to Port Orleans French Quarter. The rooms have recently been rennovated and been done very well therefore everything in the room was brand new. The food court was better here than at Caribbean Beach as everything is cooked to order therefore fresh however, this did mean sometimes having to wait a while for your order. The buses were very good the great thing about this resort is as it was small there is only one buses station unlike some of the other resorts where you have to go to a number of stops around the resort before you start the journey to your destination. We thought as there was only one stop it might make the buses very busy however, we actually found the opposite to be true as when the bus arrives at your hotel it is mostly carrying passengers for that resort and so the bus was normally empty when you got on it. Overall it was a great resort with good rooms and friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsskceb
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the POFQ from May12th-19th, 2011 and enjoyed our stay. The grounds are lovely and well kept and our service was impeccable. We were put in Building 7, which is right by the river, but is also as far away from the dining hall, Disney buses and main building as you can get. Folks who are still okay after a day or more of walking around the Walt Disney World Parks would have no problem with the location of Building 7. However, those who can barely walk after their Disney days, might consider asking for a room close to everything. We had planned on using the pool and jacuzzi, but couldn't face the considerable back and forth distances. The room was very nice, but does need to be upgraded. The carpet was very stained. The dining hall was okay:it is what it is! It can get very loud inside. The food is okay, as are the selections. The refillable mugs ($13.99) are good value, and we used them a lot. The staff at this hotel were wonderful also. We loved the entire atmosphere and experience; the fact that it was very hot and humid, really added to the "New Orleans" feel of the entire place. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loved it - 3rd time to stay here”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMom51
Reviews.Content: We just came back May 26 2011 from a five night Disney Vacation and stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter. This is the best resort it's small in reguards to the distance from the bus station, food court and pool . There is only one bus stop not four or five like at the other moderate resorts. My sister and I love Disney and have been 10 times/ we have stayed three times at the french quarter and walked around to see what rooms to request next time we come back- If you want a good view of the pool and to be close to the elevators and the boat that goes to downdown disney- request room number 2333 or 2334( 2334 is a corner room These rooms are a little bigger) this is on the top floor which is the 3rd floor and overlooks the pool with the elevator right around the corner- also a very good room is right straight across the pool area in building 5 with an even better pool view request room 5315 o 5316 you cannot go wrong with any of these rooms if your want a good view of the pool/close access to elevators and ice and downtown disney boat. Also if you want a water view and to be close to the elevators/pool request room # 2331 or 2332. The elevators are located on only one end of the building so hence the reference about being close to the elevators-all these room numbers are close to the food court- Disney will try to make your requests come true- so when you book your stay make sure your room number request is on the reservations. Tell them the number of the room plus - building 2 or building 5 facing the pool- so if you do not get the exact room number you want- you will get one close to it. If you do not request anything you might be facing the parking lot or a room a good distance from the main area of the food court, pool and boat. loved it and can't wait to go back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Moderate resort in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: klytia
Reviews.Content: If you can't quite afford a Deluxe resort (Beach Club is definitely my pick there), have no fear! The Port Orleans French Quarter is the perfect Moderate resort. Unlike it's sister property, Port Orleans Riverside, French Quarter is a smaller property. This means there is only one central bus stop and that you don't have to navigate miles of pathways to get around the property. The pool is large and there's a small, cute waterslide. With the constant complimentary bus transportation to all the parks the wait is never long to get out and play or get back home. The rooms are plenty spacious and the theme of New Orleans Mardi Gra is a fun presence throughout. As far as moderate resorts go, this is a lovely, manageable property with a boutique feel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations- so glad we picked French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: kweiland06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter in early May 2011 and absolutely loved our hotel choice. We had debated for a while between this resort and other non-Disney resorts, and are SO glad we went with French Quarter. When I booked the room back in February, I requested a renovated building, and a week before departure called to see if they could arrange a river view, as well. I didn't have my hopes up because usually you have to pay for that upgrade, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that our room was in a secluded corner of a beautifully renovated building with a wonderful view of the river. We enjoyed watching the river boat going to and from Downtown Disney (and was also a very convenient and unique way to travel to this area). Other reviewers seem to acknowledge that some of the farther buildings are quite a hike from the main entrance of the resort, but we didn't mind the distance at all. The service was exceptional, and all of the staff at the resort were so friendly and helpful. The decor and atmosphere was perfect for an adults-only vacation; the New Orleans feel was authentic and tasteful, but not overdone, and not overly "Disney", which was exactly what we were looking for. The pool was also an enjoyable way to relax after a long day at the parks. The food court selection was adequate, but we didn't eat there aside from breakfast and to sample the beignets (a must!). The live music at night was a great touch, and we loved having the "mayor" of New Orleans greet us each morning as we left for the parks- he was so cheerful and really was a great start to our day. I cannot say enough about Port Orleans French Quarter, and I have no doubt that we will be staying here again for our next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL NEWLY RENOVATED CUSTOMER SERVICE NEEDS WORK!!!”
Reviews.Author: m13638
Reviews.Content: I stayed in building 2,I highly recomend this building because of its location to the pool and lobby and restaurant. Considering Disneys committment to customer service, at this location it was less than desired. Lost reservation, room key not working, after some choice words , problems were resovled and $200.00 credit awarded.

Reviews.Title: “My Family & I LOVED Port Orleans French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: MoMo0925
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans French Quarter is beautiful! My 10 year old loved the pool with the slide, she looked forward to coming back to the resort after the parks, because of the pool slide. Our room was clean and nicely remodeled with queen beds. The only negative I have to say is regarding the pillows, not comfortable at all, the down pillows were to flat & the foam pillows were to thick for your neck, AND the walls might be a little thin, we had a family with a baby next door, when the baby woke up crying in the middle of the night, we were woke up as well, but luckily it didn't happen the whole week. Would I stay here again? ABSOLUTELY! I mentioned staying somewhere else next time & my family wants to come back to POFQ. The meals in the food court was good, we had the Quick Service dining Plan and I would definitley recommend the dining plans! All the staff was very nice, but I read in other reviews where they had animals made out of towels daily... we did not. Just the once when we checked in, not a big deal. Another plus about POFQ, is the River Taxi to Downtown Disney. We were here 6 days and never had to wait longer that 20 minutes for bus to the parks, and most of the time not even that long.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation with memories to last a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: ksmama
Reviews.Content: Our son, 3 1/2 at the time, LOVED this resort! The pool, the guy handing out coins & necklaces each morning, the huge cinnamon rolls, the aligators that he'd pose with on the way to the pool...he STILL talks about staying at Port Orleans! It was actually in Jund of 2009, I just now figured out I could rate our stay on here! Not as clean in 2009 as our stay in Riverside (before the two were combined) back in 2001, but we really did enjoy it and it's a great location for small children! The slide in the pool is very cool for them!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Anniversary Resort!”
Reviews.Author: lilibee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from May 3rd to May 7th. We have stayed at several other Disney resorts in the past (Floridian and Wilderness Lodge to name a couple) but we would rank Port Orleans to be our hands down favorite! We checked-in online before arrival which was smooth and problem free. Pros: We had reserved a King bed room in our original reservation. When we arrived at the resort around 3:30pm, we asked the check-in staff if they had any river view King rooms available. They did and upgraded us without additional charge. We were in Building 1 (the building furthest south on the property) in room 1332. It was a corner room which meant that it also had windows on two sides of the room making it much brighter, and the view was superb. It was quiet and we could watch the sun come up over the trees in the morning. While we were the furthest building south on the complex, it was still only a 2 minute walk to the pool and a 4 minute walk to the main building with the food court and gift shop. It was about a 5-7 minute walk to the bus stop, but easy and picturesque. If you are a couple on honeymoon, anniversary or romantic getaway - building 1 is fabulous. We never heard any other guest, and since we were on the 3rd floor, never heard any of the loud toilets that so many others have commented on. The renovated rooms were lovely, and we found the beds to be extremely comfortable. Our mousekeeper (Juana) created different towel animals for us each day of our stay, and made our room immaculate! The first day we had a towel mickey on the bed waiting to welcome us, the second day 2 swans, the third day to baby elephants, the fourth day two love birds and the final day a cute little clutch purse decorated with confetti stickers. We did tip her $5 a day for mousekeeping (leaving $10 on the day we checked out), which was beyond worth it to come back to an amazing room and a little treat after 12-14 hour days at the parks. We walked over to Riverside several times during our stay. It was probably a 15 minute walk door to door since we always took time to fill our refillable mugs on the way over. The river path between the two resorts is lovely and a nice way to unwind after a day at the parks. We took advantage of the refilling option for drinks at both resort Food Courts, so we made sure that we never got dehydrated during our stay. It was also one of the few places that had Sprite Zero as a non-calorie option in the carbonated drink section. We ate dinner at Boatwrights the first night we were there. Jenny was our waitress and she was just lovely! Helpful, friendly and quick to refill a drink that was running low. We would highly recommend the crawfish appetizer (delicious!), barbeque shrimp appetizer (yum!) the blackened fish main course (nice heat to it), and the bread pudding! The bananas foster angel food cake dessert was good too, but couldn't hold a candle to the bread pudding. The gift shop at French Quarter was decent but nothing special. I didn't get a chance to check out Riverside's gift shop, but we ended up buying most of our souvenirs at the Floridian and in the actual parks. There were a couple of pairs of very cute Mardi Gras themed Mickey ears you could purchase at the gift shop, and a large swath of Princess and the Frog merchandise. We also took advantage of the boats that travelled between Port Orleans and Downtown Disney several times. Each boat can accommodate approximately 32-36 passengers, and that number is split between Riverside and French Quarter guests. So, if you pick the boat up at Riverside to go to Downtown Disney, the captain will only allow up to 24 people at Riverside to board at one time so that they can board at least 12 people from French Quarter on the ride to Downtown Disney. And vice versa. We never waited for more than 15 minutes for a boat, even when it was peak times in the evening when tons of people were waiting to go the Downtown Disney. The boat captains were uniformly friendly, and some of them were extremely knowledgable regarding the flora and fauna along the river as well as the wildlife to be seen. The boats stop running at 11:30pm but as long as you are on the Downtown Disney dock by 11:30 - they will make sure a boat takes every passenger there home. They trip to downtown disney takes about 20 minutes from French Quarter, 25 from Riverside. Downtown Disney has a very nice AMC theatre now, so we got to see some new releases in the evening that my husband wanted to see. Theatre has IMAX and enhanced THX which were great! The pool at French Quarter was lovely, big enough to accommodate all the people there without ever feeling too crowded. The slide was super fun, and there were plenty of sun loungers and towels. Pool bathrooms clean and comfortable. Pool bar had very yummy frozen drinks (if you like that sort of drink). I can highly recommend the Pina CoLAVAs. Pina Colada with Raspberry Coulis (oh my goodness, delicious!). There is also a very cute little playground near the entrance of the French Quarter pool, but is geared toward younger children (under 10) I would say. We didn't eat at the French Quarter food court all that often because we were on the Disney Deluxe Food Plan (it doesn't make sense to use the credits on quick serve meals on that plan). However, we did enjoy the beignets almost every morning before heading out to the parks. Those beignets are amazing! And a half order (3 beignets) are equal to a snack credit on the dining plan. Big enough for two people who prefer a light breakfast. You will not regret ordering those when you stay at French Quarter. Buses came very regularly to French Quarter. We waited (at most) 15 minutes for a bus to arrive. And the only time the buses also went to Riverside before going on the the final destination was when it was before 7:30 in the morning. Otherwise, the buses went immediately to the final destination. Drivers super friendly, but also sticklers to families with strollers (making them collapse all strollers before entering the buses). It never took longer than 35 minutes to reach any park from the French Quarter and the buses were reasonably comfortable. Cons: The only con we could really point to as that our room's shower faucet was very weak. Which we decided didn't matter all that much because everything else was amazing! And I think it is a problem with that specific room's shower faucet, not an issue resort wide. If we had been in the room more often/longer, we would have asked to have it fixed while we were there, but we were too busy for that to bother us. And every other part of that room was a perfect 10, so we shrugged our shoulders and had a fabulous time! The other slight con (and it is slight) is that the concierge service can take some time because they only ever have 1 person at the concierge desk. It just means you might wait 10-15 minutes if you want to talk to the concierge, so it really isn't a huge issue, just make sure you plan the time. The concierge took his time with each guest making sure they had everything they needed before they were finished, so just be patient. Rudolph was very nice and helpful! I would highly recommend French Quarter to couples visiting Disney. I also think it would be fantastic for families whose children were old enough not to need a nap in the middle of the day because it is a distance away from most parks and isn't the most efficient transportation (due to it being on the bus system rather than the monorail). Rooms were lovely, affordable, and larger than I expected. Service was excellent and friendly. And Boatwrights was an unexpected treasure of a table service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: jdc8621
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at a Disney Resort and we quickly decided we won't stay anywhere else. I have a family of 4 myself, wife, and 2 girls 8 and 6. The French Quarter was perfect for us. After the hustle and bustle of the parks it was like coming home. Total peace and quiet the second you step of the bus. A nice peaceful walk to our room to have a nice relaxing nights sleep in the queen size beds or take the kids to the pool for a swim before bed. Our kids liked the resort pool even more than Blizzard Beach. If you don't like waiting for the bus to and from the parks this is also a great quality of the French Quarter, we only had to wait for a 2nd bus once in the 5 days we were there, our longest wait was about 23 minutes which in my opinion was just fine after seeing the enormous lines for the other resorts. The staff was outstanding from our check-in right down to the cleaning staff, which made some amazing characters made out of the towels and wash clothes. Our kids would run back to the room every evening to see what she left for them. Though it doesn't have a sit down restaurant Boatwright's is just down the river at the Port Orleans-Riverside Resort, which was very good. To get to the Riverside you can take the quiet boat ride or the peaceful walk along the river. It does have a nice variety of quick service dining which was all excellent. We did the quick service plus dining package and was well worth the money, make sure you make your reservations ahead of time. I would warn you about the downfalls of the resort but we just didn't have any bad experiences at all. It truly was OUTSTANDING in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: saw4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. We really liked that it was quiet and small. Everyone was helpful and friendly and the grounds were clean. If you aren't planning to spend much time in your room or the hotel but just want a nice, pretty place to come back to each night, it's perfect. I do wish there was a sit-down restaurant and a gym.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Norma062
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my good friend, my daughter and my niece. We had a exellent time! The pool was great the life guards were on duty at all times they left at 9:00pm and closed the water slide but the pool was still open. The meal plan was awesome . The food was much, much better than I expected. They had pizza,subs, salads, pastas, sandwiches, and the breakfasts were very good as well. The service was excellent I had so many questions and the staff were happy to answer. I never complained once. S taff are very friendly and helpful. The buses and boats were great, the most time I ever waited was about 10 - 15 minutes but that happend about twice. The normal wait time was 2 - 5 minutes or some times we would arrive at the bus stop and the bus would be there waiting. The room was clean the maid came every day and left new towels,soap,face clothes and shampoo and conditioner. They even shaped the towels as mickey mouse and little bunnys for the kids. The grounds are beautifully kept and the gardens are gorgeous. We loved to see the ducks, bunnys, squirrels but could of done with out seeing the racer snake on the walk way to the pool.(Only saw it once ) The beds were very comfortable, best matress I have ever slept on! I would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: BCorr
Reviews.Content: Really great stay with my wife and 4 year old son. Spent 5 nights in the resort and wished we would have 7. PROS Close to Downtown Disney Shuttle service was good Rooms where clean and quiet Pool was the perfect size Staff was pleasent and capable Cleaning staff was great (Chloe) CONS No onsite sit down restaurant TIPS Ask for building 2 or 5 If going to another resort take a Taxi, always available on site Take the boat to Downtown Disney wake up early and use the magic hours Buy water and put it in the fridge

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back in a Flash!”
Reviews.Author: vacationanually
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The grounds are beautiful, the location was perfect and the staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. We did online check in which was a smooth, easy process. When we arrived it took about 5 minutes to get all our package info, our tickets, our resort map and our room. We then picked up our refillable mugs on the way to our room, within 30 minutes we were in Magic Kingdom park. We did not use the Magical Express as we rented a car and the parking was free at POFQ and all Disney parks and resorts. French Quarter was newly renovated to include queen sized beds, the double sinks was great and there was a clothesline in the tub to hang the swimsuits. The pool was very nice, lots of lifeguards around. We used the laundry facilities which were great. The shop was very nice. The ferry boat to Downtown Disney was wonderful! The restaurant/cafeteria could use some updating menu-wise. The live band playing in the evening was very nice and not too loud to hear in the rooms. The mousekeepers were great and made towel animals for our room everyday and posed them with our kids toys from home. The rooms were well appointed and plenty big enough for our family of four! Overall a wonderful experience and we wouldn't hesitate to return to POFQ!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: joyce72487
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel the first week of May. We were extremely pleased with it. The rooms were great and had a lot of space. There were 2 queen beds, dresser, tv, table with 2 chairs and bathroom. We had a river view room which was beautiful and on the first level! The staff was super nice and very helpful. We ate breakfast every morning there(crossaints) and then had a big lunch at one of the parks(we had the dining plan). The pool was great and it wasn't too filled with kids! This resort is kid-friendly, but is great for couples too. We also had a shuttle boat to Downtown Disney which worked out perfect and the shuttle buses were great too! I would definitly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, cozy, quiet resort”
Reviews.Author: CapriSun73
Reviews.Content: I love this resort! This was our second time staying here. The rooms were recently renovated which is an added bonus. The staff was always friendly. Our kids, aged 7 & 11, loved the pool with the slide. One night they played a Disney movie on an inflatable movie screen in the courtyard. The food court is a bit smaller than other resorts, but it offered enough choices for our family. There was always plenty of seating. The only negative thing I can think of is that the buses pick up at Riverside most of the time unless there are people already standing from French Quarters. This is fine unless you are trying to get to a park for a reservation. It adds four extra stops. I would definitely recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed Disney Hotel, great facilities and warm service”
Reviews.Author: Supaspud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans for 7 nights in mid-April - I have two kids aged 9 and 6. The hotel / resort is pretty large, but because of the relaxed atmosphere and spacious grounds it never feels busy - in fact it is a perfect place to relax after a busy day at the parks. The rooms are plenty big enough, recently refurbished, and have two queen sized beds which were comfy (with slightly hard pillows). The room had a good sized fridge, useful for keeping milk, fruit etc for breakfast when you want to make a quick break for the parks, and a good coffee maker. The grounds were beautifully maintained and a river ran alongside the resort with boat trips to Downtown Disney and Riverside which were very relaxing, and although we had to queue for these some evenings the wait was never longer than 15 minutes. The staff were very friendly, with some nice touches like the guy who greeted us every morning at 7:30 am as we left to catch a bus to the parks and gave the kids 'doubloons' to throw into the wishing well, and showings of disney films outside on projection screens in the gardens in the evenings. The pool is large, had a great slide for kids, and never got outrageously busy even in the Easter holidays - there were days when the sun loungers were all taken by the time we got there after 4 in the afternoon but it never felt like a zoo. The food hall is fairly basic but had a reasonable selection of pizzas, hot meals, salads, and a good bakery section, and the prices weren't cheap but were significantly cheaper than full service restaurants. There is a nice walk along the river to the sister resor, Port Orleans Riverside, which appeared to be a bit more crowded than French Quarter. Our kids both loved the resort with its feeling of space and laid back atmosphere. It wasn't particularly 'in your face' Disney but you knew you were staying 'on property' because of the service, cleanliness and the small touches here and there. I would definitely recommend this for younger families - the bus rides at Easter to the parks never took longer than 20 minutes to the furthest parks, and out of the 7 days we stayed we only needed to wait more than 10 minutes on one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “The best, friendlist, helpful, place that goes ubove and beyond any expectations.”
Reviews.Author: FROG1313
Reviews.Content: The best breakfast, and beginets ever. Good food, friendly people, great towel sculptures, clean, helpful, beautiful and peaceful place. The most amazing thing is the caring of the staff even after we had gotten home. There was a toy rifel for my son we tried to ship from there to our house, which UPS lost. Then UPS wouldn't tell us anything about it being lost, They had to talk to port orleans and port orleans then had to talk to us. They kept in contact with us and even went out of their way and sent us another rifel to repace the one UPS lost, which was not their responsibility to do. Even though that one was delivered broken by UPS, they still were helpful and pleasent and concerned about my son being upset about the gun from disney he didn't get. I reasured them he was taking it well and is up set with UPS and that he mentions that he wants to go back to disney almost every day. The rest of us had a great time also. Personally I would love to come back just to stay at the hotel and take advantage of more of the things they offer at the hotell. THANK YOU PORT ORLEANS!! I would recommend you to everyone who stays in or near Disney. from Manchester, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosetta66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. They let us check in early and kept our bags while we went to the park and enjoyed the day. When we returned I called for my bags and they brought them up to the room. The room was large and the beds were very comfortable. This hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly and very helpful. The pool was large and beautiful. They provide free life jackets for young children that do not know how to swim. My children loved the hotel so much that they rather be there than go to the parks. The only minus would be that internet is not free and the buses can get crowded but they do run every 20 minutes. In all a great experience well worth the price. .

Reviews.Title: “More compact Moderate. Great kids pool”
Reviews.Author: FastPass
Reviews.Content: For moderate WDW resorts, this one has the best pool. It's also lively, a bit loud, but close to the restaurant and gift shop. My least favorite moderate - but, because it's busy. I like the less busy resorts. Others love this one though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, good location, nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: adsky
Reviews.Content: This was just about the only hotel available when we booked a last-minute trip to Disney just last week. It was affordable and it looked interesting enough, since I love the look of the French Quarter in New Orleans. Sure enough, the grounds were great - it looked very similar to the streets around the French Quarter. Being on the water was a nice touch, too. It was also a short bus ride to Epcot, which was the only park we visited on our one-night stay. A big plus was that when the park closed, there was a specific bus that just took guests from the French Quarter back with no other stops (unlike the ride TO the park). The rooms were just ok - it reminded me of a regular Days Inn, but with kitchy Mardi Gras decor. It was clean enough, though, and just right if you don't really need a fancy hotel. We didn't use the pool area, arcade, shop, or either of the restaurants (the main one looked like an overgrown cafeteria), but it seemed like it catered to a wide variety of visitors. Overall, I'd recommend it, but it was a little expensive for what you got. But that's just Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Natalyandfamily
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 10 days stays at the French Quarter and wouldn't exchange for anything even if it was our first time to a Disney Resort everything was terrific... The Riverside is a much larger resort and sometimes when we had to wait for the buses to make every stop there we found that very long to wait and were very happy when we only had the guests of our hotel... The pizza and the beignets was very good. The service, the pool and everything was much more than we expected. One of my children is allergic to peanuts and nuts and everybody I spoke to was very helpful in deciding what he could eat so it was a relief for me to see that... If I were to return I would certainly go to the French Quarter again...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanandaiguaVaca_time
Reviews.Content: The staff was great!!! The room and grounds were so beautiful and didn't want to leave. Disney has a great family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE FRENCH QUARTERS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BunnyPig1123
Reviews.Content: Our family (4 adults) was staying in French Quarters – Building 5 from Apr 6 to 12, 2011. Building 5 is next to Laundry, Swimming Pool and Hot Tub; just few minutes walk to food court and lobby (bus station is in front of the lobby). The pier (ferry to Downtown Disney) is at the end of the block (the river side view is so beautiful & peaceful). The room is clean and the room amenities always got replenished. 13 years ago we stayed in River Side Hotel ((it was called Dixing Landings), we like French Quarter much more, because everything is so centralized and convenient. In Dixing Landings, we needed to talk a long walk each day for the breakfast and bus station. Our meal plan includes “1 Snack + 1 Quick Service + 1 Table Meal each day”. We have bought the refillable mug on the first day when we arrived at the hotel, so we just used the “Snack” & refillable mug (coffee) for our breakfast, and we kept the “Quick Service” for lunch. “Snack” includes bagel with cream cheese, cinnamon roll, Danish, biscuits with sausage gravy sauce …(there is a sign on the menu that show you which item is count as Snack, otherwise you could ask the cashier before you pay). Turkey leg (in the Theme Park) is not included in the meal plan; the Turkey Leg in Epcot ($8) is much dearer than Hollywood Studio & Animal Kingdom ($7.xx). We have a good time in French Quarters and all of us agree that we will stay again in French Quarter if we visit Disney World again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: LoveCruising
Reviews.Content: After weeks and weeks of trying to decide if I wanted to spend the extra money and stay on property I'm happy to say "sure glad we did!" Port Orleans - French Qtr side is just beautiful. The staff is so friendly & helpful. On our very first day we locked ourselves out of our room! I trip to the front desk and moments later we had new keys with a smile from the desk clerk (guess that's not the first time they heard that story). Any questions we had they had the answer or directed us to who did. There is a nice gift shop and yummy self serve restaurant that's open till 11pm nightly. And let me just say, don't forget to try the beignets that are fresh made while you wait!!!! Prices were reasonable (for Disney that is) and there is plenty of seating. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. There is a really nice pool for the kids as well as a snack bar out by the pool. The river boats run from the French Qtr side to the Riverside as well as to Dwtn Disney every 10 minutes or so, ending with the last boat from downtown back to the resort at 11:30pm. If you want to stay out later then you'll have to catch a bus back. On the Riverside you can book a carriage ride ($45), rent a mini speed boat ($35) and several other fun things, and there are several restaurants on that side as well. You can catch one of many buses that drop off & pick up every 10 mins or so to any of the Disney properties. But be warned it will take you twice as long to get there because they go to all the bus stops on the property and then to more than one destination to drop off. For example to get to the Animal Kingdom we first had to go to one of the water parks and drop off people before heading to our park, same thing when your coming back. And be prepared you might have to stand for the trip, they really pack you in on these buses. After 2 days of that we opted to drive ourselves because your room key gets you '"free" (yes free) parking at any park. Our room was very nice and clean with ample room for the 2 of us. It includes a mini frig for keeping cold drinks or whatever you please in. There is high speed but it is $9.99 for 24 hrs. Our room had a king bed which was very comfortable and a river view. Everyday we had new little wash cloth animals holding things like our coffee cups and of course fresh Micky Mouse soap & shampoo! If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the parks, people, kids, strollers, etc. This is just the property for that, quiet and peaceful (at least in April). We can't wait for our next trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Resort at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: TriDelt88
Reviews.Content: I am a Disney Diehard and have stayed at resorts from the Contemporary and BayLake Towers (newest place to stay at Disney) to the Value All-Star Resorts and seriously nothing compares to the French Quarter. I've stayed there twice already and have been greeted with helpful and nice cast members behind the desks. They seriously make you feel welcome. I love being outside and walking around and this resort is HUGE! The grounds are gorgeous and it definitely embodies the feeling that you are really in New Orleans. The pool is not so bad either! Because this is a Moderate resort, the rooms are definitely moderate but cozy and spacious, we had four adults in the room and were completely comfortable. My absolute favorite amenity of this resort are the boats to Downtown Disney! They're so relaxing and convienent and really add to the resort vibe. Although there is no boat to the parks, you shouldn't expect there to be because unless you're staying at the Polynesian, Grand Floridian, or Contempory, you're not getting one. The buses are not so bad though. I am staying at Riverside next month in May and if it is anything like the French Quarter, I won't be disappointed! You're absolutly getting your money's worth and the some!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: kwisnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter for 3 nights. We had a great stay. Never felt overly crowded and everything was within a short walk. The boat ride to Riverside was great- went there for dinner two nights. The food court was not large but was convenient and easy. Bus service was fantastic, don't think we waited for the five minutes for any bus. Kids (and us) loved the pools! I'm sure we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Resort at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: mamasann
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at French Quarters several times. We've also tried AllStars Movies, Animal Kingdom Lodge and Caribbean Beaches. We don't even try the others anymore & .just book French Quarters. The renovated rooms are great! We love the convenience of the ferry to DownTown, our child LOVES the pool. Oh, and we enjoy Elliot Dyson at Scat Cat's while we're there. Bus service is usually good, but sometimes runs thru Riverside. It's a nice waterfront walk to Riverside if you Must have table dining or want a larger gift shop. We prefer the smaller resort and nice walk rather than the enormity of Riverside. Oh, and I'm about to book our next holiday trip, and we're staying at French Quarters!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: LINDAG2011
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the French Quarter for 3 nights/4 days which was rated on the moderate level for cost & found it a very nice resort for this level. We stayed in Bldg 7. It is the building furthest away at one end by the river but we were facing a parking lot so there was some road noise. It is a very colourful resort with beautiful grounds. The pool is very large with a huge dragon slide and clam shell fountain with colourful characters as well as others around the area. Quite a pleasant surprise. The dining area is just a large cafeteria style eatery but we ate there twice and found the food to be quite good. We used the transportation to the different theme parks and found you had little wait times both going & coming back to the hotel with not a lot of people waiting probably because this was a smaller resort. At check-in they didn't provide us with a lot of information as we had no idea how anything worked i.e. transportation to parks, admittance to parks, etc., different types of transportation, times for events, etc. but once we started asking questions they were very helpful & informative. As well there was another concierge information desk & pamphlets available for all the theme parks. They also have a souvenier shop that has nice items and is equivalent in price to anything you can buy from the theme parks so if you forgot something and were leaving the next day you could always pick up a last minute item from there. We took the boat ride from the hotel to Downtown Disney which was about a 15 minute ride and very pleasant going by a golf course as well as some of the cabins from the Wilderness Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: barnette2011
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Sunday from our trip to Disney. We LOVED the French Quarter. It was very peaceful and quiet. It was very nice to come back at the end of the day after being in the busy parks. The only compliant that I have is that there was a security guard who was rude to us when we first entered the park. It was raining and he got ill with us b/c we didn't know exactly where we were going & he tried to tell us we were not staying at that hotel (which he was wrong or being smart). Other than that, the staff was really friendly and the room was really nice. We stayed in Bldg. 1 which is a bit of a walk from the buses and restaurant but it wasn't bad. There was a small fridge in our room and there is no microwave. The pool was nice but the lifeguards were a little paranoid walking frantically around the pool to check it out--kinda took the "relaxation" factor out of the pool. Would def. recommendation this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, def. worth the money & the dining plan was great. If we visit again, this is our place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful trip at our favorite Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimboslicer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter countless times and it is one of our favorite Disney hotels. The rooms are clean and the ambiance is fun, even for adults! One of the nicest features is the proximity of the Riverside resort and the ability to walk between the two. It is a very nice quiet walk, especially in the evenings when the horse-drawn carriages are traveling the path. The food court is extremely convenient, and to address the below review stating there are no microwaves, you solve this by simply walking down to the food court and viola! A microwave, toaster ovens, and everything else you may need. It is especially nice to have this as an in-room refrigerator is now standard (finally!). The pools is big and there are plenty of pool chairs (although during peak season it is advisable to get to the pool early and stake out your area with towels). If that isn't enough to convince you, the boat service to and from the downtown Disney area and the Riverside resort should seal the deal. Much more convenient than driving and trying to park downtown for shopping and dining. All in all, you can't go wrong staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Level Disney Choice”
Reviews.Author: bigblueinflorida
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter resort this past weekend. The resort is extremely well kept and the rooms are in much better condition than other like hotels in the moderate range such as Caribbean Beach or Coronado Springs.
