Building 3 is currently closed for renovations which made parking a bit of a hassle. Disney has relinquished much of the lots that best serve buildings 3 and 2 to contractors and their endless rows of vehicles, dumpsters and debris piles. We stayed in Building 2 (riverside view and caddy corner to the pool which was fabulous!) so lugging of junk was a pain but the room was worth it. We had a view if the Sassagoula River and could just about see the pool but this was a quieter spot for us given the upheaval in Building 3. The pool was great. Nice and warm and my kids loved the waterslide. There is a hot tub on the back side of the pool bar which was great in the morning before the sun hit the pool. There is a small playground which was also nice. Food at the food court was interesting. With the Mardi Gras - French Quarter theme there were items such as jambalaya (not bad), ribs/chicken (ok), beignets (great!) and I loved the Angus Creole Burger with shrimp. There were plenty of other choices as well. The river taxi was nice. They run small riverboats to Downtown Disney (15 min ride) which was a nice alternative to the buses and they also run to Port Orleans Riverside. Being able to see the Saratoga Springs Treetop Villas from the water brought back memories of when we stayed there a year ago. The DTD water taxi runs right to RainForest Cafe which is a good choice for lunch. The room quality was a pleasant surprise. It was evident that our room had recently been remodeled and everything was clean, fresh and perfect. My only complaint was the thin walls and the gap underneath the connecting doors. Our neighbors were a college-aged couple and there was alot of action going on in the room very late at night. Thankfully my kids were exhausted by bedtime so they didn't notice. The shuttle buses to the parks run every 20 minutes and were actually running more like every ten minutes probably due to the peak crowds this time of year. If I was looking for a room in the moderate price range I would definitely return to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - loved the resort and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jassyandjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney's Port Orleans for 7 nights in Building 5. The room was immaculate and the housekeeping staff had made a Disney character out of towels which my children loved. We received our luggage in our room a few hours after our arrival. We had a pool view, easy walk to the bus port and the cafe. An added bonus to staying at this resort was that in the evenings if you wander down to the grassed area ust behind Building 5 they played Disney movies on a large screen for the kids. Make sure you take some bug spray and you could have a lovely picnic dinner while taking in a movie. It was extremely peaceful after a long day at the park and the kids really enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this resort for families with young children.. We will definately be back. .:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: melissalpn24
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone with my two year old son. We arrived around 11pm. We got a refurbished room in building 4. (room 4310). This room was an easy walk to busses, restuarant, pool and dock. I would request that room if I were to stay here again. Our luggage was delivered to our room around 1am. bell service called to let us know they were right outside the door. My mother came on a Sunday to stay with us and her luggage was placed right inside the room while we were out at Epcot since we were Family of the Day there :) My son's favorite part of the entire trip was the swimming pool and slide. He went down that slide so many times during the week. The dining plan was included in our package for free so the price of the food was not an issue for us. The options they had were good for us. Very yummy salads :) Transportation was great as well. The bus to Epcot did go through Riverside twice during our stay. But that was it. All of the other busses went straight to the parks. After leaving parks at night we never had to wait in a line to get a bus. We always got right on. I loved that this was a smaller resort. The boat to Downtown Disney and Riverside resort was amazing as well. you get to go right by the treehouse villas. Really neat. I do plan on staying at WIlderness Lodge next year when I go. But am kicking myself about that decision a little bit since I LOVED Port Orleans French Quarter and could save so much money staying there again. I just wanted to try out something new.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Tommy2pointO
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with our boys aged 9 and 7 .... their first time at WDW. Very happy with our choice. Rooms were very clean and more than adequate. Very comfortable beds, close to food court, pool, parking, etc. Food court was perfectly fine for on the go meals. The pool was awesome (kids and parents both word of choice). The river taxi down to Riverside for sitdown dinner at Boatwrights was nice touch. The bus wait to MK first day was 15 minutes but quicker day 2. Food was a bit more costly than anticipated but still not unreasonable all considered. The charm and atmosphere of POFQ was a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dextervhc
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious, had an iron and ironing board (a MUST for me), great bathroom, staff were SO helpful and friendly. Free and frequent buses to and from all of the parks and Downtown Disney (our maximum wait time for a bus was about 15 minutes). To get to the parks, the bus took about 15 - 20 minutes depending on which parks you went to (in our case, Magic Kingdom, Epcot and Hollywood Studios). Would appreciate more healthful food in the resort's restaurant (other than salad) although there was a reasonable selection of food, and the restaurant was open until either 11pm or midnight (can't remember). The resort was quiet, bed was comfortable. Would stay here again, except next time we are planning on forking out a bit more to stay even closer to the Magic Kingdom (our favourite!) Also, you can check in for your flights before you leave the resort, plus free bus to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mnworkingmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ 2/25 - 2/27 and had a wonderful time. This was our first time here and first time staying at a Disney report and we loved it. We checked in on-line before we left home and all we had to do was get our tickets/keys when we got there - check in took about 2 minutes - it was wonderful! I had called a week before and requested a refurbished room, but they were all taken when we got there, so we were in building 3 on the second floor. It was every close to everything and the room fit our needs. The bathroom was definately ready to be updated, but it was still clean and worked for us. Our only complaint about the room were the pillows - they were lumpy and firm - I have a feeling they'll be putting in new pillows when they re-do the beds. We took the boat ride to Downtown Disney when we first got there and only had to wait 5 minutes both ways for the boat - very prompt! We took the bus's to Magic Kingdom and never had to wait for more than 5 minutes either direction. We ate breakfast and 1 lunch at the resort and everything was very good - my daughter loved the beignets. Used the pool one day and the kids had a very good time swimming and enjoying the slide. All in all - a great time had by all of us and I would definately recommend this hotel ... good service, quiet, smaller, peaceful setting to come back to after long days at the parks. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: DianaKansasCity
Reviews.Content: Families should know that it is a long way from any restaurants and the parks. You can go by bus but you will have to wait for it and it could be full. You should also know that there is no microwave, and no inexpensive food nearby. We waited 2-3 hours for them to bring our luggage to our room and we had to stay there and wait because they would not deliver it if we were not there. Expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: lacajungirl1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at All Star Music twice, Wilderness Lodge just last year and this year at FQ, I must say this is our favorite! The renovated rooms are nicer than the Wilderness Lodge and about the same size and also queen beds- for MUCH less $$. (Don't get me wrong- WL is beautiful and I would stay there again in a heartbeat but....) If cost is a factor you should definitely choose this resort. You will not be dissappointed. The food court was great, guest services was great and it is the perfect size resort! The only negative would be the bus service which honestly wasn't too bad. They tell you buses run about every 20 minutes at that is pretty much the schedule at this resort. We never stopped at Riverside. Having said that - we did find that the bus service was slower than the WL but I guess that's to be expected for the price difference.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodations”
Reviews.Author: NateandJustinsmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Disney resorts, both moderate and upscale. The Port Orleans - French Quarter was lovely, quiet, clean, and very comfortable. I had asked for a renovated room -- the bathroom was immaculate, the beds were extremely comfortable (2 queens), and the resort was quiet. Breakfast in the food court was better than some of the upscale resorts we had stayed at. An added bonus is the boat that goes to Downtown Disney. My only wish would be that they add 2 more bus stops at the resort, as it was too far to walk to the bus stop from our building.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Mindu23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans for 2 nights in February. I knew I wanted a little higher quality than the economy level but I thought this was a MUCH better option. Beautiful grounds, huge pool and great rooms. Much smaller and cozier than the other resorts. Our group consisted of myself, my husband and two kids ages 4 and 1 1/2 along with my in-laws. On the lawn outside our room they played a movie and in the food court and lobby were TVs with kids shows. The service was excellent and the bar had a great selection and great music. Buses were very prompt and our trip to the Magic Kingdom was very quick 10 - 15 min. Epcot took a little longer because we made few stops. Still no complaints. I can't wait to visit Disney again and plan to stay at Port Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in need of Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: bfg1943
Reviews.Content: The rooms are showing their age. They are in dire need of Refurbishment. The grounds and public areas are well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “THIRD VISIT AND STILL A CHARM!”
Reviews.Author: chrisfigz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at POFQ. This was our 3rd visit in the last 3 1/2 years and we were just as happy as the previous visits. We had requested a refurbished buidling but no such luck. Our 2 previous stays were in bldg 6 (now redone) but we were in bldg 3 this time. While a bit dated, the room was clean and the location was good. Now that our daughter is almost 7, we find we are spending less and less time in the room (no need for naps) and more time in the parks. Face it, all you really want is the room to be clean and quiet as 95% of the time you are in it your eyes are closed. We only ate in the food court a few times but what we had was good. A few new selections from last time - the pork po boy was delicious. The bignets (sp) were as good as ever. For us this hotel is exactly what we look for - a clean, quiet, small low-key place to unwind after a bust day at the parks! We are already planning another visit in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel nice atmosphere. Would definitly stay again.”
Reviews.Author: francelover11
Reviews.Content: The only downfall was the coffee in the food court was not very good. The coffee in the hotel room was better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,Awesome,Request building #5”
Reviews.Author: feltched
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter Feb.15-19 2011. It was my first time staying at a Disney Resort and I think that is the only way to go. We stayed in room #5122 and it was excellent we had a view of the river,it was close to the pool and the lobby. The weather was beautiful everyday.My wife and 3 yr old daughter had never been to Disney before so the French Quarter made a great first impression on them. My wife already wants to go back and said she would definately stay there again. The room was nice and clean.It had a small fridge,flat screen tv,2 queen size beds,clean bathroom ect. The staff were friendly and helpful. Make sure you stop and say hello to Arnie the doorman.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families with small children”
Reviews.Author: JordansDad
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Disney Port Orleans - French Quarter. Overall I was pleased with this resort. Its compact size (relative to other Disney resorts) makes a great option people traveling with small children, as the distances from the room to the food court and transportation are short. The rooms are on the small size, but manageable - you do feel however the space was "value engineered". The updated rooms are very nice and overall the property is in great condition. The boat to Downtown Disney is really convenient. My biggest criticism of this resort is food options and value at the food court. There were no real healthful eating options for dinner or lunch. The did have a make your own salad (not a salad bar you told the attendant what to put in) which for $10 was an appetizer sized portion.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Coldensmom82
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of the smaller ones on disney grounds and was absolutely perfect, we would highly recommend to anyone, it has a large pool with awesome slide, baby pool and hot tub, a nice place for quick service meals and a small gift shop with travel items. It was such a great experience, they are currently renovating their rooms, so far they have completed renovating buildings 7,6, and 4 and were working on building 5 when we stayed in early Feb., so if you are considering this hotel make sure and ask for a newly renovated room, they are beautiful and a great value for the price. This resort also offers a boat service that can take you to downtown disney and pleasure island which is a great way to travel. I can't say enough good things about this place...if you are considering staying on disney grounds this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Romantic, Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: estaples
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary here, and it really was all we could have asked for between the theming/polish of everything and the friendliness of the cast members. (Not to spoil anything, but even the manhole covers in the cobblestone streets have a surprise!) We were fortunate enough to land a room in building 4, which is closest to the main building and bus stop (I faxed a request for this prior to our arrival, knowing that it was newly renovated). Comfy king room with nice decor. It faced the bus stop/parking lot, but we didn't mind too much since there was a nice courtyard separating the space and, like everyone says, you're pretty much just sleeping there. We had two very minor annoyances, once of which wasn't the resort's fault at all: 1) you could hear toilet flushes from other rooms because of the high water pressure, but not so loud it woke you up or anything; 2) Some sort of cheerleading event was going on so towards the end of our stay the building seemed to be overrun by giddy and loud teenagers who could be heard in the walkways from our room. (I thought they usually got a value resort? But I digress.) We loved our proximity to the buses (which were very reliable—no more than a 10-15 min wait for anything), as well the ferry dock for Downtown Disney (a 15 min boat ride away). All in all, we loved this resort and would definitely recommend it... And if you have a good housekeeper (or mousekeeper?) like we did, it's always nice to leave a little tip! :)

Reviews.Title: “disney magic”
Reviews.Author: gulliverYorkshire
Reviews.Content: having stayed in this resort 6 times in the last 10 years, i cannot recommend it enough. the beds are extremely comfortable and clean, and trust me there is no-one fussier! maybe the bathrooms could do with an overhall but that would be picky as they are kept spotless. My only real complaint would be that sometimes in the early hours you can hear the occupants above using the bathroom, but isnt that the case in most hotels?. The staff are lovely and helpful, the maids particularly so. The buses are fab, if you forget the " stand in a queue and wait your turn " theory you will be ok!! Seriously the buses are great and we never waited more than 20 minutes on a busy day. Who cares its disney! we are here on holiday! P.s . use the jacuzzi after along day in the parks, meet friends and chill its fab.

Reviews.Title: “My Review of Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: emtmikey
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the French Quarter Port Orlean's for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Due to the renovations room was very nice. Too bad they didn't update cafeteria. The choices for Breakfast & Lunch were fine but Dinner left a little to be desired. We ended up ordering Pizza one night that cost us almost $23.00. Not a bad Pizza but a bit pricy as it was delivered by room service. We have stayed here in the past back in Jan of 2001 w/ our 2 sons who were 12& 6 @ that time. The swimming pool was great for the kids then but we went to go swimming and it was absolutely "ice cold". We were informed by the lifeguard that the heater was broke and that "they" were trying to fix it. Theo only other thing I will mention is that I doubt we will book the resort again as it's very far from everything and you can only take the bus,which a few filled up early in day and we waited almost 30 mins for next bus to Epcot. We also used the river boat but it was a bit chilly @ night.. Should be protected from wind etc. The maid was very nice but she forgot to leave us glasses one day and had to call front desk for glasses to be delivered. Overall though very nice resort

Reviews.Title: “lassiez le bon temps rouler!”
Reviews.Author: scrappymel
Reviews.Content: this is a fairly small (by disney standards) resort where it is easy to walk around, quiet and laid back, and a place you can relax. the food court is not very busy; it's easy to grab something and go quickly. the beignets are amazing! and three for one snack credit (or a dessert w/ a quick meal). the pool slide is good for young kids, and towels are always avaliable. the grounds are clean and well maintained. bus service was great... never much of a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans French Quarter is good, affordable lodging on disney property!”
Reviews.Author: brentsf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night trip to the Port Orleans French Quarter resort. We have stayed at a few of the other disney resorts that were more expensive, but for the price, you cannot beat this place! We paid around $150/night, which is pretty cheap for disney! The resort itself is very nice, but basic. It is a no frills place,but it is very clean and quiet and they are currently remodeling all of the rooms! We stayed in builing 7 where the rooms are completed and they are small, but very nice and clean and quiet! It is joined to the port orleans, riverside and they both have good food courts with reasonable, good, basic food! They even have a boat that goes to downtown disney! I highly recommend staying here if you want to save a few bucks, the pools, arcades and property are very nice and quaint!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort...we LOVED it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DVCMembers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ in Nov/10. This resort is fabulous. The grounds are beautiful. The pool was a hit with both our 9 year old and 16 year old. The buses were quick and easy, and we lucked out by never having to share a bus with POR! I would high recommend staying at this resort. The entertainment in the Lounge by the food court was so much fun. We found ourselves wanting to spend less time in the parks and more time at the resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend!”
Reviews.Author: DKlun
Reviews.Content: I took my 15 year old daughter to disney for the weekend. Chose French Quarter strictly off the reviews and so glad I did! Building 7 was a slightly longer walk but we enjoyed it. Room was brand new, spotless and the best nights sleep for both of us! A dark curtain could be pulled between the bedroom and bath areas so my daughter didn't even know I was getting ready, even though were are basically in the same roomTransportation was a breeze (both park and airport) Grounds were beautiful and construction continues so I'm sure all rooms will be as nice. We had a wonderful time and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: brystonmama
Reviews.Content: We switched from the disappointing Coronado Springs to French Quarter. I am so glad we did. The atmosphere was amazing and I was 500% more relaxed when we switched. The pool was great and the size of it made most rooms close to everything. The food court was great and Travis made me the best binnets in the world. The Po Boys were massive and the sugar cookies made my daughters day. All the cast members were great and went the extra mile. Arneil at the door was so welcoming. My kids were always looking for him for some wishing well coins. When the arcade points card machine broke they made the games free. There were some renovations going on but it isn't unusual for the time of year we went. Hardly noticed it anyway. Excellent service and all needs were met from towel service at the hot tub to crackers for my daughter when she didn't feel well. This resort was so charming all the bad time I had at Coronado Springs melted away. I would highly recommend French Quarter to anyone staying in Florida even if they don't visit any of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter is Great Place to stay while at DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: SFmomof2
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at French Quarter. My family stayed here and had a blast on our Disney Vacation. Lynda Hower at Dream Makers Vacation Service was a wonderful help. She took care of everything for us and also got back to me immediately with answers to my questions ;) After arriving from Disney transportation (which is a must!) they greeted us with bead necklaces and a gold coin for kids to throw in fountain as you enter the front desk. Gorgeous entrance, all glass is so welcoming! Everyone on staff was very helpful and friendly. French Quarters had a nice quick service centrally located to all resort buildings, next to front desk/gift shop. With 3 food areas all with different choices at each meal plus a yummy desert area with many choices. As you walk out of the gift shop you follow a path to pool lined with cute, colorful, fun aligator statues playing instuments! The pool is very large with a fun lizard slide, my kids loved it! We reserved a life jacket at gift shop beginning of our trip and were able to keep it in our room until the end of our stay, so easy. A bar area is next to pool to get a cold drink. Nice play area and hot tub too. This is all in the middle of the resort, great location. Right past the pool is a walkway along the river that is 7 min walk to Port Orleans Riverside Resort, beautiful. You can also take a ferry boat ride to downtown disney right from French Quarters. We stayed in building 5, which was just opening, brand new rooms with flat screen tv, frig in room, nice shower, 2 chairs and sm table, 2 beds, large dresser. Their is one bus stop for transfer from resort to parks but we never had to wait long and always got on the bus. Bus stop is close to check in building, and right behind building 5. I would definitely stay here again! :) And look forward to working with Lynda at Dream Makers Vacation Service again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: preedlips
Reviews.Content: This hotel and grounds are a beautiful and quiet place to base yourselves. The staff was very friendly and helpful from arrival to departure. We requested a renovated room and got one in Building 6, which was lovely. Housekeeping did a super job every day. Great set-up in the room, with the vanity and curtain divider outside of bathroom. The bus service to all of the theme parks was excellent, although the buses for Hollywood Studios seemed to have a longer wait ,both leaving the hotel and returning, so just allow extra time for travel to that park. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Bigfamily44
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. We have stayed at others depending on our finances. We liked Caribean and Pop Century better. Believe it or not, one of our favorites was Pop Century even though it is a value resort. The food was good there and the bus service was good. We didn't like the fact that bus service at French Quarter was shared with Riverside. One morning it took us 2 hours to get to Animal Kingdom. We did not like the food court. It was not New Orleans cooking or even Zartain's in the box. The main thing was the rooms. They were SO SMALL! There were only 3 of us this trip and we felt like we were in a shoe box. I would say do Pop or Caribean. This was the least favorite place we have ever stayed in at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cubalan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Jan 23-28th. I have to start by saying this is the first time I've stayed at a Disney resort, typically we stay off resort. What a great experience, I'm now hooked. We used the Magical express and at first I was a little nervous leaving my luggage for someone else to get but sure enough it arrived shortly after we did. At check in, I requested a renovated room and they had one left in building 7, over looking the river, they gave it to us at no extra charge! The mattresses are brand new (I found a tag on one of the beds saying it was delivered Nov. 2010) and everything was clean. The beds were a bit on the firm side but I still had a great sleep. I wont spoil the surprise but there are hidden mickey's in the bed spread and shower curtain..... The resort it's self is smaller compared to the other ones and you can easily walk from one end to another. Building 4 has been done and on our last day it looks like people were being checked in and they've started working on building 5. I couldn't believe it, it looks like they were pretty much gutting some of the rooms. Two of the rooms they took down part of the wall and you could see they were taking out the tub. On the second night of being in Disney I started to get a migrain, it was just after 11pm and the Jackson Square had just closed as we arrived from the Magic Kingdom (odd, I couldn't find any asprin in the parks). I knocked on the window hoping they would let me in. Even though they didn't have to, they quickly let me in to grab asprin. What customer service! For 3 out of the 5 mornings we had breakfast at the Sassagoula Food Court. The waffles with berries was so good. We booked in December when the Dining plan was offered for free. What a savings! I don't like fast food and am a bit of a picky eater. Having the dining plan allowed us to eat at some fantastic places with out costing me a fortune (chef mickey's Breakfast with tip for just my daughter and I would have been $70! Because of the dining plan, we just paid the tip......). Even if I had to pay for the dining plan I would certainly get it. We didn't really snack and used the credits towards rice crispy treats and those big lolly pops to bring back as souvenirs. The best advice I got from tripadvisor is ask whats included. Some restaurants had smoothies included (coral reef) and others didn't. The dining plan ended up being a lot of food. My daughter who just turned 10 was considered an adult and ordered off the adult menu. She would have been content ordering off the kids menu but it was a bit of a novalty at first to be considered an adult. We both tried to eat some of the most expensive entrees (lol, a couple of times I was trying to get her to order the steak instead of pasta)when we used the dining plan but by the last day all she wanted was the kids chicken fingers. Only disappointment we had which really is nothing, I've seen pictures on trip advisor of all of these neat towel foldings left behind on the bed from the cleaning staff. We got a mickey on arrival but didn't see anything after(I still left a tip each morning, room was nice and cleaned)....again really not a complaint and didn't change my view or experience. For the buses we didn't have to wait longer then 10 mintues with the exception of the early morning bus taking you to magic Kingdom for the Chef Mickey breakfast. The front desk told me to be at the stop at 6:20 and the bus didn't come until 6:45am....no worries we still got there early. Lastly, Magic Hours in the parks are so worth it. Having the extra time allowed us to just walk onto the most popular rides and in the afternoon when the park was the busiest my daughter and I would go back to the resort and rest. When it slowed down we would go right back. I would definately stay at this resort again, it's overall a great value and is small enough that you're not walking for ever......

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: PatMillsboro_DE
Reviews.Content: We loved POFQ. We had called the week before to request a renovated room and our request was honored. We were in Bldg. 6....corner room...top floor. Loved the renovations and had plenty of room. While only 3 drawers in the dresser unit, they are deep ones....nice big shelf under the sinks. Toilets are noisy (heard this is common in most places there) but that didn't spoil our stay. They were finishing Bldg. 4 and starting on Bldg. 5 for demo and renovation, so there was some construction noise.....but that couldn't be helped aice staff everywhere. The only complaint was the pool water was NOT the 82 degrees that Disney likes to maintain, but I'm guessing that is because it had been drained the previous week for cleaning and hadn't yet been heated up to 82. The food court is adequate but a restaurant would make a nice addition to the hotel. Bus service was very good, also. I'd have no hesitation about staying here again as I love the size of it, too! All staff members were very nice and attentive. I feel Disney is WRONG to charge $9.95 for 24 hours of internet.......if they feel they must charge, that is too high a rate, but I needed it, so I had no choice but to pay. (That is at all their hotels unless you are Disney Vacation Club members...or maybe in the highest price sweets in the deluxe hotels.) That, of course, isn't the fault of POFQ, so it's not a complaint ab out this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity, the Disney way.”
Reviews.Author: GoBucsGoRays
Reviews.Content: We stay in the Disney "moderate" resorts quite frequently. Nestled price-wise between their "deluxe" resorts and their "value" resorts, we find the amenities rival those of the more expensive hotels Disney offers. We stayed during the week after Christmas, so you can well imagine the prices were at their peak and there were no deals to be had. That said, the pool is Mardi Gras-themed, with a huge sea serpent as the centerpiece and his tongue as the slide. They had the heat cranked up during this un-Florida-like cold snap, so it was quite swimmable. Just a short jaunt from the pool area is the boat ramp which will take you into Downtown Disney or the other extension of this resort, Port Orleans Riverside (formerly Dixie Landings). This, in tandem with the buses that run to the theme parks, makes this a "park your car and forget about it" sort of experience. Any stress reduction during a theme park vacation with little kids is good, right? The rooms are of a reasonable size; ours had two queen beds. The double basin sink is a plus and is separated from thebathroom facilities by a door. There was a mini fridge, but we stuck with the family cooler since the fridge's thermostat was stuck on the setting "just a tad cooler than room temperature." Note: if given the option of a waterfront room, jump on it - even if it's an upcharge. We're from Florida, so the view is not the point. The waterfront rooms are situated much more conveniently than the others, to the jogging path, the dock, the pool, the dining hall...you get the picture. In summary: been there before, will be back again, it's clean, it's secure, it's Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Job Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: ohiotraveler10
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. We stayed here in Dec 2008 and returned due to the nice, quiet nature of this resort. I love going back here after a busy day at the parks. We checked in early at 11 AM and our room was ready for us. The staff was quite helpful and gave our daughter balloons for her birthday which made her day! Our room was in building 6 and was beautifully renovated. The queen size beds are a nice new feature, although it does leave less room available to move around. The only thing that was noisy was the flushing of toilets in the other rooms that would sometimes awaken us at night. But the beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Will be great after renovations done”
Reviews.Author: stjohnrocks
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property, lots of New Orleans flair. Check in was not great, I'm guessing it was the girls first day on the job. She didn't know much! I asked for a renovated room and they could not accomodate us. This was the first week in January. The room we had had been partially renovated, new sinks paint seemed fresh but the shower was really really bad. In fact I can't believe a Disney property would let it get that bad. The tub itself was peeling really bad. Also, it had not been cleaned well so had I been paying rack rates I would have complained. Since only our feet would be in it (we showered only) we let it go. Otherwise I really had not complaints, as previous reviewers have stated the beds are comfortable but really small. The food court is ok, we enjoyed the beignets, not as good as in New Orleans but not bad at all. Bus service was good with one ridiculous event, it was quite chilly one AM with only a handful of people on the bus to Animal Kingdom but the bus still went to the water park, driver never said one word just pulled in to the water park parking lot which was Completely empty except for 3 cars (employees I would think) turned around and left. He didn't even stop, nor did he ask if anyone was getting off so what was the point??? Very strange. We took the boat to Downtown Disney one night. It was freezing, would have been nice on a warm night. I would definetely stay at this hotel again especially once the room renovations are complete and if I could get a good price. Think Holiday Inn with Disney flair. Transportation from the airport was great too. Really you don't need a car here!

Reviews.Title: “Full of disney magic!”
Reviews.Author: cbrandt1209
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this resort. The transportation was easy to navigate and use. We never had to wait long for busses or boats. The rooms were clean, well themed, and comfortable. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper left us lots of cute towel animals. I really enjoyed this resort, and have already booked our next trip here!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value with Convenient Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Emily L
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on this site, we decided to book our trip to Disney World and stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter - a moderate Disney Resort. I was in Orlando for a conference earlier in the week and my husband came to join me from Thursday night - Sunday afternoon. We asked for an updated room and got building 7. We were told that building 6 was also renovated (and slightly closer to the main lobby, buses, etc.) and they were in the process of renovating building 4 - so if you are reading this some months later, building 4 is probably a safe bet as well. We booked through a travel agent online and she was able to get us the Disney Dining plan for free (something the Disney website didn't offer). I loved the decor of this hotel - very colorful on the outside and the rooms were clean, modern, and warm. We ate in the dining hall/food court area several times with no complaints - everyone seems to know about the dining plan and can tell you what you get. Get there early for breakfast or finding a place to sit could be difficult. If you are on the basic plan, I would pay for breakfast and use your quick service meal credit for lunch and your table service meal credit for dinner to make the most of it. If you are planning on nice meals (particularly in EPCOT) make reservations online or through your travel agent far in advance or you will be waiting forever, even in the slow months. The only downside we saw here was that when the buses pick you up for certain parks at the Port Orleans stop, you then have to stop at all the bus stops for the Riverside part of the hotel (4 additional stops) before getting to the parks. In some cases it took over 45 minutes to get to Epcot, so plan on that taking some time. You may even want to grab a cab if you are short on time. Overall we were quite pleased and would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great resort after all these years!!”
Reviews.Author: BBE2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the French Quarter twice when my kids were "kids" back in the 90's. Loved it then but after reading all the negative reviews concerning lack of cleanliness, worn out rooms, etc was hesitant to book here again 10 years later. So I booked a 2 bed condo at Saratoga Springs and kept calling back to inquire about openings at the Boardwalk resort (either Villa or Inn). Meanwhile I checked rates at French Quarter and just couldn't justify the expense of the other two resorts when I found out that the French Quarter was so much more reasonably priced. Afterall, I figured we'd spend little time in the room and with the savings would be able to get tickets for Cirque and hop over to Universal for a day and see the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. Also wanted to check out some of the pricier places for dining... So the French Quarter it was. We booked two rooms and I was amazed at how wonderful our stay there was...again. Details: Bldg 7 is completely renovated. Stayed in room 7348. King sized bed, overlooking Sassagoula River. Magnificent view not that I ever got to really sit there and look out the window. My kids stayed in 7301, slightly less expensive, two double beds, no real view to speak of but they could care less at 22 and 25; they were just happy Mom and Dad were taking them to Disney again. I had put in a request for bldg 7, and for the king room and the river view. Everything was honored by Disney. Delightfully surprised. Pros: Rooms were spotless, including the bathroom and tubs. Brand new everything. Beds were extremely comfortable. Lighting is excellent. Vanity area with two sinks was very roomy and both husband and myself could store all our toiletries without fighting over the space. Flat panel TV (again, never used it except to check the weather channel) In room fridge Thermostat control for temp Quiet and efficient ceiling fan Plenty of towels provided daily without asking for extras Cons: The WORST pillows I've ever laid my head on. Can't imagine what they were thinking when they ordered these for the new rooms. The good news is that you can request feather pillows, which we did and they were provided almost immediately. BYOBD Bring your own blow dryer. Also bring your own bathroom amenities. Disney provides soap and shampoo/conditioner minnies (no pun intended) only. And a word or two about that soap. Don't know what's up with the packaging but those wrappers are virtually impossible to open without a sharp knife. And to make matters worse, the two bars are replaced every day for reasons unknown, even if they were barely used. This is such a waste in addition to the torture of trying to open the package. Wall Safe is not. In this day and age why Disney would opt to place a keyed safe as opposed to a combination safe is puzzling to me. I would imagine there are many "extra" keys floating around so I never felt comfortable using the safe. Other comments about this resort, both good and bad: Bldg 7 is a distance, though not a great distance, from the lobby,Floatworks food factory, pool, and bus stop. Not an issue with older kids but I would imagine that for little ones this would be a hassle. We stayed in Bldg. 5 when the girls were little so we could be closer to the terrific pool they have there, but bldg 5 has yet to be refurbished. Bldge 6 is currently under construction and this is less of a walk to the things mentioned. Bus situation: It seems that the buses from French Quarter to the Parks no longer make those 4 stops at Riverside (AKA Dixie Landings the sister property). This was a delightful surprise. Even when the bus was virtually empty it went directly to the park. The only time we stopped at Riverside was when traveling to Downtown Disney but I would recommend the ferry boat for this anyway if it is available at the time you are traveling back. Buses were very prompt and we hardly waited most times we needed to travel. Staff was very responsive as far as addressing any concerns raised. Pillows were replaced almost immediately as mentioned. Our door handle was falling off when we checked in and this was also addressed almost immediately. One thing that hasn't changed though, is the less than accomodating attitude of the front desk staff. Do they train them to never smile or say a welcoming word? I recall being confounded by this in the past. Afterall, this is the hospitality industry ; why not be hospitable in attitude as well as action? But no matter. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Happy to answer any questions my fellow trip advisor members may have.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend and would stay again on a future visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jen071903
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 2 year old daughter at approx. 10:30am, had a flawless check-in.We were pleasantly surprised to find our room was ready. After opening the door to our room however, we found the room had not yet been cleaned. We went back to the check-in desk (honestly thinking they would say it will be ready by 3pm as that is the normal check-in time) and the staff was very helpful. They immediately offered us a new room in building 7 which was newely renovated. The room was very clean and met and even exceeded our needs. Only complaint was the toilet was extremely loud, it even scared my 2 year old daughter. The quick service at the resort could have used a little more variety, however we did take a short walk to the Riverside and had an excellent sit-down dinner. We enjoyed the boat ride from the resort to Downtown disney which was very close to building 7. Had the evenings been a little warmer we would have loved to sit out on the lawn to watch the movies put on by the resort. My husband and daughter were able to enjoy swimming in the adorable pool at the resort and the grounds of the resort were very beautiful especially with the Christmas decorations. I would definately stay again on a future visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time down in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: EveningStar7679
Reviews.Content: This resort is phemenol. My daughter loves New Orleans, so for her birthday we booked it for her birthday. The French Quarter is just like walking in the actual French Quarter in Louisiana. The atmosphere is so authentic, that in our multiple trips to Disney World we will stop in at this resort to eat, walk around, and take the beautiful waking path from Port Orleans French Quarter to Port Orleans Riverside and vice versa. I cannot recommend this resort enough. The rooms are cozy with the New Orleans flair traveling throughout. The sassagoula food court is scrumptious. It could quite possibly be the best food court in Disney (better than the park food) with the beignets (absoultly delicious) and variertyvof lunch and dinner options. The gift store is awesome with friendly cast members who always are celebrating mardis gras 24/7, offering beads to guests (we easily had 5 beads for each of the members in our family). In the end this resort is phenomenal and fantastic! With the rooms getting a fresh look I can't wait to come back. If anyone still has doubts stop by the French quarter and walk around...even stop by the riverside resort. This review goes for the both of them. The two Port Orleans resorts are right up there with the deluxe disney resorts :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip - will go back!”
Reviews.Author: jillc123
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on here prior to booking and will say the reviews I read on this site are overall fair and accurate. I stayed in a 1st floor room with a king bed. Room was comfortable and clean. I rarely stay in a hotel without feeling the need to keep socks on at all times and surprisingly I didn't feel the need here. Also, I have bad allergies and mold is a big issue with me...but no issues here! POFQ Resort is being updated and I was in a building which hasn't been renovated but I will absolutely go back! Planning another trip either later this year or early next year and will definitely book Port Orleans - French Quarter. Highly recommend doing the Disney Magical Express. No waiting at baggage claim, hopped on a bus which took me right to the resort. I did forget that I could have checked-in online - will remember that trick next time, was very jealous of the other people on my bus that were able to walk straight up to the counter and get their room keys (but I didn't really wait that long). Got my room key/park ticket and left them my cell number since check-in is supposed to be at 3pm, I got there at 10am so I went straight to the parks and around 1pm got a text with my room number. When I came back to the resort that night, my suitcase was waiting in my room!! Wonderful service!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Fun, and Memorable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BronteReed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on December 16th for one night. While we did not get a renovated room (I've heard that they should have them all renovated by April or May 2011), we did have a lovely room in Building 2 not too far from the Food Court/main building. We loved the tree lined walking paths and the quaint, romantic ambiance. It truly is the romantic resort we were glad we had picked 11 years ago for part of our honeymoon. The kids loved the alligators playing instruments and all about the pool. It was entirely too cold for us to consider swimming while we were there, but the kids (8 and 6) both said it looked like it would be fun - especially the slide. Our room was clean and fresh smelling. There was a small area chipped on a tile in the bathroom, but I'm not ranking the hotel much lower because I know they are renovating soon :) I like that they give several to-go cups by the coffee maker instead of just 2 like some hotels do. It's convenient if you want both water, coffee, or to have the kids split a juice, etc. We ate at the Food Court and it was very good (review will be separate), though not excellent. I wish that they had just a little more variety as I'm sure if we had been here more than a 2-3 days like most people, we might have gotten bored with the menu. The beignets were wonderful though :) On my rating, I am putting that the hotel has a restaurant and room service, but please keep in mind that it's really a Food Court/Quick service restaurant and that room service is really just pizza delivery ;) We did LOVE Elliott Dyson (the jazz musician that they have some nights for free in the lobby) as he was fabulous. We must have stayed watching him for 2+ hours and it was one of the highlights of our trip. The Scat Cat Bar open to where he played is also nice. Dyson was absolutely wonderful with our kids and all of the kids that stopped by with their families. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and it was really beautiful, especially the lobby. It was one of the best decorated that we saw over the next 10 or so days (and we stayed at the Animal Kingdom, Beach Club, and Carribbean - we switch hotels a lot, lol). We are hoping to go back for one night (as we are DVC ;) ) in the near future so we can try out a newly renovated room and see Dyson again :) I am overall giving this a 5, even though it's more like a 4.5 with the rooms that need renovating. Once the remaining rooms are done, I'm sure it will truly be a five star for its value.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed at every turn”
Reviews.Author: FergusRob
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Walt Disney World. We were impressed the moment we arrived at the resort. We arrived at 9:30am expecting to have to wait for our room but check in was quick and our room was ready for us already. The room was very clean and comfortable. Transportation to and from any of the resorts was quick and easy using Disney's transit system. The hotel only has a quick service restaurant area but the food was good and portions were adequate. The staff were great, everyone was friendly and always willing to help. We will use this resort again on future trips for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for an Upgraded Room”
Reviews.Author: BackTooSoon
Reviews.Content: The last time we stayed here, we were not pleased, but I read that the rooms were being upgraded and decided to stay here again. We had 2 connecting rooms, and they were excellent. The bathrooms have thankfully been retiled and regrouted. The new beds are queen sized. The rooms now have flat screen TVs. Everything is new!!! As of today, buildings 6 and 7 have been redone, and they are now working on buildng 4, but by April, all the rooms should be done. The only complaint I have is that when we moved the clock and phone on the nightstand, there was an inch of dust under them. This is a shame, since the room was redone within the last 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “POFQ is dated, but still had great stay”
Reviews.Author: dler
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed four nights before Christmas 2010. We had stayed in All Star Movies, Coronado, Riverside, and offsite previously. French Quarter has a lot of charm. We liked how compact it was, and how close Downtown Disney was by boat. (Super trip by Donna-a true information guide, great traditional Disney service not seen as much recently). The pool was warm enough even in 50º weather, and the laundry was well equipped. Nice holiday music in lobby (excellent guitar quartet when we were there). The room was OK. There was water on the floor by the toilet--it was leaking, and the air conditioner/heater rattled so much we couldn't run it the first night. Both were fixed when we returned in the evening. There was a bit of a old dirty wax ring around the edge of the bathroom floor, grout was stained a bit, etc., but the room was clean. I hear that they are updating this resort, with good reason. It is old and has seen a lot of guests. My teenagers' biggest complaint was lack of Wifi. Wired internet is available for $10 a day. I do hope that Disney adds free Wifi to all their resorts before we return, but I would stay at POFQ again.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: modo66
Reviews.Content: While this nice hotel is Family friendly it is also huge! There is so many things to do with your family no matter what the age they will have a blast!!! Our room was nice and comfortable it come with your basic needs including: Hair dryer, bathroom, sink, iron board, iron, and beds. I have a problem with sleeping in other peoples beds but these beds were so clean and comfortable. There was this boat thats takes you to the disney market place and the driver was so nice to us he saw that my mom had a new born and a bunch of kids so he took the extra 3 mins to wait for us I felt so happy that they care about us. The only bad thing is the prices for things like drinks and food I got this cappchino (please mind the spelling) and it cost like $4.25 and it wasent even that big. Overal this hotel was super clean and family friendly. And I would for sure stay here agin, and recommend this wonderful and magical resort to a freind. See ya real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas stay even in non-renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nunzio_Rochester_NY
Reviews.Content: I was initially (and wrongly) disappointed when we got to the resort and did not receive a recently renovated room in bldg 6 or 7, based on the reviews here. I was mistaken as our room in bldg 4 was Disney clean, a little outdated maybe but this was a perfcect home for our family Christmas. In the end having a room on the ground floor, close to the pool, laundry, cafe, bar, hot tub and other great amenities of this resort totally beat out a duve and queen size beds. After one night of getting used to the smaller beds everything was perfect. Great property, small, not overwhelming, very resort like feel and privacy. A perfect 10 for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “shh... a gem of a Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl1978
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter is a gem if you have stayed at Disney Resorts in the past. You can appreciate a smaller resort with the same quality service. The bus lines getting you in and out of the theme parks are shorter than many of the other resort lines and the distance from your room to the bus stop in short. This needs to be taken into consideration when traveling with children and staying at a Disney Resort. The pool is fantastic and perfect for small children with enough space for adults to enjoy themselves as well. The only food option is the food court unless you travel over to Riverside. Although Disney lists both properties as Port Orleans, I suggest you look at them as two different resorts with their own character. Don't expect to use the services at Riverside unless you are and avid outdoors person who appreciates a good hike. The French Quarter is perfectly charming!

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: EDMER0515
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed at several Disney resorts, I haven't found them to usually be worth the inflated prices you pay compared to those that are non-Disney but near the property. However, Port Orleans French Quarter is a great hotel for the money. We have a 2 1/2 year old and a 3 month old and we found the hotel to be very family-friendly, as you'd expect a Disney resort to be. The rooms were clean and nice. They put a pack n play in our room at our request for no extra charge. There is a food court that has a nice variety of food and there was a lady working there who would talk to my older child and make him laugh. She gave him a cookie with some icing and sprinkles to decorate, which made his day. There's also an arcade, which has games for elementary-aged kids through adults. My husband really enjoyed playing there as it has some older games from the 80s. Even though there were lots of kids in the hotel, we never heard a lot of noise. It might be because of where we were situated (building 5 along the back). But they did a good job making the walls thick and designing the walkways to minimize echo and noise. A tip for Disney with more than one very young child: Don't bring a double stroller. Even a tandem double stroller takes up alot of space and is bulky to get on and off the buses. We brought both a side by side double stroller and a single stroller since we drove to the hotel and had cargo space. We found that the single stroller was much better as the 2 year old wants to walk alot of the time. When he was really tired, we'd put him in and one of us would hold the infant. A baby bjorn or similar carrier would have been a good idea, too. There are buses that transport you to the parks, as there are from all Disney resorts. I advise getting there early and coming back at non-peak times (ask the driver when those times are for each park). Port Orleans is a popular resort and the wait for the buses can be very, very long.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Filthy Room”
Reviews.Author: chancelace
Reviews.Content: What a dump! The bathroom was absolutely disgusting. The toilet bowl had dried poop and pee on the outside of it. The shower floor was dirty and gray-looking. I asked the front desk rep (3 times) to have housekeeping clean the bathroom and it wasn't done. The kids and I had to wear flip flops to take a shower. I will never, ever stay at this nasty hotel again...very disappointed. Also, the bath towels didn't smell fresh and was dirty-looking.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY ROOM EVEN AFTER WE SPOKE WITH MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: KMFHOBART
Reviews.Content: The shower curtain, shower head and walls had red and black mold on them. Toothpaste from someone else on the sink when we checked in. Manager didn't seem to care. Edges of room looked as if they were never cleaned and stains all over walls

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Smaller IS Better”
Reviews.Author: NYHalfmoom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter the last week of november, first week of december for 7 nites. Had a great corner room with a view of the pool serpent slide and the river. Our family of 4, two aduts, 6 ys old and 11 yr old fit well into the room. The beds are a bit small, but if you want a bigger bed, you need to move up in price range. Staff were friendly and the grounds were clean. The resort has cute brick streets and quient grounds,,makes you feel like you're in a little city. Everything is very close to your room, that includes laundry, hot tub, pool bar, game room etc. The 1 hotel restaurant was cafteria style, the food selection was good. If you're a coffee/tea drinker get the hotel disney mug right away, free refills during your stay plus it's a great souvenier, (I still use it now), it's well worth the 15 bucks. Plus, if you're doing the dinning plan, note: a small salad is cosidered a dessert or snack. I gained 5lbs on the dinner plan because I didn't realize till my 2nd to last day, that I could sub a salad for a dessert. Bonuses: French Quarter is is a short walk or boat ride to Port Orleans Riverside, you can use the amenities of that resort which looked very nice, but much bigger, Riverside does have both a sit down restaurant, (only open for dinner) as well as a cafteria (a bit bigger than French Quarter). The one pool at Riverside (with life guards, which is what I prefer) seems to be a bit of a walk from the rooms, the boat ride to Downtown disney is a must do, I've read reviews that some of the resorts are too big, French Quarter is the smallest of the Disney resorts, if you have small children or individuals that are disabled this is the resort for you. We had a great time here and would come again, if we could not get French Quarter, Riverside would be our only other Moderate price range choice.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans hotel - best for a fabulous trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Loriintheburgh
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter was a terrific hotel for a family trip to Disney World. Prior to arriving, we had many questions and requests and all were accommodated. We had ground floor rooms that were close to everything. The hotel reminded me of New Orleans- exactly what I had hoped for. The grounds are well kept and the playground for the kids was terrific. The pool was very nice. One complaint may be that there is only one hot tub and it is usually crowded - including young children. The hotel was nice in that the grounds were not too large - so things were very convenient. It was nice to have Port Orleans Riverside connected so that there were more choices of activities and things to do. We used the shuttle buses to get to the other parks and used the boat to go to downtown Disney. The hotel room was very quiet and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: lisa018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two boys to Walt Disney World for the first time this Thanksgiving for one week. I did a lot of research online and was very happy with our stay at French Quarter. We used Magical Express and only needed to wait at the airport for about 15 minutes before we were off to the resort. I had checked in online ahead of time so registration at the hotel went quickly. We actually arrived on Thanksgiving day which seemed like a good time to arrive because there weren't many people on our Magical Express bus and only two groups ahead of us at registration. We arrived at 1:00 and our room wasn't ready so we checked our bags at the resort and went to the parks. The shuttle service to the parks was pretty good. We never waited more than 15 minutes, with the busy time being in the morning. Our room was in building 4 which is closest to the main building and shuttle stop. Only a five minute walk to either place. Pool was very close also. Our room was clean and comfortable. The housekeeping service was great with making wash cloth animals and even a toothbrush holder out of wash clothes. I did hear toilet flushing from the room above us at night but I was usually too tired to be bothered by it. The pool was big and clean with plenty of lounges. And lots of lifeguards. Very impressive. We had three meals at the food court and I was pleased with all of my food. We even got a home cooked Thanksgiving meal on Thanksgiving day. It was awesome. Fifteen dollars for a huge tray of food. Tasted better then my families Thanksgiving cooking. I was very impressed with how professionally Disney runs things. All employees we encountered were friendly and courteous. The little touches mean a lot. The beautiful holiday decorations in the lobby were a great first sight when we got there. First thing when we walked into the food court a woman came up to the boys and offered them a free cookie decorating activity. I was fortunate enough to have a 40% off coupon for our room and I feel that we got our money's worth, and them some.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms and Nice Quiet Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here December 1-4th and it was a pleasant stay! We were quickly checked in upon arrival and given a Water View, Double Bed room in Building 7. The lobby area is small but this resort is the smallest in Disney so it wasn’t a big deal. Request a room in Building 7! This building is totally renovated (it’s the first one done in their renovation project… currently they are working on building 6). The room was immaculate. We walked in and it just smelled new… the carpet was spotless, the beds had new comforters, sheets and pillows. The dressers were brand new and we had a LG flat screen TV and a brand new ceiling fan. The bathroom had a new tub and flooring as well. Overall, I have no complaints about the room because it was all new! I was expecting the worst after reading other reviews about mold and dust but this was such a treat. My husband noticed a tag on the mattress that said “July 2010” so we knew the mattress was new as well. The view from the room was lovely, as it overlooked the river. The room was also very quiet. We did hear some construction later in the morning going on at Building 6 but it didn’t bother us as it was about 11am. The food is average, cafeteria style like you find at other Disney resorts. It got a bit crowded in the morning and the seating area would fill up. We ate over in the bar area for breakfast as there was no one sitting in there. From Wednesday to Sunday there is a “Scat Man” performing right outside the lobby in the bar area. He’s fun and drew a crowd! The pool area was clean. As it was in the 60s not many people were swimming but we did. It’s a heated pool. The slide was fun! The resort could use an additional hot tub as the one by the playground was consistently full. A lot of families brought their children in the hot tub. The grounds of the hotel were immaculate. The great part about this resort is the boat to Downtown Disney. We utilized it many times throughout the trip and never had to wait more than 5 minutes for it to arrive and depart. It was about a 15 minute trip to Downtown. You can also take it to Riverside if you want to check out that monstrous resort. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. Since the resort is so small, you can walk across it in just minutes. It’s nice that you don’t have to walk 20 minutes to get to your room after a long day at the park! French Quarter is the first stop for the park buses. We didn’t have to wait longer than 10 minutes for a bus. However, the bus does stop 4 times at Riverside so it can get packed and take a bit to get to the parks. Overall, we’d definitely stay here again! We enjoyed the small, laidback atmosphere and the quiet of this hotel. It’s a bit less “Disney themed” than other resorts but we didn’t mind that at all. Ask for a renovated room and you won’t be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: kimmy04
Reviews.Content: Well I can honestly say that the PORFQ was not what I expected it to be. The hotel is very pretty and well taken care of on the outside. We stayed for 5 nights and we were so miserable with the beds being so small and so hard. You can here the flushing of toilets but that was not a huge problem for us. Here is the good and the bad. The good: Friendly staff Nice pool Boat ride to Downtown Disney very relaxing Close proximity to Disney a plus The bad: Rooms are in terrible shape. Beds very hard and very small Tub is worn and moldy Paint is fading A/C and heater needs refurbishing Overall I will not stay here again until Im guaranteed a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for building #7”
Reviews.Author: mickandkeri
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for the money. When booking your stay ask for building #7. This building is the farthest away from the buses and the river boat to Downtown but has just recently been redone. The walk to buses is maybe 2 or 3 min and the boats are the same. They are redoing building #6 now so that building may be ready soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disney does it right!”
Reviews.Author: ndupre
Reviews.Content: This year we decided to take a vacation during Thanksgiving and a new family tradition. While we were all worried travelig with 6 adults and 3 children under the age of 3, we were pleasantly surprised when all of our apprehension was erased. We made all travel plans through Dream Makers Vacation Services with Lynda Hower by our side. She made all decisions very easy, providing all necessary information, not to mention all of the wonderful helpful hints along the way. We received constant updates about flight changes, hotel accomodations and everything we could ever ask for. Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter was a great place to stay. Not a huge resort, but super clean, accomodating and the staff was fantastic. Everyone was very knowledgable and eager to assist us in every way. Once the sun goes down and you wonder around the property, you cannot help but feel like you are in the French Quarter of New Orleans, well a much calmer version of the French Quarter :-) Not if, but when we return to Disney, I would definitely consider staying here again, and would not plan the trip with out the assistance of Lynda!!

Reviews.Title: “It's alright - clean, convenient. A little pricey for the experience”
Reviews.Author: gstravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on my first trip to Disney World. I had a standard view room for three people. Here's what was good: 1. Clean room, fairly close to disney parks. The furthest one was Epcot- that took around minutes by bus (Disney is huge, so that's not too much) 2. Double sinks cordoned off by curtains- very useful in the mornings! 3. Friendly staff, quick to address issues 4.Charming setting with a very quiet, peaceful ambiance- a nice college feel to the place 5. Reasonable food options Not so good 1. The room was fairly small for three people. The double beds were tiny- could definitely not accommodate two people comfortably. A third rollaway bed was provided at additional charge of around 18 dollars a night (including tax) 2. The bathroom was tiny- you hardly had space to turn. Also the hot water was lukewarm most of the time. Not that it mattered too much since the weather was warm. 3.Insufficient soap and toiletries for 3 people- My friends and I were flying in from NY. Due to restrictions on what you can carry on flights in your hand baggage, we carried limited toiletries. Would have been nice to have more than one bar of body soap and one bar of facial soap for 3 people. 4. Room was unmade on arrival. However housekeeping immediately fixed this

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE , DIRT AND MOLD ROOMS SHAME ON DISNEY!”
Reviews.Author: STEAMBOATWILLY1
Reviews.Content: First place in desperate need of renovation!...Mold and mildew in the bathroom tub grout and on walls, carpet smells, ripped sheets and pillow cases and enough dust you could grow seeds!!!! We cleaned the dirt ourselves!! when spoke to someone else near bye had room same thing....800.00 stay for Disney you should be ashamed!!!!!! mattress felt like was old and used up sack into it . Refridgerator in room smelled..... good thing wife had a can of lysol wiped the mold off walls in bathroom...left rag when we went out came back that nite still mold......Never cleaned the dust from furniture or fan blade we did!

Reviews.Title: “Magic of disney all day.”
Reviews.Author: TheGormans
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in a Disney resort, and also our first time at DisneyWorld. But we have visited DisneyLand many times and always stayed at the best deal outside the resort grounds. From the moment we drove onto the resort property we had smiles. Staff and reception were helpful and very polite. Took about 10 minutes to get our room. The rooms are a little small but very clean, not the most up to date though. The pool at the resort was a lot of fun for our kids (ages 5 and 2 1/2), towels, life vests and life guard are all provided. The food court at the resort has a wide selection of food, and some really good desserts. Buses were timely, only down fall being you share with Riverside, but you do get picked up and dropped before those stops. You can also take a boat to DownTown Disney which is fun for the kids, about a 15 min ride. Riverside is a 10 min walk down the path, and they offer a sit down restaurant, but we did not eat there. Overall the benefit of staying at a Disney resort is great; extended hours, shuttle services, and i feel most importantly, you avoid a lot of the traffic and interaction with the locals. You are submerged in Disney, which is what we wanted. Cons; bit pricey, but we got free Disney Dining plan which over 6 days we had at least 700 dollars of food written off.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless concierge”
Reviews.Author: vaguelylost
Reviews.Content: Overall the french quarter is a fairly nice place to stay at disney. However the quality of the staff is extreamly uneven. My main complaint has to do with the quality of the concierge staff, some of them are good at their jobs however I delt with one mantronly concierge who was worse than useless. I had lost, my phone charger a fairly frequent travel issue that should be fairly routine. However when I asked her to please direct me to the closest verizon wireless location first she tried to dissuade me then it took her half an hour to produce directions which consisted of simply googling verizon wireless guessing which might be closest and turning her screen around and pointing to it on the screen and she had trouble pointing out where the hotel itself was in relation to the store finally she mapquested the location. She also spoke in such a low voice that I had to strain to hear her.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, We Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeucfknights
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. The room was clean. We enjoyed our water view room (building 6), great to watch the boats go by. This resort's size is perfect, one of the smallest at Disney! The resort offers decent dining options. The kid corner is a nice touch, our 2 year old enjoyed coloring while we enjoyed our meal. We enjoyed the live entertainment at the Scat Cat's Club. The bus service was decent, although at times some buses did make the 4 additional stops at the Riverside Resort, making the ride extra long. Definitely recommend this resort, we found a decent rate utilizing the passholder discount.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlrichhc
Reviews.Content: Although I did not stay at this hotel, I had family that did. It was my God daughter's 5th birthday and I was unable to make the trip to Disney World with them, so to surprise her on her birthday I had a large candy bouquet to be delivered to her room. After speaking with several staff members, management, etc throughout the day making sure my bouquet has arrived to the hotel and being reassured it would be delivered, it was not!!! A miniscule task that could not be achieved! This was not a very 'magical' experience. Actually called again TODAY-on the phone with them right now and still has not been delivered!!!!! WOW COMPLETE INCOMPETENCE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: justily
Reviews.Content: All the staff at this resort were wonderful. DD threw up one night all over the sheets and bedspread and mousekeeping came up and brought us new linens, etc. They were very friendly and helpful. The concierge desk was amazing, everyone was willing to help. The only un Disney like employees that we encountered were a few of the food court workers (although they weren't rude, just not quite as friendly). This resort is a great size and has beautiful grounds. We walked over to Riverside and were glad that our resort wasn't as spread out as Riverside. My daughter loved the pool and the water is heated so you are able to enjoy it in the evening after the sun goes down too. They have closed Building 7 as they are updating the hotel one building at a time. My only complaint would be that they corners of the carpet were pretty dusty (needs edging from a vacuum) which I may not have noticed if I wasn't checking under and behind everything for bedbugs which I am thrilled to report there were NO signs of!. We will definitely stay here again, especially after the remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aspeetzen
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for my husband and two-year-old daughter to stay at. Our room was about as far away from the main building as you could get, but it only took a few minutes to walk. The buses almost always stopped here for pick-up and drop-off first. Make sure you stand by the front corner of the bus station if you want to get on first. We always got a good seat. The only thing we didn't like was the lack of a nice restaurant and the small number of food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Nicole37594
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 1:30 am because of delayed flight. Asked at the desk if I could get milk for a bottle for the baby. Was told he could call us a cab, nothing more he could do. Went across the lobby to the hotel's restaurant. Asked them for milk for the baby, was told no, they were closed. Asked if they could just open up the cooler, they said no, we're closed. The man who plays the music in the lobby was able to get someone to get milk from the employee lounge. After that ordeal, got up to our room, and found no sheets on either bed. Just a pile of sheets on the floor. KId friendly? Not at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: kkstraveler10
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! Our room was right across from the dining hall in building 5, which was great for when we wanted to fill our resort mugs. We were on the first floor next to the main walkway, and never heard other guests walk by. This was a huge concern for me because I'm a light sleeper, but I had no problem with outside noise. One night we did walk to Riverside on the trail next to the river, which was very peaceful and quiet. The room itself had old decor, but it's very very clean. It was spacious for the 2 of us, and I loved having a free fridge there. Only ate breakfast there, and the omlets were very good. Bus service was very good to the parks. The longest we waited was 15 minutes for Animal Kingdom, but we still got to the park before opening time. Overall, I loved the atmosphere here! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: kleiker1978
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel because it is the perfect hotel for a Disney stay. You are not in your hotel room all that much when you go on a Disney vacation, therefore a moderate resort is perfect. Our kids loved the swimming pool. There is a kiddie pool for little ones and a dragon slide for the older kids. My older daughter loved the slide. The food is mediocre. It is like any of the other Disney moderate resorts' food. The room was perfect for the amount of time we spent in it. The other advantage of this hotel, is that it is close to all of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: flossy37
Reviews.Content: Fantastic disney hotel great location very clean spotless grounds everthing well maintained just spot on 1st class.Disney buses ran every ten mins did not have any problems with them. Staff very friendly and could not do enough to help you out with anything you may need or need to know. I would recommend staying here to all families.Pool area lovely and great for kids. Every day mousekeeping left towel animals for my son and when it was his birthday we returned to find a birthday cake waiting FANTASTIC PLACE am returning again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was probably nice in 1985...needs updating”
Reviews.Author: keithjs
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a nice enough hotel but I expected a bit more. Most disappointing was our room. The room was very small and cramped - spending a few hours in the room, along with my 2 kids, was very difficult. The bathroom was about the size of a 1/2 bathroom in most houses...it's impossible to use it comfortably. The sinks and mirrors are adjacent to the living room, which cuts off the available living space. Our TV was a 27" tube TV from the 80's...time to upgrade guys. As far as Internet access, WiFi was not available, so I was stuck with a LAN cable which was 5 feet long and restricted me to sitting right next to a very small table, which did wonders for my back. Beds are very small (my wife and I had to split up and share with one of our kids), but were comfortable enough. The radiator was also from the 80's, with a "high cool/low cool" switch that made it impossible to regulate temperature. Each night, we would wake up either shivering or sweating and attempt in vain to adjust the "dial". Guys, thermostats were invented 50 years ago...this is supposed to be the land of innovention.
