Common areas were OK...the food court is good to grab a quick snack but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner (think Food Court at the Mall). The pool looked nice, unfortunately is was too cold outside to enjoy it. I would give Port Orleans a solid C, but we'll try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A place for romance...”
Reviews.Author: mf_tastaldi
Reviews.Content: PORT Orleans- French Quarter Date: 4 nov 2010 I booked this package to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I guided my choice by therevews at Tripadvisor. We was at free dinning plan and it worth every penny spent. The hotel is amazing, clean peaceful and foodcourt is miles away from the crowd of other resort hotels we´ve stayed before. We celebrate with the beautiful sound of the piano on the lobby. I wish I could be back soon. Disney means youth forever.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Worn Around The Edges”
Reviews.Author: JBB071
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter is a very nice hotel. Check in was smooth. Grounds and landscaping are superb!! Bus transportation to theme parks was efficient and easy to use. Nice boat ride away from Downtown Disney (shopping). Mousekeeping did a great job cleaning room. Pool was very nice with water slide. The only complaints I have are the room we had was a little worn around the edges. Furniture was scratched and dinged up. The shower does not have a curved rod for the curtain. I never realized how nice that feature is until I didnt have it. The AC had the old dial that is turned to adjust the temperature. They should have a thermostat. I hope Disney remodels these rooms soon because they could use it.

Reviews.Title: “A first impression”
Reviews.Author: GuardMusic
Reviews.Content: This was my 24th Disney-related trip; I have stayed at all of the levels of Disney resort hotels. This was the first moderate (vs. deluxe or vacation home) resort stay in nearly 7 years. We stayed at POFQ after a conference and chose this one as 1) work colleague had a 40% off pin, as it was her first Disney trip and 2) this is one of the resorts I had not yet stayed at. We were here Oct. 6-8, 2010. We arrived via rental car and I was shocked no one from BELL SERVICE greeted us upon arrival. I found a bellman in the Bell Services office just leaning against the door. This was NOT the type of service I was used to at Disney. They did quickly unload the bags and we left to turn in the rental car. We returned to the resort via the FERRYBOAT from Downtown Disney, which took about 15-20 min. We did Online Resort CHECK-IN, so our folder was ready for us when we returned around 1:30-2pm, at which time our room was ready (Thurs.) Check-in took about 3 minutes. We were in room 2147 - a building directly behind registration/shop, the 2nd room on the ground floor. Although I had stayed at the sister resort, Port Orleans-Riverside (formerly Dixie Landings) a few times, I hadn't realized how small and compact POFQ was! Our room was probably only about 100 ft. from the gift shop! I had requested a roll-away in advance, as we had 3 women in the room. They didn't have this request, but quickly added it at no cost! This saved me $45 ($15/night)! As I feared, the ROOM seemed somewhat dark, even with the blinds open. I was also aware this resort was about to go through an upgrade, and it (by Disney standards) needed it! Our room was a lovely blue, but the bathroom was a darker green and gold - ick! Disney is in the process of getting rid of the traditional "bedspreads" and to that we say - thank goodness! We also had a standard 19"? tube TV. (The fall upgrade will switch this to a flat screen.) The most shocking thing was there was no mini-fridge in the cabinet, even though the cabinet was made for it! This was confusing. The room included the typical iron/ironing board, coffee maker with coffee, insufficient wall-mounted hair dryer, etc. The toilet was quieter than most Disney toilets. The ROLL-AWAY was a clean twin, but it was saggy! I felt like I was sleeping in a squishy ditch every night, even though I got used to it. The regular BEDS seemed nice & firm - just what I'd want. As for CLEANLINESS, I really don't have to mention it - it's Disney. Everything was clean. We were there early enough to hit the POOL the first day. We easily found both sun & shade behind the slide, but shady spots were few. It was noisy, as we were at the ladder & shoot part of the slide. Again, I was amazed how small the resort was, as our room was only about 150-200 ft? from the pool area! Towels were plenty and the water clean. All Disney pools are "supposed" to be heated, but it certainly didn't feel like this one was! Try the toe-dip test before jumping in! The GIFT SHOP was adequate. The FOOD COURT was adequate for the size of the resort, but it was too small of a space. You basically ran into other people when you turned around and at peak time the lines from the food stations and the registers ran into each other, leaving virtually no room to maneuver. Because of this one night we walked to Riverside for supper and our last morning, we brought the food back to the room instead of dealing with the crowded food court & noise. (Keep in mind this was not a busy season!) I wish there had been a "check yourself out" option! It was my BFF's BIRTHDAY. They noted this and left a Mickey b-day card and Photopass discount card for her. I knew to allocate necessary time for the BUSES to the parks (45min to 1hour for transport), but that wasn't necessary in Oct. Wait times were as expected 5-15 min. We only went to Magic Kingdom & EPCOT, and those took no more than about 35 min. max. I fully expected to share buses with Riverside. However, either per the season/our timings or just luck, we never had to share with Riverside! Yay! At closing of EPCOT (during Food & Wine Fest), we were also lucky to have a bus line of only about 10 people and got a bus within 10 min., which Riverside had 4-5 rows of the switchbacks filled. (I felt sorry for them.) To go home we used MAGICAL EXPRESS. Since we were so close, we took our bags to Bell Service instead of calling them. The bus was right on time. I was surprised how many people from our resort climbed on; we nearly filled the bus. So it was also surprising that we then also stopped at Old Key West and Saratoga Springs. (I know the buses usually make a few stops, but that bus was packed!) We were the 2nd stop at the airport and still arrived very early. I was hoping this stay at a moderate resort would "reground" me to staying at that level instead of the higher level resorts in the future. But like all things Disney, it only confirmed we like the best! After staying at deluxe/vacation club resorts and having stayed at all 4 moderate resorts, it will be incredibly hard for me to stay at a moderate again. POFQ was fine for this trip, as it was short and we spent most of the time running to the parks. POFQ would also be perfectly fine for those who have never stayed at Disney or not stayed at a higher level resort. (I remember when we loved the values resorts!) It would be great for those who don't want to walk distances. For me, I want the most from my Disney $ & time. So location is super important (close to more dining options & parks), and if I'm spending a day at the resort, I'd like more amenities/impressive environment. So for our 25th! Disney trip in Dec., I'll be back at a vacation club resort. Again, don't get me wrong, POFQ is perfectly fine; I've just gotten spoiled by the others! Happy to answer ANY questions!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: RuthKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans French Quater from 05 Oct to 19 Oct 2010. Myself and husband took our 8 year old grandson for his birthday. We had a fantastic holiday it was only our second visit to Orlando and first stay at a Walt Disney World Resort Hotel. The hotel is lovely the grounds are beautiful and the boat to Downtown Disney a big asset. The Transport system (buses) are great too never waited long to go to any park. the buses are clean , air conditioned and many drivers are great entertainment, Even singing happy birthday to our grandson on his birthday. Once your in Disney World it's hard to escape !! just because they make it s so easy to stay there. We were there a week before we relised that we hadn't been out or visited the Universal Parks!. The only thing I would say is hire a car even if only for a week of your stay as if you want to get 'out to universal or shopping the bus service is hard to find and a bit of a pain, so we got cabs which are around 30 dollars each way. Also the beds are surpising small (only 4 foot I think). Having visited America before was very surprised to find such small beds. We recommand Port Orleans French Quater to anyone especailly with the Disney dining plan which is brilliant and saved so much money , we left still having over 10 meals unused. Also the free refilable cup your given on arrival at the hotel is great , free hot and cold drinks for the entire stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reviewing just the hotel, not Walt Disney World or our trip, it's just average...”
Reviews.Author: theepp
Reviews.Content: This review is going to try to focus on the property itself, rather than our overall vacation (great) and customer service (top-notch) experience which would have been the case regardless of where we chose to stay. I gave it three stars because at its price point, based on its "moderate resort" competition, it is only average. We have stayed at the Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter in the past, so long ago that it was simply called the Port Orleans and Riverside was called Dixie Landings. Because of that, we were confident that for our first family trip, this would be the place to stay. The front desk upgraded us to a river view room for not charge, as it was our annivesary....but that was after I asked, it wasn't volunteered. (for the record, I did not expect it to be, river view was not available when I booked, otherwise I would have reserved it) The first surprise was that it really had not changed much in the past 12 years. The double beds (we knew the size of the beds going into it, but what $175 per night hotel still has double beds?) felt like they had been there the past 12 years. The TV was an old 19" 4:3 tube model. The decor both in the rooms and around the property, well you get the point. Everything was clean and well kept, but it really had more of a highway Comfort Inn that of a classically themed Disney hotel. On to the food...there are not a lot of dining facilities at French Quarter, as compared to other Disney resort hotels. There is no sit down restaurant, just cafeteria style, and the food there is mediocre, at best. The beignets were flat-out disgusting compared to those at Cafe du Monde in New Orleans and the french toast was consistently cold. Note that if you are on the dining plan and you want a sit down meal (i.e. waitress service), you will have to leave the property. Night life is minimal, which is probably good for families that turn in early. The bar is small, but it does the job if you want a nightcap before turning in. The live music was entertaining for a little while. Strolling around the grounds, they were nice and meticulously kept, as well as quiet. The pool area is nice, but, again, is falling behind the quality of the pools at other similarly priced properties on site. As an Epcot hotel, the location is excellent. Buses were relatively efficient, no more than about a 15 minute wait for the bus to any park. The boat to Downtown Disney is great and just outside your door. Transportation to the Magic Kingdom will take a little bit longer, something to consider if Magic Kingdom is your top priority. Would we stay here again, probably not. In reality, it really is just a place to lay your head, to recharge for the next day in the parks, but the aged decor and minimal services do not justify the price point. We would likely try Riverside (additional services, likely the same rooms & decor) or Coronado Springs (queen sized beds, newer resort & more amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome :)”
Reviews.Author: Kavo55
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando five times and this was our first time staying on Disney. We travelled with our 2 daughters who are 20 and 22. This was the best Disney vacation we have had. So convenient to stay on Disney property. WE had the Disney Dininig Plan as well and we prebooked all of our suppers when we booked our trip. Resort is great, nice pool area and there is a riverboat for travel to downtown disney. I highly recommend staying at this resort and getting the dining plan it worked so well for us. I seriously dont think that I will ever stay off site again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jhleeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you would expect from Disney, clean,efficient and a great place to stay. The rooms were spacious and well equipped. The swimming pool was great although a little cold in April. The lifeguards were so efficient it was amusing to watch! We found the bus transportation too and from the Disney parks very efficient and never had to wait longer than about 15minutes for a bus. The only down side was the hotel food, typical American fast food although since we last stayed they do seem to have discovered salad and fruit which is a start! We found the best place to eat was at Downtown Disney. The river boat to the Downtown Disney area was fabulous, again very efficient with regular service. The queue at the French Quarter was never very long and we only had to wait for the second boat once, the queues at the Riverside Hotel looked huge! We became stranded due to the ash cloud and although our holiday company moved us to another hotel we found that for our last day the hotel staff were so helpful, allowing us to us the reception computer to contact work and friends by email. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney charm, great atmosphere, good location, crappy food”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: Disney really knows how to make things magical. From the free motor coach that pics you up from the airport and starts playing theme music as you reach the hotel to the beautiful decorations and amazing scenery. If you go to disney you should stay on the property to get extended hours in the park and for he proximity and convenience. The rooms have themes and very good AC but are below the usual amenities of most hotels. They are old and the beds are simple. It's like a very big group of motels that have cool decor. Buses take you to all the parks and staff is friendly. If you like Disney and want to be a kid for a bit again you will not be let down. All you really need the room for is to sleep. The perks are what you are paying for ( extended park hours and proximity, disney themes) The towels are arranged in mickey ear-like designs. The hotel is connected to Riverside by a free boat shuttle and by buses. There is an outdoor pool and a jacuzzi. The restaurant serves greasy junk food but breakfast is a must for Mickey mouse waffles. The decor is amazing. I visited Port Orleans Riverside. It is much larger and harder to get around. it is more for adults (quiet, romantic) while French Quarter is more young, noisy and cool. I have to say that the night I can in there were bugs in my room. I think the room had no been used in a while. I was surprised they had not re-cleaned it before I came. I think it was an exception but still. If it was any other place but Disney I would have been upset. Bottom line: Disney magic, many perks included (airport coach, extended hours, shuttle to parks) unique themes, moderate prices but very basic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fall break trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: CharlaBenton
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the French Quarter hotel and were upgraded to a river view and it was nice. The staff is friendly!! There is a boat you can take for free to Downtown Disney and it is great.This was our 7th trip. We've stayed at the Value Resorts also,Pop Century and Music, and I feel that the rooms aren't much better. You get a refrigerator,but it doesn't keep items real cold-we found it better to ice our little cooler down. It is quieter at the moderate resort and not as busy, but that also meant not as many buses come to the resort and we had many 15 minute waits for a bus.One day we quit waiting and drove to the theme park.The swimming pool with the slide was a great hit with the kids and the pool has many life guards to make you feel safe. We found this to be our best trip yet--perfect weather,parks weren't as busy. As much as we loved the scenery at the hotel, for the money, I would probably stay at the Value resorts next time.

Reviews.Title: “first time on disney park”
Reviews.Author: theoldcottage
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the french orleans resort in september and because of a booking error we were upgraded to the river view which was exellant and very quiet, we were on the free disney dinning plan which could be used on all the resorts as well as the parks and was really good value, there was so much food that we were unable to use all the credits, most of our dinning venues were at downdown disney where we used wolfgang puck, earl of sandwhich and the irish fish and chips. we hired a car but hardly used it, it was so easy to use the buses and the boat that took you to downtown disney. the rooms were large but there were only two of us, the bathroom was small but there were plenty of towels that were changed daily, the pool was never too crowded, plenty of beds for everyone and also plenty of pool towels, french orleans is smaller than the other resorts, if you like it quiet then it is for you, not a lot to do at night but you are not far from downtown disney, everythings is there

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandGal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now with our toddler. The rooms are comfortable and have everything needed and the free refrigerator in the room is a definite plus for snacks and drinks (or leftover meals). The grounds are kept immaculate and the staff is wonderful. The hotel is pretty quiet and the food court has a lot of food offerings for everyone. The pool is nice and large and the boat that takes you to Downtown Disney is great. It was nice also being able to stay in a hotel that didn't take you forever to walk from one place to another and the buses to the theme parks where on time and in a location close to all the hotels. We love this place and will always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: letsgometsgo
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at POFQ, normally my friends and I stay at the sister resort, Riverside. It was quite a nice change. FQ is much smaller than Riverside (less walking to far off rooms), one bus stop (i.e. the bus is rarely full), and it is very quiet. It is a bit darker in decor when compared to Riverside, but that is something you get used to quick. One downside is the boat ride to Downtown Disney as FQ is the second stop so sometimes the boat is already full with passengers from Riverside and they can't take anymore. Not so bad when it is after 4pm and the boats run every 10 minutes, but prior to that they only run every 20min. The first few boats of the day tend to be crowded. Rooms are comparable to Riverside, two full size beds, two sinks, fridge. I think we may have a new preferred moderate resort to stay at when we go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWD
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Very pretty landscaping, loved the look of New Orleans. Food court was very convenient and had lots of meal options. Kids loved the pool. Easily scheduled meals with the concierge. Front desk was very helpful when we needed medicine delivered to the hotel because our daughter became sick.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: minushka72
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 9/27-10/1/2010. This was our second stay at this resort. We were in a standard courtyard view room (#1727) in building 7 which is one of the buildings farthest (not a long walk though)from the food court, pool, shops and arcade. Even though it is farther away it is a very short walk which is why we like this resort. It is a quaint mardi gras new orleans theme and very compact rather than sprawling like most Disney resorts. The room was clean and big enough for me, my husband and our 2 children (4 year old boy, 8 month old girl) My 4 year old son loves the pool with the sea serpent slide. We also feel that the food is pretty good for cafeteria style and has very large portions. We had the BBQ ribs and pot roast dinners. I also love the beignets from the bakery window. They are made fresh all day long. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As Always, Disney Resorts are Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PammieJB
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to WDW, and my second staying at Port Orleans French Quarter. This is the smallest of the resorts, but not small on atmosphere! The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and welcoming, and the overall experience was just what you'd expect from a Disney resort, even a 'moderate' one. We love the proximity to Downtown Disney (you can take the boat), and the shared pools with Port Orleans Riverside. There's a nice, nearly 2-mile loop that winds through both resorts and the river for walks or runs. The pool was clean, and the Mousekeeping was excellent. We prefer staying on the Disney resorts since the bus transportation is so much more convenient, and Port Orleans French Quarter has a wonderful Bourbon Street feel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay for Familes with Preteens”
Reviews.Author: winm
Reviews.Content: We were given a corner room. It was nothing amazing, but for a family of four with two children, ages 9 and 11 it was a good place to come home and sleep after a day at the parks. I did bring an Aero bed for my youngest as there are only double beds at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite!"”
Reviews.Author: gail--r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 4yr, old grandaughter stayed here for a week in June. The grounds and pool were lovely. She loved the water slide down the dragon. The room was well themed and roomy enough for the three of us. I felt the lighting was not in line with the room. I would have liked to have a bedside lamp instead of a wall mounted glare in the evening, but that is just my opinion. The biggest disappointment came from the bedbug bites and the lack of follow up on Disney's part. I dropped over 3k on this week and I still feel robbed. I spoke with a Disney Rep. back in July and he never got back to me as promised. I put off writing this review until now, because I thought they would make things right, but now I only wish to warn others about the problem before they spend their hard earned cash. Stay outside of the world if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Disney resort but transportation to parks could be better”
Reviews.Author: oscaris15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the French Quarter with my partner for 12 nights from 23rd September and this was our first experience staying in a Disney resort, recommended by a colleague. The magical express service from the airport was very efficient and took about 30 minutes. The check-in was friendly and we found the resort was very pretty and tidy as you would expect from Disney. The room was a good size and overlooking the river as requested. The room appeared to have been decorated recently but the furniture and bathroom were a little worn and old fashioned, but there were lots of towels and toiletries and you just sleep there anyway. We took a kettle (we british need our tea) as you only get a coffee maker in the room, but there were no pottery cups or spoons, you just get paper cups so we would take mugs and spoons in future. The Sassagoula Floatworks was the food hall for this resort but the food hall at Riverside is only a five minute walk and was larger and had a slightly larger choice. We found the breakfasts were not very good value as a counter service on the dining plan so we used our snack allowance to get a muffin or a fruit cup for breakfast. It is better to use the counter service at the parks. We had lunch at Riverside once and it was very good, a pizza and pasta dish cooked to order with whatever ingredients we wanted. The music played at the resort started to get on our nerves a bit as it is the same over and over, in the food hall, outside the food hall and even around the pool. The bus service (every 20 minutes) was erratic and we often waited 30 to 40 minutes, and one time even 55 minutes! It always seemed to be worse when going back to the resport from the parks. Standing on the bus was the norm and we did sometimes worry about how safe this is. Also we don't think it is necessary to have music played on the bus, we just wanted a refuge from noise occasionally. The boat service to downtown disney was a bit slow, the wait was quite long and we actually gave up one day and didn't bother to go down there any more. We bought the resort mugs and we had about three drinks a day, so they were good value at about $28 for two for all our drinks for the whole stay. The maid service was very good and it was fun to see what shape the face flannels (wash cloths) would be each day. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay but we visited a few other resorts while there and we would go to Boardwalk another time as you can walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios in about 5 to 10 minutes and it would save all the waiting around for buses. Also we ate at the bakery at Boardwalk and they did really nice sandwiches and cakes, and quite big so you could share one counter service meal between two. We spent most time in Epcot as the restaurants were so good for the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in a crazy place”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaKml
Reviews.Content: I've been to several other Disney Resorts over the years but this was my first time @ the French Quarter. Accompanied by a friend on her first visit to WDW, we arrived Sept 30th for a long weekend planning to do the Food & Wine Festival at Epcot. We did the online check-in and used Magical Express as well. Upon arrival, we strolled off the bus and were greeted by the doorman, dressed in a wild suit complete with sequins and complete with a huge feather on his glittery top hat. He gave us Mardi Gras beads and directed us to the concierge desk. Our room was ready even though it was just past noon. We were given our tickets , took a quick peek at the grounds and headed out to the park. We had to wait about 20 minutes for the bus & then stopped at ALL the Riverside stops as well so it took over 40 minutes to get to Epcot.. Buses are rare and wonderful things at this resort, we never seemed to time it right and some people were complaining loudly. I suppose this is what prompted CMs with clipboards and watches to appear in subsequent days. Even so, travel was always hit or miss. When we returned after Illuminations that night, it was a gorgeous peaceful walk to our building (number 1) and we had a view of the courtyard with a tinkling fountain. Our room number was 1343 and it was more than fine. Perfectly clean, towel Mickey on the bed. Bathroom was clean and no signs of mold, mildew, etc that other posters experienced. We had plenty of towels, soaps and shampoos. No dust anywhere and certainly no cobwebs. We breakfasted at the Sassagoula Floatworks Food Court the next morning and the food was hot and the area clean, we chose to eat outside and people-watch. The tables outdoors were clean as well and a CM roamed around periodically wiping tables as people finished. We walked to Riverside one evening to see Yee Haw Bob Jackson perform, what a terrific evening! It's only a few minutes to walk along the river and it is absolutely beautiful at night. When we returned, we had the first of many towel animals waiting, a butterfly on the edge of the sink. Too cute. Also, another comment to do with cleanliness, we had YeeHaw Bob autograph a picture and somehow I dropped it behind the dresser where the TV is located. Well, I tell you, that is some HEAVY furniture, it took 2 of us to scoot it out so we could retrieve Bob. There was no dust or crumbs, anything behind that dresser, I guess we had a supercalifragilistic Mousekeeper! The chairs by the little table had some scuffs but it wasn't like it was beat up or anything. I do agree, the rooms need updated but don't expect it to look like an Interstate Motel, it really is pretty and again, I stress- clean! We also took the boat to Downtown Disney one evening, we left at dusk and watched the lights come on at the resorts along the river, a really nice way to travel and it was the one transportation option that did not haul us around all the stops at Riverside before heading to our destination. Back to concierge, we stopped by on Saturday to pick up our tickets for the Spirit of Aloha Dinner Show and Gerry could not have been more helpful. All the staff here is very kind and seem genuinely concerned that you enjoy your stay. The next day, my friend checked her bank acct and found her credit card had been charged for the dinner tickets which were part of our dining plan. However, Joan, another concierge member remedied that in a jiffy and we were off to the parks again. Joan was really funny, this was a Sunday morning with a lot of people coming and going, some were pretty cranky but she kept her smile and cheery attitude through some rough moments. We commented on that and she laughed, said she understands people have been traveling and it's exhausting. She said concierge is usually the first Disney Cast Member people meet so they go out of their way to make it a good experience and set the tone for the rest of the stay. I thought that was great. Other than updating the rooms a little and revamping the bus system, I wouldn't change a thing about this hotel. It was a perfect quiet haven after a crazy day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Possible the best-located of the Disney resorts”
Reviews.Author: AngleRaise
Reviews.Content: Location was great. A short bus-trip to all the parks, and a quick ferry ride to Downtown Disney. I preferred eating at the Riverside section, but that was also just a quick ferry ride. The problem I saw with Riverside was that the bus lineups at the parks was much longer for Riverside than it was for French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...BUT Rooms Need to be Renovated”
Reviews.Author: VegasLovesDisney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times when we only need a place for a night or two. We usually stay at the Deluxe Resorts when visiting any longer. This is a decent moderate hotel. It is smaller than the other moderate resorts which makes it very convenient when coming back from the parks after a long day. We have never had to wait more than 20 minutes for a shuttle bus no matter what time of year we have visited. They do have a convenient store as well as a food court area. The outside of the resort looks like it has been freshly painted except for the doors on the hotel rooms. Unfortunately, the rooms are run down and need to be re-furbished. The bathrooms are small and the tubs desperately need to be scrubbed or replaced. I realize the Deluxe Resorts are much more expensive, but if you can get a deal on them, I highly recommend staying at one of them. Our favorite is the Yacht & Beach Club. They are BEAUTIFUL and offer so many more amenities. The rooms are larger and they have an amazing pool area. There is NO comparison between the moderate resorts and the Deluxe Resorts. Treat yourself and I promise you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “What Happend”
Reviews.Author: JBLANCASHIREUK
Reviews.Content: We started staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter in 1996 and have returned every 2 years.It has always been a great place to stay,untill this year.It is still very clean and the staff are wonderful, the gardens are immaculate but the rooms are well overdue a make over.The bathroom was neglected to the point the surface of bath was missing in places,the wall sockett moved when you plugged the hairdryer in.Gone are the fluffy towels.The mattress was of the kind you rolled into the middle whether you wanted to or not.The bedroom furniture look tired and the television was very retro.It is an none smoking hotel and there are designated areas ,but unfotunately one is outside the food court therefore it isnt very pleasent if you wish to eat outside.Also the non smoking rule was not policed very well. Apart from the these little problems it is still a great place to enjoy and relax after a hectic day in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort but rooms desperately need updating!”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyann13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter for ten nights with my teenage son. This was our second visit, previously staying in 1997 and the rooms have not been updated since this time! Our room was a good size for the two of us but the furnishings etc were old and shabby. The bathroom was awful, the bath being old and stained and with some of the tiles cracked. The beds were comfortable and we didn't get any bites from bed bugs as other visitors have mentioned. Mousekeeping was good. On the plus side, this is a lovely resort in all other aspects. The grounds are tranquil and well maintanined. The pool area is a hit with all ages and was patrolled by numerous lifeguards. There is a quick service food court which has a good selection on offer and we always found the staff at the resort friendly and helpful at all times. The bus transportation was very good and the longest we waited was about 15 minutes. The theming of French Quarter is very well done and in keeping with the theme throughout except for the bedrooms! Another great aspect of this resort is the boat service to Downtown Disney. We found it such a lovely way to travel to and fro especially on warm nights. All in all I would recommend this resort if you can put up with the accomodation as it has so much going for it. We really enjoyed our stay and would definately return if renovations were due to take place in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney resort... so far!”
Reviews.Author: adrianacollado
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights b/c it was one of the host resorts for the Wine & Dine Half Marathon. This is now my new favorite Disney property. The resort is very quiet and peaceful and the buildings, foliage and ambiance are absolutely beautiful - almost more New Orleans than New Orleans itself! There's a river that runs across the rear of the resort and ferries to Riverside and Downtown Disney. I do agree with other posters that the rooms are a bit worn and in need of a serious technology update. Why Disney doesn't provide Wifi or a decent TV is beyond me. Housekeeping was very good and would leave different little towel animals in unexpected places. The beds were nice and comfy - I actually slept quite well and (thankfully!) did not have a bedbug experience like some other posters. My only complaint is directed to the food court, which as per usual Disney, is overpriced and generally mediocre. That said, I would definitely stay here again - I actually liked POFQ much better than the more expensive Saratoga Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyC1
Reviews.Content: This was probably the 10th time I have stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter. Although the rooms are the same size and layout as the other mid-priced Disney properties (Caribbean Beach, Coranado Springs, etc), I love the look and feel of this particular hotel. The design with the quaint streets, parks and fountains make it a very attractive hotel. The location "on the river" is a plus scenery wise and well as the water transportation to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is a definite moderate experience”
Reviews.Author: lovinglifeGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter September 22-26. This was our first time at a Disney Moderate Hotel and it was exactly that - moderate. Not that it is a bad thing, just different from our past experiences. The Highlights - ~Mickey Mouse Not so Scary Halloween - a must do for everyone! We enjoyed it tremendously and will do again. ~Boatwright's restuarant - Great food, Good Atmosphere and excellent service! ~Dining plan - fabulous and will do again on the next trip. ~French Quarter - nice grounds, peaceful atmosphere, great pool, excellent food court for coffee and quick snack. ~Boat service to parks and downtown disney - Wonderful, nice change from the bus. The Lowlights ~ Monorail - if you have ever stayed at one of the Deluxe hotes than you will miss this. We felt as if it wasn't a true experience since we didn't get on the monorail. ~ French Quarter - Rooms are outdated, worn and yes, I had bites all over my feet from bed bugs...had to wear socks the second night of our trip till the end due to the bites! The staff wasn't overly friendly, didn't really have the "Magical" feel to it as some resorts. Overall it was a good time, Disney always is but not sure we would stay at the French Quarter again, we will spend a little more money and go back to the Deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SuzyX5
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the French Quarters, it was just as nice if not better than the first time. Staff is very friendly and personable. Next time we go we are going to get a water view. The food is great for a quick service. Kids love the pool. Will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort With Great Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Janilou
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten days. Loved walking along the river and my younger daughter really enjoyed the pool with the water slide. Once we learned our way "around" the place, it was more than comfortable. We were thirty seconds walk from a bus stop and never waited more than ten minutes for a bus. Most of the time, they were there in minutes. Housekeeping was awesome. They made my daughter a new towel animal every day. Never saw anything to complain about in the room, and the grounds were beautiful. We didn't eat at the restaurant here so I can't comment on that. We had the Disney Dining Plan (which I highly recommend to anyone) and ate at the parks most of the time. The complimentary fridge in our room was great for keeping drinks cold.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool and relatively peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Kirk0
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 1 week at Port Orleans French Quarter with our family and really enjoyed our time at the resort and in the parks. Highlight of this hotel is the pool and the smaller size versus other moderate resorts, which I think makes it a bit quieter and gives you slightly better service in terms of transportation. Rooms are as advertised, not real big but fine for a family of 4. Two double beds, refrigerator, two sinks and a bath. Curtain separates sinks from sleeping area. Rooms are clean and comfortable. As well, appeared very quiet. We never heard any noise at all from any other rooms. We also got a room near the main lobby, which made transportation and going to the pool very convenient. Pool here is very nice. Very large, with a nice slide for the kids and some waterfalls. We really enjoyed the pool. The food court is ok. Fine for breakfast which is all we used it for. A bit busy, but always able to find a table and never more than 10 minutes before we were eating. Transportation to and from parks were generally very good. Most mornings the bus went directly to the Theme Park and we were always there in less than 30 minutes including wait time. Only once did we need to also stop at all 3 Riverside stops before going to the park which was a longer trip. Evenings were fine as well except for after big evening shows, and then you needed to waited for 2-3 buses, but that is standard for most resorts. Location seemed pretty good. Very close to Epcot and not too far from any of the Parks. Service was fine ... prompt and friendly. We would go again to this resort and recommend for others. We have no other comparisons, but did enjoy our time at French Quarter. We also really enjoyed the convenience of staying on resort. We used the bus service from Orlando Airport and the Disney Transportation system once there and this really made for an easy and stress free vacation. All of the services were very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good ... BUT”
Reviews.Author: Maisqueporra
Reviews.Content: Overall, nice setting - not too big, decent eatery (except the coffee -yuck). Price is lower than other disney hotels. BUT - the housekeeping is poor - dust, hair and stain are too common in rooms. Rooms are smallish, and need updating. Worn furniture, old bed spreads and TVs. It is 8 minutes to most parks, but due to the weird road system 15 minutes back. Nice pool - but my son got swimmers ear in it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: superwomanpine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and we were really impressed with this hotel. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The boat trips that run from the hotel to the riverside and downtown disney ran regularly and was a welcome change from using the shuttle buses. The bus service from the hotel to the parks was convenient and efficient and we never had to wait any longer than 20mins for a bus. We much preferred the feel of the French Quarter to that of the Riverside, the French Quarter is smaller and has a more peaceful feel. My Kids loved the pool which was open till midnight, again the pool was very clean and well maintained. The only downfall this hotel has, is its limited dining options, the dining hall doesn't offer much healthy food. The dining halls serves mainly foods such as Hotdogs, cheesburgers etc (we were sick of the sight of the fast food by the end of our trip) However, its a short trip to Downtown and there was lots of dining options there. I'm sure we will be returning to this hotel for another holiday. Lastly, the staff have to wear such terrible looking uniforms! Feel so sorry for them, they have to be the worse uniforms ever!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Luvorlando1
Reviews.Content: I've been to WDW many times and this was the first time we were here. I traveled with my husband and 2 kids, ages 11 & 12. We got my son a cot but the room was very small and it became cramped and hard to get around once the cot was opened up. Decorations were nice but I felt the room should have felt better cared for considering the recent renovations. As usual, the TV on WDW property is horrible which I discovered because I got sick while there and was stuck in the room for 2 days. The weirdest part was how confusing the walkways were, I used the laundry room and kept having a hard time finding my way back to our particular room and building. The grounds were absolutely lovely but maze-like. The beds themselves are very small which was fine when the kids were little but has now become a problem. I didn't like that there wasn't a restaurant there any longer, years ago there was a nice one. Being able to visit Downtown Disney by boat is always nice which is limited to a few resorts. The bus service and Magical Express are always nice, but that's at any WDW resort. Overall I think the place is fine but it was just too cramped for us, we've outgrown these sorts of accomodations. I don't think I'll ever go back as a family but I would recommend it to families like us on a tight budget, people with young kids who don't need much space or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DJwog
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there a few years back and had decided to return, as we had gotten an excellent room rate. Upon arrival, there was no crowd, and a very short wait for check in. Desk cast members were very helpful and courteous and were able to grant our request for adjoining rooms. They asked what special occasion we were celebrating, and gave us buttons to wear to the parks. Our room was in building 6 on the 3rd floor, furthest from the elevators. This may be a consideration if you need to be closer as it was a good walk to the elevators from our rooms. Rooms were neatly appointed and I believe that the rooms had been repainted not too long ago. AC was meat locker cold and wasn't noisy at all. Beds were comfortable. Toilets were as stated by others noisy to say the least, but a minor nuisance. The Showers were nice and clean, although the shower head massage head was on its last leg and hard to change settings. One thing we were hoping for was a towel character from the maid, but never got one..oh well. The food service at the hotel was ok, nothing fancy. But stayed busy. Get the refillable cup. May seem expensive ($14.00) on the outset, but got my moneys worth as you get free refills at the resort (hotel) drink stations. The pool was very nice, the kids love the water slide, Although they close the slide at 8 PM when the life guards are off duty. There is a nice boat ride shuttle to Downtown Disney from the hotel. Another nice perk. Bus service was available there too. The bus service to the parks was never longer than a 15 minute wait and a short walk from the room. One bad thing is if you have a lot of luggage you might be better getting bell service to help. They will not let you use the baggage carts by yourself. We had an incident where one of our vehicles had a dead battery when we were checking out, Front desk was called and security promptly arrived and assisted in getting it started. Thanks Michael! All in all a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: JR123connecticut
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I recently spent three nights at the French Quarer. I found the location and rooms to be good. The room was spacious for the two of us and there was good shuttle service to all the parks and the ferry boat to Downtown Disney. The beds were a bit old and did not do wonders for my back, but overall it was okay. My main complaint would be the food, in my opinion it was horrific. I understand it was cafeteria style service, which is fine, but for the prices they are charging, the quality was terrible, I would avoid the hotel restaurant. One piece of advice would be to by a souvenir mug as soon as you arrive. It is worth the price, since Mickey charges $3 for a bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and Serene”
Reviews.Author: Mousejunkie
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week at this resort. The exterior courtyards were attractive and well maintained, as was the pool. Although the food court is "famous" for its beignets, the cornbread won my heart! The staff was very friendly. We received Halloween candy at check-in. Housekeeping was satisfactory. Taking the boat to Downtown Disney was a delightful experience. We requested a room in building 4, which is closest to the bus stops but we were never bothered by engine noise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Becky_993
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a disney hotel before on any previous visits to orlando, but can only reccomend this hotel. The food services where great(reccomend beignets) a specialty cake like treat of the resort. We where given refillable resort mugs which so easy to use with the long opening hours of the food hall, you could not only get soda but a wide selection of other drinks at any time during your stay. We also used the dining plan and was so easy to use and great value, the plan easily gave us enough as all of the portion where very big anyway. The rooms where spotless and all staff where very helpful. Transportation around the resort was spot on and we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus.Using the parks magic hours where very good we would have everthing done by 11. Loved disney and loved this hotel would reccomend with out a doubt and would go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: DznyLvr2005
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this resort. I've stayed at all the Disney moderate resorts and this was my favorite one by far. We were in room 3225. It's small, everything is close, there's an elevator (needed one with a baby and stroller) and there's a beautiful walking trail to Port Orleans Riverside. What a huge difference from Coronado Springs and Caribbean Beach Resort. We loved the pool, the crazy dressed guy out in the front giving out Dubloons (sp), the bus stop was so close, it was just a perfect week at Disney all thanks to PO French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expensive as we thought”
Reviews.Author: Sheena-Steve
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the above hotel. We stayed the first week on I-Drive and the 2nd week at Port Orleans FQ. On paper the week at Disney looked much more expensive than the Idrive hotel, but it wasnt. We were lucky to have free Quick Dining Plan which was 2 meals and 2 snacks each day. I thought that wouldnt be enough and we would need additional meals but we actually had over 40 snacks left at the end of the week (there were 6 of us) and used these to buy lots of sweets at the hotel shop to take home. Including all the free drinks it probably saved us about $250+ each day. The extra hours which are only available to those staying in Disney was helpful and meant we could have a few hours in 1 park then go back to the hotel for a rest or relax at the pool then go to another about 8pm and stay til late. I asked the bus driver how long the buses would be on until and was told until about 1-2 hours after the parks close even if that meant two in the morning. Downtown Disney boats were on until 11.30pm but buses until after 2am as well. Staying at FQ I think was better than Riverside as everything was close by. 1 bus stop at front of hotel, beside restaurant, pool and spa in front of restaurant, and river in front of that. No long distances to walk for us which was nice. Rooms were smaller than I-Drive hotel, with smaller fridge and no microwave but clean and quiet. As food supplied on disney disposable plates you could carry tray with meals back to your room if too tired to sit in restaurant. Visited a few other hotels while there and preferred ours, if go back in future will probably stay there. Hard Rock cafe was disappointing compared to previous visits but Planet Hollywood exciting and worth the money, atmosphere and food made it an evening to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Same French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: FanOfLands
Reviews.Content: This is not the same French Quarter where I have stayed in the past and given positive reviews. I hope Disney restores this resort and service at this resort back to its better days. After 2 nights at this resort I moved to a different resort. This place has become a big disappointment. Room was not clean; I won’t say it was real dirty, but not real clean either. Service has fallen off a lot and for the first time this resort really had the feel of a low to mid-range Motel 6 or Super 8. I actually think a mid-range Super 8 would have better beds, furnishings, service, and would probably be cleaner. It is really sad that French Quarter has been so neglected. This was a fantastic resort in a great location for years. I hope this resort can be restored both in terms of service quality and resort quality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ALteacherK
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Disney world and the POFQ. It was great! I did online check in, and when I arrived the check in time was less than 5 minutes. Everything was prepared in advance for me. I had requested ground floor near the transportation, and both of my requests were granted! We stayed in building 4 and we were close to the food court, transportation and pool, as well as being on the ground floor. Our room was very clean and nice. As some others have stated, it did seem slightly dated, but this did not bother us in the least. Mousekeeping kept the room tidy for us all week and we always had clean towels. I saw no signs of bedbugs, and believe me, I looked! The pool is fabulous and there are plenty of chairs for all. It was incredibly refreshing after a morning in the parks. There is a laundromat next to the pool area, and it is clean and nice as well. I did a load of laundry one of the nights we were there, and it washed and dried within an hour. The transportation was good. We never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes for a bus, and we usually were able to sit. Several times during the week I witnessed people giving up a seat for a woman with a sleeping child. The food court was adequate. It is expensive as is everything disney. It was clean, and the staff there was more than friendly. I dropped my plate of beignets at the register one night, and the man immediately went to the window and got me a fresh plate without charging me for my clumsiness. I loved the POFQ. I will always stay there when visiting disney world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would Recommend to Anyone Looking for Value and the Disney Experience. Also Great for Kids.”
Reviews.Author: jamesslitdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before Labor Day, below are highlights: Positives: Beautiful Premises with many quiet areas for walking or just taking in views of the river, fountain, or surrounding scenery Bus Service to the Parks: Short wait-time (always less than 10 minutes), always got a sea (no standing) Beautiful River behind the resort with ferry service to Downtown Disney Friendly and accomodating Staff Room was clean, beds were comfortable Room Service was great (and they leave neat towel figures also) Pool is very big (water slide is also cool, but a lot smaller than in the pictures) Arcade is large and was good for our teenager Playground was good for the toddler Negatives: Food Court selection is limited. No Table Service Restaraunt on site. TV's in the rooms are old and channels are limited. Overall, a great stay-would recommend especially for families with children. One of the best resorts for buses to the parks as the bus stop is within walking distance of all buildings, the resort is small enough so there are not usually crowds at the bus stop, and busses came often for this resort. Also, since it is one of Disneys smaller resorts, no internal shuttle is necessary-all resort amenities are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “An end of the day relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlyprr
Reviews.Content: From what I had read from other reviews it was exactly as I was hoping it would be. We had a bit of a walk from the shuttles but nothing terrible considering what you had just been through for the day, and for that walk we had complete isolation from everything else. We stayed at Building 1 in the back we were on the bottom corner, never heard a peep from anyone until the morning (the toilets are a bit scary loud when flushed). We were very close to the water taxi for downtown disney and just a walk between buildings for the pool. The food court seemed really expensive until you see the prices at other places and not so bad, lunch seemed the most expensive, dinner you got more for your money. Unless you drink alot of fluids, stay clear of the 14.00 refillable cup, this will add up if you have a decent size family, just go to the gift shop and buy a 2 litre of pop for 3.50 and use the mickey cups they supply you with and we had thermos that we kept the water in, refrigerators keep everything really cool. There is a small arcade enough to keep kids busy for a good hour, pool is decent, hot tub always busy but nice. Never wallked over to the other hotel, saw it enough from the shuttles. Shuttles usually always on regular schedule, except once when leaving Animal Kingdom the line was way back and when they finally did show up 2 came because of the size of the line. There are 2 bars, one inside and one by the pool very expensive can buy small bottles of liquor at gift shop for 18.00 but still cheaper than the bar. We packed 2 bottle of liquor in our suitcase and they went through fine. Make sure you get the locks approved by airports (they have pass keys that will open your locks without having them to cut your locks. We got ours at Walmart. You have the feel on New Orleans very pretty landscaping, all employees seem pretty nice, food court employees look tired and on their last nerve, but everyone else super nice. We always got our food to go, just ask for lids when you get your food and you are allowed to take the trays back to your room. Our room was very nice and quiet, we had the view of the back parking lot but still there was plenty of landscaping in front of it so you really didn't notice it that much. If you want scenery the fountain was right out by our front building with benches around it. We had room 1108 if interested. And finally if you are a stickler for not wanting noise or a lot of kids running around then you should choose french quarter instead of the riverside side. There was kids but not that many to take alot of notice. Our kids 15 and 7 were just as quiet as the other small amount of children there. Hope your stay was as enjoyable as ours. T

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate WDW Hotel - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: oli-business
Reviews.Content: This is a nice moderate hotel of WDW Resort. I've been to multiple WDW Hotels and this one is the most centrally located. Less than 20 minutes of bus ride to any WDW stop. You can't be more central. This resort is way smaller than the Riverside, so less wait at bus stops, at restaurants and at pool. It has also a better pool for kids. Rooms are clean, a little bit outdated, but you're there only to rest between crazy Disney days. If you have choices of moderate hotels, this is the one to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sade_10
Reviews.Content: After a shaky start with our party being split into 2 separate buildings & a really slow check in, we settled into our 11 day stay @ DPFQ. The beds were very comfortable & the room was clean but in need of updating - dark & old fashioned with heavy cumbersome furniture & a very clinical looking bathroom with no decor. However to be fair I had expected this, so was not surprised.Personally I would prefer clean & old fashioned than modern and dirty. We had an issue with a tap churning out black grit but was resolved by maintenance within 2 hrs. Lilia our housekeeper ensured that the kids had some lovely novelties to return to from their days out. Flannel puppies,doves,ducks, rabbits, butterflies. Staff were generally welcoming & friendly. Food was very average in a canteen style environment with paper plates & plastis forks. Ok for snacks & drinks but personally wouldn't eat there in the evening as quality of food in restaurants just off WD resort cheaper & much better quality - and have real cutlery too! Pool area was clean & well maintained with lifeguards on duty, availability of towels & sunloungers was good too. Transport was excellent & included the bonus of a relaxing inclusive riverboat cruise to Downtown Disney. Overall would visit there again as I found it reasonably price but would want to see some updating first. Tip - buy yourselves an insulated souvenir refill mug on the 1st day to receive unlimited soft drinks & hot beverages during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rossa1125
Reviews.Content: "Unmagical" staff- they got the job done but that's it! On our 4th day there we found a pair of shorts under the bed that did not belong to us. They hadn't thoroughly cleaned our room in between guests. The shower had a slow drain so everytime you took a shower you had a bath also! At least half the pool towels were stained. The bus service was HORRIBLE!!! Standing room only 90% of the time. But that wasn't the worst part of the transportation....not one person would offer a seat to my husband holding our sleeping 18 month old on more than one occassion. I can't believe we had to ask people for a seat in this situation. Do not stay here! This trip has really questioned our attitude towards Disney. The magic is unfortunately gone :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Hotel a bit Tired looking”
Reviews.Author: Saultites
Reviews.Content: Just back from POFQ, with wife and kids (9 & 5). Overall a great experience. As stated by most reviewers, some aspects of the resort are well liked by all (pool, river, boat to downtown Disney, service, etc.). Instead, I will comment on a few aspects of the resort that people seemed to disagree on. Room: Definitely a bit tired and a bit worn. Portorleans.org has info about a big renovation this fall, with themed rooms (princes and frog, and haunted mansion), with all new decor and flat screens. Very cool (here is a link, scroll down to see the pic's,http://www.portorleans.org/news.php). But the room was adequate as it was. We had no bed-bug-bites, and were not really concerned about not having a flat screen TV. If you intend to spend a lot of time on a TV, stay home. This is Disney! Go enjoy! Yes you can hear when the toilet above you flushes, but I didn't find it too loud, and it never woke me up. I found the rooms to be clean. Buses: Some have complained about the bus service, and I don't get that at all. We found the buses to be frequent, and never waited more than a few minutes. Most of the buses in the morning didn't go to the Riverside area, but the afternoon bus occasionally did. This added about 10 minutes to the ride. Even still, the total time on the bus to Animal Kingdom was about 25 minutes. Maybe less. I loved the bus service, and would stay onsite again just to access the transportation service. Food and Dining Plan: We loved the food for adults, especially for my wife who has Celiac disease. The food (really in all of Disney) was great, especially for the gluten-free crowd. The exception was the kids menu. It was always nuggets, hot dog, mac'n'cheese, and pizza. Not great. The best aspect of POFQ was the size. It is by far the smallest onsite property. This means less people at the pool and restaurant, less distance for short legs to walk, and less people waiting for the bus (we've been home two days and 5 bet there are still people standing in the line for the Pop Century!). Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better, a bit disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: mjhoudart
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at Disney's and we paid more (moderate instead of value) to have a decent place to stay and sleep. Well, when we arrived in the room, it looked OK. FIRST' THE BAD NEWS !!!! The kids wanted to watch TV and we search all over the room and did not find the remote so my husband went to front desk to get one and he was told to call so someone could come and bring us one. 10 minutes later someone came. We asked for bell service because we had so much luggage, anyway, we waited more than an hour and my husband had to call back after 45 minutes to know what was going on ??? 2 days later, while walking in the room, i saw something underneath the bed cover on the floor... a TV remote !!! So, we finally found it !!! For our entire stay, we had 2 TV remote but that's not all... We found also an empty water bottle and an empty bottle of Advil under one of the bed along with some used chewy bars foil paper... And under the second bed, we found a black tank top and some more chewy bars foil paper meaning that the cleaning staff dont clean under the beds !!!! I know they are not paid much but they should check the cleanliness of the rooms randomly. Clean Glasses were only given 3 times during our 7 nights stay. Also, you hear the toilet flush of other rooms nearby. We have tried to rest in the afternoon and we always hear the toilet of someone around flushing !!! 2 days before we left, I had like 3-4 bites on my right leg (mosquitoes ???). It was itching and a bit painful ??? I read a previous comment and the person mention BEDBUGS !!!! Was there really bed bugs in the bed ???? THE GOOD NEWS !!!! We were in building 7, third floor and we really appreciate it, it was more quiet. The friendly Disney's concierge when we arrived was very pleasant (Laurent of Toulon, France). Food court was never crowded and meals were affordable (at dinner) and tasty. THE POOL !!!! Kids really enjoyed the pool very much with the dragon's slide !!! Perfect after a day at the parks !!!! To be a REALLY moderate resort, DISNEY should consider this : UPDATING THE ROOMS by adding queen size beds, new bedding and LCD TV. Also, I found cheap that no wi-fi was provided free. It should be a nice addition to those rooms. For everything else, staff is helpful, pool is great, food court is OK, bus transportation is good but could be better because a bus every 20-30 minutes, if you missed it, the ait is a bit long and even if they see someone coming by, they wont stop so you have to wait for the other one 20-30 minutes later !!!! I would recommend and hopefully return one day but they'll have to upgrade their rooms first.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Gator1993
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the French Quarter and I was very disappointed. When I first considered staying at Disney's moderate resorts, I believed that I would be staying at a hotel that would be some what upscale. However, I was greatly mistaken. The beds are covered with the traditional blanket and bedspread. The bathroom was in bad shape. There was mildew on the shower curtain and on the tile grout. The bathtub grout was also poorly applied and was also mildewed. The sinks were also poorly cleaned as there was gunk around the faucet and handles. The TV also had issues. Not what I would expect from a 3.5 star hotel. On our way to Orlando, we stayed at three hotels all of which would be considered 2 start hotels. All of those hotels had flat screen tvs and duvets of varying qualities. All except the last had new furniture and clean bathrooms. The furniture at the French Quarter had definitely seen better days. I don't have any complaints about the service which was excellent, although our housekeeper was a little sloppy. The pool is also excellent. My gripe is mainly that I paid extra for a moderate resort which should have had better quality bedding and bath than what we had. The Super 8 in Savannah (which I normally consider 1 star) was more luxurious than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My mom wanted to take me and my daughter...”
Reviews.Author: acudd
Reviews.Content: My mom wanted to take me and my daughter to Disney for vacation. We arrived on Monday night and a few mornings later I woke up with bites on my foot. These were 3 small to medium sized red spots in a row that itched like crazy. I work in the apartment industry and have heard way more than I want to about bedbugs. I couldn't find evidence of anything and didn't get bitten anymore but I wore tennis shoes & socks everyday & could only have gotten bitten in the room. When I went to the front desk the person I spoke to said that they could have pest control come the next day but that was the day we were leaving so it wasn't going to do me any good. The next day I spoke to someone else named Dawn who said that she thought that it looked like a bite by a type of fly that they have around that area. She told me to be sure to put cortizone cream on it. I told her that I thought that they should really check the room and treat it. Its been several days and I still have the marks on my leg and they just don't seem to be going away. I've worn myself out trying to find something else this could be but so far everything still points to a bedbug meal.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans - Good location, but amenties more like a Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CampbellvilleOntario
Reviews.Content: The location is great - you can take the boat to Downtown Disney. But the rooms were really tired - very mediocre and needed updating. There was no table service restaurant - you have to go to the Riverside Hotel which is quite a hike. I wouldn't stay here again. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: ldubelle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week long vacation at the French Quarter in September. It was a particularly good time of year to go because the weather was lovely and the traffic level in the parks was down. I had stayed in the French Quarter previously and was very excited to be going back. The grounds are gorgeous we enjoyed walking to the bus stop (NOT a big deal like some would say) each morning. The food court has a pretty good variety of quick foods for families on the go, but there are some nicer sit down choices in the parks and other resorts. The room itself is a nice standard room, all the room you should need in Disney...you come for the parks not cable in a hotel room. Overall it was yet another wonderful stay at the French Quarter its a wonderful resort in a very magical place!

Reviews.Title: “Love the French Quarter's quietness and majority of staff.”
Reviews.Author: jbp60885
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, pool area comfortable, entertainment and food court helps to start and finish your day off nicely. The only negative item I have to comment on after 5 visits to the Quarter is that there is NO BELL SERVICE OR AREA TO PLACE YOUR LUGGAGE AT CHECK IN! So be prepared to have someone in your party stay with your luggage while you check in and be ready to schlep your luggage to your room.

Reviews.Title: “I'm from Scotland, not England”
Reviews.Author: Jambo1874
Reviews.Content: My only complaint/concern is that I come from Scotland and for the whole stay as on my previous stays the cast members at the resort and parks expect the UK cast members thought I come from England They were puzzled and confused when I attempted to explain the difference to them that the UK is not just England but Wales, Northern Ireland and Scotland as well. Disney Magical Express: After landing at Orlando airport the Disney check in queue was very short mainly due to the time of night. Everything went very smoothly and within an hour of landing was at the reception desk checking in. The driver’s English was very poor and it was difficult to understand the useful information he was telling us. When it was time to leave the bus returned me to the airport in plenty of time to catch the flight home. Check In: I had booked through the UK Disney web site. When I presented the various vouchers for the accommodation and park pass I was sent I had to provide my personal details again as the Disney web site is not compatible with the UK site. As I had booked through the UK site I was unable to book in on-line and my requests hadn’t been passed on. Thankfully the very helpful cast member managed to sort everything out expect I was in building 6 rather than building 5 as requested and handed me my room card and information pack. The room card is also you park pass and you can charge everything you buy to it at the parks and have it delivered to your room. Room: I was in building 6 on the top floor overlooking the court yard which was only 2 minutes from the food hall, concierge desk, gift-shop and 3 minutes from the bus stop. The room was very comfortable with 2 double beds, fridge, coffee maker, in-room safe and plenty of storage space. The toilet flush is rather loud as is the a/c unit but you get used to it. I was never disturbed by any noise expect for the a/c unit the whole time. It was cleaned every day and was left several towel bunnies etc which I appreciated. Food Hall: The food was freshly prepared when you ordered it and was fine but the options are limited and never change. The refillable mug was handy as I had the Disney Quick (Counter) Service Dining Plan which was great but again limited your choices at the resort and parks. The queues at the register were reasonably quick even at the busiest times but you struggled to find a table at peak times. Frequently people never cleared the table or left dropped food so you had to clear their mess before you could sit down. Disney Transportation: I never waited more than 10 minutes for buses to any of the parks or downtown Disney. As mentioned before the buses expect for downtown Disney stop here first before going onto Riverside which has 4 stops unlike FQ which only has one so you always found a seat. The buses were clean and comfortable and the drivers informed you where to catch the return bus at each park and other information about the park. Sometimes the noise of understandably excited children and people talking made these announcements impossible to hear. After the firework shows at each park there were plenty of buses waiting so you never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes. You can also catch a ferry to downtown Disney and to the Riverside resort which are worth well catching. Concierge Desk: If you want to go to Sea World and Universal Studios the staff who are very helpful and friendly advised me to book a Mears shuttle which costs $20 return and you can specify the pick up and return times to suit your day. They were very happy to do this for me and it’s best to arrange this the day before you want to go. I was also able to exchange my traveller’s cheques here and book tickets for the amazing Cirque du Soleil at downtown Disney. Resort: The grounds are very beautiful and well maintained. I never used the pool which seemed popular going by the noise coming from it whenever I walked pass. The hot tub looked inviting but again I never used it. All the staff are friendly and approachable and seem to go that bit extra to make your stay enjoyable. The Riverside resort is only a 10 minute walk away along the river bank and you can catch the ferry to return. Unless you have a lap top you have to go to Disney Quest in downtown Disney to access the internet where it’s free as there is no Wi-Fi access at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gross service, grosser rooms, worst hotel on Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: Avp415
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear in April. We were supposed to be there for 5days 4nights, but after 1 night we asked to be moved to a different hotel. The beds are incredibly uncomfortable and springy ( and possibly have bed bugs) we woke up very itchy. The front desk staff is very inconsiderate and unwilling to go the extra mile like other resorts do. I found the ride to the park Was very long because you share busses. The food was overpriced and gross. The only good thing is the cute water slide that my daughter loved, but honestly this hotel is way overpriced for the quality and service of this hotel. I will NEVER stay here again! Save your money and stay at pop century because we had MUCH better experiences there!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for a honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: littlebluegiraffe
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The room was clean and well presented, and in an ideal location. We were in block four, which is not recommended in the guide books as it faces a garden instead of the pool / river. However, this meant that it was very quiet and the gardens were beautiful. It took about a minute to walk to the food court and the bus stop and two minutes to walk to the pool. Bus transport to the theme parks was excellent. The food court was very good, particularly the refillable drinks mugs. We were able to walk to Riverside resort and use the restaurant there - it took about ten minutes. All the staff we met were polite and very helpful. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very upset!”
Reviews.Author: luluburke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans, french quarter, in the beginning of July, 2010. The resort was set up nicely. However, upon looking for some of my personal items and my daughters items, that we brought with us to this resort, went missing during our stay at Port Orleans, French Quarter! I was violated, but because my items did not show up, i was made to be felt like the wrong doer! I still do not have the items I went with to the Resort with. Have been through the mill with Disney Claims Dept., and Hotel Guest services. Whom will not compensate my total loss! It has been a disgrace to the Disney Industry. If you decide to visit Port Orleans, French Quarter, bring an xtra lock, for your suitcase, while you are out enjoying your day, put any or all of your valuables in your suitcase and lock it! Bring the key with you! Just very upset over this whole ordeal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: forbsey1967
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney and what an experience. We had phoned down a few days before arriving to request a room location and they said they couldn't guarantee anything but would try. Well, when we arrived, they had accomodated us and it was wonderful. We were right on the river just 10 steps from the pool and 15 steps from the dock. Everybody was so friendly and receptive. The rooms, though, starting to show their age, were clean and just the right size for our family of 4. We did the dining plan and would do it again in a heart beat. It was a quieter resort which we had hoped for with a beautiful pool area. The only thing was that because our kids are now deemed adults, there was a lot of food wasted because they just could not eat the portions that were served.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessM7
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in no way disappointed by the Port Orleans-French Quarter. The grounds were beautiful, peaceful, and romantic. We opted for a river-view room which was a good choice. The resort is much smaller than other WDW resorts, so even the farthest room is a short walk to the entrance. It is also much quieter due to less guests/families. The bus stops at FQ first, so you always get a seat. And it drops you off first from the parks. There are also ferries that depart from the hotel every 20 minutes to Downtown Disney. The hot tub is open all night and is in a little secluded area, separate from the pool (which is also nice). There is a food court, but no restaurant. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Bizzy_Mom_of2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit last week and had a fabulous time! It was clean, convenient and service was exceptional. The buildings and amenities were close enough to each other so that at the end of the day when you and your kids are tired from the parks, or at the beginning of the day when you are desperate for coffee and beignets (yummmmm!) the walk is not devastating or painful. My kids loved the serpent pool and the resort area was well-manicured, peaceful and clean. The buses to the parks were timely, the water taxi to Downtown Disney was charming, and the staff (cast members) were so sweet to my kids - they gave them balloons, pirate scarves and toy jewelry. They seemed really invested in making our stay enjoyable. Yes, to be fair the room was very basic and could use an update, but it was clean and everything worked well (fridge, TV, lots of towels and soap/shampoo). We were there just to sleep and shower. It met our needs. But the real fun was outside the rooms doors. And in that respect, POFQ delivered! Enjoy your stay and do not worry. Also, love (love, love, love) the Magical Express. It did everything it promised.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING TIME IN ORLANDO!!”
Reviews.Author: WelcometoFL
