Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, son and his girlfriend stayed one night at this resort for my daughter's 20th birthday. With Florida resident rates, the room was the same price as the other hotels in the Orlando area. We had a very relaxing time. Swimming in the wonderful pool. There were a lot of people but because of the size it was not crowded. I love it because you can take the ferry to Downtown Disney. The dock was just steps away from our room as was the pool and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: kreme28pa
Reviews.Content: loved our stay there,only way the resort is lacking is in the food court.im a very picky eater and found the choices very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Chrystal1207
Reviews.Content: As usual Disney is extremely clean. This hotel is very quiet and great for small children. The only downfall I found was the dining area is not great, and it is appx a 45 min bus ride to Animal Kingdom. If you go take the ferry to Port Orleans Riverside for breakfast. Also, careful when you walk in I slipped and fell on my tush from the water fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Cleob62
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, staff was very friendly, hotel was an experience to remember, Disney does a wonderful job at entertainment, hotel rooms could use some updating, but we didn't spend alot of time in it, the overall experience was great would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not the quality I expected.....”
Reviews.Author: e3ward
Reviews.Content: This is suppose to be a Disney moderate resort.....I would say it's leaning more towards one of the economy ones. Pros: Staff was fantastic. Housekeeping was timely and always left clean towels and soaps. The outdoors was very nicely maintained. The pool on the property is fantastic, although very crowded. I guess guests from the adjoining Riverside property use it as well, even though there are pools on that property. Cons: Room needs updated. Our carpet was worn out, the fridge didn't keep anything cold, air conditioner was very loud, tv's are very old and didn't work well. Rooms are small as well. The buses that take you to various places are slow.....we waited on average 40 mins for each one (not that this is directly related to the property itself). For the almost thousand dollars we paid to stay here, I expected alot more than a cute, but badly need of renovation hotel. Next time we will just pay out some extra money and go for a deluxe resort.

Reviews.Title: “The stay at the hotel was moderate with a few drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: SheShe25
Reviews.Content: I tenjoyed staying at this hotel and having access to the parks without having to drive. I saved a ton in gas and in parking. I think the bathrooms need an upgrade, the beds need to be rid of bed bugs and the carpet needs a good steam cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible would not recomened”
Reviews.Author: carpet26
Reviews.Content: It was quiet and check in was easy that was it. The air conditioners were not working properly, the refridgerators were not working, rooms were very small, food was over priced and discusting,and you were waiting about 30min. to 65 min. for buses. We complained and nothing was done. This was my 8th trip to disney and by far my worst.I do not recommend the french quarter to anybody. The only good thing was the fairy to downtown disney.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but needs a small facelift.”
Reviews.Author: casmith_93035
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days while celebrating my sons birthday. Check-in was a breeze since I did it online prior to arriving to the hotel. Our room faced the river which was very nice. We were on the third floor and had a great view. The hotel remianed quiet the entire stay. Our room had two queen beds, small fridge, two sinks, etc. The room needed a bit of a facelft, as things looked a bit tired. The carpets needed to be cleaned as well as all the tiles. The room was large and roomy. All-in-all the room was perfect. The eatery at the hotel was sub-par. We only ate their twice, breakfast and dinner. Neither times were impressive. The gift shop has all the Disney things that one could want. Had a negative experience with the front desk. We had a piece of numbered, litimted pieces of art, which we purchased in the park, to be shipped ot our hotel. By the time we got it, the piece had significant damage to the matting and in general was mishandled. I called the front desk of the hotel to see what they could do to help and the lady was a bit rude and did not want to deal with this situation. Other than that, the stay was great. I recommend, if you have a car, there is a Walmart less than 2 miles from the property. Go there and get some groceries and store in the small fridge. This will save you money. In addition, the hotel is less than 2 miles from an array of non-Disney restaurants that can save you a bunch of money!

Reviews.Title: “Only one bus making a trip to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Granny069
Reviews.Content: Loved our room and stay a French Quarters only problem waited over 40 minutes for bus to Magic Kingdom The same driver came back over and over so it was very obvious there was only one bus making a round trip. Plenty of buses to other parks

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet & peaceful - close to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: hazelzak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks at the beginning of July and thoroughly enjoyed it. Its true that the rooms could do with a bit of an update and the tvs are old fashioned but this did not put me off at all. We stayed in building 5 which was perfect for the swimming pool , food court, reception, shop, water taxi and buses. No more than a 5 minute leisurely stroll to any of them. The buses were frequent - even over the busy 4th of July weekend - we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus and we never shared with Riverside. We used the water taxi frequently to get to Downtown Disney - a pleasant 10 minute boat ride - handy for meals at night and a bit of shopping! The water taxi runs every 10 minutes between 4pm and 11pm and was only closed down once during our 2 week stay due to lightning in the area. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here ( last year stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge) and would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but Rooms need rennovating & updating”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMom1997
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the resort for 6 nights. The pool was fun for the kids with the slide. I liked the gift shop and the food court's convience. We stayed in building 5 and had a view of the pool on the second floor which was nice. The bus transportation to disney parks was great-we didn't usually wait more than 10 minutes for a bus even though it was during July. The ferry to Downtown Disney was small and slow. The rooms need some updating/rennovating. The carpet is older. The bathtub shows age with worn out spots and stains. The shower curtain was moldy at the bottom. The comforters on the bed seem to be from the 1980's. The hotel only supplied us with 4 pillows for 2 double beds. .When I called and asked for extras they did bring them. Much of the furniture in the room was dusty. I was a bit disappointed that they only provided 1 bottle of shampoo/conditioner there was not lotion or extras provided at all.The internet is $10 a day and is not WIFI-you have to use a cable. Although the room needed TLC, I still enjoyed staying on Disney property and the resort outside of the room. I've never stayed at any other disney resort, so I think I'd give a different one a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Quietest Disney Resort I've Yet Been To”
Reviews.Author: HereHere
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a resort on the outskirts of Downtown Disney, one of the smallest Disney resorts, has one of the best pools for the 7 and under crowd. The pool slide down the lizard tongue is gentle enough for 5-7 year olds to enjoy, and mine did thoroughly! I read somewhere that among Disney's mid-level resorts, this one has the best pool. Things to do at the resort: Swim in the fabulous pool, eat the fabulous food, take the boat to Downtown Disney or the P.O. Riverside Resort. They apparently have a horse and carriage ride too but it was rarely seen when we were there. Things to do nearby: Walk to the Port Orleans Riverside Resort and get your child's hair braided, go fishing there, or eat at their sit-down restaurant. Drive for literally ten minutes and you're at Typhoon Lagoon water park. Don't forget, you can take the Disney buses from the resort to any Disney theme park. No driving required. The 15 minute boat ride from the resort to Downtown Disney was nice, and the boat drivers really try to hype the other resorts you pass along the way. The river water is dark brown and murky, as expected in a Florida wetland. The boat drivers feel the need or were instructed to calm the fears of anyone from out of state who may feel uneasy about the dark brown color of the river water. Anyone who takes the boat to Downtown will remember the captains saying "The dark brown water color you see is a natural result of tannins from leaves and tree roots, etc..etc... the same thing that colors your tea" Ha Ha Overall it was a great resort. We stayed at Disney's Polynesian Resort for the last three years, and this was a totally different and much calmer, quiter atmosphere. Highly recommended all around. Only complaint- Mickey Mouse, please get rid of those '90's clunker TV's that take up too much valuable space in those rooms. About time for just a little updating, ahem....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hansen4
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a visit to Disney World and would highly recommend this hotel. Location-close proximity to all the theme parks. The buses are not shared with any other resort. In addition, you can take a boat to Downtown Disney, something we did several times. Service-Upon arrival, our children (ages 3 and 5) were greeted with Mickey stickers and necklaces. When we got to our room, housekeeping had used towels to make Mickey Mouse. Each day, the kids looked forward to seeing what new towel animals were waiting for us. One day, she even had them, along my daughter's stuffed animal dog, peering out the window at us. What a nice touch! The concierge was very helpful. On our day of departure, we noticed the rental car had a flat tire. They quickly connected us to security, who in turn came to our rescue. Facility-It was a fun ambiance and pretty quiet. The pool area was great. They had free life jackets available, a wading pool for the younger kids (our son loved being able to go in here on his own) and a waterslide that our daughter couldn't get enough of. The onsite restaurant is cafeteria style, and the few times we ate there, it was fine. There are also refrigerators in the rooms. The room was a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “A definite favorite of ours”
Reviews.Author: pwoods29
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a very friendly staff and wonderful ammenities. The pool is fantastic. The food court is great as are the staff members. Busses run every 10 minutes and we never waited longer than that. The landscaping is quiet and serene. We have stayed here several times and enjoyed eveyone of them. Legendary Disney Magic at its finest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay but expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: starski07
Reviews.Content: This review comes almost a year late but since I'm gearing up to make another trip to disney world next month, I decided to write about my stay at French Quarter in Aug '09. We stayed there for three nights after spending one night at Coronado Springs. After carrying all of our bags from Coronado to French Quarter that first morning, we came to find out that our room wasn't ready yet. Not a problem, We stored our bags with front desk and left to go enjoy the parks during the day. When we came back tired from walking all day, our room was finally ready but they gave us 2 queen beds when we paid for a king bed. I had to drag our bags back to front desk and ask for a different room. After waiting, they sent us to a new room only to find out that it wasn't a water view room which I also paid for. I didn't feel like settling so I went back and demanded a water view room. After some fuss, we were finally given a room with our accomodations. The room didn't look as nice as our room at Coronado. The bedding seemed a littly tacky, there was no sliding door for the bathroom, and we didn't have a flat screen tv like at Coronado. All in all, we didn't plan to spend much time in the room anyway so we got over it pretty quickly. We checked out the pool and again, it was smaller and not as impressive as the Aztec pool at Coronado. Also the hot tub was small and always packed so we never had a chance to ride it. I did enjoy the decor and landscaping of French Quarter though. I loved waking up by the lake and then walking down cobble stone brick lanes through the resort. My girlfriend and I regretted not going on a carriage ride. It looked pretty fun and relaxing. I also appreciated that the resort was fairly small so it was never a long walk to get to where we wanted to go. The magical express buses were pretty convenient too and we never waited longer than 10 mins for a bus. The boat to downtown disney was pretty relaxing too. Mousekeeping was good. They kept our room nice and clean and left us a nice gift for our anniversary. I think I would have really enjoyed the hotel more if I didn't stay at Coronodo Springs the first night. I think that it's a much better moderate resort. However, French Quarter is a lot smaller which is better for getting to the pool, lobby, or bus services. I'm heading back to Disney next month and saved up to stay at the Polynesian! I'll be writing a review on it soon!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Just as Magical as Ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disneycrazy25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from Sunday June 27- Friday July 2. Like everyone else I read all the reviews before we left and was a bit concerned. But let me tell you we had NOTHING to worry about! The hotel was VERY CLEAN the Staff VERY FRIENDLY and HELPFUL!!!!! We have been to the other Disney resorts and we ALL agree this is our FAVOURITE one. We will definately be back and we will let everyone know about our MAGICAL experience here!!! I definately recommend the dining plan it saves you a fortune, just make sure to book your CHARACTER meals ahead of time to avoid dissapointment. Make sure to really read the park maps as there are alot of hidden gems there. Above all relax and enjoy after all it is your vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: xiphoid76
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before our trip and settled on the French Quarter. The luxury resorts were way too expensive and this seemed like the best moderate resort out there. The grounds were beautiful, loved the theme of the hotel. Very easy check in - took 2 minutes. Our room was not ready yet, but they texted us as soon as it was done and we already had our keys, so it was easy to go right to the room. We had asked for third floor, building 6, corner room and received all of our requests - room 6340. It was fantastic with a beautiful view of the river and windows on 2 sides. You do have to close them some times as people walk by with the external entrance, but the view was great. The pool was very nice as was the food court. We were also just a 5 minute walk from Riverside which had a sit down restaurant and a bigger food court as well. We were able to rent a pontoon to travel on the river as well. Being at the French Quarter provided us with relatively easy bus transportation to the parks (longest wait was 30 minutes for Downtown Disney one time). Most times wait was about 7 minutes. There is also boat transportation to Downtown Disney. Big advantage of French Quarter over Riverside is that the buses stop at French Quarter first before Riverside (if they stop there - sometimes they are direct to the parks and back). Staying at a Disney property allowed us to purchase items in Disney and have them shipped to our hotel which was a great service as well. We used the food court a lot and found it reasonably priced - I usually bought the child meal for myself and used the refillable soda mug often. It was annoying seeing other people use the soda fountains without a refillable mug (or old ones) as the fountain soda rule was not enforced. The hotel does need a little facelift in the rooms and especially the elevators (they were scary), but overall it was a very nice hotel and location and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally happy”
Reviews.Author: nnimon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans French quarter for 7 days and it was great. We got a room near the front desk, food court and bus stop. Our room was always clean, the buses didn´t take too long and food was alright. This was my first time at a Disney Resort and I totally recommend it. I liked it so much that Im coming back in september. The only thing that I didnt like was a cashier in the food court that always seem to be in a bad mood but other than that it was great. I was supposed to receive a package within my stay and it didnt get there until I had left for another hotel in Orlando and they sent it to me! they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: Nwash
Reviews.Content: This was our fist stay at French Quarter. It's a standard no frills room that opens up to the outside. It's designed like an inexpensive motel that opens to the parking lot. Of course it's decorated and themed beautifully with Disney imagination, but that doesn't change the basic facts about the accommodations. This resort is still better than any of the value priced resorts. The faux French Quarter music got on my nerves after awhile at the cafeteria. It was the same two songs on a never ending loop. Rooms were clean. Mousekeeping made animal arrangements for our daughter each day to surprise us when we came back to the room. Very nice touch like only Disney can do. Important considerations: No full service restaurant. If you have the Dining Plan, this means you're hunting other places to use your full service meals. When you come here you will get hot and you will get tired and you will just want to sit down and have a decent meal with real coffee(not nescafe) without requiring a bus ride to a distant park and a walk in the heat for a 1/4 mile before you can sit down and eat. The Quick service diner was good, however occasionally you want a full dinner or breakfast instead of mickey shaped waffles. No Balcony = little privacy. Don't bother requesting water view for extra money, it isn't anything special. You just get a view of the narrow river from your small window which you'll keep closed most of the time anyway because of guests walking by the sidewalk outside your room. Smoking is located at several convenient spots. Will I stay here again? No. If I go again I'll upgrade to something with more privacy that opens to the inside building and has a full service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamie87
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, check in was smooth and without problem, room was great but the hotel will need a renovation soon to keep up with others. Still it was more than we expected. One thing was the bathtub itself was old and was chiped and peeling, it didn't bother us, but can see how others would actually request antoher room. The AC was fantastic with always a nice cool room on return from the parks. The pool area needs a face lift too as it does not live up to the pictures. Not a huge issue with use as we didn't stay onsite all that much. Riverside is a huge resort and seems to over power French Quarter with Buses and Boats to an annoying extent, once you figure out the quicks of transportation the hotel itself was fun and a great theme. Entertainment was great at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Basic Hotel..........”
Reviews.Author: leenie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced and clean. It's easy to catch the shuttles to and from the parks,and easy to catch a quick bite in the morning or late at night at a food court right by the entrance. We were in building 1, which was quiet by the river. All rooms face the outside sort of like a motel.It is a very no frills place but well maintained. The staff was friendly and I would probably stay here again due to price and cleanliness. I prefer a more luxurious hotel like the Grand Floridian. However, unlike other Disney Hotels such as the Wilderness Lodge which has dark, small, expensive rooms, at least here I did not feel like I was being ripped off. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at Port Orleans French Quarter since it opened. It was the best choice for the moderate Disney resorts because it is smaller than Riverside and has shorter bus lines. However, this will be our last stay until the rooms get a complete makeover. Our room was dirty and very run down. The bathroom was dark and very old looking. The rooms are small and the beds are tiny. Disney needs to spend some $$ and completely rework all of the rooms. The property itself is still nice including the food court. I suggest you look at other Disney properties. Also, Disney's Magical Express was a huge mess for us. We booked our airline tickets through Expedia. Expedia booked us "point-to-point" which means we were on two one way tickets to get there as well as on our return (we did not know this). This meant out luggage was only booked from Kansas City to Atlanta, not Kansas City to Orlando. This saves the travel agent a few bucks but causes a huge problem getting your luggage. Expedia blamed the airline, the airline blamed Expedia, and eventually both blamed Disney (which had nothing to do with it).

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: gabby_xo
Reviews.Content: i stayed her for 3 nights with my family. the rooms were small, only two full beds, the bathroom was small the toilet and shower were crammed in a little area together(there was a door) and only a curtain seperated the bathroom from the room. this made getting ready & sleeping terrible. its not that bad if you get a king bed with just 2 people, but if youre coming down with a family of 4 or 5, its bad. your hardly ever in your room though. they have a huge themed pool. its very nice and had a water slide. there were marti gras decorations around the resort and pool. and around the pool there were aligator decorations. theres plenty of chairs but barely any tables. the pool didnt seem that crowded because its really big. swimming at night is also nice b/c theres barely anyone there. they also had a nice lobby & gift shop. theres a ferry boat that takes you to downtown disney- which is very nice. the boat comes about every 15 minutes and you get a scenic trip and you get dropped off in the middle of d.d.. you can also take the bus to the parks, but they cram so many people into 1 bus. they pack people in to people are literally on top of each other.. and the bus going back from the park took 45 minutes to arrive. but for the most part the resort itself was VERY nice. the rooms & buses.. not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my son's first Disney Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Loukymom
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Port Orleans French Quarter as our first family vacation. Both my husband and I had been to Disney before, but this was my son's first trip. We also took my mother in law along. Online check in is available, so when we arrived at resort and parked, by the time bell services had unloaded our luggage from our truck, I was finished checking in (only took about 2 minutes). We headed to our room (2129) which was in a GREAT location. It is far from the parking lot, but close to the swimming pool, food court and main lobby. The view from our door was of the river that has a boat shuttle to Downtown Disney. Very nice and convienient. Rooms were clean. The decor is somewhat dated, but in good condition. Had no problems at all with the room. We asked for extra pillows, washcloths and towels and got them quickly. We got a towel Mickey only 1 day of our stay which was disappointing, but no big deal. The pool is WONDERFUL. There is a huge dragon slide where you actually slide down the dragon's tongue. My son loved it! The pool is kind of split into sections so it doesn't seem as crowded because of it's size. There is also a kiddie pool to the side and a separate hot tub cove. All stayed pretty busy but were clean and comfortable areas. Pool noodles are available, but they are just in the pool area. First come, first serve. You can borrow a life jacket from the gift shop for the length of your stay for free. There is a poolside bar. The drinks were good but extremely overpriced. My husband and I each got a frozen drink and the total was $24.00. The Mardi Gras theme on the grounds is so nice. The plants and trees are beautiful and well maintained. The food court had a nice variety. They had pizza, "homestyle" foods like meatloaf, fried chicken, there was nachos one evening. Fresh salads, etc. I enjoyed all of the food we got there, tho we ate mostly at the parks. There is a small jazz bar off of the main lobby. We stopped in one evening. The drinks there were also pricey, but we had opted for the souviner glasses so that's probably why. There is live music some evenings. When there is, it's CROWDED. Not enough seats. The gift shop was nice and we did a lot of our souviner shopping in there. They had a great deal going on where every $30 you spent, you could get a huge Mickey beach towel for only $10 and every $50 you could get a Mickey 2 piece luggage set for $15 which was a GREAT deal. Very cute. Bus service was okay. Seemed like we waited longer for the Magic Kingdom bus than any other. It wasn't a long enough wait that it caused any issues, just not really reliable.. If you have character breakfast/dinner reservations, etc, I recommend leaving VERY early just in case or driving your own car. Overall, the service and amenities of this hotel were wonderful. It is an exceptional value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for quiet, relaxing setting- rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: 4travellite
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to wanting a quiet location. We stayed June 9th through June 13th. We loved the setting, had a water view room and it was relaxing and we really felt like we were on vacation. The pluses the staff- friendly and helpful, the setting, the pool especially for the kids, on sight laundry, and Disney Transportation and the Disney quick service dining plan ( we had 4 nights and a free dining plan- saved $$), it was quiet. The down side: The rooms are worn (resort is 20 plus years old), the tub had dents and mildew and needs to be replaced. The rooms are small and the beds are full size the a/c was loud, parking is not close but that is also part of the charm-walking down the french quarter streets. We did have to ask for our comforter and blankets to be replaced- weren't in good shape. The food court seems undersized for the size of the hotel so sometimes got a little crowded. Our housekeeper did do a nice job daily. We loved the setting and staff so this helped to overlook some aspects of a worn room. Not sure if we'd go back again or try another Disney Property.

Reviews.Title: “A good moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: Pipermurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our second trip to Disney World and it was better than we expected. There was plenty of drawers and closet space for three people's clothing. The room we had was in Building 5 which had a view right on the river. The only gripe I have is the bedding doesn't have fitted sheets. Other than that it was clean, fresh, cool, and the cleaning staff left nice towel animals every day. The best bet is to buy the dining plan, with a quick, sit down and snack. The 'cafeteria' at the hotel served its purpose, a quick breakfast before going out, and a snack after a long day. It is not a dinner destination. The pool was plenty big enough and not too crowded, as this is the smaller of the 2 sister hotels. The only real drawback was the transportation. Your only real choice was the bus to Magic, Epcot and Hollywood, so the early open parks you have to give yourself 1 hour to get there. Sometimes there would be 4 busses to other parks that aren't open yet before your bus comes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Magical, will go again very soon”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May 2009, upgraded to a River view which was beautiful. Especially for my little girl (6) and husband, who were visiting Florida for the first time. Rooms clean and beds comfy. As with all Disney resorts clean and tidy. The setting was great and the pool perfect for my daughter. The staff were on the whole very helpful, the greeters gave out wishing coins for the foyer fountains. We paid for our meals in advance with the meal deal. The only concern was with the lack of guidance to what was a "snack" or a "breakfast", we did received a small leaflet on checkin but we didn't do more than scan on arrival. The food cashiers didn't help matters in their surly unpolite unhelpful attitude. Tips: Book all character meals well in advance (before arrival if possible). Leave a tip for room service and see what towel animal creations are left on your childs bed. Will be visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: DYK
Reviews.Content: This is a moderately priced hotel at Disney but is in excellent condition and is very comfortable. Our room was on the second floor with another floor above and we heard very little noise from the neighbors. Only improvement I would have liked would be queen-size beds and Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I were still there”
Reviews.Author: bittenbytravelbug10
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at a Disney Resort. I travelled with my husband and 22 year old daughter (her first visit to Disney). We arrived at 3 am, I had checked in online so everything was ready and waiting for us. The room was exactly as requested, lovely, roomy, comfortable and easy to find. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. This resort felt like a friendly little community and was very restful after a long day at the parks you really felt like you were coming home. We had several meals in the food court, a great selection, reasonably priced and huge portions. I recommend buying the travel mugs with free refill. There is so much to say about the beauty and the setting. We had a surprise letter advising a bear (not Winnie the Pooh) had been seen in the area and for everyone to use caution. This did not dampen the holiday, just added to the excitement. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a Disney shuttle to the partk. I hope to be able t return again.

Reviews.Title: “Realxing and low key...”
Reviews.Author: huskyhoops
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans - French Quarter resort with my fiancee during April 2010. We used Disney's Magical Express to get from the airport to the resort, and the whole process was seamless right through check-in. Our room was small and basic, but since we were out of the room most of the time, this wasn't a concern. If you're looking for more luxurious room accommodations, this probably isn't the resort for you, but if you're not spending a lot of time in your room, and all you need are rooms that are clean and have basic amenities like television and a refrigerator, then this will work nicely. The resort itself evokes the feel of New Orleans' French Quarter, with the buildings having balconies, wrought iron fencing, and various gradens and reflecting pools around the property. As I understand it, this is the smallest Disney property. The food court had a decent selection of food, and service was reasonably fast. When we visited, the resort was fairly quiet, as it was the off-season and most kids were in school. We did not use the pool itself, but did spend quite a bit of time at the pool bar, where we found the staff to be very friendly. This resort is located very close to Downtown Disney, and was only a short water taxi ride down the Sassagoula River. The ride was only about 10 minutes long, and offers a nice change of pace from the more traditional shuttle bus system. Other Disney parks have a longer ride, but overall, I find Disney Transport to be very well run and convenient. The staff were mostly helpful, and was dissatisfield only in one minor instance. On the last day we took a short walk over to Port Orleans Riverside, and would like to stay there in the future. I would stay at French Quarter again, but I would like to try other Disney resorts before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “A great time!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkgirl1977
Reviews.Content: I decided to surprise my son with a trip to Disney. So I went online and booked it about 2 weeks prior to us leaving. We used to live in Orlando and I knew that the best times to go to Disney are March and October to avoid heat and lines. We had a ball! This resort was located on the water and a has a boat that will pick you up and take you to Downtown Disney, which we really enjoyed. The benefits of staying on Disney is the shuttle service to and from the airport and how easy it was to get on a bus and go to whichever park you want to go. I have to mention that the Disney express shuttle from the airport, the line inside the airport is very, very long and my son and I made the mistake of walking the whole length of this line only to discover it was the line for the shuttle! So if you see a long line down the center of the airport just ask people what their standing there for to save yourself some time! Port Orleans hotel is very nice, the grounds are gorgeous and we enjoyed the pool. The pool was open till midnight which is great for when you get back from the parks to relax and have a drink. We really enjoyed Blizzards beach, we went on a cloudy day and there were no lines, which was great. Just my son and I went together and we had so much fun, he wrote a report in school about how much fun we had. We're def looking forwarwd to going back and staying at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: HeyChickamauga
Reviews.Content: We just returned from WDW French Quarter and LOVED it!!! The grounds were beautiful and immaculate. The rooms were clean and well designed/decorated. We felt that this resort had a very comfortable feeling, very quiet and peaceful. The staff was extremely helpful and very knowledgeable in all areas. Our girls especially liked Laurent, the gentleman who took care of the guests in the lobby area. He would sometimes do magic tricks for them and they called him "The Magic Man". He was very sweet to my children and gave them a large Mickey balloon to take home with them. The resort is so peaceful and quiet. Our girls (ages 10 and 7) loved the pool area - very beautiful and well designed. My husband and I have been to Disney World 3 times (twice with our children) and as a rule we all wanted to try a different resort each time. However, after our visit to Port Orleans/French Quarter, we all agreed as a family that this was the place for us and any future vists to Disney World would be spent at the French Quarter. This resort is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Kimber_jewel
Reviews.Content: We found Port Orleans French Quarter to be an excellent moderate hotel on the Disney property. We are passholder and have stayed on property and in surrounding area hotels so we had something to compare this to. We normally like to book the Wilderness Lodge because we really enjoy the theming but after one stay at the French Quarter I know we will definitely be back. We stayed over Memorial Day weekend. The rooms are older and with out central A/C but the wall unit was in perfect working order, no bad smells and very efficient. The bathroom area had two vanity sinks and lots of space. The beds were comfy. There were hidden mickeys all through out the room and the french quarter theme was spot on from the curtain dividing the bedroom and bathroom area to the fleur-de-lis carved in the furniture. My only complaint of the room was the bathtub. It was really in need of refurbishment. We were in building 4 with a courtyard view. Each building area had it's own small courtyard with gardens and benches, some with fountains or ponds. We were never bored or looking for things to do at this resort. There was a large grassy courtyard area near the pool where our two year old met other children and played while the adults relaxed on the surrounding benches. The pool are was clean and baby pool was a very nice feature for families with little ones. We took a walk along the river and saw rabbits, squirrels, and lizards all along the way. The playground area was easy to access, safe, and clean. Dining was terrific! The food court had so many options and seating was ample. We never spent more than $20 a meal to feed the 3 of us (after using our refills mugs!). They provided a small table in the dining area where children could color or build legos while their parents finished eating. The lines were never very long and clean tables were always available. We took the bus several times. I was worried about this because of previous reviews but we never had a problem. Both our bus to MK and bus to Epcot were direct, no stops at Riverside. Coming back from MK we had just missed the bus and ended up with a 15 minute wait. Staff was good. Not as friendly as I have seen at other Disney properties but nothing to complain about. Tip : The New Orleans French Quarter theme is available to taste as well. Order a hurricane from the bar or try some beignets from the food court. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: AwwBabyElelphants101
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Disney hotel of all time. We have stayed here at least 10 times and will always come back. It is the cleanest hotel I have ever been too, amazing location with free boat service to Downtown Disney. Amazing staff as always. This time we had a deluxe room and it was incredible. The resort itself is small enough where there is only one bus stop to get to the parks and is just a short walk regardless which building you are in. Same thing goes for the food area, gift shop, front desk, and pool. We also LOVE the pool and waterside. Very fun. Always stay here. You can also walk along the river to the Port Orleans Riverside and use their pools as well. I cannot say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Familes!”
Reviews.Author: homerton
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations! Very clean and fresh for an older hotel. The staff were wonderful and even left special messages and a picture from Mickey for my daughters birthday. The buses were air conditioned and very convenient. Pool was nice and there were several life guards in the afternoon when it was busy. Fun slide for kids. We found that the food was pricey and was mediocre. Food was typical Disney food. Fine for a few days with a 4 year old. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Got a great deal and frankly the bus service a lone was worth it. Perfect for families. Rooms were plenty big for 3 people and they were very clean and fresh. Grounds were well kept and attractive. No complaints for the price at all! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyLuvs2Travel09
Reviews.Content: We just got home last night from Port Orleans Resort. Really a great hotel. I read alot of reviews online before picking this hotel. The grounds are very relaxing and had a great view of the pool from our room! Staff was very friendly. Enjoyed it the whole time we were there. Beds are double beds so not very big but worked for us. Beautiful grounds and the carriage ride that goes around the grounds is great!! Boat to Downtown Disney was very relaxing and just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: JenniferT25
Reviews.Content: We all loved it! It was a great experience. The walk from the room to the lobby was pretty long but we didn't go up there much. We had a great time and will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent A+++”
Reviews.Author: Abhtlw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend our 5Th Anniversary there and it was my first time going to Walt Disney World and we had a wonderful time there and the staff was excellent and professional in every way. We would stay there again. I would recommend to my friends and family. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Great location with the amenities we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Yogamama41
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 2 and 4 year old. We had a room close to the main lobby/restaurant and the pool and playground. The pool was a hit with the kids, as was the playground. The room was standard, but fine for our purposes. We really appreciated the in-room refrigerator and coffee-maker. Disney was prompt with requested bed rails for the kids' bed. Being able to hop on a bus and be at any park in minutes (or back from) was worth a lot.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying onsite-fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jlchwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter May 18-21. Check-in was a breeze as I had completed the check-in online a few days earlier. Our room was on the third floor in building 2(requested as I did not want to take the chance of people stomping across the ceiling as my luck normally goes) facing another building of rooms and a grassy area. I feel the room is very good sized and there were only two of us. I feel it would be fine for a family of four. More than that would not be a good fit. It was clean and decorated well. I read previously that it is old and outdated but if you are looking for imperfections you will always find them. You are staying the park-enjoy it! We utilized the purchase of the drink cups that include free refills at your resort during your stay. We only had baked goods in the food court and drinks in the bar. We used the in room fridge for oj and granola bars. The pool area is large and clean. There is also a bar there. They could use extra staff for the bars. It gets very busy at times. The housekeeping staff is very good. I asked for extra soaps and shampoo and they granted my request. Also, left us (thirtysomethings) an animal made of towels-loved it! I would stay here again as it is pretty quiet. I saw quite a few other couples mixed in with the families and felt quite comfortable. I think they could be a bit more serious about the gate as if you are four feet away from the "guard" and show your id or room card they just wave you in. I believe they should check this more for safety purposes. All in all, I would recommend the Port Orleans for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: deejenna
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upgraded river front room for four nights in mid May. I have stayed at a few other Disney resorts and this one definitely had its pluses. First, even from our room which was the farthest in the back, right on the river, it was only a 2 minute walk to the pool, 4 minutes to the dining area and 5 minutes to grab a bus or the convenient boat shuttle to Downtown Disney. This hotel is located close to Downtown Disney, Epcot, and easy to get to and from. Only had one bus stop, unlike the Riverside which had 4. Never had to wait very long for the bus or boat service. The room was nice, nothing fancy. Plenty of room for two people with lots of luggage and gear, a small sitting area, bathroom was nice with double sinks, and for the most part, quiet as a mouse. Yes, you can hear the "rocket" toilets flushing on occasion, but it lasts for 2 seconds. Did not hear the people upstairs, next door, nor outside. I will say I have stayed in a Value resort, and that was my biggest complaint, was the walls were paper thin, and I could hear everything. The flowers and grounds were lovely, the river soothing. The pool was always crowded, but we were able to find lounge chairs in the middle of late afternoon no problem. The dining choices were limited as there were only 4 stations to choose meals from, where some of the other moderate hotels had quite a nice spread and lots of choices to pick from. Never had a problem finding a table to eat it, outside or in, and always managed to find something to eat. Service was excellent, except the outside pool bar probably could have used an extra set of hands as it was always busy and only one bartender. Check in was a breeze, bags were in our room in a timely manner, and room was refreshed every day including cute little towel animals. My husband did not care for the decor and considering it is almost 20 years old, it is showing a little of its age, but is still lovely and well taken care of. Would highly recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the French Quater..”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo1967
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel.. My family loves it and we would stay here again.. The rooms are the average Disney size but hey, how long are you really in them if you are in the World.. Staff was great, pool is very nice(could use a longer slide) my kids kind of outgrew this one.. Asked for and received the building number we wanted, close to pool, lobby and bus stop.. Buses ran very efficiently, never waited more then 10 minutes.. The food court is ok, just used it for lunch a couple of days, always ate dinner at other Disney properties or parks.. Great stay and overall experience..

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgolf
Reviews.Content: This is a good family hotel. If you are a world traveler, you might want a little more, but fine for a family. This was a very quiet sleepy hotel somewhat removed from the hustle of Disney. Not a honeymoon type hotel. Very clean and quiet. The pool is mostly for kids. Would not say it is a romantic hotel and rooms are showing their age. Very clean and peaceful. Good "intermediate" hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This was a very nice clean room.”
Reviews.Author: flower3910
Reviews.Content: I looked for the best slide forI my grandchildren. They utterly didn't get out of the pool until it was time for us to leave. The pool area is really nice but has no shade. The area around the hotel is beautiful. The food court is really nice and we ate there for all our meals on Sunday. I accidently left my scales there {on a diet} and went back to get it but they couldn't seem to find it. I believe housekeeping stold it !!! I called even when we got back. No they didn't have it. It cost me almost one hundred dollars! Would I go back there? NO--I do not like dishonest people.!!! If they cleaned the floor thety had to pick up my scales!! So I suggest you don't leave anything behind. Because you won't get it back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jast64
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Port Orleans Resort-French Quarter. What a pleasant experience! The resort is set as if a small part of New Orleans French Quarter was brought to Orlando and planted on Disney grounds. It has quaint narrow streets, horse pulled carriages, lush vegetation, and an awesome pool for the kids! The only negative is that the rooms have two double beds instead of two queens, but the beds are very comfortable. Kids will love the pool! The resort offers a complimentary water taxi to downtown Disney and to the Port Orleans Resort-Riverside next door. Will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “A little on the small side”
Reviews.Author: PinkLynx3013
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is a little on the small side but cute. Aside from that they are fast getting you into a room, very friendly, and the whole luggage storage room is very convenient. The pool is adorable. I loved being able to take the shuttle to the hotel from the airport and the fact that you could participate in the Disney dining deal (def do that). The bus however from this hotel to the parks and back is very slow. We saw a bunch of other hotel buses more frequently then we saw our own and probably will not stay here in again in favor of one of the others that made more frequent stops.

Reviews.Title: “We will be going back! Loved this hotel. :)”
Reviews.Author: JustABit
Reviews.Content: My family had an amazing stay at Port Orleans French Quarter! We highly recommend you stay there (ESPECIALLY if you love New Orleans Square in Disneyland, California)! The service was excellent! Our travel agent failed to communicate our king-size bed request and the front desk staff set us up in a WATERFRONT king-size bed room. Talk about going the extra mile! We loved our room - it was a corner room with two windows, full of light, with an amazing view. The dual sinks and privacy curtain was great. We slept really well and never heard any noise from the other Guests. Also, Hidden Mickey's are everywhere, so be sure to keep your eye out! Really, we could not have dreamed of a better room. The grounds were well themed and well maintained. It was a beautiful and serene setting with a very uncrowded feel. The New Orleans train station lobby, French Quarter and Mardi Gras decor, and Jackson Square ambiance and style are wonderful, the attention to detail was refreshing. The pool was wonderful - our daughter enjoyed her time there. Say, "Hi!" to Scales the sea serpent for her when you visit the pool! The boat ride to Downtown Disney was a fun way to get around! My hubby and I made dinner reservations at Fulton's Crab House and had a fantastic romantic dinner. This hotel is a great Moderate [priced] Resort and we plan to go back as soon as we can! (We added a Disney Cruise to our trip and we also HIGHLY recommend doing that, too.)

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids - not for couples”
Reviews.Author: ms6238
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic - a few buildings, one place to eat, one pool, one hot tub, and one store. The room itself is ok. Our room had two double beds (I requested a king, but did not get it) Two people can not comfortably sleep on one bed. My husband and I slept in separate beds. The air conditioning unit didn't work the first night and we were dying of heat. It magically worked the next two nights that we were there (I think the maid had maintenance fix it while we were at the parks...) The unit goes on and off all night (once it reaches it's max temp, it turns off and then about a minute later, turns back on). There are not a lot of amenities at this hotel. If you are looking for more kid friendly, I would suggest staying at the Port Orleans Riverside which is right next door to the French Quarter. There are seven pools there, a sit down restaurant, as well as a food court, boat rentals, a "fishin hole", and the atmosphere just seems nicer all together (my husband and I walked over to the Riverside and were quite jealous by what we saw!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at Disney's Port Orleans-French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BronzeQT
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was a great value. Check-in was painless. We were allowed to get our room key earlier than 3pm. Rooms on the small side and beds not very big or comfy. However, for the price I was willing to forgo the plush and trendy amenities I prefer. The grounds were well-kept. It really did remind me of the N.O. French Quarter. It was also extremely quiet there considering our visit was during spring break 2009. We ate the on-site cafeteria once and I was not a fan of the food but it wasn't the worst I've had. Parking was a breeze as we were able to get a spot several times literally right outside the room door (we could see our truck from room window). Nothing bad to say about the service, we don't do housekeeping ever any time we travel but they were polite when we would pass them around the grounds and they were quick with any requests. Like I said before, it's a great value for a small family wanting to enjoy the on-property Disney experience and not break the bank at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Resort”
Reviews.Author: duffydog100
Reviews.Content: After staying many times at this resort, we continue to give it rave reviews. If you want a more relaxing, quieter resort, this is the place for you. The smallest of all Disney resort hotels, it has it all. Want to go to Downtown Disney for lunch or dinner- take the complimentary (no tipping) shuttle boat for a leisurely 15 minute ride. Once you park your car you never have to take it out again until time to pack up and go home. Flying into Orlando, take the Magical Express Bus. Going to a Disney theme park, hop the bus and leave the driving to them. Again, complimentary and no tipping. You also get early entrance or later evenings at various parks during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, welcoming, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tora422
Reviews.Content: I debated between 4 and 5 stars. I loved this resort and would be more than happy to stay here again. I read some of the past reviews and prepaired for certain things such as the toilets being loud. We stayed in building 4 on the 3rd floor. It was rare that we heard other toilets flush and when we did it was a faint sound and we had people on both sides of us and people below us I believe. If you weren't listening specifically for it you would not hear it. But again we were on the top floor. The room was clean and comfortable. The mousekeeping staff was great. Our daughter who is 5 truning 6 while on our trip had an accident while taking a nap. Mousekeeping had no problem at all coming in and doing a complete bedding change even though they litterally just changed it only a couple hours before hand. My husband went back to the room one afternoon and found our door ajar. It startled him a bit, when he went inside head of mousekeeping was in there inspecting mousekeepings work. One of my complaints would be that the beds are a full size beds. My husband is a tal stocky man and I am not small but not large either and we barely fit in the full size bed. There was even one night I slept with my 5 year old so that I was a bit more comfortable. Often we had towels made into ittle characters. When they made my daughters bed they always made her stuffed animals comfy. My other complaint would be the eggs in the dining hall. They were VERY under cooked. However one morning I got a ham and cheese omlet and they were just fine. A problem my husband had was that we shared a bus with Port Orleans Riverside which is a mush larger resort and had 4 stops. They drop off Riverside people first. Which we kind of had a bit of a problem with because FQ only has 1 stop, and when you have a VERY sleepy child you want to get back ASAP. All in all we had a very nice stay and would stay there again without any hesitation! But, I am one that likes to try new things so we are looking into staying at maybe the Fort Wilderness Lodge next time we go. But we would not hesitate to stay here again. We even picked out possible room numbers for next time.

Reviews.Title: “There are Definite Differences between Basic Rooms at Moderate and Value Resort”
Reviews.Author: joobilance
Reviews.Content: My family and I make a yearly trip to Orlando from Sarasota and, as a result, have stayed at several of the on and off-site Disney properties. Of them all (Polynesian to the All-Stars) this is by far the best one for the money. The grounds are lovely and tranquil and the rooms are comfortable. Also, there are subtle differences in the basic rooms that make a big difference: 1) A curtain that divides the bathroom area from the sleeping area 2) Dual sinks 3) A coffee pot 4) A mini fridge (included in the room rate). Those things made a huge difference for us after having stayed at the All-Star resort for one night prior to checking into the French Quarter. Also, the All-Star resorts tend to attract a younger, rowdier crowd which makes the cafeteria and pool areas a bit unbearable at times. Another feature I loved about this resort is the ferry that runs from the resort to Downtown Disney - what a nice feeling to know that we wouldn't have to compete for a parking space on Friday night! Also, there is a great pool that the family will love. My only regret is that we didn't get to stay longer. Just a tip - if you are there more than a couple of days and you are a fountain drink fanatic as I am, get the refillable souvenir mug. It's kind of pricey at around $13, but worth it when you consider that small fountain drinks are around $3 at the resort and the parks. Also, if you are thinking of staying off-site to save money you should reconsider. With the fridge to keep a good supply of food at-hand and the fact that you don't have to pay for parking at the parks when you are a guest at a Disney resort, being at an on-site property is so much more convenient. It also keeps you in a "Disney frame of mind."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - great option for a Moderate Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Grace123Orlando_FL
Reviews.Content: My mother, myself and 2 kids - 9 and 6 - spent the weekend of April 9-11 here. We all enjoyed it. The rooms are similar in size to the Value Resort, with exterior doors - no hallways. But the room was wonderfully decorated and the bathroom was good size - 2 pedestal sinks, with toilet and shower behind a door. Large curtain to separate sinks from bedroom view - we used it to change. We were in Building 4 and our room looked out over the courtyard with a fountain. The whole area is wonderfully landscaped and each city "square" was different from one another. I loved walking around and feeling like I was walking in Mary Poppin's neighborhood! The kids loved seeing how it was similar to the movie The Princess and the Frog. On our 2nd day we stayed around the resort and took the boat over to Downtown Disney. The pool was a huge hit for the kids and us. There is a dragon slide - but not scary and easy for most kids to slide down - life jackets are provided to swimmers and you can use one on the slide also. Lots of life guards around. A nice hot tub was in a semi-private area away from the pool and was great after a day of walking at Epcot. We walked over to Riverside - about a 10 minute walk - very relaxing as you are following the Sassagoula River. We rented a 4 rider bike and love it. We then took a horse drawn carriage ride around. We ate at the food plaza at the Riverside - both the French Quarter and Riverside offer slightly different menus. For breakfast we would pick up beignets (think Princess and the Frog!) coffee, mickey waffles and bring it back to eat in our room. Very convenient. In response to the pillows - I thought they were fine, my mom thought they were too firm! To each his own! Overall, a great stay and I have already made plans to stay at the Riverside in September!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarylandFamilytrvlr
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely atmosphere. The grounds are well manicured, and the rooms are adequate. The other reviews were correct. The food is AWFUL. There is one food court with unhealthy choices. The property's location is far from everything. The bus service was reliable but it took a long time to travel around WDW. I have stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Contemporary and Grand Floridean. If I return to WDW, I will pay the extra money and stay at a deluxe resort. The atmosphere at the deluxe resorts make the trip extra special for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: myoc2001
Reviews.Content: This was our first WDW visit and we chose this resort after extensive internet research. Everything was as we expected. The check in staff were a little brief on the info they provided to us, but we found our room and were very happy with the location. Far enough away from the pool that we couldn't hear the noise, and close enough to the food court and bus stops. We had connecting rooms and they were clean and comfortable and great for the travelling family. Double sinks in the bathroom were handy. A little bit noisy sometimes - we were on the ground floor and we could hear the kids in the room above us running back and forth and we could hear their toilet flushing. But let's face it, most nights we came home so tired from the parks that we had no real trouble sleeping! The food court was a bit noisy and grotty when busy, and the staff there were a bit surly at times, particularly at the end of the breakfast session. The selections are the same each day, but we didn't eat there often enough to find it boring. We had deluxe dining plan which was absolutely fantastic - all meals and snacks and all character dining was alreay paid for before we arrived - we didn't have to worry about anything - in fact we had heaps of snack credits left over at the end which we redeemed for packaged snacks and sweets to bring home. The Disney transportation system is excellent, we never had to wait for more than 20 minutes and the buses go directly to and from this resort most of the time. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great especially with small kids”
Reviews.Author: tripmom82
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after much research and it showed. The hotel is small in size but the amenities are large. The hotel is very quiet unlike the cheaper resorts except for the occassionly horse drawn carriage walking down the streets at night. There is only 1 bus stop on the grounds closest to buildings 4 and 5 but not a long walk from other buildings. The bus for epcot stops at the riverside and has 4 bus stops that the bus stops at every time, but french quarter is first to get on and first dropped off with is great. We stayed over easter and the housekeepers were great. they made bunnies out of washcloths fro the kids. the quick service meals offered are pretty good. There is a lot to choose from. i will absolutely stay at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Disney atmosphere on a budget”
Reviews.Author: skaboovy
Reviews.Content: I stayed about a week here in Jan. 2010 with my mom, our first trip to Disney World! The rooms are nicely designed and include all the amenities you would expect in a moderate hotel. The design of the buildings at Port Orleans are extremely charming and the grounds are great to take a stroll through. The jazz music piped throughout the resort was fun and made the theme even more charming. Unfortunately, we were there during an uncharacteristic cold snap (about 29 degrees each night), so we didn't do much strolling. My only problem with the room was the heater; it didn't shut off automatically so you could really leave it running during the night. Usually this wouldn't be much of a problem, but it was very cold for us! The service was great, as you would expect at any Disney hotel. The food court was also decent, although one might run out of options after about a week of meals. The Disney buses arrive promptly and we never had any trouble finding a seat. In the mornings French Quarter has its own bus, so travel time to the parks was pretty short. Getting back to the hotel at night took a little bit longer, as the buses go to both Port Orleans resorts. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those seeking a fun atmosphere at a reasonable price. Personally, I might spring for one of the deluxe hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: tmaw09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans over the summer of 2009 (very late review, I know!). We've stayed at several of the Disney value and moderate resorts and this is our favorite. The grounds around the resort are great - quiet atmosphere, relaxing, manicured landscaping, very pretty. The public areas are great as well - great lobby, they had live music over the weekend nights we were there in one of the bar areas, etc. The kids had a blast at the pool and there's a poolside bar for adults. The pool can be updated, it's one of the oldest ones in Disney, but kids don't notice that! Another great thing about this resort are the bus lines - it's not as popular as other resorts, therefore you don't have to wait in extensive bus lines at all. We love that about this resort! It's very easy! The rooms were adequate, could use a total renovation as other reviewers have stated. That's the only negative I can say about this hotel. You need to realize what you are getting when you stay here - a decent price for an adequate room. Everything outside the room is great and continues with the Disney experience!

Reviews.Title: “sucks”
Reviews.Author: Daisy12344321
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because it was "moderate' hotel thinking dining will be different upgraded, than value hotels.The menu is the exact sameeee We couldn't figure out why this was "moderate" it was no difference from a value hotel. We could've saved alots of money staying at a value resort as there was noooooo difference.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for a Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gingerbirdie71
Reviews.Content: This was our third and final stop of our honeymoon. We arrived at about 10pm and fortunately didn't have to wait too long to check in. We told the Cast Member we were on our honeymoon and we got a badge each with our name on! Apart from one free fast pass pn one ride, we didn't get any other freebies though!! The room was in block 7; we thought it was a bit dingy and dated. We weren't allocated a king bed, even though we asked for one at the time of booking - so we had two beds for our honeymoon!! We did have a nice view of the river though, which was lovely first thing in the morning with the mist rising. The main problem with the place was noise - we could hear people using the toilet in the rooms adjacent and above and below... the toilet system emptying and filling sounded like a cannon going off! We did complain - all we were told by guest services was to close our bathroom door!!! Laughable! Main food area was okay - busy. We weren't on a meal plan and only ate their twice. Standard American breakfast fayre but not brilliant quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience at this mod. hotel one of my favorites!”
Reviews.Author: rnonvocals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Port Orleans from Dec. 10th to the 19th...the weather was so beautiful, we forgot it was winter back home in NY! This is our 4th trip staying on Disney property and I must say, our favorite hotel! The port Orleans French Quarter is small, but not so much as to make it seem to crowded....granted, Dec. is the least crowded time to go to Disney-a nice tip! the rm was clean and well stocked and the maid service very thorough. Many times the housekeepers would set up there stuffed animals in a fun way on their bed, or put them in the window as if they were greeting us home at night! The boys got a kick out of that. The sheets were crisp and clean, and yes, as others have mentioned, hard- so you may want to bring your own. the pool area is neat- a serpent tongue that the kids slide down was a big hit w/ my 10 and 8 yr old.The life guards are excellent- they were painstakingly patrolling constantly and were obviously well trained.At one point i was doing laundry and a female lifeguard offered to keep an eye on them while I switched my clothes into the dryer! I am so overprotective, I surprised myself when I agreed-thats how comfortable i felt! The resort is small enough and family oriented enough that I would let the kids go down to the arcade area alone (and I would tail them w/out them knowing). The food area was clean with a pretty good selection.Sometimes the lines were long, but the cast members moved the lines along quickly. the food area is brightly decorated with delightful Mardi Gras masks-neat! the bus situation is excellent at this resort- always a place to sit and never a long wait.Riverside is a whole other story! That bus stops @ every building and you may end up standing while carrying a sleeping schoolaged kid1 ugh!

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay Hotel Before our Disney Cruise!!”
Reviews.Author: winchesterdoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a wonderful spring break vacation with our two children (ages 9 and 6). We spent two nights at the Port Orleans: French Quarter prior to our 7 nite cruise on the Disney Magic. The hotel is extremely handy with young kids given how close it is to Downtown Disney and the fact you get to take water taxi to get there! The water taxi is fun 10 to 15 minute ride that our kids (along with most kids on the boat) loved. The lobby is very festive, colorful and has several great photo ops. The grounds are truly well maintained with colorful flowers, manicured shrubs, iron work and fountains in the french quarter look and feel. In addition the walking path along the "river" is quite nice. The rooms are adequate in that they are clean, colorful and well priced. We were in room 1131 and it was fine. The decor is a little dated and I think they have the last 19 inch thick bodied televisions left on the planet. Only true downside is that the toilet flushing sounds/feels like a rocket ship launch (i would think disney could work on that) Restaurant for breakfast is fun: Beignets are the draw for the kids all of the other items are standard. Colorful staff throwing bead necklaces and plastic coins for the little ones. Pool is very nice, it is heated and comfortable. Water slide is ok but my two loved it so what else do I care. Towels available and clean, plenty of deck space and chairs along with a nice view of the river from one of the sun decks. Bathrooms are right there and are quite clean and convenient for people using the pool Downtown disney was great. Nice restaurants (portabello's and fultons crab house were hits). Street entertainment was priceless as the girls got involved with a dance lesson, hula hoop contest along with 75 to 100 other people, great video to show them when they are both 18 and too cool for dad. Nice shopping, etc. Would rec a lite jacket for the boat ride back if staying in Downtown after sunset as we forgot ours and it was a tad chilly Cruise was awesome. Transfer from hotel to cruise was seamless. I'll review cruise seperately. All in all for the price/location and our needs this "moderate" hotel can't be beat. Hope this is useful information, take care

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFamilyLovers
Reviews.Content: My family of 7 stayed at this resort and loved it. It was our first trip to Disney so we didnt know what to expect. We had two rooms of course one for my husband and myself along with our 2 children and my parents and sister had the room right next door to us. I only have 2 small complants the pillows for startes were hard as rocks so just take your own. And the lines in the food court were long but thats the only other problem all you do is figure out when its less busy durring your stay and your good!! All the workers were friendly, we needed an extra blanket and towels called down stairs and they were at my door in less than 5 mins!! Also you had the buses coming by at all times to go back and fourth to the parks and you have to riverboat in the back you can take to downtown disney and to some of the parks! It was great we loved to have 2 different options on how to get to and from the parks, I am so glad we didnt have to worry about a a car at all. Also we had to rent a stroller while we were there the ones in the park average about 185 for a week and you cant take them back to your rooms and you just have to carry your child back to bus and rooms, but I found a great company online they bring a stroller to your hotel and it waiting on you when u arrive and u leave it with the bell service when you leave and they pick it up. Its called Orlando Stroller company, I got a double stroller for my 2 and 7 year old and it was the best idea we had cause yes the 7 year old got tired from time to time. It cost 90 dollars for a week and you can take it everywhere with you!!! I recomend them to anyone!!! We will be back within the next 2 years and I cant wait!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney "Moderate" Resort”
Reviews.Author: evergreen620
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that among the many things Disney gets right is their categorizing of the resorts. The deluxe properties are certainly deluxe, their "value" resorts are a bargain and nothing special, and their moderate resorts somewhere in the middle. That being said, I have stayed at almost every Disney property from the All Stars to the Grand Floridian, and I have learned that each resort is perfect for a specific purpose. The Port Orleans French Quarter was perfect for my purpose: show my spouse (Disney first timer) a great time in the world without breaking the bank or scaring him away with hordes of noisy teenagers or screaming babies. Here are the basic pros and cons I found with the resort as a veteran Disney tripper, but a first time Port Orleans visitor. Pros: 1) The location was central enough to be convenient to all parts of the the world 2) The resort was very quiet, small, and relaxing - a great oasis after a day at the parks 3) There were no large school-age groups that are always present at the All-Stars and can get quite loud 4) The location next to the river was scenic, and the added novelty of a boat to D-town Disney was fun 5) There were two sinks in the bathroom, and the area outside of the toilet/shower was very spacious Cons: 1) Nothing about the beds or pillows was special or "deluxe" 2) The toilets were so loud that we could hear the one above us flushing throughout the night 3) Buses for Epcot, Animal Kingdom, and the Studios stopped at all 4 Riverside stops before actually going to those parks, making it a longer trip than necessary Overall it was a great trip, and my husband and I both agreed we would stay at French Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLovers99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at FQ 2-7 through 2-14. It was awesome. Our rooms were 4347 and 4348. We had fun. The dining was not the best, but was ok. We really enjoyed Earl of Sandwich at Downtown Disney. We relaxed and had fun with the kids. I enjoyed the parades at the parks. See ya real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat at Disney”
Reviews.Author: dela
Reviews.Content: The Port Orleans French Quarter delivered everything we wanted on our Disney vacation. Because this hotel is smaller and doesn't cater to convention crowds, it is less crowded and less noisy. It is quick to walk to anywhere in the hotel area. The flowered grounds are beautiful. We enjoyed the walking path along the river and the on-site boat that glides between the resort and Downtown Disney. The pool, with its dragon slide, is heated. The hot tubs were relaxing. I think the pool area would appeal to younger kids more than teenagers. A laundry building is on site. The room decor is an attempt to recreate a New Orleans "feel," with its rather ornate headboards and colorful wallpaper and paint. We were satisfied with the room, but really didn't get the "New Orleans feel." We did like the double pedestal sinks though--wish more hotels had double sinks. The mini-fridge was useful also. For some reason, our room had no toiletries and only one washcloth when we arrived. A phone call to front desk resulted in a bag full of lotion, shampoo, washcloth within ten minutes. Thereafter, our maid service was very good. This hotel has a small food court with a bakery section, Italian section, pizza, sandwiches and a few dinner choices--pot roast was nice and tender. I always ordered the kid's meal (even though it was printed as being for guest nine and under) as it came with an included drink, and was a big enough portion for me. My husband got the refillable drink mug, which can be used at the hotels but not in the parks. For a coffee or soda drinker, I guess this is a good value if you are staying at least a week. There was no milk at the beverage station and the hot chocolate was tasteless colored water. We enjoyed taking the boat to Downtown Disney and eating at Earl of Sandwich where a wide choice of delicious sandwiches and salads cost an average $6.00. The Disney transportation system is the best reason for staying inside the resort--no driving or parking hassles. The transportation from New Orleans French Quarter was quick and usually not very crowded. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: a-consumer
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans, French Quarter was as a fine place to stay on our trip to Disney. We were at the parks from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm so it really didn't matter where we slept. Quick overview: Beds are not that comfortable (a little soft); heating was not as comfortable as we would've liked it -- the stand alone unit allowed for on/off of heat (unfortunately we needed some heat!) but didn't have a thermostat so we could set it to a certain temperature; shower/toilet area VERY small; nice to have two sinks on the outside for us to get ready; toilet flushing from other rooms was loud but you got used to it; quiet overall; would've been nice to have a restaurant and not cafeteria (by the time you got your food, waited in line to pay, got your drink and found a seat everything was cold). The theme was tasteful and the walk to the buses good. The transportation to the parks was great and hardly any wait. Overall a good experience but no WOW's. One thing all hotels should have by now is WiFi and they didn't (not sure if any Disney hotel does). Nothing really special but a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Ritchie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stay ed here during the Princess 1/2 Marathon Race weekend. As expected Disney has a good reputation for friendly and helpful service and we were not disappointed. We chose this hotel over the some of the cheaper ones simply because we didn't think it would be overrun with children. We were right. It was a quiet, peaceful stay. The pool and hot tub was nice. There is a 2 mile loop to walk/run/saunter and very close to the sister resort Riverside. The rooms were nice, a bit on the standard side, but clean, well stocked and attended to. The maid staff was great, kept us supplied with towels and coffee filters. The concierge desk was great and helped us get reservations to the restaurants we wanted. The location really can't be beat. There is a river to walk along or just lay by the side and nap. A shuttle boat to Downtown Disney and of course buses to all the other parks. The only thing I didn't like is they do not provide free internet and there is no WiFi. This is a bit outdated in my opinion. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: TheWiseOnee
Reviews.Content: Its all said there ^^^ Quick Facts : Food - OK but eat elsewhere LOCATION- Amazing floral new orleans scene ROOMS- Small but "Cozy" STAFF- Front Manager is scary :S , (always yells) cleaning staff needs to clean bathrooms and hallways better ENTERTAINMENT- unfortuanatly never caught a show but the whole atmosphere was fun and exciting . Wud come back !!!!

Reviews.Title: “great venue”
Reviews.Author: jojonjo
