Reviews.Content: We visited as a family staying for ten days and were really impressed with Port Orleans French Quarter, transportation links were very good with a freaquent boat trip (every 10-15 minutes) linking the resort with Down Town Disney and busses taking guests to the other attractions. We never dined within the hotel, prefering to sample the delights of Epcot, Down Town and some of the luxury Disney Hotels, We did have a couple of cocktails in Skat Cats where live jazz was played. Our room was spacious but not huge, and we were greated with towel animals on our bed. Right outside our room was a jogging track linking to the resort of Riverside which was picturesque. All in all a great hotel in a great location and we very much hope to return. The only downside being the loss of the Adventurers Club in Down Town Disney which is a huge loss!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and big step up from Disney's value resorts”
Reviews.Author: HikeVT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great visit to Disney's Port Orleans - French Quarter. The resort has two parts: the French Quarter and Riverside. The French Quarter has a downtown New Orleans decor, while the Riverside portion has mansions along the river and seems a bit more rural. The French Quarter is much smaller than Riverside and every room is a short walk to the pool/hot tub/pool bar/restaurant. We stayed in Building 7 so we were also a short walk up the path to the rest of the resort and all of Riverside's amenities. As always at Disney, the service is fantastic and everyone is friendly. The foodcourt at the French Quarter is a bit more sparse than the one up the path at Riverside, but still good and features a few French specialties. Also, try the ice cream cookie sandwich...delicious and made with (huge) fresh cookies. Room size is sufficient and bathroom area is relatively large with two sinks outside the shower/toilet area. One of best features is the free boat ride to/from Downtown Disney (runs every minutes at night and the ride is beautiful).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0317
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. The buses to and from the parks are reliable and very convenient. We had a view of the river- very nice, but we didn't keep the windows open much for privacy reasons! Boat comes to the dock right on the property for a leisurely trip to Pleasure Island. The quick service food was very good- expensive, but with the Disney Dining Plan we didn't really care. Sometimes during off times of the day selection was sparse, but never had a problem finding something to snack on. Rooms were large. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At Port Orleans - French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jamlove04
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely perfect for a couple on their own. It is small, very quiet and there isn't much for kids to do so it is much better suited to a couple. It's very close to all the parks as well as to Downtown Disney. It is smaller than most of the other resorts that we visted. There were a handful, if that many, of children staying at the resort (it was also low season) so it was amazingly quiet, especially after a day in the parks. We had a room by the river which was great for the 15 minute boat ride into Downtown Disney. We had a room with a king-sized bed. The room was about 350 square feet and was, again, perfect for a couple. Unlike many other resorts, French Quarter has its own dedicated bus service to the Parks so no stopping at other resorts on the way out in the morning. On the way back, it does share the bus with Riverside, but French Quarter is always the first stop. The longest we spent on a bus was maybe fifteen minutes. Disney's bus system, by the way, is top-notch - we never waited longer than ten minutes on any bus anywhere in the World. Two cons about the hotel: one was that you could hear the toilet flushing plumbing noise a few times in the early evening (three times was the most I heard) but if you're out at the Parks or out at Downtown Disney, it wouldn't bother you. Two is the only food is a limited selection at the food court. However the Parks either close late or it's a ten minute boat ride to Downtown Disney. Alternatively, there's an actual restaurant at Riverside. We never ate at French Quarter, and we never had to. Honestly there's nothing but good things that I can say about this hotel. Service was excellent and the people who worked there were friendly and helpful. We visited the Swan, the Dolphin, Boardwalk, a bunch of other resorts while we were there, and we'd pick French Quarter again in a heartbeat. We absolutely loved it, and whole-heartedly recommend it for your trip to Walt Disney World. A few tips: (1) If you're a couple, definitely do the Disney gift card package rather than the meal plan package. We had so much more fun because we had all this money to spend on the gift card and we weren't restricted to certain menus or restaurants because we were on the meal plan. On the other hand, since Disney food is so expensive, I wouldn't recommend the gift card over the meal plan for, say, a family of 4. (2) If you have a coupon for minigolf and want to figure out how to get there using Disney transportation, no one at the hotel knows the easiest way; we eventually had to figure it out on our own. Essentially, either take the bus from either Downtown Disney or one of the Parks to Blizzard Beach for Winter Summerland, or to Disney Swan for Fantasia Mini Golf. You'll see directions for both courses once you get to your destination. (3) Eat at any or all the restaurants at Animal Kingdom lodge - it's an absolutely fantastic experience. We had lunch at Sanaa (the other restaurants aren't open for lunch) and the service and the food were both outstanding. (4) Get to Epcot and Magic Kingdom as early as possible. However for DHS and Animal Kingdom, we got there around 11 and still made it to every single attraction by 5pm. It definitely helped that it was the end of February. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay at Port Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie-Buckeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bldg. 4 on the first floor---convenient to the foodcourt and store and bus service. The food was great--especially loved the pot roast and the Mickey Mouse waffles for breakfast with the raspberries!! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Resort”
Reviews.Author: jewels1130
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia Bay and it was wonderful. Close to everything! I would go again!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess1108
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at this resort with my husband and my 4 year old daughter. We live in Florida and travel to Disney often due to the great rates for FL Residents. We deicded to make another quick trip up and booked Port Orlean's FQ for our stay. Partly because of the hotels that were available it was the "fairest" price and because of the positive things we had heard. I was a bit nervous due to the reviews and I will admit that in some ways, the reviews are right and the hotel does fall short in some areas, but more often than not, the experience exceeded our expectations. We are a family who spends little time in our hotel rooms, so perhaps we have a different perspective, but here was our experience in a nut shell. The resort is adorable and quaint and if you ask me - so easy to get to! We have our car and actually prefer to drive everywhere and this hotel is so accessible from every area of Disney. The theme is not overdone - it's tasteful and really quite enjoyable. My daughter was thrilled when we went to check in! There are cast members in costume handing our coins and beads to the kids and they really get a kick out of that! My daughter loved the little playground at the hotel and also the arcade! She didn't spend much time at either, but appreciated the time she did spend and it was just nice knowing it was there. Everything in the hotel is easy to get to. Unlike Coronado - you can walk to everything! We were in building 5. Nice because it's set back a little, but parking was weird. There was no great parking close to the building - a trade off to being in a nice, quiet location! The staff is friendly, warm and professional. If you do have a problem (which we did - more below) be sure to ask for the manager Mario. He is as wonderful as any manager I have ever come acorss. Genuinely concerned and apologetic for any difficulty and will go out of his way to ensure your stay is a good one. The food is Disney Hotel food - it's mass produced theme park food! It's as good as any other "cafe" type restaurant at other resorts. Not sure what some people truly expect. We got a quick bite there in the morning and my daughter loved the mickey waffles! the food is good - big portions for the price. good selections. If you want fine dining - go elsewhere! Even the "five star" type restuarants on property are mass produced food establishments - it's fine. If you are a picky eater - bring your own snacks, etc. OK, so now for the bad and ugly.... The resort itself is nice, but once you walk through the door of your hotel room you do at times feel that you have stepped out of a disney property and into a motel 6. THe rooms for the most part are clean. Not to "ritz carlton" standards, but we had no issues with that. Yes, as poeple have said, the rooms are outdated. hey only have double beds which is not ideal. I dont so much care that the tv wasn't flat screen. It worked and it did it's job. Aside from the beds being small, be preparred to feel the "age" of these beds the next morning if you are sensitive to those things. The toilet flushing was louder than any toilet i have ever heard - and of course that means not only does the sound of your own bother you, so will the sound of everyone else's! We could hear them all night. The walls are thin. Had a baby screaming next to us, but the front desk was more than happy to let us change rooms and they went out of their way to find one that had no occupied rooms to either side. should you have to do that at a moderate disney resort...no. But, i apprecaited that they were apologetic and helped fix the problem! The bathroom amentities are ok. Nothing fancy. If you are particular about products - bring your own! Our frige didn't work great. We didnt have anything spoil - but even when I told Mario the manager that it wasn't working as well as it should, he offered to reimburse me for any food/beverages that wen bad. Mario did tell us that they are due to get room overhauls before the end of the year! I will say that once that is done, i would go back and visit this resort any time! We stayed at Coronado in December. Yes, the rooms were fantastic. But the customer service was not nearly as good as Port Orleans FQ. Give this hotel a fair chance. Go knowing that while it might not be the grand floridian, it's certainly worthy of being a moderate hotel considering its amenities and amazing cast members! If you are headed to Disney and you are not likely to spend much time in the room and you can understand what you are getting at this hotel, you will enjoy and appreciate it. If you go expecting the ritz carlton, you will be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Was very dissapointed with the food and quick serve. Decor was nice but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: jayzerimar
Reviews.Content: I went to the corranado springs last year and it was way better in every way then the french quarter. I would suggest lowering the french quarter to a value resort.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Christmasvacati0ner
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Disney for Christmas for 10 years and this was the first time we stayed at French Quarter. We feel it is our favorite because when we get back from the parks the cafeteria is still open and there is a jazz night club right on site. As always the staff bent over backwards to give us anything we asked for, not just on a surface level but if you needed anything above and beyond they would happily accomodate you without any questions. We weren't happy that the smoking area is right outside the store and the restaurant and we have to walk thru it every time we go anywhere, and if you have daughters, don't get the meal plan, it would be appropriate for growing boys but not for daughters who don't eat alot. The boat that goes to Downtown Disney was something different as opposed to the buses, and if you like a quiter experience I would definitely recomend the French Quarter. We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, Food rubbish, all sugar and fat”
Reviews.Author: triangle3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and well looked after, rooms clean and quiet, entertainment poor. The only thing that lets this Hotel down is the food, it is too sugary and fat. It does not cater for european taste, healthy.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Benwa52
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 daughters, 10 & 8) stayed there at the end of January through the beginning of February. It was a terrific place to stay! I ilked the French Quarter layout of the property. Very nicely landscaped. Honestly, I would have liked the buildings to have been closer together to enhance the French Quarter experience, but this in no way detracts from my impression of the property. We stayed in a very clean room with two Queen beds. It was more than adequate for our needs - sleeping. We were out of the room by 8:30 a.m. and did not return until the parks were closed. If you are going to stay in the room for an extended period of time, then you might consider it a bit small. The pool was large and nicely-arrayed. However, we did not use it because it was a bit cool the whole time we were there and I don't believe the pool is heated. I thought the food at the food court was much better tha I expected when I first saw the food court. The prices were not wallet-gouging. In fact, I expected to have spent more than what was charged. For Dads, you can buy beer and/or liquor at the on-property store. To my chagrin, it took me a couple of days to figure this out!!!! Though we did not take the water taxis to Downtown Disney, it appeared that they ran quite efficiently. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Quaint French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BelieveInYourself
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the POFQ from January 21 to 25. This was our 5th visit to the FQ and won’t be our last. This resort has a nice feel to it. There are wide peaceful walking paths along the canal that lead you to the Riverside resort. The ride aboard the riverboat ferry to downtown Disney is relaxing and scenic. The kids love the huge heated pool with its Mardi Gras theme and dragon slide. Our family really appreciates the bus service to and from the parks. The resort is small enough so that there is only one bus stop. You will be the first to be picked up by the bus going to the parks and the first to be let off from the parks when returning. The rooms are average size and accommodate our family of four comfortably. The bathroom is small and the beds are doubles. We wish they were queens. Some of the rooms have a king bed. There is a small refrigerator, coffee pot and a safe in the room. The food at this resort is pretty good and the cost is moderate. We eat breakfast here daily and dinner occasionally. A family of four can eat breakfast at this resort for about $30USD and dinner for about $40USD. It is cafeteria style so there’s no tipping. We like to take the riverboat to Downtown Disney and eat at The Earl of Sandwich while sipping on a cup of there great Kona coffee. A family of four will spend about $40USD to eat at the Earl. Planet Hollywood has a neat theme to it and the food is pretty good as well. We spent $70USD including the tip to eat at Planet Hollywood. You may spend more but we tend to keep it simple. Downtown Disney has a large selection of restaurants from which to choose. If you like fast food there is a McDonalds as well. Disney’s Magical Express will get you to and from the airport flawlessly. We always visit Disney in January and have observed the parks are getting more crowded with each passing year. The staff at the POFQ is pleasant, helpful and easy to get along with.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good things to say...”
Reviews.Author: fredheadsaskatoon
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the French Quarter. The style and layout of this relatively small resort is a nice alternative. The grounds are stunning and immaculate. We had a teriffic room location on the ground floor walking out onto the river. The pool and ferry dock were nearby, and the foodcourt and other amenities were also very convenient. Ferry service to Riverside and Downtown Disney were easy and dependable and the shuttle service to the parks was great. Food at the hotel was quite good and the Riverside foodcourt had some additional offering that we took advantage of. ( the collard greens at the French Quarter were awesome) We realized that not buying the meal plan was the right decision for us early on in the trip. As 2 adults and a 6 year old we would have had to eat way more food than we need to take advantage of it. The restrictions would have also been a downside. 9 and under meal options are available all over Disneyworld and are great value options. My wife and I shared meals most of the time, often with an additional side, and were always satisfied. All of the staff encountered at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The grounds, pool area, foodcourt and other public areas were extremely well maintained. The maintenance of our room was unfortunately not up to quite the same standard. It seemed that the daily service was rushed and not overly thorough. This may have been due to lack of staff or just a particular staff member. It seemed better at the beginning, then dropped off. The room could use a little cosmetic work, and queen sized beds are a must. There is plenty of room for them and the doubles are really undersized for two adults. The very basic cable would have looked better on a modern flatscreen. Despite these few shortcomings we would strongly recomend the French Quarter. If we ever return we intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little oasis”
Reviews.Author: busterjosh
Reviews.Content: As I write this review I am sitting in my room at the french quarter of port orleans sad to be leaving tomorrow. I travel extensively for business and I have become a bit of a "hotel snob". But I have to say that this is an excellent hotel. Service is great. Nice selection of food in the food factory. Great pool and reasonably nice rooms. Property is absolutely georgous and just a short boat taxi to downtown disney or port orleans riverside. I wouldn't hesitate to strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Adorable!”
Reviews.Author: zazuHicksville
Reviews.Content: Went the day after Thanksgiving with 3 teeagers and Husband- his Bday. We stayed here 13 years ago- it is adorable! Having stayed at almost every WDW property- at least once many even more- I was so happy to have come back to this resort. The room decor was so nice- very charming actually - to compare this to a value resort is rediculous, especially having stayed at one in October and not having the best time with our room- Hubby went swimming- kids used the game room- food court was fine had a decent selection- ck in was a breeze- very friendly fun cast members- our rooms were on the 1st floor facing the pool. We ate dinner at the Grand Floridian Cafe- our new favorite- must try it! Fun at MK that nite and back home the next day- Going back to French Quarter in June for daughter's bday- already booked before we left using code they leave in room-

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: TheBoss99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter for a week. We loved it. The room was nice and clean and had plently of room for our family of 4. The "mousekeepers" left cute towel animals every day and even made a hammock for my daughter's stuffed bunny one day! The staff was friendly and location was good. We took the Disney shuttle to the parks each day. French Quarter is one of the smaller disney resort hotels so you don't have to walk as far to the bus stop as you would at some of the other ones. You can also take the water ferry to downtown disney from French quarter. The dining hall was average. We ate a pizza there our first night. The Port Orleans Riverside actually has a dining hall with more selection and it is just a boat ride away from French Quarter. There was usually jazz music playing when we walked in the lobby. The mardi gras theme is carried out throughout the whole hotel. The grounds are beautiful and they have a great pool with an alligator water slide! Wish the hot tub would have been a little bigger though...that was a popular place for the parents most nights. We were there the week of mardi gras and I was disappointed that the French Quarter hotel didn't do anything special for it...I think that is a missed opportunity on Disney's part. BUT...we loved the hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST DISNEY EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Swimgal77
Reviews.Content: We made our resversations 1 year in advance and received NONE of our requests! We needed a 1st floor room due to a handicap family but received a 2nd floor far away from everything. The very UNFRIENDLY castmember who checked us in said where we neede to be was having :CONCEREE WORK" done but we saw people checking in on that floor. So back up we wnt to the desk and they said "No ROOMS!" She didnt even look. We would never stay there again and we tell all of our famiy, friends,and anyone who will listen to stay away from this very RUDE, unfriendly, very UNMAGICAL Disney RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient for Children with Disabilities”
Reviews.Author: Supermom123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and two children in July. My daughter is 7, my son is 5 and has an Autism Spectrum Disorder. The resort was clean, colorful and pretty. It was in a perfect location for reaching the parks in under 15 minutes. The bus service was quick and efficient, including the Magical Express to and from the airport. The overall reason we chose this resort was because the walking distances to and from the bus stop, dining hall, arcade, pool and gift shop are very short as compared to other Disney Resorts. This is very helpful when dealing with young children with disabilities. The staff was quick to bring us anything we needed to the room; extra sheets, blankets, and a clean egg-shell foam mattress for our son. We also had a roll-away bed for our daughter (at an additional small charge) so that everyone could spread out and get a good night's sleep. Each morning I left a note for housekeeping stating what we needed (with a tip), and when we returned from the parks the room was clean and meticulously made up with everything we had asked for. The pool is fabulous for children at this resort, and the lifeguards are extremely professional. Whenever we were at the pool I would alert the lifeguards to my son's disability and his limited awareness of danger. They even talked to him about the pool rules at my request. We were very happy with our stay at this resort and the professionalism of the staff. The Micki Waffles were delicious, too!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at a very good resort”
Reviews.Author: moviedave83
Reviews.Content: For my honeymoon, I stayed 6 nights at the Port Orleans French Quarter (POFQ). I had hoped to stay someplace a little fancier, say, the Contemporary Resort, but do to budgetary reasons, I had to scale back to the POFQ. It ended up not being too big of a lost as we had a very comfortable week here (it might have been a lot colder then we were hoping for, but I can't very well fault Disney for that). Although normal check-in time was 3pm, our room was ready at 12:30pm when we arrived, which was nice. Check-in went reasonably smooth, and the people at the front desk were polite. The grounds were very beautiful and wonderfully maintained. A stroll along the paths at night can be very romantic. The buildings are still in good shape, however some signs of wear in the paint is starting to become evident. This would be an ideal time to repaint; that way the resort will never look anything but wonderful We had a room with a king bed on the second floor with a very nice view overlooking the river. The room itself was very functional and comfortable. It was kept clean. Mousekeeping did a fine job. The room has two separate sinks outside of the bathroom, allowing my wife and I to have our own space, which was really nice. That way one of us could be getting ready while the other was in the shower. The bathroom is small consisting of just the toilet and a shower. The toilet worked fine, although its flush is rather loud. The shower was great. The water heated up fast and the pressure was excellent. Some people have taken issue with the room that houses the toilet and the shower, but I have never understood that complaint. They could alter the bathroom to include the vanity area as most hotels do, but then the room would lose a lot of its functionality, especially for families. The bathroom does what it needs to do. If there is an area that the room could use some work, it is with the TV. It is an older TV and the channel selection was weak. A few movies channels would be much appreciated, and perhaps and upgrade to a flat screen TV would be in order. I did hear that Disney is in the process of adding flat screens to their moderate resorts, of which POFQ is one. I hope this is true. The bed linens and bedspread could also use some updating, however I found the mattress to be very comfortable. The temperature dial on the mini-fridge was broken so it kept freezing our water. Annoying, but no not a big deal. I didn't even mention it till I checked out. Overall, though, I was very happy with the room. I enjoyed the food court although a few healthier selections couldn't hurt. The food is rather greasy. The outdoor pool is heated and really nice, and although I didn't use the spa as my wife is pregnant, it looked fine. Maybe next time. The general store at the resort had some basic toiletries and snack foods and was a nice place to browse through. Port Orleans Riverside (another moderate resort) was a nice stroll down the path and guests at POFQ have full access to the amenities of that resort as well. We walked down there for a private carriage ride one night, which was very relaxing and romantic. We utilized the Disney Bus transportation system to get to the parks, and I had no issues with them. They run every twenty minutes, which means that sometimes the bus will be waiting when you arrive at the bus stop and other times, you will have to wait the twenty minutes. If waiting is a problem for you, then a rental car might be in order. If you are like me however, and like to be waited on while you are on vacation, a short wait is a small price to pay for not having to worry about a car. The same goes for Disney's Magical Express (their complimentary transportation to the airport). It might take a bit longer, but it is free and comfortable. It is just one less thing to worry about. They will even take car of your bags for you. POFQ also has ferryboat service to Downtown Disney. It is a relaxing and scenic alternative to taking a bus, and one we utilized. The only downside to Disney's transportation is that it can be difficult to go from one resort to another as you first have to take a bus to one of the parks and then grab another bus to the resort you are trying to get to. It can make getting to dinner reservations at another resort a bit of a hassle. Providing a shuttle service from resort to resort is something they should look into. Overall, this is a fine place to stay when you are at Disney. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Port Orleans French Quarter to someone else. It isn't the most luxurious resort at Disney, but it is clean, comfortable, convenient and the grounds are beautiful. It is a good choice for romance on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLRS1
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth stay in this hotel. It's our favorite of the Disney "moderate-price" hotels. The grounds are beautiful, rooms nice and clean, and location is convenient to the theme parks. We had a rental car, so we did not use the Disney bus transportation, nor did we eat in any of the resort restaurants. All the rooms have a refrigerator, so we stocked it with beverages and breakfast items which saved a lot of money. We love the New Orleans ambiance of the hotel and will probably stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay not the typical Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: nulyte
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney 2-3 times a year and always stay on property. This recent trip we chose the Port Orleans French Quarter. We signed up for on-line check in and expected no problems. When we arrived there was only one person in line and 4 representatives at the counter. No one acknowledged us or offered to help. Finally a young woman from concierge came over and inquired if we used the "on-line" check in since that was the line we were in. We stated yes and she took us over to concierge. Check in was than less than 5 minutes. We were booked for 8 nights/9days. The room was nice and more importantly ready for us. Our biggest complaint was during our stay we were never given enough towels or toiletries. We have 2 adults and 3 young children and were always given 4 towels, 1 bottle of shampoo and 1 soap. Since 2 of our children are under 6 believe me they are always spilling something on themselves:) and get at least 2 baths per day. We never saw any Disney magic at this hotel. Most times at Disney the housekeeping staff will make towel animals when they know there are young children in the room. All we saw was a mass exodus of housekeeping staff daily at 3:30pm running for their shuttle. Believe me don't be in their way. This was our FIRST time ever seeing this at any of the resorts. We frequently passed staff and our children were raised to say good morning,afternoon , etc. , half the time we weren't even acknowledged. On the day before our check out the East Coast was hit by a big snowstorm. We called the front desk to inquire about extending by 1 day. The young man on the phone said they were not booked and he could extend our stay at the rate we booked our package,$149/nt. My husband went immediately down to the desk to pay for our extra night and was told then that they would only extend at $209/nt. He explained he just called and they went and got the manager who basically said too bad. As I said earlier we visit Disney 2-3 times a year and this manager was the worst of Disney customer service. I called WDW reservations and spoke with their manager. She stated she could not override the price but the manager should honor his employees guarantee. She then called the hotel for us and the manager still refused. WDW reservations then transferred our reservation to the Pop Century resort and they gave us a room at $89/nt which was below the current rate. Overall we know that each resort is operated as a single stand alone hotel and in the future will not re-book the Port Orleans French Quarter. When a company like Disney puts themseleves out there as the "best" in customer service they should strive for that.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful holiday stay at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLizzy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending the week of Christmas in Walt Disney World at Port Orleans French Quarter Resort. This is a moderatley priced Disney Resort. The staff is very freindly and helpful, our room was very comfortable, the decor was perfect foe the New Orleans theme. Housekeeping kept our room very clean and the bed was heavan after long days in the parks. The quick service restaraunt at the resort served a variety of food and beverages that we found perfect for breakfast and snacks (we ate our lunches and dinners in the parks and at other resports). We will definatley be rerurning to this resport next year for the holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: davidbeckhamxox
Reviews.Content: My aunt and uncle stayed here in November with my 2 younger cousins.. At the same time, myself and my boyfriend stayed at one of the all-star resorts.. The rooms are the SAME EXACT size.. the ONLY difference is that the french quarter had a small mini-fridge.. honestly, i was shocked that we had the same amount of space and we were paying less than half what they were paying per night.. rip off!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: thumper2009
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at POFQ. It was comfortable and clean but nothing overwhelmingly fancy. We had people from every age range with us from 3 years to Senior Adult. I have stayed in a wide variety of hotels and resorts and would say that as far as the room goes it was something comparable to a Holiday Inn Express or La Quinta. The beds were comfortable however the bedding was nothing to write home about. The room could use some updating but was always clean. For the short amount of time that is spent in the room while at Disney World, it is a fine stay. The biggest factor was the convenient location and small resort. Due to it being one of the smaller resorts, it made walking to the bus stop a non-issue. Also, it was a short bus ride to all of the parks. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinagirl5483
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Port Orleans French Quarter, we stayed from Dec 17-24, 2009. The room was clean and tidy, check in was fast and efficient, all cast members were friendly. Housekeeping was confused I guess, we had asked for no housekeeping during our trip but they were stopping by anyway, always leaving bag at our door and knocking despite the privacy please sign. Overall great value with the Extra Magic Hours and Transportation, would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “WDW”
Reviews.Author: maddee72
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, the atmosphere was very cool, and the amenities were good

Reviews.Title: “Been to Walt Disney World 8 times now and this was the best holiday by far!”
Reviews.Author: irvine091208
Reviews.Content: We have been to Walt Disney World many times now but this year was the best holiday ever! We visited Florida for our daughters 1st birthday- we were a little reluctant at first whether she would enjoy it or not- but to our suprise, she loved it! We went for 2 weeks at the end of November. The hotel was absoloutley amazing! In the past, we have stayed at Disney's Pop Century Resort, Disney's All Star Movies Resort, Disney's Yacht and Beach Resort and Disney's Animal Kingdom Resort, however this hotel was awarded our favourite so far with the Animal Kingdom Resort following shortly after. We stayed in a room the centre of the resort. Everything was close to our room (food court, pool, launderette and the car park) and nothing was a long walk at the French Quarter! However, a few times when we woke up before the food court opened at 6am, we would have an early morning walk down to the Riverside and we found that everything was much more spread out there and it was a much bigger resort. We preferred the FQ's food court to the Riverside as it was more fun for kids (it was very colourful and had a basket of megablocks for the children to play with). I would say, if you have children, the French Quarter is the one for you. The rooms are plenty big enough with 2 double beds, a fridge, iron, safe, plenty of drawers for clothes etc... The pool at the French Quarter was amazing and the waterslide was a lot of fun! Also, definatley take advantage of the hot tub, it is so relaxing and we wished that we had used it more than we did. We had the Quick Service Dining Plan, and my partner thought that the restaurants would be dissapointing compared to the table service meals but he was pleasantly suprised by the menu's and service we received, and as we did the table service plan the previous year, we wasn't sure what to expect but we actually preffered this plan. It saved a lot of time! On the Quick Service Plan you get 2 meals a day per person, 2 snacks (most things of a single serving under $4) a day per person and a free refillable mug per person which you can use at the hotel throughout your holiday. The holiday and the hotel was fantastic! We couldn't recommend the Port Orleans French Quarter more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Met our needs plus some”
Reviews.Author: GoEagles323
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Disney World for Thanksgiving. (first of all, dont go at Thanksgiving!!! So crowded!!!) We stayed at the Port Orleans - French Quarter resort on Disney. The resort is one of the moderate level resorts. We didn't want to stay in the economy, but we didn't want to dish out the dollars for the deluxe, so we chose Port Orleans. The hotel is lovely and tries to replicate the beautiful french quarter/garden district style with wraught-iron railings and courtyards. The hotel is very quiet. I don't think we ever heard our neighbors. We had a water-front view, which really was not all that spectacular. For the amount of time that you actually spend in your room, don't waste money on upgrades and views. The room does have a small fridge, which came in handy and double sinks. The resort also has a heated pool. We did not use the pool as I was afraid that once my kids got in and found that the water was warm, they would never leave. We spent too much money on the parks for the kids to prefer the pool at the hotel! The only downside to the room was that the beds our double beds, which I didn't think would be an issue. We have two kids, so we figured that we would sleep better and have more room if my husband and I each slept with a child. That might not have been the best idea. Had we gone with the deluxe resorts, we would have had bigger beds and a bunk bed option. However, that is my only con for the room. The resort offers a food court with a wide variety and has a New Orleans theme to it. It does not offer a sit down fancy dining, but with kids, that was not a priority. The resort offers around the clock transportation by bus to the parks and monorail system, which was great. It also offers boat transportation to downtown Disney. Parking was available and easy to find a spot. The only time we drove was when we left the resort to go home. For the price, I highly recommend the hotel. I enjoyed it. It was not a hotspot as it did not have a monorail that ran through it. It was very secluded and quiet which was kind of perfect after a long day at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: sthoeft
Reviews.Content: For a genuine Disney Hotel the prices arte fair. Nice architecture and surounding, very good service. Breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: rosemcf
Reviews.Content: December 19th through Christmas Eve is always a good time to visit here. Request Building 5 overlooking he courtyard, because you will be a short walking distance away from the pool, the hot tub, the food, the gift shop, and the bus. After being in the theme park for 10 hours you might enjoy this. The food court is small, but they have a bakery ((beignets!)) and have pizza, sandwiches, mickey waffles, and more. The service is slow at times, but the service is always friendly. There's a pool, which most kids will enjoy, and a waterslide, which is a bit mild for my tastes. I'm a big fan of wild water rides! The hot tub is separate from the pool area. Compared to the one at the Caribbean Resort, this one is quite large. There are a lot of friendly people in the hot tub each evening. The French Quarter does not have a sit down restaurant, but you can either take a short walk or boat ride to Riverside next door. This resort is very charming as well and it;s like you're staying in two resorts for the price of one! The buses run regularly and you can talk a boat to Downtown Disney. Just you and your spouse. *wink wink* After jamming into buses it's nice to just float peacefully on the river. You could get a Disney Vacation Home if you are starting to go more frequently. But if you decide not to invest, you are going back to the french Quarter. Or I'll sic Mickey Mouse and Goofy on you. ^_^

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice for Park Hopping Fun”
Reviews.Author: NorthernGuy13
Reviews.Content: My family and I (wife and 8 yr old) recently returned from a wonderful trip to Disney World. We chose the Port Orleans French Quarter mainly because of the hotel theme and it's compact size. The rooms are not overly huge as noted in previous reviews but are more than adeqaute considering that you will be exhausted from theme park fun by the time you return to you room. None of the rooms have private balconies that we could determine and the extra money for "water view" is probably not worth it. The resort is one of Disney World's smaller ones which is nice since you will need all of your walking strength for the parks. If you are looking for fancy spacious rooms this probably is not the place for you. The hotel restaurant (not table service) is OK with the pizza being our favourite. Hotel staff are very nice and will go out of their way to help. The water taxi ride to Epcot or Downtown Disney is fun. Maid service was good and all of our needs were promptly attended to. I would recommend this hotel as a good base for your families Disney adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: ToddMcfly
Reviews.Content: The location is great! The rooms are small but clean. The grounds are beautiful. The resort is not too big and the staff is great. The other resorts appear to be more spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Over sized,over expensive Blackpool but one you need to experience”
Reviews.Author: Bozzabubbu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POFQ with my teenage daughter, son and two adult friends. The resort is clean apart from the numerous leaves on the grounds often slippy when it does rain and they get wet. . It is ideal for families with young children with good clean swimming pool and often three life guards on duty at any one time,therefore,very safe. Quite expensive shop,drinks and food especially if not on the dining plan although I'm glad we weren't as I couldn't face the food everyday, burger,hot dogs,chicken nuggets,pasta and pizza. The menu never changed and although edible it was boring. Suggest visiting the larger Riverside restaurant with a slightly better menu. Disney must be seen but take plenty of spending money as you'll need it. Hotel good but would not stay again, would like to experience the others available.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: gojogo67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to WDW and we stayed at POFQ with two children, ages 6 and 9. The room was more than adequate in size and the service and staff could not have been more accomodating. The wait for the bus was never more than 10 minutes, usually less, and the water taxi to Downtown Disney was easily accessible from our room in building 5. The only thing wrong with the room was that the tub looked worn and probably needed to be updated, but other than that, the housekeeping was great. If you are looking for nice accomodations at an affordable price, then POFQ is for you.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: WDWlover
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading some reviews but I gotta say, I thought the rooms were well taken care of. I even looked at the paint which quite honestly when we are at Disney we just fall into bed at the end of the day and are not that concerned with paint. Our towels were white. Our room was clean. We had a message one day that they would be power washing the building exterior the next day so I know that was clean. Our shower head was not removable, and the water pressure was wonderful and always hot. We never heard neighbors or anyone outside so much that it was a bother. We had a first floor room in building 5. Would I stay there again, sure, but it wouldn't be my first choice. My first choice would be Shades of Green. I won't pay the Deluxe rates just to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Never want to stay off site again”
Reviews.Author: clairelybelgian
Reviews.Content: On previous Disney World trips, we stayed off site on International Drive, not anymore! on to this hotel... They are refurbishing the Lobby entrance but we did not experience any problems as a result. As a pessimistic soul, it would be the sort of thing I'd pick on Disney for but all was quiet. Our receptionist at check in was very nice and gave us a map to the nearest car park and our room, which was conveniently located near to the bus stop, car park and lobby area (building 4, sneaky shortcut to bus stop). We were also able to purchase park tickets in reception to add to our room keys (one less thing to lose), which was also easy and that cast member was also helpful and didn't try to sell us anything extra, just gave us what we asked for. The room was clean, tidy and not painfully Disneyfied. The bathroom was probably the most dated aspect but was clean with good shower pressure and a huge supply of towels. The airconditioning unit was very effective and quiet, compared to the last I-drive hotel I was in. We had towel animals every day and housekeeping were more than diligent in keeping the room clean during our stay. I would only fault them for their keenness to get in and clean the room on the day we left but they waited, I just felt slightly rushed and surprised as that hadn't happened on any of our other days. The park buses were frequent when leaving the hotel, the waiting area has benches and fans, important in the muggy summer months, not really an issue in November! It can be a wait for the buses at park closing times and I noticed that this was when the buses were shared with Riverside. We probably waited about 10mins or so for a bus either way so you're not spending valuable park time at a bus stop! The food court is convenient and has a good selection of family safe options and was open quite late. Can only vouch for the burgers but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The obligatory gift store also had a few sundries in case you needed water, snacks or the odd band aid. Overall, I really liked the complete ease of the entire stay, having the room key to charge meals anywhere in the park to, send our souvenirs back to the resort and our park tickets on, plus the novelty of extra magic hours to try rides in the dark! Also, not having to track the hotel bus down, they were really easy to find compared to the Mears buses for outside hotels. If I had kids, this would be the only way to do Disney but I'd probably cough up the extra for the Monorail resorts, after robbing the bank, which we didn't have to do for POFQ. The boat to Downtown Disney was just as efficient as the buses, with a little sightseeing tour included. I'll just say if Dixieland jazz doesn't appeal to you, I'd suggest another resort, it's piped in around the grounds, on the buses and boats. The pool looks really cool but never had time for it! If you hadn't guessed, I'd do it all again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFarrington
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, for the 3rd time, in early November when we visited for the wife's 50th Birthday. The last time had been about 3 years ago and the place simply hasn't changed, and perhaps that's a little mistake. Don't get me wrong, this is a fabulous hotel in beautiful grounds with brilliantly helpful staff. In a perfect place for visiting the parks, especially Downtown Disney which is but a short boat ride away. The food court was also outstanding But the bedrooms are starting to look a little dated, it's time they were given a face lift. Get rid of the 2 awful queen size beds and put in 1 nice King Size bed, change the air-con unit's to a new more modern style that doesn't rattle (like the fridge did) and put in double glazing to eliminate outside noise. The TV could have done with being a new new Flat Screen Style as well. But possibly my only real complaint with the hotel is that, for some reason, it was very noisy (We were in Block 6). The plumbing seemed to make a hell of a row. So on a whole a great hotel with more good points than bad, but with a few changes it could become excellant hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cakes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. We really like the location and ambience. We are runners and enjoy running alone the river. We like the boat service to Downtown Disney. We also like being close to Epcot. I really like the way that the rooms are designed. I don't like paying extra to get a king sized bed. I'm glad they have a refrigerator but would also like a microwave. My only real complaint is with the linens. The sheets are scratchy and the towels are gray. I think that Disney could do better. After visiting most of the other Disney hotels, we will definitely stay here again when choosing one of the "moderate" resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice grounds but disappointed with the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MoniqueD8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days prior to a cruise. The grounds were very nice but the actual rooms was very worn, scratched furniture, scuffed walls, funny smell. We had connecting rooms which were very convenient. The room was on the smaller side, bathroom was sectioned off with just a curtain. The beds were hard, not very comfy for what I expected from a Disney hotel, of course it was from the "moderate" category, so perhaps my expectations were too high. We could not believe we could hear the toilet flushing from the upstairs unit. Also the room doors open to outdoor corridors and we could hear everyone passing. The first night we had to have someone come out to fix our AC unit. They did so quickly. We had a problem with the room key card and had trouble getting another one from the front desk. On the plus side, the food court nearby was nice, good food, nice gift shop. However, no room service at this hotel. I would definitely recommend paying to stay at a better hotel in the Disney complex, after a long day at the parks it makes a difference to come "home" to a better and higher quality hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A great, adult-friendly hotel in the best park ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyDisneyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at Port Orleans French Quarter after getting a good deal on a Disney Land & Sea package (3 nights @ a Disney moderate resort and a 4 night cruise). Normally, we would just book a value resort to save money so this was a great deal for us! My husband and I have no children yet so we were doing Disney as a couple and French Quarter was fantastic! It is very small in relation to most of the other Disney hotel properties so we never felt overcrowded or surrounded by a million kids (and this was over July 4th!). The grounds are beautiful and very charming and it's a lot of fun to just take a romantic walk along the river. Our room was very well appointed and did not feel at all crowded (especially with only 2 people). The only slightly negative aspect of this resort is that the food court is really quite small and doesn't have a huge selection of foods. However, this is definitely offset by the fact that it doesn't get extremely crowded or noisy, not to mention they have beignets (a traditional New Orleans fried dough breakfast food)! Overall, this resort exceeded our expectations and we would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience On Property”
Reviews.Author: bear7711
Reviews.Content: Each time we go to WDW, we end up staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter because they have the exact right mix of value and Disney Magic. The staff is exceptionally friendly and the rooms are nice, if not elaborate. The swimming pool and food court are favorites. (Try the pizza!) The skiff takes you to Downtown Disney, and buses make all the other attractions just a quick ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant resort - small, quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DISNEYFANLincoln
Reviews.Content: Have been to Orlando 8 times and staying within WDW 3 times before at value resorts. Decided to treat ourselves to a Moderate resort and after lots of research picked French Quarter. So glad I did, it was brill. After the wonderful madness of the Parks it was great to get back to an oasis of tranquility. The resort is smaller than the rest which means you don't have to walk too far to get anything. WDW buses were plentiful and the staff were friendly and helpful. The resort is quite intimate and feels like a proper hotel not a motel. The room was great, larger than a value resort with two sinks - a bonus when you have an 3 year old who always wants to be where you are. Comfy beds and a fridge to keep all our provisions in. You can take a boat to Downtown Disney - it's a quarter of an hour ride and well worth it. The resort was great for adults but my 3 year old loved it too, especially the kids play area and the themed pool. Stay here you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little too quiet”
Reviews.Author: samies-mom
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney for the past 7 years - have stayed primarily in the Value resorts, including All-Star Music and Pop Century. Due to the stellar deal that Disney was running this year, we decided to give the Moderate group a try with Port Orleans - French Quarter. This resort is lovely and not crowded. We did not wait in a line anywhere in the lobby, concierge desk, or even the food court area for more than 1 minute (except for one morning at breakfast). The entire staff, as in all Disney properties, were fantastic. We did not feel for one second that we were in New Orleans, and that's pretty accurate, because we weren't! I did expect a bit more of a Big Easy kind of feel based on how Disney markets this particular property. But my main complaint is that the resort is extremely quiet. The gift shop reminded me of a hospital gift shop. I felt so conspicuous talking to one of the cashiers because it was so quiet it seemed like we were disturbing the peace! The boats that travel along the Sassagoula River to Port Orleans - Riverside and Downtown Disney were very convenient and the captains are helpful, informative and friendly. The pool at French Quarter is a nice large affair, and it has a wonderful slide and lots of fun bells-and-whistles, such as a fountain that splashes into the pool from four "alligators" standing beside it. Fun! Although I don't know if this would've been handled differently at any other Disney property, I think it is worth mentioning that the Port Orleans staff were beyond helpful to me during my trip in one key instance. It was about midnight, and my 2-year old was coming down with a fever. I ran to the gift shop which I hoped might stay open until midnight, but I learned it actually closes at 11. When I approached the front desk, they immediately opened the shop for me without hesitation, and got children's Tylenol for me. Again, probably any Disney property would've done it, but they put me so at ease when I was a bit nervous, so the Port Orleans staff deserve credit for that. The travel time to the Magic Kingdom, EPCOT and Hollywood Studios by the bus service was about 10 minutes - very convenient. Animal Kingdom was quite a ride. This is one of the main pluses of this resort - it's really quite close to nearly everything with just the one exception of Animal Kingdom. Also, there are taxis that wait in the front holding lot of this resort which can be called by the Bellman. We had to get to a lunch at EPCOT quickly on the day of our arrival, and the cab was efficient, clean and about $10. All in all, a lovely place, especially for anyone looking for a quieter resort at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic "Small" Resort”
Reviews.Author: wanito
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and had a great time. The welcome we recevied when checking in was wonderful and our daughters were given small gifts galore! The room was an adequate size and nice and clean. I had read some reports on here about cleanliness so was a bit aprehensive but we had excellent housekeeping throughout our stay with lots of nice towels arrangements for the girls to find on our return to the room each day. The resort is perfect for smaller children as after a hard day walking around the parks the last thing you want is a trek around the resort. Everything is so close together a few minutes walk will get you anywhere. The staff we encountered were really helpful and sorted out any queries we had. When we needed to seek minor medical attention for our daughter they even called us cab and told us they would charge it to the hotel. Transportation was excellent with very little waiting around before a bus arrived. On the rare occassion we shared with Riverside we were picked up first so got seats and then returning we were dropped off first so a win win situation. Elliott Dyson in the Scats Lounge was great and made such a fuss of the girls that one night they turned down the eveing parade to go back a see Elliott perform! We visited lots of the other resorts and although they were all great we did notice they all had more than 1 bus "depot" due to their size so having several stops within the resort before even leaving for the parks would get a bit wearing when staying for 2 weeks. Also the thought of needing to catch a bus just to get to the pool or dining would not appeal either. We plan to go back in 2011 and this will definitely be our resort of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay! Attractive, clean and fun!”
Reviews.Author: StephTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans - French Quarter on a recent family vacation. The atmosphere was whimsical and fun. The kids enjoyed the pool and we enjoyed the clean rooms and site. The restaurant was convenient and tasty and the frequent buses to Disney Parks and hotels were great. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “POFQ IS CONVENIENT BUT FOOD CHOICE & QUALITY IS AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: CAPTAINDerby
Reviews.Content: As a couple without kids in tow who wanted to focus on the WDW Parks, POFQ made a good base with transportation to all parks excellent, and the riverboat service to and rom Downtown Disney particularly useful. Rooms were adequate with comfy beds and a good shower, but nothing more. Overall cleanliness was good around the resort, but threadbare and occasionally less than really clean towels and sheets were disappointing. Staff, particularly in food halls, ( by the way that's what they are, so don't be confused with the claim of multi dining opportunities, it is the same principle as your average shopping center food court) were someway short of the 'Disney' standards of friendliness. Would recommend taking the ten minute stroll down to Riverside if eating in the hotel, as, particularly at peak eating times like breakfast, the FQ capacity is woefully short. Without the benefit of having Downtown a 15 min boat ride away, evening dining would have been limited and would have involved additional cab fares to get away for somrthing bette than fast food, which itself waas not particularly tasty, and didn't vary in 14 days. Breakfast, a big feature of previous US hols was particularly disappointing, and we ended up eating plain cereal as the best deal. So in summary, if you want to have convenient accommodation for the Disney parks, and are not looking for anything special in your hotel facilities it is fine especially if you have younger kids, but don't expect any level of sophistication. We had a great holiday, but the resort was probably the least contributor. Parks fab as ever!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kaciopeia
Reviews.Content: Excellent for a couple of a small family. Well worth the extra if you're going to Disney and want to stay sane.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the two of us”
Reviews.Author: pixtkr
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at POFQ and thoroughly enjoyed it. The size of the resort was perfect as we were less than a 3 minute walk to dining and the bus stop. Bus service was consistant and the food was great for our needs. We didn't have any kids with us so we only utilized the dining hall for breakfast and a few snacks. All other meals were in the parks or adjacent hotels. We used the Disney Dining Plan which was super easy. Because the resort is smaller you don't have the benefits of a sit-down restaurant or a large variety menu in the dining hall, but that was OK for us. Walked down to Riverside one morning for a change of pace and were overwhelmed with the crowds and lines. The intimacy of POFQ spoiled us for sure! If you stay here, take advantage of the water taxi to Downtown Disney. Most of the restaurants there also accept the dining plan and the trip over is a vaction in itself! Our only complaint of the hotel was the dingy paint job on the guest room doors of the buildings. I knew this was a motel style hotel, but I didn't expect it to LOOK like a motel. However, during our last two days there, we noticed the maintenance staff systematically sanding and painting all the doors. We didn't even have time to complain before the issue was resolved. As for mousekeeping, I can't complain about much. We prefer to be a bit more eco friendly when traveling and requested our towels and sheets only be changed once while we were there. However, they left us a bag of fresh towels and such even if we left out the "Do Not Disturb" sign. We had to actually call and tell them NOT to bring us fresh things and they complied. When we did call to have them change the room they were pompt and thorough. Some complain about the size of the rooms but I have no beef here. At Disney, we spend MOST of our time in the parks and these rooms were perfect for the small amount of time each day we spent there (most of it sleeping!). We felt it unneccesary to spend more on a facier room we'd never see!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALittleBitDisneyMad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter in August for 2 weeks after staying in the All Star Resorts for our previous 3 holidays. Found it much more sophisticated and elegant. The atmosphere is always very relaxing and charming, with Jazz music playing throughout the day and night. The rooms are always very clean and pretty and the cleaners always do a very good job of making flannel animals!!! The cast members in the shop are very friendly, welcome you as you come in and they gave us vead necklaces all the time! The food court is decorated with stylish memorabilia and is continually being clean, with a good variety of food. The staff again are friendly and will make conversation with you. We appreciated the greeters at the main door who would ask where we were going that day and wish us a good day, and welcome us "home" when we returned. The boat on the way to Downtown Disney was lovely, really relaxing, very picturesque and a new experience for us, (the bus to Downtown from the All Star Resorts was always really busy and took about 25 minutes.) We're definitely going back next year and we would recommend it to anyone who wants a brilliant holiday and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: cbbb73
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans FQ is the smallest of all WDW resorts. It was the first time we stayed at a Disney resort and we were not disappointed. The resort was beautifully themed. Because of it's size, it's very easy to get around to various parts of the resort. Walks to bus stops, cafeteria and themed pool were short and enjoyable. Getting to the parks could take 20-30mins though since FQ does share buses with Riverside and makes several stops. We thought the services were great and the staff very friendly. We also got a few towel animals in our room. I would recommend this resort to family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mknpearls
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel for our honeymoon and could not be happier! They upgraded our room to a river view room (highly recommended if you don't have any children) for free when they found out we were celebrating. Also, the entire complex, though the smaller of the resorts, is perfectly manicured and always very clean. They have a riverboat that takes you to downtown disney which is great if you are over 21 as they don't close down their transportation till about 2am. Also, lots of restaurants and clubs in that part of town. If you have kids, the pool is great and the food court is really convienient. There is only one bus stop in POFQ so it's kinda nice if you are in a hurry. I'd recommend staying away from building 1 or 7 as these are on the outskirts of the property and there is nothing worse than being in the parks or out and about all day and then coming home to a long walk. I'd stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convienent, fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Supercharged_Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the Disney property this past March for a week. Did not disappoint! Disney definitely knows how to cater to families with small kids. Staff at the hotel was great - no issues. Room was clean and comfortable. Property itself was REALLY well maintained. Food was very good, but not always great. Definitely take advantage of the Disney meal plan during your stay. Bus transport to and form the parks was good - but depending on when you get to a pick-up stop you can spend anywhere from 1 to 20 minutes waiting for a bus for your particular destination - sometimes a bit long, but tolerable. You can also take the free water ferry from the hotel to downtown Disney - also a plus with the kids to take a break from the parks! Staying on the Disney properties is a MUST if you have small kids. The convenience it affords is fantastic. Was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disney World meets New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: clover718
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at Disney's French Quarter resort. Found the resort to be beautifully themed. Convenient location to all the theme parks with efficient bus service. Enjoyed the food court and the activities at the resort. French Quarter guests can also enjoy the amenities at the sister resort Riverside. I especially enjoyed the small size of the resort, as all room locations are convenient to the food court, pool and transportation. The resort bar offers live music most nights of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Not a disappointing in any way”
Reviews.Author: jimforbes
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Port Orleans French quarter (POFQ), we have previously stayed at Disney’s all star resort and Carrabin beach resort. POFQ is small friendly and accessible from each of the buildings. We will be back without a doubt Magical Express This is a great free transfer provided by Disney; if you travel from within the USA they collect your luggage and deliver them to you room at the Disney resort. if you travel from UK you need to collect your own bags and take them to the Disney magical express desk. Transfer takes around 30-40 minuets. Check in This was easy we used the on line check in and our room and information was ready when we arrived. Check in was very easy and the desk staff helpful. The room The rooms are well presented the same size as most Disney rooms (they tend to stick to the same format) moderate resorts have two sinks (value resorts have 1) which is very useful when getting ready in the morning. The room has two double beds sleeping 4 people, this may be a little cramped if you travel with teenagers (but again this is the same with nearly all Disney resorts- all star resorts have some suites). Some reviews on her show photos of dust and dirty rooms; our room was always clean and made up every day, fresh towels and toiletry’s every day. I believe that if you look at almost any hotel review you will find some unclean rooms as not all staff have the same standards. Food court The food court was ok some of the staff don’t speak very good English but you manage. Good choice of food snacks throughout the day. If you are on the Disney dinning plan there is plenty of options (dinning plan is a great deal in my opinion, we have bought it on our previous trips to Disney and always found it to be good value, this time we got it free as part of the Disney package). The refill cup for around $13 is a must you can get this refilled as often as you want with soda (pop) coffee, hot chocolate or water, (I have been told you need to use this three times to benefit) You can use the nearby food court at riverside 10 min walk or you can take the water taxi or bus. The riverside food court is much better with the option to create your own salad or pasta, fresh sandwiches. The evening meals are nice over there and they have a restaurant. Shop The store at POFQ is small with some essentials on offer and a small choice of Disney gifts on offer, again the riverside store has more choice (this is a supply and demand issue, as POFQ is a small resort and riverside is very large) You can buy soda (Pop), juice, wine, beer, bread, donuts, pastries, milk to name just a few, a bottle of Bud is around $6. The pool The kids will love the pool with a slide, children’s float/ life vests available to use for free, free towels to use around the pool, plenty of sun loungers and chairs around. It was September when we visited this is a very quiet time at Disney. Getting a sun bed was not a problem any time of day. The hot tub is very nice to use after a long day in the parks it holds around 10 people at a time. It’s supposed to close at midnight but people continue to use it after that. Oddly children can use this hot tub if supervised by adult. The temperature is around 104 degrees ( *advise children can not control thee body temperature and could have problems in the hot tub- drink plenty of water and don’t let them in for very long if you let them in at all) Transport The bus to any Disney park arrived around every 10-15 min great for getting to the parks; some times you have to stand up. The trip to and from the parks can be educational talking to other guests. The trip to and from the parks take around 10 to 20 minuets depending on what park you are going to. Please note there is no transport to and from resort to resort. So if you are dinning at a hotel/resort you need to travel to a park then to the resort. The return journey from the park can be very busy especially after the fireworks at MK. The boat/ water taxi to down town Disney and to the riverside is very nice and makes a relaxing shopping trip/ visit to downtown. Transport to other non Disney parks - taxi cabs are available all day outside reception cost around $30 to seaworld $35 to universal (if you go in you car it is $13 to park for the day) buses are available from the ticket and transportation centre but it takes a long time. Tips / gratuities Usually $1 a bag/ case to bus driver, for taxi $3 for a $30 trip (this is what I was told from a USA resident) you pay 15% to 20% at restraints. Photopass This is good especially if you travel with family so you all get on the photo, you can buy a CD with all your photos on for around $150 ( a lot of money may be but you can have hundreds of photos with Disney boarders and characters signatures’ on them) Hope this is of some use to you, feel free to ask questions.

Reviews.Title: “We preferred Coronado Springs.”
Reviews.Author: VickieMH
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is a Moderate Disney Hotel. The grounds are pretty and are kept very clean. The rooms were ok. Beds were a small double, My Husband and myself are not large, I am 10 stone but I struggled with space in the bed. There was very little cupboard space for four people. we had 5 hangers for all of the clothes on an open rail in the sink area. Cleaners came in everyday but they did not clean as well as they could have, Dust on TV, down the headboards and dirt on sink pedestal on day of arrival until we left. Bathroom was small and needs an upgrade but it was clean enough and the free shampoo and soap were a nice touch. The restaurant was ok for a snack but the meals were bland. I had a Vegetarian burger for $ 6.99 and thats what I got no lettuce, relish or cheese. Room service consisted of Pizza Delivery. The French Quarter is next to Riverside and very often one bus would need to collect from both locations and would be full. I would recommend staying at the Coronado, it has one bus service, better restaurants and a business centre if you require internet access. PS recommendations for food, if you are on the Disney Dining Plan check out Ohanas at the Polynesian Hotel, The Yachtmen Steakhouse at the Yacht Club, The Brown Derby at Hollywood Studios, Crystal Palace in Magic Kingdom and Sunshine Seasons is an excellent Counter Service restaurant. I am Veggie and my Husband is Meat eater and we were all pleased with the choices in these restaurants. I would recommend you steer well away from restaurants not owned by Disney but doing the plan i.e Planet Hollywood and Raglan Road Irish pub, we were made to feel like second class citizens here for using the plan, they freely admit they take off with your card prior to the meal to check on it to ensure you can cover the bill. They also like to mention regularly that they require a good tip, they seemed to change their tune when presented with the generous Gratutity afterwards. Not sure if they think the british are tight on tips? So to finish, we will be going back to Disney either in 2010 or 2011 and I will be staying in Deluxe accommodation with at least one bedroom for privacy. If I had to stay Moderate I would stay in Coronado Springs which has recently had a room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Disney World for the Money”
Reviews.Author: areadercolorado
Reviews.Content: We love Disney's Port Orlean's Resort. It is a great moderate resort. Clean - great theming - Great pool! Perfect for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “A very good option at Disney”
Reviews.Author: maylegolf
Reviews.Content: We've visited this hotel three times in the past several years and find it always provides a good experience for a Disney stay. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The pool looks great for kids, there is a large spa for the adults. The area seems quiet and the trees and plantings are lovely. The walkways are nice for those who want to extend their walking day past the parks. The boats to Downtown Disney are a fun option to get to that area. The only negatives I can compile are no room service food and in some instances we were not given the King bed we'd requested. They have a limited number of those rooms and we have had two full beds on occasion when expecting the larger King. Not a huge problem, but something I feel people should know when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: joanarc4
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Port Orleans (French Quarter). Several years ago, I had stayed in one of the Disney Value Resorts, and wasn't impressed, not with the quality, the location (FAR from everything, which meant it took forever to get anywhere), crowd, service, etc. On this visit, I wanted to try staying on Disney property again, but was looking to avoid those problems. The Port Orleans was a perfect choice! First, location. The Port Orleans is very close to Downtown Disney, which serves two benefits: a) close to restaurants and shops and activities; and b) close to a transportation "hub." This is important. If you are relying on Disney transportation, you cannot get between the hotels directly, usually (the exception being the monorail hotels). Thus, if you are staying at one hotel and want to get to another (to use spa services, or visit a restaurant, or other activities at the resorts) you have to go to a hub (Downtown Disney or one of the theme parks) and switch to another bus. Being close to Downtown Disney made this a breeze from the Port Orleans. Also, Port Orleans is close to EPCOT and not too far from the Magic Kingdom. Really the only park that's far is Animal Kingdom, and since we weren't planning to visit there on this trip it wasn't an issue. Second, price. We got a great deal on this hotel (~40% off the rack rates, but responding to a promotional email), which made it an even better deal than normal, but I still think it's well worth the price point. Port Orleans is a step about the Value Resorts, and a step below the Deluxe Resorts (such as the Yacht Club or the Wilderness Lodge, for example), which makes it the best value for the price. The Value Resorts, while cheap, *feel* cheap. The beds aren't comfortable, the service is nonexistent, and everything looks and feels flimsy. The Deluxe Resorts, while very nice, are often prohibitively expensive for the average person, and I question whether the vastly increased price matches an increase in quality. The Port Orleans, on the other hand, has a price that fits well with its level of comfort. Third, room/setting: The Port Orleans is adorable. The pathways are pretty and well-groomed and styled to look like the French Quarter in New Orleans (obviously). The buildings are not particularly special, but an attempt is made to make them look like more than just a motel building. The room is fine -- comfortable beds, clean, furniture that is made out of actual wood and not particle board. Everything is well kept. Fourth, service: I was very pleased with the service. We didn't have anything particularly special, but everyone was nice and took the time to answer questions are greet us. With the Value Resorts, I ended up feeling like I was a hassle to all the employees -- just another in the herd of cattle moving through the hotel -- but at the Port Orleans it felt more personal. The concierge was able to book us dinner reservations on our second day with no trouble, and the gift shop ladies were a lot of help when I was looking for something specific. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat From the Craziness of Disney”
Reviews.Author: DirtyJersey
Reviews.Content: Our travel party was a party of 6 adults with three rooms. When we made our reservations we booked king size beds and all received the rooms we booked and paid for. Check in at the front desk was quick and easy. We arrived many hours prior to the official check in time and were told that as soon as our rooms were cleaned we could get into them. Within a hour of arriving all three rooms were ready to be occupied. The rooms were clean and each day when we returned from the parks the rooms were made up and towels and toiletries were replenished. The resort offered a cafeteria type area where quick service meals were available until midnight. Choices included, but were not limited to, taco salads, grilled chicken sandwiches, burgers, pizza, spaghetti and meatballs. Next to the eating area there was also a bar and very small lounge area.
