Next to the pool was also an outdoor bar area. The pool was very large. They had a separate wading pool for the little ones and a separate hot tub area. The resort also offers horse drawn carriage rides (for a fee) and numerous quiet garden and fountain areas. While at the resort we utilized Disney's free buses for transportation around the various parks. Buses came at regular intervals and were always clean and air conditioned. Most parks were a 10-15 minute bus ride away. Sometimes the buses would go straight to the parks and sometimes they would stop at the 4 bus stops at Port Orleans Riverside. When this happened the buses were extremely packed and the trips to the parks took some time. The return trips to the hotel seemed to be just as packed as most buses accomodated both resorts; however, the French Quarter is the first stop on the way back so it's not too bad. We also utilized the boat transportation to Downtown Disney from our resort. It is about a 12-15 minute ride down the "Sassagoula River" from the resort to Downtown and is a lovely, relaxing way to get to your destination. The only negative experience we had was with checking into our flight the last day and utilizing Disney's Magical Express. The counter in the lobby only accomodates two staff members at a time to check in people for their flights. We waited on line for 40 minutes only to be told that I'd have to wait in line again at the airport to check in since the Magical Express Bus was leaving. The young man that was attending to our party was very rude and actually laughed at me when he told me I'd have to check in at the airport. Hmmm, not so "magical" to me. In all fairness, that was the only rude Disney employee we encountered the entire time we were at Disney. Port Orleans French Quarter is one of the smaller resorts on Disney property and as such is quiet and not as crowded as other resorts. The location can't be beat and the rooms are an excellent value for your money. After the craziness of the Disney theme parks it was nice to come back to a quiet low-key resort to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent food, great front desk help.”
Reviews.Author: Disneymom23boys
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel with our children, 6 people in all. We had adjoining rooms on the first floor. My room was a corner room, which was nice, the only noise came from people coming in really late walking by our door. The beds were awesome! The kids fell right to sleep as soon as their heads hit the pillows; they were that comfortable. Our room had 2 double pedestal sinks with a tall curtain separating the sink area from the room - it was very nice an convenient. My friend's was all enclosed with a door, I didn't like that as much as I did ours. I read a lot of reviews about the maid service making towel animals and leaving them on the bed - neither of our parties found any towel animals on our beds, but maybe it was because we didn't leave a daily tip for the maid - we left her a Christmas card with cash in it on our last day. The layout was a little confusing at first, but then again we arrived at nighttime. It seemed like we had to haul our luggage a long ways to get to our room, what I did not realize is there are "turn ins" where you can pull out of the traffic lanes, park, and unload your luggage, and they are located much closer to the rooms. The food court was really good and had a good variety, something for everyone. I was especially thrilled to see they offered Coke Zero in the fountain machines. Ribs, mashed potatoes, chicken, freshly cooked burgers, pizza, beignets, ice cream, and other treats galore. The food court is open late for those arriving back from the parks late. Plenty of room to sit, never had a problem finding a seat. The hotel is smaller footprint-wise, meaning not as many rooms which helped simplify things. One central bus station was a bit of a downer since the bus did fill up at times and we had to wait for another or stand. The help at the front desk was great. I had left my return driving directions at home, and they had pre-made driving directions on an index card they gave me so I was able to get home without a problem. I would stay at this resort again, hands down. I am taking another Christmas trip to Disney, but my kids want to try the Carribean Beach resort, I do hope that it is as nice as this one. If not, our next stay will be back at POFQ.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, but still a great stay”
Reviews.Author: starshine296
Reviews.Content: After a good stay last year, we decided to stay at FQ again this year. While I would still recommend it to someone, I would make sure that they know that it is not the most up to date in terms of technology or bathroom. Otherwise, it's a good hotel for the money. I think the number one selling point is the size, which is about a quarter of any of the other moderate hotels. The food court was good, always well stocked and kept clean even though I felt that could use a face lift as well. Since we're planning on heading back to Disney next year we may try Coronado Springs since it's much newer and will hopefully be less outdated! I think that what it comes down to is whether or not you're willing to trade off some older outdated pieces for a great theme, good size and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: foxybitt
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day/5 night stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. We booked a standard room. Before leaving, I read in one of the guide books to ask for building number 5. It is right across from the pool/bar, close to the Disney buses and the main building. I called a week before to request the room and was told that it was an upgrade but they would request we be close building 5. When we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised to find that we were in building 5, a free upgrade. It was a great location, considering we swam in the pool every day and would drag our double stroller and young kids back from the bus when the parks closed. The staff was beyond friendly. They were accommodating, sweet and very helpful. The rooms are a little worn, but for a place to sleep, it gets the job done. Bathrooms are tiny. We had groceries delivered from Garden Grocer the day we arrived. What a great deal. The rooms have a mini fridge and was great for the kids milk, water, gatorade, etc. If you want to save a mint on drinks in the park, this was a great alternative. We had the dining plan and it was ridiculous how much food you get. The food at the hotel is pretty horrible, but they had a descent selection of cold drinks at the food court. Make sure that you use the airport check in at the front desk. Great time saver and super easy!

Reviews.Title: “Older but comfortable resort”
Reviews.Author: MissyGryphon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the POR-French Quarter September 18 to 25. This resort is showing its age but does possess a certain charm. The room size is adequate with two double (not queen) beds. The beds were very comfortable. There are double sinks and a great marble shelf above both sinks on which to place all your toiletry items. The closest is exposed to the sink area with lots of hangers and another shelf. The tub and toilet were in a separate, very small room. The room is supplied with a small coffee maker and housekeeping did leave lots of coffee packs each day. There is also a small refrigerator that worked well. The air conditioning worked very well and kept us cool during a very humid September. My biggest complaint about the room was the towels and linens. I was very disappointed to see threadbare towels with holes in them at the Disney Moderate resort. The bed sheets were fine but the bedspread is in dire need of replacement. We found all of the staff at the resort very nice with the exception of the concierges. It has always been my experience that concierges were there to help their guests with any of their needs or to give information. Thanks to Trip Advisors previous posts I was able to get the information and directions as to how to use the public transportation to go The Florida Mall for one morning. I thought I would just check with the resort’s concierges to see what their suggestions would be in case they knew of a method that was easier. I was aghast that she knew of no way of getting to The Florida Mall by public transportation. She advised me that it would be a huge hassle with many, many transfers. Basically inferring that it couldn’t be done. She did manage to recall (but was unsure) that Mears Transportation did a trip once a week for $18.00 and gave me a phone number to call. I used the Trip Advisor information and boated to Downtown Disney and easily walked across the street to catch the Lynx bus for $2.00 each way direct to the mall and back. The boat to Downtown Disney and the bus system was wonderful to have. Be aware if you close down any of the parks that it is mayhem getting onto the bus to go back to POR. It’s like trying to put on a pair of size 4 jeans when you are really a size 12. The congestion is unreal as people line up for the various bus stops blocking others from moving past them to their own bus stop. Keep a smile on your face and make a few friends as you attempt to get into the right line up. Overall, I would stay here again as it was a relaxing, comfortable, clean and quiet resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Moderate Stay”
Reviews.Author: todaystraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a stay at POFQ. All in all, this was an awesome Disney resort. Firstly, once we arrived we were checked in promptly and given our "Keys to the World". We went to checkout our room (Building 2, Room 2222) and found the room to be just like the pictures with a nice towel animal greeting us. It appeared as though the room had just been painted and everything seemed to be nice and clean. An added bonus was a nice overview of a courtyard with a very pretty fountain. Building 2 is an awesome building to stay in because you are directly across from the pool and laundry and also extremely close to the main building where the food court, gift shop and etc. are. Although the rooms aren't humungous, they were fine for our family of four. So here's a breakdown of POFQ. Positives: Small resort, with minimal walking and only one bus stop. Awesome location. Friendly and accomodating staff. Quiet and not in your face Disney. Very cute fairly large pool! It was me and all of the four year olds going down the dragon water slide, I'm fifteen :) Landscaping. I could tell that the resort was always trying to keep up on maitnence and every morning as we left the hotel we would see many cast members watering plants, painting, etc. Price. Escpecially with the free dining plan. Negatives: Housekeeping not giving us enough towels and shampoo for four, as well as not doing simple things like dumping out the water from the ice bucket. The boat to Downtown Disney, since you have to share it with POR, it is a horror getting on on a Friday night. The bus system generally, even though we drove most of the time. Double beds. No flat screen TVs. Lastly, if you are considering staying either here or POR. Chose POFQ 100% especially if you are going to take the bus. Everyone we encountered from POR had a tired, frazzled and mean look to them. I try to say this kindly, but they were a tad grumpy. Also, POR has four bus stops instead of just the one POFQ has. Its a smaller quiter and from what I could tell, more family friendly resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mother and Daughter trip to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mutter38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from the 19 th Sep-26 th Sep And this was a very nice surprice. I needed to go on a holiday , but didn´t want to use the exctra money to go to one of the delux ones and found out that this might be a place for my daughter and me. Still I was a bit worried before arraving. But my worries got crushed at the moment we arravied. The place was beautiful, the people that worked there was beautiful and helpful people. The food court was good. I have no complains about the hotel. Its a small resort compared to the others in the Disneyworld, but that was one of the things I liked most. It was easy to get around. We went for a late walk over to Port Orleans, we swimmed in the pool every day. We got towelbirds in the room from our maid :-) We stayed in building number 2 on 3 floor which was good. Building number 2 is very near every thing a short walk to the pool and food court and reception.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Our dreams came true”
Reviews.Author: JaMay2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a peaceful park like setting along side a river. With easy access to a all amenities. This was our ideal setting for a family holiday. The service could not have been more friendly & helpful. Access to all Disney parks was so easy that the hired car sat in the car park for the majority of the holiday. The food never disapointed the restaurant was close to the hotel room which was ideal with two tired children. Our stay was over Christmas & New Year. We felt that the hotel supplied enough festive atmosphere without being over powering. This was to be a once in a life-time holiday. We enjoyed it so much we're saving up to return.

Reviews.Title: “POFQ”
Reviews.Author: klvb1162
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay. This has always been one of my favorite hotels. Although, this was my least agreeable. We did not get into our room until very late in the day. This was the first time I checked in on a Friday. When we were told we could go to our room housekeeping was still in the room with whom I believe was head of housekeeping because the door in the mini fridge was broken. We were told they would sent someone right up to fix. In the 8 days we were there no one ever came to fix the door and it kept swinging open and would get walked into. The remote for the TV was also broken and never repaired. They are filling this place to the hilt. It used to be a great place stay because it is small. Now the pool is over crowded, not enough chairs by the pool. Even the class of people seemed to go down hill. There were a couple groups of people that brought their room trash cans down to the pool and had them filled with beer and ice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethOldForge
Reviews.Content: I took my 9 year old grandaughter to DW for her first visit. We were very pleased with the French Quarter. The room was adequate but clean. The maid service was more than helpful by giving additional coffee etc. The resort lacks a dining room but we only ate breakfast there and had dinner at the parks. The pool was awsome. The water taxi to Downtown Disney was convenient. It's a slow ride on man made canals but my granddaughter didn't seem to notice. The bus service to the parks was very convenient but when returning to the hotel FQ seems at the end of the line for pick up. The grounds are lovely. The Marti Gras theme was not overdone. I would stay there again since this is the smallest resort. My only complaint was the Magical Express did not find our luggage until the morning of the second day. By 8am our luggage arrived. I don't know if I would use this feature again because of this difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: CardiffWendy
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter end of August beginning of Septermber 2009 one of which was my teenage daughter. I have to say that we all enjoyed staying at the Port Orleans we couldn't find fault with this resort even though I had been reading reviews before we went and had some concerns, I can only speak of this resort very highly the service was good overall, our room was bigger than I expected and quite near the food hall, gift shop, swimming pool, arcade room and laundrette couldn't fault the location and amenities if I ever come back I would choose to stay at this resort again it was very peaceful and I felt very safe on the site even the disney transportation was excellent the least thing I liked was the way people disregarded people waiting for disney transportation where people would just turn up and board the buses regardless of other people being there before them other wise best holiday as a family we have had in a long time

Reviews.Title: “Great value, easy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: tmjpjm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights over the Labor Day weekend. Our rate was $94 a night which I thought was wonderful. This hotel is perfect if you are not picky, so you have to be honest with yourself before you book. There is nothing resort-ish about the room even though they call this a "resort.". The decor is dated, everything is older looking, there is nothing really new or modern or stylish in the room. So if you want to feel like you just walked into a resort room with Aveda products and Evian or Smart Water waiting in the fridge, don't go here. You will be very disappointed. My first comment when we walked into the room was"wow what an ugly room." But I quickly adjusted. Our stay at this hotel was perfect. It is incredibly convenient. Ask for building 4. Very close to the buses and parking. Also very close to the dock for the boat to Downtown Disney. Quiet. The room was spacious for two adults and one kid. The fridge was small but we also brought a cooler and refilled it with ice from the machine. Housekeeping service was perfect. A/C was perfect. Water pressure in bathroom was good. The buses to and from the parks were very convenient, spacious, drivers friendly. We had late check out until 3 p.m. for an extra 50 bucks. We were in this room just for naps and overnight sleep and for that purpose this hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter was very good”
Reviews.Author: junglebook
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 17 nights and really enjoyed it. It was the childrens first time at Disney and they soon got into the "Disney" spirit. Even the 15 year old got sprinkled with the Disney magic dust and had his photo taken with Mickey Mouse etc! We found it to be a nice size - not too big - some of the other resorts had 4 or more bus stops to service the Disney transport, French Quarter only had one. There is also the added advantage that the water taxi to and from Downtown Disney can be used. This was actually quite a nice little river trip and depending on the "Captain" could be informative as well. The food court was canteen style (got the free quick service dining plan so not complaining) but if you look around, and ask questions on here, quite reasonable alternatives can be found. Put it this way, I didn't have any burgers during our stay. I loved the food at Morocco in the World Showcase at Epcot, and the Seasons food court at the Land Pavillion was pretty good too. Okay, none them were fine dining experiences, but my 2 wanted to be in and out and back to the action. We found the rooms to be of adequate size, although after 17 nights of 4 of us in the room I think we all had enough of being on top of each other. Rooms were cleaned very well with plenty of towels and lots and lots of towel made animals! We personally liked the fact it was smaller than the average Disney hotel, other people we spoke to thought the same. The Disney theme (small rodent with big ears) is not as prominent in the hotels, which is a bit of a relief, you can tend to get "Disney'd out" after 17 days! We booked the flight and hotel seperately, flight with US Airways, maybe not the most luxurious of airlines but it got us there and back at a very reasonable cost for the school holidays, and the hotel through Walt Disney UK. We were able to use the Magical Express from and to the airport, which saved a lot of hassle and, like everything else at Disney, it was all very efficient. All in all, a memorable holiday run by an extremely efficient organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: imshocked2
Reviews.Content: This is not Disney Best, but certainly well worth the money. I traveled with my sister and favorite niece as a family treat. As a manager of high end condos & apartments tend to be a tough critic. I could find absolutely nothing to complain about. While not a 5 star hotel..... Riverside French Quarter gives it a great shot! The rooms were on the small side, but we found everything that we needed. The hotel staff were top notch! Including housekeeping. The facility pristine and everyone was interested in making the trip magical. The pool ( while shallow) was wonderful. Transport was exceptional and the addition of low keyed jazz music throughout the property added to the ambiance. This was so wonderful, that I returned with my hubby for a weekend. This time, no theme parks. It was wonderful to just stay and enjoy all that the resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “One of Our Favorite Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: twochinas
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel takes you away to New Orleans while providing you with all of the amenities of being a Disney World guest.. While the grounds are large, it is intimate enough that everything is within a short walking distance. The lovely tree-lined streets and the themed pool area add to its charm. In addition to swimming, you can stroll to the nearby Riverside Hotel, ride a bicycle or in a horse drawn carriage, or take a leisurely boat ride on the 'Sassagoula River' to the Downtown Disney area. This hotel is a destination within itself... you don't even have to set foot in a theme park to have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of Disney but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthFan
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a trip that was as cheap as possible for a 2 week summer trip away. We normally spend a lot on our Florida holidays so it was a nice challenge to go cheap! We would have gone for a non Disney or Disney budget resort but with the free dining it was a no brainer. Over $2000 dollars worth of food for a small increase in room price. The French Quarter is probably the best jack of all trades resort. It does nothing badly and does quite a lot very well. Its very compact yet quiet. Its got a lovely pool and the main service area with food court and check in was very pleasant, as were all the staff. Complaints? The bus service was great when the bus only serviced the French Quarter but just at the time you wanted to go somewhere fast it would head over to the riverside to pick up, which included its 4 bus stops! 20 mins after we got on the bus we were passing the same bus stop to head out?!? As mentioned below, the rooms need updating. I don't mean the design as a themed hotel, they should be timeless anyway but the furnishing, especially the doors and dressing area, were looking VERY tired. Some of the doors as we walked past were distinctly NOT Disney. Mainly though the grounds were very clean and the gardens were being re landscaped while we were there. The boats to Downtown Disney were lovely and the Riversides amenities were a short walk away, including the fishing hole which the boys loved! So for the money it was a bargain and I would recommend to others, but next time we would probably look at another Disney resort, if only because we like to them all! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Love French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: magicalUsa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at FQ quite a few times & have found it quite satisfying. Staff excellent, have always catered to our needs & requests. Am coming back in Oct! Like proximity to trans, also food court is quite good!

Reviews.Title: “We could hear the toilets flush above us.”
Reviews.Author: starshell
Reviews.Content: The walls were peeling . It needed a desperate paint job. We were on the main level. We could hear everything above us. The room was dirty. We bought a whole bunch of chocolate from Chiradellis IT disappeared. I have never had food stolen from a room. Oh they decided to paint the room when we were LEAVING and rushed us out. Only place available NEVER AGAIN. What a DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for 1st time at disney”
Reviews.Author: billabongbabe5
Reviews.Content: Well, we just got back last week.. we went for the free meal plan and our tickets were included. Good to book with an agent.. We met wonderful staff.. very helpful and loved our room we got there 3hrs before our check in and were put in a room right away . We were in building 7 which is the farthest..but we loved the walk and it was nice and quiet there. The pool area can be louder ... but we loved how it was open til midnight everyday... we got to go for a swim and a hot tub every time after our long day at the parks.. which was perfect !! Our kids loved the pool and wanted to be in it all day long. .. We usually always got a chair.. wasn't always busy you may just have to wait a bit and then you can get one.. (some people are rude and leave their towels on the chairs even after they leave) so if I see them there for awhile I just go sit there anyways. ... The buses were always on time.. sure yeah you have to stand once in awhile but you get back quickly and everyone always lets little children or babies sit with their mom. We didn't mind the food it was good but found they need to just make the menu plan for dinning with the card easier.. its kinda confusing at first what you can get.. for snack... etc... alot of people that just got there had to ask alot of questions.. they need to chang3e up the menu a bit as well. Oh and you can get a coffee And a Drink with the meal plan in the morning... we didn't know this.. and missed some of our drinks.. the cashier will usually tell you though.... Our room was always clean on time and they only ran out of towels once but it was around 11pm..... !!.... Not a big deal get one from your room. The ferry going to downtown disney was informative and friendly. Mcdonalds there is NOt covered on the meal plan.. boy our kids were upset..LOL... all in all it was a nice resort.. I found it quieter than most and less busy.. The staff were super helpful and friendly... they gave us tons of mardi gra beads and the girls loved this.. we will definitaly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: cafc328
Reviews.Content: The theming and staff at the hotel were great. The grounds were beautiful. However, our room needed some attention. There was mold on our tub and dirt in the corners. Our tub drain ran very slowly, but this was fixed quickly after I reported this to the Front Desk. The bus transportation was very crowded (standing room only.) I have stayed in WDW 10+ times and next time I will choose a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Between Good and Excellent.....”
Reviews.Author: JanetfromMA
Reviews.Content: Arrived June 30th to be greeted with smiles and a welcome packet. Room was clean and convenient. Ask for building 4 or 5 to be close to the main building and pool. Each day the room was clean when returning from a day at the park. One night my daughter was not feeling well and housekeeping was right at my door to help with any mess that we had. Changed the bed linens the next morning and gave me extra towels when needed. The rooms could use a little more light...but if that is my only complaint...then I had a great eight days at the Port Orleans-French Qtr. The food court was all right, mostly fast food. Only ate breakfast there and the pool was nice a clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and small resort”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks. We found the hotel to be very clean and the rooms were fine. I do prefer a Kingsize bed as the doubles are so tiny! We booked a waterview room, and our room overlooked the pool and river. (Well outside the room did) We were in block 5 which could not have been better as we were close to everything, but to be honest the resort is nice and small and nowhere is that far away. The food court was good with the food being slightly better than in the parks, such as the burgers etc, which were not quite so greasy. We would use the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues but still going back”
Reviews.Author: elwoodSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: The location, size and layout of this hotel is great. We just went in July and are going back soon. That being said there were some cleanliness issues. In the shower there were shaving rements on the curtain. Really grossed me out....but everything else was good so we are going to give it one more try. The pool is great and the size of the resort makes it very easy to get around. I like building 5 close to the main pool and reception area. I will ask for this building next time. We broke down and purchased annual passes so the price of the room in the moderates this fall is REALLY cheap so we are going back. I will post a follow review when we get back. Obviously would go back....going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: MsJillH
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights here. I enjoyed the theme of the hotel and found all the employees very nice and accomodating. We arrived early & room wasn't ready, but was about 40 minutes later. I do agree with others that the mousekeeping is not quite up to par, but our overall experience was fine. I liked that the hotel is smaller in size than other disney proeperties and that is why I picked it. It did request a specific building to be closer to lobby and pool, and they met request. I had delivery from Garden Grocer which bell staff held and delivered for me; they were extremely accomodating. We barely used food court, but did enjoy the pool daily, and took boat over to Riverside one afternoon to use their pool. I was happy with my choice of FQ, and glad I didn't upgrade to luxry resort for the amount of time we used it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our return trip!”
Reviews.Author: spunkymom2
Reviews.Content: Husband, 2 kids and I stayed at POFQ from June 18 to June 26 and really enjoyed our stay. The resort grounds are beautiful, peaceful and relaxing. The last time we were here was 13 years ago for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time then too. This time we were able to do online check-in before leaving home which was very easy and quick. We took advantage of the Magic Express transportation from the airport and we were very surprised that we were the only family besides one other on the bus so our wait was very minimal and arriving at the resort fairly quickly. Upon our arrival after a red eye flight, the check in process was very quick; however, our room was not ready yet being that it was only 7 am. The desk clerk was trying to get us a room that was open but apparently was an upgrade as far as the view goes but the manager was very stern and flatly said, "No!" The desk clerk gave us the hotel number to call later in the morning or early afternoon to check. We ended up going to the parks to kill some time. Our room was ready just after lunch. When we got to our rooms, our luggage was there already and when we called bell services for our carry-on, they delivered them within 15 minutes time which was very impressive to us. Our room was just right for the four of us, kids are 10 and 7 so the doubles were not to crammed for us. It was on the smallest side but we were mainly out and about so not an issue for us. We had enough room for our luggage and things. The room we ended getting was only steps from a river view but we had a wonderful view of the courtyard. We were in building 6 on the 3rd floor. It was clean so we felt very fortunate given the reviews in whihc other families encountered dirty bathrooms and leftover food. Our mousekeeper was very good. We requested room cleaning every other day and on the days we didn't have cleaning, she left a bag of fresh towels and toiletries on the door for us. On cleaning days, she left towel animals to greet us after a long day out. Very nice touch! We felt the walk to the bus transportation was not too far at all even after a long day. We only had to wait a couple of times beyond 15 minutes during our whole trip. Otherwise, we felt the wait was very efficient. Only once did the bus go to PORiverside which has 4 stops so that was a good thing too. We thought the river taxi to downtown Disney was the best. It was a leisurely ride down the river that took about 20 to 30 minutes. We did this many times during our stay to eat at Downtown Disney. The kids loved the pool which was clean and had plenty of towels available. The work staff was very friendly and courteous without being too overbearing. The cafeteria actually had pretty good offerings - mexican, italian and american. Better than we expected. Decent prices for the amount of food we got. We really enjoyed the beignets! Yummy! Check out was easy as well. We were able to check in our luggage for the airport at the lobby. They were very friendly and helpful. We did have to wait over 15 minutes our scheduled pick up time for the Magic Express bus which made us a bit nervous. The bus appeared to be near capacity but we were able to find seats for us and got to the airport with time to spare. All in all, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLmom
Reviews.Content: We were met at the entrance by two very friendly workers who opened the doors for us and greeted us with Mardi Gras bead necklaces and wishing coins for my little girls. One ushered us inside to the wishing fountain where they made a wish and tossed their coins in excitedly. Check-in at 3 pm was quick; however, the employee assigned us a third-floor room in the farthest building (7) even though she could clearly see I was 8 1/2 months pregnant and accompanied by small children. We had to do a lot of walking to get to the main area with the pool and ferry boat launch. That said, the buildings and grounds and the riverside walk are lovely. If you reserve early enough, you might be able to get a room in bldg. 2 or 5 -- they're much more convenient to the pool, ferry boat, front desk, etc. See bottom/purple portion of map: http://www.wdwinfo.com/resortmaps/port-french.htm The room appeared to be clean and in good condition. It was smallish but well-designed with a small table and two chairs, dresser with swiveling TV, mini-fridge, convenient bench and wall hooks. The double beds are high and we found them too firm and uncomfortable. There was a separate curtained vanity area with two pedestal sinks at a nice height for kids and a shelf with bar for hanging clothes outfitted with iron and board. The toilet/tub room was small and nothing special. Our little girls found the Mickey-shaped configuration of towels on the bed fun. Our kids loved the pool area, which includes a sea-serpent waterslide. Our only complaint was that the lifeguards didn't arrive until 10 am on a hot August Saturday morning, so the slide wasn't opened until then. The nice thing about staying here is that you can take the ferry boat to Downtown Disney and to the larger companion property Port Orleans Riverside. And you're free to use the pool area at Riverside's Ol' Man Island, too; it has a bigger waterslide than FQ's. Both hotels have a playground on the property. There's a lot more to do at Riverside, but it's also much bigger and more spread out and more crowded than FQ, so we were glad we picked the smaller one. The rates at both usually start around $149 but we were able to get our room for $96 plus taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: BackTooSoon
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in this hotel when it was brand new in 1992, and have been back many times throughout the years. Due to this, I will probably give it a higher rating than it deserves. We like this resort, because it is small and manageable. The transportation to the parks is also quite good.....but.....from the moment I stepped into the room, I thought it did not look clean. The first thing I did was remove the bedspreads for the length of our stay. Also, the grout in the bathroom was black with mold. At first, I thought they had regrouted in black, but when I looked up, I realized the grout near the ceiling was white. Gross!! I want to add that we had dinner at the Polynesian one night, and I found the common areas old and dirty, so maybe it's time for Disney to do some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but nothing over the top grand”
Reviews.Author: SnuffleBugg
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Disney resorts and this was our first trip to French Quarter. It was fine. The resort is beautifully landscaped and clean - I like that it's small so you didn't have too much walking to get around. I LOVE the ferry ride to downtown disney! The pool is really fun especially for kids and a great park too! The food is like any other disney resort - overpriced and crappy - but the beignets were fun to eat. You don't get a real Disney/Mickey Mouse feel here - it just really feels like you are in New Orleans. I was expecting more Mardi Gras feel - like maybe some free beads when you check in or in your room - but it was pretty plain overall. It's nice to go once to check out but some of the other resorts are more fun (Animal Kingdom Lodge, Coronado Springs).

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing honeymoon I could have ever asked for.”
Reviews.Author: silversangel
Reviews.Content: This resort was just amazing. It was so beautiful. The service is supreme. Everyone was so friendly and very helpful. Me and my husband had the honeymoon of our dreams. I would advise choosing what you want to do before heading out. Make sure that you make dinner reservations ahead of time, that way you can avoid the long lines that tend to begin forming around 6 o'clock. We are looking forward to taking our children there next year.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE This resort!”
Reviews.Author: kdpei_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the French Quarter July 11-18 and we loved it. It was so quiet and peaceful that we could not believe that we were at Disney. To get up in the morning and take a walk by the lazy river was so nice. We really enjoyed the boat ride up and down the river - yes even in the lightening storm. Downtown Disney was so close that we could go for an hour's walkabout any evening we wanted. The room was fine and I do like the two sinks outside the tub/toilet area. We had plenty of room for two, but I would nto want 4 people in that size of a room. Really enjoyed the hottub and our greeter Beau who was there every day with maps of the parks and tips for us. I can understand people not enjoying the food court as it was loud first thing in the morning - but the food was good and filling. Do yourself a favour and get the dining plan. We booked 3 months out and were able to get great restaurants. We did figure out the cost of purchasing the meals versus the plan and we came out way ahead. The truth is that we would have spent as much and ended up eating junk for 7 days without the plan. With the plan we have wonderful dinners each night. If you want a quiet place to relax after the parks - this is it. For you smokers our there - there are spots to smoke at the hotel and in the parks - clearly marked on the maps but you may still need to ask for help as they are fairly hidden. At the French Quarter there was a frog courtyard just below my room ( see picture attached).

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice if you're staying at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Chunkylover5480
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter for a few days while we vacationed at Disney and had a nice stay. The New Orleans style buildings are pretty, the pool is nice, and it is quiet. There's a central area where the pool, lobby, restaurant etc. are then several individual buildings of rooms going off to the sides. It's a little spread out but it's not as bad as some other Disney hotels are. So you might have a short walk to the pool or parking lot but nothing too bad. The rooms are nothing special - your basic hotel room setup. It was a place to sleep after being at the park all day. If we had stayed longer we would have explored the grounds more and maybe had a meal or two, but we mostly just collapsed there each night. I paid extra for a river view, which was nice, but with all the walks back and forth from the car I would rather have had something closer to the parking lot (which is on the opposite side from the river). I wouldn't have a problem staying here again, however with all the options at Disney the next time I return I'll probably try somewhere else. After all the hassle of traveling to the parks I'll probably splurge and try a place on the monorail line.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location, some concerns”
Reviews.Author: Cymraes13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 14 days during July. Out of 10 I'd rate the hotel as a 6. Good Points - Good location for the Disney Parks with bus service to and from hotel. Also, a very nice boat service from hotel to Downtown Disney. Friendliness of some staff. Nice pool. Negative Points - Cleanliness of room. Housekeeping everyday yet I felt the room was never really cleaned only topped up with towels etc i.e. there was a sweet on the floor for (NOT ours) and a flip flop under the bed (NOT ours) which proved that the room wasn't thoroughly cleaned before our arrival. If you tip the housekeepers they will occasionally make 'characters'out of towels, which is nice if you have kids, however I would have preferred they spent their time cleaning rather than making these! The rooms are slightly dated now and could do with a lick of paint and new furniture. The Food Court offeres a variety of food but nothing different to what you get in the parks i.e; fries, pizzas, nuggets, burgers etc. I ordered a chicken burger once and wasn't impressed at all. When you see them preparing the food you'll understand what I mean! If I stayed in Disney again I would not stay here but rather upgrade to a better standard of hotel with the hope that housekeeping was a little more thorough. Although I've 'complained' a bit all in all the hotel is a decent standard and I had a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “rude management,flood in bathroom ,horrible stay away”
Reviews.Author: doylelucygizmo
Reviews.Content: ok this hotel was the worst the manager sent me up a broken rollaway cot and told me he has others but they are all the same, they dont change linen everyday, they gave me 2 shampoos for 4 people and i had a floof in the bathroom all week long told management they didnt do a thing to help all the boxes to my souviners were ruined , bathroom was not clean beds were double beds on the small side and very hard, this resort has Nothingto offer its Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Now that we've been there we would do things differently.”
Reviews.Author: BeachMamaNumberOne
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney and we were overwhelmed with all of the hotel options. We went to Disney on the 4 night get 3 free deal so there weren't a lot of rooms available in our price range to choose from. Port Orleans was nice but very cramped for 4 people. There wasn't a lot of room to store food brought from outside the park. There was a refrigerator but it did not have a freezer compartment so you couldn't freeze ice packs too keep drinks cool when taken to the parks. The rooms were clean and had great air conditioning but for the price it would have been nice to have queen sized beds. The hotel complex is huge and spread out. Parking is very far away from your room and therefore quite difficult to move your luggage back and forth. We weren't allowed to use the luggage carts because they wanted you to use the bellhop service. The restaurant there had a good variety of foods to choose from with decent prices for Disney World. The buses to and from the parks weren't too crowded. Port Orleans is the first to board from the hotel so we usually were able to get a seat. Wait time did not seem unreasonable. The pool was a hit with our children. The lifeguards there were very attentive. Despite facing the pool area our room was quiet. We enjoyed taking the boat to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: Whether it is worth staying at a moderate resort, when you are never in your room, can be discussed. I believe that it is worth it if you stay longer, but not if you just stay for three nights as we did this time. Still, Port Orleans has some good sides to it. First of all it was a lot less crowded than some of the value resorts. And the communications were really working wonderfully well, with the boat to Downtown as a nice addition. The pool was not exactly in my taste, but the grounds were otherwise OK. And, as many have said, it is really great that it is a rather SMALL resort! Interior design was however rather awful, and looked very cheap, overdone and plastic. And the food at the food court was TERRIBLE! My teenager could not even finish his hamburger, since it was dripping with fat. But if you just avoid the food court, and do not have too much of a problem with bad interior design, Port Orleans French Quarter is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: NCASMOM
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter has beautiful landscaped walkways and parks. Nice benchs to sit on at night. The pool was very lovely and the hot tub made you feel like you were in New Orleans. Room was clean and nice. Nothing great but comfortable. The resort was quit and we never heard a lot of noise. Stayed on the 3rd floor and loved it. Best part of the resort was the boat to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: MsMathTeacher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the moderate resorts at Disney World and thought that this was the best. It's wonderfully small so you are never far from anything; bus stop, food court, pool, etc. Although it doesn't have it's own table service restaurant, it's sister resort, Riverside, contains Boatwright's, and is just a five minute a water taxi ride away. Everything here is very colorful and animated. Having never been to New Orleans I can't comment on the likeness, but I loved every minute of my stay here. Another plus is when the Disney buses pick up passengers (and drop off) they do so at French Quarter before Riverside so you are more likely to get a seat. I am definitely going back to French Quarter, but maybe not in the heat of the summer next time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: alanier
Reviews.Content: The service definately lived up to Disney's standards. We loved the towel animals we found in our room everyday, and room service was superb. The room was always spotless. The food in the onsite cafeteria was good, and it was so convenient to just walk downstairs and hop on a bus to go to the resorts. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: kjmcc0729
Reviews.Content: Just returned (7/6/9) from a wonderful trip to Disney. The French Quarter is a delightful place to stay while visiting WDW. I have only previously stayed on-site at the Grand Floridian, and while POFQ is not the Grand Floridian, it is a really nice place to be. I have seen others write that it is a nice, quiet respite after a hectic day at the parks, and they are absolutely right! It was truly refreshing to come "home" to POFQ and be able to unwind in general peace and quiet. We chose POFQ because it is considerably smaller than the other moderates, and that is the key to it's charm. My only complaint was with the mousekeeping. I was so looking forward to the towel animals for my daughters to enjoy, but there were none for us in the 10 days we spent there. As disappointing as that was, we were doubly discouraged by the quality of their overall service. Used glasses left on the table and not replaced without a phone call, sinks not cleaned/rinsed out, and vacuuming done at the absolute minimum, if at all. Thankfully, we are not a messy lot, and my wife typically straightens up prior to the maids arrival anyway, so it was not as big an issue as it could have been. But still, a little disheartening considering it is Disney and you expect top notch service. Thankfully, the rest of the staff at the hotel provided typical Disney service. I have seen some reviews mention the level of noise you are able to hear while in your room, and I can honestly say that was not the case for us. We even had 2 or 3 rather large teenage tour groups there at the same time, and noise was never an issue. The pool is great and a lot of fun for everyone. Again, despite it being Disney in June/July, it was never overcrowded and you were able to enjoy yourself in your own space. The food court offered a variety of items and was a nice option each morning for breakfast. The beignets were fantastic and became a daily staple. I would definitely stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “NO WAY!”
Reviews.Author: burnak
Reviews.Content: At first I thought the trip was perfect fun in the sun. Untill, we went to the pool. When we frist went it was closed. I was okay, I didn't really care. Then we came back 11 times, and everytime we went it was closed. The closed the pool every ten minutes for NO REASON. I started to get soooooo mad!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: insuranceman2428
Reviews.Content: we go to disney every year and this is a great moderate hotel. The pool is great and the hotel is in great shape. The best thing about this hotel is that is it smaller then most and even when they are fulled booked it seems not very crowded

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Joannblueeyes
Reviews.Content: This is the second review I am writing. The first was for the first time a went to the French Quarter. This review is for the vacation I just returned from. Again, I was impressed with this moderate resort. It had all I wanted. Convenience!!! The buses were at my disposal almost immediately. The Dragon pool is very impressive for young children. This year I took my son and his family. He usually stays at the Riverside, but this year I took one of his children (he has three) into my room and he was able to stay at the French Quarter. They all loved it!! He stated that he would like to do the same next year. The Port Orleans French Quarter is for his family. Just what they were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Want to go back now.”
Reviews.Author: Englewoodlian
Reviews.Content: If I were to give a recommendation of a romantic hotel at Disney, I would say the POFQ immediately. It is so pretty, small and tucked away - yet very accessible to everything Disney. The best is a river view room because you can walk out at night and watch the fireworks at Magic Kingdom at the water's edge. There is a relaxing boat ride to Downtown Disney and the bus service is first rate. Great lobby, pool, and staff. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: KimmieInIndy
Reviews.Content: I hate to share how wonderful this place is for fear of not being able to book it again! It is picture perfect. So quiet and relaxing. I don't know how they do it with such large crowds at Disney in June. The pools and French Quarter and Riverside out great. The grounds are lovely. The surrey bikes and river boats are so much fun. Rooms are small, but we just used them for resting and refreshing so no big deal. A definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel at Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Polkadotsmile
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The Rooms were a decent size and clean. The staff was great and helpful. The New Orleans theme was quiet and peaceful. It was a great place to come back to after visiting the parks. I even think they piped in the sounds of the Bayou. Our room was on the first floor in a building away from the main entrance and the walk was just fine and a great way to unwind. The main entrance and bus transportation was excellent and the staff as Disney as they get. The restaurant was counter service and just perfect for us as we were traveling on a budget. The pool area was quiet and small, but perfect for our kids. There was plenty of area to swim or lay in the sun. The Laundry area was close by so I did a couple loads of laundry while the kids swam with Dad ( I dipped in the pool between loads). The only thing I would have done differently was to bring our own life jackets for the kids, as they have free ones to use (poor condition) and some you can rent for free but you need to sign away your life to get one. We will be staying here from now on--we upgraded from the All-star resorts and it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: disneylover01_9
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney world every year. We have stayed at the contemporary, Wilderness lodge, Polynesian, Carribean beach, and all star movies. Surpriseingly we really liked french quarter. The maid service was outstanding. Service was great.. We loved the pool. We will probably go back but not in June only complaint it was too busy in the parks all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Moderate Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: LynnTed1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter in May 2009. We love this hotel and feel it is a great value. It is our faorite moderate resort. It is small which makes it an easy walk to the lobby, pool, food court, pool and bus stop. We also enjoy the boat ride to downtown Disney. The horse drawn carriage ride is a nice touch too if you have the time. You can't beat this hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same Disney as 2006”
Reviews.Author: TSand12361
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a different moderate (Carribean Beach) in 2006 but there was a huge difference in level of customer service between then and now. Maybe the economy but it looked more like complacency to me. Bus wait was as long as 35 minutes from Downtown Disney back to hotel, use the boat to DD, less wait and a 15 minute ride without the airbrakes rocking you. In 2006 someone always seemed to be at the bus stops to call for a bus and let you know how long the wait was going to be, these people I saw one day and was told they have them a couple hours a day. Overall condition of building and grounds was not up to what I thought Disney standard was. Flooded sidewalks after hard rains almost made it to doorways on ground level rooms (obvious broken downspouts contribute to this problem). Debris on sidewalks was cleaned up after a couple days with a gas powered blower at 8:00 am, nice job but awful loud. Elevator in bldg 3 has broken buttons, paint stains of flooring, chips on walls where bell carts have run into them. I could go on and on and get picky but I won't, just overall not what I expected from Disney. Luggage finally made it to our room after 5 hours. Travel agent (AAA) did not give us the proper tags for our bags or travel vouchers so I guess this is not entirely a Disney problem but the attitude of the bell services staff was as if I was bothering them by asking questions The biggest disappointment of all was the conceirge service. The dinner reservation that was made by the hotel at TRex had to be changed due to a schedule conflict. While near the restaurant at DD the day before I decided to change it myself. The reservation made a day earlier by the con. did not exist. So I made a phone call and took care of it myself. I would recommend following up reservations or make them yourself. The one experience I did have with the con. that I have never had anyplace else was when they told me NO, they did not have a pair of scissors I could borrow for a couple of days. I absolutely found this to be amazing, I was told to go to gift shop to see if they had one (I had already checked there and many other stores). While my experiences with concierge service is not numerous, the ones I have had were always pleasant and my request was always met. (Hard Rock/Universal in 2007 comes to mind) The best value was the dining plan and the best service provided was by the Housekeeping staff. As I said, my stay at CBR in 2006 was much better and the service was far superior. Maybe its the economy or maybe complacency but once inside this property at WDW, I failed to see any difference between it and the place that leaves a light on for you

Reviews.Title: “Get Two Hotels in One!”
Reviews.Author: alluna
Reviews.Content: Our first trip ever to Disney World was one that I budgeted carefully. We are not a rich family, but we could afford to save some scratch all year to take the kids to Disney World. This is usually the story of the families who stay at hotels like Port Orleans French Quarter, which is priced in Disney's 'Moderate' range. One of the best features of Port Orleans is that you are really getting the services of two hotels for one low price. The Port Orleans Riverside is just down the river and has a whole other pool and amenities to explore. You can take a brief walk or bike ride to Riverside, or take the boat ferry, which offers beautiful views of the New Orleans themed river and vegetation. When booking, we chose French Quarter because it seemed like the more 'fun' out of the two. With Mardi Gras clowns, musical crocodiles and crowned heads decorating the outside and eatery, we decided our kids would get the most out of this atmosphere. The pool at French Quarter also features a long serpentine dragon slide with Triton riding upon his head. Again, we were going for the fantasy on our vacation, so this was a feature we loved. The pool has plenty of seating and the hot tub is set off on a secluded path covered in foliage and away from the splashes of the pool, (but not too far from the bar!). Take the ferry and you get a whole new pool at Riverside. It has less theme to it, but offers a great slide that weaves through the plants and a hot tub that is closer to the pool if you'd rather keep one eye on the kids while you relax. The double hotel factor makes Port Orleans more of a luxurious resort than Disney gives it credit for. Which is great for us, because that means a lower room price. Avoid the over-abundance of loud families at the Value hotels while avoiding the skyrocketing prices of the Deluxe resorts. Port Orleans was anything but moderate in service, cleanliness and activities. The quality was outstanding in all of these areas. The desk managers had french accents and spoke French to some of the overseas guests, so the New Orleans theme was flawless. Our Mousekeeper (housekeeper) always left towel animals for us and rearranged our stuffed animal souvenirs all over the room. The room was spotless and our bags, grocery service and pizza delivery were always delivered on time. I think that some of the negative reviews for cleanliness for French Quarter are from some VERY picky clean freaks. The only 'moderate' aspect may be the room size. Who spends their vacation in the room, anyway? To avoid a smallish room, simply ask for a corner room at the front desk. Also, ask for buildings 3, 4, 5 or 2 if you are adverse to walking far to get to the front desk, pool and eatery. They will be more than happy to accommodate these kinds of simple requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rara8698
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and her mother on vacation to Disney World. One of the best things about staying at a Disney resort is that they have a shuttle to and from the airport, which is included in the price of the hotel. That was so convenient and saved me from having to worry about additional travel expenses, like renting a car or paying for a cab. Plus it was so easy to do, just one less thing to worry about! The hotel accomated me with allowing me to check in early without me even having to ask. The room was nice, fashioned in the style of something you would think to find in New Orleans. It was very convenient to have a food court on hotel grounds. They even had a bar at the pool, which was nice. There were also shuttles from the resort to the parks, which was really convenient. There was also a boat shuttle from the resort to Downtown Disney. I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely return on my next trip. Disney does a great job with friendly service and convenience, which I sincerely appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Good disney choice”
Reviews.Author: Belgian-Brussels
Reviews.Content: Obviously, a disney hotel is more expensive, but it gives some extra's: the free transport (it worked perfectly for us, even on the busy days, we were wherever we needed to be within 30 mins), the opportunity to book the dining plan (wonderfull and really a good deal if you choose the right restaurants), the atmosphere. Even if this is one of the smaller ones, it does give some "industrial feeling", but nothing wrong with it. Everything perfectly organised, well maintained. No complaint at all on housekeeping (soap, shampoo, disney figures, all we needed and even more). The food court has friendly staff, but is overall not really attractive. Would definitely consider this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Can't add to others reviews, so here is some pictures!”
Reviews.Author: WK0119
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Port Orleans. First time was at Riverside and now at the French Quarter. I agree with everything the other posters have said. The end of May is the best time to go as the crowds are down and lines are short in the parks. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 4th trip to Disney and our 2nd time staying at the French Quarter. The first time we stayed there (Nov. 07) my husband came down with a terrible cold. It was after midnight and the staff was friendly enough to get him some medicine for me from the gift shop (charged to my room- not free). This last time we stayed (May 29th-June 7th) was a wonderful experience. We traveled with my in-laws and it was their first time ever at Disney. We both were very impressed with the grounds and the willingness of the staff to help in any way needed. Housekeeping did a good job; however, I was a little disappointed that we had to ask them to make our children a "towel animal". Also I left extra money for a tip if my bedding could be changed (the pillowcase had mildew stains)and it didn't get changed (I could tell because the pillow case had not been changed). Needless to say it is standard for them to change the bedding your 4th night there and it did eventually get changed (didn't fret too much cause I brought a pillow to use from home). The pool is nice, but we traveled down to the Riverside resort to explore and their water slide is more fun (although French Quarter can use Riverside's pool and vice versa). Laundry room wash=$2.00 dry=$2.00... Great bus service... great food in food court.... hot tub very hot :)........refrigerator was cold once we put our water bottles in that we bought from the store... Overall I enjoyed our trip. My family loves Disney and it is so sad when we have to leave. We would definitely stay at the FQ again.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice moderate priced Disney Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ptb4life
Reviews.Content: Basic Overview: Port Orleans French Quarter is designed to look like New Orleans....having never been there, I don't know how well they succeeded. It is a nice and unique looking hotel though. All rooms are accessed from outside, which I always thought was the difference between a hotel and motel....oh well. The grounds were very nice and well kept. Everything was very clean. There is a walking path that leads to the Riverside hotel The Room: We had a king size bed. The matress was a little hard, but I've had worse. The pillows however were the worst I've ever had in a hotel/motel....they were hard as rocks and extremely high. After the first sleepless night, I ended up cutting open the pillow and took out half the stuffing....after that, things were much nicer. The shower was pretty standard, with a slightly above average sized tub. The powder room is separated via a curtain and had 2 separate sinks and mirrors which was nice. The room had enought drawer space, an average tv, and a mini fridge. One odd issue with the rooms in this hotel is the toilet. They flush with the power of a jet engine. That was fine, until it was time for sleep and you realized that you can hear a loud WHOOOOSH every time the room next door would flush. If you're lucky, your neighbors won't be peeing and flushing all night....we weren't so lucky a few nights. Front Desk: Nice as could be and very helpful with anything we needed. We had groceries delivered (good money saver in disney) to the hotel prior to arriving and they held them for us. They helped with any reservations we needed and made checking out and baggage for the flight pain free. Pool: The pool at the Port Orleans French Quarter is geared more towards children then it is adults. The slide is too slow for an adult to have a good time (Grand Floridian has a great one though). Also, we went in May, where the nights are still chilly, so it would have been nice if the pool had been heated. There is also a separate hot tub/jacuzzi area. You are allowed to use Port Orleans Riverside's pools though, and they were much nicer for adults (and warmer for some reason). Food: Just a basic food court here. Pizza, hot dogs, chicken nuggets, hamburgers, sandwiches, etc. Nothing fancy, but it was good enough for a quick snack or meal. They also serve breakfast, but we never got any. Transportation: You can take the boat to Downtown Disney (only do this if you feel like taking your time) or you can use their shuttle bus service. Depending on where you are going, the trip can be a pain, or nice and quick. Magic Kingdom is about a 10 minute ride (although, you might be waiting at the bus terminal for up to 20 minutes for any bus). Epcot and MGM are also fairly quick rides at 10-15 minutes. Animail Kingdom is a little longer (and it also stops at Blizzard Beach) at maybe 15-20 minutes. And Downtown Disney seemed to be the longest (it took about a half hour to get home one night). One advantage that Port Orleans French Quarter has over Port Orleans Riverside is that the buses are FAR LESS packed. The lines for Riverside were always 2-4 times longer than the French Quarter Bus lines (although, sometimes, you are forced to share a bus with the sister hotel....but usually not). Overall, it's a nice place to stay in Disney. Quick transportation to all the them parks and a moderate price each night. The pillows and the loud toilet flushing are the only big negatives.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: steve1cheshire
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the french quater for the last two years running and have just booked to back again next year.We found the rooms spottless and very comfortable,the pool is great our eight year old son loved the slide and fountains! The customer service is excellent the staff couldn't do enough for you.One of the best things about this hotel is the boat service that runs to downtown disney,we never waited more than ten minutes for a boat and found the trip it's self very relaxing,it really made our holiday to have all the retaurants and shops of downtown practically on our door step.The only negative thing i can say about this hotel is that the food court isn't very good,the breakfasts were o.k but the dinner choice was very limited ,you'd be much better off catching the boat downtown!Overall though i would deffnatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Disney”
Reviews.Author: annaspjs
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney and I have been researching resorts for months. I choose the French Quarters because it's a lot smaller than the other hotels and I didn't want to have to walk half way around the world to get to the food court and the bus stop. I was pleased with my choice. French Quarters was a clean, quiet, and comfortable resort. We stayed in the further end of building 4, which is only about a block away from everything. My 10 year old loved the pool. We arrived at 12pm and our room was ready and check-in only took 5 minutes. The only draw back about the rooms were the smallness of the bathroom and you can hear the toilets flush in other rooms. But after a long day at the park we were just ready to go to sleep and sometimes passed out in our clothes. Our flight didn't leave until 7pm that night and check-out is at 11am. I called the front desk that morning to ask for more time but was told all the late check-outs were already taken. That was kind of a bummer but I'll know next time. Also the water taxi to Downtown Disney is a nice ride. It's a lot nicer than taking the bus everywhere and it seems to run just as often. Other than that it was a good experience and I would stay her again. ***TIP***If your catching the magical express to the airport make sure to check your bags in early because the line becomes extremely long around check-out time and also if you have an early flight you may have to take your bags with you to the airport because the resort doesn't have enough time to get them there in time. One more tip. Purchase the mug in the food court for $12.95 and get unlimited refills. I only purchased 1 for me and my daughter and that was plenty. The food court was so close to our room that if we needed more we could just go get a refill. We also took the mug to the parks and filled it with water from the fountains for free.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Dudes and Divas 2009”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBomber
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at POFQ as part of a Grand Gathering. We are always pleased with the intimate size of this moderate Disney resort, as compared with the others that have so many more rooms. Very happy to have gotten rooms in a building that was close to the front (we have travelers from 2-72 years of age). Pros: Bus service - never had to wait longer than 5 miinutes at the resort or from parks. My parents were able to get to and from many different activities that did not include the actual parks, and the staff were always available and willing to direct them on how to get to where they were heading. Food court - We were on the Disney Dining Plan, and the quick-service meals here were fantastic - rotisserie chicken, bbq ribs, etc. Come to find out, whenever there is a new employee for any resort kitchen, they train at POFQ for up to six months before being assigned to another resort. They pride themselves on having the best food in all WDW because of this training program. Laundry facilities - very convenient - as we found out with the 2-year-old. We were able to put the laundry in and enjoy the pool while the clothes were washed and dried. Cons: Room cleaning - the rooms were not kept up to the standards we have come to expect from WDW resorts. Upon check-in, one room had dust so thick on the shelf above the "closet" that my mom wrote her name in it. Another room had so much toothpaste and hairspray on the mirrors that you couldn't even chip it off with your fingernail and there was hair on the floor behind the bathroom door - yuck! My husband ended up having to work a couple of mornings from the room on his computer, so he was able to direct the maid staff (and tipping went a long way), and the issues were resolved. Boat - the boat to Downtown Disney that left from POFQ was out of commission the entire 10 days we were there, so if you wanted to take that mode of transportation you had to walk to Riverside. Overall, POFQ is still our favorite moderate resort at WDW, and upon check-in, when they said, "Welcome Home", it really did feel like coming home. We will stay there again, because the pros outweigh the cons everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not magical!”
Reviews.Author: Tizzy2
Reviews.Content: So disappointed in the rooms at this resort. The ice in the refrigerator had never been defrosted and the ice was so thick the unit ran constantly. Bathroom so small that toilet almost touched tub. Towels very worn; furniture knicked;no room at all. I will say the bed was comfortable but I could hardly believe the room could be so sad! The resort is wonderful;fun, great food court; beautiful fun pool. Nice transportation by river to Downtown Disney but......again the room....the room!

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor”
Reviews.Author: janendon
Reviews.Content: My husband had never been to DisneyWorld and I hadn't been in 25 years. We are in our 70s and I felt it was time he had that experience. I picked the French Quarter because I liked the way the pictures looked. It was an OK room--nothing special and not as nice as I had thought it would be. Our refrigerator did not work and after complaining it was replaced with a working one. I had medication that must be refrigerated. One day when we came back to the room early, it had not yet been cleaned (that was about 3:00) and when she came to clean we just left and took a walk. We purchased the dining plan and weren't exactly sure how to do the breakfast but the staff was very helpful. In fact each staff member that we met whether in the food court, the lobby, or the shop was a person who was friendly and helpful. The bus transportation was mostly good but one day we had a 40 min. wait to get to Hollywood. That day the bus was full and even though the bus driver asked if someone would give up their seats to us, no one did and my husband had to stand. Other days we always got a seat. The boat to downtown was a nice experience so we did that twice. The ice cream in the food court was a huge snack so we learned to share that and not get two of them. The best snack at the park was the frozen lemonade. The least value for our dining plan was using up two to eat at the Brown Derby. Using 1 for the restaurant at Norway was great because we got free photos with Belle --4 of them. The Coral Reef was also a good meal. I don't recommend the Sci-Fi in Hollywood and we sent our food back and ordered something else. I wear a pedometer and one day I had 23000 steps. We didn't get to take advantage of the late nights at the parks because we were too tired by dinnertime and ready to head back "home". On the whole, it was a nice trip. I did check in on line so checkin took 5 minutes to get the key and directions to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: niksmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the POFQ and I must admit that we were fairly unimpressed. While I am aware that Disney moderates are comparable to lower end no frills hotels in general, I was not prepared for the poor quality we found. The theming of the grounds is nice but the hotel itself is very old and tired. Check in was quick and our room was ready before noon, which was a nice surprise but once inside the room, we were taken aback by the state of it. The furniture was banged up and there was so much dust in the corners of the headboard, our son was scraping it out with his fingernails. UGH! There was a large blob of old dried toothpaste on the curtain separating the dressing area from the sleeping quarters and there was a large hole in the shower curtain which was never replaced. My son actually wrote "Clean Me" in the dust on top of the TV! Even still, we chalked it up to an unmotivated housekeeper and decided to leave a tip for her/him in the hopes of getting better service. I left that tip in a clearly labled envelope on top of the tray on the dresser. It was still there the next day (didn't see it?), after our room was cleaned, as was the toothpast blob and the headboard dust. I then went directly to the concierge and explained the situation. He advised me that they would provide a VIP cleaning that evening while we were at dinner and apologized, explaining that they no longer had enough staff to provide the daily spot checks they once conducted. (Housekeeping spot checks are now done weekly) Upon our return from dinner we found the room cleaned and turn down service completed, but the housekeeper had taken the towels and didn't replace them so we had to send our son to the pool for more! We checked in on a Sunday and by Wednesday, I had decided to stop tipping since the torn shower curtain was still there, clothing tags were under the bed from the previous guests, there was an open water in the refrigerator (also from a previous guest), toiletries weren't replaced and we had received no towel art. The boat ride to downtown Disney is really scenic and relaxing and very convenient. The walk to the Riverside is nice as well, and the food there is much better and more varied than the French quarter, by far. Buses ran frequently and as the hotel is small by Disney standards, the bus stop is not too far from any room, a big plus by days end. I would not stay here again, though, as this hotel offered very little in the way of amenities.The pool, while very cute, is geared for younger children and the slide is very short and slow. It held no fascination for our son and most of the other children at the hotel went to the Riverside to use the pool there. If you're looking for a quiet hotel with a convenient location, this may be the one, but if you have children, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decline in service since 2005. Poor housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: GabrielFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort in 2005 and were so impressed with how clean it was and how housekeeping went out of their way to make little "towel art" and arrange our son's toys in the window while we were gone. This time leaves and debris were outside our door the entire week stay. A wad of tissue stayed on the bathroom floor for 5 days, depite the maid tidying the room daily. There was no towel art or anything friendly about our housekeeper. And when I went to pick up stray toys before our departure I found food that wasn't from us under the bed skirt!! The room location was ok...close to the pool, but kind of far from the bus stop. There were many more choices for dining at Port Orleans Riverside which was a short walk away on a beautiful scenic walking trail (or boat taxi). The entire staff seemed to be just putting their time in. No one was overly friendly or kind. Very Un-Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTinkerbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at resort May 2 -4. Me, my husband and daughter. It was a quick getaway as my daughter had her gymnastics competition at the Wide Worls of Sports that weekend. We did not want to spend a lot of money so decided on a moderate resort. We got a fantastic Florida resident rate! And were we pleasantly surprised! The resort is beautiful! I guess this was not a busy week as it was also very peaceful. I had requested building 2 or 3 (as I read other reviews) and we were put in 3 on the third floor. There were people staying next to us but I honestly did not hear them. The room I thought was very nice, 2 double beds 2 sinks, seperate bathroom, small table & 2 chairs and bench. It was clean and had Mickey ears on the bed! We have stayed at other Disney resorts (all deluxe resorts) and for the money this place was so worth it. The pool was nice, had a slide for the kids, bar for the adults. The best thing was that you can go to the Port Orleans Riverside pool which my daughter (5yrs) loved alot more!
