Ther was a nice walkway between the two resorts. Riverside pool had a bigger/faster slide. We actually all liked that pool better, it was a little quieter with a little more shade and a cozier feel. We did go to DD both nights for dinner and stayed on site for lunch. I would defineatly recommend this resort to families with young children. Although we did not stay at the Riverside I would still recommend it. We are already booking a quick getaway in August before school starts but I think we will stay at the Riverside instead.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: JolietKim
Reviews.Content: 5 great things about POFQ: 1. Boat taxi transportation is well run making it a nice, relaxing trip to Downtown Disney. 2. Check-in staff was friendly, fast and informative. They answered all our questions and the room was ready at 8AM when we arrived at the resort. 3. Concierge staff was also quick, friendly and very helpful. 4. High end restaurants (Fulton’s Crab House and Portobello in Downtown Disney) have excellent food and service. Dinner for 2 at both restaurants, with 1 adult beverage each, ran $120.00 but that’s what I expected. 5. POFQ has a beautiful setting along the river with shaded interior walkways and a nice path along the river for walking, jogging, etc. You can also rent boats to enjoy the river on your own. 4 not so good things about POFQ and Disney: 4. For the price, the rooms are small, noisy and in need of an upgrade. We could hear the people on the second floor most of the night running up and down the outside corridor or flushing the toilets. It quieted down around 2AM. 3. POFQ’s Sassagoula Floatworks Food Court… run away, quickly! Avoid the food court at all cost! Breakfast for 2 was $25.00 and inedible. Most of it was thrown away. If you have a car, eat off site. IHOP, Denny’s, the Village Inn… anything is better than the resort’s food court. 2. The attraction you came to see is closed. Not as bad as the Griswold’s trip to Walley World but a lot of the attractions we wanted to see were closed or not operating the days we were at Disney. At the Magic Kingdom about 5 or 6 of the well known attractions were closed or not working. Most of stores/restaurants/night clubs in Downtown Disney are empty while Disney decides what direction they should take this more adult area of their park. 1. Bus transportation is lacking. The driver who transported us from Hollywood Studios back to the resort I nicknamed “Surly.” He was running about 45 minutes behind schedule (in 90 degree heat 45 minutes is an eternity). He did not want to answer any of the guests’ questions and when he did it was either with a grunt or an offhanded comment. The driver back from Downtown Disney (boat taxi not running due to rain) I will call “I no speak English.” A guest asked him the same questions multiple times to no avail. Another Disney employee looked at the driver and said “Just say Yes!” We experienced communication issues a number of times throughout the park; often having to ask the employees to repeat themselves. Since we had spent the first 3 days of our vacation on the beach in Daytona we had a vehicle and decided to use it to transport ourselves throughout the park for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: devineka
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans is an OK hotel - it's in a good spot to see Disney World. The transportation is efficient (buses, boat) and the service is spot on. The rooms are dated and the bedspread is a little thin. It's motel-style, so your door opens to a common walkway. The walls are somewhat thin and you can definitely hear what's going on next door!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sambolin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending a week in this hotel and I was very impressed. This hotel was everything we expected and more. After previously staying the the Value Resorts we decided to try a Moderate Resort and we were not disappointed - it is worth paying that little bit extra. The location was excellent and the small size of the resort was a bonus as we never had to wait long for the Disney Transportation buses and they were never full. The rooms were well appointed and although they could have been cleaner at least the important things like the bed and bathroom were spotless. The boat trip to Downtown Disney was lovely too. The end of April is an excellent time to visit as the parks are generally quiet and the queues short.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Port Orleans/FQ!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfar8
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Wednesday from POFQ. I had a great stay.Magical Express was great and our bags were at our hotel an hour after we go to the hotel. Check-In went so smoothly just had to show ID and off we went. Theres a cast member in the lobby mid-day who has great advice and is sweet w/ the kids. Lobby bathroom was clean but had a bad stench just a heads up. The room was spacious but okay. Can definitley use remodeling. There was a broken tile, shelf in closet can use retouching and the bathroom floors were dated and yeah the toilet makes a noise when you flush but nothing that would wake you up from sleep. Mostly cosmetic, cleaners were nice and proficient; no prob. there. Pool area great, bartenders friendly, boat to downtown/riverside relaxing and always on time. Buses to parks were on time & I went to the parks at 8AM even earlier so i do not know what the previous reviewer is talking about..Hot tub was relaxing after a long day; a lil snug but being in tight quarters we got to meet other people. It was a quiet resort and the food court had everything you can need, we enjoyed it. The store has pretty much all the souveneirs the other disney stores had even a lil cheaper check it out. In all the landscaping, buildings, music made me feel like i was in new orleans and there were no worries in the world. I would turn corners and cast members were throwing beads at me and wishing me a great stay. I would def. stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Our room was filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Holnee
Reviews.Content: I wouid absolutely not recommend this resort, although I realize that most of the reviews have been positive. I am in the process of writing a letter of complaint to the resort and Disney Guest Relations. The room had a slightly run-down appearance. I couldn''t tell if the sink area tiles were dirty or discolored/scratched from age. Our room had mildew in the shower and on the shower curtain liner, caked on dirt in the shower corner, a previous guest's hair wrappaed around our toilet seat hinges, a layer of dust on the baseboards, splattered water, toothpaste and handprints on the bathroom mirrors, some brown liquid splashed on the wall and a tag and some string (maybe used dental floss?) on the bathroom floor when we checked in. I waited a day to see if perhaps they'd been especially busy the day we arrived and maybe they'd fix it, but it was no better. So, I called and requested it be fixed the next day, and it was not. In addition, the staff at the restaurant was not at all friendly, and the sink area for the bathrooms is part of the sleeping area, only seprated by a curtain that can be drawn. And we ran into trouble getting to a 9:15 a.m. character breakfast at the Beach Club (although I had spoken with the concierge and followed her instructions, she never mentioned that the buses don't start until 8:30) because the buses don't start running until 8:30 at the resort and 9:00 at Downtown Disney (where you have to change buses to get to other resorts). I would definitely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Value and Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller33k
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are absolutely fantastic! We enjoyed the ambiance of the French Quarter, the horse drawn carriages, dixie music, and street names only added to the enjoyment of our stay. The rooms were spotless and we enjoyed returning to our rooms to see what new creation was made from our towels. The pool was warm, even on the coldest days and our son stayed so long his fingers were pruny. After our long days of walking around Disney, it was wonderful to sit in the hot tub and relax our aches away, and enjoyed the quiet night life as we walked back late at night. We would recommend Port Orleans French Quarter to families and honeymooners alike - a true getaway from the hustle and bustle of life. The poolside bar was fantastic and the mai tais went down smooth. The food was great and cast members always had a smile and a joke or something nice to say. You can't go wrong with this place, we can't wait for our next trip to the same resort!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: lovesmickey
Reviews.Content: I traveled to POFQ with my 2 boys (15 and 6) for Easter. This was our 2nd time staying here and I don't want to go anywhere else! They both LOVE the pool(which we made sure to swim in every day) and I love the small size as my 6 year old didn't want to walk any more after walking all day. The only downside this time was that my son's favorite blanket was somehow pulled off the bed when they changed the sheets and sent off with the laundry. Everyone I spoke to (even at midnight when the loss was discovered) was great. the housekeeping supervisor got right back to me the next morning and told me to charge a new blanket to my room and they would remove the charge. She also followed up a few days later. Unfortunately, it wasn't found but they did try their best. I do think that housekeeping in a child oriented resort should check beds before removing sheets all in one pile considering children sleep with all kinds of toys. I am still hopeful that a package will show up at my door but I'm not optimistic.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: suzemaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans, French Quarters in April, 2009. What a wonderful resort. Everything was clean, and the staff was extremely helpful. (Espically Beau the doorman, Beverly @ the front desk and Bertha, our housekeeper). We traveled with a 6 year old girl who was treated like a princess everyday. The grounds were well kept, the pool was better than great, and the room was spectaular. We had a room in building #2 overlooking the river. The boat from the French Quarter to Downtown Disney arrived just as promised. This resort definately received an AAA +++ from the 3 of us. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: labeckley
Reviews.Content: I had so much trouble trying to decide where to stay at Disney World, that I wound up reserving a split stay between Port Orleans French Quarter and the Villas at Wilderness Lodge. The New Orleans theme and the landscaping of the French Quarter really appealed to me. It definitely met my expectations and then some! When we initially arrived, we found we had a FedEx that required a signature that would need to be brought to our room, and also a delivery of water and other items, and my husband wanted extra hangers, and we were having trouble adjusting the temperature of our refrigerator and needed assistance with that as well. We were anxious to get out and about and were concerned that we'd be waiting around for deliveries, etc in our room for a long time. But everyone arrived very quickly -- we were so impressed! The staff was absolutely wonderful at this resort. The room was very clean and charming. As we departed for a park early every morning, I loved opening the door to dazzling sunshine and the beautiful, tranquil landscape of trees and cobblestone streets and horsehead "hitching posts". And there would be a cheerful doorman who would hand out a Mardi Gras coin to our five year old -- what a great way to start off the day! We later took her to the pretty fountain on the grounds so she could put her coin in and make a wish. She participated in the Pirate Cruise leaving from Port Orleans Riverside. We enjoyed a lovely walk on a sunny morning along the river to get there. My daughter absolutely loved the pirate cruise! When I arrived to pick her up, she just walked by and said "It's not over yet." And it wasn't. The children had one more treasure chest to find, which was located in the Riverside Lobby. All of the children were having so much fun! This was a really wonderful experience for my daughter. She also loved the dragon slide at the pool. She had a lot of fun at the Wilderness Lodge pool as well, but this was her favorite. We all enjoyed the boat ride to and from Downtown Disney -- what a unique way to get to and from a shopping/restaurant area! The bus transportation from this resort was excellent as well. We never had to wait long for a bus to any of the parks. I can't say anything about the food court here because the only thing we bought here to eat were beignets. We were on the regular dining plan and would have a light breakfast in our room and lunch and dinner either at the parks or at other resorts or at Downtown Disney. The one thing that began to wear on us towards the end of our four night stay here was the double beds. We are accustomed to king-sized beds at home. And my daughter, being in a strange place, insisted that I sleep with her -- so my mother, daughter and myself wound up together in one double bed, if you can imagine that! But I knew about the double beds going in, which is why I scheduled the second half of our stay at the Wilderness Lodge Villas. I think if we were to do an entire stay at the French Quarter I would reserve two rooms for the four of us, just to ensure we all got a good nights sleep. Anyway, I just loved the tranquility and beauty of this resort, with jazz music quietly playing -- such a relaxing place to return to after a busy day in the parks. It really is an excellent value when compared to other resorts at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “British Traveller Review of Port Orleans FQ”
Reviews.Author: FamilyP41
Reviews.Content: Flights with Virgin-they were fine and on time both ways. Used the bus transport to hotel as we didnt want to hire a car. Check in was fine. Our room in building 2 was dead handy for the pool area, foodcourt, reception and riverboat dock.We couldnt have had a better location. Rooms in FQ are adequate but could probably do with a refurb. Room was clean and everything worked which was most important. We missed having a balcony/patio as we normally do on European hols.The hotel foodcourt wasnt really a place we could enjoy a proper meal-paper plates and plastic cutlery. It was OK for a croissant /pastry or a quick snack. Get the souvenir mugs-theyre good value 12.99$ and you can refill at the hotel with hot+cold drinks. The pool area was nice. But it did get crowded in the afternoon (as it was school holidays). We used the Disney buses and even though it was Easter break and busy we always got on our bus. We made use of the Magic Hours and were up early most days but it was worth it. Used the riverboat loads for Downtown Disney-every 20mins fm 10-4 then every 10mins till 11.30pm.(Got a bit tired of the commentary on the new Disney Vacation Club Tree Houses!!!!). We were really near to Epcot and Downtown Disney fm this hotel. One thing we found though was that the Disney people werent very helpful when it came to asking how we get OFF the site to I-Drive without a car. 'Take a taxi' they said. They werent up to speed on the bus services-we found out ourselves from our 'Brits Guide' that the Lynx 50 from outside Downtown gets you to Seaworld and there you connect with the Lynx 8 to I -Drive and also the outlets malls in the opposite direction. Ask for transfers when you board the 50 and it costs you 2$ each way AD and 1$ KIDS.Downtown Disney was a bit too noisy and overpriced for us to enjoy a meal so we ate off site most nights. We walked to Riverside a few times. Its a nice walk or you take the riverboat. You can hire racer boats etc there and also eat in the foodhall if you wish to. The Port Orleans was a good base for us as we wanted to do Disney properly over the 2 weeks+taking in to account it was school holidays we did and saw all we wanted to. Parks, water parks, parades, fireworks are really super and even though we had to get up at 6.30 a lot of the time it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Glennsgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ 2 years ago and we loved this resort, we had 2 rooms for the five of us. The staff was friendly, the pool was awesome, we saw horse and buggy rides. The resort is not as big as some of the other Disney World resorts we stayed at in the past. The restaurant, gift shop and the lobby were a short walk from our room. There is a small playgound area for younger kids. We took a leisurely walk over to it's sister resort PO Riverside to check it out and it was not far at all. That is another beautiful resort that we would like to stay at. Port Orleans French Quarter resort has dock with boats, I believe they are pontoon boats that take you over to Downtown Disney, which was very convienient and relaxing. We did not wait long for them. Even the wait for the buses were not long. Overall this is a great resort!! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This one is now my favorite”
Reviews.Author: MarySLakeland
Reviews.Content: We are Florida residents and take advantage of DisneyWorld every chance we can and have stayed at a variety of locations in and around DisneyWorld. In April 2009 I decided to give Port Orleans- French Quarter a try. What a nice surprise! Of all the moderate level hotels, this one is now my favorite. It's a smaller property which means less walking from your room to lobby/shuttles/food court/pool etc. If you want more, it's a quick and beautiful walk along a very scenic path to get to the Riverside section if you want to boat/bike/fish etc. Riverside offers more ammenities, but I liked the tranquility of the French Quarter best. For the price (off season) you can't beat this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nervous at first, but we hit the jackpot with Port Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: aidawedo
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney World during Passover/Easter week. I know, but it worked out well without the crowds and madness, if you plan well. Three kids, and we chose the Port Orleans for the price, and for all of the Resort benefits, like early park hours and the meal plan. I liked the French Quarter theme and the family style restaurant was VERY family oriented. The pool was gorgeous and fun for the kids. It was clean and nice and I have no regrets. Transportation by boat to Downtown Disney was a plus. I think the reason that I like the French Quarter was that it was not too "over the top" Disney-wise, and a good price. I hope it stays this way!

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: mandmfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Disney Hotel and it was wonderful! We stayed in building 7 along the river. It was very quiet! It was just a short walk to the pool or the dining area. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The buses came every 10 min. We took teh water craft down to Downtown Disney. ( not even a 10 min wait) We rented the sea racers. I was a little nervous about wait times after reading other reviews and it being spring break. Everything was convient and relaxing! Can't wait to do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “I Miss the French Quarter Already!”
Reviews.Author: Stineqnb
Reviews.Content: I recently went on vacation with my family to the French Quarter and had the best Disney vacation ever! The resort was clean, beautiful and the service was great. Ever morning on our way out the front door a gentleman who worked at the resort would give my daughter a coin to throw into the fountain in the lobby, she just loved it! Our rooms were cleaned within mintues of us leaving the room; we would go to breakfast at the foodcourt and be back in 15min. and the room would be cleaned! The buses ran fast and we rarely had to stand on the bus, their was always enough seats for everyone. The pool had a great theme with an awesome slide, which my daughter just loved (I could never get her out!). Severly times we took the boat from the resort to Downtown Disney, it was a short 15 min. trip and we never had to wait long for a boat in either direction. The rooms are a perfect size for 4 people, the bathrooms were super clean and the water pressure in the shower were great (not like typical hotel showers). I just loved this resort, there was soo much to do, I wish I had had more time to do it all! While on this vacation, I was already planning my next trip to the Disney Resorts!

Reviews.Title: “I wonder if some people expect too much...”
Reviews.Author: lizzybear
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 2 weeks in September 2007 during WDW's free dining promotion. We liked the small size of the resort compared to most of the others and all the cast members we encountered were friendly even when they were obviously rushed off their feet! We had a car so I can't comment much on the bus service (only used it once to DHS and found it fine) but we thought the location was great for getting anywhere else in Orlando (we didn't just do the Disney parks) and liked the fact that security always checked for ID at the gate as it made the hotel feel very safe (something that can be a concern with motel style outdoor corridors) The pool was small but you can use the facilities at Port Orleans Riverside, just a short walk away, and they have a bigger one plus a larger food court (with this said, we found the POFQ facilities adequate for our needs and never bothered to go) My boyfriend is vegetarian and the food court staff were very accomodating of this and would always prepare his breakfast without the meat (cheese omelette, scrambled eggs with waffles or potatoes etc) We're choosing to stay at Coronado Springs this year for 7 nights as we want to try somewhere different so it'll be interesting to compare the 2 moderates. I think it should be obvious that you DO pay a premium for staying onsite at WDW so as far as value for money it may not be worth the cost to some people, it's a personal choice =]

Reviews.Title: “The best pick for the money!”
Reviews.Author: OregongirlOregon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely outstanding!! Everything was perfect and to Disney standard. I will stay here again.....everything was as it should be, "magical." Every view is great, even if you have the parking lot because Disney will put shrubs and flowers to hide the parking lot view so you don't see the cars. The pool and hot tub are so convenient and the little shops and restaurant so close to run and get your morning coffee with refillable mugs you can use over and over again. The atmosphere is great, and there's a little horse drawn coach offering rides going down the street with live jazz music in the background and the "feel" of New Orleans as you take walks through the hotel to your room. Very quiet and romantic type atmosphere....Loved everything about it and can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joy_1024
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great... check in was a breeze, we even checked in early - I guess depending on the season, our room was already available at 11 am. We stayed in building #7 - it was somewhat far but easy to walk even w/ my 8 year old, not confusing to find at night as my 8 year old was able to memorize which was our room the same night. The staff was wonderful... this was the first time we ever had a dining plan and my husband & I were not sure what quick service entailed. The cashier helped us complete our orders, which was pretty funny as my husband & I would go back & fourth picking items we were missing. We loved the beignets! This was always our choice of snack for our meals. Anyways... the location was great, but make sure your hotel room is on the ground floor - this we found most convenient since we can walk directly to our room rather than finding the elevator or taking the stairs. I loved the bathroom where there was curtain that separated the rooms where the his/her sinks were. The grounds were kept absolutely clean! My husband & I enjoyed walking at night along the riverside - very quiet and peaceful... romantic. The shuttle system was great - my husband was thrilled he didn't have to drive around the Disney grounds. After a long day at the parks, none of us felt like driving and just relaxed on our way back to our hotel. We found that it did not take long to get to any of the parks from this hotel, on average 10-15 min. One regret we had was not having the opportunity to take the boat to Disney Downtown. Overall we would definitely stay here again and this was absolutely excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, pretty tree lined streets, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HLHaynes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the French Quarter in March 09. We are a family of four, our children are 5 and almost 3. We travelled there from the UK and used the Disney Magical Express to get to the hotel which was very convinenent. We loved the hotel - it was quieter than the other end of the resort (Port Orleans Riverside). The pool was great - the kids loved the water slide. There were 3 lifeguards on duty at all times when we were there and they were activley patrolling the pool (not just sitting around on their chairs all the time). We felt that the children were very safe in the pool, even when we were not in the water with them. There was a lovely atmosphere around the hotel - it was nicely themed without being too over the top so you felt you were having a break from all the characters etc that are in the parks. We enjoyed walking along the path by the river and watching the boats come and go heading to Downtown Disney (which was a nice way to travel - we used the boats on a number of occassions). Although the rooms don't have their own balconies, we brought our chairs out onto the shared walkway a number of evenings after the children were asleep. We had a room with a lovely view over the river (we had paid for a water view room) so it was nice to sit outside. The rooms, while not enormous were perfectly adequate for all our needs with plenty of storage for all our clothes and children's parafinalia. The staff at the hotel were always friendly - the children particularly liked getting mardis gras coins from the door men each day to throw into the the fountain in the lobby. Staying in the Disney complex made it easy for us to get around with the children using the complimentary bus service. The self service restaurant onsite was good - there is a sit down restaurant in the Riverside part of the resort if you want to use it (we had a lovely meal there one night - but it does get busy). Alcohol was expensive - we bought a bottle of wine a couple of nights which was not cheap. Other than that the food was reasonably priced - not cheap but reasoanble. Overall we really liked the hotel and would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaJam
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at this hotel if you have the opportunity to change w/out charge. We called well in advance advising of a very late check in. We arrived at 2am and was greeted by a very rude individual that not only was not able to check us in but gave us a huge attitude. After fighting for 45 minutes we were brought to our room but they wouldn't give us a room key until the morning because the computers turn off at 2am ... how insane is that! Next morning we asked for a hopper pass and was charged only to find out it wasn't put on our card at the park. We spent another half hour at guest services trying to straighten out. The hotel did not make anything easy and everything was an argument. For a moderate priced hotel the pool was nice and the room was average. The beds were not comfortable but again this is not a luxury hotel. I'd skip this one ...

Reviews.Title: “Old, Tired and Worn....Not what I expected from Disney!”
Reviews.Author: CMRies
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 adults and 2 children ages 6 and 8 1/2) stayed at this property from March 20-27, 2009. This hotel has been around a long time. It was formerly called Dixie Landings. Our first choice was Coronado but it sold out because of all the promotions going on. I had stayed at the Dolphin on another trip and thought that was the Disney way of doing things (I believe it was owned by Disney at the time) hotel-wise so I was expecting something just as fun. I was sorely disapppointed. I was amazed at the lack of upkeep of the property in the rooms areas. I looked at little details like the lamp posts that were absolutely dirty, the paint on the doors was chipped and needed repainting. The walk areas by the rooms (on the different levels) were dirty and stained. The paint job in general is extremely drab and boring. I tried to like the resort and succumb to its supposed charm but I was truly underwhelmed. This was supposed to be a "moderate level" resort. I shuddered to think what the discount resorts were like. The beds were only double-sized and NOT comfortable at all. The rooms were very small with very nicked up furniture like another reviewer pointed out. This property needs a lot of love in order to get it up to the "moderate" level. I felt except for the grounds that it was no higher in quality than say a Super 8 or Motel 6. We rented a car so we could have quicker access to the parks and not have to ride through the other resorts to get to the parks. Parking was quite a distance from the building we were in (6). I would recommend people stay in building 2,3 or 4 in the future if you want to be closer to the pool and main building where the dining area is. Luckily we really didn't spend a lot of time here except to sleep and eat---but we woke up every morning with sore backs because of the beds. You can always tell the quality of a hotel by its towels, I believe and these towels were scratchy. Enough said. The positive things about this resort: It is small (some people think this is a plus) The waterway takes you on a free river cruise to Disney Downtown The pool is nice, life jackets are provided for younger children) There is a playground for the children (if you have time to spend at the resort) We saw a horse-drawn carriage taking people around, we didn't know how to use it, but we saw it Door men friendly Negatives: DIRTY exterior areas including light posts TIRED, WORN paint jobs nicked up furniture double-sized, uncomfortable beds drab painting parking not so fab...quite a distance to our rooms (we stayed in building 6)

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: myersj125
Reviews.Content: Back from 5 nights at French Quarter. Loved the layout of the resort. Enjoyed walking down by the river and over to the nearby Port Orleans riverside. Pool area was clean with plenty of seating. Room was fairly clean, could have been better. Beds firm. Pillows too soft for me. Food in food court very good. All staff friendly. Affordable--didn't worry about how much I was spending just to stay here. i am not much of a drinker, but there is a pool bar and I had the most delicious frozen drink--a pina colava(pina colada with a swirl of raspberry puree) Yummo! Live music in Scat Cat's Lounge--very enjoyable fella named Elliot Dyson.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok - you have to think of the other items to judge”
Reviews.Author: binaural02
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews. Here is my take in short: For what you pay for the room $200-$250 a night, the hotel room (by itself) is woefully inadequate. When you add on the convenience and extras, it probably breaks even. Therefore, i'm stunned by the 5 star reviews and the 1 Star reviews. I stayed at this resort probably 15 years ago when it was called Dixie Landings. The room interior looks like very little has changed. The lighting is old, the furniture is beaten up, the sheets are very cheap, the TV is the old box version. This is all forgivable if the cost was cheaper. I am not suggesting that the rooms are inhabitable in anyway. It's just that they don't reflect what you'd expect for a similar hotel anywhere else in the world for $200-250 a night. What was not forgivable is that in this reluctance to update the hotel, there is a mold problem.My wife is highly allergic and had trouble sleeping. If we stayed for 7 days for a full vacation, i'd have been very annoyed. Especially since the next level up for a Deluxe hotel is only another $200 -$300 in the package cost. Therefore, it seems even more over priced in my mind. We were only there for 3 nights, so we just got benedryl and sucked it up without complaint. In the end, I thought about it in these terms. If I stayed at a similar hotel off the Disney resort and paid$89-$115 a night (the price i think a room like that should be priced), what would the cost of a car, the gas, the parking, the extra time traveling about, the lack of early admission and extra hours, etc have tacked on? I think in a dollar sense, it'd be close, but aggrevation of traveling etc, i would have been very upset. Additionally, one reason i wasn't too mad, was the value hotels aren't much cheaper. It's not like i booked a much more expensive room to stay in the moderate instead of value. Conclusion If i went back to disney, i would tell friends about the issues i had with the mold at Port Orleans, but i wouldn't tell people to avoid the place. If it fits your budget and you just want to be at Disney to avoid other headaches and don't envision spending a lot of time in your room, this hotel will be good. Pros: 1. Hotel staff - very good. The doormen have a lot of good advice if you want it. They are always smiling. 2. Hotel cleaning staff was really good. We tipped them and got some really exotic towel art and the room was as clean as it could be. Cons: 1. The mold 2. The safe is actually very very narrow. and it's actually a key as opposed to a keypad. Therefore, you have to schlep the key with you. And in the event you lose the key, they'll charge you. i didn't lose the key, so i don't know how much that is. but it's annoying to have that bulky key with you.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: EarleNc
Reviews.Content: We fully enjoyed out stay . Excellent Staff. Everything was close. Our only complaint was too many Fast Passes given out in the parks. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Peaceful Resort.. Best Moderate I stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Ohgoosh
Reviews.Content: I was there from 3/8 - 3/14/09. I stayed in Building 2 on the 3rd Floor. I had requested for connection rooms and that requested was made. That was a big deal to me cause I had my mom in the next room with my teenager. I also traveled with my 2yr and husband. The double sinks was a huge plus with a teenager. They do need to upgrade the TV but only we were not in the room that much to care. We requested a Water view and that is what we got. We wanted a view of the river but got the pool view. So if you want a specific water view state that when booking. The Resort is quiet and breath-taking. The pool is great for kids. Even though we only visted it twice, we had a ball. Husband and I enjoyed a few nights at the Scat Cats bar. The jazz player was great. The food court is a standard food court. The staff was always helpful espically the conceirce service. The check-in line was quick and check-out was even faster. Disney Trans was great as well. I never waited very long for a bus. The only time we waited long was leaving Hollywood Studios after Fanstamic.. And at that it was only 15 minutes and Disney had 2 buses for our resort and Riverside. We had very early breakfasts and the buses got us there in great time. If you are going to Downtown Disney, I would take the Boat every time. It is a little longer but it is so worth it. We only waiting about 10 mins for a boat to come. Had no complaints about Mousekeeping. Only was disappointed that we only got 2 animals towels in our stay. Bathroom was clean and everything was clean when we came back to the room. We also rented a car from Alamo at the Disney Car Care Center and had no problems there either. They come and pick you up at the resort and then will take you back to the resort when you done with the car. As I have stayed at many Disney resorts I have no complaints. I would defintly stay there again and would recommend this hotel to a friend/family as well.

Reviews.Title: “First time on magical grounds”
Reviews.Author: mickeyfanforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year, first time ever on magical grounds. This was our sixth trip to DW, we've always rented properties which were nice but I just couldn't wait to stay on the grounds. There truly is a difference and let me tell you we weren't disappointed. My husband loves Disney but has always said that it's not really a vacation, since this trip he has changed his mind. There are buses and boats that take you to the parks, restaurants and shopping. There are beautiful grounds, pools, hot tubs to relax in. Our dining was included so we made arrangements and knew where we were going and when. The castmembers couldn't be friendlier. The people in the lobby were so polite and quick. The grounds, absolutely beautiful. We did have to wait until 3:00 to check in, but that was the time stated, so we just took a drive around to get situated. The room was nice, it accomodated the four of us just fine and we were in a nice location-near the pool, lobby, shops, laundry and the boat launch. Even if you have to walk, this place is just beautiful, relax and take it all in, remember it was all done, every bit of it, just for your enjoyment. It still gets me when I think of how much imagination, thought and work that it takes to make it such a pleasurable experience for all who attend the kingdom. It amazes me in such a selfish world one man had a vision and it was to make sooo many people happy and to this day his vision is being carried out. Anywho, we used the dining plan and the food was outstanding, so worth it. We felt like kings and queens. I can't say enough, PO Frenchquarter was Magical. We're going again this year. If you go, you won't be disappointed-believe in the magic.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great, Except (M)Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: rchs20
Reviews.Content: My family has been to Disney and stayed at this resort several times. We love the small setting, compared to the larger resorts. We were a group of seven, so we required two rooms. I asked for connecting (BTW, must ask for connecting rooms, adjoining is next to) and had them. Check in was a breeze. One of the rooms was ready, so we went to that room to drop off carry-on stuff. Not even an hour later, the second room was ready and all of our luggage was in the room. So far, this was more than we could ask for. We had a great couple of days, returning every day around 1pm from the parks for naps and rest. We were there for 6 nights and with four kids (Ages 7, 4 and 18 month twins), housekeeping of rooms is a necessity. The second day they arrived during nap times. We told them that this would be our time in the room each day. We collected trash and received new towels and they were on their way. The third day, they arrived at 7:45am, we were just about ready, and so we left for the morning. We returned to Mickey shaped and animal shaped towels. My older children were thrilled and loved them. The fourth day, they came at naptime again, after we had asked them for mid morning. The fifth day, they arrived at naptime again. With this, my wife called to complain and said that we would be leaving for the parks around 3:30pm and needed service, they never came. The sixth morning, my wife called again, she was assured that they would come in the morning ansd was told to "have a magical day". We arrived back from the parks and they had not come. I called this time and demanded that they come as soon as we left for the parks this day. We arrived back that night and they had not come. Rather than spoil our last night, we decided to let it go, but have since written letters to the General Manager of the hotel, Director of Operations for the Resorts, and the Director of Guest Relations. I believe that this problem is due to the incompetence of one or two employees out of the hundreds who were wonderful. I almost did not want to include this problem, but wanted to be fair to any other guests. The pool is really fun for kids, it has a great slide. The pool bar is great for adults and the bartenders are wonderful. Do not ever take the bus to Downtown Disney; there is a boat dock behind the pool. It is about a fifteen-minute ride and is awesome. If you end up at Downtown Disney, take the boat back. Buses to everywhere else came within ten minutes of getting to the bus stop. Some of the buses do stop at the Riverside resort on the way there if the bus is not full. On the way back, the bus from Disney Studios and Animal Kingdom stop at Riverside first. There is no restaurant at the resort, but the counter service is good. It does not have a great selection, but the friendliness of the staff was great. We overall had a great time despite our housekeeping misadventures. This resort is great and we would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than a resort”
Reviews.Author: Smokeyham
Reviews.Content: Disney Port Orleans – French Quarter Resort Review February, 2009 We just returned from an 8-night stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter (FQ) at Disney World. This was a good base for touring the various Disney parks. The grounds are very nicely landscaped. Given the quality of the room, prices are definitely higher than you would expect to pay for the same quality of room outside of Disney. For the additional price you are getting the following benefits: * Use of the Disney bus and boat transportation systems, so you don’t have to drive and pay for parking. * Purchases made in the park can be delivered to the motel’s gift store. However, you must be staying for at least two nights from your time of purchase to make use of this. * Magic Hours - Early entry/late use of a specific park which is only available to Disney resort guests. However, some guides suggest not going to parks on the days which have the Magic Hours, so you might want to think about the value of what you’re getting. * Ability to purchase a meal plan, which will get you some discounts on food. The word “resort” in the name is probably stretching the definition a bit. Large motel would probably be more accurate. There is a cafeteria-style dining, but no sit-down full service restaurant. The serving area is small and congested, and you will need to keep a sharp eye out for an available table during busy times. There is a small bar area, a video game arcade, and a gift shop. Food at the cafeteria was limited, and quite expensive. We were also disappointed at the amount of packaging used (everything is served on paper plates, which have a plastic lid put on top, plastic silverware, and everything is then thrown in the garbage). There was one recycling container for bottles, near the exit, but you had to hunt for it. Decorations consist of oversized plastic mardi gras style masks. The motel room was fairly clean, though I did find some debris from previous guests. The front doors of some the rooms were scraped and looked like they needed a coat of paint. Motel type amenities (small in-room refrigerator, coffee maker, hair drier) are provided. Soap and shampoo are provided, but not hand lotion. There is a nice design feature, which is a curtain which separates the sinks/changing area from the rest of the bedroom. This is nice to allow for a private changing area, and to allow one person to sleep in a bit while the other showers or changes. Staff were helpful, and knowledgeable about park activity times. The room was generally quiet, which was appreciated after some long days of touring the parks. However, we did hear the sound of toilets flushing from the rooms around us. Also, we were there during a colder spell, so didn’t have to deal with people lingering on the porch/walkway which runs in front of the rooms, which has been a complaint of other reviewers. Like all of the Disney hotels/motels, this one is large (but smaller than some of the other properties), so try to get a room relatively close to the bus stop and cafeteria to minimize long walks at the beginning and end of each day. The pool is quite large and fun for kids. Lifeguards were on hand, and appeared to be vigilant. There is also a hot tub. A pleasant trail winds alongside the river, which is nice if you’re looking for a quiet place to get away from things for a bit. We didn’t spend much time at the motel, and only used it as a place to sleep and have breakfast. For us, it was nice not having to rent a car, and just using the Disney transport system and having our purchases delivered. We also fully used the meal plan we had purchased. We also planned to eat dinners at various restaurants in different hotels and parks, so were not concerned about the lack of a full service restaurant. If the above sounds like your plan for visiting Disney World, and you are OK with the basic motel amenities, then the French Quarter might work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just booked our 3rd Stay at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: allie3490
Reviews.Content: October will be our 3rd time staying at this wonderful resort. My family and I love everything about this place. It's small, all buildings are close to the bus stop, food court, and pool. We love the boat to downtown Disney...and we also enjoy the beignets for breakfast...Yum!! It was always nice after a long day at the parks to come back to our room and relax. The housekeeping was great, and always took care our our trash and gave us fresh towels. We are literally counting down the days till our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience,”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFlier
Reviews.Content: We stayed ant Port Orleans-French Quarter for our first trip to Disney World last week. We were very happy with our choice. We booked our trip through the Disney site and used the Magical Express to get from the airport to the resort and back. It did take a few hours for our luggage to arrive in our room. You will want to bring a carry-on with a change of clothes and pajamas for the kids. Our luggage got there well after bedtime. Overall we were very happy with our stay at the resort. We purchased the deluxe meal plan and it was definitely worth the money. The room was decent. My daughter was so excited when we returned to the room in the evening to find towel animals and her teddy bears arranged in a "towel hammock." The room could have been a little cleaner but it wasn't so bad that I wouldn't stay there again. There was a little mold in the grout of the shower and the carpet could have used a shampoo. The food court had a nice variety and the staff was friendly. The pool big and fun. The water slide was a winner for my daughter. Buses to the parks ran pretty regularly. Sometimes they were crowded and we had to wait for the next one. This was not such a problem on the mornings that we got an early start. I would definitely stay at this resort again. I would also use the Magical Express and purchase the meal plan. It was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, lovely staff, very picturesque...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jhoppy01
Reviews.Content: For our very first trip to WDW, we decided to immerse ourselves fully in the Disney experience & stay at a WDW hotel. We chose this hotel as it was mid range & looked lovely. And, yes it was! Helpful, happy staff all around....concierge, luggage, cleaning, bookings EVERYONE was lovely. Pool was gorgeous, grounds were pretty & immaculate. As I have a disability, we asked for a room close to the lobby and got it. They were so helpful. Buses were regular (unlike All Star Music which was SHOCKING) & on time. Close to Downtown Disney. Catch the ferry to here as its nice sightseeing on the way. We wanted to stay here the whole trip BUT couldnt as it was booked out so we stayed here for 6 days & then had to go to All Star Music which was a whole new (bad) world. We would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, lousy beds”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: POFQ must have one of Disneyworld's best locations. We LOVED the free boat that took you to Riverside or Downtown Disney. A very pleasant way to get about. We never waited more than 5 minutes for a bus, and all the trips we took were very quick with no stops, usually 10 mniutes or less. Buses were punctual too, which was important at the end of a very long day. We really enjoyed the fun pool area, the hotel layout was very nice, we thought that the woods on the opposite side of the river gave the POFQ a very nice non-Disney feeling. We really liked that the whole Disney thing wasn't shoved in your face at this resort, as it really seemed like a hotel instead of part of Disneyworld. Downsides were the poor beds, which really belonged at a sleezy motel rather than a resort with aspirations of grandeur. The just-about-bearable beds were complimented by the worst pillows too, also befitting a sleezy motel. At least they very quickly replaced them with feather pillows when asked, which improved our sleep. This hotel is very quiet at night, but the bar and jacuzzi areas were quite lively. The other big negative here is that the restaurant is cafeteria style, which is fine for breakfast maybe. WE ended up eating at Downtown Disney often, giving us a great excuse to take the lovely boat in the afternoons and evenings when you want to relax. In all, I do think this is a good choice, but ask for a room with new beds.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LoveDisneyTrip
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after revewing many other moderate disney resorts through trip advisors and other sites. We stayed at the caribbean beach before and we found the FQ is so much better since it is smaller and provides a relaxing resort atmosphere. We went to the Port Orleans Riverside (next door) one evening for dinner and found that the service is not as good, tense, and quite chaotic; perhaps because they have to serve too many guests. All and all, we love the French Quarter and got to appreciate the smaller resorts and the convenience. One bus stop and don't have to wait for long to get to the parks. We also bought the Quick Service Dining Plan that we really like. We use it a lot at the downtown disney Wolfgang Puck Express and this really make the plan worthwhile. The boat trip to downtown disney is wonderful. The disney magical express is also truly magical. We got our luggage at the room. At the end of the stay, dropped and checked them in at the airline desk at the hotel and stored our carry on with the friendly bell service to be picked up after we played at the park and catch the magical bus taking us back to the airport. I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DISNEY RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Fundytrail
Reviews.Content: This was not our 1st trip to a Disney Resort, but we loved POFQ! The smaller size of this resort makes it special, short line-up for bus, food, check in & etc. Also loved the easy boat access to Downtown Disney. Very clean and well kept. WILL RETURN!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: daisymb
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. Just like any othe place I've stayed. While I wouldn't make a special point to stay here, it was just as good as any other place. The room was clean, and generally looked pretty typical. Pool seemed nice, although we didn't swim because it was too cold. It had a little playground too, which my twins loved. It's smaller than the Riverside, which was nice for several reasons. 1. less walking to/from room. 2. one bus stop for the Disney parks versus at least 4 at the Riverside location. That is a big deal when coming back from a long day at the parks and you just want to get back to your room and not wait through a bunch of other bus stops. The boat took you to Downtown Disney and was nice; however, closed when it was too windy. It only has a cafeteria (no restaurants), with average food but costs a Disney$$ price. Welcome to Disney world, that is common. Buy the Disney cups for bottomless sodas, coffee, hot choc, etc, although remember it is only good in the resort, not the theme parks.The bus system to/from resorts was excellent. Never had to wait around for a ride, and the buses were clean. While I would not recommend the hotel, I would not discourage one from staying here either.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: barrylnat
Reviews.Content: We loved our 10 night stay at Port orleans French Quarter. From beginning to end service and amenities were all great. There are many negative comments here so as I write my review I will comment on these other viewpoints. CHECK-IN: Yes, when we arrived at 2 pm there was a line but it moved swiftly and the check in person who helped us was friendly, full of info taking time to prepare us for all we needed to know. Most inportant, they upgraded us to a RIVER VIEW room free of charge when we didn't even ask for it. THE ROOM: The room was well decorated and the set up was lovely. The seperation from the bath and sleeping area was much appreciated. The beds were ultra soft and the decor was fresh and not at all dated. MOUSEKEEPING: There have been many complaints about the housekeeping at this resort. Our first full day there we left early - around 8 am and returned around 3 pm. Our room had not been cleaned yet and I was not pleased. There is a card in the room saying housekeeping will come any time between 8 and 4:30. I called housekeeping and discussed my displeasure. The maid was there within 5 minutes and I explained to her our schedule and what time of day we would like our room cleaned. She was very agreeable and for the rest of the stay our room was cleaned late morning while we were out. Bathroom was always spotless, animals left, soft sheets and soaps etc. always plentiful. THE GROUNDS: This resort is truly like being away from Disney. It is all cobblestoned streests, very quiet and peaceful. What a wonderful retreat after tiring days. We often felt as if we were the only ones there. We have stayed at the economy resorts before and this was a 100% improvement. THE FOOD COURT: I really liked the food court. many are upset there is no sit down restaurant here. We ventured over to the Boatwright Dining Hall a couple of times and it was always crowded, crazy, loud and cumbersome. Even wih a reservation we were not seated. The food court even at its busiest time was friendly, fast and the food was not like a cafeteria. it was all fresh and made before your eyes. Burgers were great and highly recommend the huge chicken ceasar salad. Definitely a bonus when wanting to stay on the grounds for a meal. You could eat there or bring it back to your room. BOTTOM LINE: I highly recommend this resort. Seems many people are desiring ultra deluxe. if that is what you want, stay at a deluxe resort. This is a moderate resort and far surpasses all expectations. For those who may encounter some problems politely address them with the appropriate staff and I guarantee you will be accomodated with genuine kindness. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Mavis44
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the negative reviews on this place. We stayed this weekend for one night. We had a quick and courteous check in. Our room was nice, with a big king bed. It was very clean. The resort itself had a very nice feel to it, and had great access to all things Disney. I felt it was reasonably priced and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Charm in the Middle of the Disney Distractions”
Reviews.Author: redink46142
Reviews.Content: I booked the Port Orleans-French Quarter for a long weekend, hoping it would be an oasis of calm in the middle of the Disney chaos - and this exceeded my expectations. The quiet courtyards, peaceful walking paths, and friendly ambiance were a welcome respite after enjoying fun-filled and exciting days at WDW parks. Loved the relaxing boat ride to Downtown Disney. Used the in-room fridge to keep milk, yogurt, and sodas available. Enjoyed soaking my tired feet in the hot tub at night. And the Disney Express and other transportation helped me make this a restful, but affordable, long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: seethesightsUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded me of our hotel in Charleston, SC. The room was spacious and pretty (standard room). My kids loved the pool and hot tub. We were near the hot tub, which also put us near the food court. The gift shop had everything that I ended up buying in the parks--a great selection of Disney merchandise and food, meds, and sunscreen. The staff was great, esp the 2 men standing at the doors of the lobby every day handing out coins for the fountain. Sometimes the buses would go straight to the parks after picking us up, other times we would make several stops. We never had to wait too long for a bus. The boat will take you to downtown disney or riverside only, not the parks. Everyone says you won't be in the rooms much, but my daughter was sick one day and I was glad we had a nice room. The magical express was great but takes you to your homebound flight 3 hours early, so don't pick a 7am flight home! Get some beignets!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripPA
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for hubby's convention @ Marriott World Center. Stayed 7 nights here; daughter and son-in-law joined us the last 5 nights. As a late book, we had a choice of this Disney resort or Carribbean Beach as everything else was booked. We usually stay @ a deluxe level Disney (usually go every 4-5 years) so were pleasantly surprised with French Quarter. We do have an issue with double beds as hubby is pretty good sized but needed the 2 beds and really prefer to stay ON Disney for the convenience. It was very easy for hubby to catch a cab each AM ($12-15 one way). I have to say the beds were really our only issue and, since we knew that going in, I'm still giving this resort a 5. Everything was clean, comfortable, and convenient. The pool area is a delight with all the frolicking alligators, slides, and fountains. We were there during a particularly cold time - below 30 3 nights - and the staff covered flower beds and moved planters up close to the buildings to try to save them. I think they were successful as I didn't see any black leaves. Hubby still hit the heated pool and hot tub every day though. There were just a few northerners braving it. The pictures show the decor as garish I think but it's really not, just fun. We were in building 5, on the back side from the pool, over the courtyard and with an angled view of the river, #5339. Highly recommend the bottomless coffee cup that you can fill for free during your visit at the cafe. It's $12.50 plus tax but, if you'll be there for a few days and don't mind sharing, well worth it. The cafe has some healthy choices but @ Disney prices. They sell pizza, a couple of dinner salads, sandwiches, beer by the bottle, ice cream, cookies, single serve cereals, milk, ready-to-eat packs of grapes, carrots, etc. We packed instant oatmeal, bowls, and spoons so we could heat water in the room coffeepot (it's just a 4 cupper) for breakfast. There is also a mini-fridge, no microwave in the room but one in the cafe. There is a separate potty/tub room off the sink area; the sink area has a curtain that can be pulled to make a separate changing area. It was handy while hubby was getting ready in the AM before the rest of us were up. The boat to the Marketplace is a very pleasant ride and picks up every 20-30 minutes. Our daughter is a distance runner and used the stone path along the river each day. It's a mile out and back @ French Quarter and connects to a .7mi loop @ Riverside. She needed a few of those to get her mileage in but, heh, whatever works. I walked it one day and had an employee in a golf cart stop and ask if I wanted a ride. It's very quiet and beautiful along the river but still in sight of the buildings so feels quite safe. We made Disney dining reservations before we left home as I'd read that they can fill up. The whole resort isn't overly large and is all centered around the cafe/reservations/gift shop building. You can catch buses to all the resorts and water parks right out front of that. They're usually pretty regular, about a 20 minute wait if you've just missed one for your destination. We did see 2 MK buses back-to-back one morning and waited maybe 30 minutes that day for a Hollywood Studios bus (or did it just seem that long because it was so darn cold?). We did notice that all the parks seem to have the FQ buses at the other end of their pavilions, so a bit longer walk there. Disney Express also picks up out front on the other side of the building. We arrived just after midnight at the end of the work week so were beat that day and thankful we didn't have to drive. The Disney employees working at the airport to load those buses were very friendly and nice. It's always interesting to hear where those folks originated and their story of landing at Disney so ask! We did have a bit of trouble finding the Express bus area - we knew it was @ ground transportation but turned the wrong way off the escalator and didn't see any signs to direct. It's a long walk to the other end at 12:30AM! Registration was fairly smooth but just one employee on duty. Had to stop the next day to get our late-ordered park tickets as concierge was, of course, closed. The 3 people @ the concierge desk that day told me I had to go to On Call @ the park to pick up the tickets and they couldn't retrieve them and add them to our room key, even with the confirmation number. When our daughter and son-in-law arrived 2 days later, I mentioned it while they were checking in and was told that, yes, they certainly could do that. We weren't starting @ the parks until the next day so retrieved hubby's key card and added everything onto both our keys. Much handier than having to keep 2 cards apiece. Not sure why none of the first 3 knew of that capability. The outside entry is so much more convenient than waiting for elevators in the deluxe resorts. We were on the top floor (3rd) and just used the elevator when we had our suitcases with us. That could be an issue of you have trouble with stairs We liked this resort so much that we're hoping Disney will either upgrade to queen beds or the kids will be able to afford their own room in a few years so we can upgrade to a king room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover429
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Disneyworld. We loved it soooo much that we joined DVC(Disney Vacation Club). Great place, moderate prices. If you are looking for a great vacation experience I highly recommend this hotel. They have a great staff and the atmosphere is wonderful. They have the scat cat club on resort grounds and they have wonderful entertainment. You must check out Elliot Dyson. We loved him so much we bought one of his Cd's that he signed for us. Good location, can take boat ride to park. Awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ll72
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days here through New Year 09. First impressions were fantastic, check-in was a breeze and the staff were very friendly (as you'd expect from a Disney property). We had a problem in our room with water damaged carpet, after a considerable delay we arranged to be shifted to a different room @ midnight. To be fair though we checked in on Dec 30 and the hotel was full to capacity so it wasn't like there were a lot of rooms to spare. The food court was a bit ordinary, you could walk to Riverside (@ 5 minutes) and choose from the restaurant there but it would be nicer to have more variety at your doorstep. Pros: Bathroom size - way better than we'd hope for at this property. Location - the property is lovely, right on the river and very well presented Convenience - very easy to get to any of the parks with regular shuttle services. Even on New Years Eve there was no significant wait for transportation. Laundry - our stay was in the middle of a 4 week trip to the USA so the convenience of having a laundry on site without having to cue to use the machines was a real bonus. There were some comments about the price of using the machines ($2 a pop) but I didn't find this totally unexpected given the location. Cons: My biggest disappointment was that after check in the service just wasn't what we expected from a disney property. Sure, the "cast members" were no doubt really busy given the time of year you but we kind of got the feeling that the guests were a bit of an inconvenience sometimes and that it was all just a little too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: pamouselover
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights here at the hotel. We arrived on Dec. 31st 2008 to a nice doorman opening the door for us and welcoming us home. Our room was not ready at 3:20 in the afternoon,but we were ok with that since we wanted to head out and see some sites. We found our room to be a bit in need of a good dusting when it was ready. I had packed some cleaning wipes and got to cleaning the remote, phone, tables etc. The bathroom areas were cleaned, so I get that no one had stayed in this room latley. Other then that we fell in love with this resort. The grounds are wonderful, and the resort has a very warmy feel to it. I love that it was small and close to everything. The food court had a great variety for all meals. Being from the east coast I was very impressed with the cheese steak I ordered one night. The boat is a nice ride over to the riverside resort or to downtowne. This is a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fussy traveler perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: joni*girl
Reviews.Content: I think alot has to do with your expectations, whether you like a hotel or not, and my expectations are on the higher end. The only things which prevented this property from 4 dots are: 1) It is a 'motel-style' property (I prefer to enter my room from the hallway). However, I did know it was motel-style when booking. 2) The safe was too small for my laptop 3) Commode was noisy to flush (really noisy). 4) Limited channel selection outside of Disney choices. Items of note: 1) The beds are quite comfortable for a "moderate" property, moreso than I'd expected. 2) The heating/AC unit is very quiet - a pleasant surprise. 3) Decor rivals that of the Hilton Garden Inn quality - very nice and very theme-appropriate. 4) Our room was clean and the furnishings well-maintained. I especially liked the design of the sink area - we took photos to inspire us for our bath remodel!

Reviews.Title: “Wao what a vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Luisa13
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 days stay at POFQ. Firstly when we arrived we were extremely pleased with the help and warm welcome from the guy at the front desk reception. He was wonderful and helpful with our room accomodations. We had two separated rooms that were close by (something we had request) and they were beautiful. We can remember the last time we saw a hotel rooms so clean and spacious before (for the money we pay) as we have travel around the world. We were impressed with the lay out of the hotel as it was easy to find our way around. The rooms were immaculate clean, Regina, our Housekepper always took her time to clean and beautify our rooms. It is a small resort wich is great. Just a short walk to go anywhere in the resort. Port Orleans - Riverside - is just 5 minutes walk. The transportation is very good as well. Bus service to the parks and Downtown Disney were very accurate, less than 20 minutes wait for any bus to take you anywhere. The boat ride to Riverside and Downtown Disney was quick and fun. However, to be totally honest, my family was extremely dissapointed with the food at the food court .(food expensive and a little amount for the price). We took advantange of the Disney Dinning Plan and felt it saved us a lot of money in our dinning table reservations, but I must say, reservations should be made for all services, table and quick services. The food at the hotel was the same food that we got in Disney Pop Centure. (We stayed here in March 2008). Overall we had a very pleasant experience at this property. I would definetely recommend this resort. The Deonarine Family Trinidad, West Indies

Reviews.Title: “50 th birthday and family Christmas Holiday”
Reviews.Author: dlapl01
Reviews.Content: We had a fun time but found that service was either "WOW" or below average nothing in between. Jose who looked after our bags was great. This was our third visit to Disney French Quaters and we were surprised how much the quality has dropped. The sheets on our beds were never tucked in just left hanging over the side which made for a very uncomfortable sleep. We aso noted this time I felt that I was nickled and dimed to death. We found this very annoying and made the stay which was a special time for the family a little less special. Over all we would never spend Christmas at Disney again and are not expecting to go back for a long time. I would rate the trip Parks 5 stars out of 5 Rooms 2 stars out of 5 Staff 3.5 out of 5 Cleaning staff for rooms 1,5 out of 5 Quality of merchanised 2.5 out of 5 Fire works displays 5 out 5 with Epcot being the best

Reviews.Title: “Hair in Bed Fingernails on Floor. Ewww!”
Reviews.Author: chickles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a bad experience at POFQ and we just want to give a heads up to anyone who may want to stay there or is staying there soon. I've been and stayed at Disney World on 23 different occasions since 1985 and this was the absolute worst experience I've ever had. We checked in to POFQ 12/23/2008 and were very excited because we've read so many nice things about it online in different places. When we got to the hotel around 10 am and our room wasn't ready and the front desk told us we'd have to wait until 3 pm. That's very normal for Disney hotels, so we were fine. We went to the parks at 11 pm, got our hotel room number, and went up to our room. The room was absolutely filthy. There was hair all over the floor of the sink area, in the bathtub/toilet area, and in the bathtub itself. The floor was all smudged and had dirt marks on it too. Plus, on the carpeted area by the beds, there were six fingernails in different locations on the floor... it was clear the floor of the room had NOT been cleaned. The worst part was when we pulled down the sheets and there was a lot of hair in the sheets in BOTH of the beds. Plus there were some other nasty things in the sheets I'd prefer not to even mention. My husband complained to the front desk and they gave us a new room in a new building still at POFQ. In that room, the floor and bathroom were clean, but both of the beds had hair under the pillowcases and some in between the sheets. We decided to leave POFQ and stay at a different Disney resort. By this time it was 12:30. The manager was not helpful and wanted us to A. take her to the rooms and show her the hairs and nails, and B. keep checking different rooms until we found a clean one we would stay in. After an hour and a half (literally) of discussion/arguments with the manager, we finally were able to have the money we paid for that night transferred to the new hotel as a credit, which the manager did NOT want to do. Please, beware of the POFQ and think twice about staying there. If you already have plans to stay there, make sure your bed is clean before you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: mcpeete
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 night stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. It was a graduation gift for my 18 year old grandaughter and the two of us had a ball. We both loved the POFQ. Our room was clean and fresh. We recieved clean towels every morning with out requesting them. The staff was curteous, helpful and very friendly. We stayed in one of the farthest buildings from the main entrance but it only took minutes to get to the bus stop, food court, front desk etc. Buses ran quite often and the boat ride to Downtown Disney was fun and quick. We took advantage of the Dining plan and felt it saved us a great deal of money. It was also nice to not have to worry about what everything was going to cost at each meal. I must say, reservations really should be made for all table services. We had either breakfast or lunch at the food court at POFQ and had no complaints about anything we had. I have another grandaughter graduating in 3 years and I plan to return to the French Quarter with her as well.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Port Orleans French Quarter and loved it both times. The rooms were immaculate and clean and very quiet. Staff were wonderful - we found them exceptional everywhere at WDW. However, at the hotel, in particular, everyone was pleasant. Any of the staff that you'd pass on the streets or anyplace always smiled and acknowledged you. It is a smaller resort than some at WDW which is great. Just a short stroll to anywhere in the resort. It is close to Port Orelans - Riverside and so a five minute walk will get you there, too. The buffet at French Quarter was great. Always a reasonable variety. Other than the pizza, we never had to wait any amount of time at all. Again, with Riverside so close, you can easily walk there for a meal, which we sometimes did in the evening as it was larger and had a bit more variety for a change. We never had trouble getting a table at either one. Pool is amazing. There is a great waterslide there for the kids (and adults). Lifeguards are wonderful. Even if there were only two kids in the pool, they are on duty and very attentive. Lots of lifejackets there available for the kids to use, too. You can use the Riverside pools, too, although we preferred the French Quarter ones. Transportation is good. Bus service to the parks and boat to a few other resorts as well as Downtown Disney. Even just the boat ride is nice. There is piped in jazz music all over French Quarter. The grounds are immaculate. There is nice gift shop with lots of selection. Arcade, which was never busy, also had a nice variety. The rooms had two double beds. Lots of storage space and drawers. Safe built in. Two sinks in an area separate from the tub and toilet. Always lots of towels and toiletries. We chose French Quarter when we went to Disney in 2006 and loved it. When we went back in 2007, it felt just like home again. Definitely every time we go do Disney, we will be at French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley marvellous holiday”
Reviews.Author: philfifilauren
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 11 staying, and can honestly say what a fantastic place. Staff were so helpful, areas were very clean and tidy and the rooms were superb. Kids had a great time in the pool and we enjoyed the boat ride down to downtown disney every evening. Also the buses to the parks were so regular and the other bonus was we were first to be picked up etc so had no trouble getting seats on the bus. We will all be back 2010!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice resort”
Reviews.Author: ilovejimmychoo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Orlando, and so decided to stay at a Disney resort this time as we stayed on I-Drive the year before. Overall the resort was a good choice and yes I would stay here again. Good Points are, 1. Clean room and resort 2. Friendly staff who were always willing to help. 3. Beautiful grounds 4. Free Disney transport busses to all the parks. 5. Nice pool 6. Short boat ride to Downtown Disney 7. Close to a golf course 8. On site shop 9. Peaceful resort Bad Points are, 1. Pool bar closes at round about 9pm 2. One bar man needs to go on a customer relations training programe. 3. The food court....yuk......Not my type of food, but hubby loved the crosiants. 4. The rain from Tropical storm Fay......but hey we still had fun. The best thing about staying at a Disney resort has to be the free buses to all the parks. Dont forget to buy the refill mugs/beakers. If you are staying here, you will have a fab time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: boots_delicious
Reviews.Content: My sister took me and my oldest childhood friend to Disney World for my Graduation present and I had the best time ever. This was my third time going to Disney World and so far this was the best hotel that i've stayed at in florida. the service was great, the room was beautiful, the pool was fun, the food was delicious, I loved everything about this hotel. I'd recommend it for everyone, it was mature enough for and 18 yeat old yet it still had an immature kind of thing to it so it was really fun!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: sunfired_
Reviews.Content: It wasn't until after I had booked our room and flight that I discovered these reviews. I must say that after reading them, I was very skeptical at what we were going to find. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and our anniversary while we were there and I had myself prepared for nothing good. I had called the week before our arrival to make a couple requests such as the building we wanted and the floor which I based on some of the reviews I had read. When we arrived for check-in, the building and floor that was assigned to us was no where near what I had requested. I thought to myself this was the beginning of all the bad reviews I had read!! I told the castmember these accomadations were nothing like I had requested and were not acceptable. After 2 telephone calls, she assigned us Building 6, third floor, corner room which was what I had requested. She was extremely helpful and very friendly. We went to our room, and again, after reading some of the bad reviews, I was not expecting anything great. July in Florida was extremely hot and humid, but as soon as my husband opened our door, we were greeted by a wonderfully cool room!! We had a king-sized bed which was exceptionally comfortable. The room was very clean. The bathroom was your average hotel bathroom, but nice-sized. We had read about the loud toilets and sure enough they are loud when flushed, but that is a small detail. After we unpacked and were heading out, we stopped by the front desk and told the castmember that checked us in that our room was exactly what we wanted and I mentioned to her that her attentiveness and friendly attitude was the start of a great anniversary and birthday week after all. We kept our Do Not Disturb on the door at all times, which was honored by the housekeeping staff. They did however, leave a bag with clean towels, soap, coffee, etc. on our door 3 of the 5 days we were there. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is very nice and relaxing!! The bus service does leave alot to be desired. That is just about the only complaint I can think of. Sharing the bus with the neighboring resort, Riverside, is not a very good idea!! There were a couple times when the bus was so full, people had to stand which I don't think is actually safe!! Overall, we had a very pleasant experience at this property.
