As I mentioned earlier we were in Building 6 which is close to the boat ride. We were on the 3rd floor with a corner room that had a river view. Very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Week at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: pburland23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a long weekend at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter and we absolutely loved it. I found the resort to be classy and understated, for the most part. It wasn't as sprawly as some other WDW resorts I've stayed at (ex. All Star Sports). Check-In: We arrived at the hotel around 1:30 on a Friday and the check-in line was a few people deep. The line moved pretty quickly and the actual check-in process was a breeze. Room: We were on the 3rd floor of building 5. When I booked our room, I booked a standard view room using the rationale that I wouldn't be in the room except to sleep, so why pay more for the view. I was surprised to find our room was a corner room with two windows facing the river that runs along the property. The room location was ideal. It was quiet and peaceful. Additionally, Building 5 was still close enough to the common areas of the resort that it was a brief walk to the pool, food court, bus stop, etc. Hotel Grounds: The grounds were very nice with manicured lawns and fountains throughout the property. It was a pleasant environment to walk around and was lit very nicely at night. Pool: We used the pool/hot tub one day and it was a fun design with the dragon slide and alligator fountains. The pool was pretty empty during the day, since it was December. I imagine it might get cramped during business seasons. Food: We ate breakfast in the food court twice and a late lunch there one day. The food was pretty standard for Disney. Nothing was outstanding, but nothing was bad. The food court seemed small to me, but it was never particularly crowded which was a plus. Transportation: The bus stop was a close walk to our room and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus leaving the resort. A few times there were long waits coming back from the parks, but I feel that it is to be expected. We also took the boat to Downtown Disney from the resort. It was a very pleasant ride through a part of WDW I had never seen before. On the ride back from Downtown Disney we had a boat captain who had been with the company since 1972. He told the best stories about the early years of WDW and was a real pleasure. Overall, it was a fantastic four days at the Port Orleans French Quarter. I would definitely recommend this resort and I will surely stay there again in the future. It had some of the classiness and elegance of the Deluxe resorts, but at a much more manageable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a moderate....”
Reviews.Author: crananon
Reviews.Content: Close to Epcot this hotel was a great choice for us. The pool was big with a great slide for the kids. I do think the rooms could have been cleaner. The staff was very friendly and the food at the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Charming resort”
Reviews.Author: mg3542
Reviews.Content: I loved the well manicured property. It was charming, with several grassy squares with fountains in them. It was not a huge property like many other WDW resorts, you could comfortably walk the property. We stayed in building 4, very convenient to the bus stop, and while technically it overlooked a parking lot on our side, it was buffered by bushes and grass. The other side of the building would have been prettier as it overlooked the grassy square and fountain. The pool was nice sized and interesting, many areas were 3 foot 6 inches deep so my kids could touch down. Fun dragon slide, well life guarded. There was a nice hot tub tucked behind a boxwood hedge with a lions head shower. The theming was great. Laundry room right near the pool open 24 hours. A nice arcade, lounge area with live music some nights. You can book a horse and carriage ride, catch a boat launch to Downtown Disney (very commercial, I hated Planet Hollywood) or a boat to Riverside the adjoining resort. Kids get Mardi Gras style beads and wishing coins on arrival. Food court was nice, good breakfasts, and late night bites, no complaints (except the Nescafe, make coffee in your room!). My kids did not like the huge fiberglass heads hanging for decoration, I guess they were a bit scary. We had dinner at Boatwrights at Riverside which was walking distance. Nice service, food was variable (I think that might have been Minute Rice and margarine on the table!) The room was also nicely themed, newly decorated. Mousekeeping was sufficient. We tipped a bit each night. Last day our mousekeeper checked in with us as we were leaving, but not prior to this. Buses were quick and reliable, we never waited more than 10 minutes the whole trip. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Magical Express took care of transportation both ways, luggage arrived within 45 minutes of our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VTMChris
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the hotel was good. The Disney Magical Express was very convenient, yes it can take up to 3 hours for your bags to arrive, but Disney makes this VERY clear in the documentation that you receive, it sure beats standing at the baggage claim! FOOD: Disney does tend to nickel-and-dime you. There is no continental breakfast. I think the restaurant gets a bad rap from some of the other reviewers. The local restaurant offers a variety of food options and it does tend to be slightly over-priced but the food is the same quality as most any other park restaurant that doesn't offer table service. The staff here was really quite friendly even in the face of some demanding guests that I observed. There is a restaurant with table service at Port Orleans Riverside; we found the food there to be somewhat mediocre. ROOM: Our room was on the third (top) floor and we paid $20.00 extra for a water view. We found it to be clean and well maintained and, above all else, it was quiet! Internet service was available for about $9.00 for 24hours use. The room has a strong box/safe, refrigerator, double-sinks. The room was rather spacious but the beds were on the smaller side. POOL: The pool was cute and the kids seemed to like it. It was designed to look like a Mardi Gras float. There was a charge for a locker. It was a little too cold for us to use the pool. STAFF: All around we found the staff to be very friendly. TRANSPORTATION: The free boat that runs between Downtown Disney, Port Orleans Riverside, and Port Orleans French Quarter was timely and convenient. We never had to wait long for the boat and it ran fairly late into the evening. The park buses could be a little crowded at times. Sometimes we had to wait up to 20 minutes for the bus we wanted. The day that Epcot opened early we saw the bus for the Magic Kingdom, Hollywood Studios, and two Animal Kingdom buses before the Epcot bus arrived. MAGIC EXPRESS: Having the Express deal with the bags to and from the airport was very convenient. We also were able to get our boarding passes at the hotel (we chose an airline specifically so that we could take advantage of this) This was stress free! At the hotel, the Magic Express bus stop is in front of Bell Services near the main entrance. When we first arrived at the Orlando Airport (at the start of our trip) we found the Disney Express Welcome center to be somewhat difficult to find (there is a lack of signage) having the directions that Disney had mailed to us prior to our trip was helpful in pointing us in the right direction. OTHER ADVANTAGES: Staying on the Disney property allows you to enter certain parks early, or you can stay late at certain parks (the concierge can help you determine which parks will open early/late while you are there). You will need your room key to take advantage. Purchases made throughout the parks can be sent back to your hotel's gift shop (as long as you are not leaving the next day), this is also convenient. PARK TIPS: Magic Kingdom: If you want to try to eat at Cinderella's Table (in the castle), make reservations early! We were there in November and their next table was in January! Monster Inc's comedy show is impressive. Animal Kingdom: A bug's Life, the Safari, and Expedition Everest are all very cool! Epcot: The World Showcase is awesome; the restaurants with table service have above average food for the park! Disney's Hollywood Studios: Tower of Terror, Aerosmith's Rockin' Rollercoaster, and Toy Story are great! Skip Drew Carey, it was boring and a waste of time (too bad since Drew can be very funny), it did not live up to the Disney brand. Small children were also scared in the darkness (much of the "show" was in darkness). HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Some Problems, But Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: garpts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ from November 16-21st, there were 3 of us traveling, myself, DW and the 13 year old boy. We requested a standard room with 2 beds. Overall, our trip was not as fun as it could have been, but that's for another board. At first we were put in Building 1, room 1235, which had a sort of river view. Our luggage took 3 hours to get to our room, so I would recommend not letting Magical Express get it at the airport to deliver later. Upon arrival, we noticed that the room as not particularly clean. There was mold in the bathroom along with long hair from a previous occupant in the tub and, uck, on towels. The sheets had holes in them. While I thought maybe this was the old time New Orleans experience, DW was not impressed. There are no 2 queen rooms, so we were in a double bed, and we like our space at night so this was also a drawback. That night the ceiling fan rattled like it was going to come out of the ceiling, and our upstairs neighbor flushed their very loud (all are loud) toilet what seemed every 15 minutes, keeping DW awake. So, in the morning I requested that we be moved to a 3rd floor room somewhere else that didn't have the problems we noticed. The front desk staff readily accommodated the request, but more or less said we had to move our own stuff unless we wanted to wait until Bell Services could get around to it. We packed our things and moved over to building 3, room 3347 which was closer to the main building, but our room now had a view of a parking lot. However, it was clean and other than a neighbor prone to coughing fits was quiet for the rest of the trip. The room was identical to the other one. The air system worked fine, we had good water pressure and it appeared that they have done something to lessen the swampy smell and taste of their water from our last trip. The TV only has a few non-Disney stations, but does have front inputs if you bring a portable DVD. We were usually exhausted by the end of the day so it didn't matter much other than checking the weather. Check out was really easy, as we did the express option. Magical Express required our bags by 11 am for our 3pm flight, so we had to get packed early to use the resort airline check-in. Also ME leaves 3 hours before your flight so we had 2 hours to kill after we passed security so if we have a later flight next time we may send the bags but take a cab. We didn't have to stand in line at the airport except for security, which was convenient. Resort Amenities Pool - looked nice, we had record cold so didn't use it. Food Court - Small, but food was decent. Soda still tastes funny, I think it's the water - all Coke products throughout the property (including the parks). We got the mugs, but didn't use them enough to justify the cost - convenient though. If not on the meal plan, prices are just a hair above reasonable. Lunch for 3 would run around $45.00 or less. Gift Shop - Disney is a shopping mall with rides, so we only used the gift shop for necessities, which it had what we needed. Lounge - Intimate, but expensive. $8.75 for a hurricane, $6.50 for a draft Abita. Entertainment from Wednesday - Saturday. Water Taxi - This was a nice touch, we had several excursions to Downtown Disney so we used the boat a couple of times - a pleasant 15 minute trip, unless it's 40 degrees... Bus Service - there is only one bus stop at POFQ compared to four at POR. Depending on where you're going, you may have to sit through the other resort stops. We were really lucky, and never waited long for a bus, and most we took didn't go through POR, but when they did it adds 10 minutes to your trip at least. Staff Friendliness - mixed. I believe we have had better overall service previously, but still above non-Disney hotels. So, overall it was an okay resort, but we probably wouldn't stay there again. I have stayed at all the Moderates now, and have to say that Coronado Springs was probably the best experience I have had - but it's a huge resort and that presents it's own issues. Feel free to e-mail any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: xnokturnx
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the POP, Carribean Beach and Coronado Springs prior, I must say that the small size of the French Quarter made it the most enjoyable out of the bunch. Even for the great price, I did not enjoy the POP (way too big, and made me feel a bit too economical). The private hot tub is a real nice touch to the pool scene!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: pam0205
Reviews.Content: Have been to Florida twice previous but never stayed in a Disney hotel.Decided Port Orleans was better for us than Pop Cetury as my children are older.The rooms were lovely basic but very clean and well situated about 3 minutes walk from our rooms to the dining area and gift shop.The pool area was well maintained a decent size with a laundry (very handy). I found the transportation to the parks pretty regular with an added bonus of the boat to Downtown Disney. All the staff were really nice which is what helps a lot towards an enjoyable holiday.Were glad we stayed at the French Quarter as it was a lot smaller(more compact than Riverside).If we ever return to Wdw would definately consider staying at POFQ as although its classed as a moderate hotel in my opinion its slightly higher.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!!! I can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beebake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got back from our honeymoon at Walt Disney World. When planning our trip, we knew we wanted to stay in a moderate resort but we weren't sure which one. After speaking with a Disney associate, we decided on the Port Orleans French Quarter. We wanted to stay in a hotel that was quiet and romantic for our honeymoon and we couldn't have picked a better hotel!!! I absolutely fell in love with the French Quarter the minute we walked in. The atmosphere there is very laid back and it is just beautiful!!! We got our room keys and went up to our room which was surprisingly close the the main entrance so we were very happy. The room was adorable. It was very cozy and clean. It also had a small refrigerator which was very nice to have. There were two sinks so we each had our own which was nice. It was just a really nice room for the price. After the first day, we made our way down to the food court area and the we were very impressed. You could get pretty much whatever you wanted and the food was very good. The staff was very friendly throughout the hotel and everyone was very accomodating. The front desk gave us Just Married pins and every castmember that we saw congratulated us. It was such a magical experience!!!! The pool was amazing with a huge dragon slide draping over the whole pool. We didn't go in during the day because we were in the parks but we went over a couple nights and it wasn't crowded at all. Very relaxing!!! And just behind the pool area the riverboats that go over to Downtown Disney and Riverside. It was so nice to be able to take a nice boat ride over to Downtown Disney instead of one of the buses. We had an amazing honeymoon that we will remember for the rest of our lives!!!! Walt Disney World is one of the most amazing places you could ever visit and I would definitely recommend staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter on your next trip!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Travelhelper
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but a great value. Book directly with Disney using your AAA card will save you about 15%. Lots of parking - very close to the rooms. Pretty quiet. Casual dining in the food court was clean and convenient. Very nice pool - great for the kids. Take a ride on the pontoon boat to Dowtown Disney - takes about 15 minutes and it's free. I recommend the Rainforest Cafe at Downtown Disney. If you are driving yourself, signage to this Hotel is not good. Follow signs to Downtown Disney and eventually you will see a sign for this property. We've also stayed at Polynesian, Contemporary, Pop Century and Coronado Springs. For the money, you can't beat Port Orleans - French Quarter. Polynesian was our favorite, but very expensive. Pop Century is the cheapest, but loud and not nearly as nice. Highly recommend the Disney Resorts - get free parking at all Disney parks, and extra magic hours. R Hargett Rock Hill, SC

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Again”
Reviews.Author: NancyNS_Canada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the French Quarter 4 years in a row. Loved it. Everybody we met was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this resort to older, but still like the romance. It was nice just to stroll around in the evenings and hear the Mardi Gras music. The moss hanging on the trees, seemed like it was there on purpose. Dave the Bartender is great. Love our Frozen Cocktails. We are going again in April, but staying at Coronado Springs, just to be differant, I know we will go visit the French Quater just to ride on the river boat and relax. Love the cheeseburgers at the restaurant. at the resort. The conveniance of it being so close [just a boat ride away] to downtown Disney is wonderful. We would go for lunch and get back in time for a swim before heading to a park.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as I expected but ok”
Reviews.Author: birdlegsred
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say the resort grounds were beautiful. Its pretty small so everything was within walking distance. I never went down to the food court but my husband said it was crowded and small. The rooms were somewhat of a disapointment. Our refridgerator (which I was glad to have!) had the outer door ripped off (they are enclosed in a wooden type thing) and was propped up beside it. The housekeeping was wonderful...our rooms were cleaned by the time we got back for our afternoon break. In our sons room several of the light bulbs were burnt out. I know these are minor problems, but since this is a moderate resort I just expected better. I will stay here again due to the fact that the resort is small.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay !”
Reviews.Author: imas98
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter and we really liked it. The hotel location was great for all the parks. Check-in was quick. The rooms were spacious & clean....had two sinks which I love ! The grounds were nice and very quiet at night. The food at the food court was pretty good too. They had those cute waffles shaped like mickey mouse ! We didn't use the pool but it looked really fun for kids. The shuttles were frequent and taxi service was fast to pick us up when needed ! The river boat to & from Downtown Disney is a nice, relaxing ride. I just wish the hotel had a table-service restaurant and an in-room movie rental option. Also, the toilets make a LOT of noise when flushing. But over-all it was a nice place to stay, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jadecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in Jan. 2008. Our one big regret was that we couldn't stay longer. We've stayed at the All Star Sports Resort and the Caribean Beach Resort a couple of times each and liked them but this was definately our favorite. Smaller in size, easier to get around. Clean rooms, nice to have a bar on the property, lovely grounds and a great pool. The boat to Downtown Disney was relaxing and a nice alternative to the buses. We requested river view and couldn't have been happier with our room. You could have easily thrown a rock in the river from our front door. Check in was pleasant and quick. Disney isn't cheap but if you want to be totally immersed in Disney Magic stay on one of their properties and if you can swing a moderate resort we highly recommend the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Average but overall Disney experience wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KiwistoUSA
Reviews.Content: Looking through the reviews for this hotel in the last couple of months, some good balanced comments and I won't repeat too much. To get best out of our time in Orlando, we stayed the first week at Four Points Studio City by Sheraton and the second week, in this hotel - Port Orleans French Quarter. What's good about POFQ includes: * on Disney property, so able to access the great transportation options - ferry to Downtown Disney, bus to parks etc * efficient check in, even when there is a big queue * good swimming pool, with very helpful & vigilant lifeguards * if you eat a light and healthy breakfast, then the food court provides good options * one of the few Disney places where there are small queues (because resort isn't that big) What you need to be aware of (as we were from reading others reviews before we booked): * the rooms are tired (carpet, bathroom etc) and not much sun light gets in * the in room safe is about 2 inches thick so really only passports and money; not for camera's, laptops etc It was a great experience staying on Disney property (previous visits have stayed on I-Drive) and POFQ whilst not being the best pick of the options available (others were booked out) we left as satisfied guests. The only quibble we had was the inconsistency of service - at Disney theme parks ALL the staff were friendly, provided answers etc - at POFQ it was a mixed bag - some very helpful - some were ignorant - some were ?

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsFHoboken
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in as many years at POFQ. We first stayed there in March 2006. Both trips booked via our AAA travel agent. Enjoyed a large corner room with a king bed - was a little bit far from the main building and transportation to the parks, but we had a water view and it was very quiet. Front desk staff was wonderfully polite, room was spotless. A great place to stay if you're going to Disney on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: BORIVILI
Reviews.Content: We staying in Disney's Port Orleans for Eight days. The room was very dusty. My son got sick with running nose the very moment we entered the room. However, the hotel food was Excellent. They have great chefs! I enjoyed the food and hotel surroundings but not the room. It was terrible to stay inside the room due to lot of dust and broken fixtures. The refrigerator door was not closing. The cabinets were broken. The room was not vaccumed well. For the Dollors we spend, Deluxe hotel is an option not moderate hotels - especially french quarter never again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Boojum323
Reviews.Content: My family vacationed at Walt Disney World from October 4 -8, 2008. This stay at Port Orleans French Quarter was our fourth stay at this resort. Check-in was a breeze! We arrived so early that our room wasn't ready yet, but we were given our keys/tickets and a phone number to call after 3:00 p.m., at which time we'd be given our room number. We simply left our luggage in the car, headed for the Magic Kingdom, and came back late that evening after being assigned our room. We stayed in Building 5, room 5108. This is a prime location, as it is literally a 30-second stroll from the pool, the hot tub, the food court, the store, the laundry facilities, and guest services. That being said, French Quarter is one of Disney's smaller resorts--no room is very far from the facilities. This is one of the main reasons we choose this particular resort. The room was big enough to accomodate a family of four comfortably. We had two queen beds, a compact refrigerator, a table, a dresser, and additional shelving/hangers in the bathroom area. The bathroom area has a privacy curtain you can use which separates it from the rest of the room. This was a great advantage in a hotel room with two teenaged girls! The decor in the rooms is cute, if a little kitschy. The bedspreads are designed with Mardi Gras masks, balloons, streamers, beads, etc. There are even "hidden Mickeys" on them, if you look closely. The food court, called "Sassagoula Floatworks," is very nice, with an extensive choice of foods. One can get anything from hot dogs and pizza to barbeque ribs and pot roast. There is a good selection of dessert items, too, and we highly recommend the beignets! The Castmembers at the food court were always cheerful and helpful, and the eating area was always neat and clean. There is no "sit-down" restaurant at Port Orleans French Quarter. The pool is enormous! There is a huge water slide for the kids, a waterfall, a bridge,and plenty of room to spread out! The deepest part of the pool is a little over four feet. There lots of lounge chairs, beach towels are available at poolside, and the bar is nearby for more mature tourists. There is also a kiddie-pool and a hot tub. The store is part gift shop, part convenience store. One can buy anything from tee-shirts and snow globes to a bottle of Pepto-Bismol. We found the Castmembers there to be as helpful and friendly as those in the food court. The ambiance of this resort is also a huge selling point for us. It is landscaped to closely resemble the French Quarter in New Orleans: cobblestone streets/walkways, black wrought iron fences, fountains, lush flower beds, and pastel paint on the buildings. Dixieland jazz music is always playing in the food court, the pool area, and guest services. The resort is situated on the "Sassagoula River," and there are boat rides available to Downtown Disney. It's a pleasant, 20-minute ride--the gentlemen driving the boats were entertaining and genuinely nice! Bus service to and from the parks was excellent! Port Orleans French Quarter is small enough that it has only one bus stop. It sometimes shares buses with Port Orleans Riverside, but this wasn't the case during our trip. I think the longest we waited on a bus was about 15 minutes when leaving the Magic Kingdom. Check-out at this resort (and any Disney resort) can be easily done if you are paying by credit card. Guest services simply hangs a copy of the bill on your door early on the morning you're due to check out. You don't have to go through the hassle of returning to guest services; it's all done ahead of time. I had only two VERY minor complaints about this resort: when we checked in, there was some sort of sticky white goo on the table, the refrigerator, and the bedside table. I think someone had spilled milk. Anyway, I cleaned it up myself and left a note for the "mousekeeper" the next morning. She wrote another kind note, and left four candy bars by way of apology. We had no other "mousekeeping" issues while there. My other complaint was our building itself: the outside paint looked a little worn-out. The paint was chipped off our door in spots, and you could see this was true of other buildings, too. They could have used a little sprucing-up. However, neither of these SMALL problems detracted from our vacation one bit. Yes, this is a long review, but it's due to my enthusiasm for Port Orleans French Quarter! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Tranquil right inside Disney”
Reviews.Author: michiganbeachflower
Reviews.Content: Right inside Disney. Located near Epcot Center. Quiet and Tranquil setting. Busses and water taxi's to Downtown Disney and the Parks included. Park your car and go. Food was reasonable and good. Not great but good. Lounge had a marvelous entertainer for all ages (even young children loved him). Hotel room was quiet , clean and spacious. Stayed across the river from the main lodge. Was like being in New Orleans. Plenty of activities and pools to choose from. Very moderately priced. Didn't think I could afford to stay in the Park but this was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Percy2009
Reviews.Content: My family spent 8 days at the French Quarter (wife & I, 11 yr old son, 13 yr old daughter, and my 75+ parents); we had adjoining rooms in Building 2 (on the third floor) overlooking the pool. The rooms were recently remodeled--two beds with a comfortable sitting area. French Quarter is a great place to stay--everything at WDW is EASY to get to. It just takes a little planning. Downtown Disney--take the BOAT! And make sure that you don't miss the last one at night. Everything else (Disney Studios, EPCOT, Magic Kingdom, AK) is a short bus ride away. The trick for the FQ is to plan your meals. The Floatworks (on property) is fast food. Great for breakfast and heavy snacks. I suggest that you make a lunch reservation at the park you want to visit, and then make a dinner reservation at one of the hotels. That way you can take the bus from the PARK to the HOTEL (very fast) and then take the BUS to whichever park has late hours. Take advantage of late hours (or not) and catch the bus back to FQ. My family LOVED the French Quarter and cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “okay rooms, nice landscaping.”
Reviews.Author: travelTO1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what it is. a 3 star hotel. the landscaping around the hotel is beautiful while the rooms are average. the rooms are clean, the bathrooms - a bit tired. for the price compared to other hotels at wdw is decent (over 2 bills a night). you're at wdw and don't spend the majority of the time in your room so its good if you're just there to sleep and shower. you get all the perks of staying at wdw (magic hours) without having to pay a lot. plus, the boat to downtown disney is a fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: supertsar59
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a moderate resort which was cheap and convineant, so we called up the Walt Disney World resort staff while we were in the middle of booking, they said that it was a wonderful resort with nice rooms, but most of that was false!. First, we checked in at about 1.00 am to go to our rooms and the staff at the check in were nice, and happy, there was only one person in the check in at the time and he had to handle everything while other members of staff were in a club. The second day my daughter woke me up at about 4.30 am because she was so exited, we went out while my partner and my daughters friend were sleeping and let me say, they had a great theme too the Port Orleans even the music was the same theme!. We went to get some coffee from the shop but unfortunatly, it was closed. At 4.30 am they were supposed to open but they wernt. The pool was great but a bit sandy and dirty but was big with a slide for younger children, it was a great swimming pool but unreliable lifeguards who are hardly there most of time so we had to look after the kids. The room service on the other hand was terrible!, we had a coffe machine but it broke so i started to fix it and i did, but we didn't get any toilet rolls of coffe cup after we asked for them nearly our holiday they did'nt pay attention at all. And the food court was messy and unclean.The food was horrible there too. But what shocked me the most was that a woman started shouting at my daughter in spanish, just because she asked for ice cream. If I was you i would stay there but have a word with them if they do any funny business with you and get some proper food from the parks or resuraunts over in riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central hotel with a great disney feel!”
Reviews.Author: nathaliejane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Port Orleans, French Quarter for two weeks. It was a lovely hotel, very clean with spacious rooms and friendly and helpful staff. My only gripe was the lack of restaurant, which was a real pain after a day out at the parks when you just want a shower and to eat in the hotel. The food court there is fairly basic and the food a bit naff but ok. There is a restaurant along at the Riverside which was really nice (although a limited menu for a non meat eater but I am used to that!) Staff at the Riverside are very nice too and service was great. In addition Downtown Disney is a boat ride away BUT be aware the restaurants are really busy and we struggled to get in to them (1 hour wait etc) so eating was a bit of a problem some nights, especially if you want a romantic meal for two and don’t have kids with you! Rooms were clean but a bit shabby if honest. However it was good enough for "moderate" accommodation. I can't understand why movies are not offered on the TV as a pay per view as Disney is missing a trick in getting money here as I think it would be a nice extra to have had. The TV channel is updated with park times etc which was useful. The plus point about this hotel is the river and the boats. If you can get a river view room and use the boats to get to Downtown Disney as that was such a lovely relaxing way to travel. We had a great holiday and I would recommend staying here but for the resturant issue. If you have kids and want quick and easy,the food court will do you fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...just a few little things!”
Reviews.Author: jajd123
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 21 night stay at Port Orleans French Quarter and have a few comments/suggestions. We arrived on the 7th September and checked-in to the resort at around 6.30pm. Check-in was quiet and we were quickly and efficiently given our 'Key to the World' cards. We were allocated room 6321 in building 6 on the 3rd floor (top floor). Initial impressions were very good, there was a beautiful grass courtyard directly outside the room, with a view of the water to the left. The room was comfortable and clean, the beds were very comfortable although the bathroom was a little small. The room had double sinks and a privacy curtain which was very useful and made the bathroom area much larger. The room had a small refrigerator which we filled with bottled water from Walmart, a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, in-room safe and a great air-conditioning system. The resort itself was absolutely beauiful and very peaceful. The swimming pool was great with plenty of pool towels to use. The pool never got overly busy which was really nice for a Disney hotel, (we stayed at Pop Century last year and never used the pool as it was so busy all the time). The walk over to the Riverside section of the resort is lovely, and you are allowed to use all the facilities of Riverside also. The food court was good and kept clean and tidy during the course of the day. The food was not spectacular but edible!!!. The boat service to Downtown Disney was also very nice although quite often the boats were very busy as they would load passengers from Riverside first, the head down to French Quarter. My only issues with the resort were: 1. Housekeeping: We left a $4 tip everyday but the housekeeping service was very hit and miss. Some days we were never left any coffee, other days the beds were made very poorly indeed. We resorted to leaving housekeeping a note every morning with instructions like: 'Please could you leave us with cups for the coffee maker' and 'Please do not place used bath towels back on the rail when they have been placed in the bath'. I felt for the amount we were paying for the room per night, the standard was very low. 2. Bus service. The bus service was generally very good, my only issue was with the service back to the hotel from Downtown Disney. We went to DD one afternoon and getting back to the resort took 45 minutes!. The bus stopped at Pleasure Island, Typhoon Lagoon, all 4 stops at Riverside before ending the journey at French Quarter. The service is exactly the same in the evening (missing out Typhoon Lagoon which is closed in the evening ). My recommendation is to always get the boat back to POFQ from DD, the boats run until 11pm and is much quicker. Overall a very nice stay and we would definitely return!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Luvdisney42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter on our first visit to Disneyworld and had a very nice experience. We booked our stay through the Disneyworld.com website with the vacation package we selected and had no problems checking in. The desk clerk was very friendly and informative and processed us in quickly. The room size was adequate and clean and the maid service was very good. We stayed for four nights and never had any problems with loud guests or disturbances. It was very serene to walk the grounds and along the riverside and everything was kept up very well. The few disappointments we had was the comparison of the photos shown while taking the virtual tour on the Disneyworld web site and what we saw in person while there. The pool looks much bigger in the photo on the website and we thought the view from our room was going to be a bit more spectacular. Also the Disneyworld website for the hotel makes it sound like there is a sit down restaurant at the French Quarter but you have to go to the Riverside part of the resort to find one. But over all we had a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “A dirty motel in beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: BeeJay19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ for one week for my birthday- we had previously stayed at the Wilderness Lodge at Disney for our honeymoon, so we may have been a bit biased having to downgrade... When we got there, we were EXTREMELY impressed by the beautiful grounds- the buildings were beautiful, and the landscaping was fabulous. The atmosphere was very nice. It's a beautiful property to walk around, especially at night!! However, when we got to our room, we were disappointed. First of all- someone else's luggage was in our room, and the poor bellhop was trying to sort it out. The rooms are motel-style, and every review I've read about dirty rooms at this resort was spot-on!! The bathtub did not drain (had to stand in dirty water), the grout in the sink area was disgusting/bathroom floor was dirty, and housekeeping was horrible at replenishing soap/coffee/you-name-it! We didn't have soap, shampoo, coffee or coffee cups at all on the first day. They only change the sheets EVERY 4 DAYS unless you specifically request otherwise...I thought that was surprising. The pool was very beautiful, and we loved Scat Cats (the lounge). We saw a fantastic jazz musician there one night, and hung out with a great couple from Scotland all night. That was the highlight of our trip! Food court was nothing special at all, and the masks hanging from the ceiling were very creepy/tacky....we walked down to Riverside to their food court- which had more options, and a very pleasant atmosphere. Overall- I won't go back. To me, it's worth the extra money to have the hotel-style of Wilderness Lodge, as well as the cleanliness and restaurant options. Wilderness Lodge is HIGHLY recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice visit”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, we decided to visit Disneyworld for a few days. We called and were able to get a season passholder rate. The cost with tax was $111 a night. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The furniture is showing a little wear. Toiletries are very basic. The grounds are lovely. Our rooms were facing the parking lot. However, there was a park between our door and the parking lot, so we didn't see the parking lot. It was lovely and relaxing. My five year old grand daughters greatly enjoyed the pool and the slide. Because this is one of the smallest Disney resorts, there is an intimate feel about it. It is easy to get around the resort. The bus service to the parks was inconsistent. Sometimes, we would be picked up at the one bus stop at Port Orleans and go directly to the particular park, stopping at Blizzard Beach. Other times, the bus would pick up the guests at the French Quarter bus stop, then drive all the way through the much larger Riverside resort. This added significant time to our bus ride. When it happened returning from the park, we could not get seats and had to wait for almost the whole circle around Riverside before people got off so that we could get seats. However, the positives of this resort outweighed this negative aspect. I am sure that we stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: sparkler2
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely holiday, and found the staff very friendly. The room was great we were in building 4. The housekeeping was great who made little towel animals most days and the room was spacious and clean. We had the Disney Dining plan which we found fantastic. Would recommend the Californian Grill and Raglan Road. I was ill when I was out in Florida and the Hotel could not be more helpfull. They helphed sort out all the paper work and odered all the medication that I needed. The pool was fantastic and the boat to downtown was very good, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous French Q!”
Reviews.Author: turtlespoon
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable and always cleaned at the end of the day. The kids room always had fun towel characters thanks to Mousekeeping. All staff we encountered were kind, friendly, and very helpful. Two reasons that this review isn't getting 5 circle thingys: - Sadly, the entrance fountain was out of order until the day we left. - The smell of the Sassagoula river (a.k.a. the Swampagoula) was not very pleasant. But only when you were outside. All in all, it was an excellent place to stay while visiting Disney. I would definitely recommend the resort and most likely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, room a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: mrsfrog1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on Disney property as a special treat. The room was okay, the furnishings were a bit tired and tatty and cleanliness could have been better. Booked a room with waterview and although I asked on check-in the room was not a waterview. Okay for a short stay but would not return. In room pizza delivery was good and the trip to Downtown by water taxi was lovely. Although we did not use the pool, it looked very nice, plenty of chairs and quiet spots.

Reviews.Title: “Mousekeepers need some Disney Magic!”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkHallCat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before, and had no problems, so it was disappointing this year to find that things were not up to Disney's usual standard. We stayed in building 1, Rooms 1245 and 1246 (interconnecting). Our first morning, on leaving the room, we left a friendly note for the "Mousekeeper" and a $2 tip, as past expericen has shown that to do this means you get a good service. We have two kids, one of 10 and one of 7, and they love coming back to the rooms to see what has been done in terms of arranging their toys, towels in animal shapes etc. On arriving back, however, the tip was gone, but nothing special had been done. We then had to find a missing shoe, so looked under the bed "curtains", and found old Cheerios and Popcorn, and loads of dust! In the bathroom area, the floor was also grotty, and a piece of strawberry from the previous nights fruit which missed the bin was still there! Yuk! Also, the coffee machine had not been cleaned or the coffee replenished. I mentioned this to a concierge, who promised to look into it, and the next day, the room smelt of bleach when we returned...but the Cheerios and popcorn were still there! So we left another note specifically asking for this to be removed (which it was the next day). The rest of our stay (we stayed for 19nights) was a bit hit and miss with the cleaning, but we gave up nagging. The final straw came when we were packing to go home and found that my daughter's pink "milly" cat which she has had for 7 years was missing-it was always kept on her bed...we believe it got caught up with the bedding on a bedding change day. My daughter was distraught, but we had a plane to catch! On our return, I called the hotel who put me thru to "Lost & Found"...I left a voicemail (they never answer the phone), pleading for some help, but got no repsonse. I also contacted our Virgin rep out there, who also had to leave a message, but nothing. This whole experience will certainly make us think twice about taking things that are precious to a Disney Hotel. And I hope they get rid of young male housekeepers who speak no English and who plainly couldn't care less (or are just incompetant ).about cleaning rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Aklavik867
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the French Quarter at the end of August and had a fantastic time. Our room was very clean and I loved the decor. The beds were so comfortable I couldn't get my son and husband up in the morning. One thing about this hotel that worked out good for us was the dressing area where the sinks are. We had our one year old with us and we put his pack'n'play in there and pulled the curtain over. He wasn't able to see us and was more likely to fall asleep. It was like he had his own little room. So I would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with children sleeping in a play pen. My older son (9 years) loved the arcade and the pool. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. The food court was small but had lots to choose from. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. For a moderate resort you couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the water slide!”
Reviews.Author: Auburnmb
Reviews.Content: My Mom, friend, cousin and I stayed for 9 nights at the POFQ from 8/30-9/8/08. We arrived by Magical Express. No glitches there. We had a minimal wait to do a pre-check-in around 9am. We were told to call a number on a card to verify our rooms were ready after 3pm. We had connecting rooms in Building 5 on the bottom floor. We were very happy to have the bottom floor by the end of the trip! We loved the pool area and the slide! I loved watching all the adults on the slide with us! We never had any trouble getting a chair. Great place to go mid-day to relax. We had a great time at the parks. The buses ran pretty smoothly. We usually had to wait the longest at Magic Kingdom..but the longest wait we ever had was 20 min after fireworks. We even had a bus to ourselves one night and the bus driver gave us trivia and fun facts on our way home! That was neat! We also decided to partake in the Bippity Boppity Boutique one night before the "Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween Party". Be sure if you go to this to dress up! Makes it more fun! :) We liked that the food court was open late every night. The food was ok enough. Nothing spectacular. We did eat at Riverside's sit-down dining room one night. Very delicious. The best meal we had though was at Cinderella's Royal Table. Hands down the best dessert we had in WDW. We did make use of the riverboat 2x. Once from DTD to our hotel and the 2nd time from Riverside to the FQ. The one thing that really grated on us for the resort was the awful wait times for the front desk. We experienced on several ocassions where we had to wait over 20 min or so to be helped. We were the 2nd or next in line even. We did have great maid service. The gal servicing our rooms was very pleasant and accommodating. She left us several towel animals which she told us we were welcome to take any/all of them home with us! The AC in the room worked beyond super well...and the ceiling fan kept us super chilly! We loved how comfy the beds were! We also loved having two sinks and the curtain to make a little dressing area. We used a grocery delivery company to deliver water and other things the day we arrived so that we could eat bagels/bananas in our rooms in the morning along w/ taking cold water with us every morning. We also noticed that due to Fall Advantage starting in the parks there were new cast members all over the place that couldn't help us with our questions etc. We didn't even get any that would go the extra mile and tell us where to go for help for someone else. We also noticed there were a lot of rude and impolite service employees and cast members in FL compared to what we were used to in CA-Disneyland. We took two tours while we were there as well. If you get the chance be sure to try both the Segway Around the World at Epcot and the Keys to the Magic Kingdom at MK. Both fun and interesting. If there are any birthdays or 1st timers in your group be sure to get a button. We had 2 birthdays in our group and both of the girls got an extra dessert and even a Fast Pass once just b/c it was their birthday! One random guest even stopped my cousin to give her a Mickey Dollar b/c it was her birthday! We had a great time at the POFQ. The size and location worked out well for all of us. If we decide to go to WDW again we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the French Quarter for seven days in September. We enjoyed ourselves and really liked the resort. Having stayed at many Disney properties before, we tried French Quarter this time and really enjoyed the quaintness and small size of this resort. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the pool was great and the Food Court was useful for refilling your Coffee mug and a quick snack or bite to eat. We highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan as it is a real money saver. Disney transportation was fabulous and we also loved taking the boat over to Downtown Disney. We will definately stay again and we really love the customer service Disney has to offer! Also, September is a great time to go to Disney! No lines and more value! Please note that we used Disney's Magical Express Service and it was fantastic! Our bags were delivered to our hotel room not long after we arrived at the resort and it is fantastic being able to check your luggage in the lobby on your way home.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter is great!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckreis
Reviews.Content: The PO-French Quarter is a nice little moderate resort on the Disney Property. It is the equivalent of a 3 star hotel in my opinion. The room was clean, the AC worked great (and was down right freezing with the ceiling fan on), and the beds were comfortable. The resort itself could use some painting (the doors are marked up) but nothing was bad about the resort. We arrived about 9am and we were able to precheck-in with a 5 minute wait. We were then off to the parks and back when the room was ready about 2pm. I did not eat in the food court but it looked busy and loud (but this is average for a Disney Counter Service place). The buses were good, but the Magic Kingdom bus always seemed to be the one we waited for. Coming back to the resort you usually get lumped in with the much bigger PO-Riverside Resort so waits can be longer after the fireworks. Overall I would rate this as a great place to stay and worth the Disney Price.

Reviews.Title: “smaller resort - perfectt!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sassyshoes
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research before I booked and I chose the Port Orleans French Quarter for it's smaller size - BINGO!! Everything was a short walk - to the pool, the lobby, Disney transportation. The pool was great although we did not spend much time there. We paid extra for a water view on the river in building one and it was awesome. We had a second storey view of the river and the golf course on the other side. Loved the ferry boat to The Riverside Resort (also a short walk up the path) and Down Town Disney. Our room was roomier then I had imaged and I loved the curtain dividing the sinks and the bathroom which made for a great changing area. We paid for a town car rental from Tiffany Town Car Rentals (would recommend) $60. plus tip from airport which included a stop at the grocery store and purchased food for breakfast , beer and wine. With the fridge in the room we saved $$ by eating breakfast every morning before we left. We were also on the Disney Dining Plan which I loved. You have to research and book your dinner reservations before you leave but it is well worth it. Everything went so smoothly and every meal was fabulous. I preferred early dinners (5pm-6pm) because the restaurants get so busy later. After a day at a park we were ready for an early dinner. The French Quarter does not have a sit down restaurant but food is available until 10pm in their cafeteria. The food is OK but we only ate there 1 time as we were in the parks for the day and had reservations elsewhere for dinner. This resort was PERFECT and I met many other travellers who had been to other resorts and are return guests at the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Love it...love the boat”
Reviews.Author: poppyNJ
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying here. We love the boat to Downtown Disney. The rooms, location and pool were Disney perfect. The grounds are beautiful and it is nice to be able to walk to its sister hotel Riverside. We also loved all of the parks. This time around, however we did have some problems. The housekeeping department did the the least it had to do to make the room look neat. We came from Hilton Island and had gotten sand on the bathroom floor when we arrived and the floor was still gritty when we left. We went for the free meal plan and the servers were not sure how to make that work. The bus lines were also slow and some bus drivers were not helpful. This was the first time we have ever had such problems when going to disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: texas07
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this resort! It was very clean and I loved the Louisiana style decorations! Everyone we encountered was very nice, the staff seemed to really enjoy being there! We had stayed at Coronado last August and the food court at POFQ is probably 5 times better! I loved how fresh it was! Definitely try to get the beingets (sp?) in the morning! Great breakfast treat! 6 for under $4... so you get to use it as a snack! You can choose from pizza, pasta, chicken parmigiana, chicken nuggets, sandwiches, hot dogs, corn dogs, salads, cheesteaks and much more! Something for everyone! Buy the souvenir cup for sure!! We would fill it on the way to the parks in the morning and everytime we came back it was with us to refill again! Really enjoyed that and I loved being able to bring it home! Didn't have time to check out the pool or hot tub but there were tons of kids there! The gift shop was full of things you might forget too! Sunscreen, tootbrush, bathroom supplies, etc! Had a great time! Hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: GulfSider
Reviews.Content: Pool and slide were perfect size for my 4 and 6 year olds. Rooms were average in size, ammenities and cleanliness. If you are near the parking lot you will hear the buses but quiet other than that. Riverside seemed to have better ammenities overall and the bigger water slide but it's just a short walk away. A few more food options would have been nice. Overall comparable to other Disney mid-priced resorts I've stayed in and just what I expected. I was surprised that a beer can laying near the staircase of building 7 was not picked up the entire four days of our stay, usually Disney keeps grounds extremely clean. Stay away from the food court in the morning, it is beyond packed.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon The best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morgan8808
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon at the French Quarter. It was more than I could ever dream of what it would be. I have stayed at several of the Disney properties and this was by far my pick. We will be going back again next summer for a 10 day stay. The rooms are not suites but they are nice and clean. It is quiet and the bus service was excellent. Never waited more than 5 minutes for a bus. We stayed in building 4 and it was very concenient to the food court and bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Quaint Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bitsy822
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at Port Orleans French Quarter (8/4 to 8/9/08). This was our second stay at this resort, but the first time in the summer months. We chose to stay again due to the small size of the resort and the charming theming. Again, we loved our stay. While the parks were hot and croweded (it was August), it was nice to have a lovely resort to return to each day. We were able to enjoy the pool during this stay, which was very nice. The rooms were an adequate size and kept very neat and clean. We did frequent the food court for breakfast every day and found it to have a nice selection, but particularly enjoyed the biegnets! We had dinner at the food court several times, mostly pizza and sandwiches. While we didn't participate in this, we saw horse-drawn carriages taking guests for leisurely rides around the resort, which looked like a nice way to spend some time. Overall, a nice resort and we will be returning there again on future Disney trips.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: girllovesdisney
Reviews.Content: My husband (we're in our early 20s) and I spent a week at the French Quarter, and we had a great time! It was my first time staying at a Disney resort, but just about my 100th time at Disney World. When we arrived in Orlando we hopped on a Magical Express bus and went to our hotel. Our bags didn't get to us for around three hours, so that kind of sucked, but other than that no complaints with Magical Express. I thought the grounds of the hotel were very nice and the pool was nice and not very crowded. The food was expensive in the food court, but that is to be expected at Disney. We loved being able to take a nice boat ride to Downtown Disney. One night, we didn't make it onto one of the larger boats back to the hotel from Downtown Disney, so this other guy told us he had room for us on a smaller pontoon that was quieter and had cushy seats. That was a bonus! The buses to the parks were usually on time, and there was always room for us to get on. It is a bonus that the buses stop at French Quarter before stopping at Riverside. We never had to wait more than 10 or so minutes for a bus. The room was clean and it had everything I look for in a hotel room: a bed, a shower, a TV and a fridge. :o) I didn't expect to spend much time in the room anyway. Room service was nice, and they brought up your food pretty fast. The bathroom (with toilet and shower) was kind of dim and felt a bit like a closet, but it fulfilled its purpose for me. :) We had a great time at this hotel and I have no complaints. The staff were friendly and if you had a question they were always willing to help you. I always marvel at the way Disney handles masses of people! I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skye9988
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans-French Quarter in April 2008 for one night. (It was beyond our budget to stay more than a night, but worth it to splurge to get the Disney benefits of riding the shuttle bus right to the gate and extra magic hours.) The hotel was well maintained and clean. Our room was comfortable. I loved the bath area where there was a curtain that offered privacy for anyone using the sink, as well as a door for the bathroom portion. The pool area was great. My son and I stayed in it until it closed. There are several different pools, some have slides. It was a really pretty setting. The staff at the front desk was really friendly. We were treated quite well. The baggage area was wonderful. When we checked in, our room was not yet ready, so they held our bags for us. Then, when we arrived again later that evening, they delivered them right away. The transportation to Disney attractions was great. We took the shuttle from the Disney Hollywood Studios to our hotel, and it was convenient and there was not a long wait. The next morning, we took the shuttle to the Magic Kingdom, and again, we did not encounter a long wait. Later in the day, we had a bit of a wait to get back to our hotel (around dinner time) but not more than about twenty minutes. The restaurant was ok, although a little hectic. It is a cafeteria style restaurant, and it was super busy the morning we were there. If you have a small child with you (at Disney, that's pretty likely) you will have to be pretty good at dealing with the crowd here and managing to get all of your food to the table without any problems. In the future, I think I'd go to another restaurant. The food was not so great, and after going through such an ordeal of waiting in line after line to get it, I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tinkwannabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans-French Quarter for our annual Disney trip. We usually do Christmas at Disney but wanted to experience the "Pirate and Princess Party" so we waited until January. POFQ is an older resort but charming nonetheless...the food court and the theming are very quaint. In true Disney fashion, the theming is thorough and the grounds are exceptional! We often walked over to PO-Riverside along the river and took the ferry to Downtown Disney. The bars onsite are a lot of fun and feature live music so there's always something going on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the POFQ. Very nicely landscaped, beautiful grounds. It takes a lot of work to keep the grounds this immaculate! The rooms are somewhat small, but nicely laid out. Refrigerator but no microwave. The carpeting needs to be vacuumed better. 2 years ago we stayed at the Caribbean Beach Resort and our carpet was not very clean there either. Room cleanliness seems to be a recurring issue at all the Disney resorts, based on various reviews I've read. I wish they put the effort into vacuuming our room that they put into maintaining the grounds! The bathroom area was clean. The pool area is very nice. I really appreciated the lifeguards who are constantly walking around the pool, watching the swimmers; they don't just sit there and stare. The food court is very small, plan accordingly. The food court at Riverside is much, much larger and only a short walk or boat ride away. Nice bars at the pool and inside by the food court with live entertainment Wed-Sat. Be sure to take the boat over to Downtown Disney. We really enjoyed the smaller size of this resort. The only negative thing I have to report is one night about 11:30 p.m. I was sitting near the pool area and saw a rather large rat scurry across the patio area from one bush to another. There weren't many people in the pool and I suspect he came out of the "river" to look for food. Still, not what you want to see when you're on vacation! The buses to the parks work quite well, I think the longest we had to wait was 15 minutes, usually less. If you have a car, it is quicker to drive yourself to Hollywood Studios, Downtown Disney or Typhoon Lagoon. A very comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel For A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDisneyfan
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this excellent hotel. It was our first trip to Disneyworld and we checked in after first staying four days at the Hyatt Regency (another excellent hotel). It was my son and I along with my parents and we stayed in one room and felt that there was plenty of room, mousekeeping staff was excellent as well, I think the rooms must have been recently renovated because everything looked new and it was very clean. From the time we checked in to check-out and everyone in between everyone was very friendly. What I liked most about this hotel was the grounds, they were beautifully landscaped with cobblestone streets and wrought iron railings that really added to the mardi gras theme of the hotel. It is located right along the river also giving you excellent access to downtown disney on a ten minute boat ride. We used the pool everyday, my son loved the sea serpent water slide, the pool closes at midnight but they let us swim until at least 1 am every night while they cleaned up, as long as we were quiet. The spa was in a nice spot also allowing me to enjoy a good drink from the outside bar. Mid vacation we took a break from the parks and just relaxed around the hotel enjoying the arcade, renting tandem bikes and shopping in the gift shop. I read a lot of reviews and found some negative things about the food court and found none of them to be true, I didn't think the food was that expensive (you would pay just as much eating out off property) and everything I ate was quite good, the portions are large so it was very easy to share, its also open late allowing for a good snack on the way back from the parks. Every night there was a jazz singer in the lounge of the lobby who was quite talented. I really like the overall feel of the hotel, its the smallest disneyworld hotel so it stays quiet and peaceful, a nice retreat after a busy day at the parks. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it provided an excellent stay at a very good price allowing you to stay on site and enjoy the perks of staying at a disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: mosween
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the French Quarter. The hotel was excellent. Upon arrival at 9:30 we were immediately checked in. Our bags arrived within 30 minutes from magical Express. The room was small but clean. I am very picky and I will tell you the carpet was clean, the beds were clean and comfortable, the bathroom was clean as well. The hotel was small and quiet. We were in building seven, and that was not a far walk to the main building compared to other Disney resorts we have stayed in. Waiting for the bus was never an issue. Everytime we walked up to the bus stop the bus we wanted was pulling up. The only bus that was shared with Riverside was Hollywood studios. All the other buses took us straight to and from the parks. The transportation system has improved a lot since our last visit in 1999. THe only transportation issue we had was with downtown disney. Use the boat to save yourself a wait and some stress. We would go to the parks early whichever one opened at 8, stay till about 2, come back to the hotel swim and shower and return to the parks around 5-6ish and stay til 11 or 12. We have two teens and this worked very nicely. (We had to blast them out of bed, but after they got on all the rides without much wait they were happy we woke them). Use the extra hours, it makes a difference in your day. We used the dining plan which was excellent and saved us money. I kept track of how much each meal/snack cost and added it up. We saved over 150.00 using the meal plan. All staff were friendly and helpful. We won the fast pass for the day when we went to Hollywood studios, so that was very nice. It included fast passes to all of the major shows/rides. We did not have to run around and get fast passes and wait until we could get another one. Overall the trip was great we would stay here again. It was not on the monorail, but the bus service was excellent, we had no waiting time at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: georgiagrl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at all the moderate Disney Hotels, and French Quarter and Carribbean are pretty much tied for our favorites. French Quarter is a much more manageable size than many of the moderates & value hotels. Lovely grounds and view of river. You can take the riverboat to Downtown Disney or Port Orleans Riverside--very nice benefit. The rooms are very colorful. I like the bathroom/sink area better at Carribean, as there is a ledge on which you can rest items like make up, etc, and at French quarter, it is two stand alone sinks with a very narrow ledge above. But otherwise, it was a wonderful hotel & we would definately recommend & stay there again. We also requested & received a river view room which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Disney world/ Port of Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: blondie2
Reviews.Content: The Best Vacation ever. My family flew out to Orlando in mid June. It was our first time to fly and use the Magical Express. What a wonderful experience with no worries. We arrived in the Orlando airport and we saw the Magical Express sign. They then escorted us to our resort the Port of Orleans French Quarter. Upon arriving at the front desk, it took 2 minutes to check in and we were on our way to our room. The rooms were small but clean. We packed swim suits in our carry on bags so the kids could enjoy the pool while waiting for our luggage. It took about 1 1/2 hours before our luggage arrived. We thought that was great timing. We worried about nothing. We had to wait at the longest 15 minutes for transportation. If we drove, it would have taken us over an hour because we would have been lost a couple of times. The meal plan was fabulous. I made reservation 6 months ahead on the restaurants we wanted to dine. I searched the Disney web site for suggestion and menu. I made a planner to keep up with times for dining and extra hours at each parks. I can't begin to say how worry free we were and that we enjoyed this 9 day vacation to the fullest. The morning before our departure there was a letter on our door indication the time we have to be ready for our magical express transport to the airport. Needless to say, when it was time to go home we were sad. In the morning, we brought our luggage to the desk. They gave us our boarding passes and we were ready to take the magical express home. The bus driver that took us to the airport made our trip enjoyable. He made us laugh the whole way. What can I say? Disney, you guys are magical. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel ,,,fab time”
Reviews.Author: caz2114
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May this year for two weeks, last visit was 10 yrs before but to the riverside, formerly known as dixie landings. The hotel itself was lovely, well kept and staff very nice, the transport options are fantasitic to all parks in disney, we arived after a long flight and got checked in straight away, we had two rooms and a door between them which was fab, we were in building 3 which was a short walk to the pool and restraunt and 2 minutes from the boat dock to downtown disney. The pool is amazing and loved by the little one , hours of fun going round and round the slide, the only downside at times was after a long day walking round and round the parks you want to relax and swim and getting a seat around the pool can be very hard, it fills up very quick, the good use of hotel towels supplied at the pool side ment that sometimes people left these on the beds and you never knew if they were taken or not, and if you left your towels whilst you went for a dip and left no bags or shoes etc there you may come back to no bed as the life guards remove them, but overall a lovely place and good security for kids as there is a constant life guard till about 10 pm. I would say that sometimes we did get to the car and head round to one of the quiter pools in the riverside in alligator bayou. the hotel food is the only downside i would say of this hotel, there is sometimes a language barrier between you and them and it can be difficult to order , however the service never gos without the ususal disney smile ... the choice on the otherhand is limited and we often took the 10 min stroll up to the riverside or the boat if it was in to eat there, larger selection, cleaner , more seats to sit down in, Not saying the the french quarter is dirty , just some people do not clean up after themselves and it took the waiters a while to clear some tables,, if you are going for breakfast be early as it gets very crowded in there, the only thing i would recommend is the REFILL CUPS, we paid about £13 dollars and well worth it for unlimited refills on tea, coffee softdrinks all day in the french and riverside. downside can be that you have to walk a long way to get your cup if you are in the further away buildings and if you go to riverside for tea then straight out to a park on the night you have to carry them with you or do as we did and pay for drinks. overall i loved the place and found it clean, the cleaners are lovely and changed our towels and sheets every day, and arranged our soft toys every day on the bed , the rooms were standard and nothing flash but its the name and secuirty and conveniance you pay for most of the time, overall i loved this hotel and would go back , but more than likely to the riverside, it is bigger quieter and much more to eat there,

Reviews.Title: “I hope my dirty room was an anomaly.”
Reviews.Author: Jersian
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the French Quarter section of the Port Orleans Resort at Disney in July. This was my first time staying at a Disney on-site hotel and my expectations were high. We got to the hotel much earlier than the check in time and with some light prodding at check in, the very cordial Desk Clerk got us into a ready room immediately. The walk to the room was very nice as the grounds are well maintained and the pool area is beautiful. Once we got to the room, I was a disappointed in its condition. There were obvious dirt marks on the furniture and the carpet was dingy. I knew we had gotten in early and clean rooms were hard to get into at that time of the morning so, with my kids anxious to get to EPCOT, we headed out without complaint. I had hoped the Housekeeper would remedy the issues with the next cleaning. Day two and after 14 hours at the Magic Kingdom we returned to find the room in the same condition with the exception of the beds being made and the linens refreshed. Usually I would file a complaint, but at midnight, I knew it was useless so I waited until morning. The next morning I registered my complaint with the Front Desk Supervisor who told me my room would be perfect for the rest of my stay. She quickly offered an adjustment on my bill, which I was not looking for, but graciously accepted. After a third day of enjoying the park #3, we returned to the room to find it had not gotten the deep cleaning I requested. I promptly called and asked to speak to the Housekeeping Manager and asked him to come up to the room so he could see what condition the Housekeeper was leaving the room in on a daily basis. He was in the middle of another situation at the Riverside and promised he would be to my room as quickly as possible. He was there promptly and agreed that there was no way the room met the standards of the hotel and he comped my night on the spot as a result. He offered to have someone clean my room, but since it was after 9pm and we had already been there for two nights, it would have been pointless, since we were checking out at the end of the third night. In addition to the comped night, he did arrange for a late check-out for us. Aside from the hotel room, the remainder of the hotel is wonderful. We took advantage of the Disney food plan and ate breakfast at the local restaurant every morning. The meals were tasty and filling. The service was excellent and the atmosphere festive, with a Mardi Gras theme. The grounds are wonderfully maintained and very shady with lots of trees to shade the area. The pool is large, clean and was enjoyed by all. The resort is not on the monorail system though so getting to and from the parks requires a wait for a shuttle bus to take guests back and forth. If they ran a little more frequently, that would be a bonus, but other than that, it was fine. The resort also has a direct link to Downtown Disney via a water taxi. The 15 minute ride is relaxing and enjoyable, with Downtown Disney offering many options for dining and shopping. Aside from the room debacle, I would say we enjoyed our stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. I would stay there again on the hopes that the dirty room was an anomaly and we would not have a repeat issue. The service was wonderful, the staff attentive and the grounds a pleasant retreat after a long day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VAVIP56
Reviews.Content: We had connecting rooms for two families on the ground floor overlooking the fountain court in building 2. FQ is a small resort which means not much walking to your room after a long day at the parks. That was a blessing since we were tired and had two small children and some of the resorts are very large. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The kids loved the pool but we only used it one evening. We were not at the hotel very much in the 5 days there. The food court was small but had a good selection. One evening we had a quick dinner there and the kids joined the Mardi Gras band parade around the food court for us to enjoy. We took the resort boat over to downtown disney one evening which was nice but we decided to take the bus transport back after eating and shopping. We didn't have very long waits for buses to the other parks. Sometimes we would stop to pick up Riverside resort and sometimes we were just on our way immediately. We had a stroller with us and it was never a problem to take it on the bus. I would stay here again in the future. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Peace away from the bustle”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBristol
Reviews.Content: As a family of 7 adults and 4 children with an age range from 5 years to 87 years our stay at Port Orleans French Quarter catered for us all. After the busy time spent in the parks it was so peaceful to return to this resort for a lazy spell around the pool. Although the British travel agent mixed up our booking this was sorted out by the reception staff quickly and efficiently. If I had to find a downside it would be the lack of choice in the dining hall as having stayed a fortnight we needed to go off site to eat on a regular basis to avoid the same food every day

Reviews.Title: “Loved the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Erin2131
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Disney vacation and stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. Our stay was excellent and the hotel staff was extremely friendly and pleasant. The hotel is situated right on the river that flows into the Downtown Disney area which we were able to explore from the Sea Racers we had rented. The food court is very clean and offers a quick bite to eat if you are on your way back into parks for the evening. The hotel gift shop stocks much of the same gifts that the parks sell and the workers inside are extremely helpful. The pool looked great, however it being the summer there were tons of little children all around and was not very welcoming for two adults. The shuttle service is slow, so be prepared to wait up to an hour to reach each of the parks. Also be mindful that if you have breakfast reservations early in the morning the bus service might not be running and you may need to have the bell services hail a taxi. All in all our stay was great! The front desk even printed out our boarding passes for our return flight home and held all our luggage and carry-ons the day of our departure so that we could enjoy the park in the morning before our flight.
