Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Port Orleans – French Quarter fills the need”
Reviews.Author: DSCmePleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: Lets face it, at the end of the day all you want is a shower and a bed. The Port Orleans – French Quarter fills that need just fine. Family of 4 stayed here for one week. Room was clean, and house keeping kept it that way. We had a corner room but could here no noise from any of the neighbors so the soundproofing of these rooms is better than average. Like all Disney properties, the grounds are immaculate, the cast friendly the food, so so. The pools scene was good and never too crowded during our stay. Laundry facilities onsite (though expensive $2.00 per load) came in very handy for us. The downside, which could be an upside, is that there isn’t as much to do at French Qtr as there is at Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: DundeeScotty
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect Disney resort if you are looking for the quieter side of Disney. It is the smaller of the two Port Orleans resorts but beautiful. Well kept grounds, fabulous themed pool, well stocked eating area, great parking and comfortable rooms. We stayed in room 3226 for two weeks, very close to the pool and the reception area, shop, eating area, etc. The room was large with two double beds, table and two chairs, two sinks, clothes hanging area, ironing board and iron, tv, coffee maker, fridge, safe, drawers, air conditioning. There were two sinks and a separate bathroom with shower and wc. I requested a roll-away bed and this was delivered within 10 minutes of checking in and was very comfortable. There is a laundry room beside the pool. There is a pool bar and there are drinks & ice machines on each level of the accommodation (only three levels high). You can hire bikes to cycle around the resort and there are also horse-drawn carriages available for hire. The food area offered an excellent choice, from cooked meals to burgers and pizza. Would recommend buying the Disney cup $12.95 but then you refill this with hot or cold beverages throughout your stay (usually $1.99 a time) - very worthwhile if you are staying for a week or more and a great souvenir. The pizza delivery to your room is excellent - fast friendly service and the pizza is amazing! The transportation to the parks was very good (buses every 20 minutes though so time it) and the buses stopped at French Quarter first before going on to the larger resort at Riverside. There was a great little boat service to Downtown Disney (took about 20 minutes) and this was delightful and very relaxing. The boats ran from early morning until 11.30pm. This resort is close to EPCOT. The resort has the New Orleans jazz/blues theme and the onsite bar 'Scatcats' was a welcome sight after a long day in the parks. The bar was immaculate and offered a good selection of drinks including a cocktail menu (which I worked my way through during the two weeks - recommend Captain's Mai Tai, Pina Colava, Raspberry Mojito and Sunken Treasure, mmmmmmm!). Nice ambience and entertainment provided most nights of the week which was a bonus. My son had arranged this accommodation for us and it did not disappoint - excellent service, excellent accommodation, good food and excellent environment/surrounding. First Class for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “moderate in mickey world”
Reviews.Author: truetraveler8
Reviews.Content: This trip to Disney was the second for myself and the first for my husband and 2 small kids. Twenty years ago, i stayed at the Carribean Beach resort, which at the time I loved, and still have fond memories of. This trip i booked Port Orleans due to some bad reviews about the poor aging of the CBR. Because I love the shore, CBR was a better fit for me, since they have a beach on site. However, I have few disappointments with Port Orleans. The Mardi Gras scenery definitely lives up to its name. The rooms were average for a hotel of its kind, nothing special, nothing bad. The pool was nice (not quite as spectacular as some lead you to believe), but for all the people who stay at the resort, it wasn't too crowded. The river boat to downtown disney was nice....on one trip, my girls were given special co-captain badges for good behavior. My only complaint was the chaotic food court. Meal times were EXTREMELY busy, with no assemblance of order behind the counter. The food was good, especially the beignets( a must for any fried dough lover). The best part was the small walking distance between everything. We were in building 7, the furthest one, and still did not have far to get to anything. Buses were good because French Quarter is the first pick up location on most trips. One day, our family took a stroll to riverside, the sister resort. It was definitely busier and more crowded. However, there was much more activities to enjoy. The buildings were much more spread out, but seemed very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate Resort at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: agscott
Reviews.Content: This is the best Disney Moderate Resort. This was my second trip back to this resort. It is clean, comfortable and easily accessible to everything. You need to take a bus to wherever you go if you are staying at a Moderate but this by far is the shortest of all rides. Plus in the evening when you want a break from the parks, you have the added benefit of the boat ride to Downtown Disney. It is is fast and kid's love it! The waterslide is by far the best. Since the resort is so small the pool is never crowded and there are always plenty of chairs. One last great benefit is that you never have to worry about facing a parking lot . Even the cheapest room still looks out to a garden and this is something you'd have to pay extra for at another resort. You cannot go wrong with whatever building you are given.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Polehols08
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults & 2 boys aged 6 & 11) stayed at the French Quarter from 25th May until 8th June 2008 and none of us wanted to leave. We were greeted well upon arrival and check-in took only a matter of minutes by very friendly staff. They were always happy to help with any queries you had. Our room was in Building 4, on the top storey, and was immaculate. It was cleaned thoroughly every day and fresh toiletries and flannel animals left daily too. The pool area was great and there is a seperate hot tub area. Towels were supplied free of charge and the lifeguards were very attentive. There was a great laundrette near the pool so for a few dollars you could do your laundry whilst swimming or relaxing by the pool. I even brought my cases back full of clean clothes! A real bonus to any Mum. The shop sold plenty of Disney items but also all essentials - medications, sun cream, basic foods, etc. Again the staff in there were really friendly and helpful. The food hall was good too. The menu was not enormous but enough choice for snacks and to have the odd meal there. The kids loved the Mickey waffles for breakfast. We purchased the Disney thermal cups on our first day - $12.95 each and you can refill them for your whole stay for free. Really worth it - you will save a fortune. We didn't use the bus service as we had a hire car but they seemed to be very regular from what we saw. We did travel by boat in the evenings to Downtown Disney and this was a great way to travel and relax - free too! To sum up - we loved the French Quarter and had no complaints whatsoever - not even tiny ones. From Mousekeeping to Lobby staff they were all very friendly and helpful. The grounds were beautiful and the whole place was relaxing - just what you need when you've been 'Disneying' all day. We will definitely stay there again - just need to save up! Enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kate12NYC
Reviews.Content: We stay at Port Orleans pretty much every time we go to Disney World. I love it. Both properties are clean, quiet, friendly and convenient. We love to jog around the Sassagoula River and we find the bus service very convenient. We recently stayed at Caribbean Beach due to a package deal and while it was fine, my heart still belongs to Port Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: SNHN95
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The grounds are also very beautiful. However, there is a lot of walking involved. My daugher, who turned 5 while we were there, loved the pool. In our opinion the pool here was nicer than at the Riverside. As for the rest of the resort....the floor in our room in the bathroom and in front of the sinks was dirty. My youngest who is still crawling always had to have her feet and knees wiped off because they were always black which either was from the tile at the sinks/bathroom or the carpet was just that dirty! The tub also was dirty. When my 5 year old got in to take a bath on the first night she said Mom, we need to call the people that clean the tubs because look at the black on the bottom of the tub. (Out of the mouths of babes! However she was right so we cleaned it up.) Probably one of the most disappointments was the Food Court. The food at breakfast was okay but the rest of the day it was terrible. We even tried several different food options. Also, don't go here if you are in a hurry. This has got to have the SLOWEST staff I have ever seen! Even when there was a long line (which there was most of the time) they did not move any faster...NOTHING got them moving. They would literally make one order at a time...even in the morning when several people ordered pancakes they would only put enough pancakes for one order on at a time! This was so frustrating especially when you have kids who are hungry and ready to eat!!! Another couple we were with ate at the food court at Riverside and they said it was much better so this is an option. We did also eat at the Boatwrights for breakfast two mornings, they have awesome sweet potato pancakes and we loved the other things we got to. So, if you can do the walk up to Riverside (about 15 minutes) then it is worth it for better food. Ahhh...the buses...yet another problem for us. One morning we went out to the bus pickup to go to Downtown Disney...we waited 25 minutes and no bus ever came. We gave up at this point and went back to the room. Also, some of the buses also stop at Riverside which has 4 stops so it takes some time. At all of the parks except Magic Kingdom (Riverside and French Qtr have separate bus pick ups at MK) the lines to get the bus was long for this resort. Again another frustrating thing about this resort especially when you have young children who are tired, impatient, hungry, etc. We will never return to this resort again. My suggestion would be if you can afford it to go to the Beach Club. We stayed there in June 2007 and absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip at the French Quarter!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbeq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from 5/25-6/2. We are a family of 4 with 2 kids, girls, ages 7 and 11. This was our first time to WDW so I was a bit nervous about picking the right hotel and familiarizing myself with all that Disney had to offer. I had read ALL the reviews I could find on this particular hotel so I knew what to expect-both good and bad(only from reading prior reviews). I had read the hotel was dingey.....NOT TRUE!!! This hotel is quite lovely with the beautiful plants and decor outside to the 1800's themed rooms inside. Magical Express bus dropped us off at the hotel and the front desk explained everything in detail...even with others waiting behind us. Our room was in Building 5 and was perfect!!!! It was the best building to have since it was across from the pool and a very short walk to the food court, general store and busses. I was pleased to have the room on the backside of Bldg. 5 so as not to hear pool goers late at night. The room was very quiet. The only noise I did hear was maybe tourists coming home late from the parks out on the balcony(short time only) and the flush of the power jet toilets on occasion. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows fluffy and supportive. I had read there was little storage area in the room si I was prepared with my toiletries. When I arrived, I did find there is a nice mantle over the two sink area so there was PLENTY of room to sit your make-up, sprays and other items. The dresser was an ample size that held my family of four's clothing. We kept alot in our suitcases and pulled things out tha we were planning on wearing. As everyone knows, a person packs way to much that they don't wear! The room flooring from the carpet to the tiled vanity and bath areas were very clean. there were NO strange odorsin the room and I am quite sensitive to odors. We had plenty of soap and towels each and every day.The hotel staff would arrange my daugher's stuffed animals in different positions and when we returned from the parks, the girls would laugh. We didn't get any orgami animal towel cratures as others have mentioned, but I don't think my children minded. Also, the beds were very comfortable. I have an achey back and these beds were quite comfortable. The food court was beter than expected. We opted to pay as we go insteadof the Food Plan. I didn't want to be bound with reservations at a particular restaurant since one never knows how they will feel that day or if they are in the mood for a big meal etc. I am so glad we did it this way. We frequently ate at the hotel since as it gets hot in the parks afternooon, we'd return for a lunch at the hotel. An entree with 2 sides cost us approx. $8.50 with tax. This was a very good sized meal. Using the dining plan for this I would think would rip off one's dollars. The dining plan costs about $124.00 for a family of 4. We did not ever spend that on food even with ice-cream and buying pop and water in the parks. I did not want to feel trapped at having to take a bus far from where we were only to get to that preplanned reservation....too much stress for me. I DO NOT rcommend the Ding Plan. The hotel has a smaller scale General Store where you can find everything you might need. There was beer, disny items and tanning items and a whole lot more. I bought a "necklace" style holder for the park cards which ws very convenient. I put the family's cards in the plastic sealed case conected to the necklace and could easily whip the cards out at the parks for entrance admission and getting Fast Passes. The pool was fantastic. My kids, ages 7 and 11, loved the pool and slide. The dragon slide was a special bonus. I partcularly booked a moderate resort due to the fact the value resors do not offer a slide. I figured since the kids love swimming and we would be doing that in our off-time, it was worthe the extra $400.00 price difference from value to moderate resort pricing. The life guards were attentive,too. We did visit the Port Orleans Riverside for a day to swim at their pool and the kids thought this pool wasn't as bright and fun...they thought it was "boring." It did look older and in need of an update. While there, I noticed how widely spaced the buildings were at Riverside and was SO happy we weren't there considering the obvious long walks they had to get to everything at that resort. I thanked myself again, that I had booked at the French Quarter with everything close and the property so much smaller. We took the river taxi to downtown disney from the French Quarter and loved the beautiful and picturesque ride, especially at night. The taxi gives an added change to riding busses all day. I loved this amenity from our hotel. The buses came every 10 minutes while we were there for pick-ups, much better timing than I had read or expected. We did get first seatingon busses before Riverside pick-ups and first to get off at night...another bonus insteadof having to stop at all those stops at the Riverside. This hotel is smaller than the other hotels at Disney property and the most relaxing. Who wants to walk to everything at your hotel when your feet are about to fall off after the parks? Oh yes, the hot tub was wonderful to soak in for my tired feet! The staff were always cheerful and helpful. I did not see any rudeness. We did check out the "upper" echelon hotels by visiting the Polynesion, Contemporary, Boardwalk and flamingo. While the grounds are more lush and attractive, the inside offers a bigger space with more shops and walking. If one needs this, that is fine. We were happy with our litte store, pretty grounds, and smaller scale property all at a price of $1500.00 less! Don't worry, book this hotel. Ignore the negative comments on previous blogs. I don't know where and what these people expect, but this was very good for me! I am the type that enjoys the finer things and yet do not want to pay for them so this was definitely plenty for me. Have a great trip!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: tania27
Reviews.Content: We didnt like this place from the moment we drove into the grounds of this hotel. The front of hotel was a facade, looked quite good, but it masked a durty little secret. Seeing that my wife has walking difficulties, the clerk on the desk couldnt have given us a further room away from the heart of the hotel, we were closer to the tower of terror than the food court in the hotel. We went to the room, now there's a story, the supposedly well maintained, manicured Disney lawns and plants, flower beds etc. were just growing wild, i thought we had entered the wilderness instead of a Disney resort hotel. We eventually got to the room. Hmm, dusty durty windows, the bottom of the door was all black and scuffed like its been kicked a few times, cobwebs all around the front of the room. Upon opening the door we were greeting with this..well smell?!? cant really discribe it much, but another reviewer came close, 'a floor mopped with durty water smell'. The decor looked really tired. It was like an old lady's bedroom from the 1920's, dark and moody..and well, a little creepy. We left, didnt even consider staying here, straight back to reception, asked for a hotel change to Coronado Springs, which we had stayed before at. It was like pulling teeth trying to get changed, something about. 'well we can only give you a room over there for 1 night, after that you will have to find another hotel'. OK lets get out of here asap. Coronado Springs, aaahh what a difference, quailty staff, clean, well maintained grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ODU2K1
Reviews.Content: This is far and away my favorite Disney World resort to stay in. The rooms were fine. I would have rather had a door to the sink area but it was not a big deal. The size of the resort is great. Since it is on the small side you can get around very quickly. The street layout makes things even easier to get from point A to point B. We were there for a week and didn't want to leave when it was time. The location or the resort on Disney property is great as well. You are very close to Downtown Disney, the Magic Kingdom, Epcot, and Disney-MGM Studios. Animal Kingdom is probably 15 mintues away. I can't wait to return to to Port Orleans French Quarter in November of 2008!

Reviews.Title: “maid stole my earrings”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy_Bear_Chemo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and am planning a return journey; it was a very relaxing hotel resort. The gardens around the buildings were beautiful and the added plus of the wildlife was wonderful. I saw many anole lizards around the pool, flashing their red throats at me as I sunbathed. I had a jack rabbit run over my feet, on the way to see our room when we first arrived, there are many rabbits running between the small gardens. I also saw many frogs (golden coloured), this was all an added bonus for me as i love animal and was studying animal science at the time. Although i never went on the horse-driven carts, i was allowed to pet the horses (but you must always ask before). I found the pool could get very busy in the afternoons, so I had taken up swimming in the early morning, as the sun was rising; I was always the first person in the pool. I never went on the slide in the pool due to it being a children's slide and was very small, also it isn't open until the lifeguards turn up at the pool around 10am. Transport to the parks was excellent, my mother had a wheelchair for the holiday due to medical conditions and the driver was always friendly and talkative (typical for Disney), this also gave us an added bonus of getting on the buses first and always getting a seat (brilliant). There were no buses to other hotels though, which was often a problem if we had a restaurant reservation to get to, so if we were running late we had to get a taxi. The neighbouring resort, Riverside, used the same buses and our stop was before their stops and gave us chances to get seats before them and on the return journey we were let off first, which meant we didn't have to go around the numerous Riverside stops. There was a boat service to Downtown Disney and Riverside, which was a great change from the air conditioned buses. The only problem was that it would stop running when it rained (when it rains, IT RAINS HARD!), if you were in Riverside this meant you either had to walk back or wait for the mini bus service to come pick you up (one time we had to wait well over an hour, not impressed!). The maids were very friendly and would leave us aa new towel animal everyday (i kept them all), the room was always spotless. I learnt from previous experiences in hotel, that if you leave a couple dollars a day for them, then they will bend over backwards for you! I must stress that you leave ANY and ALL valuables in the safe in room, I left my white gold earrings on the chest of draws next to the television, when we went off to typhoon lagoon, when I returned, I found my earrings missing from the box. I called the lobby straight away and the manager of security came up 5 minutes later. The manager said that I would be refunded the £100 that the earrings cost (i only bought them a day before going to Florida), I bought new earrings when I returned home. I know what exact maid had taken them and told the manager her name, I was asked if I wanted the police to be involved, I turned this down because I'd been given money for the earrings and I just wanted to relax and have fun on holiday. I was extremely pleased with the service that was offered me, as they didn’t have to give me anything as I had no evidence that I had these earrings. The food court was brilliant, with such a range of food all day long, my family had the dining plan (very worth getting), so we always used our snack points to get our breakfast (cereal packs, milk, doughnuts, one of these would be a single snack point), as we didn’t want a large meal for breakfast, but we got breakfast there on the last day and it was so lovely, with Mickey shaped pancakes or waffles, with any type of syrup on the planet, or sausage, egg, bacon and biscuits (my favourite). On our first evening we were very tired from travelling so we ate there, I had a rib platter, it was the best ribs I’d ever had in my life, the meat just fell off (yum), this came with mash and gravy (also lovely). During lunch time they had sub sandwiches, burgers/chicken and fries (average Disney food), pizzas or spaghetti Bolognese with garlic bread, also a desert counter, with ice-cream, cakes and these pastries in balls covered in icing sugar (very nice). There was also a range of fruit/vegetable packs. I recommend this hotel for those who wish to have a quieter experience in Disney, whether you are an older person or young child this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, substandard”
Reviews.Author: 1UEAce
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in the room quality at Disney Port Orleans French Quarter. This was basically a below average, $50 motel room that was overpriced at $199 per night. Room was very small, carpet was well worn, bedspreads were dirty. As I said, this room was not worth more than $50 per night. The only positive note, was the grounds and pool were very nice, and also a nice dining area with a wide selection of food, albeit overpriced. Bottom line: I would NOT recommend or stay in a Disney resort again. Off property resorts have MUCH nicer rooms at a lower rate. (We stayed at Marriott Grande Vista last year and loved it! Full kitchen, jacuzzi, washer, dryer, private screened patio/balcony for $179)

Reviews.Title: “Loved French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNe
Reviews.Content: Arrived at about 10:30 A.M., desk people were very helpful. Checked us in, gave us our "magic" cards and explained that Dining Plan & park tickets were activated; gave us a card with phone number to call after 3:00 P.M. to get our room numbers (we had 2 rooms booked, one for husband & myself, one for daughter & her friend.) We headed off to lunch & park. Called around 3:00, got room numbers & headed back to unload. Very pleasantly surprised with both rooms. We had requested a king bed but had been told that was a "maybe" and no preferred locations because we were getting AAA rate...they gave us a 3rd floor room corner room with a king size bed, not to far from the elevato & on the river...beautiful view out both windows. Kids room, which was supposed to be a standard view, was also on the 3rd floor, but instead of looking at a parking lot, they had a nice view of an interior garden with a fountain. Both rooms were clean & in very good repair...had to have been renovated within last year or two. Beds were comfy, housekeeping was excellent all week. Outside, grounds were well maintained. Lobby, food court & shop were all well maintained & well staffed. We ate several times at the food court...good food, fast service and lovely views from inside tables & out. Pool is wonderful themed area. Parking was convenient to our building (#1) as was the river walk, but it was a 5 min. hike to the lobby, the boat launch for Downtown disney, and pool. It was probably closer to 10 min walk to the bus. Bus service was good except for one time we just missed a Magic Kingdom bus...the next one didn't come for 30 min, immediately followed by another Magic Kingdom bus (so I think one of them was late as every other time busses were just 15-20 min. apart, not 30.) Other than that, we had an excellent time at this resort...good decor, good cleaning, good service.

Reviews.Title: “A Magic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Orangebluebird16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time for 14 nights in May and really enjoyed it. The grounds are beautiful, as are the buildings. The short walk to Riverside is very enjoyable and the boatride to Downtown Disney is a really nice treat! We only ate breakfast in the foodcourt which was OK - the beignets were lovely! There wasn't a very big choice for lunch / dinner, but it seemed adequate enough. We were in block 3 which was extremely close to the foodcout, shops, pool etc - definitely a location I would request again. The hotel location was excellent- no more than a 5 minute drive to any Disney park. The pool was good though it is worth the walk to Riverside to use theirs, as it was slighty bigger ad better (and the water was warmer!). The only slight let down was mousekeeping - a bit hit and miss with remembering to leave shampoo and cups, and in 14 nights we didn't receive even one towel animal which was a bit of a letdown. All in all the best Disney hotel we have stayed at and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: mickaarbor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans 5/19 through 5/23 and just loved the place. When we arrived fresh off the Magical Express bus, our room was ready. I have no complaints about housekeeping at all. We were fortunate enough to have received the towel origami animals each day of our stay. I was surprised at how good the food was at the resort. The decor throughout the place was spectacular and the staff was so friendly and helpful. I was impressed with how the New Orleans mardi gras theme was carried throughout the resort, including the pool. Kids will love it. Waiting for the bus to go to the parks did not seem like it took that long. Only once did we have to make several stops on the way back at other resorts (Riverside has like 3 stops). I would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, except for food court”
Reviews.Author: BooKat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week from the end of April through early May. The hotel and grounds are lovely and well-kept. We were in the far side of bldg 4 and it was close to the bus stop, food court and pool. The whole complex is small and everything is within comfortable walking distance. Our room seemed newly refurbished; the carpet, curtains, bedding and furnishings were in excellent condition. Bathroom with toilet and shower was small, but having the two sinks outside was great. The curtain separating the sink/bathroom/dressing area from the sleeping area is ideal. Cable is just OK, mostly Disney-related channels and network TV. Housekeeping was really good; we tipped a couple dollars every day and the room was spotless with plenty of clean towels and even towel animals for a few days. Pool is big and fun with an outdoor bar that closes way too early! I would have loved to try the hot tub but it was filled with kids even at a late hour. Our son loved the small game room. The worst thing about this hotel is the food court. It is convenient for breakfast, but the cooked food is very institutional and just not good. We ate yogurt and large containers of fresh fruit for breakfast, although my son liked the kid-sized mickey waffles. I was so excited to try the beignets and they were terrible. Tough, greasy and chewy fried dough covered in sugar. We ate all other meals in the parks or at the better Disney hotels. Bus transportation was surprisingly good. We never picked up or dropped off at Riverside and went straight to and from each park. Always plenty of seats and never waited more than 5 or 6 minutes for a bus. Boat transportation to Downtown Disney was fun and relaxing in the evening. All in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney's best moderates”
Reviews.Author: PetefromRI
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the POFQ on the 23rd of May and we're really happy with this resort.We have been to quite a few Disney resorts and this is one of our new favorites.The service was good and the size of the resort being alot smaller than other Disney resorts made this trip very relaxing.We always liked the bigger resorts but as we're getting older we enjoy the shorter walks to get about.I've read some negative things as of late about the cleanliness of the rooms so we were alittle concerned about going here but luckily it was all for nothing.We found our rooms to be as nice as any Disney resort and for people who think that the rooms need updating,the theme is late 1800's New Orleans,it's supposed to look old but believe me the bedding to the drapes were beautiful and they looked relatively new.The food court was very good,it's a food court,not a steak house,so excpect what you would from a food court.The pool area was really well done and the hot tub was away from the pool so there didn't seem to be tons of kids jumping in it.The grounds are beautiful and the boat ride to Down Town Disney was an added perk.The bus service was excellent going to and comming from the theme parks.We will be back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: stanlow31
Reviews.Content: We travelled out to Florida from Manchester on the 1st of May on XL airways flight 1132, our flight was delayed 6 hours in Manchester and our plane was replaced with an Iberworld a330. Fortunately this was the worst thing that happened, the plane was a bit old and the 3 television along our part of the cabin were hard to see. Eventually we arrived at Orlando airport about 11.30pm and on to our hotel by 1am. Check in was quiet and efficient and we were in our room and asleep swiftly. French Quarter is a lovely hotel well designed and the pool and river at the back are just great. Having stayed at all star music last year, we were a little disapointed with the food court at French Quarter, apart from breakfast we ate away from the hotel. The hotel was nice and clean at all times, although not as clean as all star music. If you stay at this hotel, either drive or get a taxi to Old Town and have dinner at the Ponderosa where you get great food at great prices. For my partner and I with 2 kids all having steak dinners and using the eat as much as you can buffet, the price came to £27.00 including drinks....incredible and I hear the breakfast is even better!!. Hope you find this useful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was quiet and well maintained. We have stayed at the other moderate price resorts and this one was one of our favorites. The pool was wonderful. The food court had a great variety of food at reasonable prices. I would recommend staying in buildings five or two b/c they are close to the pool and main lobby but not too close that you here all the traffic. Definitely worth the money. We used the laundry facilities and they were immaculate and again well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Disney visitor: a mixed review for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ShaninOhio
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 8th. visit to Walt Disney World. We stayed for 6 nights at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter. We chose to stay at this resort because we had already stayed at all of the other moderate resorts at least once, and had also stayed at Pop Century and All Star Sports. We wanted to try something new. The best way to summarize our stay is to say that I have to give it a mixed review. I'll begin with the positive aspects of our stay: The grounds of the resort are beautiful and scenic. The pool was very nice, and the lifeguards were very professional and attentive. My daughter (age 4) loved the water slide. My 8 year old son loved the pool, but thought that the slide was "for babies". The atmosphere of the resort is very peaceful. It never felt crowded. It was a nice break after a busy day at the parks to return to the resort. We were lucky to have a room in building 4, which is close to both the bus stop and the food court. Our room was very well sound proofed. We never heard a sound from our neighbors. On the negitive side, our hotel room was very much in need of updating. The bathroom, especially looked very worn. There was mildew around the soap holder. The air circulation in the bathroom was so poor that none of our bathing suits or towels would dry in there, even with the exhaust fan on. During past stays at WDW reosrt, we often returned to our room to find our children's stuffed animals peering out the window at us, and our towels made into animals. Housekeeping during this visit did the minimal amount of cleaning, but nothing more. I know that this sounds like knit picking, but our children really got a kickout of these things. The dresser in our room was looking very worn, and whenever we closed one drawer, another would pop open, all the way. This was annoying because the room was not that large, and we were always stepping around an open drawer. The food court and gift shop were smaller than those at the other moderat resorts where we have stayed. The staff was not overly friendly, especially the staff at the food court. We had purchased the dining plan for the first time this year, and at fist we were a bit confused as to which foods were on the plan. The staff appeared to be annoyed when we asked multiple questions. Summary: Port Orleans French Quarter has both good and bad characteristics. I probably would not stay there again, because in my opinion, both Port Orleans Riverside and Caribbean Beach (also WDW moderate resorts) both have a more fun and upbeat atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Moderate”
Reviews.Author: Jovigirl87
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Port Orleans -French Quater was really nice. It was our first real family vacation. Our party consisted of myself, my husband and our two children ages 8 and 12. We were there 04/16-04/23 for our childrens first trip to Walt Disney World. Check in was ok. I thought that the lady that checked us in rushed through everything and we were first timers and needed the extra time to understand things. The rooms were clean and well kept. My kids thought that the towel animals were made special just for them and looked forward to seeing what was left for them at the end of every day. The rooms could use a little updating but overall nice and in keeping with the New Orleans theme. My husband and I are not small people and wished the bed was a little bigger but we sucked it up. The food court was really great and we didn't find it as overpriced as I had thought it would be but to be honest we did have the meal plan. It had something for everyone. I really had a hard time understanding the meal plan (as did others as I found out talking with them while standing in line). I thought most of the staff there was pretty good explaining it. The pool area was always well maintained and beautiful. The lifeguards were very watchful. I couldn't keep my 8 year old off the slide!! And the hot tub was a welcome relief for sore feet. The bus system was ok (it beats driving yourself). It needs some work though. I understand with gas being what it is but we waited after the show at Epcot for 7 buses to come and go before we could start heading back to our hotel. Other than that we waited approx. 20-30 minutes for the bus for any of the parks. If we had it to do over again we would probably request to be closer to the pool/lobby. We were far back in #7. After a long day of walking this was painful. We really had a great time and our children will have the memories for the rest of their lives. I would definately recommend this hotel to families or couples. We hope to return someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet break from the hectic parks!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan32
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the French Quarter Resort from May 6th - 12th. We originally did not have high expectations but were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are small but clean and more than satisfactory. If your coming to Disney to spend most of your time in your hotel room than you picked the wrong destination. If you tip your housekeeping person $2-3 each day your room is cleaned much better and they do fun creative things with the towels etc. We have 2 kids (8 & 6 yrs.old) that loved the pool area. We also liked the fact that we could walk to the Riverside resort and use their pool and restaurants as well. The French Quarter is a nice small resort that is actually very quiet. Its the perfect place after spending a busy day fighting the crowds at the Disney Parks. You actually feel relaxed and truly away from it all. The buses came very regularly and the free boat ride to Downtown Disney was a can't miss. For the mid range price we would definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: jamg001
Reviews.Content: We returned this evening from our 6 day stay at the Disney Port Orleans French Quarter Resort. We have basically no complaints from arrival to departure. The disney express was easy to find once we arrived. Plenty of signs through out the airport pointing you straight towards the pick up area. Rooms were clean once we got there and with a few dollars tip for the maid (1-4 dollars a day) she made our child ( 4 yr. old) smile daily with a towel shaped as an animal to hold his toothbrush or his balloon when we came back for a little downtime from the morning park visit. When we arrived our son had contracted the symptoms of a minor stomach virus. The room maid (Lilia...she was great... bldg. 4) left us extra bed linens just in case of an accident throughout the night. We were the first picked up and in most cases were the first dropped off for our trips to the parks. The only complaint I have is a small one. The breakfast eggs on the breakfast sandwiches were not real. HAHA I know.......but I dont like fake eggs. All other food we ordered in the food court area was cooked to order. It was fresh and hot. I suggest buying the refillable cups for $12 and change if you are staying for awhile. It will save you a little money. They are good at anytime through out your stay inside the resort breakfast to dinner...all beverages except alcoholic. The pool was clean and refreshing. Our son loved he kiddie slide once he was brave enough to do it. The pool side bar was wonderful for the occasional adult beverage. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. For a moderate priced resort I cannot find any reason (from our stay) that anyone would have any complaints unless they are acustomed to vacationing at 5 star resorts, which my wife and I are accustomed to staying at when we are away without our son. You and your family will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans F.Q.”
Reviews.Author: deedeetwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the French Quarter from April26 to May 3rd, 2008. It was a very nice hotel. We liked the location. The staff were friendly. We liked the ferry to Downtown Disney. We didn't have to walk far to get to the hotel food court and pool. My kids are 11 and 13. They liked the pool. We also had the Disney Dining Plan. It is so worth it. We ate at Hoop De Doo, Ackershus(Princess breakfast in Norway), Prime Time Cafe, Sci Fi movie, San Angel Inn (Mexico at Epcot), Japanese Hibatchi in Epcot, Maya Grill. All of the restaurants were awesome. We enjoyed it! In the mornings, we ate at the food court. It came in quite handy. The food wasn't bad either. We had a good family vacation. We stayed at the Caribbean Beach last time. We liked it there too. We liked the French Quarter better, because it is a smaller resort, and we could save our walking for the actual Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Zife
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter is definitely a nice place to stay. Unfortunately, when we stayed there, the pool was closed, which was the main reason we chose this hotel. We had a problem with the door when we first got there, but they sent a maintenance guy over and had it fixed fairly quickly. We walked over to Riverside during our stay, and I have to say that it is by far a nicer looking hotel, with slightly nicer, and more helpful staff. And it's the same cost. If you're thinking of staying at French Quarter just because of the price, take a look at Riverside. Most of the amenities French Quarter lists (including the marina, surrey bike rentals and horse and buggy rides) are actually located at Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: kaylzAmmanford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid April to the end of April for 14 nights and would never come back to this resort again. The choice of food was limited and the quality was even worse and to be quite honest i wouldnt feed some of it to the pigs. The food hall was very cold, uninviting and the staff struggled a smile most days. Our room was clean-needed a dust though and the bathroom was cleaned daily to an acceptable standard. Rooms could have been bigger considering there were 2 double beds and a rollaway bed squashed in the corner. The grounds were kept to a high standard and some nice views if you walk along the river to the Riverside resort There was not much to do at this resort apart from go to the pool, tint play area or the small amusement arcade on site. Apart from that you could only visit the food hall, the gift shop or the landerette. We had 3 children aged 12, 6 & 2 to keep occupied and luckily we were not at this resort all day as they would have been bored. In a nutshell, food was rubbish, childrens facilities were very poor, rooms very small and dreary and the staff were the most miserable ive ever seen. Definitely wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for 25th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: LALAALABAMA
Reviews.Content: My husand and I just spent 8 days and 7 nights at the Port Orleans River Side Resort for our 25th wedding anniversary and loved every minute of it.From the moment we checked in-2miutes-till we were in our corner king river view we requested 5 minutes.The room was perfect, clean, and had a towel family started tjat grew every day. It was fun ! We stayed from 4/18/09-4/25/08 and the room was cleaned each day. The roo featured a king size bed, a mimi frige, two sinks, and two gib windows-it was perfect.We were in walking distance of the food court, pool, and bus stops.The rides to the parks were only 15 minutes each and waiting for the bus was only 20 minutes, so transportation was excellent.The resort is small and tranquil.We would definately return and recommend to others. It will hold special memories for us for a long time !

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, outdated, ants!”
Reviews.Author: daddysgirlNj
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the PO FQ 4/14 - 4/20 and we were disappointed. The room was very small. One way traffic between the beds and the dresser. Beds were so uncomfortable. Sheets were hard and scratchy. They don't even use fitted sheets so they were all over the place by morning. Good thing I had my clorox wipes since there was dust all over everything in the room. Phone, clock, tv, etc. We had a connecting room with my mom and she shared her bathroom with worms and ants. She called the front desk a couple of times and they said they would send an exterminator but we're not sure if they ever really came since we were out of the room all day. The room had a very stale odor and a faint smell of old smoke. The food court was OK except for the pizza but that's bad all throughout Disney. The chicken wraps, and chicken and rib dinner was good though. The pina coladas were delicious too. I will not be staying there again and we go every year.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: 911SC
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here with my wife and 3 daughters at the start of a fortnights holiday. We specifically chose this resort due to it being the smallest of Disney's hotel and in the hope we would have a bit more peace and quiet than its much larger neighbours. It worked! We were allocated a room on the top floor of building three and managed seven sleep-filled nights. Staying on Disney also enabled early access to the parks which, together with fastpass usage meant we were able to acheive everything we wanted ride-wise. The upsides were the well sound-proofed rooms and the facilities on site which included shops, pool, cafe,bar, laundry etc. Buses leave everyday for the parks but we drove as our Virgin package included free parking at the parks. Cleaning was also very thorough. We also enjoyed using the hot tub which was located away from the pool.Staff all very friendly as expected in Disneyland!! There are some downsides to consider but each could be mitigated. The decor wasnt brilliant in the room- somewhat tired and dour but then we only slept there!. The pool itself was a bit tacky in design (but ideal for kids!) and we didnt use the food-mall type restaurant much as we prefered to eat at the better restuarants in the park. We also struggled to find the hotel amidst the complex Disney road system (poorly signposted) and even after 7 days we still got lost most days. Overall a very satisfactory stay and if you just want a modest but comfortable room with all the Disney perks then happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great moderate”
Reviews.Author: mozzchops
Reviews.Content: After reading a few unfavourable reviews I was a bit concerned about this hotel. I shouldn't have been. We arrived at about 10:30pm and checked in and got given our room cards for block 4 which was next to the food hall. The room was fine and clean enough. We thought we'd try the food hall, which was rather disappointing though as all that was for sale by the time we got there was pizza, and it wasn't very good. When we got up the following morning we tried the breakfast which was better than the pizza. The grounds around the hotel are fantastic. It had poured down on the day we arrived and by the following morning there was a gardener changing the flowers, which the rain had knocked off. We stayed two weeks and had no problems with the housekeeping or any of the staff. My daughter loved the pool and the slide. Looking around it seemed most other kids loved the slide too. We checked out the hot tub on a couple of occasions. The laundry was also handy. All in all a great stay at a moderate resort. No its not a 5 star but the price reflects that. But after saying that I do think the food hall could be better. Its adequate for breakfast and snacks but little else. There's also not enough places for all the people wanting to eat there in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Disney Resort Choice”
Reviews.Author: rhk45
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter is a good choice for anyone planning to stay at one of Disney's "moderate" resorts. The staff at the resort was friendly and helpful. Our check in was quick and our room was ready for us before the official check in time. Our room was standard for a Disney resort, but it was clean and in very good condition. Aside from loud plumbing, it was very quiet. The grounds of the resort are beautiful. One big plus for this resort is that it is significantly smaller than the other moderate resorts. Although it feels quite spacious, you are never more than a couple of minutes from the main building, food court, pool, etc. This is a big plus since most Disney guests will spend a lot of time walking at the parks each day, and other moderate resorts force you to walk significant distances from your room to get to hotel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Port Orleans French Quarter - Excellent Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: SmileU2
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at the Port Orleans French Quarter. We were a bit apprehensive after reading some awful reviews but our Easter stay here was brill considering it was their busiest time of the yearl!! Check in. On check in they told us they had a technical problem and that we were booked into the Riverside which considering we had booked almost 12 months ago we told them no way we defo didnt want to stay there. This is the only problem we had during our 2 week stay and it was dealt with quickly and professionally, the cast member dealing with us was very helpful she went out the back and after 10 mins told us that we would be staying in room 2332 in the resort. Rooms. We had one of the best rooms on the resort. It was a corner room overlooking the river and part of the pool area, very convenient for pool / food court and other hotel facilities. Room was adequate for family of 4. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom consists of a bath, shower and toilet then there is a bathroom area to the back of the room that separates the bedroom area with a curtain that pulls all the way across. It consists of 2 sinks, an hairdryer, an iron board and iron and a little safe. Room was a little dusty though but a minor complaint it didnt bother us. Food The food court was great, plenty of choice for all members of the family and great atmosphere. Open till late so when you come in from parks at night they were still open serving food and drinks. Hotel & Grounds. IMO The hotel is probably one of the best Disney properties to stay in for location. It is very convenient to DTD and all the parks are 5-10 mins away. The hotel is very easily close to the Highways and I Drive to get to the premium outlets or Walmart if you fancy escaping from the parks for a bit and doing a bit of shopping. There is also a Golden Coral close by that do big value for money buffets which include carveries and vegetables instead of the fast food. We ate in their a few times and the kids loved it. Healthy food for a change!!! The pool area is one of the best features about the hotel. It is brilliant our kids loved the dragon slide and considering we went at a busy time it was never crowded with people. Towels are provided and they also provide lifejackets for smaller children. It was open quite late and great to come back and relax after the hustle and bustle of the parks.The grounds in the hotel are very well kept and spotless with fountains all around. We had a great stay here and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I would definately recommend this resort to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cat3077
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from the 17th of Feb-3rd March 2008 and it lived up to all my expectations. We were staying in building 4, room 4225, which was literally one of the closest rooms to the food court/reception area. It was a 20 second walk if that to get to breakfast in the morning - great! Unlike other guests we had no problem at all with mousekeeping. Our room was spotless the entire 2 weeks. The room was vaccumed and towels were replaced every day regardless of whether we had used them. Our mousekeeper, Rosa, was a wonderful and friendly woman and seemed extremely grateful for the small tip we left for her each day. In fact we had no problems with customer service anywhere within the Disney World Resort. Some of the staff at the food court could be a little miserable but they were never less than helpful and nothing was too much trouble for anyone The bus service was slightly hit and miss but being a regular user of public transport in the UK I'm quite used to it. The longest we waited for a bus was 30 minutes after just missing one, and there seemed to be much fewer Port Orleans buses to take us back to the resort in the evening than there were for the other resorts, but maybe we were just being paranoid because we were so tired. Also, there wasn't much routine in that sometiomes they would call at the Riverside section on the way to the parks, sometimes not, and in the evening sometimes we'd get dropped off first, other times the Riverside people were. That being said, all the bus drivers were friendly and knowledgable and being at the French Quarter meant we always got a seat on the bus in the morning and also the journeys to any of the parks didn't seem to take as long as I expected. The food at the food court was very nice but very limited. We only really ate breakfast there and dinner on 2 occassions. We ate at the parks all other times. I highly recommend the Mickey Waffles with Strawberries for breakfast - yummy!!! All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to get a nice relaxing quiet night's sleep after being at the parks all day. It's beautiful, quite and friendly. I will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: TinaMarie4
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the French Quarter April 6th through the 12th. We were in building one with a river view. We loved everything about the hotel. Our maid service was excellent and even left a couple of towel animals for my daughters. The room was small but fit a family of four quite nicely. We ate a couple of breakfasts at the food court and found the food good. This is a good choice for a moderate hotel. It's smaller than some of the other moderate hotels and easy to get around. I would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not as magical as past experiences”
Reviews.Author: KristyS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter the first week of April 2008. We'd stayed at Port Orleans Riverside on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it, so when it was booked, we opted for the most similar resort. Overall, the stay was average. The over-the-top customer experience of visits past has dwindled a bit. While there were folks at check-in and when calling the front desk that were willing to go out of their way, our experiences with housekeeping, food service, and the gift shop left a lot to be desired. They tended to be unfriendly and I felt as if I was inconvienencing them with the simplest of questions (for example, "what's the total for my meal?" The grounds were beautiful and well cared for. Bus service was much quicker at this resort than the Riverside, likely due to the smaller size of the park. The restaurant is OK for breakfast and snacks, but we often walked to Riverside or opted to eat in the parks or at other resorts. Our room was passable in terms of cleanliness at best. We left a note for housekeeping that the sheets had holes in them and our comforter left evidence of past guests (I'll leave out the ugly details of that), and nothing was done about it. While you'll find some of these situations in other hotels, Disney tends to pride itself on excellent customer experiences, and based on our stay, I'd say that that quality has diminished significantly in past years.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: h0neym00ner3
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day stay at Disney's French Quarter and loved it! It was very charming and smaller (compared to Riverside) which is a plus. It didn't feel at all crowded. Our room was ready for check-in at 11am, and it was spotless. It stayed that way throughout our entire stay. We had wonderful experiences with every cast member we came across at the hotel, from the front desk, to the food court, to the Mousekeeping! Everyone was smiling and friendly. The food court was good. There were many choices for breakfast, we never ate lunch there, but dinner was really good as well. This hotel is close to the parks (we always rent a car though) and a boatride away from Downtown Disney. We've stayed at all of the moderate resorts within the past 4 years and this one is certainly our favorite. We'd definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Hazza99
Reviews.Content: My wife, 8 yr old daughter and I stayed at the French Quarter 13th - 30th March and loved every minute of it. To summarise:- The rooms are a decent size, and clean. The bathroom is pretty small but has a good shower. Maid service is very good and no problems there. One day we stayed in our room as our daughter was a little unwell, we put our sign outside the room for no housekeeping, and we had a message on our phone to confirm they wouldnt disturb us but we were to call if we needed anything. Fridge in the room was handy, and ironing board, iron & safe provided free. Please bear in mind this is a 3 star hotel, 3 and a half at best, so you get what you pay for - it is past basic but not luxurious - howerver it is a lot cheaper than most disney resorts, and if you want to be close to all of the parks then its a great choice. We like the security of being on disney property and not to have to drive much on holiday so it was excellent - in fact you probably dont need a hire car to stay there. Food - you can only order pizza for room service, but with it you could order 2L bottles of coke, water or sprite which was a handy way of getting water into the fridge without carrying it! Food in the food court was very good but limited choice. We ate quite often at the Riverside which is a 10 min stroll or 5 minutes on the excellent water taxi which also want to downtown Disney which has various restaurants - we actually enjoyed the trip to Riverside on the water taxi as the captains were a good laugh. At Riverside the food court is a bit bigger as it is double the size resort, they have a nice salad bar and more choice. You can purchase a souvenir mug for $12 which gives you free hot & cold drinks for your entire stay, great value. We picked the French resort as it is much smaller than Riverside and were glad of our choice. about 90% of the buses picked up from our resort and went straight to the parks, whereas riverside had 4 bus stops so journey times were about 10 mins longer. Any buses returning to the hotel stopped at French first so this was great when you were tired from a day at the park. If you are leaving a park when it closes and are not tight I would suggest howerver jumping in a taxi for about $10 you will be home in 5 mins instead of queuing for 20 mins for a bus then taking 15 mins to get home - not for everyone though but we liked our bed! The pool is excellent with a nice slide which would suit kids probably 3 - 9 years. The lifeguards were excellent, always at least 2 on and constantly walking round the pool checking all areas, unlike some who seem to be dozing behind their sunglasses! There is a nice hot tub which is open to children too provided they are with their parents, which we liked. A good sized games arcade but no fitness centre or any characters (bar easter sunday when Donald & Daisy turned up) at the hotel so you might want to book a character meal - we enjoyed the disney princess meal at epcot. Staff were all friendly, not at reception bar check in which was smooth, your check out bill was on your door the morning of departure so you dont need to check out at reception unless you are disputing your bill. So, a great time at the French and were booked to go back this Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, average stay”
Reviews.Author: SimplyAmerican
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort and it was a fine place to stay, bu t definitely "moderate." Our room was clean when we arrived, but mousekeeping (as they say!) was a little iffy thereafter. Sometimes towels were still left on the floor when we came back, and there was one towel twisted (we think) into the shape of a piece of candy with stickers on it. It had been twisted as such for a long, dusty time. They do make the beds and remove towels but little else. The place is very pretty and the staff was always very helpful. The pool was great, but made, I think, for younger kids than my teenagers. I agree with the one reviewer who said it would have been nice had there been a way to sit outside, like the FQ's sister resort, the Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place - but a little far out”
Reviews.Author: SimplyAmerican
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort and it was a fine place to stay, but definitely "moderate." Our room was clean when we arrived, but mousekeeping (as they say!) was a little iffy thereafter. Sometimes towels were still left on the floor when we came back, and there was one towel twisted (we think) into the shape of a piece of candy with stickers on it. It had been twisted as such for a long, dusty time. They do make the beds and remove towels but little else. The place is very pretty and the staff was always very helpful. The pool was great, but made, I think, for younger kids than my teenagers. I agree with the one reviewer who said it would have been nice had there been a way to sit outside. One evening we went to Riverside for dinner and sat on their patio and it was really nice. On our last night we went to the Luau at the Polynesian, and all agreed that if we were to come back we'd stay at a deluxe hotel (even if it means cutting back elsewise) on the monorail. It just seemed like it would make for an even better experience. FQPO was fine, but if I were going to do moderate again, I'd do Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot - Close to Many Parks”
Reviews.Author: endsun
Reviews.Content: French Quarter is a great mid-range resort. Not fancy like Animal Kingdom, but is centrally located, small enough that the restaurant isn't a zoo and overall - was enough space for 2 of us (we were barely in our hotel). We stayed for 5 nights on the 3rd floor of building 5. Nice view and quiet. Lots of stairs, which is great for working off the great meals. Our room was clean. Pillows were a little hard, but we're spoiled at home. Room service was very quick - showed up at 10 am most mornings and are great about not disturbing you. Transportation - buses are generally pretty quick. We took a cab to MGM one day because there were 150 cheerleaders waiting for the bus - cab was $10 and we split it with a great couple (we still owe you $5 :) It was worth it, as we would have been waiting for awhile. Dining plan - don't think twice - just get it. We had a fantastic dinner at the Italian Restaurant at Epcot, Crystal Palace in the MK, and AMAZING brunch at Animal Kingdom. These three restaurants alone paid for our 5 days worth of meal plan. Snacks - roasted almonds are the best deal for your snack plan. French Quarter and Harbour House are also great places to go for quick meals. Riverside was VERY busy!! We still found a table, but it was crazy. We had some pretty big "quick service" meals at Blizzard beach as well. Food at Disney was really good overall. You could even share meals with a partner or child if you're not a big eater. I would definitely stay at this resort again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surroundings at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ABruce
Reviews.Content: Stayed at POFQ for two weeks in two adjoining rooms. The hotel gardens and public areas are up to the usual Disney standard. I booked this as I wanted a moderate-priced Disney hotel and it looked good. It's not as animated as others and has a quaint feel to it. Our rooms were adjoining rooms located on the corner of the building (4 I think) right next to the on-site restaurant which I thought might be busy or noisy but it was a great location. It was less than a minute to the pool and about two minutes to the bus stop. No problem getting a bus. Bit busy if you go to fireworks at Epcot when park is closing. The rooms had two queen size beds, 2 sinks, bathroom, tv and table and two chairs. There is not much hanging space for clothes though. The cleaning was ok - did think they could have been more fussy with the hoover though - but I am being fussy - the bathrooms and beds were spotless. There is a shop on site with a fair selection of gifts and also crisps, biscuits, toiletries etc. If you shop at Disney, just give them your room number and they will deliver it to the French Quarter shop for you to pick up later. On the way to the pool from the main building there is a laundry room located beside the hot tub. There is also a games room with arcade games, air hockey etc and an outdoor slide. Our girls (11 and 6) loved the pool and the slide - you can see the Sassagoula river and the boat for Downtown Disney from the pool. I thought of booking a pool view room in order to keep an eye on the kids but there is a fence and bushes almost entirely around the pool area so I'm glad I didn't. French Quarter is much smaller than the Riverside resort. Some rooms look miles from the Riverside public areas. The pool is better at the French Quarter. It looks the same size as the Riverside (if not bigger) and has much fewer guests - although you can use both hotel's facilities. There are more dining options at Riverside but that didn't bother us. Most nights we got a taxi to the Golden Corral for an all-you-can-eat buffet. It's about 5-10 min in a taxi but the prices are so reasonable it works out much cheaper. The Mickey waffles on site are great for kids and the pancakes cooked to order. We had them most mornings. Fruit and cereal are also in plentiful supply. The parks were very busy when we were there - most other tourists were American - I was told this was the time of year most Americans visit Disneyland whether that's true I don't know. I have been to Florida in October before, so if you have to go in the school holidays and don't want to burn in the Summer, I would advise an October break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel If you need a smaller hotel for walking around.”
Reviews.Author: labgalbuffalo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at the French Quarter the last three years in a row. My hubby and I just love it! If you have trouble walking around some of those mammoth size hotels, this is the perfect hotel. I hate to let that cat out of the bag, because every year we go there, it is harder and harder to get a room because of the hotel's growing popularity. This hotel is easy to walk to the pool, or the hot-tub, the restaurant or the store, for someone with bad legs. The beds are super comfortable (Which is like being at home)! The price is great. The food is good. Little 'friges in the room! They have this really cool river ferry that takes you to 'Downtown Disney' and the other Port Orleans hotel. Not to mention being at Disney on Vacation, Priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Very Relaxing.........................................But!”
Reviews.Author: HareWeGo
Reviews.Content: Not to contradict other reviews of the Port Orleans French Quarter. My overall experience during Easter week 3/17 – 3/25 was great. We were on the first floor building 5 that had a courtyard view. A short distance to parking but still a good walk. - Room: Average size for a Disney moderate. We were in a room with two full size beds for a family of four. Another review mentioned Queen size but I only noticed rooms with either two full or 1 king. Solid walls. Never heard neighbors nor outside noises. Clean with no surprises. Limited storage space though. My car rental had more storage space. The room only contained one main dresser with six storage drawers. A small refrigerator, 2 cup coffee maker, average size TV with limited channel selection. Other than several Disney channels. There is no HBO or other premium cable networks. One word of caution. We requested and received bed rails for our four year old. The beds are set high off the ground. The rails were limited in a sense that they could not hold their grip to the bed. Thus on multiple occasions, our son was able to push the rail away from the bed while a sleep and fall through. An f/y/i was submitted to management to review these rails for safety. No injury occurred. A curtain divided the back end of the room near the bathroom for privacy space. Within this area there was an open rack for hanging clothing, a seat bench and two pedestals sinks. There was no draw space for bathroom materials or other items like used clothing or purchases. You have to utilize shelf space that was above the sinks. Bathroom is standard size with toilet and full bath. We noticed mold on our shower curtain upon arrival as well as our coffee maker was not functioning. Simple call to House Services remediate both problems instantly. The environmentally friendly “green” toilet made a memorable sound every time it was used. - Grounds: Major plus. Overall fantastic looking grounds. Always in very clean condition. Large pool with very kid friendly, (and sometime adult friendly) slide. Very quiet grounds compared to other resorts. - Dining: We only used the single restaurant on the property for counter service breakfast. For eight days the choices never really changed. There were several selections of eggs and pancakes, French toast as well as pastries and other selection cereals. The quality was average at best for breakfast. A short distance (15 minute walk) upstream at the sister resort Riverside, there are additional selections for meal services. - Transportation: Unlike other reviews, we thought having the transportation was a major perk. For the record, we did not return from the parks after normal closing hours. We utilized the magic hours afterwards and returned much later. Waits to go anywhere out of the resort took less than 10 minutes. Return waits were a little bit longer but we always got on the first bus that came for our resort. Rides to and from the resort was about 15 minutes. We had direct service to and from the resort to the parks with no other stops. There was also ferry service that took you on a relaxing 15 minute ride downstream to Downtown Disney Marketplace. Again, when we utilized the service, it was never over taxed even during the busy Easter week. The service appears to have been running on a every 15 to 20 minute basis. Again, very enjoyable. Overall my experience with this Disney Resort was excellent. If they could only add the much needed additional storage space as well as maybe create better sleeping options, (optional Queen / Full combos), would make the French Quarter and 10 rating must stay. I do highly recommend this resort if you can handle the short comings with dining and storage arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: KBT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter. We were there March 15-20, 2008. We were in a water view room with a view of the river, and we were close to the pool. The resort was nice, clean and the grounds well kept. The room was average size with 2 queen size beds. The beds were comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job. I had read reviews about dirty rooms, mold in the tub, etc, and NONE of this was the case with our visit. Our room was very clean, and the tub was VERY clean! We had 2 towel animals in our room upon arrival. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our little girls fascinated with how they arranged their stuffed animals each day when they cleaned our rooms. One day my daughters stuffed monkey was hanging from the ceiling fan when we arrived back from a day at the parks, and she thought that was hillarious!!!! The only complaint I have (and would be the only reason that keeps me from ever staying here again), is the bus service. It may have been because this was such an incredibly busy week in Disney, but the bus service to French Quarter was horrible. Every night that we would get ready to leave the parks (exhausted), we would wait 20 minutes or more on a bus. All the other resort bus waiting areas were never as cram-packed as Port Orleans was. There would be 2 buses to arrive at every other resort's stop in the time one bus would arrive to Port Orleans. When we stayed at Carribean Beach Resort last year we NEVER had this problem. We waited longer for a bus at French Quarter (a smaller resort) than we did at one of the largest resorts on Disney property (Carribbean Beach Resort)!!!!!! My theory is that since French Quarter is a smaller resort, maybe they have less buses servicing this resort. Who knows! We usually stood on the bus on the way home also. At least leaving from the resort, we did get a seat on the way to the parks since French Quarter is picked up before Riverside. The only other tip I have is NOT to get a river view room. We payed extra for a river view room, and wished we had not. The problem is that the river view rooms are the rooms furtherest away on the property. We drove to Disney, and therefore, we unloaded our luggage and brought it to our room ourselves. The parking lot is a long distance from a river view room!!! It seemed like we hiked forever with our luggage to get to our room. We would have much rather had a garden or parking lot view because we would not have had such a walk from the car. It was really bad the day we checked out because it was raining, and we had to walk IN THE RAIN with all our luggage all the way to the parking lot. Overall, we had a pleasant experience at French Quarter. The kids LOVED the pool with the serpant slide. The food court was never that crowded. We prefferred to eat at the resort's food court rather than the counter service areas in the park because the parks were so croweded! There were choices of pizza, burgers, sandwiches, seafood creole, etc. The beignets were good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PaulaSueS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter (building 7) 3/9 through 3/13 2008 and it was great. We found everything to be very clean and the staff was wonderful. "Have a magical day" was what we heard everywhere we went. Since it was a small resort the food court was small. No 1st class restaurant, just basic fare. If you want steak you will have to make a reservation at one of the restaurants elsewhere. Still, it was a good experience for us. Would stay there again. It was just my husband and I and we are in our 50's, but there were plenty of families with children who seemed to be enjoying their stay. The pool is very unique wiht the sea serpent in it. Would recommend this to anyone. Have a magical day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for 'Moderately' Priced Disney”
Reviews.Author: Nantucket2007
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my time there...wanted a 'moderate' Disney option and thanks to this website narrowed it down to the Port Orleans FQ and I'm happy to say it was the right decision for me. Check in: Arrived two hours early to a line-free registration and my room was ready. It's not a huge resort - but large enough where probably staying closer to the main building is a good bet. I stayed in Bldg. 4 - convenient, with a view of the internal courtyard which was lovely. Maybe it was a quiet weekend, but some buildings, by nature of the direction they faced, seemed a little too quiet. I liked being close to the lobby and bus service. Room: I loved the way these are decorated! Perhaps a tight squeeze for 4 - but more than fine for 2. Very cute - a large area where a curtain can be used to separate the bed area from the two sinks - and then a VERY small room for shower and toilet (too small maybe). Being moderate - you notice the sheets are not lux, towels are thin and room amenities are sparse. But it was clean and the decor really is cool, very ornate yet tasteful. Fun. Grounds: Very nice - wrought iron, charming. Fun pool - although the bigger pool is at the Riverside and there were more dining options there - I felt from my brief walkthrough that the FQ is just nicer in my humble opinion. I should note that the kids and adults I saw were always having a blast in the FQ pool - they have a very cool slide. The boat ride from the hotel to Downtown Disney was picturesque and fun - as mentioned in previous posts - the 'Capatains' on the boats are terrific - kind and funny. Always waving to people they pass - great touch! Bus service was consistent and it was nice to be picked up before Riverside, which has several bus stops compared to FQ's one - practically guaranteed you a seat. Amenities: The only room service is pizza, which I didn't have but it seemed popular. No fancy restaurant on site - just one large fast food place (but large and nicely themed) where you could get a sandwich, junk food, pizza, fruit - a beer, etc. A more upscale food option would have been appreciated. One night I came back after a full day at the Parks and 'Scat Cats' - the bar off the lobby (opens at 4pm I believe) - had a fantastic singer, and the bar patrons were having an absolute blast - I was very sorry I was too tired to go in and enjoy it. Summary: You pay more for the 'luxury' resorts - where you get full service and more options - the best of the best with a lot of little extras. Where at the FQ the elevator was a little run down looking, the hotel had cheapish sheets (not bad, just thin), and no conditioner for your hair (not a big deal, just the stupid little things you notice) - and all around less to offer. BUT, of course the deal is - this resort costs considerably less than those that do give you those extras and is a fine choice - clean and very nice. I wasn't there with children but the one's I saw were well occupied and having a blast (there is a little arcade on site too). For adults with no kids it may not be the perfect choice - but I enjoyed it anyway - the rates, the pretty grounds and kind employees (they really were great).
