I would recommend this hotel - it's not what you'd get at the Grand Floridian, but for half the price - it is well laid out with lovely rooms and you'll get the Disney experience which is what it's all about.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall choice for WDW”
Reviews.Author: Gabeto
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans FQ seems like an excellent choice for a moderately priced resort in the WDW area. It is very well located and with an excellent access either by car or by boat to Downtown Disney. Pretty close to the parks too. Ambiance is great and the pool & dragon looked very nice (although it was closed for the whole winter for construction!) One drawback (as in many Disney's resorts) is that we couldn't get the 2 queen bed rooms to be communicating so we had to part ways, my wife slept with the 2 girls and I had to sleep in the other room w/ my 3y son. The staff did help with our requests but I wasn't too pleased with their attitude and effort (maybe cos it was unsuccesful!)

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at the French Quarter. The grounds of the hotel are lovely. The pool and hot tub were closed, which we did not know when we booked. They offered the pool at the Riverside part of the resort, but that is difficult and time consuming. Our room was positively filthy. I complained three times and only after our agent got involved did they send someone to re-clean. The comforters were stained, one pillowcase had blood on it, there was dust all over the room, the pack n' play had holes in it and food and urine stains all over the bottom, the floor was never washed and minimal vacuuming was done. The hotel did not care when I complained and even told them my 18 month old was allergic to dust. Very disappointing for Disney. The busses take a while to get to the parks. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is nice. I would spend the extra $ and stay in a deluxe or stay off property next time. For the first 4 nights of our trip we were at the Gaylord Palms and that was amazing! Cheaper and even had a Disney shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JaneJetson
Reviews.Content: We (Mom, Dad, 2 boys age 9 and 12) stayed in Port Orleans French Quarter on our recent trip to Disney World. We had a nice room in a great location. We were in Building 6, 3rd floor, overlooking the river. We were convenient to the bus stop, and to Riverside (the other side of Port Orleans) where most of the recreational activities are located. The beds were comfortable, and the room spacious enough. The room could have been a bit cleaner. You could see where a child staying previously had put some stickers on the furniture, and the floor in the sink area had some sticky spots on it. In retrospect I should have alerted the cleaning staff, but I never thought of it when we were rushing out in the morning to get to one of the theme parks. I would definitely stay in the French Quarter again as opposed to Riverside. The complex is much smaller than Riverside, so there was only one bus stop. On buses returning from the theme parks, our stop was the first, then it would go to Riverside if necessary. Most of the buses we took to the theme parks went direct, but occassionally we had to make stops in Riverside. There are 4 bus stops in Riverside, so on those occassions, it took us a bit longer to get to our destination. But at least we had seats. During our stay, we rented a Boston Whaler to take for a spin down the river and back which was very enjoyable. There are also bicycles and "Surreys" (almost like a tandem or quad bicycle) to rent as well. The pool at the French Quarter was under renovation during our stay, so we used the pool at Riverside. A nice pool with a small slide. There was ferry access from French Quarter to Riverside and to Downtown Disney. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bleacher
Reviews.Content: It was our first time staying at a Disney Resort and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We were quite upset though that the pool was closed for refurbishment as we chose this resort from the photos posted on this website for the pool! It's understandable that it has to get fixed once in a while though and I doubt we would have had a lot of time to swim anyways. I was a little leary because of reviews I read about the resort, but it was for nothing because the resort was great. "Mousekeeping" was fine for us and our room was cleaned every day. No, our sheets were not changed every day, but I didn't expect them to be. Our housekeeper even straightened out our shoes every day for us! We enjoyed the colourful restaurant and theh food was good. The ferry ride to Riverside was a nice change as well. The grounds were beautifully kept and there were even bunny rabbits hopping around. It was a great Disney experience and we'll do it again in two years.

Reviews.Title: “Love it :)”
Reviews.Author: DanielleTennessee
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel... it is a smaller resort and that means closer to the bus stops. That is great after a long day at the parks. No problems. We have stayed here for the last three years and we are staying here again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some housekeeping and the pool is closed for Reno's”
Reviews.Author: 1mommy
Reviews.Content: Our children picked the Disney All Star movies resort. When we arrived there were no rooms and we were moved to the Port Orleans. We were not told that the pool was under renovation otherwise we would never have stayed there. The cleanliness of the rooms was so so. The dust covering the entire ceiling was revolting. If you went to bed after turning out the lights you would be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: bendwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter from February 12 to the 19th. It's kind of a hard place to review, since it has things that are good, bad, and neutral about it. In actuality, I would probably rate it a 3.5. Good: On the outside, the grounds are beautiful. Right on the river, with lots of walking paths, beautiful greenery, and a very quiet, pleasant atmosphere. The buildings are painted in different colors, with lots of wrought iron railings. All the corridors are exterior, with a combination of stairways and elevators. Also, plenty of convenient parking if you have a car. All the grounds are spotless. There are small riverboats running almost constantly between this resort and the Riverside next door (about 7 minutes by boat), as well as to Downtown Disney (about 15 minutes by boat). The boats are free, and besides being conveninet transportation they are a wonderful way to just relax on the river. We took one down to Downtown Disney a couple of times, just to wander around and have an ice cream. The room we had (1331), was clean and comfortable. Two double beds, with good firm mattresses. There are two pedistal sinks with a convenient shelf above it for toiletries, and plenty of space for clothes and suitcases. There is a ceiling fan that kept the room comfortable (February - in the 70s), as well as a wall air conditioner that worked fine and wasn't overly noisy. Despite the exterior corridors, the room was quiet. Neutral: Part of the review on the room also falls into the neutral category. There was a fairly old TV with limited channels (five of which were Disney promo), and the furniture has an older, slightly worn look to it. Two of the dresser drawers would not stay closed if you put too much in them. The clock worked, but the alarm and radio didn't. The towels were plentiful and clean, but thin and somewhat worn out. Tub/shower was clean, but lots of caulking in the corners. Not much in the way of amenities in the room, other than the usual soap and shampoo. There are shuttle buses running about every 15 - 20 minutes, which are great for getting to the park and saving on the expensive parking. However, they only service Disney - not attractions like SeaWorld or Discovery Cove. I honestly think they should offer that service, even for a small fee. The food service is okay, but certainly not great. The selection was limited, and tends to fall into the fast food or cheap coffee shop genre. It's self-service, with plastic trays, paper plates, plastic silverware, etc. There is no room service except for pizza delivery, which was expensive but actually pretty good. Prices were fairly reasonable for anything connected to Disney, where everything seems to be priced between the merely exorbitant and the utterly ridiculous. You'll get sick of eating there in a real hurry, and there is no other alternative on the property. You can walk or ride to the adjacent Riverside, which shares facilities with the French Quarter. They have an expanded self-serve restaurant as well as a table-service restaurant. We were unable to eat at the table-service place because reservations were required and they were already full - remember this is February - but their menu items looked good and their prices were high. There are lots of other restaurants in the immediate area, but you need a car to get there. Bad: Surprisingly for a Disney resort, the worst part of the stay were the people who work there. With the exception of the man who helped us when we checked in, virtually everyone we came into contact with was either disinterested and bored or downright rude. Many had only limited English skills, and some were very difficult to understand. We were going to take a drive one day (got to escape the mouse at some point!), and asked a woman at a desk in the lobby for some basic information. She informed us in broken English that she was only there to sell Disney time-shares, and we should ask at the concierge desk. We stood in line for 15 minutes (again, remember this is February - can't imagine what summer is like), and when we asked for some simple driving instructions and suggestions for local things to see, the woman told us that was "personal information", and that she could only help us with Disney-related matters. Instead of "Concierge" over the counter, it should say "Disney Hussle-You Sales". Conclusion: All in all, a good place to stay, depending on what you're looking for. If you want a convenient, quiet place to stay while hitting all the theme parks, this is a great choice. If you want some choices in food and things to do other than Disney, you might look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but could improve”
Reviews.Author: dcmsox2004
Reviews.Content: we arrived on 2/16, and without a doubt, having aaa book our hotel was a bonus. with aaa, we had the magical express deliver our baggage directly to our room, and after a 15000 mile flight, and all that goes with travel, was a great option. (note, we'd found a great deal with thrifty rental for a minivan for 177 per week, so we did not use the bus but did tell the magical express upon arrival at orlando airport that we had a rental but to please send the baggage on ahead, which they did gladly). -the check in was easy and without any problems -the room itself was okay, unimpressive, relatively clean, BUT, the shower did have mold on the tile which was never rectified.... -the beds were not terribly supportive -the room was 6314, which was a river view, highly recommended because it was a quiet setting.... we chose the french quarter because it was about 1/2 the size of the river walk..... -the main dining area which we'd used every day but one for breakfast was interesting, the food was okay, but the service was lackluster, none terribly concerned with their timely attendance to getting orders out promptly to customers... -gross, but, i did notice an old band aid on the narrow walkway every morning for 4 consecutive days, they need to be more attentive to this sort of thing... check out was easy, they will provide boarding passes as a courtesy.... all in all, a moderate resort is exactly that, a moderately okay facility that could use better cleaning of the rooms, improved service at the dining room....

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Katiehs
Reviews.Content: Pool is closed for refurbishment, we were not told at the time of our reservation. Food court is difficult to order from with limited selections and poor value for money. Rooms are small and not in great condition. The plywood that had been used to repair one of our beds had not been cut to size so we kept hitting our shins on it when moving around our room. Staff were not very knowledgeable, and used inappropriate times to contact us in our room (10:30 pm and when we had a do not disturb sign on our door). Surprising, because this is supposed to be geared towards families. (We stayed with our 3 and 5 year old kids) On the plus side, transportation to and from Disney is great, and the "extra magic hours" that come with staying at a Disney property mean that you can enjoy smaller crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the resort--not happy with the pool being closed”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter's sister hotel, the Port Orleans Riverside, is by far one of my favorite Disney resorts, so I was excited to see what the French Quarter was all about. Needless to say, I was not disappointed--the grounds were nice, the resort was clean, the room was exactly what I assumed it would be for one of Disney's "moderate" resorts--and I actually really liked the smaller atmosphere of the French Quarter, although the gift shop left something to be desired, and if I was staying a whole week (I was only there for three nights) I probably wouldn't want to stay here because of the limited resources. The only complaint I had was that the pool was closed! It was a little cool to go swimming while we were there, but my complaint hedges on the fact that Disney did not communicate to us at any point in time that the pool would be closed for renovations during our stay. They are usually good about this, so I am not sure what happened, but that was what made this a 4* resort instead of a 5*, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: peachgal50
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, we stayed here December 18-23 then moved to another hotel in Orlando for Xmas at Universal Studios. The relatively small size of POFQ compared to the other moderate resorts is a big plus in my book and the atmosphere with the horse drawn carriages at dusk, the jazzy Xmas music playing along the paths and the beautiful fountains around every corner was a fine way to spend any holiday. The rooms were a little smaller than Carribean Beach, where we stayed in May, but we really didn't miss it and prefer this resort hands down. The boat to Downtown Disney was a nice way to travel, with beautiful views approaching the area. Maid service was good although we missed getting the towel animals we got last time at CBR. I guess it all depends on the individual cleaning the room. I would recommend that you ask for a corner room, we got one without asking but in the future will ask as they have two windows instead of one. The bus service was very good and we prefered it to CBR as we had only one bus stop for the entire resort. Some of the service was shared with Riverside but on the whole we had fewer stops. One of the best things about staying on Disney property is the transportation. We parked the car and didn't have to use it until we left the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool and service”
Reviews.Author: SuzyX5
Reviews.Content: Check in was very quick, friendly and helpful. All of the staff was very helpful and very friendly . We checked in early, room was ready. Room was clean, beds were comfortable, bathroom was very clean. Loved the double sinks outside the shower area. Grandkids loved the pool and the gift shop. Loved the food court there. Great food at anytime of the day. Loved the boat service to the other hotel or downtown. Would stay there all the time when we return to Orlando. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Might want to stay away for now.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan111
Reviews.Content: They have closed the pool for renovations until Spring. Apparently, they didn't communicate this to people who had existing reservations made before this decision. There were many upset guests at the front desk when we checked in and throughout our stay. The lines at the front desk were long and the staff were not friendly ( seemed irritated ) - we felt uncomfortable. Would advise staying away from this hotel until they get things straightened out here.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter's Pool Closed For Renovations”
Reviews.Author: BearsFans
Reviews.Content: Just returned from POFQ, we stayed from 1/26/08-1/31/08. We love this resort for the following reasons: small footprint/less walking, beautiful grounds, the best bus transportation of all the moderates (1st pickup and 1st drop off means you always have a seat), nice atmosphere and quality staff & service. They closed the pool area on January 28th and it will remain closed through March. There are buses that can take you to next door Riverside to use their pool. I honestly would recommend that if you are traveling during this period, you book either Port Orleans Riverside or the newer Coronado as an alternative. Without the pool area, the french quarter is a little lacking in amenities. Just my opinion. If staying in the French Quarter, it is helpful to know that the even number buildings were previously smoking (all have been non-smoking since June). Buildings 1 and 7 are furthest from the main areas and bus stops, they are also the quietest. I feel the preferred rooms are worth the extra money, for the river views. Do check out allears website for current menus, detailed updates on closings and renovations- its a wealth of information. We enjoyed our stay and while the French Quarter was nice, I think next trip we will try out a new resort. It is starting to show its age a little bit, and I'm ready to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by the POFQ!”
Reviews.Author: morningdew4
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the French Quarter for 9 nights (before, during, and after Christmas) and thoroughly enjoyed the French Quarter. I would highly recommend staying at an on-site Disney property (especially because of the free transportation and 'extra magic hours'), and this hotel in particular left us with a great impression. Although the FQ is the smallest Disney hotel, it doesn't appear to be small or crowded, and in fact is easy to get around. There was also no shortage of southern charm and new orleans/ mardi gras music & decor. Upon arriving at the hotel, we noticed that the hotel had a nice, simple layout, was clean, well decorated, and well maintained. The check-in process was fast and smooth, and the staff were very courteous. Our room was a very comfortable size for 4 adults and was well appointed and decorated, as well as clean & fresh. We also found that the housekeeping was excellent each day. The food court was definitely adequate if one didn't want to eat away from the hotel or order in. I would definitely recommend the pizza! The gift shop was well-stocked for any occasion or need, and was open from 8am-11pm. The pool was great for kids, and was certainly large enough for adults as well. There is also a whirlpool hottub, which was always quite popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun For Families”
Reviews.Author: mmaryellen92
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights right after New Years, and we had a great time. The pool was SO refreshing, and the room was very convenient. The lines at the park were very long, but we fast passed whenever we could. The room we had was very clean, with two doubles. It might have been better if it had a queen size, but the doubles were ok. Would definitely recommend. w

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place with typical Disney charm and great pool!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my honeymoon on a trip to Disney and was very surprised how cool this place was. It is both for adults and families alike and is on Disney property so you can take a round the clock shuttle bus to any of the parks for free. The place is decorated like New Orleans style and has a restaurant in the middle that has buffet/cafeteria style with various selections for the family. It is a really nice place and decorated very tastefully. The lobby is very nice and the staff very helpful. The rooms are spacious and have everything you need. The pool is very nice with scultures of characters and large enough so you can spread out from kids etc. I would highly recommend checking this place out for a Disney property. It is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans French Quarter - A quiet retreat from the Disney parks.”
Reviews.Author: SomersetGoldies
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. We had a lovely room in Building 2 overlooking the pool - a minute's walk to the pool and the water taxis to Downtown Disney. Room was a nice size with two double beds which were comfortable. Having a fridge and an iron and ironing board was really handy. We found the staff all very friendly and helpful - except for one of the barman - who we felt never made us feel welcome. We went to the bar every night for a nightcap (we were a group of 4) - and were never greeted or made to feel welcome by him - other barmen were very friendly and welcoming. We all enjoyed the live music entertainment in the bar which gave a good atmosphere to enjoy a drink or two! Only criticism about the hotel was the lack of a full service restaurant. We went to the Boatwrights restaurant at Riverside every morning for our breakfast - which was absolutely first class and we enjoyed the 10 minute walk along the riverside to get to the restaurant. However, in the evening, after a long day at the parks, it would have been nice to stroll to a full service restaurant on the resort that had a good choice of food. The self-service restaurant was however very good value for money and the food was excellent. The swimming pool was fantastic - we were very impressed with the number of lifeguards on duty - who were all very vigilent. The water taxis to Downtown Disney were fantastic - and all the captains were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. This is a much nicer way to travel than on the buses!! Another thing that would have been nice after a long day at the parks would have been access to pay per view movies on the television in our room. And although there was web access available in the room, we didn't have a laptop and would have appreciated a business centre in the hotel where we could access the web. Overall, for the price, this was a really lovely place to stay - and we would definitely recommend it to others and stay there again if we visit Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT tima at POFQ”
Reviews.Author: love2travel63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ from Dec 8th, 2007 thru Dec 14th, 2007 and had a GREAT time. The grounds and rooms were very nice. ALL of the cast members were friendly and helpful. We really liked the hot tub especially after a long day in the park. I WOULD definately recommend this hotel !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Rest Your Head for the Disney Marathon”
Reviews.Author: R_Ko_A2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I shared a room for 3 nights at the French Quarter while in town for the Disney Marathon. This was one of the more moderately-priced affordable options for staying on Disney property. One of the best things about staying at Disney is the transportation to/from the airport on the Magical Express bus line. We were offered a free bus ride to the hotel and our bags were delivered to our room. It was great! Although the room was clean, the hotel seems to be in need of updating. The decorations seemed old, the room didn't smell new/fresh, and the paint was peeling off our hotel room door. The room size was small standard. One of the best things about the hotel was the pool area. There is plenty of seating and the pool scene is relaxing. Also, there is water taxi service from the hotel to downtown Disney, and free shuttle service to the theme parks. For marathon weekend, there was also free shuttle service to/from the race expo at Disney's World of Sports complex and to/from the race start/finish. I don't recommend the food at the French Quarter. There is a food court area where you can choose from several options, such as sandwiches, pizza, pasta, salads, ice cream... It is expensive and not gourmet by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Great repeat stay!”
Reviews.Author: cuab773
Reviews.Content: It is a great in-between option of the Disney properties. The prices are decent and the accomodations are nicer/quieter then the "value-priced" Disney hotels (I've stayed at a few of the All-Star resort). This is the second time we have stayed at Port Orleans- French Quarter. My parents have stayed at Riverside and I believe that the French Quarter is more convenient overall. The hotel has quiet, comfortable rooms and the staff was helpful and courteous. You're not at Disney for the rooms but it is nice to have a clean, quiet, reasonably priced, convenient place to stay. We enjoy staying at Disney properties because of the convenience to the parks and the added Disney experience and this is a great middle of the road option (price wise). I suggest paying a little bit extra for a king bed if you're traveling alone/with a couple as the other option is two double beds which can be snug if you're not accustomed to sleeping in a double bed.

Reviews.Title: “nice pool, bad service, bad food, bad bedding”
Reviews.Author: kitdoor
Reviews.Content: * nice pool, with an excellent dragon slide. My 6 yr old loved the slide so much, she stayed in the pool for an hour; towels are provided, but they aren't very absorbent; there is a pool bar; * The walkway between the buildings is sort of park-like, shady and pretty. There is a small playground, but it's not shaded; * The bedding is cheap and ugly. The pillows are uncomfortable. The ever-present greyish brownish icky hotel blanket is all you get. Yes, it's Florida, but it can still be a cold night. Next time, I am picking a hotel that has premium bedding. There is a mini-fridge, though, that's always good. For a surcharge, internet connection is available, but bring your own long ethernet cable. * The cafeteria, oh, what a disappointment. Everyone writes about how large and pretty it is, and yes, the seating area is large. The actual cafeteria is TINY, gets very cramped during regular meal times, and provides mere 2 or 3 choices of food of very low quality. My daughter, who loves chocolate, threw all of her chocolate cake in the trash. Will I be back? Absolutely not. No pool slide is worth an extra $100.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this resort.”
Reviews.Author: JX1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort last year around mid-December and I was not pleased. To start the resort was dirty all around with traces of neglect or lack of maintenance. I know that this is supposed to give you the feel of Norlan’s French Quarters but I could do without the trash, dirty walls and smell, thank you…. The room didn’t have central a/c-heating unit but a wall industrial mounted one; not what I expected for a moderate priced resort. The rooms looked run-down with dated popcorn ceilings and fated wallpaper. If they were going for authenticity, they got it! Compared to the Riverside and Coronado, the French Quarters needs renovation ASAP. I wouldn’t stay here again as for the same price I could have stayed in a better resort outside of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love wiht the French Quarter, Disney style!”
Reviews.Author: lovesFL
Reviews.Content: We arrieved for our stay at Port Orlean's French Quarter (POFQ) the Saturday of Disney's Half Marathon, and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff at the desk was helpful, and very kind. Or rooms weren't ready, so we headed off to the parks for some fun. Once the room was ready for us, we couldn't have been happier. It was large, and very pretty. We were in building 6, but since the resort is so small, it wasn't a problem. No matter which building you are placed in, you will be close to all the amenities this resort has to offer. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is a treat, as is the pool area. The bus service was wonderful, and the food court was ok...your tipical Disney food. We loved this resort and can't wait to return for another visit to our new favorite moderate resort on Disney World property!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected at Disney”
Reviews.Author: dha205
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to be overwhelmed with good cheer in Disney World. Instead, the staff was rude, unaccomodating and even resentful. No smiles, no "Welcome to Disney World," nothing. They seemed much more concerned with the Disney "system," and getting all of our information, probably for their marketing dept., than they were about serving their guests. (I had the same experience on the phone when booking). Even our son had to show an ID before they would give us our keys. The room itself was fine, except for the super-suction toilets that could wake the dead and the piercingly bright overhead lights. The rooms have a sort of dated feel, but they're clean, with a little refrigerator and coffeemaker. Not a bad deal for the price, but the staff needs some major lessons in hospitality. One positive--The beignets (New Orleans style doughnuts) in the food court are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1026
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. OK amenities (as other reviews state)...awful Front Desk/Concierge help. I have been a Disney fanatic all my life. I am an Annual Passholder at the Disneyland Resort and in California since we live so close, my family has never stayed at a Disney property. But it's always been a dream of mine and on this trip, we decided to go for it and splurge. Because it was a busy weekend - the only availabilty was at the Port Orleans - French Quarter. Looking online, it looked like a good bet. There was only room available for one of our two nights and through a website wholesaler we found a room at the other property (Riverside). Luckily, after a lot of hassle we were able to stay at one place for both nights. Little did we know what we'd encounter. You would expect some cheeriness in a Disney employee, no? At the Port Orleans French Quarter - the Front Desk agent hardly spoke to me - she barely asked me: "Name?!" to which I gave her mine and the next and last thing she communicated to me was where our room was on the map. When I went to the car, I noticed that she only checked us in for one night. When I went back into the lobby, I asked several of the employees standing around if there was someone I could speak to since I had a screaming 1 year old in the car and did not want to stand in line for 15 minutes again. Finally after being passed around - I landed at the Concierge desk. The employee told me he'll go in back to check on something. After waiting another 10 minutes, I had to ask another employee to check on his status. The second employee came back out and said that the 1st employee told her to tell me (!!!!) that I'd have to come back in the morning. Upset that I'd probably have to stand in line again the next day, we went to our room since we were all tired after a red eye flight from California. Luckily throughout that day and the next we did encounter Disney cheeriness...in other people. At checkout, the Front Desk agent again barely spoke. This time this agent asked "room #?" and when I asked can I change credit cards? She didn't answer but merely gave me my receipt - I asked the question again and she said - no not possible and was already looking to the next in line. Lastly when I went to our car, I noticed that we were missing our son's security blanket. And this thing is extremely important - son can't sleep in a strange place without it. I ran back in and again got tossed around here and there and begrudgingly walked over to the concierge desk. I asked if there was anyway someone could help me contact housekeeping to find if they have it. They told me to go back to the floor and ask the housekeepers there. I asked for a specific name, the Concierge employees said - no there are a couple - you'd have to ask each one - good luck! I am so disappointed that this was my first Disney stay - I would not recommend this property. Check the Riverside out first and anywhere else. I'm just glad my son isn't old enough to really be disappointed too.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in the World of Disney!”
Reviews.Author: lilacbirman
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it's the smallest of all the resorts on Disney property and it worked out great for our family of three. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient, our room was kept clean but the restaurant service could have used improvement. We initially got a lovely river view room but found that it was a smoking room so we changed it immediately and received a pool and partial river view room on the second floor. The room had two full size beds which I found a bit small for two adults but our 9 year old son had a whole bed to himself and loved it! This resort has a New Orleans theme and we loved the charm of it. There is only a casual walk up counter service restaurant which was sufficient for our early breakfast needs. We were also able to take a 10 minute stroll to it's sister resort Port Orleans Riverside for a sit down breakfast. There is also a bar/lounge which features jazz music but we did not go there during this trip. There is a smallish game room for the kids and a very nice gift shop near the lobby which sells items that you would see in New Orleans as well as the usual Disney souvenirs. The busses are efficient and the nice thing was that although the two PO resorts share busses, French Quarter guests get picked up and dropped off first! One of the best features is the boat ride to Downtown Disney! It's very a calm 15 minute ride which passes some other resorts on the Sassagoula River. The resort also has a really cool pool with a sea-serpent slide which our son enjoyed. We only used the pool once and had no problems getting lounge chairs just after lunch. The laundry room has lots of washers and dryers (maybe 15 of each) and was not crowded during the mid-day hour I did our laundry. It takes two cycles to actually get your clothes dry though. They do have a coin-operated vending machine for detergent and softener if you forget to bring your own. We noticed that most of the rooms are very close to the lobby, and all the amenities so this is very convenient for those who don't want to have to walk very far. The pool was open until midnight during our stay and we could hear the noise in the evenings. Since I am a very light sleeper, we made sure to keep our room fan on which did the trick for me! I could barely hear anything outside and our room stayed at a comfortable level of coolness (we found the room got too cold with the a/c on). Overall it was a very pleasant and enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe this hotel is even part of the Disney crew...”
Reviews.Author: barbieQ--1
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and well kept, but the staff needs a major overall. The shower curtain displayed a rather large area of mold growth. We found the general staff so disorganized and uninformed in their own business. One staff member, in particular, was actually downright confrontational. Our family has travelled a fair bit and I feel we are open minded about our hotel expectations; but I just cannot believe this particular hotel is situated within the DisneyWorld grounds and carries their name....Save yourself some grief!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced rooms with run down furniture!”
Reviews.Author: highlandsally
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying for 6 nights. Check-in was great and we were given a room on the first floor. Once we entered the room we knew that the location wasn't for us. It was in an area where everyone passed your room to get some place. I asked the front desk for a third floor room in a more quite location. They wanted $15.00 more a night for it. I told them, no way and they came up with a third floor room in the same building as the first floor room. It was much better for noise but the furnishing left alot to be desired. Let's say, they were lovely in their "hay day" but in dire need of replacement. The rooms are all non smoking but the reminders of the smoking days are evident in the cigarette burns on the furniture and burns in the sheets and top blankets. Our room had two double beds. Both beds had newer matresses on them but they were of different thicknesses. The dust ruffles on the bed frame also looked like bargain store pieces. One ruffle touched the floor and the other was 4 inches from the floor. We only had one chair at the table in the room. If we wanted to watch t.v. we had to sit on the end of the bed or on the bed. Housekeeping left allot to be desired and the fridge was just cool not cold. The fridge did not have a knob to adjust the coolness. The air conditioner was very loud and we could not turn it off. One night it rattled itself into heat mode and roasted us.To do it all over again, we would stay at a hotel on the perimeter of Disney. Most offer a free shuttle service to the parks and they are a lot less money per night. Also they have less expensive eateries around them. On a plus side, the parks were great and we enjoyed them. We weren't right in the Christmas rush but still found them very congested. We also found the food prices very high in the parks. The ambiance of the hotel is lovely and the grounds are well kept, but they have to re-do the rooms! Just go with an open mind and over look the "Chip&Dale" furniture!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the French Quarter!!!”
Reviews.Author: bridget_blais
Reviews.Content: Our Disney Trip was in September 2007. From the moment we arrived at Disney’s Port Orleans ~ French Quarter, it was everything we hoped it would be. The check-in was quick and painless and everyone was friendly and courteous. It was just my 7 year old son and I. It was his first time at Disney and my third, although it was the first time for me staying at a Disney Resort. The both of us loved the French Quarter, the lobby was very nice and so was our room with the Mardi Gras décor. Our room was spotless when we arrived and well maintained on a daily basis. The grounds were beautiful and of course the Doubloon Lagoon pool was amazing…my son particularly enjoyed the dragon slide. We made a point of going swimming every night before turning in and the pool area was well lit and beautiful at night. Every day we took a walk along the Sassagoula River and it was really nice. We had such a great experience with the transportation available there. We never waited long for the bus and the bus rides were quicker than I thought they would be to get to the different parks, I was pleasantly surprised. When booking our trip, I purchased the dining plan so I had booked all of our dining prior to the trip, but on most nights during our stay, we would stop at the Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory Food Court once we arrived back to our resort from being at the parks all day. We would pick up a snack and bring it back to our room. Only once did we stop to have breakfast there, but in all honesty, we enjoyed everything we had to eat from the food court. They also have a cute little shop with lots of resort memorabilia and Disney souvenirs. They have pretty much anything you would need there. I could go on and on but the fact is we had a great time and truly enjoyed our stay. I would recommend it to anyone with children and my son often asks if we can stay there again on our next Disney trip. I have no doubt we will stay there again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney World Resort”
Reviews.Author: Beachnut45
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at Disney World. Everything is conveniently located, great pool, room was nice size, very clean, and had very comfortable beds. The boat ride to Downtown Disney was nice too. Check-in was quick and the staff was pleasant and efficient. Highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “It's a myth-disney”
Reviews.Author: erkyl
Reviews.Content: Well, we just got back from our trip to Disney, the happiest place on earth...LOL. Not during the holidays. But, first, let me be fair. The hotel grounds are pretty, and the room is decorated in a way comparable to new orleans. But the walls were painted this sick pale blue and the wall paper border is really old and dated. But, I could over look that, whatever, it's paint. What I think everyone should know about the room is that on the wall next to the table in the room, was the dead remains of a bug that had been smashed there. After not cleaning it up for a few days, I finally took a wash rag and wiped the dead bug off the wall. And for a few days, the maids didn't even bother to wipe off the walls of the shower--they left a glob of paper or something on the wall. I didn't want to touch it. So, be warned, if you aren't tipping them every day (we usually tip on the last day of our stay), they won't take care of you. No new shampoo everyday, and apparently to save water (LOL--the environmental hyposcrisy--while running diesel buses very ineffectively) they don't change your sheets for 4 nights. Wow. And the beds are true double beds--even though there's definitely room for queens, if they would just buy narrower night stands. No one in this century sleeps in double beds anymore--almost all upscale hotels offer queen beds now in their double rooms. We had to add a roll away (another $15 a night) just to accomodate our two teenagers and us in the room. And with the rollaway, there was barely room in the room for us to walk around. It's a tiny room from the 60's or 70's and I've had more space in a Motel 6. Now let's talk about the food court at both French Quarter and Riverside. The servers are rude and the food service is slow. The prices were jacked up during the holidays ( Merry Christmas!) and the worst part of the experience, was the music track. They are playing a 'cajun' version of Christmas songs over and over and over. The worst part is it's the same 5 songs. Literally. Seriously--Disney can't afford to do better than that? And let's talk about the time of full breakfast. Get this--the Morning Magic Hours begin at 7:00 am, and the buses start running at 7:00 am (no way to get there when the park opens at 7, but I'll talk about that in the next paragraph). So, if you want to eat breakfast before you take the bus, you're out of luck because the hot breakfast doesn't start serving until --- you got it-- 7:00 am. Oh, sure you can get a bowl of cereal, or a sugar-laden muffin or danish. But if you want any protein to hold you for more than a few hours...too bad. Bus service. This is the most frustrating part of the entire 'resort' experience. You are completely dependent upon this ridiculous bus transit system. If you want to go to the park early for Magic Morning Hours, you can't even possibly get there when the park opens, because the buses don't start running until the same time the parks are opening. And so many of the buses run at erratic times. You can't plan for anything. There's no sense to it at all. Sometimes, two Animal Kingdom buses will come by to pick up when there's no one waiting, but the Epcot bus never shows up for 40 minutes. It's completely feasible that with the slow breakfast and delayed buses, you (a resort guest) could actually get into the park later than people staying off site. All for $245 a night during peak holiday season. And the best part is that when you wait and wait for a bus, you finally get on and it stops at several other stops before going to the park. And on the way, you see buses sitting around in parking lots, just waiting to be sent out by some dispatcher who's obviously not in touch with each of the stops or how many people are waiting at each stop. A couple of times we'd take walks on the grounds and there'd be lots of resort golf-cart and electric vehicles riding on the same walking paths for the pedestrians--this would be the employees. One time we were almost run down by one going so fast around a corner she barely had time to slow down before she saw us. I swore when I got home I would do whatever I could to stop people from going to Disney during the holidays. It truly was shoulder to shoulder in the park, the patrons were miserable, the kids were crying, the ride lines were sometimes 2 hours long, the fast passes would all be gone by noon for the day, the food prices were jacked up 20% during the holidays, the shows were just okay, and the rides were short, and mostly a waste of time. If I could tell anyone any piece of advice, I would tell them to get their kids out of school and take them to a 'funeral' any other week but the week after Christmas. Here's the good stuff. The hotel grounds are beautiful and we got a river view, which was nice. The best time of day was when we were back at the resort when most of the crowds were at the parks. There was a horse and carriage going around the two hotels. It was charming, but cost $35. We hung around the pool or just crashed in the room. We went over to Fort Wilderness and rode on the Sea Raycers...which was fun. If you're really hungry, go over there and eat at the buffet restaurant. It's all you can eat. It's pricey, but at least you can get your fill and maybe skip a meal later in the day at the park. Just ride the ferry over from Magic Kingdom or take any of the buses over there. All this 'magic' is created by the Disney machine that is just so money hungry they can't even figure out how to close the gates when the parks reach capacity. Or how about this idea--during the week of December 26-January 1, shut the park to anyone who's not staying on a resort property. Then you can increase your resort attendance, but keep the parks attendance down to a manageable level for those of us staying at the resorts. As it is, the Disney greed to allow outside patrons into a park that's already over filled is ruining the experience for virtually everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: After 30+ years of marriage, my husband and I finally went to Walt Disney World. Since this was our first time, I consulted with a travel agent and took her advice as to where to stay. Her suggestions of Port Orleans French Quarter was absolutely 100% perfect for us. We arrived a day earlier than planned and the resort was able to provide us a room for the night and then switched us to our reserved room the next afternoon. The staff at the front desk were just wonderful every time we talked with them and everything we did with them was done quickly and correctly. Our reserved room was on the second floor, which we thought could be a problem, but the steps were easy. The room itself was very pleasantly decorated and clean (except for a little bit of dust in some obscure places). We did have to request toiletries several times during our stay. I'm not sure why we kept being overlooked on this. We did have a problem with the AC unit running extremely loudly (it literally shook the room). We requested repairs several times, but it wasn't until our fifth night when we directly contacted maintenance that a repair was made -- they got rid of one noise (a real sleep interrupter) and replaced it with another noise (which was constant, so it didn't wake us up). That was probably our worst problem while we there -- and it really wasn't a major issue. One day we forgot to lock our safe in our room (it is a small safe, we fit my husband's meds and an envelope of cash in there) and returned to the room later in the day to find that nothing had been disturbed. Someone (housekeeping, maintanance) could have taken $500.00 that day if they had wanted. The safe was obviously open, so we know that those who were in our room that day were honest people. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. We did bring our own bottom sheet as the Disney resorts do not use fitted sheets. The fan over the bed (not found in most Disney resorts) was quite a plus. We are used to sleeping with a fan, we just like the movement of air at night. We've heard complaints about the noise of the toilets from adjacent rooms. While we did notice this, it really was no different than hearing toilets at home. We did not find this to be disturbing. I particularly liked the bathtub / shower. The floor of the tub was not slippery at all -- getting in and out was very easy and safe. The shower head was one of the best I've used in a motel. Towels were amply supplied and replaced daily (even though we followed the guideliness for reusing towels in order to save energy). The restaurant on the premises was sufficient. It had a nice selection of counter-service food (from pizza to subs to salads). Breakfast was very good. The staff here were great for the most part. (As with all of WDW, we found that the people from other countries were much more courteous and friendly as a whole than the people from the states.) The pool was very well-maintained. We never saw a crowd at the pool even though the entire resort was booked. The staff at the pool were intent on their jobs and were alert. We did note that some guests seemed to feel that the pool staff's job was to clean up after them. Even though a return bin for used towels was available, they left towels all over the place. In particular, the hot tub area (frequented by adults, not children) was a mess every morning. I don't fault the POFQ staff for this, I fault the irresponsible guests. The grounds of the resort are beautiful. From the minute you pull through the gate, you feel relaxed. The plants and grasses and walkways were all maintained impeccably. I loved the way each double set of rooms had their own unique garden or "front yard" look. Strolling through the resort was a pleasant way to start each morning. There's so much more I could say, but I'll wrap this up with -- We can't wait to go back! I hope I don't have to wait another 30 years!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool”
Reviews.Author: emma1020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our two small boys, 2 and 6 months old stayed at this resort for 6 days 5 nights. From the moment we got out of our van to check in we felt the Disney "magic". The resort itselft is tucked away in a large parking lot and doesn't look like much from the outside but once you walk in to the main building you see it's charm. This resort is a network of 6 different buildings spaced out together around a beautiful courtyard. It does a great job of representing the festiviness of New Orleans.The highlight of this hotel though is the pool. It is huge and has so much seating around it and a seperate baby bay wade pool. The large pool has everything from a large dragon slide toa rain like waterfall. Both my boys couldn't swim but loved watching the large dragons and the waterfall. We had a car so we never bused it anywhere BUT on our "date night: we took the River boat right from the back of the pool area at our hotel and it took us right down to "Downtown Disney" THAT IS SOMETHING ELSE!!! The boat ride is comp;ementary and you see a couple of resorts along the way, it's very quaint. The rooms are nice and charming, but by no mean luxurious or spacious. It is tight for 4 people we had 2 dbl beds and a playpen set up and that was tight. But every day housekeeping did an OUTSTANDING JOB! They made the boys new and beautiful creations everyday. The food court at this hotel, seems mediocre when you walk in and look at the menu, but the food is REALLY GOOD! The Mardi Gras masks in this food court are really special to see. --Last note: If you bring a car or drive there, try to make one load to bring your stuff to the room, because the parking lot is quite a trek to most of the buildings in te back so keep that in mind!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here,Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: joryanbob4
Reviews.Content: This was our family of 4,second stay here,with first in 2001.If i had too do over I would pocket the savings and stay at the All-star resort.Not because it was not worth the extra money but with Disney and any vacation extra money is a plus!! I also stayed at the all-star in 2002 for a short stay.We stayed for 7 nights.My sons were 17 and 12 at the time of our visit.A perfect age.I felt secure staying on this property even during senior weekend.So maybe this was a good choice.I only noticed about 20 staying at our resort.A few rowdy kids but security was always around the hotel and parks.One of the only negatives is the slow busses.I felt during our stay the Port Orleans resorts had the longest wait,sometimes an hour went by from pick-up to drop off!!I watched all the other resorts,this is the slowest. You could see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom from the back of our resort. Has a nice quiet,relaxing back walkway with benches along the river.It would have been nice to request a backroom.Some of the guests had brought their own fold-a-way patio chairs to sit outside their room,I had not noticed this the last time or I would have requested one!! It is a far walk from the front desk but worth the nice view!The grounds were well maintained,I did see a snake one night go into a bush in front of our first floor room.For this reason I would have liked a seond floor room. The boat stop is nice to take to Downtown Disney.Nice 20 minute ride is a change from the busses.The food court was always busy but the wait never more than 10 minutes.The food was good,I would advise against the pizza.The beignets were what I remembered,awesome,always made fresh to order.Loved them!Great sax player at night,really really good! Took time some nights to sit longer in the food court area which connected to the club.I am not a big fan of Jazz but it was relaxing after a long day at the park. When the kids were younger we picked this resort for the water slide,it has a nice pool area and tucked away hot tub.I would stay at the cheaper All-Star because of the price only.I do not regret staying here at all.Rooms were well maintained,clean and the decor was different than any hotel stay.And staying on Disney's property for the extended park hours is a big plus,.But get your fast passes before you get your wristband!!!I

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best of the moderates”
Reviews.Author: IndianaKris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in November. When we arrived, we did unfortunately get a grumpy cast member upon checking in to the hotel. That worried me. She seemed to be upset with me for using Disney gift cards because she did not know how to use them. But the rest of the stay and the rest of the cast members were wonderful. She was grumpy. The room was very nice and clean. There were of course little animals made out of the washcloths. The room had two double beds and two sinks. The bathroom was small, but it was clean and nice. I loved the landscaping at Port Orleans. The pool was great with the dragon slide. The food court was small but had a good variety of foods. One real plus is the free boat transportation to Downtown Disney. This moderate hotel is smaller than the others and did not have the feeling of crowds that many of the other Disney hotels seem to have. It was peaceful and nothing was a long walk from the room. They had a nice game room and two little shops. I really loved the serenity of this resort. After a day in the parks, you really don't need to have to walk long distances and see crowds and crowds of people. I would not hesitate to stay here again. We stayed at the Caribbean Beach Resort on our last trip. It was so large that we had to drive to the food court. It was pretty, but I prefer the coziness of Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaG
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her husband chose this resort for our Christmas trip, having stayed there once before. They liked that it was smaller than other moderate resorts, making the trek to the bus stop and dining hall a short one. We had connecting rooms with my husband and me in one, and 22-month-old grandson with his parents in the other. This set-up worked well. Grandson could nap and go to bed early while adults had the other room for conversation and watching TV. The resort was clean and housekeeping did a good job. However, there was a dead light bulb over one of our beds when we arrived and it never got fixed. Another annoyance were the dresser drawers in our room that refused to stay shut! Check-in was quick. The dining hall was more than adequate for easy, fast meals that tasted fine. And we enjoyed the pool and hot tub. For the money, however, we could have stayed at a nicer non-Disney hotel. But then we would have needed a car to get to and from the parks. The beauty of staying on Disney property is the convenience of their transportation. Unfortunately, Disney's transportation system needs major improvement. Waits in excess of 30-45 minutes are unacceptable, especially when most quests are children or elderly. In addition, there needs to be another plan for handling scooters and wheelchairs. Nearly all of our trips included waiting for wheelchairs and scooters to be loaded, and then hoping there would still be room after the owners and their *entire* family were seated. If need be, we could stay at French Quarter again. But I like to dream that for our next trip we could stay at a resort on the monorail system.

Reviews.Title: “The French Quarter is a bit of New Orleans, and Great!”
Reviews.Author: Taurus4554
Reviews.Content: We always contact properties directly, and make our own travel arrangements, because we have found it is less expensive in the long run. Anyway, the French Quarter is LOVELY! The streets are quaint, and cozy, and I love the touches that it has such as the subtle lighting, and the "horse" ties for a bit of the old flavor of New Orleans. We loved to take walks down by the river especially at night when it is quiet. That's another plus. If you are looking for something less hectic, there is no place better in Disney World than Port Orleans - either the French Quarter or Riverside. This resort offers a laid back atmosphere (except in the food court), and is quiet, and restful and truly peaceful. Walking along the river makes you feel so rested you won't want to go back to the every day grind! It's truly a unique experience in the middle of one of the busiest places on Earth! I especially, now, believe it is important for this particular resort property to maintain as much as possible the air of New Orleans as it was prior to Katrina - if nothing else, for posterity. But, our experiences with Disney have always been a plus for us after 20 + years of visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close”
Reviews.Author: smjack8088
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided we wanted to go to Disney and stay at one of the resort hotels. We booked directly through Disney.com. When we arrived at the Port Orleans Resort-French Quarter, we were worried that we would be a distance away from the resorts. It was appreciated! Disney's Port Orleans-French Quarter was wonderful. It makes you feel like you are in the (more clean) French Quarter of New Orleans. There were buses running constantly to the various parks into the wee hours of the evening/dawn. Our room was comfortable, tastefully decorated, and clean. We never had a single complaint about our room other than we wanted to stay longer! The concierge staff is very helpful in recommending restaurants to try at the parks (or Pleasure Island). I, too, was disappointed that there wasn't a restaurant on-site, but with so many other choices....I didn't care. We will be coming back to stay at the PO French Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Charming”
Reviews.Author: KittyMcGee
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 7-year old daughter, and I stayed at the French Quarter from 12/19-12/24. We were in Building 5 overlooking the courtyard and were within a short walking distance of the pool, the hot tub, the food, the gift shop, and the bus. After spending 10+ hours pounding the pavement in the various theme parks, we appreciated the close proximity of all of these locations. Our room was colorful and comfortable. The bathroom was small (just a toilet and a bathtub), but we appreciated the double sinks located just outside the lavoratory and the curtain which could be drawn for privacy. The food court was small compared to some of the other Disney resorts that we've stayed in, but it contained a bakery (try the beignets - yummy) and offered all of the standard dining fare such as pizza, sandwiches, Mickey waffles, and more. The service was slow at times, but the staff was always courteous. Our daughter enjoyed the pool, but noted that the slide was a "bit slow." She's a big fan of wild rides. The hot tub was separate from the pool area. Compared to the one that we used at the Caribbean Resort during our last visit, this jacuzzi was quite large. We met a lot of friendly people in the hot tub every evening. The French Quarter does not have a sit-down restaurant, but you can either take a short walk or a boat ride to the Riverside Resort next door. This resort is very charming as well and we felt like we were getting two resorts for the price of one. The buses ran regularly and we could take a boat to Downtown Disney from the French Quarter. After jamming into the buses, it was nice to just float peacefully on the "river." My husband and I are thinking about buying a Vacation Club Home since we've started to visit Disney more frequently. But if we decide not to invest, we will definitely return to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved POFQ”
Reviews.Author: schnzr4me
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights, rented 3 rooms for our family. A lovely, quiet resort. Beautiful landscaping, very clean rooms, great pool area. Check in was not so great, unfriendly castmember (Carole) and they had the wrong room rate for us, so I am glad I had our confirmation in hand. They did make it right and even sent someone to our room to show papers correcting the rate. That aside, it was a wonderful stay. We have stayed at WL and Contemporary before, and I found this property to be very satisfactory for the the price. I would return there without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyGirl66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec 12-18. Check in was quick and easy. Stayed in room 1306 (Bldg 1 on the 3rd floor), a short walk away but everything is so close at this resort only took a few minutes. I have to say that the resort is very quiet. We were very surprised that our room had a towel animal (duck) when we arrived. Our mousekeeper made it a most enjoyable stay (we tipped daily) and made several other animals and a flower bouquet basket out of towels during the week. She left us lots of extra coffee on our request. We left the tip in an envelope so that they would know it was for them, which also gave us the opportunity to write any notes on it from day to day if we required certain things. The room we stayed in was well kept and clean. The towels were changed daily even though we put them over the rail as suggested to conserve energy and water. The separate sink area from the toilet and tub were great for getting ready in the mornings. The air conditioner wasn't use, but we did use the heater side of it one night and it was very quiet. There is also a ceiling fan for the hotter days in summer. All the staff were very helpful and made the stay a very enjoyable one. The conceirge desk was also very informative when we asked questions regarding the dining plan and park hours/events. The cafeteria is okay, nothing to write home about, typical fare for this type of venue. Always was lots of seating and the mugs were a great deal at $12.95 for the week we often went down before bed to fill them with hot chocolate or coffee. Overall just a great place to go and spend some time. Looking forward to staying here again already..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: disjunkie
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband stayed at the French Quarter for 3 weeks in September. We had previously stayed at All Star Music, but wanted something a little quieter for a 3 week stay. Our flight was delayed so we didn't arrive at the hotel until around 7pm. There was only a few people checking in at that time, so we were checked in quickly and efficiently. Only slight issue was that she could have pointed us in the direction of our room, as we literally had no idea which direction to go in. The room was nice, noticebly bigger than the all star resort, with two double beds, 2 sinks outside the bathroom, all nicely themed. The bathroom was tiny but I believe that's the same at all disney resorts. The good thing about this resort is it's so compact, we were in building 6 and we were literally a 2 minute walk to the food court and buses. Food - we were on the disney dining plan, so had a few meals at the foodcourt. Breakfasts there were good with a reasonable selection, it could get very busy at peak breakfast time. We had a couple of lunches there which consisted of veggie burgers, pizzas etc which are reasonable as the burgers are cooked fresh when you order them. The bakery was popular and the Beignets are definetely worth a try. We often went to the foodcourt at Riverside as it was larger with a better selection incuding a carvery and a make your own salad station. Even if you don't go to eat there, it's worth a visit as it's a very beautiful resort (it was may be a 5-10 minute walk from our building). Resort - French quarter is a very quiet, beautiful resort. It's full of beautifully kept courtyards and gardens, and felt quite peaceful after a day in the park. The swimming pool was popular but we only used it once. The laundry facilities are plentiful for the size of the resort. The lounge is also good, with a good selection of drinks which you can take back to your room if you prefer. Buses - Disney transportation was really great from this resort. In 3 weeks I think our maximum wait was in the 10 minute region and often a bus would appear almost as soon as we got to the bus stop. I also liked the fact we were the first resort to be picked up, as it could often get busy by the time we'd been round the riverside stops. Overall I would definetely stay at this resort again. In the same trip we also spent a couple of nights at the Hard Rock Hotel, which was much more luxurious but also a lot more expensive! This is the perfect resort to unwind in after a day at the parks, and is good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta the POFQ!”
Reviews.Author: srcrmcky
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans-French Quarter (POFQ) is my favorite Disney moderate resort! First off, there is NOTHING like staying on Disney property! If Disney is where you want to be, you can't beat the convenience of everything being so close with buses to nearly anywhere you want to go! The pool at POFQ is AWESOME! I don't have any kids, but I love to visit the pool...great theming and a great slide! The rooms are nice and roomy. They have double sinks outside the toilet/bath area. This is especially convenient when getting ready in the morning! My favorite part about this resort is its size. It is the smallest Disney Resort, so nearly every room is close to the food court/main area and the pool! It's especially welcoming to have a short walk to the room after a long day at the parks! It is also very close to its sister resort--Port Orleans Riverside. It's just a short walk away and offers another food court and sit-down restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: RoadTravelled
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 4-day stay at WDW in mid-November. This is the 2nd time that I've stayed in this on-property hotel and highly recommend it overall. The value for the money, especially when booked through Disney as part of a package is very good. This is definitely true when you consider that the price includes free use of all Disney transportation onsite (buses, monorail, water taxis, etc.) and the Disney Magical Express that shuttles you from the airport and back again (without having to deal with your luggage which arrives at your hotel room later). We requested a corner room when we booked which are slightly larger and have 2 sets of windows overlooking the grounds instead of the standard one set. This gives a very open and airy feeling to the room. I would recommend staying in Bldg 3 or 4 for close proximity to the buses, lobby and food court. Request Bldg 2 or 5 to be close to the pool. The room itself was clean and had all of the amenities you would expect in a moderate hotel including a refrigerator and wall safe. The bathroom area is nicely laid out with 2 separate pedestal sinks which is also separate from the tub/toilet area. So, this allows multiple people to get ready very easily in the morning. We had very quick check-in and the staff were always friendly, even helping us late one-night recover our lost key card (which doubles as your charge card) in a very professional and efficient manner. We only had really one snafu in that one day housekeeping failed to clean our room. We alerted the front desk and they were very thankful we had called it to their attention. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the hotel is very quiet and relaxing, especially after long days at the parks. There is a water taxi behind the pool area that takes you to Downtown Disney and you can also rent bikes onsite to travel the vast trails around this hotel and it's sister, Port Orleans-Riverside. The bus service is quick and since it arrives before going to Riverside you are always guaranteed a seat. This time of year by the way is ideal for visiting because the crowds are very manageable and the weather is ideal (past the rainy season, mild days and cool evenings). There is no onsite sit-down restaurant any longer but there is a very adequate food court which is perfectly fine for breakfast. The prices are reasonable (considering the captive audience) and there is a wide selection of both cold and hot items.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back to this Disney Hotel. Changed our hotel the next day.”
Reviews.Author: USA_Travellers
Reviews.Content: Time to update this hotel...Disney needs to teach their cleaning service at this hotel, how to clean. Our room was in building #1 of Port Orleans - French Quarter, which by the way is a distance to walk from the bus service, food court and lobby. This room had an especially small bathroom with a bathtub that couldn't "sparkle" anymore, due to it's age. My daugher described it best, before any of us mentioned our thoughts on the room. She said, "Mom, I think I better wear my flip-flops when I take my shower"..Sinks are behind a curtain for that old Orleans flavor, however the dust that accumulated on top, flew each time we moved it back and forth for privacy. Dust on all the shelves, furniture, etc. Dirt was actually grime around the lip of the table. The full mirror hadn't been cleaned in some time., and on and on.. You get the picture. The room felt old, dark and dingy. After having a great day at one of the Disney parks, the last thing I want to do is return to an unpleasant room. Maybe I'm crazy, but when you pay almost $200.00 a night for a room, I want it CLEAN. One more thing, when checking out,if you still decide to stay at this hotel, call EARLY when you want your baggage picked up,

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet base to explore Disney”
Reviews.Author: JeffLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks while exploring Disneyland. Have travelled extensively and this hotel is quite simple, the rooms are not so large, and the restaurant was ok for breakfast/ snacks but would not have eaten dinner here - bit like a canteen. On the plus side, this hotel was quiet and good for kids of all ages, and was a really good location to explore Disneyland. Free buses run regularly from just outside to all the Disney parks and riverboats run to Downtown Disney and the Riverside resort from the jetty at the hotel. For this price could have probably had a higher class of accomodation outside the Disney resort but we felt the convenience etc overall was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel at Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: tsherrington
Reviews.Content: POFQ is our favorite Disney resort for lots of reasons and this stay (Nov. 26-28) proved why once again. Extremely quick check-in and our son received his birthday button (celebrating his 7th birthday). Even though our other party of 3 more guests were arriving the next day - they put us in side by side rooms as promised. We loved our room (#4228) - best location so far! Right near steps that put you right at the food court and close to the bus stop, pool etc! The only negative was our son's card from Mickey didn't arrive until checkout but he did have the food court crew sing to him and he and his cousin then received free Mardi Gras beads, coins and Mickey rice crispy treats. They also were given free large sugar cookies with icing and Mickey sprinkles to decorate by some other food court crew at another time. Overall, very quiet, quick transportation (both boat and bus) and my family that came with us (1st trip there) absolutely loved it! We went for the MVMCP and that was a huge hit too. Will stay there again - and soon!

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: kimNewJersey
Reviews.Content: just got back and have to say you get what you pay for. we have stayed at deluxe property and have to say i would rather pay more money then to stay here. our room was disgusting so dirty. my kids did not get there luggage for hours after we checked in. when i went to the front desk to complain, the manager was awful so rude and just made up alot of excuses as to why our room was so disgusting.(there was garbage everywhere and the room was filled with dust) anyway,do not stay here. kim, new jersey

Reviews.Title: “First stay on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: sshamby
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay on Disney property and our 5th trip to Orlando. If you read my other reviews you'll see that I believe that when you pay over $200 per night for a hotel that it should be worth it and most hotels just aren't worth the money. I'm starting to wonder if my expectations are too high for hotels but I'll let you make that decision. Anyways, the Port Orleans French Quarter itself is nice. The pool is great, the staff friendly and the atmosphere nice and quiet. The rooms were clean but tired (for lack of a better word). Our room was small and could use new linens as there were holes in the bed skirts. The furniture was worn and the bath tub was missing caulk and the caulk that was there had mold. The shower curtain also had mold which is a big pet peeve for me. In addition, the walls are very thin or we had very loud people next door. We could hear EVERYTHING they said and did. Last and most important is the bed size. We were told the beds were two queens but they are not. Each room has two Full size beds. Full size beds are 6 inches smaller than a Queen which makes a difference in how you sleep. I would not stay at this property again. I think that we paid for the Disney name and location. It's like paying for a room at the Renaissance but staying at a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emilysmum
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had stayed on resort with Disney, but it was better than we could have hoped for. We used the Disney Magical Express from the airport to the Hotel and it was all very smooth. Check in at the hotel was very efficient and quick. We were in building 2 on the 3rd floor which was a fantastic location for the restaurant, pool and shop. The room was spotlessly clean and we were greeted by a towel animal, a small cat which was excellent. It had 2 double beds, a changing area and a small bathroom. The pool was fantastic and the lifeguards were absolutley superb. We witnessed them rescue a child that had got into difficulties, they jumped straight in without hesitation. They quite often got into the pool during their breaks to play games with the kids, our Daughter loved it. The pool also had a slide, which was great fun. We used the boat service to Down Town Disney which was lovely. We had hired a car, which we were to pick up on the 2nd day of our holiday. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up and taken to Alamo to get the car. The food at the restaurant was all freshly cooked, basic but tasty and very reasonable. We did use the bus service occasionally and found it to be very good. We bought the souvine r mugs which were refillable and found these to be very good value for money. All in all we were very pleased with our choice of hotel and we would recommend it to anyone, its a brilliant family hotel. The Crandon's

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bueller1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here on a recommendation from a friend (who also enjoyed this some hotel), and would have to say that we would definitely come back here again, and also would recommend it to others coming to Disney World. Given the way the hotel is laid out, it is extremely quiet, and even though we had a partial view of the parking lot, we were never bothered by any noises from vehicles coming and going. It's extremely clean, and the grounds are beautiful. The pool is great for kids of all ages (the water slide was a hit!!), and the pool hours are very accomodating. The room size was just fine, and again, very clean. The on-site staff was very friendly, as were the guests! It was also a big help to have free use of a refrigerator in our room...definitely came in handy! The on-site gift shop had a small section with cold drinks, snacks, and breakfast items, and while the prices were higher than average, to buy food there and store it in the room was still a cheaper alternative to other food purchasing options. The bus service that ran to the parks was also great -- there was a dedicated bus for Port Orleans French Quarter and Riverside, so you knew the bus was not going to make several stops anywhere in-route. And, the buses ran quite regulary -- I believe the longest we had to wait for a bus coming or going to a park was 10 minutes. Again, overall, our stay here was excellent. The only minor complaints we had were that the the on-site restaurant didn't offer the healthiest meals, and didn't have the fastest staff around. Also, we had someone at the concierge service tell us that a bus ride to the Magic Kindom could take 1 hour, especially depending on how many other stops the bus had to make. But, since the bus only stopped at Riverside in addition to French Quarter, the ride didn't take anywhere near 1 hour, so, perhaps the concierge needs to do their homework a little more.

Reviews.Title: “The room housekeeping forgot”
Reviews.Author: No2u
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Port Orleans Resort for 3 nights in January; would have left earlier but we pre-paid. First we were assigned a smoking double room when we were promised a non-smoking king when we made the reservations.
