Front desk eventually found us another room (a studio), but it was still a double and wasn't cleaned very well: We counted at least 25 hairs (from various body locations) in the bathroom, and gunk around the mirror and toilet that looked like puke. Carpet was pretty dirty, had to wear shoes to keep feet clean. On the positive side, the canal boat ride from the hotel to Downtown Disney was nice and convenient. Pool was nice. Bus pickup for Disney parks was nice (saved on parking), but the bus to Epcot was running an hour late one of the days. There was no problem holding our luggage for last day in the park, and the staff was pretty friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Check6
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Port Orleans Hotel was nice. Very nice theme and the pool was good for the kids. Parking was convenient and the Disney's transportation system was great.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Experience at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Tater69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at our second Disney resort in the past two years. From check-in until check-check out it was magical again. The only thing that this resort needs to work on is the transportation situation. While not having to wait on transportation (bus), they use the same bus to pick up both French Quarter and Riverside resorts. Many times it is so packed that people have to wait for another bus to come. Other than that, I would highly recommend this resort. Very family oriented, as are all of the other Disney resorts. Nice pool area, nice layout, and pretty good food too, for resort food. The staff there was very helpful, pleasant and professional and we never had any problems or negative dealings with any of them in the seven days we stayed there. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Disney Base”
Reviews.Author: hoteluserNottingham
Reviews.Content: POFQ is a lovely hotel, in a lovely location. Rooms are beautifully decorated, comfortable and clean. We wanted the best of both worlds, Disney and Universal. This is probably one of the best located disney hotels - with Downtown Disney, LBV right on your doorstep, and immediate access to I-4. Bus service to the parks was as efficient as you could expect, we never waited overly long. The boat to Downtown Disney is an absolute godsend! My only downside of this hotel, was the foodcourt, long queues for a terribly low standard of food. Avoid it would be my advice, unless you are desperate for a snack on the go. While in Disney, we visited both the Animal Kingdom Lodge, and Wilderness Lodge, and asked to see rooms, for what you get for the MUCH cheaper price, I would stay at the Port Orleans any time over the two above mentioned "luxury" resorts, they aren't worth the extra, compared to what you get at PO. If in doubt over French Quarter or Riverside, well, FQ is smaller and easier to navigate, get buses etc, as there's only one bus stop and it's the first stop there and back. Riverside buildings did look nicer, and nicer grounds, BUT, the bus queues were very long, and they were always the last stop there and back. Hope this helps, and honestly, for a great holiday in the "Magic" you really can't beat the French Quarter, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another moderate resort!”
Reviews.Author: halllis
Reviews.Content: This will the last moderate we had yet to stay at on the Disney property and we were very disappointed. Other then the check in, which the cast member was very friendly, we didn't enjoy the resort at all. Room-A dresser had a door hanging by one hinge. Thankfully, we didn't have young children as this was hazzardous. The "mousekeepers" never stocked the shampoo etc. We had to call and ask twice. The bathroom was dirty, mildew and moldy. Resort-Compared to the other themed moderates, this resort was very cheaply themed. The very small counterservice only eating area had cheap plastic "icons of Marti Gras" hanging from the ceiling. There was only one bathroom in the entire Main Lobby building which was in the back far corner of the eating area. A pain to get to if your not eating. The pool area also was themed poorly. Some of the "icons" just didn't click together to the New Orleans theme and didn't make sense. If your staying on site and looking at the moderates, you'll do better staying at one of the others.

Reviews.Title: “It's Fine...”
Reviews.Author: MemphisWinelover
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed at all of the moderate priced resorts at Disney and this one is fine. My favorite is the Coronado Springs at this price level. the food court is lacking and the only restaurant is down at the Riverside resort. to be a New Orleans style resort the only New Orleans food they had was beignets. The housekeeping service was great and she kept making cute animals out of the wash cloths. The front desk staff was a little on the rude side but the concierge and the rest were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “POFQ is OK.....I'm on the fence.”
Reviews.Author: castanza0
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at the Port Oleans French Quarter for 12 nights. Sept. 22 - Oct. 4, 2007. We have stayed on several other Disney properties in the past, the most recent being CBR in 2006. Everything was just OK. Not bad. Just OK. Check in was quick, but the gal was very uninformed. The front gate to the resort was closed and it was very confusing coming in from the Riverside. Fridge didn't work and the chain lock on the door was gone. Called and they were fixed very quickly. Housekeeping was OK, but nothing special like previous trips. I left tips, but then stopped. Lots of toys in the room with 2 kids, but nothing special. Not once. The grounds are nice, the pool was nice, the food was nice. Just OK, not Disney NICE. It is very small and quite. I'm not complaining about anything. Our stay was very good. I'm on the fence about staying there again. We will probably try another moderate resort next time. I'm trying to say that I wasn't disappointed, but I was a little disappointed. Everything else ROCKED. WDW is the best place in the world for a Family Vacation. Everything is fun and you never feel threatened. Mickey's Halloween Party was a blast.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan1713
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, with my dad. I am 12 years old, and this is our second visit. Check-in was very easy, our bags arrived in our room a short time after we checked in. The maid service was good everyday, but we did not get any towel animals, even though we tipped everyday. There were 2 double beds in the room, which was fine for just me and my dad. However, the beds might be kind of small for 2 people to share. I love the food court, the food was very good, and the lines were short, and I liked the flat screen TV that was showing Disney Channel. The Pizza was awesome! The bus service was very good, we never had to wait more than 15 minutes for any bus. The arcade was fun too! I can't comment on the pool, because we were too busy at the parks to go swimming. Overall, it was a very fun stay, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Cruiser
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to Walt Disney World for the first time (she is 10.) As part of the package, we booked 6 nights at the Port Orleans French Quarter hotel on Disney property. It was a great choice. Our group consisted of 15 people and we took 5 rooms. All of our rooms were together on the first floor since my father was in a motorized wheel chair. We were in Building #6 with a great view of the river. The hotel is beautiful with nice walkways. It was quiet and we never had noise issues. The one bad part is that the parking lot is pretty far away and carrying our bags that far and also walking that far each time became tiresome. The rooms are very nice. Plenty of space in both closet and drawers and plenty of space to move around in. The beds were comfortable. The room was clean and the maids did a great job during the week includling putting the wash clothes in the shape of animals around the sink spicuts and on vanity. Having two sinks outside of the toilet/tub room is very helpful at getting ready in the morning and having a curtain to pull to seperate the sink area from the sleeping area also allowed us to get ready while our daughter slept. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that the closet area was basically "open." The tub was a full size with a seat area. Very nice since many hotels now have smaller tubs. Nice tile and again, all kept clean. The hotel has a food court which had plenty of selections for all meals. We were on the dining plan and so that helped but if we weren't, their food is somewhat expesive. TIP: purchase a souvenier mug the first day. You can take it back anytime and get free refills during your stay. Excellent value. Very nice gift shop and game room. Their lobby is very nice and I found the desk staff to be friendly and helpful. (there was an errant charge on our final bill from another Disney hotel that we had dined at and the Port Orleans desk staff did a great job of getting it fixed!) The pool is fantastic! It is the best pool on Disney property. Great slide and lifeguards. My daughter loved it. Very large and never seemed crowded. Your stay includes free parking at all of the Disney Parks and the other hotels so you can drive where you want. You can also take the free Disney bus service, which had a pick-up point in front of the hotel lobby, to the parks, Downtown Disney and the other hotels. The Port Orleans also offers a free boat trip to either Downtown Disney or Port Orleans-Riverside. Activities are limited at the French Quarter, but you could walk, drive or the take the boat the short distance to the Riverside section which offered bike and boat rentals as well as carriage rides. This is definately one of the best moderate priced hotels at Disney World. IF we go back (another issue at the parks, not related to the hotel is our problem), we would definately choose th Port Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: MarthaMichigan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the omelettes in the food court for breakfast and felt service there was great. Room was clean and beds very comfortable. Nice resort to take a walk around at night. Some areas could use a bit of a paint job but overall though the place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav403
Reviews.Content: After booking our Disney World trip several weeks before, we looked forward to this being a good priced resort that is not too thrifty. When we arrived at about 10 A.M., our room was ready and check-in was no problem. We were immediatly struck by how friendly everyone was here! After putting our baggage in our rooms, we immediatly headed for the parks. The bus service depended on the driver, since you must go through Riverside on the bus route. We had one driver who drove as slow as she could, so make sure the driver looks enthusiastic before you board. The pool was very nice, with fountains and a water slide. Children could spend hours having fun in the pool. Overall, this was a very nice hotel, with clean rooms and a well kept lobby. I would reccomend this to a budget-concerned traveler who still wants a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christen1108
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the POFQ from 10/2 - 10/10. The rooms are basic, although the his and her sinks that are seperate from the bath come in very handy for families. Housekeeping was adequate as we never had any problems with cleanliness. The rooms could use some minor renovation -- they are starting to show their age a bit, but quite clean as I stated. The pool is also starting to show its age with some damage to the sea serpent and pool tiles that could use a very thorough cleaning. Despite this, the pool area is very festive and enjoyable. My two-year-old daughter loved the pool. I feel this is the best of the moderate resorts for its size -- you really can't have a bad location here. The best part of the hotel is the fast and friendly service. Staff were cheerful and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “POFQ”
Reviews.Author: WPCLuscious1965
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at POFQ in October 2006 specifically to go to Halloween. There were 5 of us in total booked in 2 rooms, next to each other - my partner and I in one room and 3 teenage sons in the next room. The rooms at POFQ were spacious and well kept. We had a view of the river that connects POR, POFQ to DTD. The rooms were well appointed with 2 double/queen size beds, tv, drawers, table and chairs, 2 sinks and separate bathroom/shower/wc. The rooms were immaculate, cleaned every day, The facilities at POFQ were excellent although not impressed with the restaurant, we classed it more as a canteen rather than an actual restaurant. We only ate there once, which was quite early in the morning. The second time we went it was packed and there was a long wait for food so we didn't bother and went out for breakfast to Ponderosa or Sizzlers. The pool was excellent and there were free towels available. Lots of sunbeds. We chose this hotel because we thought it would be quieter and it was. On reflection we would have preferred staying at POR as it was larger and had more facilities or the Caribbean. In fact POR or Caribbean would have been a better choice for our teenage kids. Would highly recommend this hotel as a Disney moderate hotel although if we went to Disney again and stayed on site, we would probably pick the budget hotels. Although if we were loaded would probably have stayed at one of the hotels on the Boardwalk - in our dreams! Disney is fab and cannot recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie17
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip through Disney to take advantage of the dining plan. Had done this last year (2006) and had a great time! We were supposed to get connecting rooms. Verified this at check-in....twice! but when we got to our rooms at 9pm (since they were not ready when we arrived at noon), we were not connecting. Called front desk and they were very gracious and asked if we could wait until the morning and they would take care of things. It did mean we had to pack and have the bell captain store our bags until we got back from the parks that day...so it cost us a few bucks in tips to get this right! It was worth it, though! We got rooms right near the pool...and a hop away from the food court! Very nice! In the smaller moderate hotel rooms, we have found that having adjoining rooms makes it feel more like a suite! French Quarters is our favorite moderate. The food court is small...but the entertainment (this great sax player!!!) at night in the bar is great! You can always walk over to Riverside for a larger food court. The food is really the same, but you don't feel so claustrophobic at the Riverside. The gift shop and lobby are nicely done ~ and you have the feel of Mardi Gras! I like the pool and the pool bar! By the afternoon, it can get crowded with kids because of the slide ~ but early morning and late night, it is great!!! French Quarter seems to have less kids than Riverside ~ probably because you can sleep 5 in Riverside with a trundle bed. The only issue this year was the bus service. They seemed to be verrrry slow ~ and infrequent. (When there are a lot of wheelchairs and scooters, the wait is even longer) Waited our first full day for over 50 minutes (still no bus - and the bus area was loaded with people - so you knew they needed more that one bus to get us all to the park) SO ended up taking the bus to Downtown (marketplace) and spent the better part of the day shopping, instead of at the Magic Kingdon, like we planned. If you are relying on the buses to get you somewhere for dinner (like a resort hotel), you are better off taking a taxi. Our concierge gave us bad information. Told us we could get to the Yacht Club (where we had dinner reservations) by taking a bus to MGM and then another bus to the Yacht Club!!! NOT!! There is NO bus that goes from the MGM Studios to the Yacht and Beach Club. There is a boat. BUT by the time we got to the boat mooring, they were leaving and the next one wouldn't be there for 20 minutes. Had to call the restaurant (thank goodness for cell phones). Ended up walking the pathway ~ which took 20 minutes and it was lightning ... getting ready for a good thunderstorm. Made it to the restaurant just before the down pour - thankfully!!!! Took a taxi back to the hotel after dinner... I think we may "re-think" renting a car next time (unless we stay in a hotel on the monorail.) For a reasonably priced stay in a Disney hotel, you can't beat the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lagwagon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 9 nights and the way our flights were scheduled, we were able to go to the parks for all 10 days of our stay. Magical Express was great. Our plane landed at 10:15 and the bus left the airport shortly after. Hotel check-in was quick, our room was already ready (12:00). We had requested to be near the bus stop and were. Food court and lobby were also close. Staff was very friendly. Rooms cleaned well each day. We took the boat to Downtown Disney one day. Very nice ride. TIP-at the parks I rented a wheelchair for my daughter for a 9 day package. It is $2 cheaper/day and can be used @ Downtown. We got the dining plan $150/person for 9 nights. Very well worth it! Counter service, table service, and a snack/day. We ate about 6 meals @ the food court. The food was good, servers nice. In 1994, we had stayed at Dixie Landings (Riverside), but prefer FQ because its much smaller and easier to get around. Pool looked nice, no time to use it, tho. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcarp
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the French Quarter hotel inside Disney Land in Orlando. Our room was clean and conveniently located near the front of the hotel where the buses to the parks stop to pick up quests.The transportation is run very well. We found the hotel staff very friendly, accept for one Concierge who got a little "snooty" when I had some questions (apparently one too many) about the dining plan. This plan is a must, I estimate I saved between $300 and $400 during our stay. This is one of Disney's "moderate" hotels, but was still very nice. I would stay here again. One more caution about the dining plan; You must make reservations for your full services meals before you go, otherwise you will find it almost impossible to get into a restaraunt. For the price this hotel and meal package cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Charming”
Reviews.Author: Lexi7404
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our twenties) just returned this past Sunday from our time at Disney's FQ. I must say the property exceeded my expectations. Both my husband and I agreed that the pictures online did not do this hotel justice. Let's start at the beginning. Magical Express was seamless both there and on the way home. Disney welcomed us well with that! Although we arrived an hour and half or so before check-in, we walked right up and were able to check-in to our room.Our room was a standard room, and we got a courtyard view just as I had requested. There was no need to spend extra money on a riverview! Our room was in building 7. We faced out to a courtyard, and we could see the river as soon as turned left out of our room. Building 7 is the farthest building (I believe) from the main building, but we loved it! We found the walk to the bus and lobby to be just a few blocks. We loved the quietness of our building. My only complaints about our room are minor - the paint could be touched up in a few spots as there were some scuff marks and the wooden coffee tray could be replaced as it had some pretty bad rings. The beds were comfy though and the room was always clean. Cast members were all very friendly. Some of the things we enjoyed at the FQ were: the boat rides to Downtown Disney, swimming in FQ's great pool, live saxophone music in the lobby at night, getting freshly made beignets from the food court, and renting bikes from neighboring Riverside on a gorgeous FL morning. The buses were pretty packed, and the lines for Port Orleans hotels seemed to be the longest at the end of the day. However, when we checked in, the cast member did say that they were 100% booked during our stay. The sister hotels could probably use separate buses though as Riverside is a huge resort. I have now stayed at a Disney value resort, moderate, and deluxe hotel as well as off-property. I stayed at All Star Music with my high school choir, and French Quarter is definitely a step above. The all star resorts have a kid/youth feel throughout...and talk about distances from the lobby to the room! The deluxe hotel I have stayed at was Wilderness Lodge. I absolutely loved it there. While the WL was majestic and awe-inspiring, the French Quarter was absolutely charming. It (the FQ) was a wonderful and relaxing getaway (as well as romantic) after a long day at the busy parks. We would definitely stay at the FQ again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Moderate Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sandinmypants
Reviews.Content: We booked this through the Walt Disney World website, the entire package including airfare, getting the free Disney Dining Plan. We were there for five nights (9/7/07-9/12/07), and I'll try to break it down a bit into sections: We used the Disney Magical Express on our arrival. We didn't have too much trouble finding our bus, as this was our second time to use it and it seemed slightly familiar. Just don't be afraid to ask people where to go, as there really aren't a lot of signs for it. When we boarded the bus, there were only about five empty seats toward the back. (We arrived on a Saturday). I don't know how long some of the people already on board had been waiting, but by the looks of them and the antsy-ness of the kids, it could have been awhile. We then proceeded to wait another 20 minutes ourselves, while another two or three couples/families boarded and the bus was filled. We finally left the airport, stopping first at Old Key West, then the Coronado Springs resorts, then finally the Port Orleans French Quarter. I made sure I was one of the first ones off the bus here (!). Of course, we had no luggage since they handle all of that for you. Check-in: This was our second time here, so we knew right where to go. The man at check-in was very polite and helpful. I had sent a fax seven days prior to our arrival asking for room 5317, the same room we had before. It's a waterview room, in bldg. 5. It overlooks the river, and is a corner room close to the elevator and the pool. We liked the location on our prior trip. We were happily pleased to find we were allocated the same room again. Room: The room was clean, no problems with it at all other than the light that is on the hair-dryer (serves as kind of a night-light when all the other lights are out) would flicker at night. It didn't bother us enough to call maintenance. The fridge was cold, the TV was fine the few times we turned it on. The beds (two doubles) were comfy, plenty of storage, etc. We did bring up some extra towels from the pool area to have in our room because we do tend to take more showers than the average family and we like to have clean towels. Pool: As mentioned in prior reviews, there were always three lifeguards, very attentive and great with the kids. One of them even got in the water after his shift and played some catch with the kids! The pool here is great, and the slide is fun. I had a couple of margaritas at the pool bar ($8 each), and my son had a slushy drink ($5). Plenty of towels, also. They shut the slide and fountains off at 8pm, but you can still swim, just no lifeguards. Food court: We didn't use it a whole lot. My husband would use a counter service credit for his breakfast, my son would get yogurt and I would get coffee, using snack credits for those. We stopped and got ice cream there once, also. We didn't get the refillable cups, I liked to take my coffee with me on the bus in the morning, and didn't want to be carrying the cup around with me the rest of the day. Bus service at POFQ: The buses stop here pretty regularly. It's the first stop for all the buses other than the Downtown Disney/Typhoon Lagoon bus. And, most of the Magic Kingdom buses aren't shared with Riverside. To go to any of the other resorts, however, you need to head to one of the parks or Downtown Disney and transfer to the other resort's bus. For being a slower time, the buses were quite crowded, we thought. Bus service picking up at the parks was quite a wait sometimes. We ended up standing quite a few times. Boat service: Boat service can be very slow at peak times. We waited a LONG time to get on a boat in the early evening (6-7pm). Then, on the way back around 10pm, there was such a long line that we would have waited over an hour to board the boat again, so we decided to take a bus back. Parks, weather, lines, restaurants & such: For table service, we ate at the Coral Reef restaurant, it was the best meal of our trip. We had the evening buffet at Chef Mickeys (not always offered), it was just okay. We had to wait a long, long time to get pictures with all of the characters. A pet peeve: If you have a table with more than four people at it, try not to monopolize the characters' time. Some people would have the character pose individually with each person, and then again with the kids, then with the parents, then with all of them and snag a waiter to take a picture....they did this with each character as they went by. Then, they got both Mickey & Minnie in on the act....meanwhile, everyone else is waiting, and waiting, and waiting.... How rude! Anyway, we also ate at the Polynesian, at the O'Hana thing that they do on the big skewers...not so good. On our final night we wasted two table service credits on the California Grill restaurant. The food was just slightly above average, we all had steak. The service was good, and we did manage to score a window-side seat with a good view of the fireworks over Cinderella's castle. But I just expected the food to be better. Our food was better at the Coral Reef! The parks weren't overly busy. We did score a Dream Fast Pass when we were coming off of the Big Thunder Mountain Railroad ride, but it was hardly worth it as most of the lines were under 10 minutes long that day. We also got a lanyard with two collectible pins on it (three of us, so six pins total), which my son quickly traded with cast members for some of his favorite characters. They called it a "Double Dream Day" or some such thing. That was nice. This was our first time to do a Disney waterpark. We went to Typhoon Lagoon. Our 6yo son enjoyed it so much that we went back the next day! His counter-service lunch came in a sand bucket with a shovel, and he spent a lot of time playing in the sand there. The place gets really busy, good luck finding a shady area if you get there after 11am. We figured it out the first day, you have to coral yourself an area with chairs, putting stuff on them, leaving an empty spot in the middle for the kids to play, and not leave an area for people to walk thru, or else you're constantly in the flow of traffic. It's wall-to-wall beach chairs here. The wave pool is fun, but the waves build up pretty high. There are a lot of fun rides for kids in the 6yo range. We were disappointed with MGM this year. We showed up at 4:30pm, thinking we would ride a few rides before the Fantasmic show at 8pm...well, we went on one ride, then at 6pm all the rides closed down! What the heck! I had no idea that was going to happen! Even the kid's play area, "Honey I Shunk The Kids", closed down. So, we just left there and headed back to our hotel to swim, we weren't going to wait around for two hours doing nothing. Weather was hot, in the low 90's every day. We had rain a couple of afternoons, but only once did it pour enough that it disrupted our plans. We tried to wait it out, but had dinner reservations so we finally bought ponchos. ($7 adult, $6 child). About 10 minutes after we bought them, it stopped raining. Go figure. The other times it rained it didn't inconvenience us as we were riding the bus, or at the waterpark (already wet!), or doing something else. It's very humid there this time of year. Magical Express going home: We were using AirTran, so we were able to check in at the POFQ. We checked our bags there, and they gave us boarding passes, or so we thought. However, you still have to wait in line at the airport, just like you normally would, when you get there, and get a different boarding pass. Hmmm. The only thing you don't have to do is schlep your own luggage around. We like the Port Orleans French Quarter, and it will always be our resort of choice when we go to DisneyWorld, unless we decide we want to upgrade to one of the deluxe resorts. For the money, it can't be beat. The other moderate resorts are just too big for us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: daedreamor
Reviews.Content: We loved the French Quarter! Check-in was quick and efficient. We got a ground floor room as requested near the river overlooking the court yard. The room was very pleasant and clean. A previous review stated the room was very dusty. We did not find that, except on some lattice type work above the entry way to the dressing area that my husband pointed out. Other than that the room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The setting of the French Quarter is very relaxing with a nice New Orleans feel. We particularly enjoyed our walks along the Sassagoula River. We had absolutely no complaints regarding the bus or boat transporation. It was a pleasure taking the boat over to Downtown Disney which we loved, and the buses to the parks were fine - no complaints! The food court food was okay, nothing special. You do get kind of tired of it after a while, so adding some other restaurants to your itinerary is a good idea. Our room, Building 7, was rather far away from the square area with the food court, pool, etc. but we enjoyed the walk to and from, and it was quiet with no disturbances. We definitely enjoyed our stay at the French Quarter and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at POFQ”
Reviews.Author: jma236
Reviews.Content: My DH and I just returned from a week long trip to WDW. It was his first time staying on property, while I have stayed at the Poly, BW, and POR. We booked the trip to take advantage of the free dining offer, and chose POFQ due to the compact size of the resort. We had a very good experience with the resort. Check in went smoothly - had no wait at the reservation desk, and the cast member helping us was happy to answer all of our questions. We quickly hopped a bus to Epcot where the driver asked everyone to repeat back to him which bus stop belonged to POFQ. We had a late dinner that evening, and left Epcot around 9:40 and then encountered a huge line for the bus. We were convinced it would take at least an hour to get back to the resort, but Disney quickly started sending additional buses to the stop with 2 buses loading at a time - our overall wait was 25 minutes and 8 buses. Bus service during the week was generally good. Most were crowded, but as the POFT stop is before POR we never had trouble getting a seat. With the exception of our first night, we never waited more than 15 minutes for transportation. We also found the drivers to be very friendly, and we never walked off a bus without the driver making an announcement as to which stop to return to. The lines for the bus service to POFQ/POR always seemed to have the most people in them, but our buses also seemed to be amongst the more frequently appearing ones at the parks. The resort itself was wonderfully themed - we loved how compact it was and the grounds were maintained beautifully. The Mardi Gras characters are a little over the top, but they were quite popular with the under 7 set. Food court was always clean, and we never had problems getting a table in the morning. The line for the beignets could be slow-moving, but we'd rather have them freshly made and wait the extra 10 minutes. Our room was a 2 minute walk from the main building and bus stop, and a 4 minute walk from the main pool. We found our room to be exactly what we expected. The linens, while certainly not 5 star quality, were clean and always changed daily as were the towels. We had no problems with dust or dirty carpets. My DH actually had to pull back the dresser after a phone charger dropped behind it and that area was also remarkably clean. All in all, we very much enjoyed the resort and have no real complaints. I would return there without any hesitation and have no concerns recommending it. It's not a 5 star resort, nor does it try to be - if that is what you are looking for, this is not the right place. Disney does not offer a business center in their moderate hotels. The corridors are exterior rather than interior. At the end of the trip, we were happy with the resort and feel that we received a good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisfigz
Reviews.Content: Wife, 3 1/2 year old daughter and myself stayed in the French Quarter last week and were very pleased with this hotel. Found the room to be clean and house keeping prompt and efficient. Nothing dirty or dingy like some other reviews. We stayed in building 6 which is a perfect location. Close enough to the pool, lobby & food court, but far enough away to be quiet. We found the rooms to be very quiet at night - no issues with noise. FOOD COURT - we ate most breakfasts and an occasional lunch here. what we ate was good. Even though it is a "food court" almost everything is made to order. POOL - pool was awesome. My daughter loved the slide (so did I). NOTE - when ligeguards are off duty the slide is closed. So that night swim will not include the slde. SERVICE - from check in to check out everyone greeted us with a smile and was a pleasure to deal with. We requested a bed rail when we checked in and one was brought immediately. TRANSPORTATION - this is the reason my review is not 5 stars. While it is easy to use and gets you where you want to be, it could be slow at times. If going to the Magic Kingdom or Epcot, the bus is direct from the FQ. If going to Animal Kingdom, MGM, Downtown or the water parks - you stop in Riverside also (4 stops). Overall a very good stay. Will consider a stay on the monorail line resorts next time (if the budget allows) but would definatley come back to POFQ!

Reviews.Title: “Probably will not visit again”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFanNY05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to disney for our second anniv. We chose French Quarter based on price and looks. The atmoshpere there was very relaxed and fun loving. We liked the decor and the room, although the love bug were a bit of an annoyence. Anyway about the hotel, it is very nicely decorated with a look toward the french quater from the decor around the room etc. We loved the fact you could catch a nice boat trip to downtown disney, we took it one night to go see Cirque. The show was awesome. Some of the things we did not like is the buses, they were always packed and seemed like it took forever to get to the parks because after they pick up at the french quarter they go to all the stops at riverside to pick up too. That makes the trip alot longer then it should be considering you are within a couple miles of every park. Another thing was we came back to the room after a day at one of the parks to find out that our door was not fully closed after room service had been by. Thankfully nothing had been taken. We did inform the desk clerk about this and then proceeded to leave the "do not disturb" sign on the door the rest of the trip. We did get new towels and sheets and such during the week but did not feel comfortable letting them in again. The other thing both my wife and I commented on was the feel of the "Resort", the way the hotel was set up felt more like a HIGH prices motel as opposed to a resort. Given the chance again my wife and I will probably choose another resort to stay at, we still LOVE Disney however will give a different place a chance.

Reviews.Title: “very dirty disney has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: minniePhila_
Reviews.Content: just came back from disney , will not stay at french quarter ever again . there was dust everywhere got sick the first night there could not breathe doors need to be repainted. carpet was disgusting could not take shoes off. sheets were not changed entire time was there 9 nights, and the reason i know there was a stain on the sheet did not say nothing i was curious to see how many times they change the sheets i used this as my guide.i just slept on top of the sheets with my own blanket. makes you wounder if they change sheets between guest, told disney they did not want to hear it.

Reviews.Title: “More problems than last time....but still enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: mikec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here Sept. 15-21, 2007. We also stayed here in Sept. 2005. I previously gave it a 4 star rating. I now give it an overall 3.5 star. Those who go will most likely experience the following: Magical Express Check-in- At the airport, apparently Disney was not expecting these crowds. We waited over an hour and half for the bus to take us to the hotel. Had we arranged our own transportation, we could have saved a large amount of time versus saving a few bucks. They do handle your luggage but one must weigh the pros and cons. The first time we used the service it went smooth. Not this time. Check-in at the hotel- Well, this is where I encountered a not so friendly impression. I requested building 5 when I made the reservation. We stayed in building 5 the first time and enjoyed it for our anniversary. I know nothing is guaranteed as they are eager and happily to tell you. I also reiterated building 5 the week of our arrival and the day before our arrival. At check-in, the notes weren't read nor was the request honored. Lesson learned: hmmm you decide. The hotel is still nice. There are tree lined, cobblestoned streets and the quiet ambiance with an occasional horse and carriage still outweigh the check-in experience. The hotel room is basic and the provided toiletries are very minimal. They give you a one small bottle of shampoo. They use to give you lotions, mending kits, etc. Not anymore......but the price of the hotel increased substantially since 2005. The pool- Very nice with an ample amount of chairs and space. As mentioned in other reviews, they have a strict code of safety. Lots of lifeguards. When thunder is heard the pool area is closed but pool bar which is still located in the pool area was still open. Hmmm$$ Restaurant food- All around the Disney complex, we were very pleased. The food was plentiful, reasonable and actually tasted better than theme park food. One complaint though. We were on the dining plan which I recommend to everyone. It was offered for free in the months of August and September. Ironically, some menus changed in August and some semi-expensive items (steaks) were taken off the menus. Les Chefs France (Epcot) and Wolf Gangs Cafe (Downtown Disney) no longer have steaks available. I made a call to the Disney Dining plan as we were waiting to be seated at Les Chefs France. The representative even mentioned that the restaurants have steaks. Lesson learned: Don't plan to eat specific items. Disney restaurants don't even know what they are going to have. THIS IS NOT A PORT ORLEANS COMPLAINT. Bus Service to and from the parks- Excellent Riverboat sevice- Excellent Rainy day ponchos- $7.00 ......extortion Check out- Airline check-in for magical express- Rather than going into it, the 2 employees were not very friendly and borderline argumentative with people. Conclusion- Overall Disney experience was still good. Hotel has a few more isolated problems than before. As price keeps going up, we will consider another resort or destination. For more questions/information and plentiful pictures, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Best Western”
Reviews.Author: DonnaE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is attractive from the outside with well maintined grounds but the rooms are old and worn. The tacky mardi gras decor did little to brighten the dark room of scuffed, dated furniture. The tiny bathrooms are reminiscent of 1950' style motels. Quality is lacking in almost everything from the paper thin towels to the flimsy bedspread. Disney has priced this property in the range of Hyatt, Hilton and Marriott but beware. If you expect a comparable room, you'll have to look elsewhere. The staff does a wonderful job of delivering the famous Disney magic and there are benefits of staying at an on-site Disney resort. If you don't expect much from this property, maybe you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “disney magic limited here...”
Reviews.Author: Bevzvet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ from 9/9/07 to 9/14/07 to take advantage of the free dining plan. Check-in went smoothly and our room was ready at 9:00am, but when I asked questions at the check-in desk, I really do not want to see the Cast Member rolling his eyes at another associate because he feels that I am asking too many questions. All I asked was if he could check if there were any corner rooms available. As he was explaining my package I asked "How do I get there?" or "where can I redeem this voucher?" Very simple questions to answer, but for someone who is unfamiliar with the property, I don't feel these were out of line. Unfortunately, this poor attitude seemed to keep popping up, throughout the parks. Questions like... Am I on the right bus to EPCOT or Where do I catch the bus for POFQ and most of the time my questions were answered with “I don't know" with no further response. Our room (6202) was clean and in good condition. It was nicely decorated, quiet and everything was in working order. BUT this is Disney and we expected something a little more special... Don’t expect any extras. We received 1 shampoo and 1 soap, per day and we were encouraged to use our towels and let them air dry, to use again. The beds were comfortable, but sheets and mattress pads would not stay in place on the bed & the fridge was not cold enough. (no control to adjust). I called maintenance & housekeeping, but only the fridge was fixed. There is only one elevator and one ice vending area per building. The 25” TV has a clear picture but too many Disney channels. The Theme Parks were not crowded and we never waited more than 10 minutes for any attraction including Expedition Everest & Tower of Terror, until we visited The Magic Kingdom where most of the wait times were 30 minutes or more. Considering this, there is no reason to expect a ten minute ride, back to our hotel would take 1-1/2 hours. This happened 4 times and not at a busy time of day. Disney’s internal bus system is inadequate, to say the least. Our last night, several irate patrons had words, because one thought the other was cutting in line. It was a very uncomfortable situation, the driver did nothing and there was no security around. If you have a car and are staying in a Disney hotel you will get free parking at the theme parks. We used this option, to avoid the long crowded bus rides, on several occasions. The pool is great fun, spotless and large enough not to feel overcrowded. Lifeguards (3) were attentive and constantly walking around the pool. Towels were plentiful. We had reservations at Cap’n Jacks, Kona Café at the Polynesian, Olivia’s at Old Key West, Mama Melrose’s at MGM and the Concourse Steakhouse in the Contemporary. The service and food was great at all except The Concourse Steakhouse. Even with reservations, a long wait and poor manners seem to be the norm here and the food was only mediocre. Make your dining reservations as soon as you can. I spoke with a woman who had been at Disney for two days, on the Dining plan and had used only counter service credits, because she could not get reservations for table service. Try the resorts for your table service but be prepared if using Disney transportation. From other Resorts, you can only transfer to Downtown Disney then to your hotel by bus or boat. Counter service meals that deserve honorable mention are Columbia Harbor House in Liberty Sq. at Magic Kingdom and Sunshine Seasons at The Land in Epcot. With many good things and some bad not up to par with our expectations, we just did not get that Special Disney Feeling here…

Reviews.Title: “Loved The French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: celticchick_7
Reviews.Content: Have just returned form a two week stay at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter. This is a wonderful hotel which we didn't want to leave. We arrived at about 7.30p.m. very tired having been travelling for 12 hours. We went to check in got seen to straight away everything was in order ready for us got our room cards the man on the desk gave my 15 year old his card and told him to sign it so he could use it to charge things to the room with my permissions, my son loved this it made him feel very grown up. Next the man asked my youngest if this was his first visit when he said yes the man gave him a special badge saying first visit and a load of stickers, he was thrilled. We then went to the room it was very close to the shop, pool, restaurant, ect but facing a lovely courtyard which had a fountain in the middle. The room was on the third level there was a lift up. Opened the door the room was lovely air conditioned. There were 2 king sized beds which were extremely comfortable. Every where was very clean there was a low bath with shower over , with a small shelf where there was 2 bars of mickey soap also 2 bottles of shampoo . There was a toilet which was very clean. In the main room there was 2 sinks with a shelf over a hairdryer, iron and ironing board 12 wooden coat hangers. There was a large shelf which I put the cases on to keep them out of the way. A large chest of draws with 4 large draws and 2 small draws plenty of space for all our stuff . on top of this was a large TV. In the middle of the room there was a ceiling fan. The room was cleaned every day beds changed every 3 days. I did phone room service 1 day to ask if they could change the sheets that day as my son had spilt his drink on it they did this no problem. The hotel itself seemed very quite, even around the pool there was never much noise. The pool was quite large with a serpent slide which the boys loved. there was always clean towels by the pool and plenty of them . There is a bar by the pool but didn't use it so cant really comment on it. Loads of sun loungers there was always some to use. Pool was very clean and it had at least 4 lifeguards . We found the restaurant excellent it was only counter service but plenty of choice we ate here most nights always freshly made food lovely friendly staff a couple of nights my son would go to the restaurant and fetch us some tea and bring it to the room the staff would put covers over the plates for him. We brought refillable cups at the start of our holiday for $11.99 each we definitely had our moneys worth you can refill them with different fizzy pops , juice , coffee iced tea hot chocolate water. There is a bar inside also but never used it although did listen to the jazz band for a while very good. There was a shop which sold lots of Disney stuff ,drink,snacks tablets a bit of every thing really. The staff in the shop were excellent helpful and friendly even gave me free batteries when my sons ran out in his pal mickey. The buses for all the parks picked you up just outside the lobby never waited more than 10 Min's for a bus and only had to stand once. You can get a boat to downtown Disney which is a lovely trip we did this a few times. all in all this was the best hotel Ive stayed in and would defiantly go again .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little resort”
Reviews.Author: luna99
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I and both of our families stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from 08/30 - 09/03/07 for our wedding and everyone had such a great time. I booked this hotel because I knew it was much smaller and a bit more quiet than the other resorts and we had two adults with us who have problems walking... check in was a breeze and the theming of the resort is beautiful. I loved how quiet it was at night and my fiance and I took a romantic horse drawn carriage ride around the resort and the Port Orleans Riverside.. definitely look into doing this. The boats that take you back and forth between resorts and to Downtown Disney were so nice and relaxing, I loved those. The food court at the French Quarter was decent to good.. we enjoyed the pizza and chicken strips but thought it could have been a little bigger and more organized... all in all though they had what we needed and the food was good. We tried the begniets (sp) that everyone said you must have... they were good but very messy! We only had one and didn't need to get them ever again. The people working at the resort were all very nice, specifically a guy at the concierge desk who's name I didn't get... he was very informed on all things Disney and had a great personality. I enjoyed talking to him a lot. The pool is awesome at the French Quarter. We had two small boys with us (8 and 5) and they may have loved the pool just as much as visiting the parks. I even went down the slide a few times and the water was nice and warm. We sat in the hot tub for a bit one night too and that was very enjoyable. It never felt crowded at this resort... and sometimes it was down right quiet. I would stay here again without hesitation although if it were to be just my fiance and I maybe I'd go to the Riverside part of the resort to have a sit down meal and go to the lounge.. I hear there is a great piano bar there with an entertaining singer on occasion. The buses came pretty promptly and it was nice being the first ones picked up and the first ones dropped off... I might want to stay at the French Quarter just for that alone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.. Very quiet.. Very beautiful”
Reviews.Author: landonww
Reviews.Content: Stayed in building 1.. Right on the Sassagoula river.. Very quiet and very beautiful, especially in the early morning. The boat ride was very excellent, especially if you dont want take a bus to downtown disney.. The decor, dixieland music, colors, and layout of the resort all remind you of being in the "big easy".... I've stayed at several of the disney resorts and this is definatly one of my top 3 favorites.. Highly recommended if you're on a budget, and if you want peace and quiet..

Reviews.Title: “FQ or Riverside - FQ every time”
Reviews.Author: traceowe18
Reviews.Content: We had read previous reviews and really did not know what to expect as very mixed. I found our stay faultless. The rooms were very clean and well kept. Sheets were changed every 3 nights so you were always sleeping in a fresh bed. Our tv remote was missing and within 10 minutes of reporting it - a porter arrived with a brand new one. All rooms are now non-smoking and were supplied with a safe, refrigerator (which was very quiet) and tv with disney channels. The maid surprised our children with novelties made from face cloths i.e Dog, Rabbit, Teddy dressed in a skirt and other items with the towels etc. Our kids couldn't wait to see what was there! BIG TIP - buy the refillable mugs $11.99 you could have free refills for the duration of your stay - these included sodas, coffee, water, hot chocolate and tea. Pool was great with a slide for the kids (or bigger kids)- open until midnight every day. Endless supply of towels were available at the pool (you just help yourself) - watch out if you want to go swimming when a storm is iminent - the pool is closed for safety reasons. Food - great value for money. Breakfast was our favourite! You could choose various items from the food court. From full breakfast, waffles and pancakes - to fresh yoghurt, cereals and pastries. Lunch and dinner ranged from salads, pot roasts, burgers/chicken strips and pasta with meatballs. Good childrens choice, which came with a free drink as well for $3.99 We were pleasantly surprised that the meal prices were reasonable. Nice pool bar with tasty cocktails - try them! Our room was situated in block 4, we found this quieter but easy to get to the restuarant and reception desk. I would say that all the rooms are well situated as this is a smaller resort - unless you dont like a bit of a walk opt for building 5 or 2 but beware of overlooking the pool as there are a lot of people that use the pool up to closing at 12am! River boat to Downtown and Riverside resort is excellent, the views are great and would recommend it. We also hired a boat which I have to say - is a must everyone enjoyed it! Buses are excellent - they pick up at French Quarter first before going on to Riverside and normally drop you off first unless you go to/from Downtown Disney- this was invaluable when you are tired. TIP: pick the bus up from Marketplace and not Pleasure Island in Downtown as if the bus is full they will bypass Pleasure Island (although the drivers deny it) - we waited 45 mins before one even appeared during a rainstorm so beware! Disney magic hours were great, use them!! If you allow your credit card to be charged to your room at time of registration, you will be able to express check out. If you need for room past the 11.00am check out they will allow you to keep the room for free until 1.00pm if you ask provided you registered your card at the beginning of your holiday. (They dont tell you that though - you have to request it.) You can also keep your room longer if you pay a portion of the room rate - just ask reception. We were originally going to stay at Riverside, and changed to FQ, and I have to say that due to the size and number of buildings in Riverside I would recommend FQ every time! Enjoy it - we did and will again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: reztib
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty well run. At the time we were a couple traveling with parents and friends. This was a pretty good choice for us. We were looking for a pretty "kid free" hotel and pretty much had got it. The pool options were great. One was a little more kid active the other was more laid back.

Reviews.Title: “perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagomomIL
Reviews.Content: We (fam of 4) stayed Aug 11-14, 2007 in bldg 7, 3rd floor. Kids (7,4) loved the balcony, we found it lovely and quiet. Room was nicely sized w/coffeemaker and mini-fridge; liked the curtained sink/dressing area, beds were comfy. Hotel staff was very responsive; we needed a new comforter due to an apple juice spill and they were cheerful and prompt. Hotel is a good size for travel w/kids; spread out enough to be quiet but easy walk to bus stop, food court, etc. Kids loved the hotel pool slide; boat transport to Downtown Disney was convenient and friendly. Food court was ok; good chicken quesadillas and desserts, nice freshly-made beignets. Definitely get the refillable cups if you're staying more than two nights. You can buy a stroller, beer, clothing, and souvenirs at the gift shop, which was well-stocked (if pricey). Bus transport was quick and friendly. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic at the French Quarter ?”
Reviews.Author: lufc246
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from the UK and stayed for 14 nights from 3rd August 2007. Overall the holiday was great. The rooms were spacious and clean but the toilets were noisy and could easily be heard during the night from other rooms, the room was inter connecting by a locked door and this could also cause a noisy distraction from the neighbouring room. We stayed in building 2 which was ideal for the pool, reception, shop and food hall which were all in close vicinity. The pool was OK staying open until whenever, great for the kids, the poolside bar closed at dusk which in my opinion is a little early. The food court supplied good basic food at low prices compared to the UK, but again most of the food outlets closed too early at around 10pm even though the eating area remained open until midnight. You must get the re-fillable cups for great value at $11.99. The boat transfers to the Riverside resort and Downtown Disney were handy. Most of the staff were helpful and had excellent attitudes towards the guests. Sadly I did not feel the Disney Magic here at his resort. Overall the French Quarter was an ideal base for the Disney attractions but I will be trying somewhere else next time, 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Port Orleans French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: EB35
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter (Jul 26-Aug 9). Stayed in Building 7 which was set back from the main area (food court, reception etc.) but was usually quiet. The room was very clean and spacious (although a little dark) and had enough room for 2 adults and 2 children. The air conditioning was very good but fairly noisy at night but was essential as it was 75+ degrees even through the night. Our housekeeper Irene did a great job with clean towels and our room cleaned every day. We even had 5 different animal towels made for us during our stay. The food court was fine and the staff at the French Quarter were pleasant. We used the Disney bus and didn't have to wait too long (although it does get busy, people at FQ are the 1st to be picked up and 1st to dropped off later). We also used the boat service to take a trip to Downtown Disney which was relaxing. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would thoroughly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tarilyn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a quick trip to Disney. We usually stay at the Swan and Dolphin ,but we have stayed at the Caribbean, Gaylord, Doubletree at Downtown Disney and Pop Century in the past. I took my daughter(11) and her friend from August 7-11,2007. I usually like to stay at places with doors on the inside of a hallway, unlike the ones at FQ that have outdoor rooms. But I can tell you that I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We got a rate of $104/night. Because of the small size of the resort, I felt like I could let the girls walk freely to the food court, pool, gift shop and arcade. The small streets throughout the resort were canopied with crepe myrtle trees and was very reminiscent of New Orleans. The pool had 4 lifeguards that stayed until 10pm and the slide was put to good use! The food court was okay as we only used it twice. I would definitely stay there again. Also Magical Express is well worth the money and time, esp if you have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-not too big, not too small”
Reviews.Author: ebbonielw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, stay on the French Quarter side if you can, it's smaller than the other side, Riverside, which is only a 5 min. walk or a 5 min. boat ride. The staff is AWSOME. We enjoyed our stay! If you choose this hotel, request building 4 or 5, its closest to pool and dining. We were in building 7, and after a long day at the park, the walk to our building seemed to take forever on tired feet. You would enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Customer Service - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: c-chamm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the French Quarter August 3-6th/07 on the 2nd floor of the 6th building. I'm rating the experience as a 4 out of 5 simply because of Disney's customer service. Fantastic, they really know how to look after guests. The resort wasn't too bad, the room while clean enough really looked as though it could have used a new coat of paint and the tub a really good scrub (stained a bit black just from age I'm sure). The resort did provide a small fridge in the room which was great but the cabinet that it was stored in needed to be thrown out. The door was falling off. The TV had a layer of dust on it but that was cleaned the next day after my husband left some finger marks in it. All in all there really wasn't anything to complain about, the grounds were beautiful. I think that the hotel has just gotten a little old and is in need of a makeover. We were quite surprised with the restaurant on site, while obviously pricey (you are at the Disney grounds afterall) the food was good and they did have an assortment (something for every dietary need).

Reviews.Title: “Disney French Quarter Resort Just marvelous”
Reviews.Author: noriegat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days at the Disney French Quarter resort. It was one the best vacations we have had. The resort was extremely clean as would be expected from a disney accomodation but the resort was just the right size. Unlike some of the other mega hotels this hotel was small in overall size making it a short walk to the restaurant or to the buses to the park. One importnat factor to stay here is that the busline shares stops with the Riverside resort and they pick up passengers at the french quarter first so, you are the first to load on and the first to be unloaded. The staff was incrediblly professional. The food was so so and expensive but it is what you expect when you go to disney. One plus on the food is that they have a bakery and the bignets in the morning were a special treat. The rooms were just large enough for a family of four (Two Teenagers). Anything more would have been to small. This was one of the best vacations we have taken and staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter added to our overal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family resort !”
Reviews.Author: WuestFamily
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (boys 8 & 10) and stayed at FQ from July 16-22. We had an excellent time. The rooms were a great size for the four of us. When we checked in, I requested buildings 2 or 5 as I read they were near the pool and good choices for families with kids. We stayed in Rm 5127---it was perfect. Close enough to the pool but tucked in the back. It was very quiet. Just around the corner from the river walkway and a short walk to the boat to Downtown Disney. The room was always very clean---no problems there. I liked that I could draw the curtain in the sink area to get dressed etc. with a little privacy. The food court was fine. I wouldn't want to eat there every single night but it worked out good. The food court staff were not as friendly as the rest of the staff (check-in, concierge desk, maid service etc. were all outstanding). We had booked a very inexpensive flight online with Southwest Airlines. In order to get the best seating, we needed to check in and print the boarding passes ourselves. As I did not bring a computer, the concierge desk was very helpful and checked in our airline tickets and printed our boarding passes. At the last minute, we decided to rent a car through one of those "name your own price" sites on the web. We got a midsize car for $15 and it was worth every penny. We could hop from park to park with no problem or traffic. I don't think I would go back to Disney without renting a car. Maybe it is not necessary during the "off season", but it is crowded in the summer and having the car was ideal. Overall, an excellent vacation. I would go back to FQ again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort, centrally located and ideal for the parks”
Reviews.Author: SEB530
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel between 6th and 20th August and what follows is an honest unbiased account of my findings. As with all hotels you do wonder what you will be arriving at and hoping that the accommodation lives up to expectations. The French Quarter is the smaller of the two parts to Port Orleans approximately 1/3 the size of Riverside with only one bus stop and one pool (Riverside has more pools and 3 bus stops). This gives the resort a small and friendly feel to it. **Reception Polite staff who were always cheers and helped me deal with our holiday insurance company when I had to fax details to them. The concierge is worth a visit as they hold small half-A5 size cards containing brief and accurate directions to many of the local parks and shops. **Room Our room was located in building 3, two minutes walk from the reception, busses, swimming pool and boat to Disney Village. Our room was spacious enough for two adults and two children and appeared to be newly decorated and well presented. The carpets had been cleaned that day ready for our arrival. The room consisted of two ¾ sized double beds, TV, air conditioning, fan, two sinks, safe and bathroom with toilet. Larger framed people may struggle with two adults to a bed but this wasnt a problem for us and the beds were very comfy. The usual towel animals awaited our arrival and the room was cleaned each day by the housekeepers. **Restaurant There is only one restaurant and shop on the French Quarter but it serves a suffucient variety of foods for most purposes from pancakes and waffles to fruit and cereals. One thing worth purchasing is the souvenir cup for $11 each which entitles you to free refills for the duration of the holiday. The on-site shop sells souvenirs, some snacks and drinks and newspapers (including the UK Daily Mail) **Pool The pool is open 24hrs albeit lifeguards head off duty about 10pm. The water is warm and there are plenty of sunbeds to be had in the evening. Cant comment on the daytime as we didnt hang around the hotel. There is a small bar serving beers and cocktails. **Transport Being in a Disney hotel, there are buses to all the disney theme parks every twenty minutes and a river boat which can take you to Disney Village. It is worth noting that French Quarter guests are the first to be picked up and also have their own boat service which misses out having to travel via riverside.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: yay018
Reviews.Content: everyone of my family enjoeyed every second of it, it was truly fantastic. the atmosphere created there was great.. by the look on peoples faces there its obvious they liked it...i would recommend this hotel to all ages..parents children you name it thy'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool but Prefer Other Resorts”
Reviews.Author: JoanK
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have stayed at just about every Disney resort but this was our first visit to the Port Orleans. I chose the French Quarter over Riverside because I was looking for something smaller. No problems with check-in, staff courteous. We stayed in building 4 which was close to parking lot and food court. The room was fine, housekeeping just ok. Pool was really nice and good for kids. We ended up driving most of the time (rental car) because the buses were overloaded due to sharing with the Riverside. Travel times were also long because of the distances between stops. We have stayed at the Caribbean Beach so we are use to multiple stops but this was tedious. The food court service was extremely slow even when it was not busy and menu choices were just ok. The Riverside definitely has a nicer food court as well as gift shop. Our two prior visits were at the Pop Century and even with their smaller rooms, I would definitely go back. Bus service and food court are both outstanding and the atmosphere so much more "Disney".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjlimoli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at All Star Resorts, Caribbean Beach and Fort Wilderness Cabins. So far this place is the BEST, not only are the rooms plenty large enough, we stayed in building 4, which was right next to the pool and food court. The pool was great, our kids loved the slide, you are also able to use the pool and facilities at Riverside which is only a 7 minute boat ride away, the pool there was just as great. The food at the food court was a little expensive but very good. The only problem we had there was that when we arrived we had some waters that we wanted to put in the small fridge in the room, when we awoke the next morning the waters were still warm so we called maintnance and no sooner did I hang the phone up there was a knock at our door and the man fixed it in 5 minutes and it worked great from then on. I would definatly stay here again, the jazz music playing in the background of the whole resort is nice and this place rates a 5 star in my book.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED French Quarter!!!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tracykay
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children stayed here for 5 nights. What a beautiful resort. I was really surprised at how nice it was considering the great price. We had a courtyard view with a view of the river and a fountain right outside our door. We were in Building 5, which was centrally located to the food court and pool. The pool is open way past the posted closing time of 10:00, in fact, most nights we swam past midnight. The boat ride to Downtown Disney was wonderful, my only regret is that the carriage ride was booked for the nights we were there. Recommend this resort over Riverside. It is much smaller, which means less walking to get to the bus stops and food court and less crowded. Also, FQ gets the bus first, which always guarantees a seat on the bus-most riverside passengers had to stand. We were also always the first group to be dropped off on the way back. Rooms were specatcular, clean, and everything in working order. Very quiet resort and very friendly staff. Not one problem. We are going to book this for next year without a doubt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Has Done It Again”
Reviews.Author: disneytravelfanatic
Reviews.Content: We transferred to theis resort after checking out of the Coronado Springs. The first impression of the resort that is was more like a college hangout sinc ethere was so much Mardi Gras Stuff, my mom was a little uneasy about staying here since she is a travel agent and they had nothing else available so we took the room. immediatly we were brought a referigerator and extra pillows. The Lobby: Was inviting with a little area for young kids ( which my sister and I were ten and eight) and a nice check in desk with friendly staff. They quickly chacked us in and showed us to our room. The room: once again not as big as a delexe resort room or as big as a villa but just the right size for a family of three or four. There was not one speck of dust or mildue in the tubs. Housekeeping certainly did their job, because when we came back from the parks in the afternoon (around 12) the room was already cleaned and the air was still on. Recreation:The pool is very nice with a dragon waterslide and a little kiddie pool located next to the main larger pool. There are bikes for rent and there is a walking path I believe. I also believe there is a little marina in the back of the resort. There are also horse and carriage rides. Dining: There is a food court offering many options and many places to eat. I believe there was a place to get sandwitches, kids meals, spagehtti, and many other types of food. And there is a resturaunt in the Riverside. Special features: There is a boat to Downtown Disney. Theis resort once again is a family resort and a resrot for friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Disney's Port Orleans - French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter July 6-8 2007. The hotel grounds were beautifully decorated and clean. Upon check-in we were the 3rd person in line. The process was quick and painless. We entered our room which was a courtyard view. We requested a King and were very excited to see a King room as these are hard to come by at any of the All Star Resorts. The room was clean, everything was in its place. It was spacious and the bed was comfortable. We have no complaints about the room at all. Our room was close to the front of the hotel and to one of the bus stops. Each time we waited for a bus, we waited a maximum of 15 minutes, which isn't bad. While at this hotel we ate at the restaurant they have for breakfast and although the prices are a bit steep for the quality of food, its expected at Disney. For 2 adult platters and drinks we paid $18.00. This included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and a biscuit. Honestly for that amount of money you can go to Denny's and spend the same or less, however the service is very quick and its mostly for convenience purposes. Check out was very easy as they leave an invoice hanging from your door so you know how much you've spent, therefore, if everything looks Kosher, you can just walk out and go to your car! No hassles! I guess the only annoyance in the hotel are the elevators which are not air conditioned and very hot! If you can just take the steps! All in all we had a great time at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Enkadtaw
Reviews.Content: This was the most magical vacation of my life, but we did not spend an abundance of time at the hotel, if your intent is to spend a lot of time at the hotel I would probably get a higher class hotel. But if you need a great staging point for all of your Disney activities plus a place to rest your head and go for a swim then this place is a great value. Spent a week at Port Orleans-FQ from March 7-14. This was part of Disney trip/Daytona wedding for the family with two children, 11 and 6. Pool: Amazing, scheduling time for the kids to play in the pool and go to Disney seemed to be a chore. Staff: Very nice, they did a great job of making our wedding feel a little more special with a certificate signed by Mickey and Minnie and some "Just Married buttons" Food: Just okay, but we were on the meal plan so we usually ate at other places away from the hotel. As many others have said, get the free refill mugs, they are a good value for the kids. Room: Okay, it felt a little old and musty, but then again we didn't pay for a top of the line hotel. With four people it often felt cramped of course. Entertainment: We spent a couple of hours playing video games, which the kids liked and they have a pretty good selection of games. There was also a live band on most nights near the dining room and even though we didn't get a chance to check them out much it was nice to see and hear when we arrived. Transportation: We took the boats one night to meet some friends at Planet Hollywood time, at dinner time it was a chore trying to get on one and made us about a half hour late. It was better coming back, and was an enjoyable trip on both ends. The buses were great and only had one wait of more than 15 minutes (leaving Animal Kingdom midafternoon on a Thurs.)

Reviews.Title: “my new favorite disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started out on a 2 day disney getaway for our 20th anniversery and traveled to Daytona for the rest of the week, Well, we weren't in Daytona one day and we were back on the phone with disney booking the rest of the stay at Disney. We stayed at DPOR the first night and loved it so we returned for an additional 4 nites. The food was good, the location was wonderful and Disney makes everything so magical. We originally checked into The Pop Century resort but that one is NOT so magical. small rooms, hundreds of children screaming, crying, vomiting in the lobby during check in, we transfered right to DPOR. The only problem we had was the pool was forced to close 2 times in the late afternoon due to AFR.( accidental fecal release) We just went by riverboat to Riverside for the day instead. The best meal we had was at Wolfgang Pucks (upstairs dinging room) I have never had filet mignon so tender I cut it with a fork!!! We also ate downstairs at the sushi bar another night. i am planing another trip in November and we will be staying at Port Orleans.This time the children insist on joining us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RavenCincinnati
Reviews.Content: My daughter (17) and I stayed at the Port Orleans - French Quarter the week of June 18. We hadn't been to Disney World in about 14 years. The hotel was beautiful and wonderfully laid out. It gave the illusion of actually walking down peaceful streets. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Cleaning staff always did an excellent job. Pool and hot tub are clean and nicely decorated. Restaurant had a nice variety of food and it was very good and I thought reasonably priced. Once again the workers are very courteous and friendly. The staff at the desk where you check in and out are friendly and very helpful. I was impressed with my whole vacation experience. I would definately recommend Port Orleans - French Quarter to anyone especially families. An added pleasure is the boat you can take to Port Orleans Riverside or to Downtown Disney. Very relaxing ride and beautiful scenery. Thanks for a great and memorable vacation. Hope to see you again much sooner this time! Jan and Jessica - Cincinnati, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Typical Disney We Wernt Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Huntress7
Reviews.Content: POFQ was a great place to stay. We came home on June 29, and would reccomend this hotel to anyone. The pool is great the maid service was good. We asked for extra soap and shampoo and were given lots. Our maid even put a towel highway on the bed woth our grandsons Disney cars on it.The food is decent in the food court. The food plan is a must. It saved us alot and we ate at wonderful places.The only tiny drawback is that when you are leaving the parks, the loading zone for the hotel bus was always the farthest away from the park exit.All in all a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Disney”
Reviews.Author: dkoller32
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Disney for the price that we paid. The rooms are very nice and also spacious. The pool area is very nice, but obviously geared towards more younger kids. The restaurant/buffet has decent food, but its pretty expensive. The only thing that i disliked was waiting for the bus lines. It's better than driving around with a rental car, but sometimes we were stuck on a bus for more than a half hour. Overall, a great place to stay in Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the PO French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: SmithFamily84
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in Port Orleans French Quarter. Last time we came it was closed for remodeling, so we stayed at Riverside and we missed POFQ! We had 10 rooms for our reunion and everyone loved it. Our bus service was awesome. The pool was great - the kids loved the slide. I think the only possible negative thing we could say - was we wished for queen sized beds, but they only have double beds...

Reviews.Title: “super place to say with kids”
Reviews.Author: Dav&Tracy
Reviews.Content: This is our second say at POFQ (we stayed here last year too.) While the grounds are totally beautiful, this trip was not as flawless as last year. All the rooms at Disney are now non-smoking. However, our room clearly was a smoking room inthe past. The smell lingered and as the resort was full, we had no choice but to stay. That being said, the room location was great. We did not pay for a river view room, but in building 1, some of the rooms on the corners are great.
