We saw water out our window, and still we were steps from the parking lot. ( at no extra charge.) Be sure to request a first floor room as the elevators in this resort are not centrally located. We have a 7 year old and she loved the pool. The slide is just fast enough for her to have a good time. The jr high crowd would be bored. There were enough life jackets to go around and the life guards were firm, fair and fun. The shower house/ bathrooms were spotless and I bathed the older daughter there twice when the little one was crabby. The pack-n-play crib was not so spotless. While the crib sheets provided were fresh and clean, the p-n-p was not. It had dirty spots and holes in the sides. I wiped it out with several anti-bacterial wipes before I put the baby down. The mini-fridge was housed in a end table-type cabinet. It did not close properly and was really scraped and banged up. I expect better from Disney. However, it really got very cold and even froze some of the watermelon we had brought for breakfast. The beds are small (double, full... whatever) As a restless sleeper, the bed is just too small for me. I requested extra blankets and pillows, and the 7 year old slept on the floor. For the price and beauty of the resort.... I can live with this!!! The double sinks and privacy curtain are terrific. My husband can dress in privacy and not hide in the too small bathroom. Mousekeeping was just fine. My only gripe was that they did not refresh the coffee packets. (a ploy to send us to the expensive food court?) When we asked, the front desk gave us plenty. Rooms were cool and tidy when we returned. We ate only one meal at the food court. It was regular Disney fair. Tasty and pricey, but not smashing. I would recommend ingnoring the calories and just eating the biegnets. (they are to die for!!) We LOVED the boats to Downtown Disney and used them twice. It's worth staying here for the beautiful grounds and the relaxing boats. I would come back again for a third year.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: michelleg5149
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2007. I was a bit worried after we booked and reading numerous reviews saying this hotel wasnt that great. We really liked it. We had a large room with one comfortable king bed. I liked having two bathroom sinks...one for my hubby, one for me. It was very clean, the staff was polite and friendly. We loved the transportation options to the different parks. There was a boat very close to our room we were able to hop on to and from downtown disney. We did not eat at the resort at all so I cannot comment on the food. The pool was very clean and nice. We bought some gifts at the gift shop and their prices were the same as at the disney parks on official disney items. I can honestly say we have no complaints about this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Disney Moderate hotels”
Reviews.Author: 2Jax
Reviews.Content: My wife and children stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter (FQ) in early June 2007. Being from North Florida we have stayed at most Disney properties and are well familiar with the high level of service. The FQ is what Disney refers to as a "moderate "resort (others are The Caribbean and Coronado Springs) in that it is not as expensive and perhaps as fancy as their "Deluxe" resorts (Grand Floridian, Polynesian, BoardWalk, etc.). On the plus side, these resorts have a little more to them than the "budget" resorts (All-Star Resorts). Having stayed at the other moderate resorts, my first choice would be FQ. Most of the moderate resorts are extremely large and spaced out. Sometimes the bus service needs to make several stops at the resort. The FQ, while still big, is smaller than the other moderate resorts. Also, FQ is part of the general Port Orleans complex which includes New Orleans Riverside. Riverside is divided by Magnolia Bend (Southern Mansion theme) and Alligator Bayou (Bayou Theme). Magnolia Bend and Alligator Bayou share pools, food courts, etc. The FQ is smaller and does not share its amenities with the others. The FQ is based on, you guessed it, the French Quarter. The New Orleans French Quarter theme is not overly done is and is quite nice. Actually, the "real" French Quarter bares no resemblance to this resort and that can be a good thing! While the real French Quarter is more of an adult drinking party, this place is very family oriented. Think more southern charm and iron work surrounding gardens than Mardi Gras. It is usually the first bus stop back at the Port Orleans complex from the parks and that can be very important after a long day. Also, if you take the river boat to Downtown Disney it is closer than Magnolia Bend or Alligator Bayou and you don't need to wait for other stops. As a result it is the last to pick you up and first to drop you off and that is a good thing. The size also makes the resort manageable. If you have kids they will love the pool with a dragon themed slide. My kids really enjoyed the pool complex. The grounds were very nice and the gardens added a special touch. On those hot Florida days, the shade is definitely welcome. For us, we think the FQ is nicer than the other moderate resorts and more akin to the other Deluxe resorts. The main difference with this resort and the Deluxe resorts, besides price, is the outside entry to the rooms and no enclosed hallways. Also, as with all moderate resorts, you need to take a bus if you are relying on Disney Transportation and that can sometimes be a little frustrating and time consuming. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children. Our main complaint here was the bedding. Although our room had two beds, they were barely capable of sleeping two average size adults. They were just a step over a single twin bed. I don't know why Disney could not improve the bedding size with these rooms. Our other complaint is that we were placed in a room that was recently reclassified from a smoking room to a non-smoking room and it reeked horribly. The Disney hotels have gone to all Non-Smoking rooms as of June 1, 2007. As a result some of the old smoking rooms are now non-smoking and still smell like old, musty cigarette smoke. Although they informed us that they had cleaned the rooms of old smells, they certainly were not successful with this room. We needed to change our rooms and it wasn't fun. When you do check in make sure you do not receive one of the recently reclassified rooms. As far as the food it is unremarkable. It does have a food court which is similar to the other moderate and budget resorts. Not too much to count on here. We ate most of our meals in other locations. Other than those items noted above, It is a good place for couples or families. It is a quiet property and a nice escape from the theme parks. As for our family we would go back again -- just not stay in a recently classified non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic. Kids heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Jonny56
Reviews.Content: Booked through Thomas Cook, and they reccomended it. Wow they did good. This hotel is fantastic for all ages, especially kids. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well, and staff could not do enough for you. Everywhere was allways immaculately clean and all the staff were so friendly. Ideeal for getting to all major attractions. Highly reccomended ++++

Reviews.Title: “loved the port orleons french quarter”
Reviews.Author: alidoncaster
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the pofq may 18 to 1 of june having been to orlando several times before and stayed in the disney caribbean beach resort last year, this hotel is far the best of the two. the pofq is much smaller and more easier to get around on foot, the grounds were immaculate, the pool area is fantastic for the kids with a great slide which my boys loved. there is a lovely area where the hot tub is which is very relaxing. My children also enjoyed the play area and games arcade you put money into a machine which produces you with a type of credit card with points on and the kids can just use so many points on each game. The foodcourt looked very inviting but we were rarely in the hotel at meal times so we never actually ate there, you can purchase a refillable cup and just keep refilling for free during you stay. We thought the room was very clean and spacious the two basins realy helped, they provide hairdryer, iron and ironing board, fidge and t.v. also provided is bars of mickey mouse soap and mickey shampoo which is a nice little extra touch. The housekeeping was excellant it was lovely to come back after a long day at the parks and have the beds made and the room cleaned. The location of this resort is the best of all the resorts I think as it is right next to downtown disney and takes only a few minutes by car, the resort offers a lovely boat trip which takes around 20 minuates along a river which runs at the back of the resort, you can either get on a boat to downtown disney or on one to riverside. the busses also run very regular, also there are busses to all the parks. horse and carriages ride all around the resort for 35 dollars too. you do get a little extra when staying in a disney hotel,free parking in all disney parks, extra magic hours 1 hr in a morning and 3 hrs at night, plus you can arrange for all your shopping to be delivered to your hotel when shopping in any disney store in walt disney world, I took advantage of this and it was a great help. All in all we had a fab time at the pofq and are booking to stay there again next year. If anyone has anything they would like to know about pofq dont hesitate to email.

Reviews.Title: “Nice moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawgirl78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Disney hotel in early May. I was there with my husband, my parents, and my sister and her husband. It was my parents' 30th anniversary. Overall the property was pretty, and the grounds were lovely, and very well maintained. The ambience as you walked around was quite nice, especially if you walked along the "river" that ran along the back of the hotel. We all had king-bed rooms that were in building 7, and faced the river. It was very quiet back there, which we liked. I thought the rooms were beautifully decorated, and quite spacious for a "moderate" resort. We didn't have any problem with the housekeeping service. In my room, we recieved a cute towel-animal the first night, and then cute little baskets for our toiletries every other night. We used the Disney Magical Express service, and it went a lot better than expected. We had our baggage within 1 hour of our arrival at the hotel. We also found the Disney transportation to be adequate to get around to all of the parks. There's a wait sometimes, and it can get crowded, but being we're from NYC, we're used to having to deal with public transportation issues. If you're looking to go from resort to resort, I would suggest renting a car. Our only complaints have to do with the overall service with the resort. When we checked in at noon, only two of the three rooms were available, and even though they had checked in first, it was my parents who had to wait for their room! Now we understand that check-in is late afternoon (I think 2 or 3) but my parents were told they wouldn't have a room until after 5:00 that night! WIth an 11:00 a.m. check-out there is no excuse why a room shouldn't be ready by 3:00 p.m., the latest. The absolute worst experience was on our last day there. We decided to use the "convenient" airline check-in located in the lobby. Needless to say, this was a HUGE mistake, and ruined our last day. Please save yourself a lot of heartache, and just check-in at the airport, where the workers have a much better grasp of the English language than the two women who work at this counter. Since they are not technically Disney employees, the hotel was unwilling (and unable) to do anything but get us to the airport 4 hours earlier so that we could resolve the issue with the airline directly. Overall, this was a very nice hotel, and I would stay there again if we go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “POR French Quarter is just lovely.”
Reviews.Author: disneydawg
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed at POFQ from 5/18 - 5/21. We requested Bldg. No. 7 as it is the furthest building from the noisy pool and closer to the sister resort PO Riverside which has a sitdown restaurant, quiet pools and great lounge entertainment. If you are staying at either POFQ or POR you MUST see the piano entertainer at the River Roost Lounge at Riverside, Bob Jackson. He is the best and the kids will love him too. Anyway, our room 7134 was just a clean as could be, spreads look bright and new, carpet was very clean, bathroom looked brand new. Housekeeping was wonderful and replenished towels and toiletries daily. This building is the least requested building because it is farthest but since POFQ is the smallest of the moderates and very compact it was a two minute walk to the foodcourt and bus. I can honestly say there was nothing I disliked about the resort however I do think the food court could use an upgrade. Would most definitely stay here again. I particularly loved it a night.

Reviews.Title: “Room passible, housekeeping poor”
Reviews.Author: BudsMom
Reviews.Content: Our room in the French Quarter was the third room we were given in our quest for a clean room in a moderate price Disney resort. All I can say is - wow, Disney isn't what it once was! The room was just OK. Tacky print on the wall, garish colors, but hey, it was Disney and it was supposed to look like New Orleans. Housekeeping was nearly nonexistent. We weren't given any fresh towels - unless you count the hand towels twisted into a basket shape with our daughter's toothbrush shoved in it, nor fresh toiletries. I don't consider myself to be the world's best housekeeper, but I was on my hands and knees cleaning the black marks on the floor in front of the sink when we arrived. The beds were made up with flat (not fitted) sheets, so we all ended up sleeping on bare mattresses in the morning - hoping the mattresses were new. Making up the beds (with flat sheets) was the only housekeeping service they provided to us. The positives are the grounds, which are pretty, and the buildings - if you like the full spectrum of colors on the same facade. The restaurant was OK if you just want a quick breakfast. (Tip - skip the scrambled eggs) The room was quiet, nothing can be heard above the AC anyway, and it was a pleasant walk to the buses for the park. Bikes can be rented at Riverside, a short walk along the canal. We enjoyed that very much. The staff made every effort to accommodate the many elderly and disabled peole we saw in motorized chairs. We waited for special buses for them each morning and they were treated kindly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you find a good deal”
Reviews.Author: riskyman
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for two days and I would say that this is a good hotel if you get a good deal for it. I paid $136.00 p/n and for that amount it worth. Do not pay anymore. If you are going to pay more, go to Floridays. A much better place to stay. The only advantage for this hotel was the bus shuttle to disney parks and the ferry to Downtown Disney. If you compare the facilities and rooms, Floridays is better. The extra hours at Disney park for people staying at Disney resorts is not a great deal because everybody stay at the park and at that time the park are very very very crowded. Again, if you get a good deal, go to the French Quarter. If not, forget about it. It doesn't worth the $185.00 per nigth they charge for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter was FANTASTIC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Funcolacpl
Reviews.Content: We did A LOT of research on Disney before we planned and booked our kids' FIRST Disney vacation. And with a little help from our travel agent, boy did we strike it rich! Our vacation could NOT have been more PERFECT! The Port Orleans French Quarter was perfect for me, my wife, and our 2 girls. The resort was fabulous and our room was great. Our vacation consisted of Blizzard Beach on Sunday, Magic Kingdom on Monday, Epcot on Tuesday, Sea World & MGM on Wednesday, Animal Kingdom on Thursday, and then back to the Magic Kingdom on Friday. We purchased the Magic Your Way passes, NOT the park-hopper passes. And we feel THAT is the way to go. Pick ONE park per day and spend the entire day at that park. There's really no need to "park hop" unless you're not going to be at Disney long enough to visit each park. My recommendation is to stay long enough to visit each park. Another thing we did (and we are SO glad we did) was purchase the meal plan. WHAT A BARGAIN! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE MEAL PLAN TO EVERYONE; IT'S WELL WORTH THE MONEY! In the beginning I thought, "we wont need the meal plan" BUT the more people I talked to and the more research I did; I decided to go ahead a get the meal plan. IT WAS THE RIGHT DECISION WITHOUT A DOUBT! Our kids loved the character meals! If staying at the Port Orleans, you have to eat at Boatwright's, which is located at the Port Orleans - Riverside, which is a short boat ride down the river. The food there is fabulous! Make your dinner reservations for your entire stay, the minute you arrive at the resort. I also recommend using the Fast Pass when available! This will save A LOT of time! I cant say enough about what a wonderful time our family had at Disney and at the Port Orleans French Quarter. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Just Like The Brochure”
Reviews.Author: Spenn
Reviews.Content: Okay so what can i say the title says it all, from the moment we arrived to the moment we left nothing was too much trouble, the staff were fantastic, the rooms were big enough for two adults and two children, the bathroom was adequate and the dressing area a good idea. The pool area wonderfull for that early morning dip if required, and very clean and safe for small children. Our two were teenagers and they loved the place, a great arcade facility also available. We enjoyed the hotel and services that much we are going again in 2008. The bus service to all parks was good about every 10 to 15 minutes sometimes crowded at certain times but your on holiday so what's the rush. Ideal for downtown disney, just jump on a boat if you want to be back for midnight take the boat, if not wait until 02.00 am and take the bus it really is that simple. Anyway don't take my word for it go try it, oh and if your thinking it is a bit more than say a budget hotel such as movies or sports , it is BUT you get a whole lot more for your money, you can see the fireworks from Epcot each night, take a quiet walk with the sound of crickets and bull frogs around the grounds, or simply sit in the moonlight with the sound of the fountain in the background. If that does not appeal then go down to the scat club for a drink and a listen to your friend Elliott Dyson who is an exceptional jazz playing muscian and a great personality. Take a horse drawn carriage ride up to riverside and back or hire a bike and cycle around the miles of pathways between the two hotels. We priced the budget hotels and read some of the reports BUT having been here once there really was no hard decision to make it just had to be Port Orleans.It gives you the balance you are looking for after a hard days walk around the parks in the Disney area, the resteraunt area is huge but as with all Disney hotels the food choice can be limited, but you can vary your choice of food with Downtown only a 10 minute boat ride away with the famous rainbow forest cafe of Fultons crab house and many more excellant dining facilities. Give it a try, we did and we loved it. Compare the pictures on this site or in the brochure what you are seeing here really is "what you get in the brochure. The Spencer Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who stayed at the PO French Quarter from Friday, May 11 - Sunday, May 13 - we do not have kids. It was very suitable for us and if you had kids it would be fine too. The grounds were spotless as you would expect from Disney. Check-in was painless. Our room had a great view so it is probably worth the extra few bucks for a waterview room. The bathroom was slightly under par - there was some soap residue in the shower which was obviously just dried on. And we also joked that they are definitely keeping with a 'French Quarter' look because the bathroom was a bit dingy and dark. But I realize how many guests pass thru Disney on a given year so there were no complaints to the front desk from us. We were in Building 6 which was very close to everything. I also appreciated the non-hassle of self-parking as I find valet is expensive and time consuming. Anyway, Disney's transportation was, as usual, fantastic. Yes, the French Quarter is picked up first and dropped off first by the busses - that is an awesome little bonus. There is a boat launch inside of the French Quarter that takes you up the stream to the Riverside (the other property in Port Orleans) but that property pretty much identical to the French Quarter - just something to do to kill some time. There is also a paved path that connects the two resorts which we strolled on and it was very nice - well manicured, etc. The boat will also take you to Downtown Disney and they run very late, midnight I believe, so you can have a good time without driving. The last bus pickup from Downtown Disney is 2 a.m. I believe. At any rate, we orderd a veggie pizza one night (they will deliver it to your room from the food court!) and it was very tasty. We did not use the pool but it looked fantastic. Beignets were OK but nothing compared to the real deal in Cafe Du Monde. High thumbs up for this place.

Reviews.Title: “MET OUR EXPECTATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: PRINCESSAT24
Reviews.Content: my review of our stay from 05/07/ to 05/10/07 MAGICAL EXP: quite magical: one less round trip expense to worry about. Also agent was attentive, polite and very patient with me, as I was a bit perplexed about the M.E vouchers. CHECK IN PROCESS: one guy in front of me who was served as I was walking up. Within a mere minute i was called to be served. I requested bldg # 7(CM asked WHY?) I told her because it's a totally non smoking bldg. And off we went. ROOM: MARVELOUS!!! clean room, carpet, floor, linens and bathroom too. I just adore that disinfect smell of a bathroom. I felt completely safe knowing this. OMGOSH! did any of u notice that gorgeous dresser drawer? HUGE, and pretty. Wish i could have one just like it of my own (LOL) FOOD COURT: well, not too much to choose from. Nonetheless, everything we did order was hot, fresh and eatable. Also, we would venture over to the R.S. food court for a better variety. No complaints here. GROUNDS: Lovely and nicely manicured grass areas. We looped it around and found the walk relaxing and so serene. Puts you into a whole different ora. CM'S: cast members and cleaning crew were polite and accomodating. I received a message welcoming us to the resort and hope our stay is a pleasant one. I would most definitely return again. And don't listen to the negative reviews. Be your own judge. I DID.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: tv75075
Reviews.Content: Great location - whether you use the Disney buses or drive, you can't get much closer to the theme parks and to Downtown Disney (unless you pay a lot more). It will take you maybe 10 minutes travel time in the morning and afternoon. At night, especially when the parks close, it will be more like 20. The room was very clean, and everything worked properly. The two sinks came in very handy. The beds were more comfortable than I would have expected at this price range. The grounds were very beautiful and very clean. The staff was nice, but seemed overwhelmed at times. The front desk can get very crowded. The food in the food court was always bad, no matter what we ordered. Plus the food prices (as they are in all of WDW) were terrible. Finally, there were children EVERYWHERE, so this is not a place to stay if you are brataphobic. All in all, I would probably stay there again if the rate was low enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient!!”
Reviews.Author: DoDowin
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews before we decided to book this property. We weren't disappointed. We had no problem checking in. The staffs were absolutely helpful in answering all our questions. We stayed at the farthest building (Building 7) but it's only a few minutes walk to the food court/swimming pool/arcade/front desk. Transportation was fantastics - disney buses connected us to all the parks and the boat took us to the downtown disney area. Although French Quarter only has a food court, the variety of food was good. Downtown disney has plenty of good choices too (very good food). I would recommend this resort to any one who wants a smaller moderate resort.

Reviews.Title: “Still great second time around”
Reviews.Author: ajpeppers
Reviews.Content: I'm a believer of if it is not broken don't fix it. We stayed at this hotel a few years ago and really liked so we decided to stay here again. Below is my review - Pros - Not crowded ( at Disney this is a major ++++ ) - Super friendly service ( on the first day I lost my sons ticket and it was replaced with a smile ) - Great pool Cons - The only con I have is that there is not an actual restaurant on site, just the cafeteria. Suggestions - Schedule a day of rest during your stay or you'll need a separate vacation to recover. Have no fear booking this place for your Disney Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Takashi
Reviews.Content: This hotel charged us $360 for a room they switched for us for free. I just filed a dispute claim to AMEX...for the third times because the hotel doesn't admit their mistake. We made a reservation for 3 nights in January 2007. We reserved for a river-view room and put down a deposit, 1-day room charge of $180. When we got there, a front-desk representative told us that our reserved room had "an obstructed view". She said that the hotel was packed and there was no other room available. She suggested that we go and check out the obstructed-view room, and if we weren't satisfied she would switch a room to Riverside, a sister hotel adjacent to French Quarter. She assured us that there was no additional cost for switching a room. After checking out the room, we decided to ask for a room change. She switched our room to Riverside and we stayed there for the whole time. It turned out that French Quarter charged us a full 2-night room charge of $360 ($540 minus $180 deposit we already paid) while we also got another full 2-night charge of $377.02 from Riverside. We paid the latter amount, and filed a dispute claim for $360. Well, so far, for the last two disputes, French Quarter claimed the charge is correct and AMEX just differed. We are astonished how this hotel has tried to get away with their mistake and so far they have succeeded! The third dispute is still pending. Problem aside, we thought that Riverside was much nicer hotel. We stayed in one of the mansions. Although both French Quarter and Riverside have similar building concepts (small window and a walk way in front of it), the Riverside room looked cleaner and brighter, and its environment looked livelier.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at POFQ”
Reviews.Author: MicheinMA
Reviews.Content: Spent Apr 15-22 at Walt Disney World Port Orleans French Quarter. First Time staying in the park and absolutely loved it. Didn't get in until 2:30 am due to flight delays. Front desk was great, held our luggage until we called in the am to let us get some sleep. Every person we encountered working there was cheerful and helpful. Awesome pool. Our kids (3 & 5) wanted to go in it every day. Nice playground area. Does share the bus with the PO Riversid ebut French Quarter is first pick up and drop off. Nice rooms, comfy beds. Food court was outstanding. Would go back here in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: Ginnythecat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 11 April to 25 April with my partner, 18yr old son, 15yr old daughter and my mother-in-law. We had 2 rooms which were connected by inside doors. We stayed in block 5. The accommodation was spotless - i couldnt fault a thing. The resort did not have a restaurant but you could go to Boatwrights at Riverside which was a 10 minute walk away - A walk alongside the river or a boat trip would get you there. They have a large sit down dining hall which you could get all you want to eat or drink. Dont forget to purchase the refillable mugs at $11.99 each. These can also be taken to all parks for free drinks all day long so well worth the price. We purchased the dining plan before we left the UK and the ultimate park ticket. We made our dining reservations well in advance - a total must!! The food in all the restaurants in the parks were absolutely gorgeous. The portions are huge - be warned!! The dining plan is well worth the cost. The French Quarter has one large launderette - plenty of washers and driers - $2 to wash and $2 to dry. Both take approx 30 mins. I took my own washing powder as this saves money if you have kids!!! Otherwise powder can be bought as well. The river runs alongside the resort from Riverside to downtown Disney so you can either take the bus there or a lovely boatride. There is a hot tub to relax in at the end of a tiring day at the parks, a bar room to enjoy some jazz music with friends and family and of course a gift shop to buy those last minute souvenirs. They cost no more or less than those at the parks. Buses to parks come every few minutes. We never had to wait too long, it then goes to Riverside to collect people. It is a very relaxing resort which i really appreciated after a long hectic day at the parks. I would defijntely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun!”
Reviews.Author: BeckaM
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review about any trip I have taken, but it has helped me alot in my travels to read these reviews so I thought it would be good to give my opinion. I thought the resort was really nice and the parks were great! Everyone had a great time with ages ranging from 3 to 75. Our room was nice and was plently spacious enough for 3 of us. The bathroom was not as clean as I would have liked but certainly not filthy. The food was very average at the resort. I would strongly suggest the dining plan. It made things alot easier and much more affordable. Make sure and make reservations in advance for all your "sit down" table serve meals. Riverfront was much bigger and seemed nicer as far as the looks of it. The resturant at Riverfront was very good. We also ate at the California Grill which was quite possibly the best steak I have ever ate! It is semi- kid friendly and the food is different if you are used to Southern food(I'm from VA.)Lots of sushi! We also ate at the italian rest. in MGM. I wasn't that impressed with the food but the service was great. We had breakfast at the Polynesian Rest. which was awesome. The food was good(family style)and the characters were fun. I would definently go back to a Disney resort, maybe the Riverfront for something different, but the French Quarter was quiet and the pool was fun for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lindscanberra
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic family holiday we just had at the Port Orleans. Disney is just top notch with all it does and the resort was lovely-beautiful surroundings, a fantastic pool area (a number of pools) with 2 lifeguards on duty plus flotation vests for those who can't swim well. We enjoyed the drip filter coffee and tea in the room and the extra dressing area in the rooms--great to get luggage out of the way. The rooms were spacious and clean and the only 1 thing which wasn;t up to spped was the transfer from Orlando airport (Disney's magical express bus) We had booked in Australia directly online with Disney, however they never sent us the yellow luggage tags for our bags which meant, although we could use the bus transfer we had to collect our bags and drag them half way through Orlando airport and up a level to the Magical Express check in area-not good when your child has been ill all day The laundry facilities were also of great use and were clean and convenient to the pool area-so while my son and husband swam, I did the laundry and enjoyed a relaxing drink. The food court at the hotel served a selection of food but was a little on the pricey side. The boat transfer to Downtown Disney was lovely and the kids enjoyed it. Be aware that on Saturday evening you may have to wait 30 to 40 minutes to get on a boat so get there early!! We really enjoyed our time here and would definitely return to the Port Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Good value overall”
Reviews.Author: PierHead
Reviews.Content: Can I echo the comments of Grizzlykid? We were a party of 6 adults and 5 children aged 4, 5, 8, 8 and 11. French Quarter is relatively cheap and I got the impression it was an ‘older’ hotel (no idea when it was built though). It is unashamedly aimed towards young families. Nothing wrong with that, it is Disney afterall. A problem at check-in was not appreciated after booking 10 months previous and a long flight. This was quickly resolved and we were placed in block 7 for 2 nights before moving to more suitable accommodation in block 4 opposite the canteen. It was more noisy though so bear that in mind if that bothers you. FQ does lack choice on the menu in what is best described as a canteen. Two weeks of fast food and plastic forks is more than most can bear. Riverside is a better choice for (largely similar) food but is only a 10 minute stroll or boat ride away. Children love that type of thing. Riverside though, appears much more ‘grown up’ -- however picturesque it is. Quayside prettiness may be just plain un-nerving for parents of children 5 years old and younger. On the plus side, the frequent buses and free drinks refills were a bonus. If you intend hitting the resorts and want a child friendly, personable crash-pad, French Quarter is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glitter-Queen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1123 - excellent ground floor location right beside car park and corner room so 2 big windows- only drawback building one a bit of a walk from reception. Great facilities- hairdryer, iron/iron board and fridge in room. Hotel has nice pool with free pool towels and lifevests for children which was so useful. Great food hall- buy a Port Orleans mug on your first day for $11 and you can fill it for free throughout your whole stay!! Thats value for money. Disney shop on site that also stocks all your necessities and swim nappies for use in the pool. Buses run to all other Disney parks although we mostly used our car. Go to Walmart down the road if you are not from USA as its so cheap in comparison to UK. Also great designer outlet mall just on the road at the entrance to Disney. We booked our character meals before we arrived which was great as guaranteed to get to all the ones we wanted- great for kids to get autographs from characters. French quarter much quieter and smaller than Riverside and so I preferred it- easier to get to things- not so far to walk round the hotel and I thought it was definately better. I would recommend this hotel as a pretty high quality but cheaper option to the 5 star Disney properties- it really is a very good choice if you want to stay in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Happy With Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: scuba6
Reviews.Content: My mother, two cousins and myself along with 4 children ages 2.5(boy), 4, 4(both girls) and 10(girl) stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter from April 3-7, 2007. From there, we spent an additional week at St. Pete beach. Like most of us, I spent tons of time researching resorts at Disney including many visits to this site. We did not want to spend the $$$ for top of the line nor did we want to go value especially in April at holiday time. The French Quarter best fit what we wanted and more than met our needs during our stay. We flew into Orlando International Airport at about 12:30 PM and rented our vehicles. It is a short drive from the airport to French Quarter probably no more than 15 minutes. If you are renting a car, the roads are well marked as are the Disney resorts....we had no problem finding the French Quarter. Our Check in around 2:00 was very smooth as there were about 5 people working at the check in area. Our room key acted as our meal plan, park tickets and general charge card throughout the duration of our stay at FQ. There is a concierge desk located in the lobby where you can pick up theme park maps, make restaurant reservations, etc. I would recommend making your reservations in advance of your stay as most are already booked prior to arrivals. My mother and I stayed in a room with my 4 year old daughter and my cousins stayed in another with their combined three children in building two right across from the pool, facing the pool on the third floor. In spite of the location, we never found it to be too loud at night. If I had it to do over again, I would keep the same location but ask for a room on the first or second floor.......even though there is an elevator, it was located way down at the other end of our building making it a distant walk. We had requested a room close to the food court and the pool and found our location to be prime especially with kids My mother ( who is picky ) loved our room as did I. They are tastefully decorated and contain a table, two chairs and in our case, two double beds. There certainly was enough space for the three of us! My cousins even felt that with five in their room, they had plenty of 'elbow room'. The bathrooms are not large however the sinks and vanity area are located just outside the bathroom itself therefore we were not tripping over one another getting ready in the morning or in the evening. I believe there are a total of 7 buildings and from what I could see, none were a great distance from either the pool or restaurant though probably did take a bit more of a walk to get to the busses to go to the parks. Some of the buildings have water view room whcih face the river. From what I understand, the FQ is one of the smaller of all of the Disney resorts making it easier to manueaver around. During our stay, the FQ was at 100% capacity however it never felt that way. There were always tables available in the food quart, chairs and lounges around the pool and plenty of space in the pool. The food in the Sassagaloula restarant is what you would expect at any cafeteria/fast food sort of establishment....it is not 5 dtar however everything I had I found to be very good. It does offer what I feel is an ample selection for adults including chicken, ribs, burgers, pizza and a variety of salads for lunch/dinner as well as full breakfasts in the mornings including eggs, hash browns, bacon sausage, oat meal, a variety of cereals and fresh fruit, pancakes, french toast, etc. For children there are special kids meals including things such as chicken nuggets, fries, pizza, etc. In addition, they have prepared fruit cups, yogurts, juices, milk, bottled water available. We had also purchased the Disney meal plan for each person giving us breakfast, a larger meal ( dinner or lunch ) and a snack each day as well as a beverage at each meal and found this to be very worthwhile. I believe there are different types of meal plans that can be purchased though this is the one our travel agent recommended. It can be used at most any restaurant in Disney including the Theme Parks. I would check ahead of time to be sure that they take your particular meal plan. One afternoon we went to Downtwon Disney to go to the RainForest Cafe and discovered they did not take our particular meal plan and we did have to pay. There was no actual dollar limit on our particular plan which came in handy when we went to special meals at the Crystal Palace to do the Character Breakfast with Pooh and Friends as well as Breakfast with the Princesses. Our bill for two adults and one child would have been around $100 and of course more for my cousins. The French Quarter does not have an actual sit down restaurant however Port Orleans Riverside does and we ate there one evening. Again, our bill would have been high for three people but the meal plan took care of it. It is worth looking into before you travel. We did notice other guests at the resort had the Port Orleans cups giving free refills on beverages such as soda, coffee, tea, etc. I think they were $11.99 If you are planning to stay any length of time, it makes the initial cost worthwhile. It can also be used at both Port Orleans French Quarter and Riverside. The pool area was wonderful and was a nice mid afternoon reprieve after wandering around the parks. It has a great water slide that can be used by both adults and children and is actually like three pools in one with depths varying from 3 ft to just under 5 ft. There is also a separate kiddy pool as well. Just down the walkway is a hot tub. One feature that we really enjoyed was that we could walk to the back of the resor and catch a boat to Downtown Disney. It is a nice leaisurely ride taking about 15 minutes. The boats also run between FQ and Riverside making connection between the two resorts easy if you wnated to go to dinner at Riverside or partake of other activities there ( they have horse and buggy rides, rent bikes and boats, etc ). In the lounge on Wednesday through Sundays evenings, Elliot plays his variety of saxophones as well as other instruments. We found him very entertaining and freindly with everyone. He played all genres of music with a variety appleaing to both children and adults. His shows were a nice way to come home from the theme park later in the evening The busses to the theme parks run frequently and stop at FQ prior to Riverside. The first bus runs of the day were generally crowded and were standing room only though we always managed ot find seats provided we held the younger kids on our laps. I found most all other guests to be pleasant despite the crowded busses and parks. If you are willing to wait a bit, later busses tended to be less crowded that trying to catch the 6:15 AM bus the day Magic Kingdom is opening at 7 AM. The staff were all very helpful and friendly despite having large demands placed on them. I did not once during our entire stay find a person who could not answer our questions. I was sorry to leave when it was time however we plan to return to Disney in the next 2-3 years. Hands down we will stay at the FQ again. It is one of the nicest stays we have had out of all of the vacations we have taken. Disney has a great product and runs a well oiled operation including it's resorts.

Reviews.Title: “good accomodations”
Reviews.Author: John73
Reviews.Content: My wife,daughter and I stayed for 11 days at this resort in early April/07 and for the most part we enjoyed it there.The rooms were clean and comfortable with 2 double beds and minifridge included in price of room.We stayed in bldg 2 facing the river where the downtown disney boats load up to and we were on the 3rd floor with a fantastic view of river.We were on the disney dining plan which is a money saver and the food in the food court area was okay but not great.The disney buses were no more than a 5 min wait and we were the first to be picked up at our resort and the first dropped off at night as the buses also take the passengers back to the sister resort of Riverside which is much larger than the French Quarter resort.The only problems we encountered were with the luggage staff at the front entrance as they were slow in getting our luggage from our taxidriver who had to actually go over and get a cart to take our luggage out of the taxivan while the luggage staff were talking to eachother.Then the day before we checked out I had called and booked luggage assistance but when we checked out the next day I had to make 2 phone calls to get any luggage help from the staff there just 5 mins before the Disney Magical Express bus pulled up in front of the resort.I dont call that good service.We also had a problem upon check in too as I had booked the reservation months in advance for a 3rd floor room with a water view but we we given a ground room floor but after a couple of phone calls to front desk we were given a smoking room 3 rd floor river view but we wanted a non-smoking room as per my reservation request.I strongly recommend that when your checking in to this resort make it perfectly clear to the check in person about your reservation request as they sometimes just want to get you checked in quickly but not efficiently.However,these were the only problems we had there and the best food that we had during our disney dining experience was at the Corral Restaurant in Epcot as the steaks there were great along with the view of the fish etc in the large aquariums in this restaurant..

Reviews.Title: “Reviews And Advise Weren't Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Grizzlykid
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Disney and it was everything 99% of the reviews I read said it would be (I discounted the reviewers that said it was horrible figuring they are people who are never satisfied.) Being a first timer at Disney, I wanted to make sure I gave my family the best experience I could afford to. I read literarily hundreds of reviews and they were right on the money. I picked the Port Orleans French Quarter because it was a much smaller resort than all the rest and it fit into my budget of moderately priced resorts. From the moment of our arrival to the minute we departed, the cast members (all Disney employees) could not have been nicer. The grounds were immaculate as was our room and the pool was gorgeous. From reading the reviews, I requested a specific corner room with a river view. I listed 4 or 5 rooms in order of preference and was granted my first choice; room 5317; building 5, third floor. When I do go back to Disney again, I won't need to spend the time researching resorts because I will definetely return here, except I would move down 5 rooms to 5323. Its a little farther away from the pool and has a nicer view of the river. Our room had a great view and close access to the stairs & elevators but I liked 5323 a touch better. Whichever building you ask for or are put in, you are not more than five minutes from anything, but request a corner room because the two windows make the room feel larger. Speaking of the room, it was very clean, up to date and always made-up upon our return. I never once saw the housekeeping staff in my room or at my door. We walked over to the sister resort, Port Orleans Riverside, and although there are a few more ammenities such as a sit down restaurant, marina, bike rentals, more pools and a better selection of food at the food court, we liked the tranquillity of the French Quarter. Riverside is beautiful with 2 story mansions on the opposite side of the river but it is much, much larger. I'm not sure how many units there are but its got to be 3-4K. French Quarter has 1004 units but it didn't feel like there were near that many. And besides, all of those ammenities I mentioned are less than a ten minute walk from any part of the French Quarter. All said and done, with two boys ages 8 & 10, having the option to take a boat to Downtown Disney instead of the bus and being able to get around easily without getting lost, I'm extremely happy with my choice. I would highly recommend French Quarter to anyone of any age and family size. One last thought, get the Disney Dining Option. Its a great value and you will eat like kings and queens. Thank you to all the reviewers for their comments and suggestions that made our trip a very memorable and thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disney class all the way”
Reviews.Author: spurgec
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days over easter. we had originally planned to stay at Coronado but after reading "trip advisor" we decided to go with the higher rated Port Orleans. Glad we did. Everything was perfect, rooms clean, food fresh, great freindly service. We had a 2 min walk to ferry and pool vs 15 mins if we stayed at Coronado. The benefits of staying at a smaller disney property is something to consider when booking. Service is quicker and amenities are easier to get to.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy K
Reviews.Content: The Disney Port Orleans French Quarter is fantastic! We stayed at this resort during the week before Easter and even though the resort was booked full, we didn't feel crowded at all. The staff at this resort was some of the best that I've experienced! The woman at the front desk was cheerful and happy, even when we checked in at 7:00AM. We were given all the information we needed for the day, directed where to park and all our questions were answered with a smile. We were given an idea where our room would be and a card with a number to call later to get our exact room number. When we called, later in the day, for the room we were given the number quickly. The room was spotless! Housekeeping had left the room in perfect condition with plenty of towels. The room was large with 2 double beds, double sinks in the dressing area and tub/shower with a nice massage shower head. Housekeeping kept the room stocked well with supplies, plenty of coffee, soaps, and towels for the duration. Our housekeeper even made a towel animal for our daughter and posed her with daughter's bear and iPod. The food court area was clean and had a good selection of foods from Pizza, burgers, rib dinners, chicken dinners, sandwiches, and a bakery. All of the food was good quality and served fast. The burgers were not the frozen patty variety but were hand formed from fresh burger meat. Pizza was cooked to order and available by the slice or whole. The bakery items were great and the beignets were made fresh and hot and covered in powdered sugar. There were plenty of tables with some outside on the patio. I was most impressed by the pool area and the lifeguard staff. There were a minimum of 6 lifeguards working the pool in the afternoon. 2 were on stationary stands, 1 was entertaining the children and 2-3 were walking the perimeter of the pool scanning for any problems at all times. The grounds of the resort were maintained very well and were very clean. The bus to the parks was easy and the best way to travel. I would recommend this resort and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “rocky start, but quickly got better”
Reviews.Author: oldnavy61
Reviews.Content: prior to our arrival, i had contacted the hotel to request non smoking 3rd floor room in bldg 1 or 7 (away from crowds) when we arrived we got a smoking ground floor room in bldg 5 (next to pool) fortuneately the room was cleaned that the smok did not smell and while in a bldg next to the pool we were on the river side on the far corner so we did not have any kid traffic at all. it was actuall a great location as it was not that far from the busses. FQ are the first to be picked up so always have a seat. the room did get a little small in the morning. but that is a hotel room with 4 people--not going to matter where you are. We had considered a condo, but a few late nights looking at the departing traffic cemented our decision that staying on site made for a more relaxing time (well as relaxing as WDW can be)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but rooms could be cleaner!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Mumma
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are nicely themed and very well kept with a great pool for kids. The room looked okay on first glance too, but we soon realized the floors were incredibly dirty. The tiled area had not even been swept or vacuumed (toilet paper on the floor, lots of hair and something sticky) so I'm sure it hadn't been washed in ages. There was also someone else's hair all over the tub. The shower curtain had black mold as well. My 1 year olds white sleeper feet were black from walking around on the carpet. We lifted up the bedskirt to retrieve a toy she had lost and discovered crackers and other food remnants from previous guests. We left a note for housekeeping to please wash the tile floor area the first night, but it was not done when the room was made up the next day. We complained at the front desk that day and the following morning the floor was swept or vacuumed, but still not washed. The front desk and concierge staff were not overly helpful. It's really too bad the housekeeping standards are so low because the rest of this resort is very nice, the location and bus system is very handy and the food court is convenient with young kids. It is very hard to get into any of the resort or other hotel restaurants even though we were there in a "slow" week so options for eating were very limited if you didn't want to eat at the food court. If I stayed on-site again, it would not be at this hotel and I would definitely rent a car for the entire trip so we had more restaurant options.

Reviews.Title: “Horror at French Quarters thanks to front desk manager LAUREN”
Reviews.Author: Tripppp
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and our 6 month baby at the French Quarters earlier this month. To my surprise it turned out to be a disaster for my baby. We were checked into a wrong room by the front desk. The room was opened and our luggage checked in the room by the bellman, which i thought was good and I thanked him. But as the room was already open, we never used the room key initially. Now we left the room to look around and after an hour or so came back to the room (as baby was hungry) to realize that the room won't open with our card. Our baby was crying at this time as he was hungry. I ran up to the front desk and told them the situation while my wife was trying to calm the baby. At front desk there was an utter chaos. I eventually found someone who was able to understand the problem. She made several phone calls in front of me. Meanwhile I was getting nervous that my baby must be still crying as he was hungry and all his food and bottles were locked in the room. The lady at the front desk told me she will be sending someone to open the door. I went back towards the room and saw my wife crying as the baby wont stop crying. I calmed her by telling that someone is coming to open the door. We waited for more than 15 min and no one showed up. I became furious, but I kept my calm and went back to the front desk and demanded the manager. I never saw the manager at that time but a bellman showed up and I rushed him to the room. He opened the room and my wife was able to get the babies bottle. She was about the start feeding the baby...but the bellman told her that this room is reserved for someone else and it has to be emptied. I called the front desk and asked them why can't they let us stay in the same room as our luggage is already there. They told me that a group of people had requested rooms together and we have to go the other part of the building. All this time my baby was crying. So I asked for keys to the other room and asked the bellman to start moving luggage there. I took my baby and wife to the other room and FINALLY my baby was able to eat. Now I went to front desk and talked with front desk manager LAUREN. She is a young dark haired girl. She said she was one of the ladies who talked to me on the phone. I asked her why couldnt I stay in the same room. She looked in the computer and told me that the bathroom in that room is broke. I could'nt believe my ears. I was told that the room was reserved for someone else by other lady at the front desk. I told her how some other lady told me a different story. To this she told me " Sir, but this is the room you were supposed to be in". I never heard the word "sorry" or "I apologize". I told her that it was poor coustomer service that they checked me in a wrong room. She says" Sir, that was a mistake in writing room number, you are in the room which you belonged in the first place. The other room is not ready for you" Remind you, me and my wife have been taking upto 3 vacations a year around the world. I have never ever heard that kind of talking from the front desk. I decided not to ruin it for my family and never mentioned anything to my wife. When she asked me what the heck just happened to us today, I said "honey there was a mistake" and moved on with my vacation. My analysis is hiring inexperienced people can ruin your bussiness. I would rather go to the marriott or hilton close to disney than stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value & Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: budgetraveller
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a fantastic stay at the Port Orleans-French Quarter. What a perfect place for our 10 member family to stay---delightful hot tub for the adults, fantastic pool (gently warmed and open til late at night, and with a slide) for the kids, beautiful walks and runs along the riverside that connects the French Quarter to Riverside and a quiet, relaxed and comfortable stay. The beds are incredibly comfortable, shower pressure is good, and double sinks and dressing area with curtain is fun. The food in the cafeteria was good and I was impressed with the value of everything--Disney didn't gouge us on the food or the gift shop (sunscreen was only $1 more than at home). Having the bus transport to the parks, hearing the clop of horses' hoofs along the cobblestones at night while people rode in the carriages, jazz music at night, and bike rental (the kids loved the 4 person carriage bikes), and a nice sit-down breakfast restaurant (Boatwrights at Riverside) was perfect. Make this your choice and you'll be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds - Okay rooms- good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: The grounds are great. The French Quarter Theme is fun and the pool is a hit with the Kids. The only negative point during our 5 night stay was that the linens were shabby- bed spreads had holes in them. The maid service in the room was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MishaVermont
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Port Orleans French Quarter with my 2 teenagers (18 and 16). We loved this hotel, not over run with small children, great for all ages. We spent many evenings in the hot tub which was really warm and nice after spending all day at the parks. The pool was nice also. My best advice is to buy the refillable mugs on your first visit to the dining hall. They are $11.99 each but once you buy them all drinks from the self service area are free...water, soda, Hi-C. hot chocolate, coffee, tea and ice tea, this is a great deal and will save you in the long run, they are only good at your dining hall, not in the parks. We bought the hopper passes and usually did 2 parks a day, we also had the pass for the water parks and Wide World of Sports complex so were able to catch a game during spring training. We saw the Braves and Dodgers play, great seats for only $19 each. We were there from Tuesday to Tuesday and really made the most of our time. Try not to hit the Magic Kingdom on Saturday or Sunday..too busy. We used the Magical express from the Orlando airport and it was great, no waiting for your bags, they do it all. Not having a vehicle to go to the store, I shipped myself a box of goodies, bagels, cereal, lots of snacks and we saved a lot by doing this. When I checked in they told me I had a UPS package and brought it to my room. Overall our experience was very positive from the hotel, to the transportation. Would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Stacelet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from Feb. 27-March 4. I had stayed at Riverside twice previously but decided to give French Quarter a try. Pros: The grounds are beautiful as others have already said. I loved that it connected to Riverside (and their scenic paths) so that I had a great route for my morning runs. (I would highly recommend this resort to runners over the other moderates or budget hotels.) The view from our room (in building 6) was spectacular. Definitely request a river view! We did not pay extra for it because it was not THAT important to us, but upon check-in I requested it and received it. The boat ride to downtown Disney was relaxing and fun. The staff I dealt with were all outstanding from the front desk to the workers in the food court and store. I liked the smaller size of the French Quarter over Riverside. Things were definitely not as long of a walk after a long day in the sun! Cons: I really do not have many complaints. The only reason I gave this hotel a 4 instead of a 5 was the fact that our jack for the high-speed internet was broken. They did come and fix it for us on day 3 but wired it from the opposite side of the table so we had a LONG wire across our room. The food court was also very crowded due to the food court at Riverside being closed, but I think this will only be a few more weeks. Overall I think I liked the scenary at Riverside a TINY bit better than French Quarter, but the size made up for it. Both French Quarter & Riverside come highly recommended by me and are my favorite Disney resorts I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “There's only one word for this Disney Hotel, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jules2210
Reviews.Content: Having visited Florida a year ago and stayed on a hotel off site, we were very keen to stay in a Disney hotel, purely for the convenience of being able to come and go as we pleased and boy were we glad we did. We decided on this middle range hotel because we knew the cheaper ones would be over run with hundreds of people, therefore longer queues for buses etc and unfortunately we couldn't afford the more expensive ones (which we did notice, also had longer queues for buses!). This hotel was quaint, very quiet (especially the rooms which we found were incredibly sound proofed as I never heard anyone in any other rooms). I was amazed every morning when I stepped outside the door and heard........nothing, just bird song. We were literally steps away from the river. The rooms were exactly as pictured in the brochure and were spotless. We were also very pleased to see towel animals, shapes etc nearly every day when we came back from the parks. They even positioned some of my son's soft toys into little scenes on the bed. The first week of our holiday the food court was fairly quiet and the added convenience of the flasks that you top up as you need drinks was great. I must admit it did get busier the second week, but as I understand it, not only was it the week the children have off in England, but also it was leading up to Presidents week, hence the weekend was really busy. We did, however, always manage to get a table. The food was good and there was quiet a variety of dishes and there was even grapes, celery and carrot sticks which are my son's favourite. The hotel grounds and hotel were always spotless and the staff went out of their way to be chatty, friendly and helpful. They couldn't do enough for you. The availability of transport was also great. We were the first pick up and drop off from Port Orleans. If the bus was full, it skipped Riverside entirely. I only had to stand up once in the my whole 2 week stay. I can also recommend the boat trip to Down Town Disney. My son was made second in command on one trip and was given a badge to prove it. He loved all the attention he got from all members of staff whenever we went out. It was really magical for him. He also loved the swimming pool. We had a job stopping him going on the slide as he loved it so much. He is only 3 1/2 but they provide floatation equipment so he was able to swim and play as much as he liked. The lifeguards were so vigilant. There were several and 2 were on high seats overlooking the pool and at least another 2 constantly walked around looking in the pool, just in case. We felt very secure. My son even got a toy and certificate from one of them for being the first to use the pool slide that day. I cannot praise this hotel enough, even the bell boys were helpful and funny when they kept my son amused while we were waiting for our transportation to the airport. We will definitely, money permitting, be back again and would definitely choose this hotel as they really made us feel at home. I know there have been just a couple of bad reports from some people about this hotel, but feel that they must have just been unlucky and feel sorry that their experience was ruined. You will love this hotel if you decide to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: shelleytIMMINS
Reviews.Content: I took my grandma to Disney in January 2007, as she has never been abroad before. We went for 2 weeks and we stayed at the Disney Port Orleans French Quarters. She is aged 65 and i am aged 22 so i looked for somewhere that would be suited to both our ages and of course Disney it was. This has been my fourth visit to Disney Orlando and this has been the most enjoyable. Staying in Disney was truly magical. The hotel was outstanding and the staffs were wonderful. We were just a short boat ride from Downtown Disney and Port Orleans Riverside. I honestly cannot fault my stay if i tried. It was wonderful from start to finish and i will defiantly be staying at a Disney hotel again. They really made it so magical for both me and my grandma. Defiantly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could of stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Moonlit_Knight
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we were only able to spend three days at the Port Orleans French Quarter. I felt that there were so many other things to do there that I didn't have a chance to enjoy. The rooms were nice. Adequate for the time you actually spend in them. I think Disney did a good job with the soundproofing of the room, because there were only a very few times when we heard our neighbors in the room next to us and it was just barely at all. My two daughters thought that the alligator statues leading into the pool were funny. The playground area was also a big hit with them and did a good job keeping them busy the last day that we were there while mom packed to go. One of the best features of the Port Orleans French Quarter is that you can catch a boat from behind the pool area that will take you on a leisurely ride down the river into Downtown Disney. It's especially relaxing if you have been running around Downtown Disney with the kids. Another important thing about it is the bus route comes to the POFQ first before going to the PO Riverside, so there isn't any problem finding a seat early in the morning when everybody is trying to get the first bus to the park for the extra morning hour.

Reviews.Title: “A simply great stay”
Reviews.Author: MickeyInGlenwood
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 9 nights at The French Quarter. Upon arrival we were reminded that it was President's Weekend and immediately thought our peace and quiet would be ruined - but it wasn't. We had a corner room in building three. The room was clean and we never heard our neighbors until the very last night when a cheerleader convention arrived and the girls in the room above us seemed to be doing jumping jacks. It was a great room in a great location. The resort itself is beautiful, lots of trees and flowering Azalea bushes. The river runs at the back of the property and boats will take you to Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island. The food court was really busy no matter when we went - but I was told that is because the Riverside Resort next door was remodeling and their food court was closed. The President's Week at the Disney Parks was busy, but we still rode all the rides more than once and never waited in line more than 20 minutes -- and the Pirates and Princesses party on Friday night was the ultimate fun time. The park closes to everyone but holders of the special ticket and so the rides had no lines at all and you could ride multiple times in a row. When we come back next fall for the Food and Wine festival we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Torontoteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter for a week and absolutely loved it. We had asked for a room near the lobby and got one in the building closest to the lobby. Although the French Quarter is the smallest of the moderate Disney hotels, it is still huge and is spread out over a large area. I would hate to be in one of the farthest away building. There are 7 buildings, each with 3 floors and elevators. I still can't get over how quiet the room was. In one week, I never heard one footstep, heard a toilet flush, water running ,overheard anything from our neighbours. And I know the rooms were occupied as I saw children coming and going from the neighbouring rooms. The bed was among the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel (and I have stayed at a lot of hotels). The only thing that would make the beds better is if they were queen sized beds. The room was large, so I don't know why Disney insists on double beds in the rooms when queen beds would be better. I really loved the double sinks in the curtained off area. In a tour book, I had read that each room had a fridge. I phoned the hotel directly to see if this was correct. I was told that there were no fridges in the rooms but I could order one and pay 12 dollars a night. There was a minibar fridge in our room. I checked with several other people who were staying at the hotel and they all had fridges, so I have no idea why I was told that there were no fridges in the rooms. All I can think of is that I asked about a fridge and not a minibar fridge. But surely they would have known what it was I wanted. Whatever, we made good use of the fridge. The first night I bought some half pint cartons of milk in the food court for 1.29 each. Then the second day I discovered that in the giftshop they sold some food and drinks. A quart of milk was only 1.75. And if you happened to be in the Riverside hotel for a meal (the sister property) , you could buy a half gallon of milk for 2.25. We used the bus transportation system each day. No need for a car at all. We never waited longer than 5 minutes for a bus to take us to any of the parks. And when coming home, the longest wait was 10 minutes. It seems as if they have the timing of buses down pat. They know exactly when people will be wanting to go to the parks and home again and they send multiple buses to the locations. I had read that buses went to French Quarter first then to Riverside, but we only did that once and that was in the middle of the day. Other times we went directly to the parks from our lot. Going home the buses went to both places, but we always got off first, so who cared. We got a seat on the bus about half the time. But we could easily have waited the 5 mintues or so til the next bus if we hadn't wanted to stand. And it was never more than a 12 minute ride on the bus. I did find the food court to be crowded in the evenings. Lots of seats to sit at, but waits to get your food at each of the stalls. And not enough cashiers. Good thing they had a microwave to reheat the food as it was sometimes cold by the time we got to the table. The only thing not up to Disney's standards was the housekeeping. Yes, we did get fresh towels each day, but the dusting and vacuuming was not as good as many hotels. But who cares, I certainly don't dust and vacuum at home each day!!! I absolutely loved the hotel and the location and when I go back to WDW, I will absolutely stay at this hotel again. I confess to liking the atmosphere and decor at the Riverside better than at the French Quarter, but that hotel is just SO spread out. I can see it taking 20 minutes to get to the lobby/dining rooms if you aren't lucky with your room assignment. We did take the ferry to the Riverside and also to Downtown Disney and I would recommend that to everyone. It was scenic and a nice experience. All in all, if you want a moderate priced hotel at Disney World, definitely stay at the French Quarter----You won't be sorry!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: creidcooks
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at disney (REALLY COLD though, there are some things even disney can't control!) Resort was quite nice and very quiet for a holiday weekend. It felt much smaller and more intimate than some of the mega complexes at the park. Would have been nice if they had two hot tubs-one family and one adult so you wouldn't have to sit in the tub with little kids bouning around in it like a wading pool.Rooms were kept clean and neat throughout our 5 day stay in spite of their having to return a couple of times to get in. Food at the court was just ok and as with the rest of the resort hugely overpriced, but getting elsewhere to eat was a snap. Transportation from the french quarter was fabulous- I would never take a car in again. Watch out for late nights though, busses don't run as often and when it was sooo cold waiting late at night was't much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best Moderate Hotel in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: snc1032
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Port Orleans French Quarter. We stayed at Caribbean Beach last year and French Quarter is sooooo much nicer! What makes it nicer - it is smaller and has a more personal feel to it. The food court staff goes out of their way to hand out beads to the kids (and adults) and the cook came out and did some magic coin stuff with my 4 year old. He loved it! I highly recommend getting at least 1 refillable mug. We got our money's worth out of this mug. The food is pretty good and there is a good selection. The bakery has delicious treats. I really didn't think the prices were bad at all. My family of 3 ate for around $20-25 each meal. Kids meals are $3.99 and include 2 sides and a drink. It has one bus stop and is the first to pick you up and drop you off. You are guaranteed a seat - we never had to stand. You can purchase theme park tickets at the concierge, and they really need more workers to jump in and help, especially when one family takes 20 minutes selecting dining plan meals with the only worker. Lots of people got frustrated by this and left. The boat ride to Downtown Disney makes for a great, free thing to do in the afternoon or evening. We really enjoyed this and did it several times. The hotel offers a carriage ride around the resort at nighttime for about $35. The only bad thing is that you have to go to Riverside to board. The rooms are pretty quiet. We were on the 1st floor (which i recommend you request since they don't have elevators to carry up your luggage), and we were the room closest to the food court. We didn't hear anything. It's a nice quiet hotel. Housekeeping did a good job - though we were hoping for some of those animals that they make out of towels and washcloths. Though we didn't swim, the pool looked awesome. Great theme and slides for the kids. We'll have to go back where it's warmer. I would definitely stay here again. If you're undecided between Caribbean Beach and French Quarter, choose French Quarter. Riverside looked nice, but it was definitely larger and the Mardi Gras theme is a lot of fun at French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value of Disney Hotels”
Reviews.Author: dkrck
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a couple nights stay at the port orleans hotel. We really liked the hotel and grounds. The rooms were small, but we were comfortable and more importantly, clean. We have a 2 and 4 year old and we did just fine. The boats to downtown Disney were a big hit with the kids. They were the perfect way to relax and enjoy the area after a long day at the parks. The pool area was excellent and the kids loved it. There was also a small playground area to let the kids run around a bit . The only thing that shocked us, being our first time to disney, was the high price of food. This was evident all throughout anything Disney, and not a knock on the hotel itself. None of the rooms have microwaves ( almost forces you throw away leftovers and prevents you from bringing things to warm up ), but this is a tourist destination, just be prepared. We ended up getting cereal and milk ( they have refridgerators) to save us 25 dollars on breakfast. The only other thing we want to add is that the hotel seemed a little difficult to navigate around at first. We were in building 6 on the 3rd floor and parking was a good distance away. We kept saying how glad we were that we brought our own umbrella stroller instead of having to carry our 2 year old. Overall, it was a very nice place to stay and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter lived up to big expectations”
Reviews.Author: MaxPower2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter in early February. We picked the FQ because of its reviews on TripAdvisor as being one of the better hotels on the Disney property as well as being small and relatively adult-oriented. We were both impressed by the property. The resort was well laid out, with small courtyards and paths. We were in building 7 which is one of the farthest from the main building but was about a five minute walk. The resort was generally quiet, however we did notice people smoking on the exterior corridors in the evening and their conversations carried quite a distance mainly due to the quietness overall. The inter-room noise insulation was very good. As reported on here the rooms were nice for a mid-level resort, two sinks, mini-fridge and a table to sit at, everything was clean and tidy. My single complaint would be the housekeeping which seemed hit or miss. One day everything was great, next day the sheets on the bed were not tucked in and the bed was barely "made", but then next day everything was great again. The check-in service was a bit on the slow-side but that was mainly due, I think, to getting people familiarized with their many options (dining plan, theme park tickets, location of restaurants etc). As noted on TA before - there is no table service restaurant at the FQ which didn't bother us as we had made advance reservations to eat at the various parks, however if you would like one you could walk to the Port Orleans Riverside which is probably a 10 minute walk away from most of the buildings in the FQ. The Disney transportation was good. Do not underestimate the benefit of only having one bus stop for the FQ. I can see this saving considerable time over a situation where there are multiple stops in a resort. It appears that sometimes the bus that picks up the FQ people goes to Riverside but only in the slower periods (i.e. middle of the day). First thing in the morning our bus to the Magic Kingdom and the Animal Kingdom went directly to the parks after just the FQ stop. Our bus to MGM went there after stopping at one Riverside stop but not the others, so it seems a bit random. In the evening, being the first stop to be dropped off is worth its weight in gold as tired feet and cranky kids don't want to spend an extra 10 minutes on the bus. The location of FQ was a big attraction as well. In the evening after eating dinner at EPCOT the actual ride from EPCOT to the FQ was about 7 minutes long.
