In the morning it took about 10-15 minutes to reach the Magic Kingdom and about 20 to reach the Animal Kingdom. The FQ's central location coupled with it being first in the "Port Orleans" pick-up/drop-off rotation would be enough for me to suggest to anyone to pick the FQ over the Riverside. The conceierge service was good with a couple of helpful staffers getting us reservations for lunch and helping us check in for our flight home (for free - including printing out our boarding passes, I have stayed at many 5-star business hotels which charge for that). I gave the FQ 4-stars, but I would have given it a 4.5 if I could. It was better than I expected for a Disney resort and I would absolutely recommend it to others. The resons why I didn't give it 5-stars would be the hit and miss housekeeping, lack of table service restaurant and the sometimes sharing of a bus with Riverside. All in all, there is a reason why this hotel is in the top 20 out of 280+ hotels in Orlando. Believe the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Best moderate resort on property”
Reviews.Author: LuckyGirlKC
Reviews.Content: We used AAA to book a package and saved over $400 on our room, tickets, and dining plan. When we checked in we asked for a king bed but they did not have any available, however my husband and I ended up being comfortable in our shared double bed. We had not requested it when we made our reservations so it was not their fault. The hotel is landscaped very attractively, with cute little courtyards and paths all around the hotel. We were in the building that was farthest from the lobby and food court, but it was still a very short walk, about 5 minutes. The bus service was very good, we never had to wait too long for a bus, and French Quarter is the first hotel to be picked up at and dropped off at from the parks, so you will usually get a seat, and if you don't at least you aren't waiting forever. There is no sit down restaurant there but there is a food court with made to order food, and some interesting selections. Would enjoy a grab-and-go selection of cold sandwiches though. This is a much smaller resort than any of the other moderates, so it is much easier to get around, everything is easy walking distance, and the waits for the buses are reasonable. We had very good maid service every day. The only problem we had was that the lock on our door broke one night as we were returning from one of the parks, so we had to walk back up to the lobby so they could let us in. It wasn't that our card had been deactivated, the lock on the door just stopped working. But we were taken care of in about 15 minutes even though it was 1 am. Overall, my favorite of all the moderate resorts at WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jonbier
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the French Quarter. We had a nice room with two double beds. The room is separated from a bathroom area by a curtain and then there is a separate room for the toilet and tub/shower. This works very nicely as you can use the sinks while someone else in using the shower. The room also included a small refrigerator, A/C(Heat) unit, and a table with two chairs. The room was very comfortable for 4 people. The resort itself was nice because its size was manageable as compared to say Riverside or Carribean Beach. There is a main house that holds the check-in, gift shop, and food court. Our building which was building 1 which was one of the furtherest was still only a 5 minute walk. The food court was what you would expect, average over-priced food. However, items made to order like waffles, hamburgers, grilled cheese tended to be very good. Items that were sitting around were less good. They also had lots of fruit and vegetable choices for kids. The food combos sometimes don't make sense like no kids waffle for breakfast. There is no sit-down restaurant. You need to go to Riverside for that. Our maid service was average/below-average. No towel animals and really all they did was change towels and make beds. Gummy bears / coffee stirrers were left on the floor from previous guests. We did tip daily as well. The other big advantage to this resort is the bus service. For some parks it shares service with Riverside, for others it has its own bus ( during peak hours ). It is the first stop for pickup/drop-off which means you are guaranteed a seat on the way to the parks, and you'll be the first ones home at the end of the day. It also only has a single bus stop. The boat service to Downtown Disney is a pleasant ride and runs quite often in the evenings ( every 10 minutes ).

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: colin-leeds
Reviews.Content: At this time of the year Disneyworld is very busy also this hotel; was booked out but it was quite and relaxing to return to after a hectic days .The room was good and surroundings were excellent. Eating was rather basic and same on offer each day but no problem due to the transportation being so regular it gave you options to dine elsewhere. Also a pleasant stroll along the river to the Riverside to their restaurants or the boat ride to Downtown. The housekeeping was above average bathroom good with two sinks, which meant an uninterrupted shave; shower was always hot and powerful. I was impressed with the service especially at the reception desk and the shop .I could continue complimenting this hotel but will say we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World nightmare”
Reviews.Author: thewillowbunch
Reviews.Content: Upon a noon arrival, it took the reception staff 30 minutes to find and log our reservation for two connecting rooms because they were still getting used to a new computer system. One room was ready, the other not until 4 P.M.; but we were given a phone number and code to call later when we could discover our room numbers. After having returned about 10 P.M. from a day at the parks, we found one room with a group of M&M's on the floor, a shelf with dust thick enough to write one's name in it, both TV remote controls not working, and two black marks on one of the pillow cases. We called housekeeping immediately and said they could take care of these problems in the morning. They were never taken care of during our three-night stay. We saw a large water spill on the floor the length of five tables at the food court that took thrity minutes until a staff member cleaned it up. Unfortunately, the parks weren't much better -- three instances where cast members were not wearing their own name tags; a food spill at Epcot that was never cleaned up; dirty trays and plates stacked high by servers on wastebaskets at Wolfgang Puck's at Downtown Disney that ended up toppling over -- fortunately, not onto anyone; food service at Pinocchio's Village Haus at Fantasyland that should have taken three minutes, but took ten to receive part of the order and twenty-five minutes to receive the remainder, with the manager's simple apology that they were trying to shut down one of the kitchens, and having one in our party have diarrhea from her meal at that restaurant (as a result, she was not permitted to board the Disney cruise the next day -- the representative would not accept our claim about trip interruption insurance, but only offered park visit or a credit toward another cruise -- the Disney bus driver broke one of our bags in full view of other Disney representatives, but Disney will not pay for the damage; and Disney lost one of our bags, finding it after nine days despite handling our bags for all transfers.) Our family is comprised of true Disney fans, and it is difficult for us to write this kind of review, even in a summary format. We are still amazed that all of this happened to us, but it did. At this point, we cannot recommend Disney World for a vacation to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter - The way we see it”
Reviews.Author: 65bus
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the French Quarter hotel with the majority of our guests as we were getting married at WDW. Our initial reaction to the hotel was ok, that is until we got to our room and we were blown away! Room: King bed room We loved the room, it was large, had 2 sinks and was very distinctivly decorated. The bed was comfortable and there were about 5 pillows to pick from, it seemed as though they were of a different consistency so we could each find one that suited us, though I may be wrong about that. Showers were always hot and had consistent pressure. The toilets work with a pressurized tank so they are pretty loud and can be a bit of a disturbance when you go for a late night tinkle. But with the pressurized tank there is never anything left in the bowl, so thats good. Staff: The front house staff were friendly, though at times seemed a bit confused. The Maids were awesome, our room was always cleaned well and because we were getting married there and the dress was hanging in the room our maid surprised us every day with a different towel creation. These creations ranged from swans to hearts to a basket of flowers and even a bride. I will try to attach photos of some of these later. Restaurant: Cafeteria style and we usually only had breakfast there, we went to Downtown disney or off the grounds for dinner. Food was good and as pointed out in other reviews, purchasing the refillable cup is a good deal and we used it quite often. Staff were very friendly and even sang songs to people. Pool: I enjoyed the hot tub which though I like my hot tubs a bit hotter was pretty nice. The pool is newly renovated is absolutly a site to see. I can see kids absolutly loving it. Transportation: There is a river boats you can take to either Downtown disney or the riverside resort. These are free and nice way to get around rather than bussing it. The only problem we ran into was at peak hours the boats would arrive from Riverside and they would be too full to carry the waiting passengers. When we travelled as a group of 8 it took about 3 boats before we had one with space. But overall, this service was unique and is pretty much exclusive for the New Orleans resorts. Some of the boat operators talk and tell you abit about the place, while others are more focussed on the river ahead. Most of our guests took the busses to the parks and the service was pretty good. Overall this resort is nice for families and is probably one of the best for adults due to its accessability to Downtown Disney. We will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love everything ,will come again.”
Reviews.Author: PAGONEBYE
Reviews.Content: Love the grounds, very clean, very quite . You do share the bus with Riverside but the bus stops here first and drops off first .(Take the boat to downtown disney.) We have stayed Pop Century (very big resort, only one bus and it can get crowed, very noisy, you can here other people in their rooms.) We have also stayed at Movies( last bus out of the 3 value resorts). For the price this I think is a much better resort. Rooms are basic but clean. Double bed,dresser, t.v., refridge, and coffie pot: two sinks, small bathroom. Toliets are loud: but they do work. Hardly any noise from other rooms. My son was very happy with the pool .We liked the hot tub too. Staff was very freindly. The staff can make reservations for dining, park tickets, early fight check in. Food court is small but was clean; food choices are basic but good size portions. I do highly recommand the Disney Dining Plan. It pays for itself and then some. Check out the pics.on the site. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans Review”
Reviews.Author: HH2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Port Orleans Resort the week of January 17th for 6 nights. Overall, the resort is very nice. The rooms are clean and the housekeeping went out of there way to make my 2 year old many washcloth toys. The only complaint that I have about the room was the fact that there wasn't a lamp in the room. It was quite difficult to find acceptable lighting at night. The overheads were very bright, but overall we had a great time and would recommend the resort to anyone. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Disney Price”
Reviews.Author: PalTexas
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel was great. We went end of Sept. and it was during love bug season.. If you're not a bug person, don't go during this season, because they are everywhere. We had them all in the room, and flying all on us as we walk to and from our rooms. The hotels are small, but you're not in them that much. We requested a water view, since it wasn't that much more but ended up being at the very back of the property which was a very long walk everytime we went back to our room. I really wish we could have gotten a room closer to the main Lobby. The bus system was great, but at times the bus got full and some people had to catch the next bus.

Reviews.Title: “A more affordable Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: kretzcr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance (I actually proposed to her on this trip) in July 2006 and we had a great time. The hotel and rooms, like all Disney properties, are extremely well taken care of down to the last detail. For couples not wanting to spend a lot, but still want the magic of staying on property, this resort is for you. We even got a card and a picture from Mickey and Minnie congragulating us on our engagement (and yes I did it by the castle under the fireworks). A usefull tip, if you plan also to eat on property too, get the Disney Dinning plan. I've done the math and if you eat at least $40 a day it pays. Make reservations at the expensive resteraunts at EPCOT early before your trip, and then you don't have to worry about what you order.

Reviews.Title: “Third time just as great as first time!”
Reviews.Author: grandma98
Reviews.Content: We visited the French Quarter on January 2-5, 2007. This was my 3rd visit and my granddaughters first visit to the hotel and also her first visit to Disney World. We arrived at 11:30 a.m. and got into our room right a way. Food is great, transportation is great with no wait and the resort is nice and quiet and peaceful. The parks were another story. The Magic Kingdom was packed with the marathon coming up. We were told that the first 2 weeks of January are their slow times, but if the crowds were the slow season, then I definately don't want to come in the busy season. No complaints about anything. I definately will stay here in the fall when we plan on going back. I have been to Disney around 28 times since they opened, and always enjoy the vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with a Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mmb1143
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day Disney vacation with my partner and our 3 year old. I thought I was crazy after I booked a Disney Vacation with a 3 year old, but I would do it again in a second. Besides my child being an exceptional kid (atleast to me) this was a flawless vacation thanks to the Disney touch. We even managed to relax a bit. In the past we have stayed at the all-star resorts but those were my lean years, so I thought I would upgrade to a moderate resort. I honestly didn't see much of a difference. The only negative I would share about the Port Orleans French Quarter was that the food was awful and the food service was slow and not helpful, although I did over hear them making special arrangements for a guest with special dietary needs, which impressed me. But I found the service slow, disorganized and the quality of the food to be poor. But its Disney you aren't there for the food. Staff (other than cafeteria staff) was friendly and helpful. Property is nice, but the all-star properties are nice too. This one has a river and a river boat which was always full since it stopped at the Riverside resort first and the one time we took the boat we had to wait 25 min. for one that wasn't too full, although they come by every 10 min. after 4pm. The theme parks were all great, even though they were very crowded due to the three day weekend, we managed to do everything we wanted to do. Soarin' was hyped up and was a bit of a disappointment, but Test Track and Tower of Terror (at MGM) were amazing. My son (3) was mostly interested in the character meet and greets and the character were all very accomodating and went the extra mile ( I know they often get a bad rap, especially tigger) my heart was warmed when I saw characters and staff members go out of their way for a make a wish child who was waiting in line to see Woody from Toy Story, they didn't have to do anything special except be themselves but you can tell that they really took pleasure in making this kids and his family feel very special it was a wonderful thing to witness. Can't go wrong with a Disney vacation. I loved it and I know my son will remember it atleast till next week.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Small in a world of usually large and impersonal...”
Reviews.Author: Sonicblaze
Reviews.Content: French Quarter is my favourite of the moderates but for one reason: It's small. If youv'e been to other Disney Resorts the first thing you'll notice when staying here is how small it is, and that's why I like it, but that's why you may not like it. This is the only moderate to not have a sit-down restaurant, but not many people usually eat the the sit-down restaurants at their resorts so I don't consider it a real con. The pool (there is only one pool) is gorgeous and for those who want more, the Port Orleans Riverside is just a quick walk. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is relaxing and the overall mood of the resort is quiet and romantic. The walkways between building evoke a New Orleans type atmosphere and the rooms are clean and nicely designed. Bus service to the parks was fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation At POFQ”
Reviews.Author: Singer
Reviews.Content: My family and I have JUST returned from WDW. We were there from 1/2/07 - 1/9/07. My wife and I stayed POFQ and our family were at Saratoga Springs. We all had an excellent time and the weather was unseasonably warm which was great. We have vacationed at WDW approximately 15 times over the past 30 years and have stayed at ; Fort Wilderness Trailers/Cabins,Caribbean Beach, PO Riverside (when it was Dixie Landings , and the All Star Resorts. We have only stayed off property once and that was our initial visit. The hospitality at POFQ is what keeps them a notch above the other "moderate resorts" at WDW. Any questions we had and any needs we had were satisfied by the staff. Check-in and check-out were quick and painless. Another aspect , about the POFQ, we like very much is; accessability; it is very easy to get around. My guess is you can be to the lobby area in no more than seven minutes from any point on the resort. The resort overall and the rooms are very quiet. We never heard a neighbor the entire time. Obviously the rooms are well insulated and sound proofed. The food at the food court is good. We were on the meal plan and it worked out for the two of us. We did dine at various table service restaurants and our favourite was Le Cellier with Capt. Jack's a close second. Our least favourite table service was Hollywood and Vine with Mexico,Boatwright's falling in between. The parks were crowded due to the Disney Marathon Weekend and as a result the transportation was average at best. We waited at MK , mid-day, for 35 minutes for a bus back to POFQ. Leaving the parks mid-day or early evening were the worst times for making bus connections. Of course, at closing there were plenty of buses. My sense is; Disney has a lot of part-time drivers with more shifts at the beginning and end of each day. I would have to say the transportation was the low point of our stay. The longest lines to get into the park was definitely Epcot. They will have to get their act together and hire more security screeners. The best entry was MGM. We did stay on extended hours at the MK Monday evening and it was not worth it because many attractions were closed but MANY stores were open. HMMMM!! Would we return to WDW ? Yes . Would we stay at POFQ ? Definitely!!. Peace!

Reviews.Title: “Love Port Orleans,French Ouater”
Reviews.Author: eddie45
Reviews.Content: I have just returned fron a10 days at This Awesome Resort, The Parks were so busy and Crowded that we couldn't wait to get back to the tranquility of this Resort. Overall I would say this Problaby the best Resort we ever Stayed in Disney. This our 7 year in a road in Disney at Xmas .We tried,All Stars,Coronado springs.Animal kingdon.But Port Orleans is the Best

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: clowny626
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping at Port Orleans French Quarter was extremely dissapointing. The room looked as though the housekeepers had not dusted behind the furniture in over two years. We had a need to move the nightstand to accomadate a piece of medical equipment. This is no exaggeration! There had to be easily a 1/4 inch of dust behind the furniture! We were not supplied with sufficent bathroom ammenities for the number of people sharing our room, including toliet paper! This went so far that we had to go down to the front desk and complain! Other complaints to the front desk included no clean glassware provided since the day we arrived (we complained on day 4!!!) and no coffee. Overall, the room was a good size and the beds comfortable, but the cleanliness was extremely unacceptable by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “its alright...”
Reviews.Author: janeymcp
Reviews.Content: I don't know if we are getting fussier but....we have stayed at moderate Disney resorts 3 times previously and have found them to be OK. This time though, we thought the room was dingy, bathroom was tatty (cracked tiles, hot water only warm, feeble shower etc) . We had the dining plan and resort food options were disappointing. Pool was cold and shady and slide was not functioning for a few days when we were there. Good points - was quiet at night, housekeeping were efficient, boat service to Downtown Disney was fun, never had to wait long. Stayed at a deluxe resort (Yacht Club) for the last 3 nights of our stay - much better, (Not surprisingly probably seeing as almost twice as expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Go for the conveyance not the service”
Reviews.Author: oalomary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is below average for the price you pay The Disney magic service that you see at the parks does not carryover to the hotels They clean the rooms every other day, the rooms are old and stale The best thing about staying at a Disney resort is the transportation system and the ability to ship stuff from the parks back to your room The pool was nice and fun, but the food was expensive and ok

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay - just as lovely”
Reviews.Author: granmaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at French Quarter in February, so when the chance came to visit Orlando again we had no hesitation about booking again. It was a little like returning home as we drove through the gates. This time the place was decked out with christmas trees, garlands and ponsettias and looked lovely. The usual jazz/blues music had changed however to Christmas music, but it was still slightly jazzy which was a nice touch. Check in was great and we had a friendly CM who gave us a lovely room overlooking the green 'square'. The room was lovely and clean, and kept that way. One day we returned to a towel Minnie which was a lovely touch but doesn't always happen. All the staff were friendly. We ate some breakfasts at the foodcourt - try the beignets they're delicious. Only had one meal but it was quite nice. Sometimes it can be busy when choosing and paying for food though. The walk to Riverside takes only about 10 minutes, or you can take the boat or bus. You can eat there and hire water craft, surrey bikes and book the horse drawn carriages, which you hear on the French Quarter 'streets' in the evening - very quaint. We took the boat to Downtown Disney twice which is a lovely relaxing ride and a great change from the bus. Buses to the parks were mostly good and we didn't use our car to go to the parks at all. We didn't use the pool but it did look inviting and is a very pretty pool with a lovely serpent slide. It is a very peaceful, attractive resort and I rather think we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: turbotoys
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in I was standing in line around 15minutes and finally when I got up to the person doing the check-in I was greeted by a very rude person behind the counter. Other then that we had a great stay here. The rooms were very clean, property was very clean the food was pretty good for disney food. I wouldent recommend the pizza - kinda blah. my wife and I took advantage of the horse and buggy ride - it is a nice relaxing ride around the property. The transportation to the parks was great. We didnt watch TV much but they really need to work on that - there is alot of disney channels but other then that not much to watch - couldent order movies. We used the High speed internet as well and that worked out great - all though in my opinion that should be included for free - that is an additional $9.95/day. We will definatly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal size of resort and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Yippeeee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando and highly rate this hotel. It was super quiet and being a small resort by Disney standards it was peaceful and relaxing after a long day in the parks. We rented a car and used it every day, although we also used the Disney bus service which we found to be quite convenient. Just a little tip about the bus system, after 3 pm there are two separate buses for POFQ and Riverside leaving from the Magic Kingdom. All the other parks seemed have one bus only for both Port Orleans sections. Our family and another fellow all got on the wrong bus because we assumed there was one bus only. The pool was fun with the waterslide and not too crowded at all. I'm no so sure the refill mugs for $12 are a great deal unless you are absolutely crazy for soda pop. There are two microwaves in the Sassagoula floatworks which we used quite regularly and the fridges in the room are average hotel room size but do not have a freezer. The boat ride to Downtown Disney is lovely night or day. Make sure to stop at the Patiserie in the French pavilion at Epcot, they have the best coffee and pastries in all of the parks. This was one of the best holidays we have had due to the restful atmosphere in the hotel . You will appreciate this hotel after a fun but busy day in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate - loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: rz83447
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter from Nov. 3 - Nov.11. We really loved it! My husband and I are 36, and34, and our children are 9 and 6. We are both pharmacists, and typically stay in Hilton level resorts. We have been to the Disney area every year for the last 6 years with friends without the kids, or some combination of the kids, but, we have never before stayed on Disney property. We thought we'd try this year for that whole Disney experience. We stayed on property, bought the meal plan, we were all in. We were a little leary, as we stayed in condos, and went to Universal as well the other years. We were afraid we the benefits of staying on property in a regular hotel room wouldn't outweigh the benefits of the extra space, freedom, etc. of staying in a condo. Because we couldn't give that all up entirely we rented a car. We were glad to have the extra added freedom, but, we really, truly didn't need it. We won't rent a car if we go again if we plan to stay only at Disney. Port Orleans: This resort had come highly recommended by friends, and was recommended over the Riverside because there are some real benefits. The French Quarter is much smaller (we were told it only has ~1000 rooms), therefore very quaint and homey feeling, and even though we were fairly far away from the lobby it was only a 5 min. walk. Because it's smaller, there always seemed to be room on the buses. In addition, the entire time we were there the French Quarter had a bus all to itself to and from the Magic Kingdom, which almost made it worth it on its own. When you think of parking, tramming to the transportation center, then taking a ferry or monorail and finally getting there, whew! It was great! Also, the Riverside bus stop was right next to the FQ at MK and there were always tons of people waiting there and maybe a dozen or two at ours. We only ended up standing a few times, and even then the kids stood and it wasn't a big deal. It's only a few minutes and FQ always drops off first from all the parks that do make the Port Orleans share a bus. The hotel rooms were very nice, clean, with a ceiling fan, and nice vanity area outside the very tiny bathroom. The housekeeping was nice and left the animals, etc. as read about in other reviews. After all you see, it sounds ridiculous, but, the kids loved coming back to the room to see what was left. They also loved the pool, and there was plenty of room, chairs, etc. The gift shop was very nice. We used the service at the parks of having souvenirs sent directly to the resort, what a great perk, not having to lug things around the park. Food plan: If you're like us and looking for the catch, there really isn't any. There is, however, more food than you will ever be able to eat. Know ahead of time that you can share meals. Once you realize that the lunches come with a large drink (where offered) and a dessert, they are even more easily split among 4 people, and then you have breakfast everyday as you can share that as well. We ate like kings, at the Crystal Palace, Liberty Tree Tavern, Wolfgang Pucks at Downtown Disney, Planet Hollywood, Coral Reef, really amazing. We didn't have a dinner that would have cost less than $100. So, we figured we easily made it worthwile on dinner alone. You could also save a couple dinners and combine them to go to a show, such as Hoop Dee Doo, or Cinderella's royal table. Now, for the snacks. Because we didn't realize we could share right away, or what that could do for us, we made a trip to the grocery store the first night for breakfast fare for the room. However, in the gift shop, there are bags of bagels and full size bags of chips, etc. that count as 1 snack credit. Be creative with your snacks! We still left at the end of the 8 days with snacks and counter service meals left. GET IT, you won't be disappointed. Make all your dinner reservations early. months early if possible. Try to coordinate with the early/late magic hours. I tried 8 weeks ahead this year and still couldn't get into Cinderellas table, and couldn't get into the sci fi drive in at MGM on late night there, which by the way was absolutely fantastic as well. The early/late hours, of course, are the best of all. There aren't even words. There was not a moment of regret, and the FQ was great, don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: charlottehokie00
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World on three times over twenty years and have always stayed outside the parks. I was hesitant to pay the extra money to stay on site, but my wife talked me into it. We decided to pay for a moderate hotel over the value ones, in hopes of avoiding the noise of children. We also read multiple reviews on various sites and they all stated that the smaller size of this resort made the stay here so much better. We were given a room on the third floor of building seven and I can honestly say this is one of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. A huge selling point and not what I have come to expect as of late. I was thrilled by just how quiet and undisturbed we were. We were in building seven which was far from the lobby, but not worth complaining about. Its probably one reason it was so quiet. The room was clean and larger than I was guessing. I liked the curtain that you could pull to seperate the sink area from the bedroom. This was nice when I woke first and didn't want to disturb my wife. Everything was spotless and we had no complaints. The resort is beautiful and nice and we were amazed just how safe you felt no matter what the time of night. That's something you can't say if you stay off the Disney grounds. The transportation was great and we only used the car to drive to other resorts for dinner or to see SeaWorld or Universal. The cafe on site is good for breakfast, but pretty bad for lunch/dinner. We did enjoy milkshakes and fresh fruit which were nice changes, but avoid the pizza. We ate all our lunches and dinners at parks and other resorts, but one because we were on the dining plan. We would certainly stay here again. The only reason we would stay somewhere else is to experience a different theme. I am not sure it would be worth what we would be giving up!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with small kids”
Reviews.Author: sandra2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip 10/28 thru 11/5 and overall had a pleasant vacation. My husband, self and 2 year old had a good time. Our room was in building 4-which was great as it was close to the pool, foodcourt and bus stop! Excellent didn't have to walk far for anyone. Our room had 2 double beds-which worked well for my 2 year old and they even gave us a bed rail which was awesome as neither myself or husband had to sleep with her so she wouldn't roll out of bed, but my husband and I found that the bed was tight for the 2 of us. The room was comfy-nothing special. Housekeeping did come everday and supplied us with clean towels and made our beds-but other than that nothing much else was done. The tub wall tiles needed a bit of scrubbing-as mildew was starting to appear and our floor could have used some vaccumming as our 2 year old had spilled some goldfish on the floor and had crushed it into the carpet. This occured at the start of our trip and it was still there the day we left! Housekeeping was very friendly and did leave our 2 year old a towel doll and duck on our 2 last nights! Food: overall ok nothing gourmet. Typical fast food, quick lines. RECOMMEND the resort mugs for $11 free refills that was great! Pool: GREAT- We were only in the kiddie pool but the large pool looked just as good and alot of people seemed to enjoy it. Also there is a great playground next to the pool for kids. My 2 year old had a blast! And for us older adults a Hot Tub-it was great!! Transportation: Buses are GREAT!! Never had to wait longer than 5 mins. Only Complaint is that some drivers don't know which buses come and go from different resorts. They should be a bit more knowledgable in that aspect. Also a + French Quarter is always picked up first for the parks and dropped off first as well GREAT when u have kids! Ohh and also if u are coming back to the hotel at night from a park with small kids pack a coat. The Buses are very COLD!! The have the Air Conditioner Pumping and it gets very cold Also note, during the night the resort does most of its maintance so u will hear blowers and trucks coming and going and backing up. SO we were awaken several times at the wee hours of the morning with this noise. Overall though this resort is awesome, great price, perfect for families. Would stay hear again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for us!”
Reviews.Author: Cali
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I had a wonderful stay at POFQ in mid October. Our room was very clean and house keeping was excellent. They were respectful of the 'do not disturb' sign, quiet when in the rooms adjacent to us and always left our room super clean. The bus system was great. We had no long waits coming or going to the parks. It was nice to not have to drive for the week. The food was mediocre, but always very fresh, large portions and served by happy cast members. The food court was never too busy or loud, and it was never messy or dirty in our experience. The pools were wonderful for our kids (3 and 5). They loved the slide, but older kids might be looking for something more thrilling. The most activity we saw in the pool was late at night, and it could be quite loud. I wouldn't stay near the pool. The laundry facility was clean and the machines were in good working order. It was $2 to wash, $2 to dry. There is a retractable clothes line in the bathroom, but I found it took a really long time for things to air dry. Overall, POFQ was an excellent place for us to stay. Being onsite, in a smaller resort was just right for us. We found it to be a great place to return to after a crazy day in a park, and a great place to spend downtime.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Debs85
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend recently spent 7 days at the French Quarter resort (27th Oct - 2nd Nov). I chose the hotel based on previous reviews on the hotel and I was not disappointed. It was much smaller than other disney resorts which made queues and services much better. We arrived earlier than recommended and they checked us in straight away and organised transport back to the airport for our return journey at no cost. Staff were really friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were very clean and were serviced every day. They were a great size and had a fridge, 2 double beds, TV and air conditioning. The bus stops to the parks are a very short walk from any part of the resort and it was also the first pick-up. We never had to wait for any bus for more than 5 minutes. The bus only made one more stop to the hotel's sister resort - Port Orleans Riverside. On returning from the parks we were also the first to be dropped off. There is also a great boat that takes you staight to downtown disney (the staff that run these are great - they give you loads of info - and even told us that there is going to be a NEW PARK especially suited to teenagers/adults!!) The pool at the hotel was great and had a towel service. The hotel seemed to be slightly more grown up than other resorts. It was also incredibly clean and the grounds were very well maintained with lots of wildlife. The restaurant was a bit like a canteen but was extremely reasonable - around $5 each for breakfast and about $10 each for lunch/dinner. There was much more variety than the parks and downtown disney restaurants (and in some cases much better food - we paid $70 in Planet Hollywood and the food was BAD and the bill was on the table before we finished our main course). Top Tips: 1. Buy a refill mug - $11 and refill as much as you like at the resort. 2. If you want to eat in downtown disney, try to book! (the resort staff give you a booklet with all numbers in it and to ring is free). If you want to eat in the Rainforest Cafe - BOOK!! There is a 2 hour wait time even in October (the Rainforest Cafe at Animal Kingdom is much better however). 3. If you want a character breakfast, book a couple of weeks in advance. 4. Try House of Blues and Bongos in Downtown Disney - the best meals we had - and the only places that we got vegetables on our plates and didn't sell just burgers and fries. 5. Try booking it through Disney's website - I am from the UK and booked it through their UK website and found this was the cheapest by far Definitely give this hotel a go - I would truly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality resort for the price”
Reviews.Author: bri11164
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Disney at this resort October 7 - October 11, 2006. Was a family trip with my sister, her husband and 2 kids as well as our parents. Hotel is listed by Disney as Moderate resort and cost was approximately $140/night. I last stayed on Disney in 1995 at the Wilderness Lodge which is a Deluxe resort. It's sister hotel is Port Orleans - Riverside which is a 10minute walk away along a canal. Riverside is much bigger in terms of occupancy than French Quarter and has a buffet rest. and an a la carte rest. as well as a good size bar that serves appetizers/snack type fare. Staying at either resort gives you priveleges at both. ROOMS - We had a room with a king bed that was in building 5 directly opposite the Laundromat and just steps from the pool. Room was a decent size with 2 sinks/vanities outside the bathroom. Bathroom itself was small but clean. Bed was comfortable and room came with a min-fridge which was a bonus. PROPERTY - Grounds have French Quarter /Mardi-gras them as does the pool which has it's own waterslide for the kids. There is also a playground for the kids just outside the pool area. Pool area clean with plenty of chairs and 3 lifeguards on duty at all times. There are bathrooms with showers and changing area at the pool for those who can't get a late check out but want to enjoy the pool on get-a-way day. There is also a pool bar that serves just about everything and has 2 TV's for viewing. It did not serve food. They also have a gift/convenience store which in addition to souvenirs sold beer/wine/alcohol various snacks and sundries. FOOD - There is only 1 restaurant which is a buffet and appeared to be open 24 hours. Food was average. Geared mostly toward families with kids so there were many different types of food to choose from. Service a little slow but given their are over 1000 rooms most with families in them it is understandable. The have small bar next to restaurant which has all your favorite drinks, 2 TV's and entertainment on certain nights...open until about 1am. You can also eat at sister hotel Port Orleans - Riverside. They have a much bigger buffet area restaurant as well as an a la carte restaurant. Also, they have over 2000 rooms so plan accordingly. SERVICE - except for the restaurant service was prompt and with a smile. TRANSPORTATION - Buses pick you up right outside front of hotel for all parks. Behind the pool is a water shuttle that takes you to the Riverside hotel or to Downtown Disney (approx 15 min ride). Never had to wait more than 10 min for a bus and on one occasion where there were more people waiting for a particular bus than could be accomodated the driver called in for a second bus which arrived within minutes of the first bus. Overall a decent hotel for families. Would not recommend for couples or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDaddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Oct. 24-29th. The grounds are magnificent, staff friendly and helpful, and our experience with Mousekeeping was wonderful. Our room was always cleaned thoroughly. The Mousekeeper even left two little birds made from washcloths one day. Food was very good considering how busy they were. Yes the food court is busy, but the staff made every effort to keep the lines moving. Disney properties are always busy no matter whhat time of year I am there, so a line is not uncommon at any time. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone with or without children. We have stayed at several Disney resorts, and so far this one is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: suechucky
Reviews.Content: We visited in October. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was very clean and quiet. The food court food was just so-so especially for what the food cost. We liked the small compact feel of this resort. We took the ferry from Port Orleans French Quarter to Downtown Disney. It was very convenient. For this price range, I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you are looking for greater comfort (like queen size beds) I would say pay more and you will get more!

Reviews.Title: “Best disney hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: Judith1964
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Disney world, and this was our best hotel experience so far. The French Quarter was beautifully themed with spacious open areas, and a river running along the length of it. We did our homework before we went and requested a room in building 5 (no smoking block next to the pool) facing either the river or the gardens (I pointed out that I wanted a quiet room and did not want to face the pool area, but wanted to be near it for the children). We were allocated exactly what I asked for! We were even placed an equal distance between stairways and escalaters and so there was minimal foot traffic in front of the room. I was delighted with the room location and the cleanliness on arrival. The hotel was small and quiet and everywhere was easily accessible. This hotel is the smallest moderate resort. Unlike an earlier review, we found the pool area to be quiet when we were there and the children loved an afternoon swim before returning to the parks. When we returned in the evening the pool area was a little more busy and noisy (not overly so), and I was pleased to walk around block 5 to the tranquility of the garden area. We used the foodcourt for breakfast every morning and we easily found a table and never had to wait long for a good breakfast. I found the food prices to be very reasonable - childrens breakfast with a drink only cost ~£2.50. The maid service was good and we received 3 towel animals during our 2 week stay, which the children were excited about. Beds were changed every three or four days, and there were always plenty of fresh towels. We had cause to contact maintenance twice during our stay: One morning the toilet wouldn't flush, and when we arrived back from the park it had been repaired; and one evening we couldn't find our remote for the TV (I think the maid had collected it up when stripping the beds) and someone arrived with a new one in ~15 minutes - Excellent! The buses to and from the parks were excellent, we never waited long for one in either direction. I adore Disney and this hotel was perfect for our needs, I hope that we will return! Hotels that we have stayed at previously: Disney's All star movies - very good for the money, but a little hectic and so we decided to spend a little more the following years. Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort - Beautiful, but too spread out for us. We were in a building a long way from the amenities. Holiday Inn Sunspree Resort Lake Buena Vista - We chose it so that the children had their own area, but it was horrible and off site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Memphisprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (age 5) and I stayed at POFQ Oct.9-14, 2006. We were in building 6, second floor. We all loved the hotel. The size of the resort is perfect because all buildings are within easy walking distance to the pool, food court, lobby, and bus stop. The Disney shuttles were great every day of our stay. When we shared a bus with POR, we were always picked up first and dropped off first. Housekeeping did a good job and all employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. If you stay here be sure to take advantage of the boat service to Downtown Disney and POR, make ADR's for Boatwright's at POR, and check out the bike and boat rentals at POR. (POFQ and POR are sister resorts so you have privileges at both.) We will definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Jambo1874
Reviews.Content: I was divided between staying here or at Pop Century but in the end decided on POR – French Quarter after reading the reviews for both hotels and deciding small is beautiful. Once home I can say I defiantly made the right decision staying here for 11 nights. The other resorts seemed spaced over a wide area compared to the compact POR-FQ. Disney Magical Express – After landing at Orlando airport the Disney check in was difficult to find despite the location information on the booklet. Once found everything went very smoothly and within an hour of landing was at the reception desk checking in. My baggage however took over 3 hours to appear but I was informed this was due to 3 vans of baggage arriving at the same time when I phoned the concierge desk to enquire. When it was time to leave the bus returned me to the airport in plenty of time to catch my flight home. Check In – I had booked through the UK Disney web site. When I presented the various vouchers for the accommodation and park pass I was sent the cast member (Doc) informed me there was a problem as the UK Disney site is not compatible to the main Disney system. Why? He went away returning from time to time to keep me informed and after 20 minutes managed to get everything sorted and handed me my room card and information pack. The room card is also you park pass and you can charge everything you buy to it at the parks and have it delivered to your room. Room – I was in building 5 on the top floor in a non-smoking room as requested which was only 60 seconds from the food hall, concierge desk, gift-shop and 90 seconds from the bus stop. The room was very comfortable with 2 double beds, fridge, coffee maker, in-room safe and plenty of storage space. The toilet flush is rather loud as is the a/c unit but you get used to it. I was never disturbed by any noise expect for the a/c unit the whole time. It was cleaned every day but I noticed that the top shelves had a thick layer of dust which I removed with some damp tissues when I arrived. One day I was left a towel bunny which I appreciated. Food Hall – The food was freshly prepared when you ordered it and was fine but the options are limited and never change. I bought the refillable mug which re-paid itself several times over as advised. The queues at the register were always short even at the busiest times. Disney Transportation – I never waited more than 5-10 minutes for buses to any of the parks or downtown Disney. As mentioned before the buses expect for downtown Disney stop here first before going onto Riverside which has 4 stops unlike FQ which only has one so you always found a seat. The buses were clean and comfortable and the drivers informed you where to catch the return bus at each park and other information about the park. Sometimes the noise of understandably excited children and people talking made these announcements impossible to hear. After the firework shows at each park there were plenty of buses waiting so you never had to wait more than 5 minutes. You can also catch a ferry to downtown Disney which starts after 11:00am and to the Riverside resort which are worth well catching. Concierge Desk – I wanted to go to Sea World and Universal Studios and thought I be thrown out for asking but I was wrong. The staff were again very helpful and friendly and advised me to book a shuttle which costs $15 return and you can specify the pick up and return times to suit your day. They were very happy to do this for me and it’s best to arrange this the day before you want to go. I was also able to ex-changed my travellers cheques here. Resort – The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. I never used the pool which seemed popular going by the noise coming from it when I walked pass. The hot tub looked inviting but again I never used it. All the staff are friendly and approachable and seem to go that bit extra to make your stay enjoyable. The Riverside resort is only a 10 minute walk away along the river bank and you can catch the ferry to return. Unless you have a lap top you have to go to Disney Quest in downtown Disney to access the internet where it’s free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: littlesassy
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The room was good. It was clean and housekeeping did a good job. We stayed in Building 4 and was very convenient to the bus stop... which was great. It was a great location to the dining hall and pool as well. It was quiet and better than I expected and that works really well for me. I am very particular to where I stay. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quaint for a Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: disney4ever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, just returned from a 7 night stay at the French Quarter. We loved the resort. It was nice and quaint, by Disney standards. I stayed at Coronado Springs a few years ago for a business trip and hated that after a long day you had a 15-20 minute walk to your room. You definately don't have this at the French Quarter. We requested (and received) a room in building #5 and we were 1 minute from the pool, gift shop, and food court. It was fantastic. The rooms are a bit small but we were 4 adults in one room and really had no issues. The curtain between the room and the vanity area was great. As others have said the toilets are a bit loud but it wasn't has bad as some have made it out to be. Our room was clean and the "mousekeeper" left us a bunny on day #3 which was great. The staff in the whole resort were very kind and helpful. The food in the food court was decent and you must have a homemade ice cream cookie sandwich. Delicious!! Overall, we loved the resort and my husband and I are already planning our anniversary trip for next year and plan to stay the the French Quarter again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Sammy98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night trip to Disney World. We were originally booked to stay at the Caribbean Beach Resort, but after reading so many recent negative reviews we decided to change to the Port Orleans FQ. We couldn't have been more pleased with our room. We had requested and received a King room. Our room was located in building 2 right next to the pool. The location was very close to the lobby area and yet was extremely quiet. We never heard anything outside of our room. The room itself was very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job of replenishing everything we needed on a daily basis. We had a problem with the internet service one night and they ended up giving us free service for the duration of our stay. The food in the cafeteria was not great, but we weren't expecting much from a cafeteria. We only ate there for breakfast. We had the dining plan and it was fantastic. We had made reservations for dinner for each of the nights well in advance and ate very well. Not one night did our dining bill come to less than $125 and it was all covered under the dining plan...so we paid $0!! We were only responsible for alcohol. Jiko at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was the best meal...definitely get a reservation there if possible. Bus transportation to the various restaurants is difficult without a car. We didn't have a car and got frustrated at times with having to take a bus only to have to transfer to another bus to get to the restaurant. Just make sure to leave about 45 minutes for travel time if you're taking the buses. Overall our trip to the FQ was excellent and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing haven for a busy vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Bully_Wench
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ on 28 Apr-05 May. It was my husband’s 1st trip to DW and my 2nd. It was our first experience at a Disney resort and we are very glad that the Coronado was full and we ended up in Disney’s version of New Orleans. This hotel has a cozy and laid back feel to it (I dare say romantic with its cobblestone roads and old-style streetlights and fountains!) and the sound of the horse drawn carriage making its way around the resort is a nice touch. Check-in was quick and easy: we were able to get our room early and received the king room we had requested. Housekeeping was great in our experience with lots of towels, toiletries, and even towel sculptures. Tips on room location: It is important to mention that this resort is tiny compared to the other moderates so no matter what building you are given, you will be able to get to and from all locations in minutes. Buildings 2 and 5 are closest to the pool, but we were glad to be in #4, which was a bit further from the noise (nice when you need a mid-day nap!). Our king room (which are corner rooms with more windows) was quite big for just the 2 of us. We left our curtains open most of the time since we were on the 2nd floor (very private). There is an elevator in each building as well as a vending and ice machine on every floor. Highlights of the resort: 1- taking the ferryboat to Downtown Disney for dinner (a few times!). The captains are usually funny and informative. 2- using the hot tub every night to soak our sore muscles made for good conversations with other adults. This area is separate from the pool and is very private. 3- staff at Front Desk was always friendly and helpful in arranging dinner reservations, water park tickets, etc. 4 Great pool with many chairs and available towels: do order a Mardi Grog at the pool bar! Drawbacks: 1- no table service restaurant. We only ate breakfasts at the counter service restaurant, which tend to get boring after a week but you must try the beignets (my favorite!). 2- the store is a little small with less choice than Riverside’s. I didn’t find a FQ souvenir that I liked enough to bring home :( One last note: the bus transportation is a great way to get around DW hassle-free but even if FQ boards and debarks before its sister report Riverside, the busses do get crowded. We would recommend this resort to anyone (couples or families) that needs a quiet and pleasant resort, if you can handle the Mardi Gras theme. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: dutchdave123
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed in Animal Kingdom Lodge at Disney and this was fantastic...as our review stated. We wanted to stay at Disney again this year and chose the Port Orleans French Quarter. Upon arrival we found our room quite basic and dull looking, it felt like a room in Spain. Deciding to give the place a chance we went about our holiday with an open mind, but were greatly let down by the housekeeping here. The room was dark and gloomy, it was only hoovered TWICE during 14 nights, and the dust was an inch thick in places! We were digusted to find a pair of childs underpants had been left under one of the beds, and this took THREE phonecalls and FOUR days to get removed!!! We also had to ask for toiletries on several occasions. The hotel itself was tidy, but we found quite a few of the staff were generally unhelpful....and quite moody on occasions. We appreciate that generally ths hotel has got good reviews on this site, but we were let down. Yes, we may have been spoilt by staying at AKL last year, and yes POFQ was a two grades below AKL but for us in the UK this was still not a cheap option. We will return to Disney in a few years but will never stay here again. Our advice is to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Smurray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans French quarter with my husband and our 2 children, (ages 4 and 2). We got to the hotel about 11:00 and wanted to go ahead and check in (even though check in was not until 4) so that we could get our parking pass and tickets for the parks. We were pleasantly surprised that they went ahead and gave us our room and room keys so early in the day. We stayed in room 5117. It was on the corner facing the river and across the walkway to the pool. It was very quiet and there were ducks right outside our door which the kids loved to see everytime we left the room. According to the staff that we talked to, the hotel was "dead" which worked out great for us b/c we were given such friendly and attentive service b/c the people who worked ther were looking for things to do. This really worked out for us when we went to Magic Kingdom too, no lines at any of the rides, our longest wait was for Pirates of the C and that was maybe a 7 minute wait. Take advantage of the free busses to Disney parks too. We took a break during the afternoon and were able to go back to magic kingdom in the evening without wearing the kids out too much. I had brought a pack and play for my son for his naps and forgot to bring a blanket and sheet for it, but the hotel provided us a fitted sheet and we got it immedialtey after calling to request one. On the last day of our stay we were wanting to go swimming before we left so that the kids could use up some energy before we started our drive back to Texas, I called the front desk and requested a late check out of 1:00, which they gave us so we were able to enjoy the pool for a couple of hours before we left. We had a great room, view and experience at this hotel and with 2 little ones, I am all about ease of travel. We really had a great experience at this hotel and I highly recommend this hotel and this room especially for people travelling with little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Who's going to stop going to Disney?”
Reviews.Author: nfsrocks
Reviews.Content: We are Floridians local to the area and went to experience my birthday and a small family weekend getaway. Needless to say, we chose Disney, knowing there wouldn't be a disappointment. Well, I was partly right. Booking the reservation was fine over the phone directly contacting DIsney, we got the best rate. The best time to go to Orlando is September, so the rates you can't beat, especially at Disney. Anyway, we arrived on my birthday and checked in. The landscaping and outside was everything you can imagine from Disney- picturesque. Upon check-in we were given 2 rooms that I had booked adjoining each other. We were not offered bell service so we lugged our luggage and our infant to our rooms. When we went inside, the room was filled with smoke, my infant picked up a sharp pin off the floor and was holding it in her hand. It smelled so bad, I called to have our rooms switched. By the way, they don't guarantee that you will get a non-smoking room. The beds were so small that only one person can fit on them. At least most other hotels have double queen beds in them. These were full-size --- SMALL! I finally was able to get another room, on the other side of the hotel and the 2nd room was not adjoining b/c they didn't have it available. I figured I would look.... Lugged our stuff all the way to the other end of the property and the rooms were not close. I peeked into the room adjoining our room and it was EMPTY! So, again I called the front desk to see if I could get the adjoining room instead of the one around the corner and got a rude operator who told me "obviously it's booked otherwise we would have given it to you". Went on to talk with the front desk and after 10 minutes, she was able to tell me that the room WAS available and we can go back to the desk to get some keys. Well, they don't go above and beyond for you, that's for sure. Talked with the manager at the front desk and he basically told us "we don't guarantee anything". I guess if you don't promise anything, you cannot disappoint. Service throughout the hotel was the same---Nothing very special at all. Looked like we were at Disney, but didn't feel it. From the bartenders, to servers, to front desk, management, etc. NOTHING. The boat trips they provide to downtown disney is nice and a convenient item. They also allow access to the Riverside property, which seemed much nicer. Except for the pools are old and run-down and have green algae in them. Not very well kept up. Breakfast at the Riverside was great and so was the service. But that is about the only place. There is so much to choose from at Disney and anywhere else, I would take my business elsewhere. But, in all honesty, who is going to stop going to Disney? Overall, not the impression we were looking for, especially since Disney prides themselves on service. Well, I have news for you, MANY other places do it better!

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KenMeyer
Reviews.Content: We had a Blast!! This is a wonderful resort. My wife, daughter, and I stayed here August 13th-18th, and took advantage of the free Disney Dining plan that Disney was offering. The resort itself is very quiet. We had read reviews of loud noises, and toilets flushing...we never experienced any of that. We were in Building #3. We were just a short walk from the food court, pool, and bus stop. The room was very clean, and was attended to everyday by the housekeeping staff. We did leave a few dollars for the maid everyday, and she did get us extra pillows when we left a note for her. The beds were very comfortable as well. The food court at the resort was very nice. We enjoyed breakfast everyday there, and one lunch meal there. There is plenty to pick from, and you would not go hungry! We really enjoyed visiting with ''Etta'' as she prepared our breakfast nearly everyday! What a treat to see someone smile and thank you, and wish you a good day!! We did take the river taxi to Downtown Disney one evening, and really enjoyed a nice meal at Wolf Gang Puck's Cafe. It was relaxing to cruise up and down the river in the evening. The bus service was excellent. We never waited more that 20-25 min for a bus, and always had a seat, as we were the first pick up. The bus was usually full, after it had made its other stops. We would love to come back to this resort, everything was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Port Orleans French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Fun in Disney
Reviews.Content: We returned from our Disney vacation in early August, 2006. What a great time! We loved Port Orleans French Quarter. we would highly recommend this resort. POFQ is smaller than the other Disney resorts, which was one of the reasons we liked it. We stayed in building #5. We had a wonderful corner room, on the first floor, facing the pool area. Although we were close to the pool and hot tub, we never heard any noise while in our room. The room was terrific! We found the room to be bigger than we expected. It had 2 double beds, which we all found to be very comfortable. (There were 2 adults, one teenager, and one 9 year old.) The bathroom area is separated from the actual sleeping area by a privacy curtain. Our teenage daughter loved having the curtain. It really gave her the privacy she wanted to change, do her hair, etc. The toilet and shower are separate from the double sink area. This allowed someone to shower, and someone else to get ready at the same time. There was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, refrigerator and safe in the room. They all came in handy! Everything worked great. No problems. The only thing we weren't thrilled with, were the pillows. They were definitely smaller than a standard size pillow. We phoned housekeeping, and within 10 minutes, they brought us 4 extra pillows! We utilized Disney's Magic Express service. We would highly recommend this. We arrived at the airport and went directly to a shuttle (bus) to our hotel. We didn't have to worry about our luggage at all. We arrived at 11AM and our room wasn't ready, so we decided to eat lunch at the food court. The food court offered burgers, fries, mac & cheese, salads, wraps, chicken fingers, hot dogs, pizza, chicken parm, spaghetti and meatballs, desserts, etc. It isn't a gourmet restaurant, but we all enjoyed it. Breakfast at the food court includes Mickey waffles, bacon, sausage, breakfast sandwiches, bagels, scrambled eggs, homefries, pancakes, cereal, fruit, etc. We HIGHLY recommend spending the $11.99 for the refillable mugs. They are well worth the money. And, you have a souvenir when you get home! After lunch, we decided to go swimming in the pool. (Great pool! It has a sea serpent shaped water slide. (Yes, adults use it too!!) We went to the concierge to see if we could check in our carry on luggage so we could use the pool. Without us asking, they phoned the front desk, and then let us know that our room was ready. We were thrilled since they said it would probably be a couple of hours before it would be ready. We went to our room, and our luggage was already there! Great service! We were very happy with the lifeguards in the pool area. There are many of them, and they are constantly walking around, watching everyone in the pool. We definitely felt our youngest daughter was "Safe" in the pool. One afternoon, a lifeguard decided to get a group together to play "Marco Polo". The children really enjoyed it. We were impressed. The bus service to all of the parks and Downtown Disney was very good. Buses run every few minutes to each of the parks and Downtown Disney from the hotel. We had one negative experience going back to the resort from Downtown Disney. We found the driver to be rude, and generally not in a good mood. (Very rare in Disney, but it does happen.) He didn't drop off at POFQ 1st either. He went to Riverside (POFQ's sister hotel.) 1st. From everything we read, the buses always stop at POFQ 1st. This isn't true. A few times, the buses stopped at Riverside 1st. This is a pain since there are a few different stops at the Riverside resort. The way to go to Downtown Disney is by riverboat. This was relaxing and fun. We highly recommend taking the riverboat. There is a nice boat landing right at POFQ. You can also take the boat over to Riverside. (Or you can walk. Either way is pretty quick, and nice.) You can rent boats at Riverside, and the sea racers. They were a lot of fun. You can also take a horse and carriage ride and rent bicycles. Our daughter got her hair "wrapped" at Riverside too. She loved it! (They charge by the inch.) We would HIGHLY recommend utilizing the Disney Dining Plan. It was terrific! There are so many restaurants to choose from and you never have to worry about paying your bill everytime you have a meal. We loved the convenience of it! (Not to mention the food was great!) Our daughter enjoyed collecting all of the Disney pins too. You can start your collection off with a complimentary pin from the resort. Then, you need to purchase a strap to put your pins on. You can buy pins and keep them, or you can trade pins with any Dinsey Castmember. It's fun! The gift shop at POFQ was good too. It had everything from snacks, to personal items, T-shirts, and lots of Disney stuff. It was great. We were able to purchase some last minute Disney souvenirs that we couldn't find in other areas of Disney. We would highly recommend Port Orleans French Quarter Resort! Our daughters are already talking about our next trip to Disney, and they want to stay at POFQ again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTrayz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. I loved everything about the property. The decor was outstanding. The outside was just as great as the inside. All of the rooms were clean and decorated with a French Quater flair, (they also had that special Disney touch to it).The pool decorations were really great. My complaint might be that when we stayed there, they had extremely bright lights surrounding the pool in the evening. They were almost like stadium lights. I loved that you could take the bus to any of the theme parks. It was a fantastic trip which was only enriched by the Disney experience

Reviews.Title: “Small is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ukbar
Reviews.Content: This is a great Disney resort because it is small and manageable. No long hikes to anywhere. Great pool with a slide. Quiet shaded walkways and courtyards. Just a really pleasant and relaxing place. I stayed here with my 17 year old daughter and 7 year old son for two nights (7/21/06 and 7/22/06) before moving to a studio room at the Boardwalk Villas for five nights as a guest of a Disney Vacation Club member (I bought their timeshare on Ebay-I also posted a review about our BWV stay). My son and I stayed three nights at the Pop Century last August and I found the POFQ to a wonderful relaxing change from the frentic hustle and bustle of the Pop. The rooms at the POFQ are a nice size. Not as cramped as Pop. I brought along a folding cot for my son to sleep on and it fit right next to the bed by the door. At the Pop, you open the door and practically walk into the bed. The room size difference is quite noticeable. A fridge and coffeemaker are standard in the room (unlike the Pop). I really liked the tiled sink area and the two sinks. I also liked the marble shelf behind the tub. The tub at the BWV studio room did not have this feature and I missed it. We could have rented two rooms at POFQ for about the same price that Disney charges for one night at a BWV studio. (POFQ at $155.00 a night and BWV studio at $305.00 a night). Our room and bath were spotlessly clean and our "mousekeeper" even put a bag of clean towels and soaps and shampoos in a bag on our door for us the second day because I left the do not disturb sign on the door because we were only there two nights and I didn't feel that we really needed any housekeeping. I have to give kudos to the POFQ Bell Services. I called and requested that are luggage be transfered to the BWV and they promptly sent a nice young man to pick up our luggage. Our luggage arrived at the BWV pronto with no problems. It was a really really nice service. After staying at the Pop and the BWV and the POFQ, I honestly think that the POFQ is one of the best deals for the money at WDW. I think the fact that it is a smaller resort eliminates alot of the negatives that I've read about in reviews of other resorts. Our room was on one end of the resort and we were able to park close to it and to walk to the bus stop and to the pool and the lobby with ease. The bus stop is covered and has seats and a fan (at the Pop you stand in the sun in a really long long line most of the time). I honestly think that the POFQ is one of the coolest (tempature wise in summer) resorts because it has so many shaded areas. The theming is lovely and the brightly painted railings and trim and lovely landscaping really disguise the fact that the resort is just a set of boxy motel buildings. The interior design is also really pleasing in color and decor with nice "antique" -looking furniture and attractive framed prints on the walls. I would definitely stay at POFQ again and I would recommend it to anyone staying on Disney property. I would also recommend that anyone thinking about staying at a Disney "value" resort rethink their choice and go for a moderate. It is well worth it in my opinion because you have more room, improved transporataion facilities, and more amenities (Pop Century nickles and dimes you to death by charging extra for a room closer to the food court and bus stop and for fridge rental and by not providing a coffee maker, which forces you to bring your own or pay for their coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: parkhoppermax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the French quarter from Aug1-8th 2006. Stayed with my wife and 2 kids (11 and 15). We had a good time here. This is a smaller resort than most Disney resorts and it feels that way. We were in building 4 which was great (close to bus stop as well as eating and lobby). The resort was very quiet. Some disney resorts get very noisy later at night (some parks stay open until 2 a.m.), not the FQ it quieted down after 10:00 p.m. The pool was great as well as the boat trip to downtown disney. The port orleans riverside resort is only a 5 - to minute walk from this resort so if you wanted to rent a boat or have a sit down dinner you could head over there. The walk along the river to the riverside resort is very nice. Complaints (only a few): The inroom coffee was awful and the rooms could have used a microwave but refrigerator was nice. The food in the food court was just O.K. but expensive (although not expensive by Disney standards). Overall a good resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, human sized resort”
Reviews.Author: shelter
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the French Quarter, 24th of July through 28th. The girl who checked us in was very hospitable and nice with our little kid. The room was larger than we thought for a Disney hotel, we got the water view and the fridge free. The bathroom - bathtub and toilet (noisy indeed but scary...) part - is too small but the 2 washbasins are in a seperate area so it's not a big problem. The shuttle service is efficient and French Quarter is the first stop for the 2 Port Orleans resorts, good point. But the Port Orleans station is often the more distant to reach in the parks at the end of the day... just an impression ? The food court is not too large but it gives to it a familial touch and the Riverside restaurants are close enough to walk to them along the river...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaMickeyMania
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a lot of hotels in Orlando but we keep coming back to POFQ. First stayed here for our honeymoon and simply loved it. The location is perfect and does not feel as crowded as some other Disney hotels can feel. We knew that we would have to bring our daughter here, who loves it as much as we do! Pool design is fantastic and the quiet jazz music being played around really adds to the atmosphere. Food is self service and a good variety. The only drawback is that I miss Bomfamilles which was the New Orleans table service restaurant whose food was out of this world. But as there are other great places to eat around WDW I couldn't let this spoil any vacation. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Xande
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Port Orleans French Quarter, everything was perfect from beginning to end. The French Quarter grounds are beautiful and very well kept, the pool is very nice and the room I had was very spacious and clean, offered everything we needed! The food court offerings were good and the refillable mugs are a great value. With Disney Magical Express we didn't have to worry about airport transportation, it is very convenient. Disney transportation to the parks is very efficient, I don't think I waited more than 10 minutes for a bus! The hotel also offers a boat to Downtown Disney, very pleasant! Port Orleans French Quarter, like everything at Disney, is great!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: kak513
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 nights in July of 2006, the 24th through the 27th. We chose this resort for its proximity to the parks, affordability, and theme. The Magical Express service was great--no hassle at all, and since we arrived close to 10pm, it was a welcome way to ease into our vacation. The check-in staff was cordial, but the room left much to be desired. I was expecting the king, non-smoking room I'd requested, and instead received a very obviously smoked-in room with two full beds. Too tired at this point to change, we stuck it out for the remainder of our trip. This was in building two, and we faced the water. I'm not sure if this is a smoking building or not, but it was an ajoining room, so we had to deal with someone else's smoke pouring in through the doorjamb. Like someone else mentioned, the toilets are a bit scary. They flush so hard my hair practically blew in the breeze they created. I had to plug my ears every time I flushed. Aside from this, the towels were in poor shape, indeed; completely fringed with loose threads and un-soft. Towels we used at a La Quinta later in the trip were of higher standards. Be aware that there is no closet--just a few hangers on a bar outside the bathroom. But the most heinous thing to occur was the maid turning off our alarm the third day. I'd left it set for the first two mornings (I'm extremely careful about these things) and I foolishly didn't check it, and we ended up oversleeping two hours and missing the magic hours at Magical Kingdom. If you can overlook all of the above, the location is good to get to the parks. The bus that services this property only goes here and the Riverside, and it picks up here first en route to the parks (so there's a better chance of getting seats) and drops off here first from the parks.
