Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: pointe201
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Port Orleans French quater and Riverside. I feel that these resorts are excellent. My family usualy stays at the Grand Floridian but since my children are older I felt that we did not need to stay so close to Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for Adults & Kids”
Reviews.Author: bgarrett61
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 boys (ages 4 1/2 and 7), we had a wonderful time. The room was an adequate size for us. The beds were very comfy. We stayed in Building 1 beside the river. It was a beautiful view. If you don't like walking, request one closer to the pool and restaurant. We were the farthest away. We didn't mind because we liked the view. The food was pretty decent. After awhile things start to taste the same. We didn't take advantage of all of the restaurants that were available and that was our fault. A definite must is the dining plan. We could eat all of the food, but it was so nice to be able to choose whatever without worry. A typical lunch of a burger, fries, and beverage for a family of 4 would run you about $56. If you have the dining plan, it's all covered. I think the plan was about $300 for the 4 of us for the week and it was well worth every cent of it. Don't miss out on the beignets (pronounced "ben yays") at Port Orleans. They are to die for!!!! The pool was absolutely fabulous. I talked with many people that had been to Disney numerous times and stayed in many of the resorts and they all preferred the pool area at Port Orleans French Quarter--especially for kids. The big dragon slide is a tremendous hit. My boys enjoyed that more than the crowded afternoon at Magic Kingdom!:( I loved it all. Just not enough time. My son had an accident one night and housekeeping hadn't come around that day. I called and within 15 minutes they were at the door and changed the sheets. I think you'll really enjoy this resort. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Mark from Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the French Quarter from 27th June to 11th July. We were in building 5 top floor. Our party was 7 adults in 4 rooms. The rooms were all clean and spacious with good facilities. They were cleaned every day by very friendly staff. The rooms were close to the pool, the food court and the laundry. The resort was quiet rather than lively, but that is what we wanted and what the brochure had promised. The food court was rather basic but clean with reasonable service although not a great selection of food. On several days we went to the neighbouring resort of Riverside which has a full service facilty. The walk along the river is very pleasant indeed. We used the excellent water taxi to get to Downdown Disney, otherwise we used the buses which ran a generally good service and we rarely waited more than 10 or 15 minutes and mostly got a seat. The bar in the hotel was usually quiet (even on July 4th) and the staff were very friendly. There was live music 4 nights a week which was enteraining and not too intrusive. One point for european visitors -if you are under 40 you must take id if you want to buy alcohol - they were very strict about this. Overall we were very pleased with our experience and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for our first Disney trip!”
Reviews.Author: KyleInStPeters
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 1 1/2 week trip to Disney World and Clearwater, Florida. The experience we had at POFQ was really great. We arrived late (around 11:00 PM) but the girl working the check in counter was still very friendly and helpful (as were at least 90% of the other Disney "cast members" we interacted with). Upon arriving at our room (in Building 6, 3rd floor) we started unpacking, only to discover that the lock on our daughter's suitcase wouldn't unlock (it looked like a small piece of metal was jammed into it). We called the front desk and they had a maintenance man up to the room in about 10 minutes with a bolt cutter to cut the lock off. Great service! We only visited the pool one night and didn't get to try the water slide as it was closed due to no lifeguard being on duty after ~7:00 PM or so. It was pleasant though; the water was cool even after a ~90* day of Florida sun, and as others have said there were lots of chaise lounges and chairs. Don't bother bringing your room towel, there is a large towel hut by the pool where you can get as many as you need. We didn't use the food court during our stay, except for one late night dessert "binge" which was very tasty (have the dessert guy make you an ice cream cookie sandwich...yum!). I can't comment on the other food, but the desserts were very tasty! We brought breakfast bars and ate lunch and dinner in the park...definitely get the Disney Dining Plan when you go! You won't go hungry.... Just be sure to make your reservations in advance. I would highly recommend both the Japanese Teppanyaki restaurant and the 9 Dragons Chinese (both at Epcot World Showcase) sit-down dinners. Other reviewers mentioned the waits for the bus; it can get a bit long sometimes. It is also frustrating when you're trying to get to Epcot and 2 Typhoon Lagoon or Animal Kingdom busses come by first (note: whatever it says on the bus's side display is where it is going, generally no other stops, though some of them do stop in Downtown Disney after dropping off at PO). A word of warning; the beds are double beds (though there are some single king bed rooms available). We ended up trading nights sleeping with our 4 year old daughter so we could have enough room (my wife and I are both over 6'3"). We didn't get much of the "towel animal" cute displays from the housekeeping staff (probably because we were there in "prime season" the first week of July), but they did make a little Mickey head out of a towel, a couple washcloths, and coasters. Disney does support an effort to reduce water and detergent waste, so you can hang your towels up on the shower rod if you would like to reuse them. I also left a note requesting more regular coffee (instead of decaf) which was respected (they actually left 3 or 4 regular coffee packets). One final suggestion; bring your own drinks and snacks for eating in your room. I paid $2.50 for a 20oz Coke from the vending machine (even worse than the prices in the parks, though only by 50 cents!) and the chips/candy bars were similarly over-priced. Overall, we had a great trip and a great experience at POFQ and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay "on property" at one of the Moderate resorts. We met a family that had been coming to POFQ every year for 6 years because they liked it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: 19Leanne19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter resort at the end of May this year and we were really happy with our decision. We stayed for 10 days and had a wonderful time. Here is a summary of what we found: - Rooms: Were a great size and were always very clean. Housekeeping was great. Asked for an extra blanket one night and they were up within 10 minutes. Always had lots of towels, shampoo, soap, etc. Housekeeping would leave us decorated towels in the shape of bunnies. Leaving a dollar or two each day isn't required, but always seemed appreciated. You could tell they would try extra hard to make things nice. - Front desk/concierge: Read other reviews about disappointing service, but this was definitely NOT the case with our trip. People were GREAT to deal with. I had questions about some phone charges and the girl offered to go through our entire bill and call me back. Was impressed because not only did she get the problem solved, but she definitely went above and beyond my expectations. Everyone was very friendly. - Food: Food court is typical here. They had burgers, hot dogs, pizza, etc. Breakfast was good, lunch and dinner was okay. Don't expect gourmet meals here, remember that it's a food court! One recommendation is to definitely get a souvenir mug. You get free refills at the resort for the duration of your trip. We bought one mug to share, and it was definitely a savings. - Pool: Was definitely popular. Lots of people staying at Riverside seemed to come over in the day to swim in the 'better' pool. Seemed busy, but never super crowded. -Transportation: Buses were great. Always the first to be picked up AND dropped off (double bonus!). Buses came every 5-10 minutes. Never had to wait long, always got a seat on the way there. As for the magical express from the airport, well all I can say is that it was AWESOME!! We were concerned about our luggage making it okay, being as how we were traveling from Canada, but we had absolutely no problems. We put the disney luggage stickers on and then when we got to Orlando, we just hopped on the bus. We checked in at the resort and then went to downtown disney. When we got back to our room later that night, our luggage was waiting in the room for us. Definitely a plus that we didn't have to waste time at the airport waiting for it. - Other comments: Gift shop at the resort was stocked with lots of things you would find at the parks/downtown disney. Good idea is to buy from here, then you don't need to lug packages around all day. Other suggestion is to use the package delivery. You will get your souvenirs within a day or two. Overall, it was an awesome trip and I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you have any questions, feel free to email me!

Reviews.Title: “Our new Disney Home”
Reviews.Author: GoofysWife
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed the French Quarter during June 17-23. We absolutely loved it compared to the values and other moderates that we have stayed in, in the past. The proximity of everything was awesome and even though they said our resort was sold out while we were there you would of never of known it. Nothing was ever crowded even the bus stops. No complaints. Our main concern was the noise level of this resort. We stayed at the Pop Century in a room facing the main pool and the noise was unbearable. So when we checked in they had told us we were in building 2 facing the pool. I was a little upset about that and told them that I had requested a room away from the pool. The Cast Member was great and imediately looked for us another room and found a room in building 6 which was very quiet and close to parking, bus stops and the food court. They were very accomedating. The rooms are worn but in good condition. Also the size of the rooms were big enough for a family of four. My family really enjoyed the pool and the slide. We had so much fun. My only complaint is that the food court was smaller the the others and that they didn't have a grab n go but this really isn't too important to our family. If we are lucking to go to WDW again we will definitely be staying at the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: heavybuddy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to WDW (and probably the only time we'll visit with young children) so we wanted everything to be perfect. We chose the POFQ after considering not only all the other hotels at Disney but those outside the World as well. We were very happy with our choice. This hotel is small by Disney World standards (only 1,000 rooms) so even when full it never seems too crowded. The theming works so well because not only are the buildings made to look like 19th century New Orleans, they are surrounded by lush landscaping and added details like lamposts,hitching posts,brick walkways and street signs that really provide genuine atmosphere. The rooms are small but contain quality furnishings,excellent beds and extras like refrigerators, coffee makers etc that raise them from glorified motel rooms to something in the Hyatt or Marriott category. I was concerned about the exterior corridiors but it wasn't a problem during our stay. We never heard a peep from any of our neighbors (although the flushing of toilets took some getting used to). If you're concerned about quiet,request a room in Blgs 1 or 7, at either end of the property,to minimize foot traffic. The level of service here is as good as any 4-star hotel I've stayed at,maybe better. Room was clean at check-in and it was kept that way throughout our 6-night stay. The location of this hotel was perfect for us,since we concentrated our efforts on Epcot and MGM, and POFQ is right next to both. Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom are only a 5 minute drive. Another plus is if you're driving you can choose a room close to the parking lot and every morning you can be out of your room and in your car in less than 60 seconds. I doubt if that's possible at any other hotel in the World. We bought a package with a 7-day park hopper and the dining plan, which is an outstanding deal if you're planning on eating most of your meals inside the parks. The room alone cost about $900 for 6 nights,or $150 a night. Not cheap, but a decent value considering the top hotels (Polynesian,Grand Floridian,etc) cost more than twice as much. If you've got the money then by all means stay at one of those. Otherwise,I think the Port Orleans French Quarter is the best choice. I would stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Rude registration employees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over all Our stay at Port Orleans was great. But the rude and unhelpful employees were a complete turnoff!! They were not willing to accommodate our requests at all! I literally was about 2 minutes from canceling our entire trip and driving 5 hours home. It was that bad. Not only could they not place us in a room near our parents or the pool, the biggest turn off was how incredibly RUDE they were. Words can not express how upset and disappointed I was in the registation staff. The hotel was nice with beautiful landscaping. It was very clean. The pool was nice. As was the hot tub. The food court left much to be desired. The maid service was good. Overall I would recommend this resort but hopefully you will be greeted by another staff member at registration. BEWARE OF RUDE EMPLOYEES AT FRONT DESK!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort, Much Better Than All Stars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Disney world. We came in 2004 and stayed in All Star Movies and didn't really enjoy that experience. However we do like the advantages of staying on Disney property ie; transportation, extra magic hours etc. So we thought we would try a moderate resort this time and chose French Quarter. We noticed a difference between the two resorts straight away. All Stars is a glorified "Butlins" whereas French Quarter is beautiful. Lovely landscaping, pool and river plus a bar that was great for a quiet drink in the evenings, as my kids just wanted to rlelax in the room watching TV at the end of a busy, hot day in the parks. After our 8 hour flight we arrived at the resort at around 5pm and all the kids wanted to do was get into their swimming costumes and hit the pool. Unfortunately we were informed at check in that the pool was closed for a chlorine "shock". We later found out that someone had pooed in the pool! Ok, thats horrible but accidents happen. However it also happened the next day and a few more times during our two week stay. There are signs asking for toddlers to wear training pants in the pool but people must totally disregard this for it to happen so many times. The pool guards have to fish it out with a net and i actually saw one of them heaving!!! The room, we thought was good. A nice size. I think Americans must be used to massive rooms if they think these are small, we found them more than adequate. There was dust and the kids found something plastic under the bed so i don't think they are cleaned to a high standard. I was disapointed that many of the sheets had small holes in them and feel that this is not really acceptable. However the beds were very comfortable but again i was disapointed that after being there for a week our sheets had still not been changed. Despite leaving housekeeping a daily tip we did not enjoy the delights of towel animals etc. More was done for us in this way at the All Stars. I wonder if you get more if you don't leave a tip and the maid is trying harder in anticipation of a good one when you leave. The Food Court! As with All Stars the food is not particularly good but i think it is generally hard to get decent food in Orlando. After two weeks you just want to get home and have a good old roast dinner!!! Fries, fries, fries. Vegetarian like me? Forget it. Hardly catered for at all. Ventured out to the Ponderosa on I Drive. Ordered steak for husband and daughter and kids meal for my son and the buffet for me (as enjoyed on our previous trip) was informed i would have to order a main meal as they do not sell just the buffet. I asked for the vegetarian alternative and they didn't have one! Would make no concessions so i had to order a steak i didn't want just to get the buffet. I would have gone elsewhere but it was late on a Saturday and everywhere was busy. My husband and i enjoyed the food offered in the Scat Cat Bar at the resort. The nachos (i ordered them without the chillibeef) are gorgeous and my husband really liked the chicken wings. The bread and dips just ok. On our last day we had lunch at the House of Blues in Downtown Disney and had a lovely pasta dish followed by Key Lime Pie. This was easily the best meal i had in Orlando. Also ate at Planet Hollywood (below average) Rainforest Cafe (dreadfully expensive) Hard Rock Cafe at Universal (good) Golden Coral (good Value). The parks are wonderful and i love everthing about Disney. Magic Kingdom is Disney personified and i love the parades. Mgm is interesting if you like all the film information. Enjoyed the stunt show and backlot tour. My son loved Rock n roller coaster. Animal Kingdom was my kids least favourite park and we only spent half a day there. In comparison they love Epcot especially Test Track. I loved Soarin. Water parks are great but be careful in Typhoon Lagoon when the big wave comes as the floor is quite rough and my kids suffered nasty grazes whenthey were knocked over. This time we went to Universal and enjoyed both parks. They don't seem as busy and hectic as Disney but also don't quite have the magic either. Spiderman was good but Men In Black was rubbish. Shreck and JImmy Neutron were also great. To sum up we enoyed our stay and would definately stay at the French quarter again. However i would not go in May again as it was way too hot and resulted in us only being able to cope with the parks for a few hours at a time. This holiday is punishing physically at the best of times, but that heat can really finish you off. We travelled with Virgin Holidays and booked their trip to the Everglades and Miami. Expensive but worth it, we had a brilliant day out and got to see a different glimpse of Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lynettejoy
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 2 weeks at Port Orleans French Quarter I can highly recommend it. Being a family party of 11, we wanted 4 rooms together. We rang the hotel from the U.K. 5 days before leaving, requested block 5 but that was fully booked so were given rooms 2301,2302,2303,2304 in block 2 (top floor). We had read that block 2 was for smokers, but only part of the building was smoking - our rooms were definitely non-smoking and in a super position. We often gathered in the evening outside our rooms and even ate take-away pizza there. Our rooms were a good size (by english standards) and were certainly on a par with a lot of our 4 star hotels. The air conditioning was the worst thing, it was so noisy, there was no way you could sleep with it on, so we used it permanently through the day to keep the room cool and turned it off at night and used the ceiling fan. The hotel itself is immaculate, the gardens beautifully kept - even to the extent that the horses pulling the carriages round "Riverside" and "French Quarter" in the evenings wear nappy bags!! It was a lovely walk in the evenings beside the river to "Riverside", but we seemed to be the only ones doing that. The boat to Downtown was a bonus and made a nice change from using the bus. At busy times though we did have to wait another 10-15 minutes for the next ferry as it picked up at "Riverside" first. On the plus side the buses to all the parks pick up here first before going to "Riverside" so we were guaranteed a seat. May was a perfect time to go-it was hot 80 -95 deg everyday, only one day of rain and we had booked Gatorland, but it didn't matter - we donned our Mickey Mouse ponchos (all the shops bring them out when it rains) and had a great time. The pool was super - not cold (hotel pools on Mediterranean holidays are much colder) and we usually managed to get sun loungers whatever time we turned up. Unlimited pool towels were another bonus(never a shortage) as were the childrens life jackets although these sometimes did run out. The food court was fine, enough choice for everyone and you can use the food court at "Riverside" for a change which has some slightly different choices. The food court was unsophisticated as was the fayre, but the food was all freshly prepared and cooked to order - try the beignets and cookies with mickey mouse sprinkles. On an average don't expect to pay more than $5 (£3) per person for breakfast and $7-$10 (£4-£6) for evening meal(one course). The souvenir mugs at $11.99 saved us a lot of money- we took them with us if we went to the Riverside foodcourt and used them there. Free drinks using the mugs are - tea, coffee, hot chocolate(nice at bedtime), water milk, coke, 7 up, root beer and others. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Port Orleans French Quarter and can't understand some of the negative reviews we read before we went as we would definitely return there when we next go back to W.D.W.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for little ones”
Reviews.Author: leDeal
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the French Quarter. This time we stayed for 5 nights (June 5-June 9) All in all its a great place, although our first stay 2 yrs. ago (April 2004) went much better. As stated in the review before mine, we will not be going back during a peak season again. The hotel was crowded, as were the parks and buses. Dont plan a summer trip to Disney unless you like high heat and long lines! The hotel is very clean, the rooms are a bit smaller than some but still comfortable. Having a refridgerator in the room was handy. For the most part, the staff is friendly and very helpful with tickets etc... The only complaint I have with the staff was when we checked in. We got a rude, know-it-all named Scott and although I tried to explain our requests, he blew me off and ignored me. After he assigned our rooms, I told him that he was going to have to change them and asked if he would like to listen to what I wanted. He was ticked off, but did what I asked anyway. The last time we stayed there the housekeepers would leave little animals made out of wash cloths and towels on the beds everyday and my daughter who is 6, was really looking forward to them. It was a nice touch... I am assuming that since they were so much busier this time, they didnt have time to do that. The restaraunt is a bit over priced, but so is everything else in Disney. The food selections are pretty standard, although we did get a nice pot roast dinner that was delicious for under $10 one night. The helpings are large and its open late, so when you get back from the parks at night, you can get a snack. Watch them closely when they ring you up...alot of the cashiers are "in training" and dont have a clue what they are charging you. We were over charged 3 times. One of the main reasons we like the French Quarter is because you can take a boat ride to and from Downtown Disney right from the hotel. Its really convenient and the boats run about every 15 minutes. Also....the pool is great! Wonderful for the little ones. Alot of fountains and a big sea serpent water slide. It has a kiddie pool as well. There are alot of lounge chairs, although they did fill up quick! We didnt have any problems with the buses to and from the parks, but they were crowded. Alot of people had to stand. The waits werent bad either. I recommend this hotel, especially to those with young kids Over all it was a good trip and we had fun... next time we will try a different Disney hotel for a change and a different season!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the family”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed a six night stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter. For a family with two kids 9 and 5, it was the perfect place to stay. We had a room with a view of the river in building six. The view was lovely, but I will choose a view of the pool next time. If you are planning on swimming, request building number 5 or 4. The grounds were beautifully landscaped with many little rabbits and squirrels running around. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. It was a bit cramped. Overall, the room is very functional. We felt that the room could have used an additional trash can. As you can imagine, we purchased a lot of items that needed to be opened, and we also brought back food to the room which needed to be discarded. The rooms were nice and quiet to our side by side neighbors and outside noise. However, we could hear feet from above. The toilets in these rooms have a tremendous amount of flushing power so we could hear flushing from all directions. Apparantly the pool at our lodge is better than our neighbor's at the Riverside. I met three different guest that were using our pool instead of their own because they felt it was better. The theme is alligators and sea serpents. The pool uses a huge sea serpent as the main piece were his tongue is the slide that drops into water that is 1 meter in depth. There are life guards and towel service at the pool with a pool side bar. The food court is perfect for a childs appetite. Most of the servings choices are carb heavy. The portions are very, very generous. We purchased the meal plan with our package that had a table service, counter service, and snack each day for each person. WE felt like we were full the whole time. There is a small refrigerator in the room so you can take the leftovers back to the room. Plus you can substitute two table service meals for a themed or more formal breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I highly recommend doing some research prior to your trip and taking advantage of some of the better dinning at Disney World. The Disney Transportation is not good, but what can you do. I look at it as air travel with lay-overs. They promote buses every 15-20 minutes, which means you get there and might wait two or 25 minutes. I would allow 1 hour for time to and from the parks. More if you are having dinner at a different resort. Transportation doesn't take you from the Port Orleans to the Contemporary, Floridian, or Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had dinners and breakfast at each of those and you have to take a bus to a theme park and then board another bus going to your specific resort. The French Quarter has one bus stop and our neighbor resort has four. The good news is that the French Quarter is the first stop, but that means you are boarding a bus that is rarely empty. Before you get to your park, the bus must stop at the remaining bus stops at the Riverside Resort. People get off and get on, so you can plan on standing as much as you will have a seat. The cost of laundry is $2 to wash and dry. This was my third trip to Disney World, the first of which when I stayed on property. On property is the way to go with a meal plan. The extra hours in the morning and evening offer some nice flexibilities in your plans. Not to mention the fast pass option that compliments your on property status. This was the first trip in which we planned during summer time and it will be the last. Next time we are pulling kids from school and going when no one is there. The humidity is horrible and with as much waiting as we did it made all in our party on edge and exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous Time in Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Disney was from April 29, 2006 to May 6, 2006 and was wonderful. Couldn't have asked for better weather, not a drop of rain. A little slow at the airport but once we got on the Disney Express, luggage and all, it was great. We arrived at the resort around 1:00 p.m. and to our surprise the room was ready. Our luggage was put into our room some time later with no problems. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean. We were in building 7 which was away from the main pool and restaurant but that was fine - short walk anyways. Pool was great, kids(8 & 14) had a blast, very clean, fun slide! One thing we would like to share is that our son had to go to hospital on the 2nd day we were there as he managed to contract croup, and the hotel staff were great, taxi was paid for and they even called to see if he was alright after he got back. Food selection was ok, we actually went to the Riverside restaurant near the end of the trip and found it to be a better selection, was much larger as well, so we would recommend going there a few times for variety. The resort mugs work there too! Bus connections were great, better off being at the French Quarter, as we seemed to be picked up first and dropped off first from the theme parks. Boat ride was fun too. I would definetly recommend staying at this resort, it was a wonderful time and we will be sure to return to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a fantastic position!”
Reviews.Author: richharri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter for 2 weeks from 9th - 22nd May 2006. Our room was in block 2 which was central for everything. The room was clean and plenty of room for a family of 4. We loved the little surpirses housekeeping would leave each day, some days we had animals made out of towels and other times the childrens toys where arranged around the room. Oh and for those reading this from the UK the fridge is a normal size kitchen fridge so plenty of room for beer and other provisions. It was hot while we where there 80 - 95 degrees but we never needed the airconditioning on at night!? We left it on all day and turned it off at bedtime and so never suffered with the noise the unit made, there is a ceiling fan but again we did not need it, the room stayed cool all night we all slept well every night. The Foodcourt was good, although the children got a little fed up with Macaroni cheese or chicken nuggets but for adults we could always find something we fancied and did not try everything. We enjoyed on a few occasions walking up to Riverside in the evening to eat at the Foodcourt, where there is a different and larger selection although alot busier. The walk to Riverside was lovely, we were surprised how few people walked along by the river. There was a good selection at breakfast, we especially liked the Beignets and the Mickey Waffles. You could buy milk and cerial in the shop and therefore eat in your room is you wished. Oh and as for the resort mugs they saved us a lot of money. Although the initial cost seems steep, when you work out how much soft and hot drinks would cost over a two week holiday its certainly worth it. The pool was lovely, the children especially enjoyed the waterslide. The hotel supplies towels and life jackets for the children to wear, although on a few occasions if you returned to the hotel later in the day for a swim there were no jackets left and occasionally no sun loungers. The children loved the little animals (rabbits and squirrels) that ran around the grounds even the pool area during the day. The disney bus service worked great, as others have said the French Quarter is the first pick up before the bus goes on to Riverside (sometimes is didn't?) you could always get a seat going to the parks, coming back was another matter. At least it dropped off first but at 11.30 at night after standing holding two children asleep that was little consilation. The boat to downtown disney was a real bonus and a lovely trip down the river, again some evenings it could be very busy and you could have to wait one or two boats going either way. We had a magical holiday and are already planning to go back, I have no reservations about recommending this hotel families and couples would both enjoy this location.

Reviews.Title: “Truely a Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on tripadvisor regarding Disney's moderate resort-Port Orleans, French Quarter, I vowed to write my own once I returned from my trip. I just got back from the airport so I'll write while my memory is still fresh. My boyfriend and I booked the French Quarter resort through expedia and we utilized the Magical Express service which was provided to us for free. Our bus came really quick and we didn't have to worry about picking up our luggage b/c it's automatically delivered to our room. After arriving at the resort, we had a smooth check-in experience and the hotel staffs were very friendly and helpful in the whole process. Our room was just as described, cozy and clean. The bathroom is rather small but I love how they place the sinks outside and with two of them, we can get ready at the same time in the morning. There was only one small inconvenience which I thought they could improve-we didn't have the "do not disturb" sign that usually can be put outside of your room. The housekeeping lady often comes around 9am since they assume most people are already heading to the parks. We liked to sleep in so it was sort of a nusiance. The bus taking you to the parks comes very frequent. The average wait time is around 10-15 minutes. sometimes sooner. French Quarter is the first stop for pick-up so we always had seats. The best thing about the bus is when we return from the parks at night, French Quarter is the first stop for drop-off. The ferry ride to downtown disney was only about 10 minutes and you can enjoy the scenary while in transit. We stayed in Building 6, which was kind of far from the food court and the bus stop, but it's only a 5 minutes walk. The food court offers same food everyday but you do have serveral options. We didn't use the pool b/c it was too "kiddy", but the hot-tub was very nice, albeit a little small. Overall I enjoyed my stay Port Orleand-French Quarter very much. I think it's very good for couples who wants to have a relaxed time. This was the first time I stayed in a Disney resort and I must say I enjoyed all the perks (such as extra magic hour, the magical express and free gift delivery to hotel from themeparks) very much. I'd love to reutrn to Disney in the near future, and French Quarter is definitely my top choice for accomadation.

Reviews.Title: “One again loved the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dmg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter for the second time and once again loved it. The rooms although on the small side are very comfortable and the mini fridge now in the rooms was nice to have. The landscaping and theming are very nice, the boat ride to Downtown Disney worth the trip, the food in the food court very good and reasonably priced, and the small compact size of the resort more to our liking than the larger resorts. The pool was refreshing and only a short relaxing walk along the river you can visit the facilities at Riverside. The resort just has a certain feel about it that some of the larger resorts don't have and I guess one plus of the smaller rooms was that there were always people strolling the walkways and it gives you the feel of actually being in the French Quarter of New Orleans. We considered staying at Old Key West but couldn't get the room we desired, we were not dissapointed with our decision to once again stay at the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days at the French Quarters--May 6 to May 12, 2006. Our room was very clean. Food was good! We could not find one thing wrong with the resort. Everyone was very nice and friendly. Pool was great. Everyone going to Disney should try this resort, you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Disney with my husband and son. Stayed in building 1 on the 3rd floor...too far. The grounds were a mess. The landscaping looked as if it hadn't been touched in months. Very sloppy. The room was OK. The beds were very uncomfortable. And by the way, they were not Queen Size beds as advertised, they are Full Size. The housecleaning was terrible. All they did was fix the bed. The towels were just thrown on a shelf; no fancy animal shaped towels. The toilet tissue almost ran out. The food court gets boring. It's the same food everyday. The pool is nice to look at, but oh my God...dead bugs floating all over the surface. I had to get out, it was grossing me out. The Disney Magical Express is advertised in such a manner that leads one to believe that your luggage will be waiting for you when you get to your room. They don't tell you that you get your luggage 3-5 hours after you arrive, until you read the small print in the back of the booklet.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Enjoyed this Resort....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lordhavemercy
Reviews.Content: ....my daughter and I stayed in the French Quarter to celebrate her 16th birthday. Lovely resort grounds. The rooms are nicely appointed with small refrigerators. The beds are very comfortable. A nice coffee pot and amenities. The bathroom is small, but has all the necessities. The sink area is separate with very attractive pedestal sinks. We enjoyed our room as well as the pool and hot-tub. I felt very comfortable allowing my daughter to wander the grounds as they're well lighted. The atmosphere truly reminds one of the french quarter and it's residential area....(at it's best and cleanest) .....the courtyard dining area is very nice. We purchased the resort cups, which allow you to refill the cups whenever...at no additional charge....at the courtyard drink machines. We refilled the drink cups at least 2x's a day. I estimate that we drank about $100.00 worth of refills while we were there. So the cups are a great deal. We also purchased the Disney Dining Plan...which is an excellent value. .....we thoroughly enjoyed the facilities at the French Quarters. I feel it was an excellent value. With this resort you get the "feel" of a deluxe resort....at mid-range prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: amangialardi
Reviews.Content: Port Orleans French Quarter offered everything you need on a Disney vacation! The landscaping was absolutely beautiful and truly reminded us of New Orleans. The architecture and grounds seemed very authentic. While there were plenty of kids at the resort, it was big enough that you didn't feel crowded. The resort was very quiet and relaxing-a very nice atmosphere for my husband and I who were celebrating our 1 year anniversary! The river access is wonderful! It provides about a 10 minute trip to Downtown Disney. The resort is relatively close to all theme parks. The best part is that French Quarter is the first pick-up and first drop-off to and from the parks! Since the ride is shared with guests at Port Orleans Riverside, this is truly an amenity since the bus would get full and some people would be required to stand. After a long day at the parks, the last thing I would want is to have to stand for the ride back! If I had to discuss one area of improvement, it would be the food choices. But in reality, this wasn't a real problem. The resort offers a "food court" with somewhat of a variety. It is important to remember that the food is not gourmet quality and is priced according to Disney standards. But this is to be expected and when booking a Disney vacation price of food can not be of concern! And who really visits Disney to eat at the resort anyway??? Overall, my husband and I had a wonderful time and would definitely stay at French Quarter again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMomx3
Reviews.Content: We love it here....we have stayed at many of the Disney resorts, not a complaint about one of them, however, this one is perfect!! Rooms are nice, comfy! The pool is so much FUN for the kids with it's dragon/serpeant theme and slide! It is also on the waterway, with boat transportation to downtown Disney!! LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: cornflkgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married 2 years ago but were unable to take a honeymoon at the time due to my fulltime school schedule and his work and then we got pregnant and never did go. So, we finally got to go on our honeymoon after 2.5 years of marriage. We stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from March 18-24 and had a wonderful time. The resort is beautiful and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in lasted 10 minutes, if that and we were given a handicapped room with no bathtub so we thought we were going to have to go through a long ordeal of arguing since the whole resort was booked but, I simply asked nicely if they could figure something out since it was our honeymoon and the situation was very quickly resolved with a nice king bedroom right across from the pool with a bathtub. No problems there. Mousekeeping was flawless and our room was spotless the whole time we were there. We were left fresh towels EVERYDAY even when we had hung our towels to show that we would reuse them. Our shampoo and soap was replinished everyday and we had enough to take home some mickey soaps/shampoos for our family. We had nice little bows made out of towels and they even tied a bow out of the toilet paper. The resort is a very nice layout and it is hard to be far from anything. There is no more than a 5 min. walk to anything on property. The boat launch was very near our room and a great relaxing ride to Downtown Disney area. We did not take the buses because we had our car and prefered to drive and that worked out great because you get free parking at all the theme parks when you stay on property. The foodcourt was very close to our room and had okay food. They have pretty good hotdogs and a nice variety of food. The giftshop carries any of the little things you might forget to pack and many nice gift items. The only complaint I have about the entire stay was that, despite the 80 degree temps most of our trip, the nice sparkling pool very close to our room was FREEZING and we could not really swim in it. We took a couple quick dunks and ran back to the room to put on a sweatshirt. It states in all the brochures etc that Disney Resort pools are "heated." This is listed as an amenity but we do not feel we had use of this amenity at all and it should not be listed as such. We also stayed at All-star Movies for one night on the 25th and though it was clean and adequate it did not have nearly the ambience and romantic atmosphere of Port Orleans French Quarter. We felt it was more appropriate for people traveling with small children. Whereas, Port Orleans had a more mature feel to it. Overall we had a fabulous time and would most definitely return to Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Canucky
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here on a Saturday and Sunday night before heading home and although we enjoyed our stay, I found the premises dated and wanting for some updating. We arrived early and found our front-desk person to be mildly, but not overly helpful, which is highly unusual for Disney as we've stayed here before. We left all our luggage in our car and departed for the theme parks. We saved some time by buying our admission tickets (they put it on your room key) at the hotel's concierge. We found the shuttle transport to all the theme parks to be excellent except for the constant nattering by the bus drivers who I guess are directed by their powers to be to be funny. However, early in the morning this didn't work so well. We took in Magic Kingdom and headed back to our room at about 2pm. Our assigned room was ready upon our arrival. The rooms are fine but certainly not outstanding and hardly a great value. They are nicely adorned but dated. The food was truly awful (and pricey). They had some fresh fruit but most of the fare consisted of the fried variety. It really wouldn't be that hard to institute a more creative and varied menu but I guess they are simpy giving the guests what they want. The food really turned me off ever staying here again. I tried a vegetarian sandwich which was almost the worst thing I've ever tasted. My son, 7 1/2, ordered a hot dog which turned out to be almost a footlong and was accompanied by a bun which split and wouldn't even hold the monster dog...perhaps a kid's menu? The access to the theme parks, whether by bus or boat, was nice. The pool area was too busy to even think of trying to find a spot. Overall, I would not stay here again. For the price payed, I'd expect something a little more high-end but I guess you pay the price for belonging to the cult that is Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family!”
Reviews.Author: Martdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter for 5 nights the first week of March. I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor and by reading the Unofficial Guide to Walt Disney World before choosing our hotel. The result was total satisfaction with our pick. I think that's my most important piece of advice, know what you want and do your research. After requesting building 2 or 5 we were happily placed in building 5. I decided not to pay extra for a river view and have no regrets, the courtyard is lovely and the parking lot wasn't visible so no eyesores. The decor was nice too and it didn't seem over the top like some of the other moderate or value resorts. Upon arrival the room was clean and someone was already getting us extra towels. We did leave a tip daily for the person cleaning our room and it seemed appreciated. We would come home after a long day to a clean room and a little "surprise" of toys arranged in a funny scene or a towel made into an animal. We also stocked the minifridge to full capacity with breakfast and snack foods so it was a money and time saver. We used the boat to go to Downtown Disney twice even though we had our car. It's a relaxing ride and it made the journey just as much fun as the destination. Our 5 and 2 year old loved any mode of transporation other than the car. My oldest said her favorite part of the day we went to MGM was the bus ride there (it was the only day we took the shuttle bus). I agree with other reviewers to allow extra bus time due to the Riverside stops but since the kids were having fun I didn't mind. We had a wonderful trip to Disney World and staying at the French Quarter was the perfect Disney home for our family and our budget. Luckily we were going to Naples next (see Edgewater Beach Hotel review) so I was sad to leave but consolable.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disney's Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family travels to Orlando yearly and we stay at a different Disney resort each time. We found that Port Orleans French Quarters was not nearly as nice of a visit as the rest of the resorts we stayed at. The bus transportation to the parks was terrible, sometimes waiting for 40 minutes for a bus. Once the bus arrives, expect a 10 minute ride around the resort to pick up people at four other stops before you leave the resort grounds. The pool was almost too cold to swim in even with the 85 degree temps. The food court was no more enjoyable than a trip to Burger King and it is a noisy resort. The carts they run around in day and night makes it like sitting in the middle of an ATV trail. The only positive things I can say is the rooms were nice and the service was clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Pools Freezing-- New Temperature Policy for DIS Pools”
Reviews.Author: sparklynails
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was to get away from the winter cold and spend some time swimming and at the parks. Well, Disney turned down the temperatures on their pools starting in January, and the water was far too cold for swimming. My kids were disappointed. The manager apologized and gave us a $50 room credit, but we won't be doing Disney in the winter, anymore. We'll go somewhere we can swim, like Mexico or the Bahamas.

Reviews.Title: “POFQ is OK, not the best Disney resort IMO”
Reviews.Author: ssbbcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights following a 3 night land/4 night sea package. Our 3 night land resort was the Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL), which we liked MUCH better. The Port Orleans French Quarter (POFQ) is a lower level of resort compared to AKL, so we already had lower expectations. Even still, this was just not as nice as we had hoped and did not meet our expectations. This resort is grouped with the Port Orleans Riverside (POR), so there are LOTS more people here in general. If you are planning to visit any of the parks using the Disney Transport system, keep in mind that the buses serve both POFQ and POR together. The 1st stop is POFQ. Once you board, you spend another 15-20 minutes riding through POR to pick up all other guests before the ride over to any of the parks. When returning from the parks, the bus system can get totally overloaded, and it's not unusual to have to wait for 3 or more buses to come and go before you get your turn to ride back home. Unfortunately, some guests even broke in line, making the transport experience quite frustrating. I also found that the concierge staff was not very helpful and even gave incorrect information on upgrades to park passes and info on the Magical Express service(the staff at AKL were always right on track, never felt misled there). The rooms are clean and the place looks generally well cared for. Rooms have a small fridge in them. The pool is nice, but can get very crowded. Never got a chance to get into the spa because of lots of families w/ children who were too young to be in the spa, but the parents didn't follow the rules. Sometimes the noise level was a bit high, as the age demographics at this resort tend to be quite young. I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: shorti2085
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights from March 11-17th. It was my boyfriend and I, both 21 and 20. Peaceful, relaxing rides on the ferry to both Downtown Disney and Riverside. Excellent Housekeeping service. Good food and you are staying at Disney, so expect about 6 dollars per meal. Giftshop is nice, and so is the pool. Friendly customer service. Very convient bus to get to Disney Park and areas. It was romantic, we wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of Disney's best kept secrets....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children) stayed here the first week of March 2006. We had a ground floor room in Building 5 facing the river. Not too far from the pool, the main building, food court and the boat launch to downtown Disney. Great location. Check-in was flawless (as a previous reviewer had said). After walking for miles and standing in lines in the theme parks all day, this resort is an absolute pleasure to come back to. You can stroll through walkways lit by old fashioned lanterns and you are surrounded by lush foliage and flowers. You'll pass by a horse drawn carriage and hear southern jazz tunes in the distance. Or you can hop on the riverboat and take a lazy ride up the river. The pool was a hit with the kids (loved the serpent slide). Rooms were clean, nicely furnished and beds were comfy. The balloons and mardi-gras beaded necklaces were a nice touch upon our arrival. The only 'con' would be the food court. We found the selections to be limited in variety and only pizza is offered via room service. I would recommend taking the short route over to Riverside and sampling some of their food court options (better in our opinion) or even dining at their restaurant. We also went to Riverside to rent the boats and bikes which was fabulous. It's great that the two resorts are connected and close to one another. Overall, a great resort (I heard from many during my stay that the resort is often chosen over many of the deluxe resorts at Disney). We would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for entire family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the French Quarter Resort February 25 - March 1, 2006. It was my husband and I plus our two kids (6 and 10) and my parents. The accomondations were very nice (we stayed in building 5) and very close to the buses, the pool and the food court. The rooms were neat and clean - an average hotel room size. The staff was very accomondating and the kids loved the pool. The food court had a pretty good variety for a food court and the prices were pretty much what you would expect to pay (avaerage breakfast $6/each, Lunch $8/each). We never had to wait more than 5 - 10 minutes for a bus to the parks and we always got a seat. We took the boat ride (free) to Downtown Disney from the resort the first night and were entertained by the fireworks from Epcot on the way back to the resort. All and all a great time for both young and old!

Reviews.Title: “It was great.... and not just because I got engaged!”
Reviews.Author: nat_3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Port Orleans French Quarter (POFQ) for President's Week in February (19th - 26th), 2006 There were six of us who went down, all adults! First of all if you are staying at a Disney resort and flying into Orlanda look into the Magical Express. This is one of the best ways to start off your vacation. When you land all you do is go to the counter and get on the bus. You don't have to get your luggage or anything. They show you a little video telling you about some of the new attractions and shows. Seriously GREATEST THING EVER! Oh and it's free until October or something, but I would have paid for this service. There are only two things I didn't like the first was check in. It TOOK FOREVER. Be prepared because like you everyone will have a million questions about their rooms, tickets, parks, etc. etc. Don't get me wrong, the girl checking us in was nice, polite, and took her time explaining everything. It's just that when you first get there you just want to go see Mickey! We were in Building 7 with three waterview rooms. (This was a bonus since only 1 was supposed to be a waterview room). If you are looking for a quieter place and don't mind being further away from the food court this is a great place to be. We didn't hear anything in the mornings or at night and the walk to the food court was like 2 minutes. We got the refill mugs and they were great, so long as you had them with you when you wanted something. The food was pretty good. My mom and sister really like the beignets (sp?). We didn't really eat there much as we were in the parks pretty much every day. The only other thing I didn't like was the concierge staff. I had to talk to them a couple of times and they were neither overly friendly or helpful. It was a busy week though and I am sure they were just sick of answering all the same questions or listening to people complain about all the same things. One thing to keep in mind, if you are planning on going to other resorts to eat (we went to JIKO at Animal Kingdom Lodge) be prepared it takes a while and you have to transfer buses. It was well worth it though. Oh and yes I got engaged while down there, he proposed on the 15th floor (California Grill) at the contemporary resort after the fireworks at Magic Kingdom! This is a great resort, even for 6 adults we didn't feel it was too family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful and Romantic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hlh406
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Port Orlean's French Quarter from March 2nd until the 7th. Our check-in was very smooth and we were given a king bedroom, which was a corner room, that overlooked the river. There are 7 buildings and we stayed on the second floor of building 5. It was absolutely beautiful and yet very convenient to the lobby, pool, and food court. The room was very spacious for 2 adults and I loved the fact that the sinks were separate from the shower/tub area. This made getting ready in the morning quick and easy. Housekeeping was wonderful and we never had a problem. The grounds are amazing and quite romantic. I purposely picked this resort since other reviewers mentioned that the resort is much smaller than other Disney resorts. The cobblestone streets and gardens were breathtaking. It is a about a 10 minute walk along the river to Port Orlean's Riverside which I would suggest doing. The food at POFQ was decent. I read so many reviews that the food was horrible but I really didn't think that was true, however, the majority of our dining experience consisted of breakfast. We also had breakfast at the BoatRight's Dining Hall in Riverside and that was great for a sitdown restaurant...try the sweet potato pancakes or banana stuffed french toast. The transportation to the parks was very efficient. We never waited more than 10-15 minutes for a ride. And the parks didn't seem that crowded the week we were there. Fast Pass worked great for my husband as I am 21 weeks pregnant so he would use fast pass for all the rides I couldn't go on. His favorite rides were Expedition Everest at Animal Kingdom and Soarin at Epcot. My favorite was the Fantasmik show at MGM. It was great. We did the Fantasmik Dinner package which was awesome as we had great seating to watch the show following dinner at the Hollywood Brown Derby. I also enjoyed the Little Mermaid Voyage at MGM. The water taxi to downtown Disney is another must. This was so relaxing and downtown Disney was so much fun. There so many shops and restaurants. Overall, we had an incredible time at WDW and the Port Orleans Fench Quarter was a great hotel at a moderate price. It is romantic enough for adults yet it works well for families b/c the pool for the kids looked awesome and it's not as large as other resorts. We definitely would stay here again. Next time, we hope to take a day or two to enjoy the resort itself more.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: AMichiganMom
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter from February 23-March 1, 2006. We had an early morning flight and arrived at the resort around 10:30 a.m. with the plan of pre-registering. Much to our surprise, our room was available and the resort was ours to use! Cast members were very helpful at check in and took time to fully orient us to the resort, dining and transportation services. Our room was in Building 3, which was a terrific location with close access to the pool, lobby, shuttles, and dining areas. We overlooked a courtyard, which was another pleasant surpise, as we had paid for a standard parking lot view. Our corner room was nice, with two double beds, a small table with two chairs, a television, a small refrigerator, and ample storage space in the dressers as well as in the dressing area. After reading so many comments about the "small size" of Disney resort rooms, I was quite pleased with our room and how well it worked for our family. The pool area was wonderful and the grounds were so very beautiful. Quaint tree lined cobblestone "streets" were surrounded by beautful foliage and New Orleans style Mardi Gras music played in the background. The hot tub was not operational the entire time we were there, which was a disappointment given the cooler temperatures during our stay. My children, ages 5 and 8, loved the serpent slide at Doubloon Lagoon and also enjoyed having access to the pools at Riverside, especially Ol Man Island! There are recreational opportunities just down the path at Riverside, including fishing, biking, boating, horse and carriage rides, etc. I only wish we had more time to spend at the resort to use them. The food was just as described by so many reviewers, with overpriced mall food court style meals, but my children loved it, especially the Mickey waffles and chicken nuggets. We found the food in the Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory to be better than that served at the resort's only full service restaurant, Boatwright's Dining Hall. Those planning on staying at Port Orleans should note that reservations are required at Boatwrights, just as they are at many Disney dining options. Cast members were friendly and efficient in all dining areas at Port Orleans. Housekeeping services were wonderful and staff was quick to respond to requests for additional pillows, extra towels, etc. Transportation was run very efficiently, with bus service to the parks occurring frequently throughout the day. Ferry service was available to Riverside for those not wishing to walk and also to Downtown Disney. We never waited more than five-ten minutes for shuttle service at any point during our stay. Impressive!!!!!!!! We thouroughly researched all Disney moderate resorts prior to our stay and were most satisfied with our choice at Port Orleans French Quarter. We really enjoyed our time there and would definitely choose Port Orleans again!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the French Quarter for 8 nights and LOVED IT. Origianlly booked at the Grosvenor thinking it was a Disney property but it is not, and that fact combined with poor reviews on this site convinced us to change hotels. We got a great deal at the French Quarter and I am so pleased we stayed there. It was quiet and clean and beautiful, not too overrated and full of itself like the Grand Floridian, and not too busy and loud and crazy like the Pop Century and those value resorts like it. Staying on a Disney property is worth it in many ways. Check-in was a breeze. We got room keys which also serve as ID cards for the extra magic hours. They also allow you to use them like credit cards at anything Disney and then you just have one bill to settle at the end of the trip - plus anything you purchase at Disney will be delivered to your hotel free of charge. There is also Disney's Magical Express which picks you and your bags up at the airport but we didn't use it becuase we needed a rental car. We stayed on the third floor of building three overlooking the courtyard. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, and we never heard our neighbors. Maid service was excellent. We were conveniently located near the lobby, concierge, cafeteria, laundry, pool, hot tub, parking, and the bus stop. There are buses for every location from the hotel and there is a bus to each park every 10 minutes or so. They run an hour before the parks open and 2 hours after they close, plus they go to downtown Disney / Pleasure Island also - there are also boats on the Sassagoula River that run there too. The cafeteria was great - good food, big portions, fresh and fast. The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous and peaceful. Its a nice end to the day to take a walk around the courtyards or along the river. The Riverside Resort is attached and there are things there to see and do also. The extra magic hours were wonderful. We stayed at the Magic Kingdom until 1am and got to stay on rides for a second trip without getting back in line. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a ride during our stay, either with fast passes or not. We got to be part of the Expedition Everest preview, cool ride but the Rock N Roller Coaster is better. Overall the entire stay and experience was wonderful and we will stay at the French Quarter again. It was just right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long vacation at the French Quarter and had a memorable and pleasant time. Had stayed at the Riverside in 1998 when it was called Dixie Landings, but the French Quarter is much smaller and quieter than the other. The foodcourt was never really crowded, except maybe in the morning around 8-9 o’clock. Staff was friendly and courteous and helped us finding a doctor when my wife got sick during our stay. Had a room in Building 5 near the foodcourt and pool. Except for the first night when two girls next store decided to talk up a storm outside our room at 1 in the morning, they were checked out the next day and the next guests were very quiet. You can use all the resourses at the Riverside including boat rentals on the river, bikes and fishing hole stocked with catfish and bass. Pleasure boats leave from both resorts to Downtown Disney, definitely worth it. Without a car on this trip, the buses took us to any park we needed to go to, though next time I will rent a car so we can venture out to other restaurants and travel to the many attractions around Orlando. All and all, had a great time and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousWI
Reviews.Content: I wish we would have had more time to kick back and relax at this resort, it was a nice, quiet place. Our room was great, we had a king room with a river view. The only time we had trouble with noise was the first night a family checked in next door with a baby that cried at 4:00 in the morning, but that was short-lived. The boat to Downtown Disney was relaxing and a great way to get there. From Downtown Disney, you can get anywhere on Disney grounds, so we toured a lot of the other resorts. I would pick French Quarter again in a heartbeat. The food court was never too busy while we were there, the food was so-so, but we didn't expect much, it IS a food court, after all. The one exception was the beignets, which were delicious. Transportation on Disney grounds was very good, occasionally, we'd get a driver that didn't seem to know where the gas pedal was, so the trips ended up being rather long. Sometimes the drivers change up their routes, which meant being dropped off at POFQ last. That was rough when there was standing room only on the bus and we had just walked mile upon mile in the parks. Magical Express is great. We were a little nervous coming home because we could not check in for our airline at the resort, but we got to the airport in plenty of time, despite the multiple pick-ups at other resorts. Overall, this place gets an A.

Reviews.Title: “quiet convenient.great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights at beggining of 2 week holiday. . Very easy going. Room near to everything although no noise at all. Loads of hot water.Heat and air con unit excellent. We had mixed weather being February.We had a couple of minor medical incidents in the middle of the night(2 children)and found night staff to be very helpful.Nice location next to river with nice ride to Downtown Disney. We stayed in block 5 close to pool, hot tub, laundry, shop, reception and restaurant. pool very well supervised. poolside room would get morning sun. room cleaners where excellent and entertained the kids with a number of different flannel animals. Far more family friendly than the Swan and Dolphin. A tip in the restaurant order your food and pay for it before its ready otherwise when its busy the food can get cold waiting to pay. Visited the Riverside which seemed much noisier and busy. Boat and bike could be hired at the Riverside, five minutes level walk. Shop waas well stocked and appeared to have all essentials including beer and wine. We would probably stay here again if doing the disney thing

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: monchen
Reviews.Content: Disney definately has it figured out! Magical Express service was flawless. Room was great, quiet and geared more towards adults. Smaller resort made it very easy to get around. Quick boat ride to Downtown Disney was enjoyable. Those little extras like a towel folded into bunnies, ducks and a beautiful Anniversary Valentines Heart which were left by Mouse-keeping for us to enjoy made the French Quarter at Port Orleans a definate "WOULD STAY AGAIN" and recommend highly to anybody! The cafeteria style food court was good quality for the money and spic and span! We ate several times at various times throughout our stay and never had a bad experience! Overall we would rate this resort highly and absolutely stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vpapas
Reviews.Content: After looking at a lot of feedback on this website and others, we decided on staying at the Port Orleans French Quarter. Of the two, Riverside or French Quarter, this is the smaller hotel and easier to navigate. The rooms were pretty basic, nothing deluxe about them but on a positive note very clean. The grounds are nice and upgrading for a nominal fee to a river view was nice. The hotel and the staff are very accomadating, freindly, helpful etc. Buses run every 15 minutes or so to all the parks which was a big plus - they are crowded which is a negative. My husband and I could not justify the prices at the luxury resorts and this was well priced especially since we were hardly ever in our room. The food court was nice especially with our 2 year old son. There is a TV, lego's and crayons to keep children occupied. The food, especially for a food court, was very good. The grounds are very stroller friendly which is a plus. There is a river boat to take you to other parts of Disney which is nice. As much as I would like to try other hotels when we go back to Disney in a few years, we will probably go back to this hotel because it met all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bear66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Disney French Quarter. We had a King room, on a corner, so it had lots of window space. The room was lovely, and the housekeeping service was outstanding (e.g. every day we'd return to towels folded like neckties or bows). Bus service to the parks was pretty good (although this resort has a woman who directs bus service and takes herself a bit too seriously - screaming hysterically when a bus arrives - "BACK AWAY FROM THE CURB!!! STAND BACK!!") Food in the food court was better than average, and the lounge was very nice. Only downside of the resort was that you can't open the windows at all, and no rooms have balconies, so the room because very stuffy timetimes and it has no way to vent. Other than that, I felt it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Plearn
Reviews.Content: We went to Disneyworld for 7 days 6 nights at the beginning of January 2006. It's my daughter's first time there. We spent most of the time in the theme park rather than the hotel. We booked this hotel since we think that we can use the benefit of the "extra magic hour" of the Disneyworld. The Disney shuttle route to this hotel is more convenient than the one at the Riverside, especially on the way back from the theme park that we are already tired and want to get back to the hotel as soon as we can. You can also choose to go to downtown Disney by using the hotel boat service. If you are not going to stay in the hotel that much, don't pay extra for the water view. There's nothing much of the view that you pay and the room will be far from the lobby and the hotel food court. The last day that we stayed, we came back early (around 9.30 pm) for packing. We were shocked to see that the room was not clean yet. We decided to call the hotel and ask for the room to be clean. They took quite a long time (an hour) to clean up the room. We need to go to walk around the hotel and played the game instead. However, the hotel staff was nice enough to give us $25 credit for our next breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “renovated, clean, cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a suprise this resort turned out to be! The resort had been renovated recently. The grounds were very well kept, the pool was very clean and kept warm. Pool staffs was very, very attentive. There is no restaurant but a food court which is counter service, food is above average with decent variety but a bit pricey. One bar with jazz entertainers on most evennings. Our room was clean, clean, clean. Furniture looked new. Game room is small and you need to get a debit card to play all the games instead of quarters, all Disney hotels do this. There is boat service (other than bus)to Downtown Disney and to other resorts along the river, such as the Riverside and Boardwalk. The resort size is small and cozy compared to other Disney Resorts. Each Disney resort has its own bus service. This resort has one bus stop at the resort which is very convenient compared to other larger resorts such as the Carribean Resort that has 7 stops which gets confusing and inconvenient at the end of the day. The bus for this resort was hardly crowded which is nice when getting back from the parks at the end of the day. There are bike and boat rentals. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay at this Disney hotel resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and myself stayed in this hotel resort for 6 nights right after the New Year. This was our first stay at a Disney property hotel resort and we were not disappointed. We did some research before choosing this hotel resort and found in general what we had expected: nice surrounding, quiet environment and friendly staff. Our given non-smoking room was at Building #5 which offered a good view of the Sassagoula River. The room looked new and clean (probably due to a recent renovation) although the furnitures were a bit old. The beds were very comfortable but what pleased us was that the room was so soundproof that hardly any annoying noise could be heard. That gave us a very pleasant sleeping condition throughout our stay which was important to us. However, there were some minor drawbacks: we found the water running in the bathroom was not that strong, so we had to shower longer and we also found dust on the coffee maker/pot, so we did not use them. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay on this hotel resort property, despite we were at the Disneyworld theme parks most of the time. The restaurant (Sassagoula Floatworks & Food Factory) served reasonable value good food. The Disney buses to the theme parks and ferries to Disney Downtown were efficient. We would consider staying at this hotel resort again next time when we visit Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, a nice upgrade over Disney's Budget Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our past visits to Disney World, we've always stayed at the budget priced Disney hotels (All Stars, Pop Century) for the low price, but we were able to get a good price on French Quarter, and it was, as expected, a slight notch above those. The ambience is better, and felt at times more laid back than the budget priced hotels. Still a lot of children, but it tended to be a bit quieter. The rooms were slightly more spacious than the budget hotels as well. All in all it's a nice upgrade over Disney's budget offerings, and staying on property at Disney World has so many benefits over staying off property that it's worth paying extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: Sweets1
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay on Disney property and was the most disappointing, judging by the other reviews we were just unlucky. Our room was not clean when we checked in nail clippings on the floor, very dusty surfaces and hairs and dirty footprints on the tiled floor in the bathroom area. The next morning I phoned guest services and pointed out the problems and the fact that although we were staying in a no smoking building other guests were smoking in their rooms and the smell of smoke was passing through the ventillation system. The response was we'll clean the room but the smoking we can't help. Two more phone calls to guest services and on the day before we checked out the room was dusted, floor mopped and the room was sparkling, I thing it really depends on who cleans you room because the day it was cleaned properly the usual room attendant was day off. The pool, bus service, boat service and Theme Parks were all fantastic and don't miss the fireworks at Epcot and Magic Kingdom. Just for anyone who's interested I did pick up the nail clipping, wiped around the bathroom and bought an air freshener!! We were there 11 days!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie9227
Reviews.Content: We stayed at POFQ the week between Christmas and New Year's 2005 into 2006. It's a really nice place for the money. The walkways are beautiful, the pool is spacious and clean and the rooms are pretty. The biggest drawback was the fact that there was no sit-down restaurant on the property. You have to walk over to the Riverside property for that. It's a five minute walk if you walk quickly. The riverboat ride to downtown Disney is a lovely and peaceful way to avoid the buses. We really were concerned about being in Disney during the Christmas week due to the crowds, but everything was run effectively, and the resort, even though at capacity, was quiet and tranquil. The buses also came relatively quickly when getting you back and forth to the parks. The food court is small and the food passable. Those looking for gourmet food should not eat there. It's a food court - no better or worse than anywhere else in Disney. I found Boatwright's (the sit-down restaurant at Riverside) to be very tasty - the sweet potato pancakes are to die for! Each park is a 10 - 15 minute bus ride away. The most annoying thing about the buses is stopping 800x for each stop in Riverside, but getting off first when coming back makes it well worth it. Overall, it's a great resort, and my family and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from busy days at the Parks!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of researching before finally choosing the POFQ and I was a little apprehensive when I read some of the reviews. I had stayed once before at the Caribbean Beach Resort and enjoyed this location, but wanted to try something different. To my delight, the POFQ turned out to be absolutely perfect. My son, husband and his family spent our Christmas at WDW and we were pleased with the hotel accommodations and the amenities offered. The rooms were a comfortable size and the in room safe and refrigerator was a great plus. The service was great and the only downside that I could find was the selection of food in the food court. The 3 kids in our group loved the pool and didn't miss a day of swimming during our stay. I would highly recommend staying in building 5, as this building is close to everything. You are directly across from the pool and laundry facilities, which came in handy a few times during our stay, as well; we were in close proximity to the boat launch to the Riverside Resort and Downtown Disney.
