With the Christmas season being the busiest for Disney, we found coming back to our resort after a hectic day at the crowded parks very welcoming. If you have a chance, be sure to book a horse and carriage ride which takes you through the Riverside and French Quarter resorts. The convenience of staying on the resort far outweighs the price in our opinion and we wouldn't hesitate staying at POFQ in the future or recommending it to others!

Reviews.Title: “We loved POFQ”
Reviews.Author: budbrlady
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying here. We were booked at all star movies but with a discount code offered by Disney we upgraded to POFQ. We love the size and the fact that everything is nearby, short walk to food court, bus stop and pool! The food court can get busy for breakfast so after the second day we took the food back to our room and ate while getting ready. The only weird thing is that mousekeeping didnt pick up the trays out of our room that we left stacked on the table. The room was clean, we did have a shower draining slow, so maint. came a quickly fixed it for us. We would stay here again and enjoyed hearing the horse and carriage clopping around nightly. And the boat ride to downtown disney was really nice for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Disney Port Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Penguin47
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 6 nights here in mid-December (as well as 5 nights same time last year)--it is definitely our favorite Disney moderate resort, smaller & quieter than all the others. We tend to eat meals in the parks, but do enjoy the warm beignets occasionally & have sampled other good Cajun foods in the Food Court as well. Our rooms have always been very clean, & the Mousekeeping staff has been very attentive to our requests for extra pillow & a Sharps container. We requested Bldg. 4 to be closer to the Food Court for mug/drink refills as well as closest to the bus stop; although we checked in this time late on a Sunday night, our requests were well accommodated. We've never waited long for a Disney bus to anywhere, love being dropped off first on returns, and especially enjoy the Disney boat transportation from FQ to Downtown Disney; this time we enjoyed a beautiful, quiet cruise on a starry, full moon night We highly recommend Port Orleans French Quarter, especially if you're traveling without kids.

Reviews.Title: “All good except the food”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady2411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (50+), from Australia, stayed here for 5 nights and overall we were very happy with our choice. I had researched extensively before our holiday, which was part of a 15 week around the world trip. We transferred from an Orlando hotel and our room was ready for us at 10 a.m. Check-in was very fast, with friendly and helpful service. Our luggage arrived promptly, and was also picked up quickly on checkout. A tip was also refused for this service, which greatly surprised us! Our room was spacious, quiet and very clean, with plenty of towels, soap, etc. It was also thoroughly cleaned every day of our stay. We never had to wait long for buses and always got a seat. We chose this resort because it was small, which meant not much walking around the grounds. The only thing which wasn't good was the quality of the food in the cafetaria - it was AWFUL. We only ate one meal there, and that was one too many! On our trip we stayed in 42 different hotels, and this would be one of the better ones. Yes, it was expensive, but as this was our first and in all likelihood last trip to Disneyworld, we wanted to stay on-site, and away from noise and crowds. I would certainly recommend this hotel to people of our situation - older, without children, and not necessarily wanting state of the art resort facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Night in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: lilmuns
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently visited the French Quarter at the Port Orleans Lodge at WDW. We stayed for 2 nights and while the weather was not the best, the resort itself was charming. The grounds were well maintained, the lobby was impressive and our room had ample space for 2 adults. It was also very quiet at all times of day. No complaints as far as noisy neighbors or any problems of that kind. Check in was a bit slow but that should be expected in a resort of this size. Our plane came in quite a bit earlier then the 3pm check in time, the resort told us our room was cleaned and ready to go so we actually checked in 3+ hours early. Very convenient as the rest of the day was spent at Downtown Disney. When it came time to transfer our luggage to our second motel, Bell Services handled everything! A real winner in our book! We would definitly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisarc69
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from the Port Orleans-French Quarter a few weeks ago and have very little to complain about. Can't imagine how some reviews stated such unhappiness and we found everything SO incredibly clean and freshly painted! We really thought this weas an absolute exceptional stay for a "moderate" Disney Hotel, Thanks for a great first family trip to Disney, we weren't disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: termoo
Reviews.Content: November 5-11, 2005 My 12 year old daughter and I had a wonderful stay here! The grounds are lovely, quaint and intimate. It feels like a small town with streets, lampposts and New Orleans-syle buildings. There are walkable gardens tucked everywhere and several friendly salamanders scurrying about. Of all the Disney resorts, this one is the most compact, and is easy to navigate. We were in room 4121 in Building #4. The rooms have been recently renovated and include two full-size beds (or one king-sized in certain rooms)with colorful Mardi Gras themed bedspreads. There are two pedestal sinks, two mirrors and a long shelf in the vanity area. There is a privacy curtain that can be pulled shut to separate this area from the beds area. Caution: don't leave the curtain half-closed or you'll bump your head on the pole that you use to pull the curtain back and forth! (Can you tell we did this a few times?) There is also a large dresser, a bench, a wall-rack, and a table with two chairs. The beds were very comfortable with nice linens and feather pillows. We spent a lot of time in them, since my daughter got sick halfway through the vacation and had to spend a day and a half in bed. Housekeeping was thorough and courteous. They left many towel creations (animals, toothbrush holders, "fans" on faucets, etc.) There was a bus stop very closeby that offered transportation to all of the parks, and the foodcourt, pool, gift shop and lobby were also very close. There's a boatdock from which you can take a peaceful, free boatride to Port Orleans Riverside Resort or Downtown Disney. We were very pleased with the level of service and the comfort of this resort. My only complaint would be the air conditioning/heat system. It's a unit under the window which was difficult to maintain at a comfortable level. Other than that, we were quite pleased with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans French Quarter was Far Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: efficacious1
Reviews.Content: Summation: old, dirty room; poor organization at Port Orleans Resort; poor coordination between resort and parks; poor customer service at Port Orleans The Disney bus dropped us off around 11pm. After waiting behind two guests who were complaining about their accommodations, we went to a room that was smaller, dirtier, and smellier than what we expected. There was grime and hair in the corners of the bathroom. The carpet was old and dirty. The musty smell was overpowered by old cigarette smoke (we booked a non-smoking room because of our asthmatic children). At midnight, I called and asked about our luggage. I was told that it should be there within an hour. At 1:30am, my wife called and spoke to a manager. The manager said it would be another hour or two and the manager stated that she would never use the express service for luggage, and that we should have kept up with out luggage ourselves. At 3am, our luggage finally arrived and my wife and I were able to fall asleep. The next day, we attempted to use our Disney card with the dinner package and it was refused at the park. That evening we returned to the Port Orleans and they told us that there was no reason for it not to have worked, but they had to give us new cards since they had to move us out of the smoking room. After moving, we settled down in another room that was cleaner than the previous but still had an old, musty smell and the carpet was well worn – it reminded me of what one sees in a budget motel. The next day, we again attempted to use our Disney card for a snack and it was again rejected. We returned that night and the concierge advised me to just try go buy something in the snack bar and it would be fine. I asked her why would I go buy something in the snack bar if it had been rejected in two different parks? I asked to speak to a manager and after she argued with me, she reluctantly went and asked for a manager. This manager told me she didn’t know why it wouldn’t work, but that if we incurred any charges that they would take it off the bill. The next day, we attempted to pick up our free 5X7 portrait that is included in our package. However, the park told us that the resort was suppose to have given us a certificate. That evening we talked again to management, but the manager told us to just have the picture charged to our room and it would be removed. I asked to speak to the general manager the next day about all our problems and the lack of organization at Port Orleans. I was told that he would not speak to me, but I would have to deal with the managers on duty. On the day of check out, I called the front desk to have the aforementioned charges removed from my bill. After arguing with the person on the phone for twenty minutes, the individual said she would remove the charges (at this time we are not for sure if she did). I will not return to this resort, and I would never recommend Port Orleans, French Quarter to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: hghperformance
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at WDW. POFQ was wonderful. Rooms were so clean and nicely done. Recent refurbishment. We had building 3, 2nd floor, connecting rooms. Maid service each day placed my granddaughter's Princess dolls, and her Mickey & Minnie’s around. She had them in a group watching TV 1 day and just doing various things throughout the week. Mouse keeping was great this week we had excellent service. Upon check in, Sept3rd at 4:00 pm, we waited less than a minute to get to a CM. Ours was very nice and upbeat. She explained the dining plan, the layout of the POFQ etc. The hotel was everything we hoped for. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. We were used to a king-size bed, but we had no problems with the double bed. We had 4 in our room, 3 adults and 1 4 yr old. I found the room to be spacious enough and enjoyable to be in with the décor. Plenty of room in the vanity area of the bathroom. Plus the free refrigerator was great. There is no longer a charge since the recent refurbishment late last year. The playground area, the pool with serpent slide, the garden areas and the walkways and the boat to downtown Disney were great. Bus service was not bad at all, we waited around 10minutes at the most. Food court was good and resonably priced. We will be staying here again. In fact we are going again in February.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April this year for 13 nights, our 2 year old daughter loved the pool area, and my wife, pregnant at the time loved the peace and un-hurried feel to the resort. This hotel is much smaller and less over crowded than other moderate and value resorts. Apart from the resturant facilites, you get the feeling that you could be in a deluxe Disney hotel. This is our 3rd Disney hotel we have stayed in, and it was the best value compared to Animal Kingdon lodge and Coronado springs. Highly recomended to all ages for location, value, ambience, size and theme. MAke sure you take the boat ride to downtown Disney & also the horse carriage ride around the resort. The big + is that the buses for the parks picks up and drops you off before the Riverside resort.

Reviews.Title: “What Great Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kestrelway
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed on-site and reading many reviews before we booked our stay I can whole heartedly recommend the French Quarters. The check-in was very easy and the lobby of the resort was very bright and open. The room that the booking agent suggested was the gardenview building 2. So close to the pool with the serpent slide and near the lobby in case we needed anything. Having your packages shipped to you resort is easy and keeps the bulk down when visiting the parks. Our room had a view of the fountain courtyard in the center of the resort and could not have been nicer. The room was cleaned very well every day and the towel characters are a nice touch. The pool is huge and clean and the kids loved the slide. I can't say enough nice things about our stay and the people who ran the French Quarters. We stayed a Royal Pacific at Universal and the rooms were not as clean or nice as this resort. Take my word for it stay here before you spend more money and don't bother with the cheap rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 adults spent one week at the Port Orleans Hotel for the second year in a row. This hotel cannot be beat Early check-in allowed us to store luggage and begin our vacation less than an hour after we landed in Orlando. All the considerations we asked for were given--adjoining rooms, rooms overlooking the square--clean and neat rooms---minimal noise---Support staff were always willing to help. Cafeteria meals were great and and area was quickly cleaned. All in all we will continue to stay at this resort. Easy to get to all the Disney attractions either by using Disney Transportation or own transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were hoping for”
Reviews.Author: golfgreg74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the French Quarter 10/13 - 10/21, and while the grounds are beautiful, the mousekeeping leaves something to be desired. The French Quarter setting is wonderful, impeccably maintained, quite and serene. The rooms are a different story. Upon check in, there were cobwebs in our room over the valance, light fixture over the table and over the bed. We had to ask for the sheets to be changed (and for the correct size sheets to be used). The coffee pots were never cleaned and we had to request more coffee every other day (until they finally brought each of our rooms, three of them, and garbage bag full of coffee). The bathrooms were not thoroughly cleaned on a daily basis and we again had to ask for more towels, soap and kleenex. Before we checked in, I had faxed the front desk a request for a building close to the bus stop for my 75 year old grandmother and for our rooms to be as close together as possible. My parents and Grandmother had rooms next door to each other in building 3, along the river at the back of the property. My wife and I ended up in the far corner of the building (1326) overlooking the water and the golf course. This was I think as far away as the could put us. We tipped mousekeeping daily and nothing special was done and the rooms were not cleaned adequetly. The one nice thing was that we did tell the Front Desk that we were celebrating our 5th anniversary, my grandmother's 75th birhtday, and my father's 56th birthday, and all of us got a signed card and picture from various Disney characters. NOTHING is close and everything requires a 10-20 minute bus ride. The boat to Pleasure Island was great (15 min) and a great diversion from the buses. We never had to wait more than about 10 minutes for a bus to any of the parks and were always the first to be picked up and the first to be let off. Overall, I would probably try one of the Luxury hotels next time in hopes of better mousekeeping. On a side note, we ate dinner at Raglan Road Pub in Pleasure Island! Wonderful food and excellent service. Ask for Chaz of Melanie and tell them the G-Men sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: rduncan206
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney World, was a little concerned about booking a "moderate" hotel. I needn't have worried because the Port Orleans French Quarter is First Class in every respect. Beautiful rooms, wonderfully landscaped grounds, friendly staff, great pool area. I could go on and on. Don't spend the extra money on Disney's so-called "deluxe resorts" - you will not be disappointed with the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect from Disney.”
Reviews.Author: kirotank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a few days stay for our Anniversary with another couple. It was probably one of the most relaxing and fun stays I have had. French Quarter is clean, quiet, and convenient to all Disney locations. Not a thing to complain about. Highly recommended for couples and adults, but maybe a bit quiet for children. I have 3 and I know they would have a better time at some of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jeorgieboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from French Quarter and we had a lovely time. The rooms were spotless and looked newly painted. The maid left us an animal made from towels which was cute. The swimming pool was a good size, nice water temp and very clean. The boat ride to Riverside and Downtown Disney was very nice. The only downside is that the food court has a smaller selection than some, but it sufficed. Many of the employees there went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We had a great stay. Will certainly be back to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-great for couples!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new wife and myself stayed at the French Quarter form July 12-22,2005 for our honeymoon. I must say we enjoyed every aspect of the resort. We stayed in building 4 during our stay. It's a great building to stay in if you want to be right next to the food court and main building. Though all of the building at the resort are very close to each other anyway. The resort is much more quiet and peaceful compared to the other Disney resorts. The food at the dining hall wasn't bad (better than expected) and the prices weren't horrible for Disney. A tip when staying here- buy the mug at the food court after arriving at the resort. You can then refill the mug as much as you'd like without having to spend more money each time you want to get a drink. The pool was really nice. It was not as crowded as we thought it would be for a summer stay in the pool. The bus service was good though the bus drivers left alot ot be desired with their driving skills. It was nice getiing picked up first and dropped off first when compared to Riverside. The housekeeping for the most part was good. Just 1 day they knocked at our door at 845 waking us up. I highly recommend the port orleans French Quarter to anybody looking for a quiet Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at French Quarter from Sept 9-17. I called the hotel 5 days before arriving to request a corner room in building 7 (after reading reviews that 7 was a quiet building) and we got our wish upon check-in. No troubles with the "magical express" bus from the airport; our baggage was in our room in under 2 hours. The room was very clean, and was kept that way for the entire week of our stay. The pool is lovely, and it's great that it stays open until midnight so that you can still go for a swim at night after you get back from the parks. The food court has good breakfasts...it also serves lunch/dinner. I found the cast members at the hotel to be very friendly and they helped make our stay a special one. Bus transportation to the parks was easy and reliable. I would absolutely stay at the French Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for vacation. We usually stay at one of the All Stars or at Pop but decided to try something different this time. I'm sure glad we did. This hotel met and exceeded my expectations. It was very clean. The staff was excellent. It also has a lot of amenities. They have a boat that takes you from the hotel to Downtown Disney and to the Riverside Port Orleans. They also offer a horse & carriage ride in the evening. I high recommend that! We also tried their rental boats (Sea Ray)... I would pass on those if you are seeking some type of excitement. They are extremely slow (9.9 Hp). You can rent bikes and go up and down their trails between the Riverside & French Quarters. The French Quarters has a small slide in their pool which all the kids loved. The hotel has beautiful landscaping. You can see bunnies hopping around at night. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Pool, Fairly clean rooms, Convenient Layout and Transportation, POOR Dining”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the POFQ in October of 2004 for six nights with my husband and four-year-old daughter. The pool, one of the best aspects of the hotel, was clean, nicely themed and had a fun slide and water fall area. I think the FQ is one of the smaller resorts when not considered in conjunction with the adjacent PO Riverside. This is nice because it doesn't seem to get overcrowded or congested, although we were there during value season. The size and layout also make it easy to get around. We comfortably strolled the whole resort one day so if your not right at the pool or main lobby area it's easy to get to. As opposed to large buildings with elevators they have several 2 and 3 story walk-up buildings which you enter from the outside, either street level for first floor or from the balcony and upper floors. Therefore you do not have a private balcony or patio. We were on the first floor and since the large but only window in the room faced the street/walkway it made the room feel a little exposed when the curtains were drawn. The rooms were fairly clean but not immaculate. The carpet could have used a better vacuuming especially in the corners and the ledge of the window where the air-conditioning unit was needed to be wiped down. The bathroom was okay; I didn't notice any mildew or mold problems. Our air-conditioner cooled the room off well and though slightly loud not disturbing. The laundry facility had a good number of washers and dryers. The transportation service was great and since the resort area is small it's easy to get to the bus station from any room at the resort. It is also the first stop going to the parks so you're more likely to get a seat and it's the first stop on the return so you'll get back sooner. The biggest drawback to this resort was the inadequate dining and poor food. There is NO full-service restaurant in the FQ only a food court which I found to have really POOR quality food and I don't have gourmet tastes. At breakfast I tried a Mickey shaped waffle that wasn't fully cooked, it tasted like there was some raw batter in the middle. I would have been much happier toasting a frozen Eggo waffle. The eggs were also bad. They do have assorted fruits and cold cereals that we would eat at breakfast. The pre-made sandwiches at lunch were fine. At dinner the mashed potatoes tasted terrible, I think they were instant. The macaroni and cheese was bad too. Again I would have been happier microwaving some Kraft Easy Mac. The pizza wasn't very good either; I've had frozen brands I liked better. The prices at the food court aren't cheap either. I don't mind paying if I get decent food. There is a full-service restaurant on the Riverside section of the resort which would be a fair walk from the FQ but not excessive. As I understand it several of the other moderate resorts have rooms that are far from the resort's own dining facilities. You can also take the bus or boat to Downtown Disney for more dining options. The staff were neither exceptionally courteous nor rude. There is a small gift shop that also sells some snack items and drinks if you need something later at night. There is also an arcade. If staying at another moderate resort I would still consider the FQ. I found the small size and lack of congestion to be a nice break from the busy parks and rooms are convenient to the pool and transportation. Knowing what to expect from the food service makes it easier to plan accordingly. I would like to try one of the Deluxe resorts that have private balconies and possibly bettter cleaned rooms. I am a little hesitant because I'm afraid that for the significantly higher price the accomodations will not be significantly better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tigi-Winkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 17 nights in Aug 05. We had a garden view room. The gardens are very pleasant and kept nice. The rooms are all close to parking, the canteen, shop, reception and Jazz Bar are very close as is the pool. The rooms were kept very clean, we would return in the evening to our room to find towels made into Birds, which was a lovely touch. The rooms themselves were excellent, the TV channels are good for when the kids get up extra early, we were very happy with everything we received. The reception Staff were very friendly and helpful as always at any Disney resort. The pool is excellent, my son loved it, we would stay in the pool for hours at night it was so much fun. Plenty to do at the Riverside if you faniced fishing or taking a boat out, carriage ride or biking. We also used this pool of which the kids also love. The catering is basic at the French Qtr, we did visit the Riverside Dining hall which was excellent, you receive a great service. Overall i would definatly recommend the Port Orleans French Qtr, we did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: coughcandy123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 14 night stay in August at the POFQ. It was lovely and so relaxing and peaceful after days at the parks. The rooms where lovely with 2 large beds and 2 sinks with mirrors. There was a coffee maker and hairdryer in the room. We didn't use them but also in the rooms where an ironing board and iron. The resort is very relaxing and has a nice bar too. In the evenings 4 nights a week a guy provides music to listen to...ranging from Jazz to blues. He plays a variety of wind instruments and the kettle drums too. The shop has all you could need and there is a nice games room to keep the kids entertained. The pool, although we didn't use it, looked fantastic and was busy all the time - even into the dark evenings. Life guards patrolled too - which is good news. You can hop on a river boat to Downtown Disney. It takes about 20 mins to get there but is lovely and worth using. All transport is provided to the Disney Parks from site on an Air conditioned Disney Coach - generally running every 10 mins or so to each park. Fantastic location and would defo use it again......please go = you will love it there.!!!

Reviews.Title: “The cutest atmopshere!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast, and the staff was very pleasant. (Considering we just came from a rush hour 6 hour trip from Miami!!) Our room had a great view of the river, and the atmosphere was adorable at night. Breakfast was great!! The most important feature of the hotel according to my nephew was the pool & the dragon slide. I would definately stay here again. Rooms cleaned every morning, and they were very neat!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was so pleasant!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lacie
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews on POFQ, I will have to admit my husband & I were a bit worried about staying here. But all our worries faded away when we arrived on the grounds of this wonderful resort. We spent 4 nights here & 3 at Disney's Wilderness Lodge. We have two boys, one 7 and one 12. They were so excited when we finally made it all the way from Kentucky. Our whole experience at POFQ was one to remember. We had an excellent housekeeper who left the cutest creatures out of towels on two of our days there. Our children loved it! We stayed in building 5 and our room had a view of the Sassagoula River and the beautiful courtyard. It was a great location, close to the river, pool, food court, store, etc. Our room was very pleasant and I loved the curtain between the room and the sink area. That is a plus when my husband and boy's are still sleeping. The Sassagoula Floatworks & Food Factory (food court) was great. Our family was able to find something that each of use wanted everytime we went there. I will have to admit we liked the food better at POFQ & PORiverside better than the food at the Wilderness Lodge. And Wilderness Lodge is a deluxe resort versus POFQ being a moderate resort. The pool-all the reviews on the pool were right, it's a child's dream pool. The huge Sea Serpent was "so awesome" in my kids words. The slide was great. The only negative thing about the slide, when the lifeguards go home they close the slide down. So, if you go out for a late night swim w/ the kids - they may not be able to use the slide. That is the only thing the boy's didn't like much. But the pool stays open until midnight, which is good if you are coming back from the parks late. We took the river cruise down to Riverside and it was nice. Very relaxing. Fulton's General Store at Riverside is huge. We enjoyed just walking around looking at everything. We were going to eat at Boatwright's Dining Hall (in riverside) but we checked the menu out and we really didn't find anything we liked. So we decided to just eat at Riverside Mill (food court) and we were very pleased with the food there. So, in ending my review about POFQ-we had a wonderful time there. I almost hated to leave when we were going to check into the Wilderness Lodge. Everyone was so nice and made our stay at this Disney Resort one to remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomNY
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Port Orleans French Quarter and loved it. The pool was amazing and had a big water slide that the kids loved with a pool bar close by that mom and dad loved. My only complaint was that the French Quarter does not have a sit-down restaurant, you have to walk over to the Riverside complex. But it's not a very long walk and the food was good. French Quarter had family-friendly entertainment at the lounge on weekend nights, which the whole family loved. The pot roast in the food court was excellent. While we didn't get any of the famed towels folded into characters, I noticed some in the window of other rooms that were quite large (made from bath towels) and very impressive. Overall, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Disney World for our honeymoon and we stayed at the Port Orleans - French quarter resort. It was during the value season so crowds weren't bad and service was great. We got to the resort late at night and check in was courteous and fast. We had requested a transfer bench for my husband and a refrigerator for our room. Neither was there when we got to the room, but the cast member's quickly got what we needed to us. This resort is beautiful. You really feel as if your in New Orleans, staying in a fancy hotel in the French quarter. When we went, they had already begun to put up Christmas decorations and those, along with the already fun and colorful decorations made for a beautiful sight. Our room was great. The bed was incredibly comforatable and we had a large bathroom with a roll-in shower. Maid service was great. We didn't realize we should tip everyday, but our maid still left us fresh towels everyday and did a great job of cleaning. Our sheets were changed and bed made every day. We did leave a tip at the end of our stay with a note thanking her for her great work. We only ate breakfast once at the hotel because we wanted something quick. It was a little bit crowded and the prices weren't too bad if you know what to expect from Disney restaurants. The pool was nice. We only walked around and saw it as it was a bit too chilly to swim, but it looked like fun with the water dragons and other fun characters and the water slide. We only used the bus service once, one evening when we wanted to go see the fireworks. It was quick and efficient and when the evening was over, we were delivered back to our hotel quickly and with very little wait time. I would recommend using your car if you have one, because you can find a quicker route than the bus uses and you don't have to wait at all. At the end of our vacation, we called bell services to help us get our bags out to our car. Our car wasn't far from our room, but we were tired and he gladly took all our luggage out to our car and loaded in our car and he got a nice tip for it. Overall, my husband and I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our third trip to Disney this July, my husband, 8 year-old daughter and I stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter. On our first trip to Disney, we stayed at the Carribean Beach Resort, and then tried the Animal Kingdom Lodge for our second trip...both of which were magical. Having made a conscious decision to try a new Disney property each time, we opted for the POFQ this time around. A few selling points were the intimacy, the close proximity to the pool, common area and the buses, and the lovely grounds. We headed for Florida right as Hurricane Dennis was hitting the panhandle, and so we feared that this would negatively impact our long awaited return to Disney. We contacted the POFQ, and were gently reassured that all was well, and that we should go forth with our plans. From that point on, the "Disney Magic" took over, and we were on our way to a wonderful experience. As we arrived on the grounds of POFQ, a deluge of rain had gripped the area, and so everything was dark, dreary, and soaked. Nevertheless, as we headed into the Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory Food Court, we noticed that everyone was cheerful, relaxed, and enjoying themselves. Perhaps it was the jazz musician playing in the bar, or the boldly cheerful Mardis Gras decor, or the calming fountain in the foyer...whatever it was, it certainly made us feel instantly welcome. We made our way to the reservation desk and were greeted by a sweet older man who handled our information carefully and sincerely. By nature, he was genuinely interested in who we were, and wanted to ensure that we were taken care of in the "Disney Way". I can't remember his name, but he was representative of almost all the workers we had the pleasure to meet during our stay. We had no troubles at all finding our building (#6), as everything is within a very short walking distance. We were also pleased to find the bus station just a few short "blocks" away. We were on the third floor, and it wasn't until our fifth and final trip of lugging our bags up and down the stairs that we realized there was indeed an elevator. We should have known that Disney would have been accommodating. Without a doubt, we made sure to use the elevator at the end of our trip. Our room was delightful, with very comfortable beds, a picturesque view of the gardens, and a privacy curtain to boot. Disney always thinks of every last detail!!! With the exception of our housekeeping service, we were quite pleased. Although the room appeared to be clean, there was a flattened bug on the ceiling, and a piece of a barbecue chip under our unused bedsheets. We are still baffled by that, as we had yet to sleep in our beds. Perhaps a hungry housekeeper? We prefer not to think that the sheets had been left unwashed from the previous guest. We will assume that this is an aberration and know without a doubt that it is not up to Disney standards. It is simply unfair to expect perfection. Furthermore, after reading several trip advisor reviews, I had been alerted to the possibility that our housekeeper would not leave behind special surprises of folded hand towels or toys in the window. Keeping that in mind, I prepped my child for this potential, and reminded her that she had already had the priviledge of returning "home" from the parks with special surprises when we stayed at the Carribean Beach Resort, so she should consider herself lucky with just that experience alone. And, just as I had predicted, our housekeeper did not outdo him/herself, and seemed to have trouble just making our beds. Each day, our comforters were merely lifted up over the sheets, and slopped back down on the mattress. This service remained consistent until we left. Again, not a case of Disney failing at their duties, just merely a worker who hasn't quite figured it all out yet. We ate at the food court several times, and were always entertained by the colorful surroundings. There was an exceptional variety of food, and we enjoyed every morsel. A good and tasty bargain for a family is the large pizza. We were able to eat for just $22.00, with left overs to boot. Thanks to the complimentary refrigerator in our room, we were able to nibble on it for late night snacks for a couple nights thereafter. My husband and I both agreed that the prices were not outrageous, and are comparable to any food chain or nice restaurant. The pool was a kid's dream come true, and it was so imaginatively decorated. Our daughter has made us promise to come back just so that she can swim in that pool! The hot tub was behind the laundry room, in a secluded, intimate area. At first, I was perplexed by its location, but keeping in mind that you typically use the spa for relaxation and meditation, it seemed to be the perfect placement. It was shrouded by shrubbery and trees, and it certainly afforded me the rest and relaxation I needed after a day in the parks. We enjoyed walking the "streets" of The French Quarter, and were amused by their names. So often, Disney guests are in such a rush, that they fail to notice the subtle, yet well orchestrated intricacies and hidden beauties that Disney has so carefully planned out. The first time we were at Disney, we were all about the parks and the mad rush from one attraction to the next, that we didn't stop and think how lucky we were to be in such a spectacular place. So, I made certain to enjoy this time around, and I do believe I will break our pact, and return to POFQ the next time we head back down for our Disney fix.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited WDW for the first time in July 2005 and decided to stay at the French Quarter. We were in awe of the grounds and found the rooms to be nicely decorated and very clean. I left money for the housekeeper on our first morning out and when we returned, we had not one or two, but three folded towels that resembled either ducks or peacocks. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was good and there was a good variety, but by the end of the trip, I was ready to have something different. The refrigerator, room safe, and coffee pot were all great touches. Our room was very quiet and we could actually see the EPCOT fireworks around 9:45 pm. We would definitely return to the French Quarter the next time we visit WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the POFQ”
Reviews.Author: beachfamily
Reviews.Content: We loved the POFQ. Our last visit we stayed at the Poly...and this time we didn't want to spend that kind of money. The French Quarter was beautiful, we loved the food court and we loved that everything was a short walk away. I have to say, if we couldn't get a good deal on a deluxe, we would be happy here again. In fact, we liked that we had a food court for dinner/lunch/breakfast. Our room was always clean and the grounds were well manicured.

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My entire was family was excited to stay at a Disney resort and while the lagoon pool and hotel grounds were fabulous. The rooms were ho-hum. Maybe it's just me but I kinda expect my bed to be nicely made every day. The mattress covers and sheets would get pulled out(untucked) during the night and when we returned the top blanket would be pulled over the top of the bed with the sheets and cover unmade and crumpled under the blanket. The sheets were only washed once during our 6 night stay. Sorry I just expected more from a Disney resort. We stayed in a cheaper condo for our remaining 6 nights and my husband and kids wondered why we hadn't stayed in the condo for the entire trip. Port Orleans--way over priced--never again!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed here on june 13-19 this was our 3rd trip to mickeys and by far the worst trip we have had, the rooms were so far from the parking area (we were in room 2121) we were tired of carring bags to the room were not told of bellboys at check in. the rooms were ok for the size the twin beds were uncomfortable at best. long walks to anything to eat drink. the ferry boat ride was nice but waited in line at downtown for 20 minutes for return ride then rain came and they closed the ferry had to wait 30 minutes for bus ride back could have walk that fast. things I have found that were helpful, if you buy something at a theme park have it sent to the store at your resort no charge and you pick it up the next day no carrying around .also for you that are the no riding bag toters as i was a great tip on the areosmith ride while waiting for thrill seekers to ride go in the gift shop area its air conditioned and coooool. the resort is nice and close to new orleans feel as you get but they need to work on the basics.also had yard men edging and cutting grass at 7 am out of my room give me a break ..bus service was good take your own water put in the fridge provided love disney but had better time at carribean beach resrt

Reviews.Title: “Not Disney standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at the hotel at 7:30 PM with 2 children (2 and 5). We had to go through 3 different rooms before we got a room that was clean, that took until 10 PM. The first room had medicine on the floor along with soap scum on the sinks and the second room was a smoking room. It was disgusting. We have stayed at other Disney Hotels and had never experienced anything like this before. The housekeeping staff was below average. The room was never clean. One day the housekeeping staff removed our coffee pot. The next morning I called to have one delivered. I had to call 3 times and on the third call, I was asked if I told anyone my request was urgent. I would of thought that after waiting an hour and a half someone could have deliverd me a coffee pot. I will never stay here again. The other Disney Hotels are much better. On the last day, they were going to credit our account $30 for our inconveniences; but instead they charged the account. Just another reason to wonder, how this hotel has survived in Disney World..................

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most peaceful hotel on Disney property. We plan to go back for most trips to WDW. Includes nice boat ride to Downtown Disney where there are numerous restaurants of all types for a change from the decent French Quarter food. Also generally less crowded Disney bus service to and from the parks. Not the most well known, but one of the best Disney resorts, especially if you are travelling without young children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmr_723
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation staying on a Disney Resort. My husband & I traveled with our 7 year old daughter. I would very much recommend Port Orleans. It has a wonderful relaxed atmosphere. The food was good... a bit pricey, but hey your in Disney! The pool was really nice for my daughter, but of course in the heat of the day was very crowded. The staff was wonderful and very courteous. The transportation that Disney offers is wonderful. The room of course was not the Ritz, but all in all very clean and nice. I would very much come back to Port Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families & Would definitely return!!!”
Reviews.Author: unbiasedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4(me, my husband, son 7, daughter 3) recently visited the french quarter the end of May til the first few days of June. We had an excellent time. Check in was not fast but efficient. If you want baggage or bellboy help you have to ask for it otherwise front desk will not offer it unles requested. We requested our building location 3 days before we got there and our request was fullfilled. Our room was in prime location to everything. We were in building 5 pool(water) view which was a short walk to all amenities. This room had a great view of the pool(right in center). It was a short walk to the food court, pool area, laundry room, ferry to downtown disney, gift shop, lobby area, bike rentals, you name it. Our room had 2 double beds with mini refrigerator, hairdryer, and wall safe. Our safe did not have a key so a quick call down to the front desk and they quickly replaced the lock. It's a key so no remembering combinations which is a plus on my book. It was really clean. If you need extra towels housekeeping is so nice and quick too. They even made our face towel into a duck one day. The room was quiet even by the pool. It was also the perfect size for a family with small children. You may need a little extra room with teenagers. My 2 children enjoyed the pool with it's awesome dragon slide. Especially my 7 year old. The only downside to the dragon slide was if you had a younger child like my 3 year old who wanted to go on the slide but not alone you can not go with them. Adults are allowed but you can not slide down 2 at a time. So she only got on it twice by herself which was not a great thing. Lifeguards are there when it is open so they keep a pretty watchful eye on any pool rule breakers. The ferry to Downtown Disney was a very short walk from our hotel room. We catched one that stopped by Riverside first. It was a nice ride. Although it was a long ride down the Sassalouga River towards the end my kids were asking are we there yet. On the way back it rained so they closed down the Ferry Ride which was not good. So we took the bus back and of all places Disney has NO line system at Downtown Disney so it was a push and shove kinda deal in the rain. Not very good if you have small children. My suggestion is drive to Downtown Disney. It is a short drive with your car. A lot less time waiting for the bus and a lot less pushing and shoving. Some People were thoughtless. My husband had to stand up with my daughter in his arms for half the bus ride. The food court was o.k. to. They served Mickey breakfast waffles for a reasonable price. We ate there Dinner as well and it was o.k. it was like eating in a cafeteria. The only downfall, Milk was overpriced 25cent milk cartons were over $1.00. It was better to buy at the gift shop. There is no full service restaurant at this resort. You would have to go to Riverside. The laundry facilities were soso. It cost me $6.00 to do 1 load. $2.00 for wash. $2.00 for each dry. I had to double up on the dryer cause it did not dry the first time. We used the concierge service to purchase our tickets and they were quite friendly and helpful. There is a live band playing in the lobby from Wed-Saturday. My kids enjoyed it. We did take the bus to Magic Kingdon from the hotel and it took a while but was well worth it. Each Hotel has its own bus to and from the parks. we did not have to share a bus with Riverside. So overall this was a very convenient hotel to stay with your family if you have small children. We will definitely return and stay at the Port Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Adults traveling alone, stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my 14th Disney World trip. The second traveling alone. I don't mind kids in the theme parks, but 10,000 at the hotel doesn't make it pleasurable. If you are traveling without kids and want a quiet resort, stay here. The rooms will comfortably fit two people and are very nice. A river view is more expensive but I thought it was worth it. My stay was in building 6 on the third floor--away from the pool. Sometimes I wondered if anyone else was in the hotel it was so quiet. Definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The French Quarter is the place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Jim & Wendy
Reviews.Content: Disneys Port Orleans resort was a joy to visit from beginning to end. My wife and I stayed for 2 weeks in May 2005. Firstly although we arrived before our check in time, the room was ready and the reception staff were very freindly and helpful, booking in was very simple and the young lady gave a simple but useful explaination of the resort and its' facilities. We were in our room within ten minutes of arriving on site. The room was in block 3, which was perfectly located for all amenaties. The room was lovely with a real 'homestyle' feeling to it. We felt really comfortable with the whole resort from the moment we arrived. The foodhall (The sasagoulla floatworks & dining hall) offered a wide range of food for all tastes. The value for money was very good and the standards were above food court average. My wife & I are both vegetarian and it was a welcome change to have more than a cheese pizza as your dinner option. The staff in the foodcourt were always helpful and very friendly. The swimming pool is capped by a colourful sea serpent adorned with king neptune and accompanied by some jazz styled 'gators. Scat cats bar is great if your legs are tired at the end of the day, the resident musician is fantastic and can play so many instruments it beggars belief. (Sharp eyed guests will recognise him as the sax player from the Blues Brothers show at Universal studios!) He is great to listen to and is a natural entertainer. The hotel is an easy journey to all of the Disney parks by disney bus service and the boat service to downtown disney was a joy in itself. The 20 minute ferry service passed by some areas you don't normally see such as the old tree house style accomodation that was part of the disney institute. These were damaged by the hurricanes last year and are now closed. The Riverside resort is only 10 minutes walk up the river and is well worth a visit for Boatwrights dining hall (and also the bar is very comfortable). As other reviewers have said, The French Quarter feels like a deluxe resort for a moderate price and I agree fully with this. The staff, rooms, service, food and value for money is VERY good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the above! Jim & Wendy H.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for young family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here the last week of April with our 4-year-old son and 2-year-old daughter. The kids loved the playground, serpent-themed pool, and kiddie pool. We loved how accessible the bus, food court, gift shop, and pool were to our room. Unfortunately, we never got around to taking a carriage ride, but the kids did like watching the horses go by in the evenings. We took advantage of the boat to Downtown Disney, as well as the Riverside hotel. At Riverside, we rented a surrey bike which was also a nice relaxing opportunity when most of the week we were rushing around the theme parks and water parks. We opted for a Disney hotel so that we wouldn't need to rent a car, and for the most part we were glad we did. The buses do tend to get crowded in the late evenings, so if you stay out too late with little kids and have a stroller to drag along it can be difficult when you have to hold your children and a stroller when no seats are available. Also, we were a little disappointed since we had read that the buses always drop off at Port Orleans before Riverside. This is not always true. It depends on whether you are coming from a theme park or from Downtown Disney. The other advantage of the Disney hotel was that we could easily leave to take an afternoon nap, then return to the parks at dinner time. Speaking of food, in the food court, breakfast is the best meal of the day. The other meals are just ok. Other items we liked in the food court were the fruit and cheese plate and fruit bowl, which were an excellent healthy snack option. The rooms are not luxurious, but on a family vacation we aren't expecting luxury. They were comfortable and adequate for a family of 4 with a portable crib in the room. The grounds, though, were much more luxurious than other hotels with similar room types. The landscaping is lush, beautiful. It made it difficult for us to go back to the wintry spring of the Midwest when our trip was over.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for Disney Magic with a romantic flair!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at Port Orleans French Quarter and loved it!!! The grounds are truly beautiful with a feeling of Old New Orleans, including cobblestone walks, horse drawn carraige rides, fountains...just beautiful. We highly recommend this hotel to couples travleing without children but looking to avoid the higher priced "luxury" Disney resorts, it's smaller than most Disney resorts but this makes it intimate and charming...also easier to get around. 5 Stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Disney standards”
Reviews.Author: TSully_07
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and can frankly say that it was sub-par by any normal standards, let alone by the famed Disney hospitality standards! The check-in was not a pleasant experience. A very surly and ill informed employee performed this "chore". She never asked us if we wanted a non-smoking room and sent us to the nastiest smelling room. She also told us that they were booked for tbe next day and could not accommodate our request to stay another night. After we discovered the smoking room, we returned to the front desk and requested a non-smoking room, which by the way is 90% of the hotel, and another young lady provided us with a room and also told us that we could stay another night! The room was okay, the bathroom had mildew all over the shower, the blinds did not work. Also, the ceiling fan, which could have been a nice touch, was operating at high speed only. I think for the price you can do better somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BDTJSelden
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor I was able to make critical decisions while planning my Disney trip. I wanted to return the favor and have added my own collection of experiences, in no particular order... I stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter with my wife and 7 1/2 year old son from May 6th through May 13th. It was a great time of year to choose. You beat the summer crowds (read: extremely long lines), summer heat, and will even save on the not-so-peak costs of airfare. And of course, my son was thrilled to miss a week of school. At check-in you have the option to tie-in your room key to your credit card. Do it. Using your room key makes it so easy to purchase everything from gifts to food, and there will be no need to checkout at the end of your trip. There is a $1,000.00 credit line put on the card key, but you can increase it if you need to. Anything you purchase in any of the parks can be sent to your resort's gift shop for you by the next day, and there is no addition charge for this. Who wants to carry around nick-knacks all day? We took advantage of this big time. The "Disney Magical Express" is a new service being offered by Disney as of 5/6/05. We were told by our travel agent, as well as by Disney's web site that we would receive "special" Disney tags for our luggage (21 days before we left), that, once we land at Orlando, we would not have to concern ourselves with finding our luggage. Just walk from the plane to the resort bus and our luggage would "Magically" appear in our hotel rooms when we arrived. Well, after numerous calls to our travel agent (who called Disney directly even while in my presence) to find out where the hell our tags were, as well as calls placed to Disney by me, the tags never showed (so much for Magical). We were starting to become disillusioned at Disney's ability to pull off such a feat. We landed at 9:30 a.m. and by 10:00 a.m. (after 15 minutes of standing in line... so much for Express) we were trying to identify what our luggage looked like from a huge chart of luggage photos. If you have ever lost luggage with a carrier before, you'll know what I mean. I got on my bus, worrying "Now what?" I made calls every 45 minutes, and no one even knew where our luggage was. Cutting to the chase, our luggage arrived between 3:00 and 3:30 that day. Not horrible, but not happy either. Our bathing suits were packed in our luggage, so we had to buy swim suits at the gift shop so we could at least swim. Going home it’s all up to you. Drag your luggage to the bus, to your airline's check in counter and then to TSA security. The Hotel was nice, and in much better shape that I expected. Bedding, curtains and carpeting were in excellent shape, (except for 2 pronounced marble sized lumps under the carpeting) and the bathroom was neat and clean, with enough towels for 3 of us. We stayed in room 2146, midway between the pool and the restaurant. I highly recommend a ground floor room. My only complaints about the room are a VERY small safe, and not many extra receptacles. In this age of technology I need 2 outlets for our cell phones, 2 for digital camera equipment, and one for a laptop charger. The double beds are a little small for adults to share, but you’ll be so exhausted you’ll be willing to sleep on a bed of nails. We never saw any of those cutesy animal shaped towels we heard so much about, even though there was obvious evidence of a child in our room. I thought I remembered jazz music playing throughout the place the day we arrived (Fri.). Sunday night, at midnight, music started playing from a speaker in the tiny playground across from our room. I'm not sure if it played anywhere else in the park. By 1:45 am, I called the front desk to complain about it. They said they would look into it. I had to turn the ac up to high to drown out to music. By 6 a.m. the music was off. Midnight Monday, the same thing happened again, but it was off by 3 a.m. I complained to the front desk and the next night all was fine. I guess Disney couldn't figure out how to reset the music time clock, so they just shut it off. We never heard music again, anywhere in the resort, day or night. The food court is just mediocre. My suggestions would be to stick with the grilled chicken sandwich (you have to ask for the lettuce and tomato or else you won't get them), but stay away from their pizza (GAK!). The breakfast buffet is very good. I liked the King Creole and the Croissant Sandwich. We ate dinner at the Boatwrights restaurant in Riverside and I thought the meat was great, my wife wasn't thrilled by it. Also, while at Riverside's food court, stay away from anything even resembling a McNugget. Riverside's dining area was MUCH more charming and inviting than in the French Quarter, as is their hotel's lobby. Their waterside dining area is very nice and has much more ambience. It's is a shame the French Quarter didn't take advantage of it's beautiful waterside setting and use it for something. I feared being gouged by Disney for all of my food purchases, but was pleasantly surprised to find that they were very much in line with what I am used to (New York City prices), along with some decent deals thrown in. BBQ'd ribs with plenty of mashed potato and a vegetable was under $10.00. Not bad at all, and the breakfast menu was equally acceptable. Alcohol may get a little expensive. Plastic beer bottles (at the poolside bar or the food court) and mixed drinks from the poolside bar will cost you between $4.25 and $6.50 (or more), but you can buy cold Corona in glass bottles (and more) in the gift shop for only $2.25. I had a room fridge, and the gift shop was my best friend. The food court can only sell you 1 beer (state law) even if you are buying 6 meals at one shot. However, you can buy all you want at once in the gift shop. Riverside also has bicycle and boat rentals. An hour for a little two-seater boat is only $35.00. The boats aren't fast by any means, but they are meant to be relaxing. You can motor to Downtown Disney in 20 minutes and buzz around the bay a few times before heading back. Travel to the parks is a 15-minute ride at most and we never waited more than 15 minutes for any bus. Staying at the French Quarter had the added benefit of being picked up first and dropped off first (before traveling off to 4 stops in Riverside)...very nice indeed. Buses were clean and the drivers were chatty if you wanted them to be. Buses to Magic Kingdom were direct runs home to the French Quarter. The staff, everywhere, is amazing! I don't know how these people (A.K.A. underpaid cast members) can smile all day in the hot sun. They were able to give instant answers to all of questions, give directions, and make suggestions. Wanna' stay for the fireworks? Supposedly the best fireworks show is at Magic Kingdom. (Not surprised). It was the only show we saw. People were lining up curbside on Main Street 2 1/2 hours before the show started. They're nuts. Just make your way to Main Street 10 minutes before the show and stand anywhere on the sidewalk 60 seconds before the show starts, then, like everyone does, walk into the street to watch the 20 minute show. We stood halfway up Main Street and saw an awesome show. Also, as a side benefit, we were that much closer to the main entrance/exit and made the second bus to our resort. The fireworks start at closing time, so it might be better to see the fireworks on a night when the park is open late for Disney guests. Then the "mad rush" for the exit probably wouldn't be so bad. It might be a little better to stand towards the left side of the street (while facing the castle) as Tinkerbell would be a bit more visible during the show. She flies from the castle down that loooooong, black cable that is so visible during the daytime. We are early risers, so eating breakfast at 7:00 and being at the bus shelter by 7:45 is not a problem. You'll be through the bag inspection and at the ticket machine by 8:30. It's worth the 30-minute wait there ‘til the park opens. They'll be a ton of people behind you when you go through and you'd probably have to wait 30 minutes to get through the gate at that point anyway. In that 30-minute span we had been on premium rides at least twice. There is nothing worse than standing on line with kids. RIDES: Go to the library and get 2 or 3 books on WDW and spend a lot of time on the Internet reading peoples reviews of the rides. We made a list of primary and secondary rides to hit, and that saved us a lot of time just wandering aimlessly around the entire map. It's a bit of a hustle, but armed with this knowledge, we could complete the park in a day (by 4 p.m.) Our son is 7 1/2 so we were able to skip stuff like character breakfasts (he would die!!) and the teacup ride (he would kill us!!) We were able to get a ton of character photos and autographs all over the parks. Note: The Extra Terrorestrial Alien Encounter attraction, that we so much wanted to experience was replaced by Lilo and Stitch... so it was scary, big deal. Leave something cool for the older kids and parents to truly enjoy. Damn you, Disney execs! Our list of must-see, DO NOT MISS attractions: MGM: Indiana Jones (kick-ass live show) Tower of Terror Rock-n Roller Coaster (I thought a bit bumpy for a new-ish coaster) Lights, Motors, Action (New for 2005) Skip Star Tours. My son is a Star Wars fanatic and was really let down by this stinker. Lunch in Commissary Lane was very good. Try the Tuna steak in Mama Melrose’s for a late lunch. The place is all but empty by 2:00. EPCOT: Mission: SPACE Test Track Soarin' (new for 2005) "fly" in front of 360 degree screen...smell the oranges.... yummmm Skip Universe of Energy unless you're a BIG Ellen Degeneress fan. Skip It Sounds Dangerous even if you're a BIG Drew Carey fan. The butterfly house was a let down. Lunch in Germany was a delicious buffet. $16.for adults, $8 for kids. Cute show. Dinner in Italy is highly recommended. MAGIC KINGDOM: Splash Mountain Big Thunder Mountain Mickey's Philharmagic (sounds lame but it was really quite good) Buzz Lightyear (cool if you have any kid under 9) Space Mountain (We missed The Timekeeper but it's supposed to be good) Classic rides (lame by today’s standards) I remember from MY childhood that I couldn't miss... Peter Pan's Flight Pirates of the Caribbean Swiss Family Tree house Haunted Mansion Tomorrowland Indy Speedway Snow White's Scary Adventures Tomorrowland Transit Authority WDW Railroad (a REAL steam driven train) ANIMAL KINGDOM: It's Tough to be a Bug (great 3-d!) Kilimanjaro Safari (too bouncy for photo's, just enjoy the ride/animals) Festival of the Lion King (live show well done) The Kali River Rapids was closed when we were there. It was the one thing we wanted to do there. My son loved Dinoland. It has a traveling carnival atmosphere. Lunch in Rainforest Cafe'. The Tree of Life is pretty cool. There are a ton of animals "carved" into its trunk. We probably could have skipped Animal Kingdom altogether. It's not that it was done poorly, it's just that once you've been to the Bronx Zoo, everything else sort of pales in comparison. We are big on rides and this park had VERY little to offer. We tried to make a reservation at The Rain Forest Café via our concierge at 7:30 one morning. They pulled up the reservations menu for that restaurant, and showed us all the available seating times. Then we were told we could not make reservations for the same day. I went to the park (A.K.) and made them there at 8:30 a.m. This is a senseless inconvenience. The pool pretty small by resort standards, but is just nice enough, and has a small slide that the kids just loved. A bigger pool might mean you’d prefer to stay poolside all day and not spend money in one of the parks. It’s heated between 82 and 85 degrees. The lifeguards are constantly patrolling around the pool. We thought that was a bit over cautious, until we found out why. They are on poop patrol! They announced that we must leave the pool for an unscheduled cleaning. The mad exodus reminded me of the Baby Ruth scene from Caddy Shack. Pretty funny. All in all our experience was a very good, albeit an expensive one. We expected the cost to be pretty high so it wasn't a total shock when we tallied up our expenses at the end of our trip. Controlling yourself in the gift shops is key. Do you really need a Captain Hook costume, or a Mickey Mouse beer stein? Probably not, and don't buy large items that you won't get into your luggage. Don't buy stuff you can get at home for a much cheaper price. (I.e. all the Star Wars toys sold at Star Tours). There is a resort mug you can buy for 12 or so dollars that lets you get free refills. We avoided this since we didn’t want our son loading up on soda all day long, as well as having to schlep cups around all day. I wouldn’t have my child drink $12.00 worth of soda in a month at home. For $2300.00 (travel agent) for airfare, hotel 7 nights, and park hopper tickets for 3 people, FQ is an awesome deal. BDTJ.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Peaceful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyGal65
Reviews.Content: The landscaping is absolutely gorgeous! This is a beautiful resort that is well worth the money. We loved it so much that we have booked it for 6 nights again this June! It is so quaint and quiet that we loved just walking around and looking at everything. The river is peaceful and an added bonus. Take the boat to Riverside, then enjoy a stroll back. You may see a carriage clomping along in the evening. Both FQ and Riverside are beautiful with the lights on at night. The pool is so fun to just look at as well as playing in it. My daughters loved posing with the alligators along the path. The also loved the masks in the dining hall. My only "small complaint" would be that they should carry some of the lushness inside the dining hall, with plants and flowers. It would feel less like a cafeteria. The food was quite good in our opinion and we liked that you could also buy a la carte for our two-year-old (fruit and yogurt, cereal, etc.) We never had to wait for more than one bus and always got seats since they pick up FQ before Riverside and drop off first too. When the park closed FQ had its own bus and was the shortest line since it is the smallest resort. I think we waited for the second bus because we were busy folding the stroller. It was full-size, but we had no problems getting on and off the bus with it and two bags. After getting off the bus at the resort it only took about a minute or two to walk to the room. They are ALL pretty close to the bus stop and the main building/restaurant. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Six Days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and 2 children 8 and 5 had a wonderful time at this resort. Our room was very clean each day and we always found the staff very pleasant and friendly. The grounds are so peaceful and lush with greenery including some large grassy courtyards. The food court was never overcrowded and even at the busiest time your wait to pay for the food was less than a couple of minutes. Our room had no musty smell and we found it plenty big for the 4 of us. The refrigerator will hold several quarts of milk with room for soft drinks and sandwich fixings. The only place where there needs to be some improvement is the food. On a scale of 1 to 10 I would rate it a 6 or 7. But what do you expect when you have to feed so many people at one time and provide reasonable variety. We would stay there again without question. A very magical place. I would not stay off property again by the way. One last comment... one day we came home from the parks to find that Stitch had unrolled our toilet paper and caused our little girl's stuffed kitty to become entangled in it. It was always interesting to see what mischief our housekeeper and our Disney characters had gotten into!!!! The kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for families”
Reviews.Author: SpaScout
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We arrived very late having taken a red-eye and were greeted as though it were the top of the morning. Our room was impeccable and very cutely themed (as all of Disney is) and the pool was just outside the door - and open 24 hours. The kids were too wired to sleep so we all went swimming at 2 am. Very quietly of course - no need to be rude. I couldnt ask for a better 3 day get away and will definitley return for longer. This was just fun fun fun. But bring your money. If you need to eat during your vacation, it's gonna cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from April 25 through April 28 and LOVED it! We would definitely stay here again. We have a 3 year old and a 4 year old and the smaller resort was perfect for them. They did enough walking at the parks. The service was awesome! We checked in at noon, and our room was ready. Check-in was quick and easy, and we were at Magic Kingdom by 1:00. Bus service is very convenient. The longest we ever waited was 10 minutes. French Quarter is the first stop so we always had a seat. The food court was fine. The kids were in heaven! We thought the food was a bit pricy, but hey you're on vacation....what do you expect. Buy the refillable mug for $12.00...it's worth it. Our room was immaculate. We requested a roll-a-way bed, and it was brought up within an hour of check-in. We were on the third floor of Building 4....great location. It was very quiet, and Building 4 is a short walk to everything. Our kids loved the pool and dragon slide. They spent two hours just going on the slide! The pool area is so large that it never felt crowded even on a hot sunny afternoon. There is also a nice playground area for the kids to play on and benches for the tired moms and dads. We had a great stay at the French Quarter, and I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Port Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at Disneys Port Orleans French Quarter Resort. Would recommend to anyone. The grounds were well kept, and the rooms were nice. I loved the two sinks we had in our room. The price was very fair. You cant lose staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet for Disney”
Reviews.Author: JKobr
Reviews.Content: My wife, I and our 3 year old son stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter from April 12-19 and absolutely loved it. It was our 5th Disney property over the past 10 years we've stayed at, and now consider it to be the best. Simple reason was size. Each and every resort we've been at has been all we could ask for, but the French Quarter is a smaller property and you don't get the crowds/hassles that the larger resorts simply can't avoid. FOOD: just one restaurant, cafeteria type set up, nothing fancy (pasta, hamburgers, pizza, etc), but perfect for breakfast before hitting the parks. GROUNDS: well manicured with scaled down walkways that look like roads. Each of the buildings (we were number 3 of I believe 6 in total) are less than a 2 minute walk from the restaurant, pool, boat lauch, bus stops. Unlike other resorts which can be 10-15 minute walks from room to restaurant, no worries at French Quarter if you need to run back for something. ROOMS: does the job, 2 double beds (one king available as well), sitting area, 2 sinks and seperate bath. Came with iron, coffee maker, hairdryer, safe, minifridge. We rented cot for my son ($15/day). Nice if it was included, but better than getting a terrible nights sleep trying to share a double bed with a child. POOL: fantastic pool, water slide and never overly crowded due to it's large size and less guests to use it. TRANSPORTATION: Disney buses are the best, come every 5 minutes to any and all parks. Port Orleans Riverside is the French Quarter's sister resort and is quite large, sits next door. It has 5 seperate bus stops, the French Quarter has only one. Nice advantage is the bus stop at French Quarter first, so you always get onto an empty bus. By the time it makes it's rounds through Riverside, the bus is packed, people standing. And equally as nice, on the way back from the parks, French Quarter is the first stop. Another nice touch is the water launch that runs to and from Downtown Disney. It's a quiet 10 minute lazy ride that our son loved. Bit cool at night, but much more relaxing than the bus. SERVICE: smiles all around, check in not a problem. While we have enjoyed each of the other resorts, the French Quarter will be our preferred Disney resort simply for the relaxed laid back and quiet atmosphere the others simply can't provide.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: tk1991
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter from April 12 to 16th 2005, I don't usually do this type of thing but after using trip advisor so much before we went I thought I would like to give someone our views. There was myself, husband and 6 1/2 yr old. From the moment we landed at the Port Orleans things went smoothly for us, there was no lineup at check in and we arrived around 2:30 and our room was ready, we stayed in building 6, away from the noise of the pool yet close enough. We had a nice river view, and it has an amazing walking/running trail that runs to the PO Riverside, (10 min walk). All the rooms in the PO FQ now come with coffee maker, fridge, hair dryer and iron and ironing board. The rooms are quite spacious and the beds are very comfy. The pool is very nice, very big and very warm. My only complaint about the pool is that you do have to get there early in order to get a spot where you can see your kids in the pool from all angles. My son can swim and the pool is not over his head, however, I like to be able to see him at when he's in the water, there are only about 25 chairs in the section where you can see the entire pool so get there early if you want to see you kids. The lifeguards are constantly walking around and are very good, sometimes a little too strict, but you can't be too careful I guess. The only drawback to the FQ is that it only has the one pool, you can use the ones at Riverside but that is a good 10 15 min walk. The hot tub was nice we did not use it, we have one at home and its not my thing in the hot weather anymore. Very busy all the time as well. The pool bar is nicer and they have tables and chairs to sit but no food service there. The food, basically the food is how do I say it, institutional, everything comes out of bags, or packages, already prepared. Almost everything tastes the same, I am not very picky about what I eat and neither is my husband but after the first night we said that was it and ate off the resorts. Some people may find it ok, and it is, but its just that ok, and its mildly expensive, 5.69 for a hotdog and fries. Some other items were quite reasonable, chicken caesar salad, 7-8 dollars, anyway don't expect great quality food. That is also another drawback about the FQ it only has the food court and a bar which serves appetizers, no sit down restaurant, again you have to go to Riverside for that. The bus service was great, really convenient, never had to wait more than 10 min and if you had to take your car to the parks its alot longer than that , having done it before I know. The buses are air conditioned and the drivers friendly, enjoy this part of your trip as a time to get to know others around you, we met many people and had lots of good conversations on the bus. We took the boat to downtown disney one night and that was great really relaxing and enjoyable, its great no one has to worry about parking or driving. As I read this over it sounds like I am being negative, but we really enjoyed our time at the FQ and went to Riverside on several occasions. The main things to remember are about the pool, if you have young children make sure they stay in one spot or get there early enough to get the spot in the centre. Also don't expect too much food wise. After we left the FQ, we stayed at Pop Century with friends for 5 nights and there is no comparison in the two hotels, anyway that is another story for the Pop Century review.
