Also having been to Florida on several occasions and staying outside of Disney, after this trip I will always stay on site it is much more convenient and way nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: marlenaNYC
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Orlando, and stayed at the Port Orleans FQ. We really enjoyed the relaxing setting with all the trees and fountains, etc. The rooms are fine, with very comfy beds, but nothing fancy. We really appreciated having the little fridge in the room. The pool is large and it was easy for us to secure lounge chairs even during the busy time, and the pool bar is great for a mid-afternoon cocktail. We found the food court better than we expected, although it would be nice if they served more healthy food. There is a convenience store on site that sells just about everything you might need. The boat to downtown disney is very convenient, and a pleasant ride. The shuttle buses were fantastic, I think from now on we'll stay at Disney resorts because they are so convenient. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Franch Quarter was great!”
Reviews.Author: traveloverer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter from 3/29 - 4/3. The service, quality and cleanliness was beyond our expectations. The atmosphere was also great with cobblestone streets, fountains and colorful facades. The cast members were very courteous and helpful. Our room was always clean and we were provided plenty of fresh towels and soap everyday. It was also great that we could make fresh coffee each morning. The room is also equipped with an ironing board and a fridge, which we stocked up with cold drinks. The beds are nice and firm and the pillows soft. We stayed at building 3, which was still a pretty close walk to the arcade, which my son enjoyed, and the food court. The food selection was adequate but after several days, we were wishing for other selections. Overall, I give the French Quarter a thumbs up for providing us with a great Disney hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: langkawi-lisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the port orleans french quarter from 14 to 21 March, and it was altogether very ordinary. From the room that reeked of cigarette smoke (altho' it was meant to be non-smoking) to the lack of availabilty of a king bedded room, the absence of any internet connection, the overcrowded and quite small swimming pool, we felt it was at best overpriced and at worst downright nasty. Some pluses - the boat ride to downtown disney is lovely, the guest laundry the best I've seen

Reviews.Title: “Never staying off-site again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently returned from the French Quarter after a six night stay (3/19/05-3/25/05) for our college Spring Break. Having found a great deal online for $114, I booked the Dreammaker Package directly through Disney. This was my 5th time visitng WDW, but it was our first staying onsite, and having been spoiled by the FQ, I will never again stay off site. First, we arrived at FQ about noon, and were delighted to know we could check in immediately, which was awesome, since we got unpacked and settled in less than an hour and headed off to start our magical vacation. The rooms are beautifully decorated, very New Orleans feel to them, we loved that the fridge has its own little wooden cabinet and is hidden until you use it. We enjoyed the double sinks, since as a woman I have more cosmetics, etc. than my b/f. The hotel grounds well make up for shelling out extra $$, it's absolutely beautiful, the flowers, water fountains, and streets make it feel like a little village. There is also a river and walking trail behind the hotel. We took the boat to Downtown Diz once and it was very relaxing. The hotel is small and everything is easy to get to, having seen Riverside from the buses, I'm glad we chose FQ, walking at the parks during the day is enough. We ate at the food court several times, once for breakfast, I was glad to see a few vegetarian options (having been an lacto-ovo veg for 10 years). The quality of food was good and the prices weren't too outrageous, but they selection was the same pretty much everyday, they need to offer a few more different items. The refillable mugs are a great idea, I usually drink water, but my b/f drinks a lot of soda so this saved his $$. The pool is a lot of fun and pretty large. We also enjoyed the dragon slide, even though we waited in line with the kids, lol. Perhaps one of our fave features was the Disney transporation, the buses are great!! It's nice not worrying about taking the wrong exit or getting lost. They came about every 15-20 min and were never super crowded, a few times we had to stand but no biggie. We usually came back to our room in the afternoon and swam, napped and ate dinner then went back out to the parks. This was so nice to be able to do, it usually took about 15 minutes to get to the parks, so coming back to the FQ was definitely a refresher after a day of walking through the parks. The staff was also super friendly and we befriended the food manager, Mike, who is a really nice guy, he's usually around the food court so say hi if you see him. All in all, this was the less stressfull disney vacation I've been on, and I can't wait to return to the FQ, I think it's gonna be our permanent Diz headquarters. Also, the cleaning staff does a great job--plenty of towels, soap, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Stacey211328
Reviews.Content: We live just under 2 hours from Disney so needless to say we are there often. We visit about 5 times a year. We've stayed at several of the hotels but by far our favorite is the French Quarter. The pricing is great, especially for a Florida resident. The grounds are really beautiful. The rooms are a bit small but extremely clean and were just recently renovated. The food court, as far as food courts go, is actually pretty good. And the biggest hit with the kids is the pool and dragon water slide. Our kids have spent hours just playing in the pool. I would strongly recommend this hotel to any family or couple for that matter. And would also recommend either building 2 or 5 -- close to pool and food court and nicest views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: vmikelson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is known for being smaller than the other Disney World hotels but that is exactly why we loved it. The pool, gift store, and restaurant are all in very close walking distance and this is wonderful after walking all day in the parks. There is only one bus stop in the resort and it is convenient to everyone. Most buses stop at the French Quarter and then go on to the Riverside part of the resort. This means you are the first bus stop to be picked up and the first bus stop to be dropped off. This is great! Our rooms were clean and decorated very accurately to the New Orleans theme. It is also great that you can take the boat transportation to Downtown Disney and home. We have tried Coronodo Springs and Carribean Beach already but the French Quarter is definitely the favorite so far.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the PO Riverside Sept. 2003 (while the French Quarter was closed for renovations) and were very impressed with the lovely grounds and architechture. The pool(s) were wonderful and food options are great also. We went back to try the French Quarter the week of 3/20/05 and were even more impressed. We had GREAT rooms (connecting with Grandma & Grandpa's) on the first floor across from the pool and food court. We were still in easy walking distance to Riverside grounds to have a sit down meal. While at Disney we visited some of the "luxury" hotels (Contemporary, Polynesian, Grand Floridian) and I can honestly say I would rather stay at Port Orleans due to the atmosphere, great pools and lovely surroundings. A++++

Reviews.Title: “My sons loved the Dragon slide!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on our first trip to Disney in April of 2004. We were going to stay at the Pop Century, but ended up getting a better deal at the French Quarter (it was reopening after a renovation), I have to say that I was not disappointed,Disney lived up to my expectations. The atmosphere of the resort was charming. We also checked out Riverside while we were there and I don't think it even compared to French Quarter (although it may be undergoing renovation). The boy's stuffed animals were creatively displayed in the room every day when we returned and they enjoyed the special treatment. The pool area is great (no need to bring your own towels and life jackets are provided for those who can't swim) and the boys are still talking about the dragon slide! The only improvement might be the selection in the food court (maybe more salads), but overall the food is great for little ones. We checked out the Contemporary and Polynesian resorts and I think that I would have been very disappointed if I had spent the $ to stay at either place (FQ is much prettier and cheaper). We are planning a trip back in 2006 and will probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazingmystery
Reviews.Content: We stayed in POFQ for our honeymoon (3/13/05 - 3/19/05) and I chose that resort based on the feedback I read here. We were not disapointed. All of the positive things found in these reviews are true. One thing I want to add is that since all of the rooms with King beds are also handicap rooms, I specifically chose a room with 2 double beds. But my uncle works for Disney and thought he was doing me a favor by getting us upgraded to a King room. Well, I'm glad he did. Honestly, I could not really tell it was a handicap room. I've been in handicap rooms before and this one seemed very normal so don't let that be a deterrant for you. My uncle got us a room with a river view in building 6 and it seemed centrally located between the gift shop/food court, bus stop and boat dock. I loved it and since were we in a corner room, we had two windows. Very quiet! Ask for Room # 6223. There is an elevator so don't worry about being on the 2nd floor. This was my first time staying on property and I'm glad we splurged this time. The shuttle buses and river boat were perfect and we always got a good seat.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: efie30
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old daughter, my parents and I shared adjoning rooms at the French Quarter for three nights the beginning of February and found it lovely. We stayed in one of the second floor corner rooms of a building across from the playground, close to the heated pools and restaurant/main building. The service desk was very helpful. We paid about $135 a night per room. We parked the cars and took Disney's bus transportation to 4 theme parks and the boat to Downtown Disney. We always had a seat and shuttles came at reasonable intervals. Our rooms were clean, comfortable, updated and surprisingly spacious. They included a refrigerator and an open bath/vanity area that can be curtained off for privacy. We ate a to-go meal from the restaurant only once, but it was big, hot, tasty and priced as you would expect at Disney. They offered bottled drinks and snacks for purchase all day and stayed open late for convenience, as did the gift shop. I recommend this moderate resort to families or couples who don't mind 20 minutes to the parks and want a quieter place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Walt Disney World. I've stayed at both the Port Orleans-Riverside and the Port Orleans- French Quarter. My girlfriend and I prefer the French Quarter. The French Quarter feels like a much smaller resort than it really is. It has a definite intimate feeling. There aren't quite as many screaming kids as there are at the Riverside. Since Riverside is only a 10 minute walk from the French Quarter, both resorts share amenities. The Riverside has a marina where you can rent small speed boats that accommodate 2 people, medium boats that accommodate 4 people and large boats that accommodate 8 people. There are also 4-person, 2-person, and 1-person bike rentals. There is also a water shuttle that takes you to and back from Downtown Disney. Having stayed at various Disney "deluxe" resorts, it is definitely not worth the extra money to stay at the more expensive resorts. This is especially true if you won't be spending a lot of time at your resort. The French Quarter is the perfect blend of comfort and value. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: adinnerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Port Orleans French Quarter February 23rd-February 26th. The place is charming, the rooms are very nice, beds comfortable, bathroom clean and well stocked. The kids loved the pool, I loved the hot tub. The food court was convenient, well stocked and the food was decent. The staff was extremely courteous and gracious. We liked the convenience of being able to charge all items in the parks to our room. The bus was great, we were the first stop to Epcot, the first stop to MGM. The boat to downtown Disney was great, unfortunately the last boat was at 11:30 so we had to take the bus back to the hotel. I want to compliment the guest services at the Hotel, we had a bad experience in the restaurant in Italy (at Epcot). We explained the situation to the guest services representative and he removed the cost of the entire meal from our bill with their apologies! We would definitively stay there again. Amy from New York

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter vs. the Riverside”
Reviews.Author: califlawyer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the French Quarter. We have two little ones (5 and 3) and were choosing between the French Quarter and the Riverside. I'm glad we chose the French Quarter. We found the French quarter to be smaller, so it was easier to walk around and see the property. Riverside looks huge, and from speaking with people on the bus, you could stay at the Riverside and walk 15 minutes and still not make it to the Riverside restaurants. In the French Quarter, all the rooms are 5 minutes or less from the restauants. Also, the French Quarter is the first of the two resorts to be picked up by the bus (so you get seats) and the first to be dropped off (so you get back to your room sooner). I found both of these to be very advantageous. We ended up in building 7 at the French Quarter, so it was only a 5-10 minute walk to the Riverside restaurants and pool (probably still shorter walk than some rooms within the Riverside). We found this to be very good, since we could enjoy the amenities at both the Riverside and French Quarter. Overall, I really liked the Riverside pool (better, longer waterslide for older kids and adults), but the French Quarter pool is also very good. The rooms at the French Quarter were a little small, but otherwise nice. We also stayed at the Wilderness Lodge during our vacation, and if I had to do it again, I'd choose the French Quarter because of the value and also the quietness of the French Quarter. Since the Wilderness is multiple floors with long hallways, you can hear whenever someone walks by. Since the French Quarter is only 3 floors and the rooms are spread out over a big piece of land, you generally don't hear other people. Again, can't say enough about the French Quarter. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymmon resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Disney 2-14/2-20 It was our honeymoon and The French Quarter was very nice. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very nice and romantic we stayed right across from the pool and we had no problems with noise. The only complaint I have is the food court it was very overpriced and not that great I wish we had a resturant like riverside. Some nights local places to eat were overbooked and we were forced to eat in the food court. We loved the boats to downtown Disney and the buses were always right on time. We did howver fall in love with disneys wilderness campgrounds and will probly stay there next time. I do however recomend this hotel to couples it is much smaller then most other resorts in Disney and go in Febuary we had a quiet week!

Reviews.Title: “Good mid- range choice”
Reviews.Author: piz79
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 5 night stay. Good location, superior sound proofing, adequate food court, pleasant staff. Cool looking theme pool and heated warm enough to swim in February. Buses to theme park pick up here first, then go to Riverside. We always had a seat on the way to the parks. Rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable beds. There were only two of us, so plenty of room. With two children older than @ 10 it would have been very cozy, so be warned! Our room had a small refrigerator which wasn't mentioned in the information I had looked at. There is dial-up internet access at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Much improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: Mike_KS_2011
Reviews.Content: This place is to be avoided. Dirty, musty, smelly and crowded. It is not even up to par with a motel 6 - AVOID THIS ONE1 Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Standard...”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a more "adult only" resort at Disney, and were recommended NOFQ. The rooms are of standard size, but I can't imagine a family of four being comfortable. The rooms do NOT have a closet just a pole and a shelf for your clothing. And the walls are paper- thin, we heard a baby crying all night from next door - not the highlight of our trip. However, you can't beat the included shuttle and ferry service to the parks and villages. The pool was nice and everything was clean. Overall, considering you are at the parks all day, the NOFQ is an okay place to hang your hat at night.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. By far the best moderate hotel in Disney. We arrived early (around 11) and a room was ready for us. The rooms are very nicely decorated. Perfect amount of space. Only one bus stop because this part of the resort-French Quarter- is very small. Riverside is extremely spread out with about 5 bus stops. Trust me, stay at French Quarter. It is nicer, smaller, and quieter. The pool and slides surely looked fun. It was too cold for us to actually try them out. There is a path next to the river and is very nice place to get away. Buses come about every 15 minutes, and a boat OR a bus will take you to DownTown Disney which takes about 20 minutes by boat. All the staff is extremely nice. Better be out of your room by 10AM because that is when the maids come! haha. Such a wonderful experiene. Recomend this hotel to everyone. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what I expected. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool area is very nice and the boat to downtown disney is nice. You can walk to the Riverside hotel which is a giant resort. The foodcourt was pricey but it was good food. I highly recommend staying at a Disney hotel because you can go early or stay late at a different park each day. Also the transportation is great. I never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus and they drop you off right in front of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Disney Moderate Resort”
Reviews.Author: lawchicky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many of the WDW Resorts. He works for a Disney affiliate, and we are able to make trips frequently with discounts and free passes. We have stayed at all of the Disney Moderate Resorts, and this was our favorite. We had a King room at the French Quarter, not far from the food court and the main pool. One of the benefits of this resort, is that all of the rooms are within walking distance of each other and the food court/lobby/pools, etc. As with all of our stays at WDW the rooms were kept immaculately clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The transportation service was also excellent. Buses came frequently, and they have a water taxi that goes to Downtown Disney (a nice ride as well as a form of transportation). Our room was on the second floor, and overlooked the waterway behind the hotel. Don't get me wrong, all of the moderate resorts are pretty nice, but I found this one to be the most convenient and with the best layout. I also enjoyed the theme (New Orleans French Quarter), which was well done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed 3 nites at Disney's Port Orleans French Qtr from 12/5-12/8. The resort was quiet and clean. We have clean towels and soap/shampoo everyday. Everyone was very friendly. The food court was opened until 12am everyday and the gift shop was open until 11pm. We stayed in building 7, which was all the way at the end of the resort, so it took us 5 mins to walk to the lobby where the bus stop was, which we didn't mind. The pool was a decent size and there was also a small hot tub. The Shuttle service was very good. It came every 20 mins and there was always enough room for us. I also liked the fact that since we stayed in a disney resort we get an extra hr in the morning for each park before it's open for the public. We also went to downtown Disney, which you can either take a bus or a boat from Port Orleans. The last boat leaves Downtown at 11:30pm. One night we had dinner at Ohana resturant in the Polynesian resort..it was very good... 25 bucks for all you can eat... meat and other types of hawaiian food. In addition, you can see fireworks from the resturant at 915pm every nite. If your flight leaves later than your check out time. You can leave your luggage at the luggage room, which is located by the lobby and it's free of charge. If you have any other questions, you can contact me via email.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the French Quarter in May 2004. Two adults and a 7yo and 9 yo. Noone we knew had ever stayed there before. We were not disappointed. The rooms were clean and had enough room for the four of us. The pool was nice. Attentive lifeguards, ample fresh towels, nice bar service. Bus transportations is worth it's weight in gold. First to be picked up and first to be dropped off. Never had to wait more than 15 mins. for one. We had a rental car but only used it to get back and forth from the airport once we figured how great the bus service was. Food court was adequate for us with kids who lived on usual kid fare. Nothing fancy. Would definately stay there again and confidently recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I was a single guy meeting some friends at Walt Disney World, I knew that I was in for some long days and late nights. I wanted to be sure that I had a quiet place to crash and to get away from the parks and Pleasure Island. French Quarter was perfect. This place was quiet no matter what time of day or night I ventured out. Granted it was the first week of November, but there were still plenty of families enjoying the pools and grounds. Still, I felt very comfortable and secluded from the Disney pace - yet close to the action. Not being too large, everything there is within a short walk. Although I was lucky to score a king bed corner room against the river and promenade, it wasn't far from the boat launch, bus stops, pool and pool bar, lounge, and food service. Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island are just a 15 minute boat ride from this resort - no busses or taxis to get to and from the clubs. The king bed room was spacious, clean, and well kept. I will most likely stay here again and do recommend others stay here that want a small (relative!) resort experience that is close to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: cdwreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed w/3 other couples at the French Qtr 10/16-23. Only 1 of 3 rooms was ready at noon to which we said no problem as we were going to the park until after 10pm. Upon arrival to our room, a prior guest's ponytail holder stayed on the bathroom floor all week, a razor was behind the sink and the shelf had a layer of dust (even after I requested a thorough cleaning the next day.) However, the room was quiet being on the top floor, towels always in the room and at the pool. It was also nice to always be dropped off from the park 1st. Our friends paid extra for a water view which is a window to a common walkway overlooking a small manmade river.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BPSFortSmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Port Orleans French Quarter for 6 nights in October 2004. As an annual pass holder, I received an excellent rate for the room. The room was clean and larger than I had expected from reading about the rooms. When we checked in we were given a smoking room, but a trip back to the front desk and this was corrected. The next room we were given had a fridge in it, which was very useful and saved a lot of money on food. The pool was nice and my 3-year-old daughter loved the water slide. One complaint I have is the pool slide closed at 8:00 pm, and the playgrounds closed at dusk. We went to the parks in the evening and by the time we were back at the hotel the playgrounds and water slide were closed. Even though the hotel was not very crowded we did hear noise from the adjacent rooms and outside. This wasn’t a real problem for us, but this could be a problem if the hotel was busier. The bus to Magic Kingdom was nice, but we found it quicker and easier for us to drive to all the other parks, since we had our on car. We had to wait a maximum of about 20 minutes for a bus at Magic Kingdom. Overall I was happy with the stay, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright not above average!”
Reviews.Author: momtoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay 4 night stay at the French Quarter. 10/2/04-We had spent several weeks reading trip advisor and booked our trip and stay her from everyone's reviews. We booked our tip several weeks ahead and requested a non smoking room, fridge for someone with walking disablities. When we arrived we did not get the room requested and checked in at 4:00pm. We got a smoking room far away and in the inside of unit 2 on the 3rd floor! We called and asked for the room we requested and was told none where availible until the next day and that we needed to call in the morning to confirm we still wanted to move. We did and asked and requested again a room non smoking, and close to pool, bus etc for disability person. Was told they could not give us the room number but it was close to the pool. We packed up and had to have our luggage stored for the day until we returned from the park later in the day. We again went through check in and got our room key. This room was non smoking but was again quite a walk around the inside of the unit #5 not within easy waking from the lobby, bus stop, pool etc. Didnt want to mess with the move again! The next day after our return from the day at the park found our room not vaccumed, no clean glasses in fact was left in the same place as we had used them!, no coffee, table not cleaned and no soap, shampoo etc. All the maid did was make our beds and give us clean towels! I did call and cups, coffee and soap was brought to our room. Next day we pretty much had the same thing no cups but had clean glasses, and one bar of soap and one shampoo for 5 people!. Never say the cute towel animals in our room as this was one of the huge reasons we chose the french quarter for our stay with our kids. Very disappointed! The pool with the slide was a big hit with the kids and was open late but you could not find a towel! sometimes even in the afternoon. The food court closes at 10:00pm so if you happen to catch to stay late at the park by the time you catch your bus back you may only have one option for food. Bus service from the french quarter was excellent! Was always enough room due to being picked up first before riverside. Very friendly. Expect at least a 1/2 ride anywhere you need to go or return. Grounds where pretty and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent during a storm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent! Plus during hurricane Jeanne we felt safe and sound. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Port Orleans Riverside. The hotel was great, the rooms had all the conveniences, hair dryer, iron/board, coffee maker, tv, radio/alarm. If you were tired from the parks there certainly was enough activities to do at the hotel including: Fishing, boating, bike riding, horse drawn carriage, restaurant, bar w/entertainment, arcade, pools, large gift store. They offered bus transportation to the parks, and if you brought your own car you got free parking at all the parks. Also we got into the parks early and stayed late for being a Disney Hotel Guest. I would definitely stay there again. My only gripe was that the beds were a little hard for my taste. I'll bring a mattress cover next time.

Reviews.Title: “Port Orleans is great”
Reviews.Author: tamo1962
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Port Orleans Riverside resort. The convenience can't be beat. Sure, you could get a little fancier accomodations, but you would pay for it in convenience and character. Who wants a plain box to stay in? The decor is keeping with the theme, and we really like Boatwrights for breakfast. It's true, once you have stayed at a Disney resort, you never stay anywhere else. We will always stay here, or upgrade to a deluxe Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Port Orleans, and found it to be very over rated. Rooms where dated, the bed was extremley uncomfortable, and food in the resort was bland. The Disney transportation was an absolute nightmare if you wanted to sit down. Stayed at the Sheraton Vistana last time, which was excellent and in a different league to this...avoid the Port Orleans if you want value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect on site Disney hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gatorcard83
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a vacation at WDW August 10th - 18th and this hotel was one of the best parts of the trip. First of all, unlike many of the other Disney hotels which seem crowded and big, this hotel is very small so everybody is very convenient and the hotel is very quiet compared to the other Disney resorts. Everybody about this hotel is just perfect. The courtyards really are authentic of New Orleans and the hotel has some of the best grounds around. The river view rooms are great and the boat ride to and from Downtown Disney is awesome. The pool area is great for kids and one of the best pools on site, the hot tub was definately a great way to relax after a long day at the parks. The lobby and food court area are great as well. My only complaint is the lack of a sit down restaurant, they used to have one but now you have to go over to Riverside. Other than that this hotel is just perfect, we absolutely love it and we will be coming back again. Definately try to stay here if at all possible.

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 2201 Orleans Drive, Orlando, FL 32830 (Formerly Port Orleans Resort)
